﻿SHE AND [ALLAN]82-allan

By H. Rider Haggard

NOTE BY [THE LATE MR . ALLAN]83-allan QUATERMAIN

[[My]0-i friend]270-my friend , into whose hands [I]0-i hope that all these manuscripts of [mine]0-i will pass one day , of this one [I]0-i have something to say to [you]271-you .

A long while ago [I]0-i jotted down in it the history of the events that it details with more or less completeness . This [I]0-i did for [my]0-i own satisfaction . [You]271-you will have noted how memory fails [us]272-we as [we]272-we advance in years ; [we]272-we recollect , with an almost painful exactitude , what [we]272-we experienced and saw in [our]272-we youth , but the happenings of [our]272-we middle life slip away from [us]272-we or become blurred , like a stretch of low - lying landscape overflowed by grey and nebulous mist . Far off the sun still seems to shine upon [the plains]273-the plains and hills of adolescence and early manhood , as yet it shines about [us]272-we in the fleeting hours of [our]272-we age , that ground on which [we]272-we stand to - day , but [the valley between]274-the valley between is filled with fog . Yes , even its prominences , which symbolise the more startling events of that past , often are lost in this confusing fog .

It was an appreciation of these truths which led [me]0-i to set down the following details though of course much is omitted of [my]0-i brief intercourse with [the strange and splendid creature whom [I]0-i knew under the names of [Ayesha]84-ayesha , or Híya , or [She]276-she - who - commands]275-the strange and splendid creature whom i knew under the names of ayesha , or híya , or she - who - commands ; not indeed with any view to [their]275-the strange and splendid creature whom i knew under the names of ayesha , or híya , or she - who - commands publication , but before [I]0-i forgot [them]275-the strange and splendid creature whom i knew under the names of ayesha , or híya , or she - who - commands that , if [I]0-i wished to do so , [I]0-i might re - peruse them in the evening of old age to which [I]0-i hope to attain .

Indeed , at the time the last thing [I]0-i intended was that they should be given to [the world]277-the world even after [my]0-i own death , because they , or many of them , are so unusual that [I]0-i feared lest they should cause smiles and in a way cast a slur upon [my]0-i memory and truthfulness . Also , as [you]278-you will read , as to this matter [I]0-i made a promise and [I]0-i have always tried to keep [my]0-i promises and to guard the secrets of [others]279-others . For these reasons [I]0-i proposed , in case [I]0-i neglected or forgot to destroy them [myself]0-i , to leave a direction that this should be done by [[my]0-i executors]280-my executors . Further , [I]0-i have been careful to make no allusion whatever to [them]275-the strange and splendid creature whom i knew under the names of ayesha , or híya , or she - who - commands either in casual conversation or in anything else that [I]0-i may have written , [my]0-i desire being that this page of [my]0-i life should be kept quite private , something known only to [myself]0-i . Therefore , too , [I]0-i never so much as hinted of them to [anyone]281-anyone , not even to [yourself]278-you to whom [I]0-i have told so much .

Well , [I]0-i recorded the main facts concerning this expedition and its issues , simply and with as much exactness as [I]0-i could , and laid them aside . [I]0-i do not say that [I]0-i never thought of them again , since amongst them were some which , together with the problems [they]275-the strange and splendid creature whom i knew under the names of ayesha , or híya , or she - who - commands suggested , proved to be of an unforgettable nature .

Also , whenever any of [Ayesha]84-ayesha 's sayings or stories which are not preserved in these pages came back to [me]0-i , as has happened from time to time , [I]0-i jotted them down and put them away with this manuscript . Thus among these notes [you]278-you will find a history of [the city of [K"r]1-k"r]3120-the city of k"r as [she]84-ayesha told it to [me]84-ayesha , which [I]84-ayesha have omitted here . Still , many of these remarkable events did more or less fade from [my]84-ayesha mind , as the image does from an unfixed photograph , till only their outlines remained , faint if distinguishable .[84-ayesha]

To tell the truth , [I]0-i was rather ashamed of the whole story in which [I]0-i cut so poor a figure . On reflection it was obvious to [me]0-i , although honesty had compelled [me]0-i to set out all that is essential exactly as it occurred , adding nothing and taking nothing away , that [I]0-i had been the victim of very gross deceit . [This strange woman , whom [I]0-i had met in the ruins of [a place called [K"r]1-k"r]3122-a place called k"r]3121-this strange woman , whom i had met in the ruins of a place called k"r , without any doubt had thrown a glamour over [my]282-she senses and at the moment almost caused [me]282-she to believe much that is quite unbelievable .[282-she]

For instance , [she]282-she had told [me]0-i ridiculous stories as to interviews between [herself]282-she and [certain heathen goddesses]283-certain heathen goddesses , though it is true that , almost with [her]282-she next breath , these [she]282-she qualified or contradicted . Also , [she]282-she had suggested that [her]282-she life had been prolonged far beyond [our]284-our mortal span , for hundreds and hundreds of years , indeed ; which , as [Euclid]85-euclid says , is absurd , and had pretended to supernatural powers , which is still more absurd . Moreover , by a clever use of some hypnotic or mesmeric power , [she]282-she had feigned to transport [me]0-i to some place beyond [the earth]285-the earth and in [the Halls of [Hades]2-hades]286-the halls of hades to show [me]0-i what is veiled from the eyes of [man]287-man , and not only [me]0-i , but [the savage warrior Umhlopekazi]288-the savage warrior umhlopekazi , commonly called [Umslopogaas of the Axe]125-umslopogaas , who , with [Hans]87-hans , [a Hottentot]289-a hottentot , was [[my]0-i companion upon that adventure]290-my companion upon that adventure . There were like things equally incredible , such as [her]282-she appearance , when all seemed lost , in the battle with the troll - like [Rezu]88-rezu . To omit these , the sum of it was that [I]0-i had been shamefully duped , and if [anyone]281-anyone finds [himself]281-anyone in that position , as [most people]292-most people have at one time or another in [their]292-most people lives , [Wisdom]89-wisdom suggests that [he]281-anyone had better keep the circumstances to [himself]281-anyone .

Well , so the matter stood , or rather lay in the recesses of [my]0-i mind - and in the cupboard where [I]0-i hide [my]0-i papers - when one evening [someone]293-someone , as a matter of fact it was [Captain Good]90-captain good , [an individual of romantic tendencies]294-an individual of romantic tendencies who is fond , sometimes [I]0-i think too fond , of fiction , brought a book to [this house]295-this house which [he]90-captain good insisted over and over again really [I]0-i must peruse .

Ascertaining that it was a novel [I]0-i declined , for to tell the truth [I]0-i am not fond of romance in any shape , being [a person who has found the hard facts of life of sufficient interest]296-a person who has found the hard facts of life of sufficient interest as they stand .

Reading [I]0-i admit [I]0-i like , but in this matter , as in everything else , [my]0-i range is limited . [I]0-i study the Bible , especially the Old Testament , both because of its sacred lessons and of the majesty of the language of [its inspired translators]297-its inspired translators ; whereof that of [Ayesha]84-ayesha , which [I]0-i render so poorly from [her]84-ayesha flowing and melodious Arabic , reminded [me]0-i . For poetry [I]0-i turn to [Shakespeare]91-shakespeare , and , at the other end of the scale , to the Ingoldsby Legends , many of which [I]0-i know almost by heart , while for current affairs [I]0-i content [myself]0-i with the newspapers .

For the rest [I]0-i peruse anything to do with [ancient Egypt that [I]0-i happen to come across]298-ancient egypt that i happen to come across , because [this land]299-this land and [its]299-this land history have a queer fascination for [me]0-i , that perhaps has its roots in occurrences or dreams of which this is not the place to speak . Lastly now and again [I]0-i read [one of the Latin or Greek authors]300-one of the latin or greek authors in a translation , since [I]0-i regret to say that [my]0-i lack of education does not enable [me]0-i to do so in the original . But for modern fiction [I]0-i have no taste , although from time to time [I]0-i sample it in [a railway train]301-a railway train and occasionally am amused by such excursions into the poetic and unreal .

So it came about that the more Good bothered [me]0-i to read this particular romance , the more [I]0-i determined that [I]0-i would do nothing of the sort . Being [a persistent person]302-a persistent person , however , when [he]302-a persistent person went away about ten o'clock at night , [he]302-a persistent person deposited it by [my]0-i side , under [my]0-i nose indeed , so that it might not be overlooked . Thus it came about that [I]0-i could not help seeing some Egyptian hieroglyphics in an oval on the cover , also the title , and underneath it [your]303-your own name , [[my]0-i friend]270-my friend , all of which excited [my]0-i curiosity , especially the title , which was brief and enigmatic , consisting indeed of one word , " [She]305-a veiled woman . "[0-i]

[I]0-i took up the work and on opening it the first thing [my]0-i eye fell upon was a picture of [a veiled woman]305-a veiled woman , the sight of which made [my]0-i heart stand still , so painfully did it remind [me]0-i of [a certain veiled woman whom once it had been [my]0-i fortune to meet]306-a certain veiled woman whom once it had been my fortune to meet . Glancing from it to the printed page one word seemed to leap at [me]0-i . It was [K"r]1-k"r ! Now of [veiled women]3123-veiled women there are plenty in [the world]277-the world , but were there also [two K"rs]3125-two k"rs[0-i] ?

Then [I]0-i turned to the beginning and began to read . This happened in the autumn when the sun does not rise till about six , but it was broad daylight before [I]0-i ceased from reading , or rather rushing through that book .

Oh ! what was [I]0-i to make of it ? For here in its pages to say nothing of [old [Billali]93-billali , who , by the way lied , probably to order , when [he]93-billali told [Mr. Holly]94-mr. holly that [no white man]308-no white man had visited [[his]93-billali country]309-his country for many generations]307-old billali , who , by the way lied , probably to order , when he told mr. holly that no white man had visited his country for many generations , and [those gloomy , man - eating Amahagger scoundrels]310-those gloomy , man - eating amahagger scoundrels once again [I]0-i found [myself]0-i face to face with [She]311-she - who - commands , now rendered as [She]311-she - who - must - be - obeyed , which means much the same thing - in [her]311-she case at least ; yes , with [Ayesha the lovely]84-ayesha , [the mystic]312-the mystic , [the changeful]313-the changeful and the imperious .

Moreover the history filled up many gaps in [my]0-i own limited experiences of that enigmatical being who was half divine though , [I]0-i think , rather wicked or at any rate unmoral in [her]311-she way and yet [all woman]314-all woman . It is true that it showed [her]311-she in lights very different from and higher than those in which [she]311-she had presented [herself]311-she to [me]0-i . Yet the substratum of [her]311-she character was the same , or rather of [[her]311-she characters]315-her characters , for of these [she]311-she seemed to have several in a single body , being , as [she]311-she said of [herself]311-she to [me]0-i , " not One but Many and not Here but Everywhere . "[311-she]

Further , [I]0-i found the story of [Kallikrates]95-kallikrates , which [I]0-i had set down as a mere falsehood invented for [my]0-i bewilderment , expanded and explained . Or rather not explained , since , perhaps that [she]311-she might deceive , to [me]0-i [she]311-she had spoken of [this murdered Kallikrates]316-this murdered kallikrates without enthusiasm , as [a handsome person to whom , because of an indiscretion of [her]311-she youth , [she]311-she was bound by destiny and whose return - somewhat to [her]311-she sorrow]317-a handsome person to whom , because of an indiscretion of her youth , she was bound by destiny and whose return - somewhat to her sorrow - [she]311-she must wait . At least [she]311-she did so at first , though in the end when [she]311-she bared [her]311-she heart at the moment of [our]318-our farewell , [she]311-she vowed [she]311-she loved [him]316-this murdered kallikrates only and was " appointed "[311-she] to [him]316-this murdered kallikrates " by a divine decree . "[311-she]

Also [I]0-i found other things of which [I]0-i knew nothing , such as the Fire of Life with its fatal gift of indefinite existence , although [I]0-i remember that like the giant Rezu whom [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas defeated , [she]311-she did talk of a " Cup of Life "[311-she] of which [she]311-she had drunk , that might have been offered to [my]0-i lips , had [I]0-i been politic , bowed the knee and shown more faith in [her]311-she and [her]311-she supernatural pretensions .

Lastly [I]0-i saw the story of [her]311-she end , and as [I]0-i read it [I]0-i wept , yes , [I]0-i confess [I]0-i wept , although [I]0-i feel sure that [she]311-she will return again . Now [I]0-i understood why [she]311-she had quailed and even seemed to shrivel when , in [my]0-i last interview with [her]311-she , stung beyond endurance by [her]311-she witcheries and sarcasms , [I]0-i had suggested that even for [her]311-she with all [her]311-she powers , [Fate]96-fate might reserve one of its shrewdest blows . Some prescience had told [her]311-she that if the words seemed random , [Truth]97-truth spoke through [my]0-i lips , although , and this was the worst of it , [she]311-she did not know what weapon would deal the stroke or when and where it was doomed to fall .

[I]0-i was amazed , [I]0-i was overcome , but as [I]0-i closed that book [I]0-i made up [my]0-i mind , first that [I]0-i would continue to preserve absolute silence as to [Ayesha]84-ayesha and [my]0-i dealings with [her]84-ayesha , as , during [my]0-i life , [I]0-i was bound by oath to do , and secondly that [I]0-i would not cause [my]0-i manuscript to be destroyed . [I]0-i did not feel that [I]0-i had any right to do so in view of what already had been published to [the world]277-the world . There let it lie to appear one day , or not to appear , as might be fated . Meanwhile [my]0-i lips were sealed . [I]0-i would give [Good]90-captain good back [his]90-captain good book without comment and - buy another copy !

One more word . It is clear that [I]0-i did not touch more than the fringe of the real [Ayesha]84-ayesha . In a thousand ways [she]84-ayesha bewitched and deceived [me]0-i so that [I]0-i never plumbed [her]84-ayesha nature 's depths . Perhaps this was [my]0-i own fault because from the first [I]0-i shewed a lack of faith in [her]84-ayesha and [she]84-ayesha wished to pay [me]0-i back in [her]84-ayesha own fashion , or perhaps [she]84-ayesha had other private reasons for [her]84-ayesha secrecy . Certainly the character [she]84-ayesha discovered to [me]0-i differed in many ways from that which [she]84-ayesha revealed to [Mr. Holly]94-mr. holly and to [Leo Vincey]98-leo vincey , or [Kallikrates]95-kallikrates , whom , it seems , once [she]84-ayesha slew in [her]84-ayesha jealousy and rage .

[She]84-ayesha told [me]0-i as much as [she]84-ayesha thought it fit that [I]0-i should know , and no more !

[Allan Quatermain]83-allan .

[The Grange , Yorkshire]99-the grange , yorkshire .

[SHE]84-ayesha AND [ALLAN

CHAPTER]100-allan chapter [I]0-i

THE TALISMAN

[I]0-i believe it was [the old Egyptians]320-the old egyptians , [a very wise people]321-a very wise people , probably indeed much wiser than [we]322-we know , for in the leisure of [their]320-the old egyptians ample centuries [they]320-the old egyptians had time to think out things , who declared that [each individual personality]323-each individual personality is made up of six or seven different elements , although the Bible only allows [us]322-we three , namely , body , soul , and spirit . The body that [the man]324-the man or [woman]325-woman wore , if [I]0-i understand [their]320-the old egyptians theory aright which perhaps [I]0-i , [an ignorant person]326-an ignorant person , do not , was but a kind of sack or fleshly covering containing these different principles . Or mayhap it did not contain them all , but was simply [a house]327-a house as [it]327-a house were , in which [they]320-the old egyptians lived from time to time and seldom all together , although one or more of [them]320-the old egyptians was present continually , as though to keep [the place]328-the place warmed and aired .

This is but a casual illustrative suggestion , for what right have [I]0-i , [Allan Quatermain]83-allan , out of [my]0-i little reading and probably erroneous deductions , to form any judgment as to the theories of [the old Egyptians]320-the old egyptians ? Still these , as [I]0-i understand [them]320-the old egyptians , suffice to furnish [me]0-i with the text that [man]287-man is not one , but many , in which connection it may be remembered that often in Scripture [he]287-man is spoken of as being the home of many demons , seven , [I]0-i think . Also , to come to another far - off example , [the Zulus]101-the zulus talk of [[their]101-the zulus witch - doctors]331-their witch - doctors as being inhabited by " [a multitude of spirits]3126-a multitude of spirits . "[333-different personalities]

Anyhow of one thing [I]0-i am quite sure , [we]332-we are not always the same . [Different personalities]333-different personalities actuate [us]332-we at different times . In one hour passion of this sort or the other is [[our]332-we lord]334-our lord ; in another [we]332-we are reason itself . In one hour [we]332-we follow the basest appetites ; in another [we]332-we hate [them]320-the old egyptians and the spirit arising through [our]332-we mortal murk shines within or above [us]332-we like a star . In one hour [our]332-we desire is to kill and spare not ; in another [we]332-we are filled with the holiest compassion even towards an insect or a snake , and are ready to forgive like [a god]335-a god . Everything rules [us]332-we in turn , to such an extent indeed , that sometimes one begins to wonder whether [we]332-we really rule anything .

Now the reason of all this homily is that [I]0-i , [Allan]83-allan , [the most practical and unimaginative of [persons]337-persons]336-the most practical and unimaginative of persons , [just [a homely , half - educated hunter]339-a homely , half - educated hunter and trader who chances to have seen a good deal of the particular little world in which [his]83-allan lot was cast]338-just a homely , half - educated hunter and trader who chances to have seen a good deal of the particular little world in which his lot was cast , at one period of [my]0-i life became the victim of spiritual longings .

[I]0-i am [a man who has suffered great bereavements in [my]0-i time such as have seared [my]0-i soul]340-a man who has suffered great bereavements in my time such as have seared my soul , since , perhaps because of [my]0-i rather primitive and simple nature , [my]0-i affections are very strong . By day or night [I]0-i can never forget those whom [I]0-i have loved and whom [I]0-i believe to have loved [me]0-i .

For [you]341-you know , in [our]332-we vanity [some of [us]332-we]342-some of us are apt to hold that [certain people with whom [we]332-we have been intimate upon [the earth]285-the earth]343-certain people with whom we have been intimate upon the earth , really did care for [us]332-we and , in [our]332-we still greater vanity - or should it be called madness ? - to imagine that [they]343-certain people with whom we have been intimate upon the earth still care for [us]332-we after [they]343-certain people with whom we have been intimate upon the earth have left [the earth]285-the earth and entered on some new state of society and surroundings which , if [they]343-certain people with whom we have been intimate upon the earth exist , inferentially are much more congenial than any [they]343-certain people with whom we have been intimate upon the earth can have experienced here . At times , however , cold doubts strike [us]332-we as to this matter , of which [we]332-we long to know the truth . Also behind looms a still blacker doubt , namely whether [they]343-certain people with whom we have been intimate upon the earth live at all .

For some years of [my]0-i lonely existence these problems haunted [me]0-i day by day , till at length [I]0-i desired above everything on [earth]346-earth to lay them at rest in one way or another . Once , at [Durban]3-durban , [I]0-i met [a man who was a spiritualist to whom [I]0-i confided a little of [my]0-i perplexities]347-a man who was a spiritualist to whom i confided a little of my perplexities . [He]347-a man who was a spiritualist to whom i confided a little of my perplexities laughed at [me]0-i and said that they could be settled with the greatest ease . All [I]0-i had to do was to visit [a certain local medium who for a fee of one guinea would tell [me]0-i everything [I]0-i wanted to know]348-a certain local medium who for a fee of one guinea would tell me everything i wanted to know . Although [I]0-i rather grudged the guinea , being more than usually hard up at the time , [I]0-i called upon [this person]349-this person , but over the results of that visit , or rather the lack of them , [I]0-i draw a veil .

[My]0-i queer and perhaps unwholesome longing , however , remained with [me]0-i and would not be abated . [I]0-i consulted [a clergyman of [my]0-i acquaintance]350-a clergyman of my acquaintance , [a good and spiritually - minded man]351-a good and spiritually - minded man , but [he]350-a clergyman of my acquaintance could only shrug [his]350-a clergyman of my acquaintance shoulders and refer [me]0-i to the Bible , saying , quite rightly [I]0-i doubt not , that with what it reveals [I]0-i ought to be contented . Then [I]0-i read certain mystical books which were recommended to [me]0-i . These were full of fine words , undiscoverable in a pocket dictionary , but really took [me]0-i no forwarder , since in them [I]0-i found nothing that [I]0-i could not have invented [myself]0-i , although while [I]0-i was actually studying them , they seemed to convince [me]0-i . [I]0-i even tackled [Swedenborg]102-swedenborg , or rather samples of [him]102-swedenborg , for [he]102-swedenborg is very copious , but without satisfactory results . Ha ! - [JB]103-jb

Then [I]0-i gave up the business .

Some months later [I]0-i was in [Zululand]4-zululand and being near [the Black Kloof]6-the black kloof where [he]352-he dwelt , [I]0-i paid a visit to [my]0-i acquaintance of whom [I]0-i have written elsewhere , [the wonderful and ancient dwarf]353-the wonderful and ancient dwarf , [Zikali]104-zikali , known as " [The - Thing - that - should - never - have - been - born]3127-the - thing - that - should - never - have - been - born , "[104-zikali] also more universally among [the Zulus]354-the zulus as " [Opener - of - Roads]3128-opener - of - roads . "[104-zikali] When [we]355-we had talked of many things connected with [the state of [Zululand]4-zululand]356-the state of zululand and [its]4-zululand politics , [I]0-i rose to leave for [my]0-i waggon , since [I]0-i never cared for sleeping in [the Black Kloof]6-the black kloof if it could be avoided .

" Is there nothing else that [you]0-i want to ask [me]357-the old dwarf , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn ? "[357-the old dwarf] asked [the old dwarf]357-the old dwarf , tossing back [his]357-the old dwarf long hair and looking at - [I]0-i had almost written through - [me]0-i .

[I]0-i shook [my]0-i head .

" That is strange , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , for [I]0-i seem to see something written on [your]0-i mind - something to do with spirits . "[0-i]

Then [I]0-i remembered all the problems that had been troubling [me]0-i , although in truth [I]0-i had never thought of propounding them to [Zikali]104-zikali .

" Ah ! it comes back , does it ? "[104-zikali] [he]104-zikali exclaimed , reading [my]0-i thought . " Out with it , then , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , while [I]104-zikali am in a mood to answer , and before [I]104-zikali grow tired , for [you]0-i are [an old friend of mine]3129-an old friend of mine and will so remain till the end , many years hence , and if [I]104-zikali can serve [you]0-i , [I]104-zikali will . "[104-zikali]

[I]0-i filled [my]0-i pipe and sat down again upon the stool of carved red - wood which had been brought for [me]0-i .

" [You]0-i are named ' [Opener - of - Roads]3128-opener - of - roads , ' are [you]0-i not , [Zikali]104-zikali ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" Yes , [the Zulus]354-the zulus have always called [me]358-i that , since before the days of [Chaka]106-chaka . But what of names , which often enough mean nothing at all ? "[358-i]

" Only that [I]358-i want to open [a road]3132-a road , [Zikali]104-zikali , that which runs across [the River of Death]8-the river of death . "[358-i]

" Oho ! "[358-i] [he]358-i laughed , " it is very easy , "[358-i] and snatching up a little assegai that lay beside [him]358-i , [he]358-i proffered it to [me]0-i , adding , " Be brave now and fall on that . Then before [I]358-i have counted sixty [the road]3133-the road will be wide open , but whether [you]0-i will see anything on it [I]358-i can not tell [you]0-i . "[358-i]

Again [I]0-i shook [my]0-i head and answered ,

" It is against [our]3134-our law . Also while [I]0-i still live [I]0-i desire to know whether [I]0-i shall meet [certain others on [that road]3136-that road after [my]0-i time has come to cross [the River]9-the river]3135-certain others on that road after my time has come to cross the river . Perhaps [you]0-i who deal with spirits , can prove the matter to [me]0-i , which [no one else]3137-no one else seems able to do . "[0-i]

" Oho ! "[104-zikali] laughed [Zikali]104-zikali again . " What do [my]104-zikali ears hear ? Am [I]104-zikali , [the poor Zulu cheat]3138-the poor zulu cheat , as [you]0-i will remember once [you]0-i called [me]104-zikali , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , asked to show that which is hidden from all the wisdom of [the great White People]3139-the great white people ? "[104-zikali]

" The question is , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered with irritation , " not what [you]0-i are asked to do , but what [you]0-i can do . "[0-i]

" That [I]104-zikali do not know yet , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . Whose spirits do [you]0-i desire to see ? If that of [a woman called [Mameena]107-mameena]3140-a woman called mameena is one of [them]3139-the great white people , [I]104-zikali think that perhaps [I]104-zikali whom [she]107-mameena loved - - "[104-zikali]

For the history of [Mameena]107-mameena see the book called " [Child of Storm]3141-child of storm . "[108-editor] - [Editor]108-editor .

" [She]107-mameena is not one of [them]3139-the great white people , [Zikali]104-zikali . Moreover , if [she]107-mameena loved [you]0-i , [you]0-i paid back [her]107-mameena love with death . "[0-i]

" Which perhaps was the kindest thing [I]0-i could do , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , for reasons that [you]0-i may be able to guess , and others with which [I]0-i will not trouble [you]0-i . But if not [hers]107-mameena , whose ? Let [me]0-i look , let [me]0-i look ! Why , there seems to be two of [them]3139-the great white people , [head - wives]3142-head - wives , [I]0-i mean , and [I]0-i thought that [white men]3143-white men only took [one wife]3144-one wife . Also a multitude of others ; [their]3139-the great white people faces float up in the water of [your]0-i mind . [An old man with grey hair]3145-an old man with grey hair , [little children]3146-little children , perhaps [they]3139-the great white people were [brothers]3147-brothers and [sisters]3148-sisters , and some who may be [friends]3149-friends . Also very clear indeed that [Mameena]107-mameena whom [you]0-i do not wish to see . Well , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , this is unfortunate , since [she]107-mameena is the only one whom [I]0-i can show [you]0-i , or rather put [you]0-i in the way of finding . Unless indeed there are [other Kaffir women]3150-other kaffir women - - "[0-i]

" What do [you]0-i mean ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [I]0-i mean , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , that only black feet travel on the road which [I]0-i can open ; over those in which ran white blood [I]0-i have no power . "[0-i]

" Then it is finished , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , rising again and taking a step or two towards the gate .

" Come back and sit down , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . [I]0-i did not say so . Am [I]0-i [the only ruler of magic in [Africa]10-africa]3151-the only ruler of magic in africa , which [I]0-i am told is [a big country]3152-a big country ? "[0-i]

[I]0-i came back and sat down , for [my]0-i curiosity , a great failing with [me]0-i , was excited .

" Thank [you]105-macumazahn , [Zikali]104-zikali , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " but [I]0-i will have no dealings with [more of [[your]105-macumazahn witch - doctors]3154-your witch - doctors]3153-more of your witch - doctors . "[0-i]

" No , no , because [you]105-macumazahn are afraid of [them]3154-your witch - doctors ; quite without reason , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , seeing that [they]3154-your witch - doctors are [all cheats]3155-all cheats except [myself]0-i . [I]0-i am [the last child of wisdom]3156-the last child of wisdom , the rest are stuffed with lies , as [Chaka]106-chaka found out when [he]106-chaka killed [every one of [them]3154-your witch - doctors whom [he]106-chaka could catch]3157-every one of them whom he could catch . But perhaps there might be [a white doctor]3158-a white doctor who would have rule over [white spirits]3159-white spirits . "[0-i]

" If [you]105-macumazahn mean [missionaries]3160-missionaries - - "[0-i] [I]0-i began hastily .

" No , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [I]0-i do not mean [[your]105-macumazahn praying men who [are cast in one mould and measured with one rule]3162-are cast in one mould and measured with one rule , and say what [they]3161-your praying men who are cast in one mould and measured with one rule , and say what they are taught to say , not thinking for themselves are taught to say , not thinking for [themselves]3161-your praying men who are cast in one mould and measured with one rule , and say what they are taught to say , not thinking for themselves]3161-your praying men who are cast in one mould and measured with one rule , and say what they are taught to say , not thinking for themselves . "[0-i]

" [Some of [them]3161-your praying men who are cast in one mould and measured with one rule , and say what they are taught to say , not thinking for themselves]3163-some of them think , [Zikali]104-zikali . "[0-i]

" Yes , and then [the others]3164-the others fall on [them]3163-some of them with big sticks . [The real priest]3165-the real priest is [he]3165-the real priest to whom the Spirit comes , not [[he]3165-the real priest who feeds upon its wrappings , and speaks through a mask carved by [[his]3165-the real priest father 's fathers]3167-his father 's fathers]3166-he who feeds upon its wrappings , and speaks through a mask carved by his father 's fathers . [I]0-i am [a priest like that]3168-a priest like that , which is why [all [my]0-i fellowship]3169-all my fellowship have hated [me]0-i . "[0-i]

" If so , [you]104-zikali have paid back [their]3169-all my fellowship hate , [Zikali]104-zikali , but cease to cast round the lion , like a timid hound , and tell [me]0-i what [you]104-zikali mean . Of whom do [you]104-zikali speak ? "[0-i]

" That is the trouble , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . [I]0-i do not know . This lion , or rather lioness , lies hid in [the caves of [a very distant mountain]3171-a very distant mountain]3170-the caves of a very distant mountain and [I]0-i have never seen [her]3172-her - in the flesh . "[0-i]

" Then how can [you]104-zikali talk of what [you]104-zikali have never seen ? "[0-i]

" In the same way , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , that [[your]105-macumazahn priests]3173-your priests talk of what [they]3173-your priests have never seen , because [they]3173-your priests , or [a few of [them]3173-your priests]3174-a few of them , have knowledge of it . [I]0-i will tell [you]105-macumazahn a secret . [All seers who live at the same time]3175-all seers who live at the same time , if [they]3175-all seers who live at the same time are great , commune with [each other]3176-each other because [they]3175-all seers who live at the same time are akin and [their]3175-all seers who live at the same time spirits meet in sleep or dreams . Therefore [I]0-i know of [a mistress of [our]3178-our craft]3177-a mistress of our craft , [a very lioness among jackals , who for thousands of years has lain sleeping in [the northern caves]3180-the northern caves and , humble though [I]0-i am , [she]3177-a mistress of our craft knows of [me]0-i]3179-a very lioness among jackals , who for thousands of years has lain sleeping in the northern caves and , humble though i am , she knows of me . "[0-i]

" Quite so , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , yawning , " but perhaps , [Zikali]104-zikali , [you]105-macumazahn will come to the point of the spear . What of [her]3177-a mistress of our craft ? How is [she]3177-a mistress of our craft named , and if [she]3177-a mistress of our craft exists will [she]3177-a mistress of our craft help [me]0-i ? "[0-i]

" [I]0-i will answer [your]105-macumazahn question backwards , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . [I]0-i think that [she]3177-a mistress of our craft will help [you]105-macumazahn if [you]105-macumazahn help [her]3177-a mistress of our craft , in what way [I]0-i do not know , because although [witch - doctors]3181-witch - doctors sometimes work without pay , as [I]0-i am doing now , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [witch - doctoresses]3182-witch - doctoresses never do . As for [her]3177-a mistress of our craft name , the only one that [she]3177-a mistress of our craft has among [[our]3183-our company]3184-our company is ' [Queen]3185-queen , ' because [she]3177-a mistress of our craft is the first of all of [them]3184-our company and the most beauteous among [women]3186-women . For the rest [I]0-i can tell [you]105-macumazahn nothing , except that [she]3177-a mistress of our craft has always been and [I]0-i suppose , in this shape or in that , will always be while [the world]277-the world lasts , because [she]3177-a mistress of our craft has found the secret of life unending . "[0-i]

" [You]0-i mean that [she]3177-a mistress of our craft is immortal , [Zikali]104-zikali , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered with a smile .

" [I]0-i do not say that , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , because [my]0-i little mind can not shape the thought of immortality . But when [I]0-i was [a babe]3188-a babe , which is far ago , [she]3177-a mistress of our craft had lived so long that scarce would [she]3177-a mistress of our craft knew the difference between then and now , and already in [her]3177-a mistress of our craft breast was all wisdom gathered . [I]0-i know it , because although , as [I]0-i have said , [we]3189-we have never seen [each other]3176-each other , at times [we]3189-we walk together in [our]3189-we sleep , for thus [she]3177-a mistress of our craft shares [her]3177-a mistress of our craft loneliness , and [I]0-i think , though this may be but a dream , that last night [she]3177-a mistress of our craft told [me]0-i to send [you]0-i on to [her]3177-a mistress of our craft to seek an answer to certain questions which [you]0-i would put to [me]0-i to - day . Also to [me]0-i [she]3177-a mistress of our craft seemed to desire that [you]0-i should do [her]3177-a mistress of our craft a service ; [I]0-i know not what service . "[0-i]

Now [I]0-i grew angry and asked ,

" Why does it please [you]0-i to fool [me]0-i , [Zikali]104-zikali , with such talk as this ? If there is any truth in it , show [me]0-i where [the woman called Queen]3191-the woman called queen lives and how [I]0-i am to come to [her]3177-a mistress of our craft . "[0-i]

[The old wizard]359-the old wizard took up the little assegai which [he]359-the old wizard had offered to [me]0-i and with its blade raked [our]360-our ashes from the fire that always burnt in front of [him]359-the old wizard . While [he]359-the old wizard did so , [he]359-the old wizard talked to [me]0-i , as [I]0-i thought in a random fashion , perhaps to distract [my]0-i attention , of [a certain white man whom [he]359-the old wizard said [I]0-i should meet upon [my]0-i journey and of [his]359-the old wizard affairs]361-a certain white man whom he said i should meet upon my journey and of his affairs , also of other matters , none of which interested [me]0-i much at the time . These ashes [he]359-the old wizard patted down flat and then on them drew a map with the point of [his]359-the old wizard spear , making grooves for [streams]362-streams , certain marks for bush and forest , wavy lines for water and [swamps]363-swamps and little heaps for [hills]364-hills .

When [he]359-the old wizard had finished it all [he]359-the old wizard bade [me]0-i come round the fire and study the picture across which by an after - thought [he]359-the old wizard drew a wandering furrow with the edge of the assegai to represent [a river]365-a river , and gathered the ashes in a lump at the northern end to signify [a large mountain]366-a large mountain .

" Look at it well , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , "[359-the old wizard] [he]359-the old wizard said , " and forget nothing , since if [you]105-macumazahn make this journey and forget , [you]105-macumazahn die . Nay , no need to copy it in that book of [yours]105-macumazahn , for see , [I]359-the old wizard will stamp it on [your]105-macumazahn mind . "[359-the old wizard]

Then suddenly [he]359-the old wizard gathered up the warm ashes in a double handful and threw them into [my]0-i face , muttering something as [he]359-the old wizard did so and adding aloud ,

" There , now [you]105-macumazahn will remember . "[359-the old wizard]

" Certainly [I]0-i shall , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , coughing , " and [I]0-i beg that [you]359-the old wizard will not play such a joke upon [me]0-i again . "[0-i]

As a matter of fact , whatever may have been the reason , [I]0-i never forgot any detail of that extremely intricate map .

" [That big river]3192-that big river must be [the Zambesi]11-the zambesi , "[0-i] [I]0-i stuttered , " and even then [the mountain of [[your]359-the old wizard Queen]3194-your queen]3193-the mountain of your queen , if it be [[her]3194-your queen mountain]3195-her mountain , is far away , and how can [I]0-i come [there]3196-there alone ? "[0-i]

" [I]104-zikali do n't know , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , though perhaps [you]105-macumazahn might do so in company . At least [I]104-zikali believe that in the old days [people]3197-people used to travel to [the place]328-the place , since [I]104-zikali have heard [a great city]3199-a great city stood [there]3196-there once which was the heart of [a mighty empire]3201-a mighty empire . "[104-zikali]

Now [I]0-i pricked up [my]0-i ears , for though [I]0-i believed nothing of [Zikali]104-zikali 's story of [a wonderful Queen]367-a wonderful queen , [I]0-i was always intensely interested in past civilisations and [their]368-their relics . Also [I]0-i knew that [the old wizard]359-the old wizard 's knowledge was extensive and peculiar , however [he]359-the old wizard came by it , and [I]0-i did not think that [he]359-the old wizard would lie to [me]0-i in this matter . Indeed to tell the truth , then and there [I]0-i made up [my]0-i mind that if it were in any way possible , [I]0-i would attempt this journey .

" How did [people]3197-people travel to [the city]3203-the city , [Zikali]104-zikali ? "[370-i]

" By [sea]3204-sea , [I]370-i suppose , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , but [I]370-i think that [you]104-zikali will be wise not to try [that road]3136-that road , since [I]370-i believe that on [the sea]3206-the sea side [the marshes]3207-the marshes are now impassable and [you]104-zikali will be safer on [your]104-zikali feet . "[370-i]

" [You]104-zikali want [me]370-i to go on this adventure , [Zikali]104-zikali . Why ? [I]370-i know [you]104-zikali never do anything without motive . "[370-i]

" Oho ! [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [you]104-zikali are clever and see deeper into the trunk of a tree than most . Yes , [I]370-i want [you]104-zikali to go for three reasons . First , that [you]104-zikali may satisfy [your]104-zikali soul on certain matters and [I]370-i would help [you]104-zikali to do so . Secondly , because [I]370-i want to satisfy [mine]370-i , and thirdly , because [I]370-i know that [you]104-zikali will come back safe to be a prop to [me]370-i in things that will happen in days unborn . Otherwise [I]370-i would have told [you]104-zikali nothing of this story , since it is necessary to [me]370-i that [you]104-zikali should remain living beneath the sun . "[370-i]

" Have done , [Zikali]104-zikali . What is it that [you]104-zikali desire ? "[370-i]

" Oh ! a great deal that [I]370-i shall get , but chiefly two things , so with the rest [I]370-i will not trouble [you]104-zikali . First [I]370-i desire to know to know whether these dreams of [mine]370-i of [a wonderful white witch - doctoress]3208-a wonderful white witch - doctoress , or [witch]3209-witch , and of [my]370-i converse with [her]3208-a wonderful white witch - doctoress are indeed more than dreams . Next [I]370-i would learn whether certain plots of [mine]370-i at which [I]370-i have worked for years , will succeed . "[370-i]

" What plots , [Zikali]104-zikali , and how can [my]370-i taking a distant journey tell [you]104-zikali anything about them ? "[370-i]

" [You]104-zikali know [them]3210-them well enough , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn ; they have to do with the overthrow of [a Royal House that has worked [me]370-i bitter wrong]3211-a royal house that has worked me bitter wrong . As to how [your]104-zikali journey can help [me]370-i , why , thus . [You]104-zikali shall promise to [me]370-i to ask of [this Queen]3212-this queen whether [Zikali]104-zikali , [Opener - of - Roads]3128-opener - of - roads , shall triumph or be overthrown in that on which [he]104-zikali has set [his]104-zikali heart . "[370-i]

" As [you]104-zikali seem to know [this witch]3214-this witch so well , why do [you]104-zikali not ask [her]3214-this witch [yourself]104-zikali , [Zikali]104-zikali ? "[370-i]

" To ask is one thing , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . To get an answer is another . [I]370-i have asked in the watches of the night , and the reply was , ' Come hither and perchance [I]370-i will tell [you]104-zikali . ' ' [Queen]3185-queen , ' [I]370-i said , ' how can [I]370-i come save in the spirit , who am [an ancient and a crippled dwarf]3216-an ancient and a crippled dwarf scarcely able to stand upon [my]370-i feet ? '[370-i]

" ' Then send [a messenger]3217-a messenger , [Wizard]88-rezu , and be sure that [he]104-zikali is white , for of [black savages]3218-black savages [I]370-i have seen more than enough . Let [him]104-zikali bear a token also that [he]104-zikali comes from [you]104-zikali and tell [me]370-i of it in [your]104-zikali sleep . Moreover let that token be something of power which will protect [him]104-zikali on the journey . '[370-i]

" Such is the answer that comes to [me]370-i in [my]370-i dreams , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . "[370-i]

" Well , what token will [you]370-i give [me]370-i , [Zikali]104-zikali ? "[370-i]

[He]370-i groped about in [his]370-i robe and produced a piece of ivory of the size of a large chessman , that had a hole in it , through which ran a plaited cord of the stiff hairs from an elephant 's tail . On this article , which was of a rusty brown colour , [he]370-i breathed , then having whispered to it for a while , handed it to [me]0-i .

[I]0-i took the talisman , for such [I]0-i guessed it to be , idly enough , held it to the light to examine it , and started back so violently that almost [I]0-i let it fall . [I]0-i do not quite know why [I]0-i started , but [I]0-i think it was because some influence seemed to leap from it to [me]0-i . [Zikali]104-zikali started also and cried out ,

" Have a care , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . Am [I]104-zikali young that [I]104-zikali can bear bring [dashed]3219-dashed to the ground ? "[104-zikali]

" What do [you]104-zikali mean ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , still staring at the thing which [I]0-i perceived to be a most wonderfully fashioned likeness of [the old dwarf]357-the old dwarf [himself]370-i as [he]370-i appeared before [me]0-i crouched upon the ground . There were the deepset eyes , the great head , the toad - like shape , the long hair , all .

" It is a clever carving , is it not , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn ? [I]370-i am skilled in that art , [you]105-macumazahn know , and therefore can judge of carving . "[370-i]

" Yes , [I]0-i know , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , bethinking [me]0-i of another statuette of [his]370-i which [he]370-i had given to [me]0-i on the morrow of the death of [her]372-her from whom it was modelled . " But what of the thing ? "[370-i]

" [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , it has come down to [me]0-i through the ages . As [you]105-macumazahn may have heard , [all great doctors]3220-all great doctors when [they]3220-all great doctors die pass on [their]3220-all great doctors wisdom and something of [their]3220-all great doctors knowledge to [another doctor of spirits who is still living on [the earth]285-the earth]3221-another doctor of spirits who is still living on the earth , that nothing may be lost , or as little as possible . Also [I]0-i have learned that to such likenesses as these may be given the strength of [him]3223-him or [her]3224-her from whom they were shaped . "[0-i]

Now [I]0-i bethought [me]0-i of [the old Egyptians]320-the old egyptians and [their]320-the old egyptians Ka statues of which [I]0-i had read , and that these statues , magically charmed and set in [the tombs of [the departed]375-the departed]374-the tombs of the departed , were supposed to be inhabited everlastingly by [the Doubles of the dead endued with more power even than ever these possessed in life]376-the doubles of the dead endued with more power even than ever these possessed in life . But of this [I]0-i said nothing to [Zikali]104-zikali , thinking that it would take too much explanation , though [I]0-i wondered very much how [he]104-zikali had come by the same idea .

" When that ivory is hung over [your]3225-your heart , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , where [you]3225-your must always wear it , learn that with it goes the strength of [Zikali]104-zikali ; the thought that would have been [his]104-zikali thought and the wisdom that is [his]104-zikali wisdom , will be [[your]3225-your companions]3226-your companions , as much as though [he]104-zikali walked at [your]3225-your side and could instruct [you]3225-your in every peril . [Moreover north]3227-moreover north and south and east and west this image is known to [[men]3228-men who , when [they]3228-men see it , will bow down and obey , opening a road to [him]104-zikali who wears the medicine of [the Opener - of - Roads]3230-the opener - of - roads]3229-men who , when they see it , will bow down and obey , opening a road to him who wears the medicine of the opener - of - roads . "[104-zikali]

" Indeed , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , smiling , " and what is this colour on the ivory ? "[0-i]

" [I]377-you forget , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , who have had it a great number of years , ever since it descended to [me]377-you from [a forefather of [mine]0-i , who was fashioned in the same mould as [I]377-you am]3231-a forefather of mine , who was fashioned in the same mould as i am . It looks like blood , does it not ? It is a pity that [Mameena]107-mameena is not still alive , since [she]107-mameena whose memory was so excellent might have been able to tell [you]0-i , "[377-you] and as [he]377-you spoke , with a motion that was at once sure and swift , [he]377-you threw the loop of elephant hair over [my]0-i head .

Hastily [I]0-i changed the subject , feeling that after [his]377-you wo nt [this old wizard]378-this old wizard , [the most terrible man whom ever [I]0-i knew , who had been so much concerned with the tragic death of [Mameena]107-mameena]379-the most terrible man whom ever i knew , who had been so much concerned with the tragic death of mameena , was stabbing at [me]0-i in some hidden fashion .

" [You]377-you tell [me]0-i to go on this journey , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " and not alone . Yet for companion [you]377-you give [me]0-i only an ugly piece of ivory shaped as [no man]3232-no man ever was , "[0-i] here [I]0-i got one back at [Zikali]104-zikali , " and from the look of it , steeped in blood , which ivory , if [I]0-i had [my]0-i way , [I]0-i would throw into the camp fire . Who , then , am [I]0-i to take with [me]0-i ? "[0-i]

" Do n't do that , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn - [I]104-zikali mean throw the ivory into the fire - since [I]104-zikali have no wish to burn before [my]104-zikali time , and if [you]377-you do , [you]377-you who have worn it might burn with [me]104-zikali . At least certainly [you]377-you would die with the magic thing and go to acquire knowledge more quickly than [you]377-you desire . No , no , and do not try to take it off [your]377-you neck , or rather try if [you]377-you will . "[104-zikali]

[I]0-i did try , but something seemed to prevent [me]0-i from accomplishing [my]0-i purpose of giving the carving back to [Zikali]104-zikali as [I]0-i wished to do . First [my]0-i pipe got in the way of [my]0-i hand , then the elephant hairs caught in the collar of [my]0-i coat ; then a pang of rheumatism to which [I]0-i was accustomed from an old lion - bite , developed of a sudden in [my]0-i arm , and lastly [I]0-i grew tired of bothering about the thing .

[Zikali]104-zikali , who had been watching [my]0-i movements , burst out into one of [his]104-zikali terrible laughs that seemed to fill the whole kloof and to re - echo from [its]104-zikali rocky walls . It died away and [he]104-zikali went on , without further reference to the talisman or image .

" [You]0-i asked whom [you]0-i were to take with [you]0-i , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . Well , as to this [I]104-zikali must make inquiry of [those who know . Man]3233-those who know . man , [[my]104-zikali medicines]3234-my medicines ! "[104-zikali]

From the shadows in [the hut]380-the hut behind darted out [a tall figure carrying a great spear in one hand]381-a tall figure carrying a great spear in one hand and in the other a catskin bag which with a salute [he]104-zikali laid down at the feet of [[his]104-zikali master]382-his master . This salute , by the way , was that of a Zulu word which means " Lord "[104-zikali] or " Home "[104-zikali] of [Ghosts]109-ghosts .

[Zikali]104-zikali groped in the bag and produced from it certain knuckle - bones .

" A common method , "[104-zikali] [he]104-zikali muttered , ' such as [every vulgar wizard]383-every vulgar wizard uses , but one that is quick and , as the matter concerned is small , will serve [my]0-i turn . Let [us]384-us see now , whom [you]385-you shall take with [you]385-you , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . "[105-macumazahn]

Then [he]104-zikali breathed upon the bones , shook them up in [his]104-zikali thin hands and with a quick turn of the wrist , threw them into the air . After this [he]104-zikali studied them carefully , where they lay among the ashes which [he]104-zikali had raked out of the fire , those that [he]104-zikali had used for the making of [his]104-zikali map .

" Do [you]385-you know [a man named [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas]3235-a man named umslopogaas , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [the chief of [a tribe that is called [The People of the Axe , whose titles of praise]3238-the people of the axe , whose titles of praise are [Bulalio]110-bulalio or [the Slaughterer]3239-the slaughterer , and Woodpecker , the latter from the way [he]104-zikali handles [his]104-zikali ancient axe]3237-a tribe that is called the people of the axe , whose titles of praise are bulalio or the slaughterer , and woodpecker , the latter from the way he handles his ancient axe]3236-the chief of a tribe that is called the people of the axe , whose titles of praise are bulalio or the slaughterer , and woodpecker , the latter from the way he handles his ancient axe ? [He]104-zikali is [a savage fellow]3240-a savage fellow , but [one of high blood and higher courage]3241-one of high blood and higher courage , [a great captain in [his]104-zikali way]3242-a great captain in his way , though [he]104-zikali will never come to anything , save a glorious death - in [your]385-you company , [I]386-i think , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . "[386-i] Here [he]386-i studied the bones again for a while . " Yes , [I]386-i am sure , in [your]385-you company , though not upon this journey . "[386-i]

" [I]0-i have heard of [him]104-zikali , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered cautiously . " It is said in [the land]3243-the land that [he]104-zikali is [a son of [Chaka]106-chaka]3244-a son of chaka , [the great king of [the Zulus]354-the zulus]3245-the great king of the zulus . "[0-i]

" Is it , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn ? And is it said also that [he]104-zikali was [the slayer of [[Chaka]106-chaka 's brother]3248-chaka 's brother]3247-the slayer of chaka 's brother , [Dingaan]111-dingaan , also [the lover of [the fairest woman that [the Zulus]101-the zulus have ever seen]3250-the fairest woman that the zulus have ever seen , who was called [Nada the Lily]112-nada]3249-the lover of the fairest woman that the zulus have ever seen , who was called nada the lily ? Unless indeed a certain [Mameena]107-mameena , who , [I]386-i seem to remember , was [a friend of yours]3251-a friend of yours , may have been even more beautiful ? "[386-i]

" [I]0-i know nothing of [Nada the Lily]112-nada , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" No , no , [Mameena]107-mameena , ' [the Waiting Wind]3252-the waiting wind , ' has blown over [her]107-mameena fame , so why should [you]0-i know of [one who has been dead a long while]3253-one who has been dead a long while ? Why also , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , do [you]0-i always bring [women]3186-women into every business ? [I]104-zikali begin to believe that although [you]0-i are so strict in [a white man]3255-a white man 's fashion , [you]0-i must be too fond of them , a weakness which makes for ruin to [any man]3256-any man . Well , now , [I]104-zikali think that [this wolf - man]3257-this wolf - man , [this axe - man]3258-this axe - man , [this warrior]3259-this warrior , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas should be [a good fellow to [you]0-i on [your]0-i journey to visit [the white witch]3261-the white witch , [Queen]3185-queen]3260-a good fellow to you on your journey to visit the white witch , queen - [another woman by the way , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn]3263-another woman by the way , macumazahn , and therefore one of whom [you]0-i should be careful . Oh ! yes , [he]3257-this wolf - man will come with [you]0-i - because of [a man called [Lousta]113-lousta]3264-a man called lousta and [a woman named [Monazi]114-monazi]3265-a woman named monazi , [a wife of [his]3257-this wolf - man who hates [him]3257-this wolf - man and does - not hate [Lousta]113-lousta]3266-a wife of his who hates him and does - not hate lousta . [I]104-zikali am almost sure that [he]3257-this wolf - man will come with [you]0-i , so do not stop to ask questions about [him]3257-this wolf - man . "[104-zikali]

" Is there [anyone else]3267-anyone else ? "[0-i] [I]0-i inquired .

[Zikali]104-zikali glanced at the bones again , poking them about in the ashes with [his]104-zikali toe , then replied with a yawn ,

" [You]0-i seem to have [a little yellow man in [your]0-i service]3268-a little yellow man in your service , [a clever snake who knows how to creep through grass , and when to strike and when to lie hidden]3269-a clever snake who knows how to creep through grass , and when to strike and when to lie hidden . [I]104-zikali should take [him]3268-a little yellow man in your service too , if [I]104-zikali were [you]0-i . "[104-zikali]

" [You]0-i know well that [I]104-zikali have [such a man]3270-such a man , [Zikali]104-zikali , [a Hottentot named [Hans]87-hans]3271-a hottentot named hans , clever in [his]3271-a hottentot named hans way but drunken , very faithful too , since [he]3271-a hottentot named hans loved [[my]104-zikali father]3272-my father before [me]104-zikali . [He]3271-a hottentot named hans is cooking [my]104-zikali supper in the waggon now . Are there to be any others ? "[104-zikali]

" No , [I]104-zikali think [you]0-i three will be enough , with [a guard of soldiers from [the People of the Axe]3274-the people of the axe]3273-a guard of soldiers from the people of the axe , for [you]0-i will meet with fighting and a ghost or two . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas has always one at [his]125-umslopogaas elbow named [Nada]112-nada , and perhaps [you]0-i have several . For instance , there was [a certain [Mameena]107-mameena whom [I]104-zikali always seem to feel about [me]104-zikali when [you]0-i are near]3275-a certain mameena whom i always seem to feel about me when you are near , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn .[104-zikali]

" Why , the wind is rising again , which is odd on so still an evening . Listen to how it wails , yes , and stirs [your]0-i hair , though mine hangs straight enough . But why do [I]104-zikali talk of ghosts , seeing that [you]0-i travel to seek other ghosts , white ghosts , beyond [my]104-zikali ken , who can only deal with [those who were black]3276-those who were black ?[104-zikali]

" Good - night , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , good - night . When [you]0-i return from visiting [the white Queen]3277-the white queen , that Great One beneath those feet [I]104-zikali , [Zikali]104-zikali , who am also great in [my]104-zikali way , am but a grain of dust , come and tell [me]104-zikali [her]3277-the white queen answer to [my]104-zikali question .[104-zikali]

" Meanwhile , be careful always to wear that pretty little image which [I]104-zikali have given [you]0-i , as [a young lover]3278-a young lover sometimes wears a lock of hair cut from the head of [some fool - girl that [he]3278-a young lover thinks is fond of [him]3278-a young lover]3279-some fool - girl that he thinks is fond of him . It will bring [you]0-i safety and luck , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , which , for the most part , is more than the lock of hair does to [the lover]3280-the lover . Oh ! it is a strange world , full of jest to those who can see the strings that work it . [I]104-zikali am [one of [them]3282-them]3281-one of them , and perhaps , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [you]0-i are another , or will be before all is done - or begun .[104-zikali]

" Good - night , and good fortune to [you]0-i on [your]0-i journeyings , and , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , although [you]0-i are so fond of [women]3186-women , be careful not to fall in love with [that white Queen]3284-that white queen , because it would make [others]279-others jealous ; [I]104-zikali mean [some who [you]0-i have lost sight of for a while , also [I]104-zikali think that being under a curse of [her]3284-that white queen own]3286-some who you have lost sight of for a while , also i think that being under a curse of her own , [she]3284-that white queen is not one whom [you]0-i can put into [your]0-i sack . Oho ! Oho - ho ! [Slave]3287-slave , bring [me]104-zikali [my]104-zikali blanket , it grows cold , and [my]104-zikali medicine also , that which protects [me]104-zikali from [the ghosts , who are thick to - night]3288-the ghosts , who are thick to - night . [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn brings [them]3288-the ghosts , who are thick to - night , [I]104-zikali think . Oho - ho ! "[104-zikali]

[I]0-i turned to depart but when [I]0-i had gone a little way [Zikali]104-zikali called [me]0-i back again and said , speaking very low ,

" When [you]0-i meet [this Umslopogaas]3289-this umslopogaas , as [you]0-i will meet [him]3289-this umslopogaas , [he]3289-this umslopogaas who is called [the Woodpecker]3290-the woodpecker and [the Slaughterer]3239-the slaughterer , say these words to [him]3289-this umslopogaas ,[104-zikali]

" ' A bat has been twittering round [the hut of [the Opener - of - Roads]3230-the opener - of - roads]3292-the hut of the opener - of - roads , and to [his]3289-this umslopogaas ears it squeaked the name of [a certain Lousta]3294-a certain lousta and the name of [a woman called [Monazi]114-monazi]3295-a woman called monazi . Also it twittered another greater name that may not be uttered , that of an elephant who shakes the earth , and said that this elephant sniffs the air with [his]3289-this umslopogaas trunk and grows angry , and sharpens [his]3289-this umslopogaas tusks to dig a certain Woodpecker out of [his]3289-this umslopogaas hole in a tree that grows near [the Witch Mountain]12-the witch mountain . Say , too , that [the Opener - of - Roads]3230-the opener - of - roads thinks that [this Woodpecker]3297-this woodpecker would be wise to fly north for a while in the company of [one who watches by night]3298-one who watches by night , lest harm should come to a bird that pecks at the feet of the great and chatters of it in [his]3297-this woodpecker nest . ' "[104-zikali]

Then [Zikali]104-zikali waved [his]104-zikali hand and [I]0-i went , wondering into what plot [I]0-i had stumbled .

CHAPTER II

THE MESSENGERS

[I]0-i did not rest as [I]0-i should that night who somehow was never able to sleep well in [the neighbourhood of [the Black Kloof]6-the black kloof]387-the neighbourhood of the black kloof . [I]0-i suppose that [Zikali]104-zikali 's constant talk about ghosts , with [his]104-zikali hints and innuendoes concerning [those who were dead]388-those who were dead , always affected [my]0-i nerves till , in a subconscious way , [I]0-i began to believe that such things existed and were hanging about [me]0-i . [Many people]389-many people are open to the power of suggestion , and [I]0-i am afraid that [I]0-i am one of [them]389-many people .

However , the sun which has such strength to kill noxious things , puts an end to ghosts more quickly even than it does to other evil vapours and emanations , and when [I]0-i woke up to find it shining brilliantly in a pure heaven , [I]0-i laughed with much heartiness over the whole affair .

Going to [the spring near which [we]391-we were outspanned]390-the spring near which we were outspanned , [I]0-i took off [my]0-i shirt to have a good wash , still chuckling at the memory of all the hocus - pocus of [[my]0-i old friend]392-my old friend , [the Opener - of - Roads]3230-the opener - of - roads .

While engaged in this matutinal operation [I]0-i struck [my]0-i hand against something and looking , observed that it was the hideous little ivory image of [Zikali]104-zikali , which [he]104-zikali had set about [my]0-i neck . The sight of the thing and the memory of [his]104-zikali ridiculous talk about it , especially of its assertion that it had come down to [him]104-zikali through the ages , which it could not have done , seeing that it was a likeness of [himself]104-zikali , irritated [me]0-i so much that [I]0-i proceeded to take it off with the full intention of throwing it into [the spring]394-the spring .

As [I]0-i was in the act of doing this , from a clump of reeds mixed with bushes , quite close to [me]0-i , there came a sound of hissing , and suddenly above [them]395-them appeared the head of [a great black immamba]396-a great black immamba , perhaps the deadliest of all [our]397-our African snakes , and the only one [I]0-i know which will attack [man]287-man without provocation .

Leaving go of the image , [I]0-i sprang back in a great hurry towards where [my]0-i gun lay . Then the snake vanished and making sure that it had departed to [its]396-a great black immamba hole , which was probably at a distance , [I]0-i returned to [the pool]399-the pool , and once more began to take off the talisman in order to consign it to the bottom of [the pool]399-the pool .

After all , [I]0-i reflected , it was a hideous and probably a blood - stained thing which [I]0-i did not in the least wish to wear about [my]0-i neck like [a lady]401-a lady 's love - token .

Just as it was coming over [my]0-i head , suddenly from the other side of the bush that infernal snake popped up again , this time , it was clear , really intent on business . [It]396-a great black immamba began to move towards [me]0-i in the lightning - like way immambas have , hissing and flicking its tongue .

[I]0-i was too quick for [[my]0-i friend]270-my friend , however , for snatching up the gun that [I]0-i had lain down beside [me]0-i , [I]0-i let [it]396-a great black immamba have a charge of buckshot in the neck which nearly cut it in two , so that it fell down and expired with hideous convulsive writhings .

Hearing the shot [Hans]87-hans came running from the waggon to see what was the matter . [Hans]87-hans , [I]0-i should say , was [that same Hottentot who had been the companion of most of [my]0-i journeyings since [[my]0-i father]3272-my father 's day]403-that same hottentot who had been the companion of most of my journeyings since my father 's day . [He]87-hans was with [me]0-i when as [a young fellow]405-a young fellow [I]0-i accompanied [Retief]115-retief to [[Dingaan]111-dingaan 's kraal]406-dingaan 's kraal , and like [myself]0-i , escaped the massacre . Also [we]407-we shared many other adventures , including the great one in [the Land of [the Ivory Child]116-the ivory child where [he]87-hans slew [the huge elephant - god]409-the huge elephant - god , [Jana]117-jana , and [himself]87-hans]408-the land of the ivory child where he slew the huge elephant - god , jana , and himself was slain . But of this journey [we]407-we did not dream in those days .

See the book called " [Marie]118-marie . "[108-editor] - [Editor]108-editor .

For the rest [Hans]87-hans was [a most entirely unprincipled person]410-a most entirely unprincipled person , but as [the Boers]411-the boers say , " as clever as [a waggonload of monkeys]3299-a waggonload of monkeys . "[87-hans] Also [he]87-hans drank when [he]87-hans got the chance . One good quality [he]87-hans had , however ; [no man]3232-no man was ever more faithful , and perhaps it would be true to say that [neither man]413-neither man nor [woman]325-woman ever loved [me]0-i , unworthy , quite so well .

In appearance [he]87-hans rather resembled [an antique and dilapidated baboon]415-an antique and dilapidated baboon ; [his]87-hans face was wrinkled like a dried nut and [his]87-hans quick little eyes were bloodshot . [I]0-i never knew what [his]87-hans age was , any more than [he]87-hans did [himself]87-hans , but the years had left [him]87-hans tough as whipcord and absolutely untiring . Lastly [he]87-hans was perhaps the best hand at following a spoor that ever [I]0-i knew and up to a hundred and fifty yards or so , a very deadly shot with a rifle especially when [he]87-hans used a little single - barrelled , muzzle - loading gun of [mine]0-i made by [Purdey]119-purdey which [he]87-hans named Intombi or [Maiden]120-maiden . Of that gun , however , [I]0-i have written in " The Holy Flower "[87-hans] and elsewhere .

" What is it , [Baas]121-baas ? "[87-hans] [he]87-hans asked . " Here there are no lions , nor any game . "[87-hans]

" Look [the other side of the bush]3300-the other side of the bush , [Hans]87-hans . "[87-hans]

[He]87-hans slipped round it , making a wide circle with [his]87-hans usual caution , then , seeing the snake which was , by the way , [I]0-i think , the biggest immamba [I]0-i ever killed , suddenly froze , as it were , in a stiff attitude that reminded [me]0-i of a pointer when it scents game . Having made sure that it was dead , [he]87-hans nodded and said ,

" [Black ' mamba]122-black ' mamba , or so [you]121-baas would call it , though [I]87-hans know it for something else . "[87-hans]

" What else , [Hans]87-hans ? "[87-hans]

" [One of [the old witch - doctor Zikali]3302-the old witch - doctor zikali 's spirits which [he]3302-the old witch - doctor zikali sets at [the mouth of [this kloof]3304-this kloof]3303-the mouth of this kloof to warn [him]3302-the old witch - doctor zikali of who comes or goes]3301-one of the old witch - doctor zikali 's spirits which he sets at the mouth of this kloof to warn him of who comes or goes . [I]87-hans know it well , and so do [others]279-others . [I]87-hans saw it listening behind a stone when [you]87-hans were up [the kloof]3306-the kloof last evening talking with [the Opener - of - Roads]20-opener - of - roads . "[87-hans]

" Then [Zikali]104-zikali will lack a spirit , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , laughing , " which perhaps [he]104-zikali will not miss amongst so many . It serves [him]104-zikali right for setting the brute on [me]0-i . "[0-i]

" Quite so , [Baas]121-baas . [He]104-zikali will be angry . [I]416-he wonder why [he]104-zikali did it ? "[416-he] [he]416-he added suspiciously , ' seeing that [he]416-he is such [a friend of [yours]0-i]3251-a friend of yours . "[416-he]

" [He]104-zikali did n't do it , [Hans]87-hans . These snakes are very fierce and give battle , that is all . "[416-he]

[Hans]87-hans paid no attention to [my]0-i remark , which probably [he]87-hans thought only worthy of [a white man who does not understand]418-a white man who does not understand , but rolled [his]87-hans yellow , bloodshot eyes about , as though in search of explanations . Presently they fell upon the ivory that hung about [my]0-i neck , and [he]87-hans started .

" Why do [you]0-i wear that pretty likeness of the Great One yonder over [your]0-i heart , as [I]87-hans have known [you]0-i do with things that belonged to [women]3186-women in past days , [Baas]121-baas ? Do [you]0-i know that it is [Zikali]104-zikali 's Great Medicine , nothing less , as [everyone]3308-everyone does throughout [the land]3243-the land ? When [Zikali]104-zikali sends an order far away , [he]104-zikali always sends that image with it , for then [he]104-zikali who receives the order knows that [he]104-zikali must obey or die . Also [the messenger]3310-the messenger knows that [he]3310-the messenger will come to no harm if [he]3310-the messenger does not take it off , because , [Baas]121-baas , the image is [Zikali]104-zikali [himself]104-zikali , and [Zikali]104-zikali is the image . [They]3311-they are one and the same . Also it is the image of [[[his]104-zikali father]3312-his father 's father 's father]3313-his father 's father 's father - or so [he]104-zikali says . "[87-hans]

" That is an odd story , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

Then [I]0-i told [Hans]87-hans as much as [I]0-i thought advisable of how this horrid little talisman came into [my]0-i possession .

[Hans]87-hans nodded without showing any surprise .

" So [we]3314-we are going on a long journey , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans said . " Well , [I]87-hans thought it was time that [we]3314-we did something more than wander about [these tame countries]3315-these tame countries selling blankets to [stinking old women]3316-stinking old women and so forth , [Baas]121-baas . Moreover , [Zikali]104-zikali does not wish that [you]0-i should come to harm , doubtless because [he]104-zikali does wish to make use of [you]0-i afterwards - oh ! it 's safe to talk now when that spirit is away looking for another snake . What were [you]0-i doing with the Great Medicine , [Baas]121-baas , when [the ' mamba]3317-the ' mamba attacked [you]0-i ? "[87-hans]

" Taking it off to throw it into the pool , [Hans]87-hans , as [I]87-hans do not like the thing . [I]87-hans tried twice and each time the immamba appeared . "[87-hans]

" Of course it appeared , [Baas]121-baas , and what is more , if [you]0-i had taken that Medicine off and thrown it away [you]0-i would have disappeared , since [the ' mamba]3317-the ' mamba would have killed [you]0-i . [Zikali]104-zikali wanted to show [you]0-i that , [Baas]121-baas , and that is why [he]104-zikali set the snake at [you]0-i . "[87-hans]

" [You]0-i are [a superstitious old fool]3319-a superstitious old fool , [Hans]87-hans . "[87-hans]

" Yes , [Baas]121-baas , but [[my]87-hans father]3272-my father knew all about that Great Medicine before [me]87-hans , for [he]3272-my father was a bit of [a doctor]3321-a doctor , and so does [every wizard and witch]3322-every wizard and witch for a thousand miles or more . [I]87-hans tell [you]0-i , [Baas]121-baas , it is known by all though [no one]3323-no one ever talks about it , no , not even [the king]3324-the king [himself]3324-the king . [Baas]121-baas , speaking to [you]0-i , not with the voice of [Hans]87-hans [the old drunkard]3325-the old drunkard , but with that of [the Predikant]3326-the predikant , [[your]0-i reverend father]3327-your reverend father , who made so good a Christian of [me]87-hans and who tells [me]87-hans to do so from up in [Heaven where the hot fires are which the wood]3328-heaven where the hot fires are which the wood feeds of itself , [I]87-hans beg [you]0-i not to try to throw away the Medicine again , or if [you]0-i wish to do so , to leave [me]87-hans behind on this journey . For [you]0-i see , [Baas]121-baas , although [I]87-hans am now so good , almost like one of those angels with the pretty goose 's wings in the pictures , [I]87-hans feel that [I]87-hans should like to grow a little better before [I]87-hans go to [the Place of Fires]3329-the place of fires to make report to [[your]0-i reverend father]3327-your reverend father , [the Predikant]124-the predikant . "[87-hans]

Thinking of how horrified [[my]0-i dear father]419-my dear father would be if [he]419-my dear father could hear all this string of ridiculous nonsense and learn the result of [his]419-my dear father moral and religious lessons on raw Hottentot material , [I]0-i burst out laughing . But [Hans]87-hans went on as gravely as [a judge]420-a judge ,

" Wear the Great Medicine , [Baas]121-baas , wear it ; part with the liver inside [you]0-i before [you]0-i part with that , [Baas]121-baas . It may not be as pretty or smell as sweet as [a woman]3331-a woman 's hair in a little gold bottle , but it is much more useful . The sight of [the woman]3332-the woman 's hair will only make [you]0-i sick in [your]0-i stomach and cause [you]0-i to remember a lot of things which [you]0-i had much better forget , but the Great Medicine , or rather [Zikali]104-zikali who is in it , will keep the assegais and sickness out of [you]0-i and turn back bad magic on to the heads of [those who sent it]3333-those who sent it , and always bring [us]3334-us plenty to eat and perhaps , if [we]3334-us are lucky , a little to drink too sometimes . "[87-hans]

" Go away , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [I]0-i want to wash . "[0-i]

" Yes , [Baas]121-baas , but with [the Baas]121-baas 's leave [I]87-hans will sit on the other side of that bush with the gun - not to look at [the Baas]121-baas without [his]121-baas clothes , because [white people]3335-white people are always so ugly that it makes [me]87-hans feel ill to see [them]3335-white people undressed , also because - [the Baas]121-baas will forgive [me]87-hans - but because [they]3335-white people smell . No , not for that , but just to see that no other snake comes . "[87-hans]

" Get out of [the road]3133-the road , [[you]421-he dirty little scoundrel]3337-you dirty little scoundrel , and stop [your]421-he impudence , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , lifting [my]0-i foot suggestively .

Thereon [he]421-he scooted with a subdued grin round the other side of the bush , whence as [I]0-i knew well [he]421-he kept [his]421-he eye fixed on [me]0-i to be sure that [I]0-i made no further attempt to take off the Great Medicine .

Now of this talisman [I]0-i may as well say at once that [I]0-i am no believer in it or its precious influences . Therefore , although it was useful sometimes , notably twice when [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas was concerned , [I]0-i do not know whether personally [I]0-i should have done better or worse upon that journey if [I]0-i had thrown it into the pool .

It is true , however , that until quite the end of this history when it became needful to do so to save another , [I]0-i never made any further attempt to remove it from [my]0-i neck , not even when it rubbed a sore in [my]0-i skin , because [I]0-i did not wish to offend the prejudices of [Hans]87-hans .

It is true , moreover , that this hideous ivory had a reputation which stretched very far from the place where it was made and was regarded with great reverence by all kinds of [queer people]422-queer people , even by [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas [themselves]125-umslopogaas , of whom presently , as [they]423-they say in pedigrees , a fact of which [I]0-i found sundry proofs . Indeed , [I]0-i saw a first example of it when a little while later [I]0-i met [that great warrior]424-that great warrior , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , [Chief of [the People of the Axe]3274-the people of the axe]425-chief of the people of the axe .

For , after determining firmly , for reasons which [I]0-i will set out , that [I]0-i would not visit [this man]427-this man , in the end [I]0-i did so , although by then [I]0-i had given up any idea of journeying across [the Zambesi]11-the zambesi to look for [a mysterious and non - existent witch - woman]428-a mysterious and non - existent witch - woman , as [Zikali]104-zikali had suggested that [I]0-i should do . To begin with [I]0-i knew that [his]104-zikali talk was all rubbish and , even if it were not , that at the bottom of it was some desire of [the Opener - of - Roads]3230-the opener - of - roads that [I]0-i should make a path for [him]104-zikali to travel towards an indefinite but doubtless evil object of [his]104-zikali own . Further , by this time [I]0-i had worn through that mood of [mine]0-i which had caused [me]0-i to yearn for correspondence with [the departed]375-the departed and a certain knowledge of [their]375-the departed existence .

[I]0-i wonder whether [many people]389-many people understand , as [I]0-i do , how entirely distinct and how variable are these moods which sway [us]432-we , or at any rate some of [us]432-we , at sundry periods of [our]432-we lives . As [I]0-i think [I]0-i have already suggested , at one time [we]432-we are all spiritual ; at another all physical ; at one time [we]432-we are sure that [our]432-we lives here are as a dream and a shadow and that the real existence lies elsewhere ; at another that these brief days of ours are the only business with which [we]432-we have to do and that of it [we]432-we must make the best .
