At one time [we]432-we think [our]432-we loves much more immortal than the stars ; at another that they are mere shadows cast by the baleful sun of desire upon the shallow and fleeting water [we]432-we call Life which seems to flow out of nowhere into nowhere . At one time [we]432-we are full of faith , at another all such hopes are blotted out by a black wall of Nothingness , and so on ad infinitum . [Only very stupid people]433-only very stupid people , or humbugs , are or pretend to be , always consistent and unchanging .

To return , [I]0-i determined not only that [I]0-i would not travel north to seek that which [no living man]434-no living man will ever find , certainty as to the future , but also , to show [my]0-i independence of [Zikali]104-zikali , that [I]0-i would not visit [this chief]435-this chief , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas . So , having traded all [my]0-i goods and made a fair profit on paper , [I]0-i set [myself]0-i to return to [Natal]14-natal , proposing to rest awhile in [[my]0-i little house at [Durban]3-durban]436-my little house at durban , and told [Hans]87-hans [my]0-i mind .

" Very good , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans said . " [I]87-hans , too , should like to go to [Durban]3-durban . There are lots of things there that [we]3338-we can not get [here]3339-here , "[87-hans] and [he]87-hans fixed [his]87-hans roving eye upon a square - faced gin bottle , which as it happened was filled with nothing stronger than water , because all the gin was drunk . " Yet , [Baas]121-baas , [we]3338-we shall not see [the Berea]3340-the berea for a long while . "[87-hans]

" Why do [you]87-hans say that ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked sharply .

" Oh ! [Baas]121-baas , [I]87-hans do n't know , but [you]121-baas went to visit [the Opener - of - Roads]3230-the opener - of - roads , did [you]121-baas not , and [he]87-hans told [you]121-baas to go [north]3342-north and lent [you]121-baas a certain Great Medicine , did [he]87-hans not ? "[87-hans]

[Here Hands]126-here hands proceeded to light [his]87-hans corncob pipe with an ash from the fire , all the time keeping [his]87-hans beady eyes fixed upon that part of [me]0-i where [he]87-hans knew the talisman was hung .

" Quite true , [Hans]87-hans , but now [I]87-hans mean to show [Zikali]104-zikali that [I]87-hans am not [[his]104-zikali messenger]3343-his messenger , for south or north or east or west . So to - morrow morning [we]3344-we cross [the river]3345-the river and trek for [Natal]14-natal . "[87-hans]

" Yes , [Baas]121-baas , but then why not cross it this evening ? There is still light . "[87-hans]

" [I]0-i have said that [we]3344-we will cross it to - morrow morning , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered with that firmness which [I]0-i have read always indicates [a man of character]437-a man of character , " and [I]0-i do not change [my]0-i word . "[0-i]

" No , [Baas]121-baas , but sometimes other things change besides words . Will [the Baas]121-baas have that buck 's leg for supper , or the stuff out of a tin with a dint in it , which [we]3344-we bought at [a store]3346-a store two years ago ? The flies have got at the buck 's leg , but [I]87-hans cut out the bits with the maggots on it and ate them [myself]87-hans . "[87-hans]

[Hans]87-hans was right , things do change , especially the weather . That night , unexpectedly , for when [I]0-i turned in the sky seemed quite serene , there came a terrible rain long before it was due , which lasted off and on for three whole days and continued intermittently for an indefinite period . Needless to say [the river]3345-the river , which it would have been so easy to cross on this particular evening , by the morning was a raging torrent , and so remained for several weeks .

In despair at length [I]0-i trekked south to where [a ford was reported , which , when reached]439-a ford was reported , which , when reached , proved impracticable .

[I]0-i tried another , a dozen miles further on , which was very hard to come to over [boggy land]440-boggy land . It looked all right and [we]441-we were getting across finely , when suddenly one of the wheels sank in an unsuspected hole and there [we]441-we stuck . Indeed , [I]0-i believe the waggon , or bits of it , would have remained in [the neighbourhood of that ford]442-the neighbourhood of that ford to this day , had [I]0-i not managed to borrow some extra oxen belonging to [a Christian Kaffir]443-a christian kaffir , and with [their]443-a christian kaffir help to drag it back to [the bank]444-the bank whence [we]441-we had started .

As it happened [I]0-i was only just in time , since a new storm which had burst further up [the river]3345-the river , brought it down in flood again , a very heavy flood .

In [this country]446-this country , [England]15-england , where [I]0-i write , there are [bridges]447-bridges everywhere and [no one]3323-no one seems to appreciate them . If [they]443-a christian kaffir think of [them]447-bridges at all it is to grumble about the cost of [their]447-bridges upkeep . [I]0-i wish [they]443-a christian kaffir could have experienced what a lack of [them]447-bridges means in [a wild country]449-a wild country during times of excessive rain , and the same remark applied to [roads]450-roads . [You]451-you should think more of [your]451-you blessings , [[my]0-i friends]452-my friends , as [the old woman]453-the old woman said to [[her]453-the old woman complaining daughter]454-her complaining daughter who had twins two years running , adding that [they]455-they might have been triplets .

To return - after this [I]0-i confessed [myself]0-i beaten and gave up until such time as it should please [Providence]127-providence to turn off the water - tap . Trekking out of sight of [that infernal river]456-that infernal river which annoyed [me]0-i with its constant gurgling , [I]0-i camped on [a comparatively dry spot that overlooked [a beautiful stretch of rolling veld]458-a beautiful stretch of rolling veld]457-a comparatively dry spot that overlooked a beautiful stretch of rolling veld . Towards sunset the clouds lifted and [I]0-i saw a mile or two away [a most extraordinary mountain on the lower slopes of which grew a dense forest]459-a most extraordinary mountain on the lower slopes of which grew a dense forest . [Its]459-a most extraordinary mountain on the lower slopes of which grew a dense forest upper part , which was of bare rock , looked exactly like the seated figure of [a grotesque person with the chin resting on the breast]460-a grotesque person with the chin resting on the breast . There was the head , there were the arms , there were the knees . Indeed , the whole mass of it reminded [me]0-i strongly of the effigy of [Zikali]104-zikali which was tied about [my]0-i neck , or rather of [Zikali]104-zikali [himself]104-zikali .

" What is that called ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [Hans]87-hans , pointing to [this strange hill , now blazing in the angry fire of the setting sun that had burst out between the storm clouds , which made it appear more ominous even than before]461-this strange hill , now blazing in the angry fire of the setting sun that had burst out between the storm clouds , which made it appear more ominous even than before .

" That is [the Witch Mountain]12-the witch mountain , [Baas]121-baas , where [the Chief [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas]3347-the chief umslopogaas and [a blood brother of [his]3347-the chief umslopogaas who carried a great club used to hunt with the wolves]3348-a blood brother of his who carried a great club used to hunt with the wolves . [It]12-the witch mountain is haunted and in [a cave at [the top of]3350-the top of [it]12-the witch mountain]3349-a cave at the top of it lie the bones of [Nada the Lily]112-nada , [the fair woman whose name is a song]3351-the fair woman whose name is a song , [she]112-nada who was [the love of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas]3352-the love of umslopogaas . "[0-i]

For the story of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [Nada]112-nada see the book called " [Nada the Lily]112-nada . "[108-editor] - [Editor]108-editor .

" Rubbish , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , though [I]0-i had heard something of all that story and remembered that [Zikali]104-zikali had mentioned this [Nada]112-nada , comparing [her]112-nada beauty to that of another whom once [I]0-i knew .

" Where then lives [the Chief Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas ? "[104-zikali]

" [They]3353-they say that [[his]125-umslopogaas town]3354-his town is yonder on [the plain]3355-the plain , [Baas]121-baas . [It]3354-his town is called [the Place of the Axe]3356-the place of the axe and is strongly fortified with [a river]365-a river round most of it , and [[his]125-umslopogaas people]3358-his people are [the People of [the Axe]125-umslopogaas]3274-the people of the axe . [They]3358-his people are [a fierce people]3360-a fierce people , and [all [the country]3362-the country round here]3361-all the country round here is uninhabited because [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas has cleaned out [the tribes who used to live in [it]3362-the country]3363-the tribes who used to live in it , first with [his]125-umslopogaas wolves and afterwards in war . [He]125-umslopogaas is so strong [a chief]3364-a chief and so terrible in battle that even [Chaka]106-chaka [himself]106-chaka was afraid of [him]125-umslopogaas , and [they]3358-his people say that [he]125-umslopogaas brought [Dingaan the King]111-dingaan to [his]125-umslopogaas end because of a quarrel about [this Nada]3365-this nada . [Cetywayo]129-cetywayo , [the present king]3366-the present king , too leaves [him]125-umslopogaas alone and to [him]125-umslopogaas [he]125-umslopogaas pays no tribute . "[104-zikali]

Whilst [I]0-i was about to ask [Hans]87-hans from whom [he]87-hans had collected all this information , suddenly [I]0-i heard sounds , and looking up , saw [three tall men clad in full herald]462-three tall men clad in full herald 's dress rushing towards [us]463-us at great speed .

" Here come some chips from the Axe , "[87-hans] said [Hans]87-hans , and promptly bolted into the waggon .

[I]0-i did not bolt because there was no time to do so without loss of dignity , but , although [I]0-i wished [I]0-i had [my]0-i rifle with [me]0-i , just sat still upon [my]0-i stool and with great deliberation lighted [my]0-i pipe , taking not the slightest notice of [the three savage - looking fellows]464-the three savage - looking fellows .

[These]464-the three savage - looking fellows , who [I]0-i noted carried axes instead of assegais , rushed straight at [me]0-i with the axes raised in such a fashion that anyone unacquainted with the habits of [Zulu warriors of the old school]465-zulu warriors of the old school , might have thought that [they]464-the three savage - looking fellows intended nothing short of murder .

As [I]0-i expected , however , within about six feet of [me]0-i [they]464-the three savage - looking fellows halted suddenly and stood there still as statues . For [my]0-i part [I]0-i went on lighting [my]0-i pipe as though [I]0-i did not see [them]464-the three savage - looking fellows and when at length [I]0-i was obliged to lift [my]0-i head , surveyed [them]464-the three savage - looking fellows with an air of mild interest .

Then [I]0-i took a little book out of [my]0-i pocket , it was [my]0-i favourite copy of the Ingoldsby Legends - and began to read .

The passage which caught [my]0-i eye , if " axe "[466-the soldier in the middle] be substituted for " knife "[466-the soldier in the middle] was not inappropriate . It was from " [The Nurse]3367-the nurse 's Story , "[466-the soldier in the middle] and runs ,

" But , oh ! what a thing ' tis to see and to know That the bare knife is raised in the hand of [the foe]3368-the foe , Without hope to repel or to ward off the blow ! "[466-the soldier in the middle]

This proceeding of [mine]0-i astonished [them]464-the three savage - looking fellows a good deal who felt that [they]464-the three savage - looking fellows had , so to speak , missed fire . At last [the soldier in the middle]466-the soldier in the middle said ,

" Are [you]0-i blind , [White Man]130-white man ? "[466-the soldier in the middle]

" No , [Black Fellow]131-black fellow , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " but [I]0-i am short - sighted . Would [you]131-black fellow be so good as to stand out of [my]0-i light ? "[0-i] a remark which puzzled [them]464-the three savage - looking fellows so much that [all three]467-all three drew back a few paces .

When [I]0-i had read a little further [I]0-i came to the following lines ,

" ' Tis plain , As [anatomists]3369-anatomists tell [us]3370-us , that never again , Shall life revisit the foully slain When once [they]464-the three savage - looking fellows 've been cut through the jugular vein . "[0-i]

In [my]0-i circumstances at that moment this statement seemed altogether too suggestive , so [I]0-i shut up the book and remarked ,

" If [you]131-black fellow are [wanderers who want food]3371-wanderers who want food , as [I]0-i judge by [your]131-black fellow being so thin , [I]0-i am sorry that [I]0-i have little meat , but [[my]0-i servants]3372-my servants will give [you]131-black fellow what [they]3372-my servants can . "[0-i]

" Ow ! "[468-the spokesman] said [the spokesman]468-the spokesman , " [he]468-the spokesman calls [us]3370-us [wanderers]3373-wanderers ! Either [he]468-the spokesman must be [a very great man]3374-a very great man or [he]468-the spokesman is mad . "[468-the spokesman]

" [You]468-the spokesman are right . [I]0-i am [a great man]3375-a great man , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , yawning , " and if [you]131-black fellow trouble [me]0-i too much [you]131-black fellow will see that [I]0-i can be mad also . Now what do [you]131-black fellow want ? "[0-i]

" [We]3370-us are messengers from [the great Chief [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas]3376-the great chief umslopogaas , [Captain of the People of the Axe]3377-captain of the people of the axe , and [we]3370-us want tribute , "[324-the man] answered [the man]324-the man in a somewhat changed tone .

" Do [you]0-i ? Then [you]0-i wo n't get it . [I]0-i thought that only [the King of [Zululand]4-zululand]3378-the king of zululand had a right to tribute , and [[your]0-i Captain]3379-your captain 's name is not [Cetywayo]129-cetywayo , is it ? "[0-i]

" [[Our]3370-us Captain]3380-our captain is [King]3381-king here , "[324-the man] said [the man]324-the man still more uncertainly .

" Is [he]3380-our captain indeed ? Then away with [you]0-i back to [him]3380-our captain and tell [this King of whom [I]324-the man have never heard]129-cetywayo , though [I]324-the man have a message for [a certain]3382-a certain [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , that [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [Watcher - by - Night]3383-watcher - by - night , intends to visit [him]3380-our captain to - morrow , if [he]105-macumazahn will send [a guide]3384-a guide at the first light to show the best path for the waggon . "[324-the man]

" [Hearken]132-hearken , "[324-the man] said [the man]324-the man to [[his]324-the man companions]472-his companions , " this is [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn [himself]105-macumazahn and [no other]3385-no other . Well , [we]3386-we thought it , for who else would have dared - - "[324-the man]

Then [they]472-his companions saluted with [their]472-his companions axes , calling [me]0-i " [Chief]3387-chief "[472-his companions] and other fine names , and departed as [they]472-his companions had come , at a run , calling out that [my]0-i message should be delivered and that doubtless [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas would send [the guide]473-the guide .

So it came about that , quite contrary to [my]0-i intention , after all circumstances brought [me]0-i to [the Town of the Axe]474-the town of the axe . Even to the last moment [I]0-i had not meant to go [there]3196-there , but when the tribute was demanded [I]0-i saw that it was best to do so , and having once passed [my]0-i word it could not be altered . Indeed , [I]0-i felt sure that in this event there would be trouble and that [my]0-i oxen would be stolen , or worse .

So [Fate]96-fate having issued [its]96-fate decree , of which [Hans]87-hans 's version was that [Zikali]104-zikali , or [[his]104-zikali Great Medicine]476-his great medicine , had so arranged things , [I]0-i shrugged [my]0-i shoulders and waited .

CHAPTER III

UMSLOPOGAAS OF THE AXE

Next morning at the dawn [guides]477-guides arrived from [the Town of the Axe]474-the town of the axe , bringing with [them]477-guides a yoke of spare oxen , which showed that [its Chief]479-its chief was really anxious to see [me]0-i . So , in due course [we]480-we inspanned and started , the guides leading [us]480-we by [a rough but practicable road]481-a rough but practicable road down [the steep hillside]482-the steep hillside to [the saucer - like plain beneath]483-the saucer - like plain beneath , where [I]0-i saw many cattle grazing . Travelling some miles across [this plain]484-this plain , [we]480-we came at last to [a river of no]485-a river of no great breadth that encircled [a considerable Kaffir town]486-a considerable kaffir town on three sides , the fourth being protected by a little line of koppies which were joined together with walls . Also [the place]328-the place was strongly fortified with fences and in every other way known to [the native mind]488-the native mind .

With the help of [the spare oxen]489-the spare oxen [we]480-we crossed [the river]3345-the river safely at the ford , although [it]491-it was very full , and on the further side were received by a guard of [men]3228-men , [tall , soldierlike fellows]493-tall , soldierlike fellows , all of [them]493-tall , soldierlike fellows armed with axes as [the messengers]494-the messengers had been . [They]493-tall , soldierlike fellows led [us]480-we up to the cattle enclosure in [the centre of [the town]496-the town]495-the centre of the town , which although [it]497-it could be used to protect beasts in case of emergency , also served the practical purpose of [a public square]498-a public square .

Here some ceremony was in progress , for [soldiers]499-soldiers stood round [the kraal]500-the kraal while [heralds]501-heralds pranced and shouted . At the head of [the place in front of [the chief]503-the chief 's big hut]502-the place in front of the chief 's big hut was [a little group of people]504-a little group of people , among whom [a big , gaunt man]505-a big , gaunt man sat upon a stool clad in [a warrior]506-a warrior 's dress with a great and very long axe hafted with wire - lashed rhinoceros horn , laid across [his]505-a big , gaunt man knees .

[[Our]480-we guides]507-our guides led [me]0-i , with [Hans]87-hans sneaking after [me]0-i like a dejected and low - bred dog for the waggon had stopped outside the gate , across [the kraal]500-the kraal to where [the heralds]509-the heralds shouted and [the big man]510-the big man sat yawning . At once [I]0-i noted that [he]510-the big man was [a very remarkable person , broad and tall and spare of frame]511-a very remarkable person , broad and tall and spare of frame , with long , tough - looking arms and a fierce face which reminded [me]0-i of that of [the late King Dingaan]512-the late king dingaan . Also [he]510-the big man had a great hole in [his]510-the big man head above the temple where the skull had been driven in by some blow , and keen , royal - looking eyes .

[He]510-the big man looked up and seeing [me]0-i , cried out ,

" What ! Has [a white man]3255-a white man come to fight [me]510-the big man for [the chieftainship of [the People of the Axe]3274-the people of the axe]3389-the chieftainship of the people of the axe ? Well , [he]3255-a white man is [a small one]3391-a small one . "[510-the big man]

" No , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered quietly , " but [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [Watcher - by - Night]3383-watcher - by - night , has come to visit [you]510-the big man in answer to [your]510-the big man request , [O Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas ; [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn whose name was known in [this land]299-this land before [yours]510-the big man was told of , [O Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas . "[0-i]

[The Chief]503-the chief heard and rising from [his]503-the chief seat , lifted the big axe in salute .

" [I]503-the chief greet [you]510-the big man , [O Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , "[503-the chief] [he]503-the chief said , " who although [you]510-the big man are small in stature , are very great indeed in fame . Have [I]503-the chief not heard how [you]510-the big man conquered [Bangu]133-bangu , although [Saduko]134-saduko slew [him]133-bangu , and of how [you]510-the big man gave up the six hundred head of cattle to [Tshoza]135-tshoza and [the men of the Amangwane who fought with [you]510-the big man]3394-the men of the amangwane who fought with you , the cattle that were [your]510-the big man own ? Have [I]503-the chief not heard how [you]510-the big man led [the Tulwana]136-the tulwana against [the Usutu]137-the usutu and [stamped flat three of [[Cetywayo]129-cetywayo 's regiments]3396-cetywayo 's regiments]3395-stamped flat three of cetywayo 's regiments in the days of [Panda]138-panda , although , alas ! because of an oath of [mine]503-the chief [I]503-the chief lifted no steel in that battle , [[I]503-the chief who will have nothing to do with those that spring from the blood of [Senzangacona]146-senzangacona]3397-i who will have nothing to do with those that spring from the blood of senzangacona - perhaps because [I]503-the chief smell too strongly of it , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . Oh ! yes , [I]503-the chief have heard these and many other things concerning [you]510-the big man , though until now it has never been [my]503-the chief fortune to look upon [your]510-the big man face , [O Watcher - by - Night]3398-o watcher - by - night , and therefore [I]503-the chief greet [you]510-the big man well , Bold one , Cunning one , [Upright one]139-upright one , Friend of [us]3399-us [Black People]140-black people . "[503-the chief]

" Thank [you]514-the grim chief , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " but [you]514-the grim chief said something about fighting . If there is to be anything of the sort , let [us]3399-us get it over . If [you]510-the big man want to fight , [I]0-i am quite ready , "[0-i] and [I]0-i tapped the rifle which [I]0-i carried .

[The grim Chief]514-the grim chief broke into a laugh and said ,

" Listen . By an ancient law [any man]3256-any man on this day in each year may fight [me]514-the grim chief for [this Chieftainship]3401-this chieftainship , as [I]514-the grim chief fought and conquered [him]3256-any man who held it before [me]514-the grim chief , and take it from [me]514-the grim chief with [my]514-the grim chief life and the axe , though of late none seems to like the business . But that law was made before there were guns , or men like [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn who , it is said , can hit a lizard on a wall at fifty paces . Therefore [I]514-the grim chief tell [you]510-the big man that if [you]510-the big man wish to fight [me]514-the grim chief with a rifle , [O Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [I]514-the grim chief give in and [you]510-the big man may have the chieftainship , "[514-the grim chief] and [he]514-the grim chief laughed again in [his]514-the grim chief fierce fashion .

" [I]0-i think it is too hot for fighting either with guns or axes , and [Chieftainships]3402-chieftainships are honey that is full of stinging bees , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

Then [I]0-i took [my]0-i seat on a stool that had been brought for [me]0-i and placed by the side of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , after which the ceremony went on .

[The heralds]509-the heralds cried out the challenge to all and sundry to come and fight [the Holder of the Axe]516-the holder of the axe for [the chieftainship of the Axe]517-the chieftainship of the axe without the slightest result , since [nobody]518-nobody seemed to desire to do anything of the sort . Then , after a pause , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas rose , swinging [his]125-umslopogaas formidable weapon round [his]125-umslopogaas head and declared that by right of conquest [he]125-umslopogaas was [Chief of the Tribe]519-chief of the tribe for the ensuing year , an announcement that [everybody]520-everybody accepted without surprise .

Again [the heralds]509-the heralds summoned [all and sundry who had grievances , to come forward and to state them and receive redress]522-all and sundry who had grievances , to come forward and to state them and receive redress .

After a little pause there appeared [a very handsome woman with large eyes , particularly brilliant eyes that rolled as though they were in search of someone]523-a very handsome woman with large eyes , particularly brilliant eyes that rolled as though they were in search of someone . [She]523-a very handsome woman with large eyes , particularly brilliant eyes that rolled as though they were in search of someone was finely dressed and [I]0-i saw by the ornaments [she]523-a very handsome woman with large eyes , particularly brilliant eyes that rolled as though they were in search of someone wore that [she]523-a very handsome woman with large eyes , particularly brilliant eyes that rolled as though they were in search of someone held the rank of [[a chief]3364-a chief 's wife]525-a chief 's wife .

" [I]523-a very handsome woman with large eyes , particularly brilliant eyes that rolled as though they were in search of someone , [Monazi]114-monazi , have a complaint to make , "[523-a very handsome woman with large eyes , particularly brilliant eyes that rolled as though they were in search of someone] [she]523-a very handsome woman with large eyes , particularly brilliant eyes that rolled as though they were in search of someone said , " as it is the right of [the humblest]3403-the humblest to do on this day . In succession to Zinita whom [Dingaan]111-dingaan slew with [[her]111-dingaan children]3404-her children , [I]523-a very handsome woman with large eyes , particularly brilliant eyes that rolled as though they were in search of someone am [[your]114-monazi Inkosikaas]3405-your inkosikaas , [[your]114-monazi head - wife]3406-your head - wife , O [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas . "[523-a very handsome woman with large eyes , particularly brilliant eyes that rolled as though they were in search of someone]

" That [I]125-umslopogaas know well enough , "[125-umslopogaas] said [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , " what of it ? "[523-a very handsome woman with large eyes , particularly brilliant eyes that rolled as though they were in search of someone]

" This , that [you]114-monazi neglect [me]526-i for [other women]3407-other women , as [you]114-monazi neglected [Zinita]141-zinita for [Nada the Beautiful]112-nada , [Nada the witch]3408-nada the witch . [I]526-i am childless , as are all [[your]114-monazi wives]3409-your wives because of the curse that [this Nada]3365-this nada left behind [her]3365-this nada . [I]526-i demand that this curse should be lifted from [me]526-i . For [your]114-monazi sake [I]526-i abandoned [[Lousta]113-lousta the Chief , to whom [I]526-i was betrothed]3411-lousta the chief , to whom i was betrothed , and this is the end of it , that [I]526-i am neglected and childless . "[526-i]

" Am [I]125-umslopogaas the Heavens Above that [I]125-umslopogaas can cause [you]114-monazi to bear [children]3412-children , [woman]325-woman ? "[125-umslopogaas] asked [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas angrily . " Would that [you]114-monazi had clung to [Lousta]113-lousta , [[my]125-umslopogaas blood - brother]3414-my blood - brother and [[my]125-umslopogaas friend]270-my friend , whom [you]114-monazi lament , and left [me]125-umslopogaas alone . "[125-umslopogaas]

" That still may chance , if [I]114-monazi am not better treated , "[114-monazi] answered [Monazi]114-monazi with a flash of [her]526-i eyes . " Will [you]125-umslopogaas dismiss [[yonder]3416-yonder new wife of [yours]125-umslopogaas]3417-yonder new wife of yours and give [me]526-i back [my]526-i place , and will [you]125-umslopogaas lift the curse of [Nada]112-nada off [me]526-i , or will [you]125-umslopogaas not ? "[526-i]

" As to the first , "[125-umslopogaas] answered [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , " learn , [Monazi]114-monazi , that [I]125-umslopogaas will not dismiss [[my]125-umslopogaas new wife]3418-my new wife , who at least is gentler - tongued and truer - hearted than [you]114-monazi are . As to the second , [you]114-monazi ask that which it is not in [my]125-umslopogaas power to give , since [children]3412-children are the gift of Heaven , and barrenness is its bane . Moreover , [you]114-monazi have done ill to bring into this matter the name of one who is dead , who of [all women]3420-all women was the sweetest and most innocent . Lastly , [I]125-umslopogaas warn [you]114-monazi before [the people]3421-the people to cease from [your]114-monazi plottings or traffic with [Lousta]113-lousta , lest ill come of [them]3421-the people to [you]114-monazi , or [him]113-lousta , even though [he]113-lousta be [[my]125-umslopogaas blood - brother]3414-my blood - brother , or to both . "[125-umslopogaas]

" Plottings ! "[114-monazi] cried [Monazi]114-monazi in a shrill and furious voice . " Does [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas talk of plottings ? Well , [I]114-monazi have heard that [Chaka the Lion]106-chaka left [a son]3423-a son , and that [this son]3424-this son has set a trap for the feet of [him]3423-a son who sits on [Chaka]106-chaka 's throne . Perchance [that king]3425-that king has heard it also ; perchance [the People of the Axe]3274-the people of the axe will soon have [another Chief]3427-another chief . "[114-monazi]

" Is it thus ? "[125-umslopogaas] said [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas quietly . " And if so , will [he]113-lousta be named [Lousta]113-lousta ? "[125-umslopogaas]

Then [his]125-umslopogaas smouldering wrath broke out and in a kind of roaring voice [he]125-umslopogaas went on ,

" What have [I]125-umslopogaas done that [the wives of [my]125-umslopogaas bosom]3428-the wives of my bosom should be [[my]125-umslopogaas betrayers]3429-my betrayers , those who would give [me]125-umslopogaas to death ? [Zinita]141-zinita betrayed [me]125-umslopogaas to [Dingaan]111-dingaan and in reward was slain , and [[my]125-umslopogaas children]3430-my children with [her]141-zinita . Now would [you]3431-you , [Monazi]114-monazi , betray [me]125-umslopogaas to [Cetywayo]129-cetywayo - though in truth there is naught to betray ? Well , if so , bethink [you]3431-you and let [Lousta]113-lousta bethink [him]113-lousta of what chanced to [Zinita]141-zinita , and of what chances to [those who stand before the axe of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas]3432-those who stand before the axe of umslopogaas . What have [I]125-umslopogaas done , [I]125-umslopogaas say , that [women]3186-women should thus strive to work [me]125-umslopogaas ill ? "[125-umslopogaas]

" This , "[114-monazi] answered [Monazi]114-monazi with a mocking laugh , " that [you]3431-you have loved one of [them]3186-women too well . If [he]113-lousta would live in peace , [he]113-lousta who has [wives]3434-wives should favour all alike . Least of anything should [he]113-lousta moan continually over [one who is dead]3435-one who is dead , [a witch who has left a curse behind [her]3436-a witch who has left a curse behind her and thus insulted and do wrong to the living and thus insulted and do wrong to the living]3436-a witch who has left a curse behind her and thus insulted and do wrong to the living . Also [he]113-lousta would be wise to attend to the matters of [[his]113-lousta own tribe]3437-his own tribe and [household]3438-household and to cease from ambitions that may bring [him]113-lousta to [the assegai]3439-the assegai , and [them]3439-the assegai with [him]113-lousta . "[114-monazi]

" [I]125-umslopogaas have heard [your]527-your counsel , [Wife]3440-wife , so now begone ! "[125-umslopogaas] said [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , looking at [her]527-your very strangely , and it seemed to [me]0-i not without fear .

" Have [you]527-your wives , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn ? "[125-umslopogaas] [he]125-umslopogaas asked of [me]0-i in a low voice when [she]527-your was out of hearing .

" Only among the spirits , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" Well for [you]503-the chief then ; moreover , it is a bond between [us]3441-us , for [I]125-umslopogaas too have but [one true wife]3442-one true wife and [she]3442-one true wife also is among the spirits . But go rest a while , and later [we]3441-us will talk . "[125-umslopogaas]

So [I]0-i went , leaving [the Chief]503-the chief to [his]503-the chief business , thinking as [I]0-i walked away of a certain message with which [I]0-i was charged for [him]503-the chief and of how into that message came names that [I]0-i had just heard , namely that of [a man called [Lousta]113-lousta]3264-a man called lousta and of [a woman called [Monazi]114-monazi]3295-a woman called monazi . Also [I]0-i thought of the hints which in [her]3295-a woman called monazi jealous anger and disappointment at [[her]3295-a woman called monazi lack of [children]3412-children]531-her lack of children , [this woman]533-this woman had dropped about a plot against [him]503-the chief who sat on the throne of [Chaka]106-chaka , which of course must mean [King Cetywayo]129-cetywayo [himself]503-the chief .

[I]0-i came to [the guest - hut]534-the guest - hut , which proved to be [a very good place and clean]535-a very good place and clean ; also in it [I]0-i found plenty of food made ready for [me]0-i and for [[my]0-i servants]3372-my servants . After eating [I]0-i slept for a time as it is always [my]0-i fashion to do when [I]0-i have nothing else on hand , since who knows for how long [he]503-the chief may be kept awake at night ? Indeed , it was not until the sun had begun to sink that [a messenger]3217-a messenger came , saying that [the Chief]503-the chief desired to see [me]0-i if [I]0-i had rested . So [I]0-i went to [[his]503-the chief big hut]539-his big hut which stood alone with a strong fence set round [it]539-his big hut at a distance , so that [none]540-none could come within hearing of what was said , even at the door of [the hut]380-the hut . [I]0-i observed also that [a man armed with an axe]542-a man armed with an axe kept guard at the gateway in this fence round which [he]503-the chief walked from time to time .

[The Chief Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas was seated on a stool by the door of [[his]503-the chief hut]543-his hut with [his]503-the chief rhinoceros - horn - handled axe which was fastened to [his]503-the chief right wrist by a thong , leaning against [his]503-the chief thigh , and a wolfskin hanging from [his]503-the chief broad shoulders . Very grim and fierce [he]503-the chief looked thus , with the red light of the sunset playing on [him]503-the chief . [He]503-the chief greeted [me]0-i and pointed to another stool on which [I]0-i sat [myself]0-i down . Apparently [he]503-the chief had been watching [my]0-i eyes , for [he]503-the chief said ,

" [I]503-the chief see that like [other creatures which move at night]3443-other creatures which move at night , such as leopards and hyenas , [you]0-i take note of all , O Watcher - by - Night , even of [the soldier who guards [this place]3445-this place and of where the fence is set and of how [its]3445-this place gate is fashioned]3444-the soldier who guards this place and of where the fence is set and of how its gate is fashioned . "[503-the chief]

" Had [I]503-the chief not done so [I]503-the chief should have been dead long ago , [O Chief]3446-o chief . "[503-the chief]

" Yes , and because it is not [my]503-the chief nature to do so as [I]503-the chief should , perchance [I]503-the chief shall soon be dead . It is not enough to be fierce and foremost in the battle , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . [He]105-macumazahn who would sleep safe and of whom , when [he]105-macumazahn dies , [folk]3447-folk will say ' [He]105-macumazahn has eaten ' [i.e.]3448-i.e. , [he]105-macumazahn has lived out [his]105-macumazahn life , must do more than this . [He]105-macumazahn must guard [his]105-macumazahn tongue and even [his]105-macumazahn thoughts ! [he]105-macumazahn must listen to the stirring of rats in the thatch and look for snakes in the grass ; [he]105-macumazahn must trust few , and least of all [those who sleep upon [his]105-macumazahn bosom]3449-those who sleep upon his bosom . But [those who have the Lion 's blood in [them]3450-those who have the lion 's blood in them or who are prone to charge like a buffalo or who are prone to charge like a buffalo]3450-those who have the lion 's blood in them or who are prone to charge like a buffalo , often neglect these matters and therefore in the end [they]3450-those who have the lion 's blood in them or who are prone to charge like a buffalo fall into a pit . "[503-the chief]

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " especially those who have the lion 's blood in [them]3450-those who have the lion 's blood in them or who are prone to charge like a buffalo , whether that lion be [man]287-man or beast . "[0-i]

This [I]0-i said because of the rumours [I]0-i had heard that [this Slaughterer]544-this slaughterer was in truth [the son of [Chaka]106-chaka]545-the son of chaka . Therefore not knowing whether or no [he]544-this slaughterer were playing on the word " lion , "[544-this slaughterer] which was [Chaka]106-chaka 's title , [I]0-i wished to draw [him]544-this slaughterer , especially as [I]0-i saw in [his]544-this slaughterer face a great likeness to [[Chaka]106-chaka 's brother]3248-chaka 's brother [Dingaan]111-dingaan , whom , it was whispered , this same [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas had slain . As it happened [I]0-i failed , for after a pause [he]544-this slaughterer said ,

" Why do [you]0-i come to visit [me]544-this slaughterer , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , who have never done so before ? "[544-this slaughterer]

" [I]544-this slaughterer do not come to visit [you]0-i , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas . That was not [my]544-this slaughterer intention . [You]0-i brought [me]544-this slaughterer , or rather [the flooded rivers]3452-the flooded rivers and [you]0-i together brought [me]544-this slaughterer , for [I]544-this slaughterer was on [my]544-this slaughterer way to [Natal]14-natal and could not cross [the drifts]3453-the drifts . "[544-this slaughterer]

" Yet [I]544-this slaughterer think [you]0-i have a message for [me]544-this slaughterer , [White Man]130-white man , for not long ago [a certain wandering witch - doctor who came here]3454-a certain wandering witch - doctor who came here told [me]544-this slaughterer to expect [you]0-i and that [you]0-i had words to say to [me]544-this slaughterer . "[544-this slaughterer]

" Did [he]3454-a certain wandering witch - doctor who came here , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas ? Well , it is true that [I]544-this slaughterer have a message , though it is one that [I]544-this slaughterer did not mean to deliver . "[544-this slaughterer]

" Yet being here , perchance [you]0-i will deliver it , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , for [those who have messages and will not speak them]3455-those who have messages and will not speak them , sometimes come to trouble . "[544-this slaughterer]

" Yes , being here , [I]544-this slaughterer will deliver it , seeing that so it seems to be fated . Tell [me]544-this slaughterer , do [you]0-i chance to know [a certain Small One who is great , [a certain Old One whose brain is young]3457-a certain old one whose brain is young , [a doctor who is called [Opener - of - Roads]3128-opener - of - roads]3458-a doctor who is called opener - of - roads]3456-a certain small one who is great , a certain old one whose brain is young , a doctor who is called opener - of - roads ? "[544-this slaughterer]

" [I]544-this slaughterer have heard of [him]3458-a doctor who is called opener - of - roads , as have [[my]544-this slaughterer forefathers]3460-my forefathers for generations . "[544-this slaughterer]

" Indeed , and if it pleases [you]0-i to tell [me]544-this slaughterer , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , what might be the names of [those forefathers of [yours]0-i , who have heard of [this doctor for generations]3462-this doctor for generations]3461-those forefathers of yours , who have heard of this doctor for generations ? [They]3461-those forefathers of yours , who have heard of this doctor for generations must have been [short - lived men]3463-short - lived men and as such [I]544-this slaughterer should like to know of [them]3461-those forefathers of yours , who have heard of this doctor for generations . "[544-this slaughterer]

" That [you]0-i can not , "[125-umslopogaas] replied [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas shortly , ' since [they]547-they are hlonipa i.e. not to be spoken in [this land]299-this land . "[544-this slaughterer]

" Indeed , "[0-i] [I]0-i said again . " [I]0-i thought that rule applied only to the names of [kings]3464-kings , but of course [I]0-i am but [an ignorant white man who may well be mistaken on such matters of [your]0-i Zulu customs]3465-an ignorant white man who may well be mistaken on such matters of your zulu customs . "[0-i]

" Yes , [O Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [you]0-i may be mistaken or - [you]0-i may not . It matters nothing . But what of this message of [yours]0-i ? "[125-umslopogaas]

" It came at the end of a long story , [O Bulalio]142-o bulalio . But since [you]0-i seek to know , these were the words of it , so nearly as [I]0-i can remember them . "[0-i]

Then sentence by sentence [I]0-i repeated to [him]125-umslopogaas all that [Zikali]104-zikali had said to [me]0-i when [he]104-zikali called [me]0-i back after bidding [me]0-i farewell , which doubtless [he]104-zikali did because [he]104-zikali wished to cut [his]104-zikali message more deeply into the tablets of [my]0-i mind .

[Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas listened to every syllable with a curious intentness , and then asked [me]0-i to repeat it all again , which [I]0-i did .

" [Lousta]113-lousta ! [Monazi]114-monazi ! "[125-umslopogaas] [he]125-umslopogaas said slowly . " Well , [you]0-i heard those names to - day , did [you]0-i not , [White Man]130-white man ? And [you]0-i heard certain things from the lips of [this Monazi who was angry , that give colour to that talk of the Opener - of - Roads]3466-this monazi who was angry , that give colour to that talk of the opener - of - roads . It seems to [me]125-umslopogaas , "[125-umslopogaas] [he]125-umslopogaas added , glancing about [him]125-umslopogaas and speaking in a low voice , " that what [I]125-umslopogaas suspected is true and that without doubt [I]125-umslopogaas am betrayed . "[125-umslopogaas]

" [I]0-i do not understand , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied indifferently . " All this talk is dark to [me]0-i , as is the message of [the Opener - of - Roads]3230-the opener - of - roads , or rather its meaning . By whom and about what are [you]0-i betrayed ? "[0-i]

" Let that snake sleep . Do not kick [it]3468-it with [your]0-i foot . Suffice it [you]0-i to know that [my]125-umslopogaas head hangs upon this matter ; that [I]125-umslopogaas am a rat in a forked stick , and if the stick is pressed on by a heavy hand , then where is the rat ? "[125-umslopogaas]

" Where [all rats]3469-all rats go , [I]0-i suppose , that is , unless [they]3469-all rats are wise rats that bite the hand which holds the stick before it is pressed down . "[0-i]

" What is the rest of this story of [yours]0-i , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , which was told before [the Opener - of - Roads]3230-the opener - of - roads gave [you]105-macumazahn that message ? Does it please [you]105-macumazahn to repeat it to [me]125-umslopogaas that [I]125-umslopogaas may judge of it with [my]125-umslopogaas ears ? "[125-umslopogaas]

" Certainly , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " on one condition , that what the ears hear , the heart shall keep to itself alone . "[0-i]

[Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas stooped and laid [his]125-umslopogaas hand upon the broad blade of the weapon beside [him]125-umslopogaas , saying ,

" By the Axe [I]125-umslopogaas swear it . If [I]125-umslopogaas break the oath be the Axe [my]125-umslopogaas doom . "[125-umslopogaas]

Then [I]0-i told [him]125-umslopogaas the tale , as [I]0-i have set it down already , thinking to [myself]0-i that of it [he]125-umslopogaas would understand little , being but [a wild warrior - man]549-a wild warrior - man . As it chanced , however , [I]0-i was mistaken , for [he]125-umslopogaas seemed to understand a great deal , perchance because such primitive natures are in closer touch with high and secret things than [we]550-we imagine ; perchance for other reasons with which [I]0-i became acquainted later .

" It stands thus , "[125-umslopogaas] [he]125-umslopogaas said when [I]0-i had finished , " or so [I]125-umslopogaas think . [You]0-i , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , seek [certain women who are dead]3471-certain women who are dead to learn whether [they]3471-certain women who are dead still live , or are really dead , but so far have failed to find [them]3471-certain women who are dead . Still seeking , [you]0-i asked the counsel of [Zikali]104-zikali , [Opener - of - Roads]3128-opener - of - roads , [he]104-zikali who among other titles is also called ' Home of Spirits . ' [He]104-zikali answered that [he]104-zikali could not satisfy [your]0-i heart because this tree was too tall for [him]104-zikali to climb , but that far to the north there lives [a certain white witch who has powers greater than [his]104-zikali , being able to fly to the top of any tree , and to [this white witch]3474-this white witch [he]104-zikali bade [you]0-i go]3473-a certain white witch who has powers greater than his , being able to fly to the top of any tree , and to this white witch he bade you go . Have [I]125-umslopogaas the story right thus far ? "[125-umslopogaas]

[I]0-i answered that [he]551-he had .

" Good ! Then [Zikali]104-zikali went on to choose [you]0-i companions for [your]0-i journey , but two , leaving out [the guards]3475-the guards or [servants]3476-servants . [I]125-umslopogaas , [Umhlopekazi]143-umhlopekazi , called [Bulalio the Slaughterer]110-bulalio , called [the Woodpecker]144-the woodpecker also , was one of these , and that little yellow monkey of [a man whom [I]125-umslopogaas saw with [you]0-i to - day]3477-a man whom i saw with you to - day , called [Hansi]145-hansi , was the other . Then [you]0-i made a mock of [Zikali]104-zikali by determining not to visit [me]125-umslopogaas , [Umhlopekazi]143-umhlopekazi , and not to go north to find [the great white Queen of whom [he]104-zikali had told [you]0-i , but to return to [Natal]14-natal]3478-the great white queen of whom he had told you , but to return to natal . Is that so ? "[125-umslopogaas]

[I]0-i said it was .

" Then the rain fell and the winds blew and [the rivers]3479-the rivers rose in wrath so that [you]0-i could not return to [Natal]14-natal , and after all by chance , or by fate , or by the will of [Zikali]104-zikali , [the wizard of wizards]3480-the wizard of wizards , [you]0-i drifted here to the kraal of [me]125-umslopogaas , [Umhlopekazi]143-umhlopekazi , and told [me]125-umslopogaas this story . "[125-umslopogaas]

" Just so , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" Well , [White Man]3481-white man , how am [I]125-umslopogaas to know that all this is not but a trap for [my]125-umslopogaas feet which already seem to feel cords between the toes of both of [them]3482-them ? What token do [you]0-i bring , [O Watcher - by - Night]3398-o watcher - by - night ? How am [I]125-umslopogaas to know that [the Opener - of - Roads]3230-the opener - of - roads really sent [me]125-umslopogaas this message which has been delivered so strangely by one who wished to travel on another path ? [The wandering witch - doctor]3485-the wandering witch - doctor told [me]125-umslopogaas that [he]3485-the wandering witch - doctor who came would bear some sign . "[125-umslopogaas]

" [I]0-i ca n't say , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " at least in words . But , "[0-i] [I]0-i added after reflection , " as [you]0-i ask for a token , perhaps [I]0-i might be able to show [you]0-i something that would bring proof to [your]0-i heart , if there were any secret place - - "[0-i]

[Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas walked to the gateway of the fence and saw that [the sentry]552-the sentry was at [his]552-the sentry post . Then [he]552-the sentry walked round [the hut]380-the hut casting an eye upon [its]380-the hut roof , and muttered to [me]0-i as [he]552-the sentry returned .

" Once [I]552-the sentry was caught thus . There lived [a certain wife of [mine]0-i who set [her]3486-a certain wife of mine who set her ear to the smoke - hole and so brought about the death of many , and among them of herself and of our children ear to the smoke - hole and so brought about the death of [many]3487-many , and among [them]3487-many of [herself]3486-a certain wife of mine who set her ear to the smoke - hole and so brought about the death of many , and among them of herself and of our children and of [[our]554-our children]3488-our children]3486-a certain wife of mine who set her ear to the smoke - hole and so brought about the death of many , and among them of herself and of our children . Enter . All is safe . Yet if [you]3489-you talk , speak low . "[552-the sentry]

So [we]554-our went into [the hut]380-the hut taking the stools with [us]554-our , and seated [ourselves]554-our by the fire that burned there on to which [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas threw chips of resinous wood .

" Now , "[552-the sentry] [he]552-the sentry said .

[I]0-i opened [my]0-i shirt and by the clear light of the flame showed [him]552-the sentry the image of [Zikali]104-zikali which hung about [my]0-i neck . [He]552-the sentry stared at it , though touch it [he]552-the sentry would not . Then [he]552-the sentry stood up and lifting [his]552-the sentry great axe , [he]552-the sentry saluted the image with the word " Makosi ! "[552-the sentry] the salute that is given to [great wizards]556-great wizards because [they]556-great wizards are supposed to be the home of many spirits .

" It is the big Medicine , the Medicine itself , "[552-the sentry] [he]552-the sentry said , " that which has been known in [the land]3243-the land since the time of [Senzangacona]146-senzangacona , [the father of [the Zulu Royal House]3492-the zulu royal house]3491-the father of the zulu royal house , and as it is said , before [him]146-senzangacona . "[552-the sentry]

" How can that be ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , ' seeing that this image represents [Zikali]104-zikali , [Opener - of - Roads]20-opener - of - roads , as [an old man]557-an old man , and [Senzangacona]146-senzangacona died many years ago ? "[146-senzangacona]

" [I]552-the sentry do not know , "[552-the sentry] [he]552-the sentry answered , " but it is so . Listen . There was a certain [Mopo]105-macumazahn , or as some called [him]105-macumazahn , [Umbopo]147-umbopo , who was [[Chaka]106-chaka 's body - servant]3493-chaka 's body - servant and [[my]552-the sentry foster - father]3494-my foster - father , and [he]105-macumazahn told [me]552-the sentry that twice this Medicine , "[552-the sentry] and [he]552-the sentry pointed to the image , " was sent to [Chaka]106-chaka , and that each time [the Lion]3495-the lion obeyed the message that came with it . A third time it was sent , but [he]105-macumazahn did not obey the message and then - where was [Chaka]106-chaka ? "[552-the sentry]

Here [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas passed [his]552-the sentry hand across [his]552-the sentry mouth , a significant gesture amongst [the Zulus]354-the zulus .

" [Mopo]105-macumazahn , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " yes , [I]0-i have heard the story of [Mopo]105-macumazahn , also that [Chaka]106-chaka 's body became [[his]105-macumazahn servant]3496-his servant in the end , since [Mopo]105-macumazahn killed [him]106-chaka with the help of [the princes [Dingaan]111-dingaan and [Umhlangana]148-umhlangana]3497-the princes dingaan and umhlangana . Also [I]0-i have heard that [this Mopo]3498-this mopo still lives , though not in [Zululand]4-zululand . "[0-i]

" Does [he]3498-this mopo , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn ? "[125-umslopogaas] said [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , taking snuff from a spoon and looking at [me]0-i keenly over the spoon . " [You]0-i seem to know a great deal , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn ; too much as some might think . "[125-umslopogaas]

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " perhaps [I]0-i do know too much , or at any rate more than [I]0-i want to know . For instance , [O fosterling of [Mopo]105-macumazahn]3499-o fosterling of mopo and son of - was [the lady named [Baleka]149-baleka]3500-the lady named baleka ? - [I]0-i know a good deal about [you]0-i . "[0-i]

[Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas stared at [me]0-i and laying [his]125-umslopogaas hand upon the great axe , half rose . Then [he]125-umslopogaas sat down again .

" [I]0-i think that this , "[0-i] and [I]0-i touched the image of [Zikali]104-zikali upon [my]0-i breast , " would turn even the blade of the axe named [Groan - maker]3501-groan - maker , "[0-i] [I]0-i said and paused . As nothing happened , [I]0-i went on , " For instance , again [I]0-i think [I]0-i know - or have [I]0-i dreamed it ? - that [a certain chief , whose mother]3502-a certain chief , whose mother 's name [I]0-i believe was [Baleka]149-baleka - by the way , was [she]3502-a certain chief , whose mother not one of [[Chaka]106-chaka 's ' sisters]3503-chaka 's ' sisters ' ? - has been plotting against [that son of [Panda who sits upon the throne]3505-panda who sits upon the throne]3504-that son of panda who sits upon the throne , and that [his]3502-a certain chief , whose mother plots have been betrayed , so that [he]3502-a certain chief , whose mother is in some danger of [his]3502-a certain chief , whose mother life . "[0-i]

" [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , "[125-umslopogaas] said [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas hoarsely , " [I]125-umslopogaas tell [you]105-macumazahn that did [you]105-macumazahn not wear the Great Medicine on [your]105-macumazahn breast , [I]125-umslopogaas would kill [you]105-macumazahn where [you]105-macumazahn sit and bury [you]105-macumazahn beneath the floor of [the hut]380-the hut , as one who knows - too much . "[125-umslopogaas]

" It would be a mistake , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , one of the many that [you]105-macumazahn have made . But as [I]0-i do wear the Medicine , the question does not arise , does it ? "[0-i]

Again [he]125-umslopogaas made no answer and [I]0-i went on , " And now , what about this journey to [the north]3507-the north ? If indeed [I]0-i must make it , would [you]125-umslopogaas wish to accompany [me]0-i ? "[0-i]

[Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas rose from the stool and crawled out of [the hut]380-the hut , apparently to make some inspection . Presently [he]125-umslopogaas returned and remarked that the night was clear although there were heavy storm clouds on the horizon , by which [I]0-i understood [him]125-umslopogaas to convey in Zulu metaphor that it was safe for [us]560-we to talk , but that danger threatened from afar .

" [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , "[125-umslopogaas] [he]125-umslopogaas said , " [we]560-we speak under the blanket of [the Opener - of - Roads]3230-the opener - of - roads who sits upon [your]105-macumazahn heart , and whose sign [you]105-macumazahn bring to [me]125-umslopogaas , as [he]125-umslopogaas sent [me]125-umslopogaas word that [you]105-macumazahn would , do [we]560-we not ? "[125-umslopogaas]

" [I]0-i suppose so , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " At any rate [we]560-we speak as [man]287-man to [man]287-man , and hitherto the honour of [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn has not been doubted in [Zululand]4-zululand . So if [you]105-macumazahn have anything to say , [Chief Bulalio]150-bulalio , say it at once , for [I]125-umslopogaas am tired and should like to eat and rest . "[125-umslopogaas]

" Good , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . [I]125-umslopogaas have this to say . [I]125-umslopogaas who am [the son of one who was greater than [he]125-umslopogaas]3511-the son of one who was greater than he , have plotted to seize [the throne of [Zululand]4-zululand]3512-the throne of zululand from [him]125-umslopogaas who sits upon that throne . It is true , for [I]125-umslopogaas grew weary of [my]125-umslopogaas idleness as [a petty chief]3513-a petty chief . Moreover , [I]125-umslopogaas should have succeeded with the help of [Zikali]104-zikali , who hates [the House of [Senzangacona]146-senzangacona]3514-the house of senzangacona , though [me]125-umslopogaas , who am of its blood , [he]104-zikali does not hate , because ever [I]125-umslopogaas have striven against [that House]3515-that house . But it seems from [his]104-zikali message and those words spoken by [an angry woman]3516-an angry woman , that [I]125-umslopogaas have been betrayed , and that to - night or to - morrow night , or by the next moon , [the slayers]3517-the slayers will be upon [me]125-umslopogaas , smiting [me]125-umslopogaas before [I]125-umslopogaas can smite , at which [I]125-umslopogaas can not grumble . "[125-umslopogaas]

" By whom have [you]125-umslopogaas been betrayed , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas ? "[125-umslopogaas]

" By [that wife of [mine]125-umslopogaas]3518-that wife of mine , as [I]125-umslopogaas think , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . Also by [Lousta]113-lousta , [[my]125-umslopogaas blood - brother]3414-my blood - brother , over whom [she]3516-an angry woman has cast [her]3516-an angry woman net and made false to [me]125-umslopogaas , so that [he]113-lousta hopes to win [her]3516-an angry woman whom [he]113-lousta has always loved and with [her]3516-an angry woman [the Chieftainship of [the Axe]125-umslopogaas]517-the chieftainship of the axe . Now what shall [I]125-umslopogaas do ? - Tell [me]125-umslopogaas , [you]125-umslopogaas whose eyes can see in the dark . "[125-umslopogaas]

[I]0-i thought a moment and answered , " [I]0-i think that if [I]0-i were [you]125-umslopogaas , [I]0-i would leave [this Lousta]3521-this lousta to sit in [my]0-i place for a while as [Chief of [the People of the Axe]3274-the people of the axe]425-chief of the people of the axe , and take a journey north , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas . Then if trouble comes from [the Great House]3524-the great house where [a king]3525-a king sits , it will come to [Lousta]113-lousta who can show that [the People of the Axe]3274-the people of the axe are innocent and that [you]125-umslopogaas are far away . "[0-i]

" That is cunning , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . There speaks [the Great Medicine]104-zikali . If [I]125-umslopogaas go [north]3342-north , who can say that [I]125-umslopogaas have plotted , and if [I]125-umslopogaas leave [[my]125-umslopogaas betrayer]3528-my betrayer in [my]125-umslopogaas place , who can say that [I]125-umslopogaas was [a traitor]3529-a traitor , who have set [him]3528-my betrayer where [I]125-umslopogaas used to sit and left [the land]3243-the land upon a private matter ? And now tell [me]125-umslopogaas of this journey of [yours]561-him . "[125-umslopogaas]

So [I]0-i told [him]561-him everything , although until that moment [I]0-i had not made up [my]0-i mind to go upon this journey , [I]0-i who had come here to [[his]561-him kraal]562-his kraal by accident , or so it seemed , and by accident had delivered to [him]561-him a certain message .

" [You]561-him wish to consult [a white witch - doctoress]3531-a white witch - doctoress , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , who according to [Zikali]104-zikali lives far to [the north]3507-the north , as to the dead . Now [I]0-i too , though perchance [you]561-him will not think it of [a black man]3533-a black man , desire to learn of [the dead]3534-the dead ; yes , of [a certain wife of [my]0-i youth]3535-a certain wife of my youth who was [sister]3536-sister and [friend]3537-friend as well as [wife]3440-wife , whom too [I]0-i loved better than all [the world]277-the world . Also [I]0-i desire to learn of [a brother of [mine]0-i whose name [I]0-i never speak , who ruled the wolves with [me]0-i and who died at [my]0-i side on [yonder Witch - Mountain]12-the witch mountain]3540-a brother of mine whose name i never speak , who ruled the wolves with me and who died at my side on yonder witch - mountain , having made [him]3540-a brother of mine whose name i never speak , who ruled the wolves with me and who died at my side on yonder witch - mountain [a mat of [men to lie on in a great and glorious fight]3542-men to lie on in a great and glorious fight]3541-a mat of men to lie on in a great and glorious fight . For of [him]3540-a brother of mine whose name i never speak , who ruled the wolves with me and who died at my side on yonder witch - mountain as of [the woman]3332-the woman [I]0-i think all day and dream all night , and [I]0-i would know if [they]3544-they still live anywhere and [I]0-i may look to see [them]3544-they again when [I]0-i have died as [a warrior]506-a warrior should and as [I]0-i hope to do . Do [you]125-umslopogaas understand , [Watcher - by - Night]3383-watcher - by - night ? "[0-i]

[I]0-i answered that [I]0-i understood very well , as [his]563-his case seemed to be like [my]0-i own .

" It may happen , "[125-umslopogaas] went on [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , " that all this talk of the dead who are supposed to live after [they]3544-they are dead , is but as the sound of wind whispering in [the reeds]3547-the reeds at night , that comes from nowhere and goes nowhere and means nothing . But at least [ours]3548-we will be a great journey in which [we]3548-we shall find adventure and fighting , since it is well known in [the land]3243-the land that wherever [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn goes there is plenty of both . Also it seems well for reasons that have been spoken of between [us]3548-we , as [Zikali]104-zikali says , that [I]125-umslopogaas should leave [the country of [the Zulus]101-the zulus]3550-the country of the zulus for a while , who desire to die [a man]3551-a man 's death at the last and not to be trapped like a jackal in a pit . Lastly [I]125-umslopogaas think that [we]3548-we shall agree well together though [my]125-umslopogaas temper is rough at times , and that [neither of [us]3548-we]3552-neither of us will desert [the other]3553-the other in trouble , though of [that little yellow dog of yours]3554-that little yellow dog of yours [I]125-umslopogaas am not so sure . "[125-umslopogaas]

" [I]0-i answer for [him]3554-that little yellow dog of yours , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . " [Hans]87-hans is [a true man]3555-a true man , cunning also when once [he]87-hans is away from drink . "[0-i]

Then [we]564-we spoke of plans for [our]564-we journey , and of when and where [we]564-we should meet to make it , talking till it was late , after which [I]0-i went to sleep in [the guest - hut]534-the guest - hut .

CHAPTER IV

THE LION AND [THE AXE]125-umslopogaas

Next day early [I]0-i left [the town]496-the town of [the People of [the Axe]125-umslopogaas]3274-the people of the axe , having bid a formal farewell to [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , saying in a voice that [all]568-all could hear that as [the rivers]3479-the rivers were still flooded , [I]0-i proposed to trek to [the northern parts of [Zululand]4-zululand]570-the northern parts of zululand and trade there until the weather was better . [Our]564-we private arrangement , however , was that on the night of the next full moon , which happened about four weeks later , [we]564-we should meet at the eastern foot of [a certain great , flat - topped mountain known to both of [us]564-we]571-a certain great , flat - topped mountain known to both of us , which stands to [the north of [Zululand]4-zululand but well beyond [its]4-zululand borders]572-the north of zululand but well beyond its borders .

So northward [I]0-i trekked , slowly to spare [my]0-i oxen , trading as [I]0-i went . The details do not matter , but as it happened [I]0-i met with more luck upon that journey than had come [my]0-i way for many a long year . Although [I]0-i worked on credit since nearly all [my]0-i goods were sold , as owing to [my]0-i repute [I]0-i could always do in [Zululand]4-zululand , [I]0-i made some excellent bargains in cattle , and to top up with , bought a large lot of ivory so cheap that really [I]0-i think it must have been stolen .

All of this , cattle , and ivory together , [I]0-i sent to [Natal]14-natal in charge of [a white friend of [mine]0-i whom [I]0-i could trust , where the stuff was sold very well indeed , and the proceeds paid to [my]0-i account]573-a white friend of mine whom i could trust , where the stuff was sold very well indeed , and the proceeds paid to my account , the " trade "[574-the native vendors] equivalents being duly remitted to [the native vendors]574-the native vendors .

In fact , [my]0-i good fortune was such that if [I]0-i had been superstitious like [Hans]87-hans , [I]0-i should have been inclined to attribute it to the influence of [Zikali]104-zikali 's " Great Medicine . "[104-zikali] As it was [I]0-i knew it to be one of the chances of [a trader]575-a trader 's life and accepted it with a shrug as often as [I]0-i had been accustomed to do in the alternative of losses .

Only one untoward incident happened to [me]0-i . Of a sudden [a party of [[the King]3324-the king 's soldiers under the command of [a well - known Induna]579-a well - known induna or [Councillor]151-councillor]578-the king 's soldiers under the command of a well - known induna or councillor]576-a party of the king 's soldiers under the command of a well - known induna or councillor , arrived and insisted upon searching [my]0-i waggon , as [I]0-i thought at first in connection with that cheap lot of ivory which had already departed to [Natal]14-natal . However , never a word did [they]576-a party of the king 's soldiers under the command of a well - known induna or councillor say of ivory , nor indeed was a single thing belonging to [me]0-i taken by [them]576-a party of the king 's soldiers under the command of a well - known induna or councillor .

[I]0-i was very indignant and expressed [my]0-i feelings to [the Induna]152-the induna in no measured terms . [He]152-the induna on [his]152-the induna part was most apologetic , and explained that what [he]152-the induna did [he]152-the induna was obliged to do " by [the King]3324-the king 's orders . "[152-the induna] Also [he]152-the induna let it slip that [he]152-the induna was seeking for [a certain " evil - doer "[152-the induna] who , it was thought , might be with [me]0-i without [my]0-i knowing [his]152-the induna real character]580-a certain " evil - doer " who , it was thought , might be with me without my knowing his real character , and as [this " evil - doer , "[581-this " evil - doer , " whose name he would not mention] whose name [he]152-the induna would not mention]581-this " evil - doer , " whose name he would not mention , was [a very fierce man]582-a very fierce man , it had been necessary to bring [a strong guard]583-a strong guard with [him]152-the induna .

Now [I]0-i bethought [me]0-i of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , but merely looked blank and shrugged [my]0-i shoulders , saying that [I]0-i was not in the habit of consorting with [evil - doers]584-evil - doers .

Still unsatisfied , [the Induna]152-the induna questioned [me]0-i as to [the places where [I]0-i had been during this journey of [mine]0-i in [the Zulu country]586-the zulu country]585-the places where i had been during this journey of mine in the zulu country . [I]0-i told [him]152-the induna with the utmost frankness , mentioning among others - because [I]0-i was sure that already [he]152-the induna knew all [my]0-i movements well - [the town of [the People of the Axe]3274-the people of the axe]587-the town of the people of the axe .

Then [he]152-the induna asked [me]0-i if [I]0-i had seen [its Chief]479-its chief , a certain [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas or [Bulalio]150-bulalio . [I]0-i answered , Yes , that [I]0-i had met [him]479-its chief [there]3196-there for the first time and thought [him]479-its chief [a very remarkable man]591-a very remarkable man .

With this [the Induna]152-the induna agreed emphatically , saying that perhaps [I]0-i did not know how remarkable . Next [he]152-the induna asked [me]0-i where [he]479-its chief was now , to which [I]0-i replied that [I]0-i had not the faintest idea , but [I]0-i presumed in [[his]479-its chief kraal]562-his kraal where [I]0-i had left [him]479-its chief . [The Induna]152-the induna explained that [he]479-its chief was not in [[his]479-its chief kraal]562-his kraal ; that [he]479-its chief had gone away leaving [one Lousta]594-one lousta and [[his]479-its chief own head]595-his own head wife [Monazi]114-monazi to administer [the chieftainship]596-the chieftainship for a while , because , as [he]152-the induna stated , [he]479-its chief wished to make a journey .

[I]0-i yawned as if weary of the subject of [this chief]435-this chief , and indeed of the whole business . Then [the Induna]152-the induna said that [I]0-i must come to [the King]3324-the king and repeat to [him]3324-the king all the words that [I]0-i had spoken . [I]0-i replied that [I]0-i could not possibly do so as , having finished [my]0-i trading , [I]0-i had arranged to go north to shoot elephants . [He]152-the induna answered that elephants lived a long while and would not die while [I]0-i was visiting [the King]3324-the king .

Then followed an argument which grew heated and ended in [his]152-the induna declaring that to [the King]3324-the king [I]0-i must come , even if [he]3324-the king had to take [me]0-i [there]3196-there by force .

[I]0-i sat silent , wondering what to say or do and leant forward to pick a piece of wood out of the fire wherewith to light [my]0-i pipe . Now [my]0-i shirt was not buttoned and as it chanced this action caused the ivory image of Zikali that hung about [my]0-i neck to appear between its edges . [The Induna]152-the induna saw it and [his]152-the induna eyes grew big with fear .

" Hide that ! "[152-the induna] [he]152-the induna whispered , " hide that , lest it should bewitch [me]152-the induna . Indeed , already [I]152-the induna feel as though [I]152-the induna were being bewitched . It is [the Great Medicine itself]3557-the great medicine itself . "[152-the induna]

" That will certainly happen to [you]152-the induna , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , yawning again , " if [you]152-the induna insist upon [my]0-i taking a week 's trek to visit [the Black One]153-the black one , or interfere with [me]0-i in any way now or afterwards , "[0-i] and [I]0-i lifted [my]0-i hand towards the talisman , looking [him]152-the induna steadily in the face .

" Perhaps after all , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , it is not necessary for [you]0-i to visit [the King]3324-the king , "[152-the induna] [he]152-the induna said in an uncertain voice . " [I]152-the induna will go and make report to [him]3324-the king that [you]0-i know nothing of [this evil - doer]3559-this evil - doer . "[152-the induna]

And [he]152-the induna went in such a hurry that [he]152-the induna never waited to say good - bye . Next morning before the dawn [I]0-i went also and trekked steadily until [I]0-i was clear of [Zululand]4-zululand .

In due course and without accident , for the weather , which had been so wet , had now turned beautifully fine and dry , [we]602-we came to [the great , flat - topped hill that [I]0-i have mentioned]603-the great , flat - topped hill that i have mentioned , trekking thither over [high , sparsely - timbered veld that offered few difficulties to [the waggon]605-the waggon]604-high , sparsely - timbered veld that offered few difficulties to the waggon . [This peculiar hill , known to [such natives]607-such natives as lived in [those parts]608-those parts]606-this peculiar hill , known to such natives as lived in those parts by a long word that means " Hut - with - a - flat - roof , "[0-i] is surrounded by [forest]609-forest , for here trees grow wonderfully well , perhaps because of the water that flows from [its]606-this peculiar hill , known to such natives as lived in those parts slopes . Forcing [our]602-we way through [this forest]610-this forest , which was full of game , [I]0-i reached [its]606-this peculiar hill , known to such natives as lived in those parts eastern foot and there camped , five days before that night of full moon on which [I]0-i had arranged to meet [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas .

That [I]0-i should meet [him]125-umslopogaas [I]0-i did not in the least believe , firstly because [I]0-i thought it very probable that [he]125-umslopogaas would have changed [his]125-umslopogaas mind about coming , and secondly for the excellent reason that [I]0-i expected [he]125-umslopogaas had gone to call upon [the King]3324-the king against [his]125-umslopogaas will , as [I]0-i had been asked to do . It was evident to [me]0-i that [he]125-umslopogaas was up to [his]125-umslopogaas eyes in some serious plot against [Cetywayo]129-cetywayo , in which [he]125-umslopogaas was [the old dwarf]357-the old dwarf [[Zikali]104-zikali 's partner]613-zikali 's partner , or rather , [tool]614-tool ; also that [his]125-umslopogaas plot had been betrayed , with the result that [he]125-umslopogaas was " wanted "[104-zikali] and would have little chance of passing safely through [Zululand]4-zululand . So taking one thing with another [I]0-i imagined that [I]0-i had seen [his]125-umslopogaas grim face and [his]125-umslopogaas peculiar , ancient - looking axe for the last time .

To tell the truth [I]0-i was glad . Although at first the idea had appealed to [me]0-i a little , [I]0-i did not want to make this wild - goose , or wild - witch chase through [unknown lands]615-unknown lands to seek for [a totally fabulous person who dwelt far across [the Zambesi]11-the zambesi]616-a totally fabulous person who dwelt far across the zambesi . [I]0-i had , as it were , been forced into the thing , but if [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas did not appear , [my]0-i obligations would be at an end and [I]0-i should return to [Natal]14-natal at [my]0-i leisure . First , however , [I]0-i would do a little shooting since [I]0-i found that a large herd of elephants haunted [this forest]610-this forest . Indeed [I]0-i was tempted to attack [them]618-them at once , but did not do so since , as [Hans]87-hans pointed out , if [we]619-we were going north it would be difficult to carry the ivory , especially if [we]619-we had to leave the waggon , and [I]0-i was too old [a hunter]620-a hunter to desire to kill the great beasts for the fun of the thing .

So [I]0-i just sat down and rested , letting [the oxen]621-the oxen feed throughout the hours of light on the rich grasses which grew upon the bottom - most slopes of [the big mountain where [we]619-we were camped by [a stream]623-a stream]622-the big mountain where we were camped by a stream , not more than a hundred yards above [the timber line]624-the timber line .

At some time or other there had been [a native village at [this spot]626-this spot]625-a native village at this spot ; probably [the Zulus]354-the zulus had cleaned [it]625-a native village at this spot out in long past years , for [I]0-i found human bones black with age lying in the long grass . Indeed , the cattle - kraal still remained and in such good condition that by piling up a few stones here and there on the walls and closing the narrow entrances with thorn bushes , [we]619-we could still use it to enclose [our]619-we oxen at night . This [I]0-i did for fear lest there should be lions about , though [I]0-i had neither seen nor heard [them]628-them .

So the days went by pleasantly enough with lots to eat , since whenever [we]619-we wanted meat [I]0-i had only to go a few yards to shoot a fat buck at a spot whither [they]621-the oxen trekked to drink in the evening , till at last came the time of full moon . Of this [I]0-i was also glad , since , to tell the truth , [I]0-i had begun to be bored . Rest is good , but for [a man who has always led an active life too much of it]629-a man who has always led an active life too much of it is very bad , for then [he]629-a man who has always led an active life too much of it begins to think and thought in large doses is depressing .

Of the fire - eating Umslopogaas there was no sign , so [I]0-i made up [my]0-i mind that on the morrow [I]0-i would start after those elephants and when [I]0-i had shot - or failed to shoot - some of [them]621-the oxen , return to [Natal]14-natal . [I]0-i felt unable to remain idle any more ; it never was [my]0-i gift to do so , which is perhaps why [I]0-i employ [my]0-i ample leisure here in [England]15-england in jotting down such reminiscences as these .

Well , the full moon came up in silver glory and after [I]0-i had taken a good look at [her]630-her for luck , also at all the veld within sight , [I]0-i turned in . An hour or two later some noise from the direction of the cattle - kraal woke [me]0-i up . As it did not recur , [I]0-i thought that [I]0-i would go to sleep again . Then an uneasy thought came to [me]0-i that [I]0-i could not remember having looked to see whether the entrance was properly closed , as it was [my]0-i habit to do . It was the same sort of troublesome doubt which in [a civilised house]631-a civilised house makes [a man]3551-a man get out of bed and go along [the cold passages]633-the cold passages to [the sitting - room]634-the sitting - room to see whether [he]3551-a man has put out the lamp . It always proves that [he]3551-a man has put it out , but that does not prevent a repetition of the performance next time the perplexity arises .

[I]0-i reflected that perhaps the noise was caused by [the oxen]621-the oxen pushing [their]621-the oxen way through the carelessly - closed entrance , and at any rate that [I]0-i had better go to see . So [I]0-i slipped on [my]0-i boots and a coat and went without waking [Hans]87-hans or [the boys]636-the boys , only taking with [me]0-i a loaded , single - barrelled rifle which [I]0-i used for shooting small buck , but no spare cartridges .

Now in front of [the gateway of [the cattle - kraal]638-the cattle - kraal]637-the gateway of the cattle - kraal , shading it , grew a single big tree of [the wild fig order]639-the wild fig order . Passing under this tree [I]0-i looked and saw that the gateway was quite securely closed , as now [I]0-i remembered [I]0-i had noted at sunset . Then [I]0-i started to go back but had not stepped more than two or three paces when , in the bright moonlight , [I]0-i saw the head of [my]0-i smallest ox , a beast of [the Zulu breed]640-the zulu breed , suddenly appear over the top of the wall . About this there would have been nothing particularly astonishing , had it not been for the fact that this head belonged to a dead animal , as [I]0-i could tell from the closed eyes and the hanging tongue .

" What in the name of goodness - - "[0-i] [I]0-i began to [myself]0-i , when [my]0-i reflections were cut short by the appearance of another head , that of one of the biggest lions [I]0-i ever saw , which had [the ox by the throat]641-the ox by the throat , and with the enormous strength that is given to these creatures , by getting its back beneath the body , was deliberately hoisting [it]641-the ox by the throat over the wall , to drag it away to devour at its leisure .
