There was the brute within twelve feet of [me]0-i , and what is more , [it]641-the ox by the throat saw [me]0-i as [I]0-i saw it , and stopped , still holding the ox by the throat .

" What a chance for [Allan Quatermain]83-allan ! Of course [he]83-allan shot [it]641-the ox by the throat dead , "[641-the ox by the throat] one can fancy anyone saying who knows [me]0-i by repute , also that by the gift of [God]154-god [I]0-i am handy with a rifle . Well , indeed , it should have been , for even with the small - bore piece that [I]0-i carried , a bullet ought to have pierced through the soft parts of its throat to the brain and to have killed that lion as dead as [Julius Cæsar]155-julius cæsar . Theoretically the thing was easy enough ; indeed , although [I]0-i was startled for a moment , by the time that [I]0-i had the rifle to [my]0-i shoulder [I]0-i had little fear of the issue , unless there was a miss - fire , especially as the beast seemed so astonished that it remained quite still .

Then the unexpected happened as generally it does in life , particularly in hunting , which , in [my]0-i case , is a part of life . [I]0-i fired , but by misfortune the bullet struck the tip of the horn of that confounded ox , which tip either was or at that moment fell in front of the spot on the lion 's throat whereat half - unconsciously [I]0-i had aimed . Result : the ball was turned and , departing at an angle , just cut the skin of the lion 's neck deeply enough to hurt it very much and to make it madder than [all the hatters in [the world]277-the world]642-all the hatters in the world .

Dropping the ox , with a most terrific roar it came over the wall at [me]0-i - [I]0-i remember that there seemed to be yards of it - [I]0-i mean of the lion - in front of which appeared a cavernous mouth full of gleaming teeth .

[I]0-i skipped back with much agility , also a little to one side , because there was nothing else to do , reflecting in a kind of inconsequent way , that after all [Zikali]104-zikali 's Great Medicine was not worth a curse . The lion landed on [my]0-i side of the wall and reared [itself]644-itself upon its hind legs before getting to business , towering high above [me]0-i but slightly to [my]0-i left .

Then [I]0-i saw a strange thing . A shadow thrown by the moon flitted past [me]0-i - all [I]0-i noted of it was the distorted shape of a great , lifted axe , probably because the axe came first . The shadow fell and with it another shadow , that of a lion 's paw dropping to the ground . Next there was a most awful noise of roaring , and wheeling round [I]0-i saw such a fray as never [I]0-i shall see again . [A tall , grim , black man]645-a tall , grim , black man was fighting the great lion , that now lacked one paw , but still stood upon its hind legs , striking at [him]645-a tall , grim , black man with the other .

[The man , who was absolutely silent]646-the man , who was absolutely silent , dodged the blow and hit back with the axe , catching the beast upon the breast with such weight that it came to the ground in a lopsided fashion , since now [it]644-itself had only one fore - foot on which to light .

The axe flashed up again and before the lion could recover itself , or do anything else , fell with a crash upon its skull , sinking deep into the head . After this all was over , for the beast 's brain was cut in two .

" [I]125-umslopogaas am here at the appointed time , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , "[125-umslopogaas] said [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , for it was [he]125-umslopogaas , as with difficulty [he]125-umslopogaas dragged [his]125-umslopogaas axe from the lion 's severed skull , " to find [you]0-i watching by night as it is reported that [you]0-i always do . "[125-umslopogaas]

" No , "[0-i] [I]0-i retorted , for [his]125-umslopogaas tone irritated [me]0-i , " [you]0-i are late , [Bulalio]150-bulalio , the moon has been up some hours . "[125-umslopogaas]

" [I]125-umslopogaas said , O [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , that [I]125-umslopogaas would meet [you]0-i on the night of the full moon , not at the rising of the moon . "[125-umslopogaas]

" That is true , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied , mollified , " and at any rate [you]125-umslopogaas came at a good moment . "[0-i]

" Yes , "[125-umslopogaas] [he]125-umslopogaas answered , " though as it happens in this clear light the thing was easy to [anyone who can handle an axe]3560-anyone who can handle an axe . Had it been darker the end might have been different . But , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [you]0-i are not so clever as [I]125-umslopogaas thought , since otherwise [you]0-i would not have come out against a lion with a toy like that , "[125-umslopogaas] and [he]125-umslopogaas pointed to the little rifle in [my]0-i hand .

" [I]125-umslopogaas did not know that there was a lion , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas . "[125-umslopogaas]

" That is why [you]0-i are not so clever as [I]125-umslopogaas thought , since of one sort or another there is always a lion which [wise men]3561-wise men should be prepared to meet , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . "[125-umslopogaas]

" [You]0-i are right again , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied .

At that moment [Hans]87-hans arrived upon the scene , followed at a discreet distance by [the waggon boys]647-the waggon boys , and took in the situation at a glance .

" [The Great Medicine of [the Opener - of - Roads]3230-the opener - of - roads]3562-the great medicine of the opener - of - roads has worked well , "[125-umslopogaas] was all [he]125-umslopogaas said .

" The great medicine of [the Opener - of - Heads]3564-the opener - of - heads has worked better , "[125-umslopogaas] remarked [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas with a little laugh and pointing to [his]125-umslopogaas red axe . " Never before since [she]3565-she came into [my]125-umslopogaas keeping has [Inkosikaas]156-inkosikaas i.e. ' [Chieftainess]3566-chieftainess , ' for so was this famous weapon named sunk so low as to drink the blood of beasts . Still , the stroke was a good one so [she]3565-she need not be ashamed . But , [Yellow Man]157-yellow man , how comes it that [you]157-yellow man who , [I]125-umslopogaas have been told , are cunning , watch [[your]157-yellow man master]3567-your master so ill ? "[125-umslopogaas]

" [I]87-hans was asleep , "[87-hans] stuttered [Hans]87-hans indignantly .

" [Those who serve]3568-those who serve should never sleep , "[125-umslopogaas] replied [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas sternly . Then [he]125-umslopogaas turned and whistled , and behold ! out of the long grass that grew at a little distance , emerged [twelve great men]648-twelve great men , all of [them]648-twelve great men bearing axes and wearing cloaks of hyena skins , who saluted [me]0-i by raising [their]648-twelve great men axes .

" Set a watch and skin [me]125-umslopogaas this beast by dawn . It will make [us]648-twelve great men a mat , "[125-umslopogaas] said [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , whereon again [they]648-twelve great men saluted silently and melted away .

" Who are [these]648-twelve great men ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [A few picked warriors whom [I]125-umslopogaas brought with [me]125-umslopogaas]3569-a few picked warriors whom i brought with me , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . There were [one or two more]3570-one or two more , but [they]3570-one or two more got lost on the way . "[125-umslopogaas]

Then [we]649-we went to the waggon and spoke no more that night .

Next morning [I]0-i told [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas of the visit [I]0-i had received from [the Induna of [the King who wished [me]0-i to come to [the royal kraal]652-the royal kraal]651-the king who wished me to come to the royal kraal]650-the induna of the king who wished me to come to the royal kraal . [He]125-umslopogaas nodded and said ,

" As it chances [certain thieves]3571-certain thieves attacked [me]125-umslopogaas on [my]125-umslopogaas journey , which is why [one or two of [[my]125-umslopogaas people]3573-my people]3572-one or two of my people remain behind who will never travel again . [We]649-we made good play with [those thieves]3574-those thieves ; [not one of [them]3574-those thieves]3575-not one of them escaped , "[125-umslopogaas] [he]125-umslopogaas added grimly , " and [their]3574-those thieves bodies [we]649-we threw into [a river]365-a river where are many crocodiles . But [their]3574-those thieves spears [I]125-umslopogaas brought away and [I]125-umslopogaas think that they are such as [[the King]3324-the king 's guard use]3578-the king 's guard use . If so , [his]3324-the king search for [them]3574-those thieves will be long , since the fight took place where [no man]3232-no man lives and [we]649-we burned the shields and trappings . Oho ! [he]3324-the king will think that [the ghosts]3580-the ghosts have taken them . "[125-umslopogaas]

That morning [we]653-we trekked on fast , fearing lest [a regiment searching for these " thieves "]3581-a regiment searching for these " thieves "[125-umslopogaas] should strike and follow [our]653-we spoor . Luckily the ox that the lion had killed was one of some spare cattle which [I]0-i was driving with [me]0-i , so its loss did not inconvenience [us]653-we . As [we]653-we went [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas told [me]0-i that [he]125-umslopogaas had duly appointed [Lousta]113-lousta and [[his]125-umslopogaas wife]654-his wife [Monazi]114-monazi to rule [the tribe]655-the tribe during [his]125-umslopogaas absence , an office which [they]656-they accepted doubtfully , [Monazi]114-monazi acting as [Chieftainess]3566-chieftainess and [Lousta]113-lousta as [her]654-his wife head Induna or [Councillor]658-councillor .

[I]0-i asked [him]125-umslopogaas whether [he]125-umslopogaas thought this wise under all the circumstances , seeing that it had occurred to [me]0-i since [I]0-i made the suggestion , that [they]656-they might be unwilling to surrender power on [his]125-umslopogaas return , also that other domestic complications might ensue .

" It matters little , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , "[125-umslopogaas] [he]125-umslopogaas said with a shrug of [his]125-umslopogaas great shoulders , " for of this [I]125-umslopogaas am sure , that [I]125-umslopogaas have played [my]125-umslopogaas part with [the People of the Axe]3274-the people of the axe and to stop among [them]3274-the people of the axe would have meant [my]125-umslopogaas death , who am [a man betrayed]3583-a man betrayed . What do [I]125-umslopogaas care who love [none]540-none and now have [no children]3585-no children ? Still , it is true that [I]125-umslopogaas might have fled to [Natal]14-natal with the cattle and there have led a fat and easy life . But ease and plenty [I]125-umslopogaas do not desire who would live and fall as [a warrior]506-a warrior should .[125-umslopogaas]

" Never again , mayhap , shall [I]659-i see [the Ghost - Mountain where the wolves ravened and [the old Witch]3588-the old witch sits in stone waiting for [the world]277-the world to die]3587-the ghost - mountain where the wolves ravened and the old witch sits in stone waiting for the world to die , or sleep in [the town of [the People of [the Axe]125-umslopogaas]3274-the people of the axe]587-the town of the people of the axe . " Where the Axe goes , there go the strength and virtue of the Axe , [O Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . "[659-i]

" It is a strange weapon , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" Did [you]659-i then see [the Opener - of - Roads]3230-the opener - of - roads ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Aye , [I]659-i saw [him]104-zikali . [He]104-zikali it was who told [me]659-i which way to go to escape from [Zululand]4-zululand . " Did [he]104-zikali ? "[0-i] [I]0-i replied indignantly , for [Zikali]104-zikali 's power of seeing or learning about things that happened at a distance puzzled and annoyed [me]0-i .

[Only Hans]87-hans grinned and said ,

" [I]87-hans told [you]0-i so , [Baas]121-baas . "[87-hans]

On [we]660-we travelled from day to day , meeting with such difficulties and dangers as are common on [roadless veld in [Africa]10-africa]661-roadless veld in africa , but no more , for the grass was good and there was plenty of game , of which [we]660-we shot what [we]660-we wanted for meat . Indeed , here in [the back regions of what is known as [Portuguese South East Africa]23-portuguese south east africa]662-the back regions of what is known as portuguese south east africa , every sort of wild animal was so numerous that personally [I]0-i wished [we]660-we could turn [our]660-we journey into a shooting expedition .

But of [this Umslopogaas , whom hunting bored]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored , would not hear . In fact , [he]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored was much more anxious than [myself]0-i to carry out [our]660-we original purpose . When [I]0-i asked [him]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored why , [he]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored answered because of something [Zikali]104-zikali had told [him]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored . What this was [he]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored would not say , except that in [the country]3362-the country whither [we]660-we wandered [he]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored would fight a great fight and win much honour .

Now [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas was by nature [a fighting man]665-a fighting man , [one who took a positive joy in battle]666-one who took a positive joy in battle , and like [an old Norseman]667-an old norseman , seemed to think that thus only could [a man decorously die]668-a man decorously die . This amazed [me]0-i , [a peaceful person who loves quiet and a home]669-a peaceful person who loves quiet and a home . Still , [I]0-i gave way , partly to please [him]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored , partly because [I]0-i hoped that [we]660-we might discover something of interest , and still more because , having once undertaken an enterprise , [my]0-i pride prompted [me]0-i to see it through .

Now while [he]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored was preparing to draw [his]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored map in the ashes , or afterwards , [I]0-i forget which , [Zikali]104-zikali had told [me]0-i that when [we]660-we drew near to [the great river]670-the great river [we]660-we should come to [a place on [the edge of bush - veld]672-the edge of bush - veld that ran down to [the river]3345-the river]671-a place on the edge of bush - veld that ran down to the river , where [a white man]3255-a white man lived , adding , after casting [his]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored bones and reading from them , that [he]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored thought [this white man]675-this white man was [a " trek - Boer]3603-a " trek - boer . "[663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored] This , [I]0-i should explain , means [a Dutchman who has travelled away from wherever [he]676-a dutchman who has travelled away from wherever he lived and made a home for himself in the wilderness lived and made a home for [himself]676-a dutchman who has travelled away from wherever he lived and made a home for himself in the wilderness in [the wilderness]677-the wilderness]676-a dutchman who has travelled away from wherever he lived and made a home for himself in the wilderness , as [some wandering spirit and the desire to be free of authority]678-some wandering spirit and the desire to be free of authority often prompt [these people]679-these people to do . Also , after another inspection of [his]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored enchanted knuckle - bones , [he]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored had declared that something remarkable would happen to [this man]427-this man or [[his]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored family]681-his family , while [I]0-i was visiting [him]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored . Lastly in that map [he]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored drew in the ashes , the details of which were impressed so indelibly upon [my]0-i memory , [he]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored had shown [me]0-i where [I]0-i should find the dwelling of [this white man , of whom and of whose habitation]682-this white man , of whom and of whose habitation doubtless [he]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored knew through [the many spies who seemed to be at the service of [all witch - doctors]684-all witch - doctors , and more especially of [Zikali]104-zikali , the greatest among [them]684-all witch - doctors]683-the many spies who seemed to be at the service of all witch - doctors , and more especially of zikali , the greatest among them .

Travelling by the sun and the compress [I]0-i had trekked steadily in the exact direction which [he]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored indicated , to find that in this useful particular [he]663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored was well named [the " Opener - of - Roads]3604-the " opener - of - roads , "[663-this umslopogaas , whom hunting bored] since always before [me]0-i [I]0-i found a practicable path , although to the right or to the left there would have been none . Thus when [we]685-we came to [mountains]686-mountains , it was at a spot where [we]685-we discovered [a pass]687-a pass ; when [we]685-we came to [swamps]363-swamps [it]363-swamps was where [a ridge of high ground]689-a ridge of high ground ran between , and so forth . Also such tribes as [we]685-we met upon [our]685-we journey always proved of a friendly character , although perhaps the aspect of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [[his]125-umslopogaas fierce band]690-his fierce band whom , rather irreverently , [I]0-i named [[his]125-umslopogaas twelve Apostles]691-his twelve apostles , had a share in inducing this peaceful attitude .

So smooth was [our]685-we progress and so well marked by water at certain intervals , that at last [I]0-i came to the conclusion that [we]685-we must be following [some ancient road]692-some ancient road which at a forgotten period of history , had run from [south to north]693-south to north , or vice versâ . Or rather , to be honest , it was [the observant [Hans]87-hans who made this discovery from various indications which had escaped [my]0-i notice]694-the observant hans who made this discovery from various indications which had escaped my notice . [I]0-i need not stop to detail [them]695-them , but one of these was that at certain places [the water - holes on [a high , rather barren land]697-a high , rather barren land]696-the water - holes on a high , rather barren land had been dug out , and in one or more instances , lined with stones after the fashion of [an ancient well]698-an ancient well . Evidently [we]685-we were following an old trade route made , perhaps , in forgotten ages when [Africa]10-africa was more civilised than [it]699-it is now .

Passing over [certain high , misty lands]700-certain high , misty lands during the third week of [our]685-we trek , where frequently at this season of the year the sun never showed itself before ten o'clock and disappeared at three or four in the afternoon , and where twice [we]685-we were held up for two whole days by dense fog , [we]685-we came across [a queer nomadic people who seemed to live in movable grass huts and to keep great herds of goats and long - tailed sheep]701-a queer nomadic people who seemed to live in movable grass huts and to keep great herds of goats and long - tailed sheep .

[These folk]702-these folk ran away from [us]685-we at first , but when [they]702-these folk found that [we]685-we did [them]702-these folk no harm , became friendly and brought [us]685-we offerings of milk , also of a kind of slug or caterpillar which [they]702-these folk seemed to eat . [Hans]87-hans , who was [a great master of different native dialects]703-a great master of different native dialects , discovered a tongue , or a mixture of tongues , in which [he]87-hans could make [himself]87-hans understood to some of [them]704-them .

[They]705-they told [him]87-hans that in [their]705-they day [they]705-they had never seen [a white man]3255-a white man , although [[their]705-they fathers]707-their fathers ' fathers an expression by which [they]705-they meant [[their]705-they remote ancestors]708-their remote ancestors had known many of [them]705-they . [They]705-they added , however , that if [we]685-we went on steadily towards [the north]3507-the north for another seven days ' journey , [we]685-we should come to a place where [a white man]3255-a white man lived , one , [they]705-they had heard , who had a long beard and killed animals with guns , as [we]685-we did .

Encouraged by this intelligence [we]685-we pushed forward , now travelling down hill out of the mists into [a more genial country]711-a more genial country . Indeed , [the veld here]24-the veld here was beautiful , high , rolling plains like those of [the East African plateau , covered with a deep and fertile chocolate - coloured soil]712-the east african plateau , covered with a deep and fertile chocolate - coloured soil , as [we]685-we could see where the rains had washed out dongas . The climate , too , seemed to be cool and very healthful . Altogether it was a pity to see [such lands]713-such lands lying idle and tenanted only by countless herds of game , for there were not [any native inhabitants]714-any native inhabitants , or at least [we]685-we met [none]540-none .

On [we]685-we trekked , [[our]685-we road]716-our road still sloping slightly down hill , till at length [we]685-we saw far away [a vast sea of bush - veld]717-a vast sea of bush - veld which , as [I]0-i guessed correctly , must fringe [the great Zambesi River]25-the great zambesi river . Moreover [we]685-we , or rather [Hans , whose eyes were those of a hawk]718-hans , whose eyes were those of a hawk , saw something else , namely [buildings]719-buildings of a more or less civilised kind , which stood among trees by the side of [a stream several miles on this side of [the great belt of bush]721-the great belt of bush]720-a stream several miles on this side of the great belt of bush .

" Look , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] said [Hans]87-hans , " [those wanderers]3605-those wanderers did not lie ; there is [the house of [the white man]3607-the white man]3606-the house of the white man . [I]87-hans wonder if [he]3607-the white man drinks anything stronger than water , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans added with a sigh and a kind of reminiscent contraction of [his]87-hans yellow throat .

As it happened , [he]87-hans did .

CHAPTER V

INEZ

[We]685-we had sighted [the house]722-the house from far away shortly after sunrise and by midday [we]685-we were there . As [we]685-we approached [I]0-i saw that [it]722-the house stood almost immediately beneath two great baobab trees , babyan trees [we]685-we call them in [South Africa]26-south africa , perhaps because monkeys eat their fruit . [It]722-the house was [a thatched house with whitewashed walls and a stoep or veranda round [it]722-the house , apparently of the ordinary Dutch type]723-a thatched house with whitewashed walls and a stoep or veranda round it , apparently of the ordinary dutch type . Moreover , beyond [it]722-the house , at a little distance were [other houses or rather shanties with waggon sheds]724-other houses or rather shanties with waggon sheds , etc . , and beyond and mixed up with these a number of native huts . Further on were [considerable fields green with springing corn]725-considerable fields green with springing corn ; also [we]685-we saw herds of cattle grazing on the slopes . Evidently [[our]685-we white man]726-our white man was rich .

[Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas surveyed [the place]328-the place with [a soldier]728-a soldier 's eye and said to [me]0-i ,

" This must be [a peaceful country]3608-a peaceful country , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , where no attack is feared , since of defences [I]728-a soldier see none . "[728-a soldier]

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " why not , with [a wilderness behind [it]722-the house and [bush - veld]3610-bush - veld]3609-a wilderness behind it and bush - veld and [a great river in front]3611-a great river in front ? "[0-i]

" [Men]3228-men can cross [rivers]3613-rivers and travel through [bush - veld]3610-bush - veld , "[726-our white man] [he]726-our white man answered , and was silent .

Up to this time [we]685-we had seen [no one]3323-no one , although it might have been presumed that a waggon trekking towards [the house]722-the house was a sufficiently unusual sight to have attracted attention .

" Where can [they]3615-they be ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Asleep , [Baas]121-baas , [I]87-hans think , "[87-hans] said [Hans]87-hans , and as a matter of fact [he]87-hans was right . [The whole population of]731-the whole population of [the place]328-the place was indulging in a noonday siesta .

At last [we]685-we came so near to [the house]722-the house that [I]0-i halted the waggon and descended from [the driving - box]734-the driving - box in order to investigate . At this moment [someone]293-someone did appear , the sight of whom astonished [me]0-i not a little , namely , [a very striking - looking young woman]736-a very striking - looking young woman . [She]736-a very striking - looking young woman was tall , handsome , with large dark eyes , good features , a rather pale complexion , and [I]0-i think the saddest face that [I]0-i ever saw . Evidently [she]736-a very striking - looking young woman had heard the noise of the waggon and had come out to see what caused it , for [she]736-a very striking - looking young woman had nothing on [her]736-a very striking - looking young woman head , which was covered with thick hair of a raven blackness . Catching sight of [the great Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas with [his]125-umslopogaas gleaming axe and of [his]125-umslopogaas savage - looking bodyguard , [she]736-a very striking - looking young woman uttered an exclamation and not unnaturally turned to fly .

" It 's all right , "[0-i] [I]0-i sang out , emerging from behind [the oxen]621-the oxen , and in English , though before the words had left [my]0-i lips [I]0-i reflected that there was not the slightest reason to suppose that [she]736-a very striking - looking young woman would understand them . Probably [she]736-a very striking - looking young woman was Dutch , or Portuguese , although by some instinct [I]0-i had addressed [her]736-a very striking - looking young woman in English .

To [my]0-i surprise [she]736-a very striking - looking young woman answered [me]0-i in the same tongue , spoken , it is true , with a peculiar accent which [I]0-i could not place , as it was neither Scotch nor Irish .

" Thank [you]0-i , "[736-a very striking - looking young woman] [she]736-a very striking - looking young woman said . " [I]736-a very striking - looking young woman , [sir]3616-sir , was frightened . [[Your]0-i friends]3617-your friends look - - "[736-a very striking - looking young woman] Here [she]736-a very striking - looking young woman stumbled for a word , then added , " terrocious . "[736-a very striking - looking young woman]

[I]0-i laughed at this composite adjective and answered ,

" Well , so [they]3617-your friends are in a way , though [they]3617-your friends will not harm [you]736-a very striking - looking young woman or [me]0-i . But , [young lady]3618-young lady , tell [me]0-i , can [we]3619-we outspan here ? Perhaps [[your]736-a very striking - looking young woman husband]3620-your husband - - "[0-i]

" [I]736-a very striking - looking young woman have [no husband]3621-no husband , [I]736-a very striking - looking young woman have only [a father]3622-a father , [sir]3616-sir , "[736-a very striking - looking young woman] and [she]736-a very striking - looking young woman sighed .

" Well , then , could [I]0-i speak to [[your]3616-sir father]3624-your father ? [My]0-i name is [Allan Quatermain]83-allan and [I]0-i am making a journey of exploration , to find out about [the country beyond]3625-the country beyond , [you]3616-sir know . "[0-i]

" Yes , [I]736-a very striking - looking young woman will go to wake [him]3624-your father . [He]3624-your father is asleep . [Everyone]3308-everyone sleeps [here]3339-here at midday - except [me]736-a very striking - looking young woman , "[736-a very striking - looking young woman] [she]736-a very striking - looking young woman said with another sigh .

" Why do [you]158-jocosely not follow [their]3628-their example ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked [jocosely]158-jocosely , for [this young woman]738-this young woman puzzled [me]0-i and [I]0-i wanted to find out about [her]738-this young woman .

" [Inez Robertson]159-inez , "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , " that 's a queer combination . [English father]3634-english father and [Portuguese mother]3635-portuguese mother , [I]0-i suppose . What happened [there]3196-there [I]0-i could not see because boughs were in the way , but presently [I]0-i heard blows and screams , and caught sight of [people]3197-people , all dark - skinned , flying from [the huts]752-the huts .

A little later [a fat , half - breed man]753-a fat , half - breed man - [I]0-i should say from [his]753-a fat , half - breed man curling hair that [[his]753-a fat , half - breed man mother]754-his mother was [a negress]755-a negress and [[his]753-a fat , half - breed man father]3312-his father [a Portuguese]757-a portuguese - appeared with [some other nondescript fellows]758-some other nondescript fellows and began to give directions in a competent fashion about [[our]759-our oxen]760-our oxen , also as to the killing of a calf . Also [he]753-a fat , half - breed man made uncomplimentary remarks about [Hans]87-hans , who of course understood every word [he]753-a fat , half - breed man said . Evidently [Thomaso]162-thomaso 's temper had been ruffled by this sudden and violent disturbance of [his]162-thomaso nap .

Just then [[our]759-our host]763-our host appeared puffing with [his]162-thomaso exertions and declaring that [he]162-thomaso had stirred up the swine with a vengeance , in proof of which [he]162-thomaso pointed to [the sjambok that was reddened with blood]764-the sjambok that was reddened with blood .

" [Captain Robertson]161-robertson , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [I]0-i wish to give [you]161-robertson a hint to be passed on to [Mr. Thomaso]162-thomaso , if that is [he]162-thomaso . " Oh ! that 's the way of these ' snuff - and - butters ' one of whose grandmothers once met [a white man]3255-a white man , "[765-the captain] replied [the Captain]765-the captain , laughing , " but [I]765-the captain 'll tell [him]162-thomaso , "[765-the captain] and [he]765-the captain did in Portuguese .

[[His]765-the captain retainer]766-his retainer listened in silence , looking at [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas rather sulkily . Then [we]767-we walked into [the house]722-the house . As [we]767-we went [the Captain]765-the captain said ,

" [Señor Thomaso]163-thomaso - [he]163-thomaso calls [himself]163-thomaso [Señor]163-thomaso - is [[my]765-the captain manager]3656-my manager here and [a clever man]3657-a clever man , honest too in [his]163-thomaso way and attached to [me]765-the captain , perhaps because [I]765-the captain saved [his]163-thomaso life once . "[765-the captain]

" [I]0-i hope so too , for [his]163-thomaso own sake , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied emphatically .

[The Captain]765-the captain led the way into [the sitting - room]634-the sitting - room ; there was but one in [the house]722-the house . [It]773-it proved [a queer kind of place with rude furniture seated with strips of hide after the Boer fashion]774-a queer kind of place with rude furniture seated with strips of hide after the boer fashion , and yet bearing a certain air of refinement which was doubtless due to [Inez]159-inez , who , with the assistance of [a stout native girl]775-a stout native girl , was already engaged in setting the table . Thus there was a shelf with books , [Shakespeare]91-shakespeare was one of these , [I]0-i noticed - over which hung an ivory crucifix , which suggested that [Inez]159-inez was [a Catholic]776-a catholic . On the walls , too , were some good portraits , and on the window - ledge a jar full of flowers . Also the forks and spoons were of silver , as were the mugs , and engraved with a tremendous coat - of - arms and a Portuguese motto .

Presently the food appeared , which was excellent and plentiful , and [the Captain]765-the captain , [[his]765-the captain daughter]778-his daughter and [I]0-i sat down and ate . [I]0-i noted that [he]765-the captain drank gin and water , an innocent - looking beverage but strong as [he]765-the captain took it . It was offered to [me]0-i , but like [Miss Inez]164-inez , [I]0-i preferred coffee .

During the meal and afterwards while [we]779-we smoked upon [the veranda]780-the veranda , [I]0-i told [them]781-them as much as [I]0-i thought desirable of [my]0-i plans . [I]0-i said that [I]0-i was engaged upon a journey of exploration of [the country beyond [the Zambesi]11-the zambesi]782-the country beyond the zambesi , and that having heard of [this settlement]783-this settlement , which , by the way , was called [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir , as [I]0-i gathered after [a place in far away [Scotland]28-scotland where [the Captain]765-the captain had been born and passed [his]765-the captain childhood]784-a place in far away scotland where the captain had been born and passed his childhood , [I]0-i had come here to inquire as to how to cross [the great river]670-the great river , and about other things .

[The Captain]765-the captain was interested , especially when [I]0-i informed [him]765-the captain that [I]0-i was that same " [Hunter Quatermain]165-hunter quatermain "[0-i] of whom [he]765-the captain had heard in past years , but [he]765-the captain told [me]0-i that it would be impossible to take [the waggon]605-the waggon down into [the low bush - veld]789-the low bush - veld which [we]790-we could see beneath [us]790-we , as there all the oxen would die of the bite of the tsetse fly . " That might be managed , [Mr. Quatermain]83-allan , "[765-the captain] [he]765-the captain answered . " But , [man]287-man , will [you]287-man ever return ? " If [I]0-i might ask , what brought [you]765-the captain [here]3339-here , [Captain]3670-captain ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said , for the point was one on which [I]0-i felt curious .

" That which brings [most men]3671-most men to [wild places]3672-wild places , [Mr. Quatermain]83-allan - trouble . " There [I]765-the captain married [a Portuguese lady]3679-a portuguese lady , [a real lady of high blood]3680-a real lady of high blood , [one of the old sort]3681-one of the old sort . So [I]765-the captain sold up and swore that [I]765-the captain would have no more to do with what [they]3686-they are pleased to call civilisation on [the East Coast]29-the east coast .[765-the captain]

" During [my]765-the captain trading [I]765-the captain had heard that there was fine country up this way , and [here]3339-here [I]765-the captain came and settled years ago , bringing [[my]765-the captain girl]3682-my girl and [Thomaso]163-thomaso , who was [one of [[my]765-the captain managers]3690-my managers]3689-one of my managers , also [a few other people with [me]765-the captain]3691-a few other people with me . Yes , [I]765-the captain am [a rich man]3694-a rich man now and could go to live on [my]765-the captain means in [Scotland]28-scotland , or anywhere . "[765-the captain]

" Why do n't [you]765-the captain ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Oh ! for many reasons . [I]791-i have lost touch with all that and become half wild and [I]791-i like this life and the sunshine and being [[my]791-i own master]3695-my own master . Also , if [I]791-i did , things might be raked up against [me]791-i , about [that man]3696-that man 's death . [A man]3551-a man may be fond of [[his]3551-a man children]3698-his children , [Mr. Quatermain]83-allan , even if [their]3698-his children skins ai n't so white as they ought to be . Lastly [I]791-i have habits - [you]0-i see , [I]791-i am speaking out to [you]0-i as [man]287-man to [man]287-man - which might get [me]791-i into trouble again if [I]791-i went back to [the world]277-the world , "[791-i] and [he]791-i nodded [his]791-i fine , capable - looking head in the direction of the bottle on the table .

" [I]0-i see , "[0-i] [I]0-i said hastily , for this kind of confession bursting out of [the man]324-the man 's lonely heart when what [he]791-i had drunk took a hold of [him]791-i , was painful to hear . " But how about [[your]791-i daughter]3702-your daughter , [Miss Inez]164-inez ? "[0-i]

" Ah ! "[791-i] [he]791-i said , with a quiver in [his]791-i voice , " there [you]0-i touch it . [She]3702-your daughter ought to go away . There is no one for [her]3702-your daughter to marry here , where [we]3703-we have n't seen [a white man]3255-a white man for years , and [she]3702-your daughter 's [a lady]401-a lady right enough , like [[her]3702-your daughter mother]3706-her mother . Still - perhaps [you]0-i might help [me]794-i about [her]3702-your daughter , [Mr. Quatermain]83-allan , that is if [you]0-i live to come back from [your]0-i journey , "[794-i] [he]794-i added doubtfully .

[I]0-i felt inclined to ask how [I]0-i could possibly help in such a matter , but thought it wisest to say nothing . This , however , [he]794-i did not notice , for [he]794-i went on ,

" Now [I]794-i think [I]794-i will have a nap , as [I]794-i do [my]794-i work in the early morning , and sometimes late at night when [my]794-i brain seems to clear up again , for [you]0-i see [I]794-i was [a sailor]3710-a sailor for many years and accustomed to keeping watches . [You]0-i 'll look after [yourself]0-i , wo n't [you]0-i , and treat [the place]328-the place as [your]0-i own ? "[794-i] Then [he]794-i vanished into [the house]722-the house to lie down .

When [I]0-i had finished [my]0-i pipe [I]0-i went for a walk . First [I]0-i visited the waggon where [I]0-i found [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [[his]125-umslopogaas company]796-his company engaged in cooking the beast that had been given [them]797-them , Zulu fashion ; [Hans]87-hans with [his]87-hans usual cunning had already secured a meal , probably from [the servants]798-the servants , or from [Inez]164-inez [herself]164-inez ; at least [he]87-hans left [them]797-them and followed [me]0-i . First [we]799-we went down to [the huts]752-the huts , where [we]799-we saw [a number of [good - looking young women of mixed blood]802-good - looking young women of mixed blood , all decently dressed and engaged about [their]801-a number of good - looking young women of mixed blood , all decently dressed and engaged about their household duties household duties]801-a number of good - looking young women of mixed blood , all decently dressed and engaged about their household duties . " [Those children]3712-those children are very like [the Baas with the red beard]3713-the baas with the red beard , "[87-hans] remarked [Hans]87-hans reflectively .

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , and shivered , for now [I]0-i understood the awfulness of [this poor man]806-this poor man 's case . [He]806-this poor man was [the father of a number of half - breeds who tied [him]806-this poor man to this spot as anchors tie [a ship]808-a ship]807-the father of a number of half - breeds who tied him to this spot as anchors tie a ship . [I]0-i went on rather hastily past [some sheds]809-some sheds to [a long , low building which proved to be [a store]3346-a store]810-a long , low building which proved to be a store . Here [the quarter - blood]812-the quarter - blood called [Thomaso]163-thomaso , and [some assistants]813-some assistants were engaged in trading with [[natives]814-natives from [the Zambesi swamps]816-the zambesi swamps]815-natives from the zambesi swamps , [men of a kind]817-men of a kind that [I]0-i had never seen , but in a way more civilised than [many further south]818-many further south . What [they]819-they were selling or buying , [I]0-i did not stop to see , but [I]0-i noticed that [the store]820-the store was full of goods of one sort or another , including a great deal of ivory , which , as [I]0-i supposed , had come down [the river]3345-the river from [inland]822-inland .

Then [we]823-we walked on to [the cultivated fields]824-the cultivated fields where [we]823-we saw corn growing very well , also tobacco and other crops . Beyond this were cattle kraals and in the distance [we]823-we perceived a great number of cattle and goats feeding on [the slopes]825-the slopes .

" [This red - bearded Baas]3714-this red - bearded baas must be very rich in all things , "[826-the observant hans] remarked [the observant Hans]826-the observant hans when [we]823-we had completed [our]823-we investigations .

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " rich and yet poor . "[0-i]

" How can [a man]3551-a man be both rich and yet poor , [Baas]121-baas ? "[87-hans] asked [Hans]87-hans .

Just at that moment some of [the half - breed children whom [I]0-i have mentioned]827-the half - breed children whom i have mentioned , ran past [us]823-we more naked than dressed and whooping like [little savages]828-little savages . [Hans]87-hans contemplated [them]829-them gravely , then said ,

" [I]87-hans think [I]87-hans understand now , [Baas]121-baas . [A man]3551-a man may be rich in things [he]3551-a man loves and yet does not want , which makes [him]3551-a man poor in other ways . "[87-hans]

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " as [you]87-hans are , [Hans]87-hans , when [you]87-hans take too much to drink . "[0-i]

Just then [we]823-we met the stately Miss Inez returning from [the store]820-the store , carrying some articles in a basket , soap , [I]0-i think , and tea in a packet , amongst them . [I]0-i told [Hans]87-hans to take the basket and bear it to [the house]722-the house for [her]832-i . [He]87-hans went off with it and , walking slowly , [we]823-we fell into conversation .

" [[Your]0-i father]3624-your father must do very well here , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , nodding at [the store]820-the store with [the crowd of [natives]814-natives round [it]820-the store]834-the crowd of natives round it .

" Yes , "[832-i] [she]832-i answered , " [he]3624-your father makes much money which [he]3624-your father puts in a bank at [the coast]3718-the coast , for living costs [us]823-we nothing and there is great profit in what [he]3624-your father buys and sells , also in the crops [he]3624-your father grows and in the cattle . But , "[832-i] [she]832-i added pathetically , " what is the use of money in a place like this ? "[832-i]

" [You]832-i can get things with it , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered vaguely .

" That is what [[my]832-i father]3272-my father says , but what does [he]3624-your father get ? Strong stuff to drink ; dresses for [those women down there]3720-those women down there , and sometimes pearls , jewels and other things for [me]832-i which [I]832-i do not want . [I]832-i have a box full of them set in ugly gold , or loose which [I]832-i can not use , and if [I]832-i put them on , who is there to see [them]3721-them ? [That clever half - breed]3722-that clever half - breed , [Thomaso]163-thomaso - for [he]3722-that clever half - breed is clever in [his]3722-that clever half - breed way , [faithful]3723-faithful too - or [the women down there]3724-the women down there - [no one else]3137-no one else . "[832-i]

" [You]832-i do not seem to be happy , [Miss Inez]164-inez . "[832-i]

" No . [I]832-i can not tell how unhappy [others]279-others are , who have met none , but sometimes [I]832-i think that [I]832-i must be [the most miserable woman in [the world]277-the world]3727-the most miserable woman in the world . "[832-i]

" Oh ! no , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied cheerfully , " plenty are worse off . "[0-i]

" Then , [Mr. Quatermain]83-allan , it must be because [they]3729-they can not feel . Did [you]832-i ever have [a father whom [you]832-i loved]3730-a father whom you loved ? "[832-i]

" Yes , [Miss Inez]164-inez . [He]3730-a father whom you loved is dead , but [he]3730-a father whom you loved was [a very good man]3731-a very good man , [a kind of saint]3732-a kind of saint . Ask [[my]0-i servant]3733-my servant , [the little Hottentot [Hans]87-hans]3734-the little hottentot hans ; [he]3733-my servant will tell [you]832-i about [him]3730-a father whom you loved . "[0-i]

" Ah ! [a very good man]3731-a very good man . Well , as [you]832-i may have guessed , [mine]0-i is not , though there is much good in [him]3730-a father whom you loved , for [he]3730-a father whom you loved has a kind heart , and a big brain . But the drink and [those women down there]3720-those women down there , [they]3737-they ruin [him]3730-a father whom you loved , "[836-she] and [she]836-she wrung [her]836-she hands .

" Why do n't [you]836-she go away ? "[0-i] [I]0-i blurted out .

" Because it is [my]837-i duty to stop . That is what [my]837-i religion teaches [me]837-i , although of it [I]837-i know little except through books , who have seen [no priest]3738-no priest for years except one who was [a missionary]3739-a missionary , [a Baptist]3740-a baptist , [I]837-i think , who told [me]837-i that [my]837-i faith was false and would lead [me]837-i to hell . Yes , not understanding how [I]837-i lived , [he]3730-a father whom you loved said that , who did not know that hell is here . No , [I]837-i can not go , who hopes always that still [God]154-god and [the Saints]167-the saints will show [me]837-i how to save [[my]837-i father]3272-my father , even though it be with [my]837-i blood . And now [I]837-i have said too much to [you]3742-you who are quite [a stranger]3743-a stranger . Yet , [I]837-i do not know why , [I]837-i feel that [you]3742-you will not betray [me]837-i , and what is more , that [you]3742-you will help [me]837-i if [you]3742-you can , since [you]3742-you are not one of [those who drink]3744-those who drink , or - - "[837-i] and [she]837-i waved [her]837-i hand towards [the huts]752-the huts .

" [I]0-i have [my]0-i faults , [Miss Inez]164-inez , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" Yes , no doubt , else [you]3742-you would be [a saint]3745-a saint , not [a man]3551-a man , and even [the saints]3747-the saints had [their]3747-the saints faults , or so [I]837-i seem to remember , and became [saints]3748-saints by repentance and conquering [them]3747-the saints . Still , [I]837-i am sure that [you]3742-you will help [me]837-i if [you]3742-you can . "[837-i]

Then with a sudden flash of [her]837-i dark eyes that said more than all [her]837-i words , [she]837-i turned and left [me]0-i .

Here 's a pretty kettle of fish , thought [I]0-i to [myself]0-i as [I]0-i strolled back to the waggon to see how things were going on there , and how to get the live fish out of the kettle before they boil or spoil is more than [I]0-i know . [I]0-i wonder why fate is always finding [me]0-i such jobs to do .

Even as [I]0-i thought thus a voice in [my]0-i heart seemed to echo [that poor girl]839-that poor girl 's words - because it is [your]840-your duty - and to add [others]279-others to [them]842-them - woe betide [him]843-him who neglects [his]843-him duty . [I]0-i was appointed to try to hook a few fish out of the vast kettle of human woe , and therefore [I]0-i must go on hooking . Meanwhile this particular problem seemed beyond [me]0-i . Perhaps [Fate]96-fate would help , [I]0-i reflected . As a matter of fact , in the end [Fate]96-fate did , if [Fate]96-fate is the right word to use in this connection .

CHAPTER VI

THE SEA - COW HUNT

Now it had been [my]0-i intention to push forward across [the river]3345-the river at once , but here luck , or [[our]845-our old friend]846-our old friend , [Fate]96-fate , was against [me]0-i . To begin with [several of [[Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas ' men]848-umslopogaas ' men]847-several of umslopogaas ' men fell sick with a kind of stomach trouble , arising no doubt from something [they]847-several of umslopogaas ' men had eaten . This , however , was not [their]847-several of umslopogaas ' men view , or that of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas [himself]125-umslopogaas . It happened that [one of [these men]850-these men]849-one of these men , [Goroko]168-goroko by name , who practised as [a witch - doctor]851-a witch - doctor in [his]168-goroko lighter moments , naturally suspected that a spell had been cast upon [them]850-these men , for [such people]852-such people see magic in everything .

Therefore [he]168-goroko organised a ' smelling - out " at which [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , who was as superstitious as [the rest]3749-the rest , assisted . So did [Hans]87-hans , although [he]87-hans called [himself]87-hans [a Christian]3750-a christian , partly out of curiosity , for [he]87-hans was as curious as [a magpie]3751-a magpie , and partly from fear lest some implication should be brought against [him]87-hans in [his]87-hans absence . [I]168-goroko saw the business going on from a little distance , and , unseen [myself]168-goroko , thought it well to keep an eye upon the proceedings in case anything untoward should occur . This [I]168-goroko did with [Miss Inez]164-inez , who had never witnessed anything of the sort , as [a companion]3752-a companion .[168-goroko]

The circle , a small one , was formed in the usual fashion ; [Goroko]168-goroko rigged up in the best [witch - doctor]853-witch - doctor 's costume that [he]168-goroko could improvise , duly came under the influence of [his]168-goroko " Spirit "[168-goroko] and skipped about , waving a wildebeeste 's tail , and so forth .

Finally to [my]0-i horror [he]168-goroko broke out of the ring , and running to [a group of spectators from [the village]792-the village]854-a group of spectators from the village , switched [Thomaso]163-thomaso , who was standing among [them]854-a group of spectators from the village with a lordly and contemptuous air , across the face with the gnu 's tail , shouting out that [he]163-thomaso was [the wizard who had poisoned the bowels of [the sick men]857-the sick men]856-the wizard who had poisoned the bowels of the sick men . Thereon [Thomaso]163-thomaso , who although [he]163-thomaso could be insolent , like most crossbreeds was not remarkable for courage , seeing the stir that this announcement created amongst [the fierce - faced Zulus and fearing developments]858-the fierce - faced zulus and fearing developments , promptly bolted , none attempting to follow [him]163-thomaso .

After this , just as [I]0-i thought that everything was over and that the time had come for [me]0-i to speak a few earnest words to [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , pointing out that matters must go no further as regards [Thomaso]163-thomaso , whom [I]0-i knew that [he]163-thomaso and [[his]163-thomaso people]3358-his people hated , [Goroko]168-goroko went back to [the circle]860-the circle and was seized with a new burst of inspiration .

Throwing down [his]168-goroko whisk , [he]168-goroko lifted [his]168-goroko arms above [his]168-goroko head and stared at the heavens . Then [he]168-goroko began to shout out something in a loud voice which [I]0-i was too far off to catch . Whatever it may have been , evidently it frightened [[his]168-goroko hearers]861-his hearers , as [I]0-i could see from the expressions on [their]861-his hearers faces . [Even Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas was alarmed , for [he]125-umslopogaas let [his]125-umslopogaas axe fall for a moment , rose as though to speak , then sat down again and covered [his]125-umslopogaas eyes with [his]125-umslopogaas hands .

In a minute it was over ; [Goroko]168-goroko seemed to become normal , took some snuff and as [I]0-i guessed , after the usual fashion of [these doctors]862-these doctors , began to ask what [he]168-goroko had been saying while the " Spirit "[0-i] possessed [him]168-goroko , which [he]168-goroko either had , or affected to have , forgotten . The circle , too , broke up and [its members]863-its members began to talk to [each other]3176-each other in a subdued way , while [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas remained seated on the ground , brooding , and [Hans]87-hans slipped away in [his]87-hans snake - like fashion , doubtless in search of [me]0-i .

" What was it all about , [Mr. Quatermain]83-allan ? "[164-inez] asked [Inez]164-inez .

" Oh ! a lot of nonsense , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [I]0-i fancy [that witch - doctor]3753-that witch - doctor declared that [[your]83-allan friend]3754-your friend [Thomaso]163-thomaso put something into [those men]3755-those men 's food to make [them]3755-those men sick . "[0-i]

" [I]125-umslopogaas daresay that [he]163-thomaso did ; it would be just like [him]163-thomaso , [Mr. Quatermain]83-allan , as [I]125-umslopogaas know that [he]163-thomaso hates [them]3755-those men , especially [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , of whom [I]125-umslopogaas am very fond . [He]163-thomaso brought [me]125-umslopogaas some beautiful flowers this morning which [he]163-thomaso had found somewhere , and made a long speech which [I]125-umslopogaas could not understand . "[125-umslopogaas]

The idea of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , [that man of blood and iron]865-that man of blood and iron , bringing flowers to [a young lady]866-a young lady , was so absurd that [I]0-i broke out laughing and even [the sad - faced Inez]867-the sad - faced inez smiled . Then [she]867-the sad - faced inez left [me]0-i to see about something and [I]0-i went to speak to [Hans]87-hans and asked [him]87-hans what had happened .

" Something rather queer , [I]87-hans think , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans answered vacuously , " though [I]87-hans did not quite understand the last part . [The doctor]3756-the doctor , [Goroko]168-goroko , smelt out [Thomaso]163-thomaso as [the man who had made [them]3758-they sick]3757-the man who had made them sick , and though [they]3758-they will not kill [him]163-thomaso because [we]3759-we are guests here , [those Zulus]3760-those zulus are very angry with [Thomaso]163-thomaso and [I]87-hans think will beat [him]163-thomaso if [they]3758-they get a chance . But that is only the small half of the stick , "[87-hans] and [he]87-hans paused .

" What is the big half , then ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked with irritation .

" [Baas]121-baas , [the Spirit in [Goroko]168-goroko]3761-the spirit in goroko - - "[87-hans]

" [The jackass]3762-the jackass in [Goroko]168-goroko , [you]87-hans mean , "[0-i] [I]0-i interrupted . " How can [you]87-hans , who are [a Christian]3750-a christian , talk such rubbish about spirits ? [I]0-i only wish that [[my]0-i father]3272-my father could hear [you]87-hans . "[0-i]

" Oh ! [Baas]121-baas , [[your]121-baas reverend father]3327-your reverend father , [the Predikant]3326-the predikant , is now wise enough to know all about [Spirits]169-spirits and that there are some who come into [black witch - doctors]3767-black witch - doctors though [they]3767-black witch - doctors turn up [their]3767-black witch - doctors noses at [white men]3143-white men and leave [them]3143-white men alone . However , whatever it is that makes [Goroko]168-goroko speak , got hold of [him]168-goroko so that [his]168-goroko lips said , though [he]168-goroko remembered nothing of it afterwards , that soon [this place]3445-this place would be red with blood - that there would be a great killing here , [Baas]121-baas . That is all . "[87-hans]

" Red with blood ! Whose blood ? What did [the fool]3770-the fool mean ? "[0-i]

" [I]87-hans do n't know , [Baas]121-baas , but what [you]121-baas call [the jackass in [Goroko]168-goroko]3771-the jackass in goroko , declared that those who are ' with the Great Medicine ' - meaning what [you]121-baas wear , [Baas]121-baas - will be quite safe . So [I]87-hans hope that it will not be [our]3772-we blood ; also that [you]121-baas will get out of [this place]3445-this place as soon as [you]121-baas can . "[87-hans]

Well , [I]0-i scolded [Hans]87-hans because [he]87-hans believed in what [this doctor]868-this doctor said , for [I]0-i could see that [he]87-hans did believe it , then went to question [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , whom [I]0-i found looking quite pleased , which annoyed [me]0-i still more .

" What is it that [Goroko]168-goroko has been saying and why do [you]121-baas smile , [Bulalio]150-bulalio ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Nothing much , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , except that [the man who looks like tallow that has gone bad , put something in [our]3772-we food which made [us]3772-we sick , for which [I]125-umslopogaas would kill [him]868-this doctor were [he]868-this doctor [not [Red - beard]121-baas 's servant]3775-not red - beard 's servant and that it would frighten the lady [[his]868-this doctor daughter]778-his daughter]3774-the man who looks like tallow that has gone bad , put something in our food which made us sick , for which i would kill him were he not red - beard 's servant and that it would frighten the lady his daughter . Also [he]868-this doctor said that soon there will be fighting , which is why [I]125-umslopogaas smiled , who grow weary of peace . [We]3772-we came out to fight , did [we]3772-we not ? "[125-umslopogaas]

" Certainly not , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " [We]3772-we came out to make a quiet journey in [strange lands]3777-strange lands , which is what [I]0-i mean to do . "[0-i]

" Ah ! well , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , in [strange lands]3777-strange lands one meets strange men with whom [one does not always agree]3779-one does not always agree , and then [Inkosikaas]156-inkosikaas begins to talk , "[869-him] and [he]869-him whirled the great axe round [his]869-him head , making the air whistle as it was forced through the gouge at its back .

[I]0-i could get no more out of [him]869-him , so having extracted a promise from [him]869-him that nothing should happen to [Thomaso]163-thomaso who , [I]0-i pointed out , was probably quite unjustly accused , [I]0-i went away .

Still , the whole incident left a disagreeable impression on [my]0-i mind , and [I]0-i began to wish that [we]870-we were safe across [the Zambesi]11-the zambesi without more trouble . But [we]870-we could not start at once because [two of [the Zulus]354-the zulus]871-two of the zulus were still not well enough to travel and there were many preparations to be made about the loads , and so forth , since the waggon must be left behind . Also , and this was another complication - [Hans]87-hans had a sore upon [his]87-hans foot , resulting from the prick of a poisonous thorn , and it was desirable that this should be quite healed before [we]870-we marched .

So it came about that [I]0-i was really glad when [Captain Robertson]161-robertson suggested that [we]870-we should go down to [a certain swamp formed]873-a certain swamp formed , [I]0-i gathered , by [some small tributary of [the Zambesi]11-the zambesi]874-some small tributary of the zambesi to take part in a kind of hippopotamus battue . It seemed that at this season of the year these great animals always frequented [the place]328-the place in numbers , also that by barring [a neck of deep water]876-a neck of deep water through which [they]877-they gained it , [they]877-they , or [a proportion of [them]877-they]878-a proportion of them , could be cut off and killed .

This had been done once or twice in the past , though not of late , perhaps because [Captain Robertson]161-robertson had lacked the energy to organise such a hunt . Now [he]161-robertson wished to do so again , taking advantage of [my]0-i presence , both because of the value of the hides of the sea - cows which were cut up to be sent to [the coast]3718-the coast and sold as sjamboks or whips , and because of the sport of the thing . Also [I]0-i think [he]161-robertson desired to show [me]0-i that [he]161-robertson was not altogether sunk in sloth and drink .

[I]0-i fell in with the idea readily enough , since in all [my]0-i hunting life [I]0-i had never seen anything of the sort , especially as [I]0-i was told that the expedition would not take more than a week and [I]0-i reckoned that [the sick men]857-the sick men and [Hans]87-hans would not be fit to travel sooner . So great preparations were made . [The riverside natives , whose share of the spoil was to be the carcases of the slain sea - cows]881-the riverside natives , whose share of the spoil was to be the carcases of the slain sea - cows , were summoned by [hundreds]882-hundreds and sent off to [[their]881-the riverside natives , whose share of the spoil was to be the carcases of the slain sea - cows appointed stations]883-their appointed stations to beat [the swamps]884-the swamps at a signal given by the firing of a great pile of reeds . Also many other things were done upon which [I]0-i need not enter .

Then came the time for [us]885-us to depart to [the appointed spot]886-the appointed spot over twenty miles away , most of which distance it seemed [we]885-us could trek in [the waggon]605-the waggon . [Captain Robertson]161-robertson , who for the time had cut off [his]161-robertson gin , was as active about the affair as though [he]161-robertson were once more in command of [a mail - steamer]3645-a mail - steamer . Nothing escaped [his]161-robertson attention ; indeed , in the care which [he]161-robertson gave to [details]889-details [he]161-robertson reminded [me]0-i of [the captain of [a great ship that is leaving [port]892-port]891-a great ship that is leaving port , and from it [I]0-i learned how able [a man [he]161-robertson must once have been]893-a man he must once have been]890-the captain of a great ship that is leaving port , and from it i learned how able a man he must once have been .

" Does [[your]161-robertson daughter]3702-your daughter accompany [us]894-us ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked on the night before [we]894-us started .

" Oh ! no , "[161-robertson] [he]161-robertson answered , ' [she]895-she would only be in the way . [She]895-she will be quite safe here , especially as [Thomaso]163-thomaso , who is [no hunter]896-no hunter , remains in charge of the place with [some of [the older natives]898-the older natives]897-some of the older natives to look after [the women]899-the women and [children]3412-children . "[897-some of the older natives]

Later [I]0-i saw [[Inez]164-inez [herself]164-inez , who said that [she]164-inez would have liked to come , although [she]164-inez hated to see great beasts killed , but that [[her]164-inez father]902-her father was against it because [he]902-her father thought [she]164-inez might catch fever]901-inez herself , who said that she would have liked to come , although she hated to see great beasts killed , but that her father was against it because he thought she might catch fever . So [she]164-inez supposed that [she]164-inez had better remain where [she]164-inez was .

[I]0-i agreed , though in [my]0-i heart [I]0-i was doubtful , and said that [I]0-i would leave [Hans]87-hans , whose foot was not as yet quite well , and with whom [she]164-inez had made friends as [she]164-inez had done with [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , to look after [her]164-inez . Also there would be with [him]87-hans [the two great Zulus who were now recovering from [their]903-the two great zulus who were now recovering from their attack of stomach sickness , so that she would have nothing to fear attack of stomach sickness , so that [she]164-inez would have nothing to fear]903-the two great zulus who were now recovering from their attack of stomach sickness , so that she would have nothing to fear . [She]164-inez answered with [her]164-inez slow smile that [she]164-inez feared nothing , still , [she]164-inez would have liked to come with [us]904-us . Then [we]904-us parted , as it proved for a long time .

It was quite a ceremony . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , " in the name of [the Axe]3781-the axe "[125-umslopogaas] solemnly gave over [Inez]164-inez to [the charge of [[his]125-umslopogaas two followers]906-his two followers]905-the charge of his two followers , bidding [them]906-his two followers guard [her]164-inez with so much earnestness that [I]0-i began to suspect [he]87-hans feared something which [he]87-hans did not choose to mention . [My]0-i mind went back indeed to the prophecy of [the witch - doctor]907-the witch - doctor [Goroko]168-goroko , of which it was possible that [he]87-hans might be thinking , but as while [he]87-hans spoke [he]87-hans kept [his]87-hans fierce eyes fixed upon [the fat and pompous quarter - breed]908-the fat and pompous quarter - breed , [Thomaso]163-thomaso , [I]0-i concluded that here was the object of [his]87-hans doubts .

It might have occurred to [him]87-hans that [this Thomaso]163-thomaso would take the opportunity of [[her]908-the fat and pompous quarter - breed father]902-her father 's absence to annoy [Inez]164-inez . If so [I]0-i was sure that [he]87-hans was mistaken for various reasons , of which [I]0-i need only quote one , namely , that even if such an idea had ever entered [his]87-hans head , [Thomaso]163-thomaso was far too great [a coward]910-a coward to translate it into action . Still , suspecting something , [I]0-i also gave [Hans]87-hans instructions to keep a sharp eye on [Inez]164-inez and generally to watch [the place]328-the place , and if [he]87-hans saw anything suspicious , to communicate with [us]912-us at once .

" Yes , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] said [Hans]87-hans , " [I]87-hans will look after ' [Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes ' "[87-hans] - for so with [their]913-their usual quickness of observation [[our]912-us Zulus]914-our zulus had named [Inez]164-inez - " as though [she]164-inez were [[my]915-i grandmother]3782-my grandmother , though what there is to fear for [her]164-inez , [I]915-i do not know . But , [Baas]121-baas , [I]915-i would much rather come and look after [you]121-baas , as [[your]121-baas reverend father]3327-your reverend father , [the Predikant]3326-the predikant , told [me]915-i to do always , which is [my]915-i duty , not girl - herding , [Baas]121-baas . Also [my]915-i foot is now quite well and - [I]915-i want to shoot sea - cows , and - - "[915-i] Here [he]915-i paused .

" And what , [Hans]87-hans ? "[915-i]

" And [Goroko]168-goroko said that there was going to be much fighting and if there should be fighting and [you]121-baas should come to harm because [I]915-i was not there to protect [you]121-baas , what would [[your]121-baas reverend father]3327-your reverend father think of [me]915-i then ? "[915-i]

All of which meant two things : that [Hans]87-hans never liked being separated from [me]0-i if [he]87-hans could help it , and that [he]87-hans much preferred a shooting trip to stopping alone in [this strange place]916-this strange place with nothing to do except eat and sleep . So [I]0-i concluded , though indeed [I]0-i did not get quite to the bottom of the business . In reality [Hans]87-hans was putting up a most gallant struggle against temptation .

As [I]0-i found out afterwards , [Captain Robertson]161-robertson had been giving [him]87-hans strong drink on the sly , moved thereto by sympathy with [a fellow toper]917-a fellow toper . Also [he]161-robertson had shown [him]87-hans where , if [he]87-hans wanted it , [he]87-hans could get more , and [Hans]87-hans always wanted gin very badly indeed . To leave it within [his]87-hans reach was like leaving a handful of diamonds lying about in [the room of [a thief]919-a thief]918-the room of a thief . This [he]87-hans knew , but was ashamed to tell [me]0-i the truth , and thence came much trouble .

" [You]87-hans will stop here , [Hans]87-hans , look after [the young lady]3786-the young lady and nurse [your]87-hans foot , "[0-i] [I]0-i said sternly , whereon [he]87-hans collapsed with a sigh and asked for some tobacco .

Meanwhile [Captain Robertson]161-robertson , who [I]0-i think had been taking a stirrup cup to cheer [him]87-hans on [the road]3133-the road , was making [his]87-hans farewells down in what was known as " [the village]792-the village , "[87-hans] for [I]0-i saw [him]87-hans there kissing a collection of [half - breed children]921-half - breed children , and giving [Thomaso]163-thomaso instructions to look after [them]921-half - breed children and [[their]921-half - breed children mothers]922-their mothers . Returning at length , [he]87-hans called to [Inez]164-inez , who remained upon [the veranda]780-the veranda , for [she]164-inez always seemed to shrink from [[her]164-inez father]902-her father after [his]87-hans visits to [the village]792-the village , to " keep a stiff upper lip "[164-inez] and not feel lonely , and commanded [the cavalcade]926-the cavalcade to start .

So off [we]927-we went , about [twenty of [the village natives]929-the village natives]928-twenty of the village natives , [a motley crew armed with every kind of gun]930-a motley crew armed with every kind of gun , marching ahead and singing songs . Then came the waggon with [Captain Robertson]161-robertson and [myself]0-i seated on the driving - box , and lastly [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [[his]125-umslopogaas Zulus]931-his zulus , except the two who had been left behind .

[We]927-we trekked along [a kind of native road]932-a kind of native road over [fine veld]31-fine veld of the same character as that on which [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir stood , having [the lower - lying bush - veld]933-the lower - lying bush - veld which ran down to [the Zambesi]11-the zambesi on [our]927-we right . Before nightfall [we]927-we came to a ridge whereon [this bush - veld]934-this bush - veld turned south , fringing [that tributary of [the great river]670-the great river]935-that tributary of the great river in [the swamps of which [we]927-we were to hunt for sea - cows]937-the swamps of which we were to hunt for sea - cows . Here [we]927-we camped and next morning , leaving [the waggon]605-the waggon in charge of [[my]0-i voorlooper]939-my voorlooper and [a couple of [the Strathmuir natives]941-the strathmuir natives]940-a couple of the strathmuir natives , for [the driver]942-the driver was to act as [[my]0-i gun - bearer]943-my gun - bearer - [we]927-we marched down into [the sea of bush - veld]944-the sea of bush - veld . [It]944-the sea of bush - veld proved to be full of game , but at this [we]927-we dared not fire for fearing of disturbing the hippopotami in [the swamps beneath]945-the swamps beneath , whence in that event [they]946-they might escape [us]927-we back to [the river]3345-the river .

About midday [we]927-we passed out of [the bush - veld]948-the bush - veld and reached the place where [the drive was to be]949-the drive was to be . Here , bordered by [steep banks covered with bush]950-steep banks covered with bush , was swampy ground not more than two hundred yards wide , down the centre of which ran [a narrow channel of rather deep water]951-a narrow channel of rather deep water , draining a vast expanse of morass above . It was up [this channel]952-this channel that the sea - cows travelled to the feeding ground where [they]946-they loved to collect at that season of the year .

There with the assistance of [some of [the riverside natives]954-the riverside natives]953-some of the riverside natives [we]927-we made [our]927-we preparations under the direction of [Captain Robertson]161-robertson . [The rest of [these men , to the number of several hundreds]956-these men , to the number of several hundreds]955-the rest of these men , to the number of several hundreds , had made a wide détour to [the head of [the swamps]884-the swamps]957-the head of the swamps , miles away , whence [they]955-the rest of these men , to the number of several hundreds were to advance at a certain signal . These preparations were simple . A quantity of thorn trees were cut down and by means of heavy stones fastened to [their]946-they trunks , anchored in [the narrow channel of deep water]959-the narrow channel of deep water . To [their]946-they tops , which floated on the placid surface , were tied a variety of rags which [we]927-we had brought with [us]927-we , such as old red flannel shirts , gay - coloured but worn - out blankets , and [I]0-i know not what besides . Some of these fragments also were attached to the anchored ropes under water .

Also [we]927-we selected places for the guns upon [the steep banks that [I]0-i have mentioned]960-the steep banks that i have mentioned , between which [this channel]952-this channel ran . Foreseeing what would happen , [I]0-i chose one for [myself]0-i behind a particularly stout rock and what is more , built a stone wall to the height of several feet on [the landward side of]962-the landward side of [it]963-it , as [I]0-i guessed that [the natives posted near to [me]0-i]964-the natives posted near to me would prove wild in [their]964-the natives posted near to me shooting .

These labours occupied the rest of that day , and at night [we]927-we retired to [higher ground]965-higher ground to sleep . Before dawn on the following morning [we]927-we returned and took up [[our]927-we stations]966-our stations , some on [one side of [the channel]968-the channel]967-one side of the channel and some on the other which [we]927-we had to reach in [a canoe]969-a canoe brought for the purpose by [the river natives]3693-the river natives .

Then , before the sun rose , [Captain Robertson]161-robertson fired a huge pile of dried reeds and bushes , which was to give the signal to [the river natives far away to begin [their]3693-the river natives beat]971-the river natives far away to begin their beat . This done , [we]927-we sat down and waited , after making sure that every gun had plenty of ammunition ready .

As the dawn broke , by climbing a tree near [my]0-i schanze or shelter , [I]0-i saw a good many miles away to the south a wide circle of little fires , and guessed that [the natives]972-the natives were beginning to burn [the dry reeds of [the swamp]974-the swamp]973-the dry reeds of the swamp . Presently these fires drew together into a thin wall of flame . Then [I]0-i knew that it was time to return to the schanze and prepare . It was full daylight , however , before anything happened .

Watching [the still channel of water]975-the still channel of water , [I]0-i saw ripples on [it]975-the still channel of water and bubbles of air rising . Suddenly there appeared the head of a great bull - hippopotamus which , having caught sight of [our]927-we rag barricade , either above or below water , had risen to the surface to see what it might be . [I]0-i put a bullet from an eight - bore rifle through its brain , whereon it sank , as [I]0-i guessed , stone dead to the bottom of [the channel]968-the channel , thus helping to increase the barricade by the bulk of its great body . Also it had another effect . [I]0-i have observed that sea - cows can not bear the smell and taint of blood , which frightens [them]977-they horribly , so that [they]977-they will expose [themselves]977-they to almost any risk , rather than get it into [their]977-they nostrils .

Now , in [this still water]978-this still water where there was no perceptible current , the blood from the dead bull soon spread all about so that when the herd , following [[their]977-they leader]979-their leader , began to arrive [they]977-they were much alarmed . Indeed , [the first of them on winding or tasting it]980-the first of them on winding or tasting it , turned and tried to get back up [the channel]968-the channel where , however , [they]980-the first of them on winding or tasting it met [others following , and there ensued a tremendous confusion]982-others following , and there ensued a tremendous confusion . [They]980-the first of them on winding or tasting it rose to the surface , blowing , snorting , bellowing and scrambling over each other in [the water]983-the water , while continually more and more arrived behind [them]980-the first of them on winding or tasting it , till there was a perfect pandemonium in [that narrow place]984-that narrow place .

All [our]985-our guns opened fire wildly upon the mass ; it was like a battle and through the smoke [I]0-i caught sight of [the riverside natives who were acting as [beaters , advancing far away , fantastically dressed , screaming with excitement and waving spears , or sometimes torches of flaming reeds]987-beaters , advancing far away , fantastically dressed , screaming with excitement and waving spears , or sometimes torches of flaming reeds]986-the riverside natives who were acting as beaters , advancing far away , fantastically dressed , screaming with excitement and waving spears , or sometimes torches of flaming reeds . Most of these were scrambling along [the banks]988-the banks , but some of [the bolder spirits]989-the bolder spirits advanced over [the lagoon]990-the lagoon in [canoes]991-canoes , driving [the hippopotami]992-the hippopotami towards [the mouth of [the channel]968-the channel]993-the mouth of the channel by which alone [they]992-the hippopotami could escape into [the great swamps below and so on to [the river]3345-the river]995-the great swamps below and so on to the river . In all [my]0-i hunting experience [I]0-i do not think [I]0-i ever saw a more remarkable scene . Still , in a way , to [me]0-i it was unpleasant , for [I]0-i flatter [myself]0-i that [I]0-i am [a sportsman]997-a sportsman and a battle of this sort is not sport as [I]0-i understand the term .

At length it came to this ; [the channel]968-the channel for quite a long way was literally full of hippopotami - [I]0-i should think there must have been a hundred of them or more of all sorts and sizes , from great bulls down to little calves . [Some of these]999-some of these were killed , not many , for the shooting of [[our]1000-our gallant company]1001-our gallant company was execrable and almost at hazard . Also for every sea - cow that died , of which number [I]0-i think that [Captain Robertson]161-robertson and [myself]0-i accounted for most - many were only wounded .

Still , [the unhappy beasts , crazed with noise and fire and blood]1002-the unhappy beasts , crazed with noise and fire and blood , did not seem to dare to face [[our]1000-our frail barricade]1003-our frail barricade , probably for the reason that [I]0-i have given . For a while [they]1002-the unhappy beasts , crazed with noise and fire and blood remained massed together in [the water]983-the water , or under it , making a most horrible noise . Then of a sudden [they]1002-the unhappy beasts , crazed with noise and fire and blood seemed to take a resolution . [A few of [them]1002-the unhappy beasts , crazed with noise and fire and blood]3174-a few of them broke back towards [the burning reeds]1006-the burning reeds , [the screaming beaters]1007-the screaming beaters and the advancing canoes . One of these , indeed , a wounded bull , charged [a canoe]969-a canoe , crushed it in its huge jaws and killed [the rower]1009-the rower , how exactly [I]0-i do not know , for [his]1009-the rower body was never found . [The majority of [them]1002-the unhappy beasts , crazed with noise and fire and blood]1010-the majority of them , however , took another counsel , for emerging from the water on either side , [they]1002-the unhappy beasts , crazed with noise and fire and blood began to scramble towards [us]1000-our along [the steep banks]1011-the steep banks , or even to climb up them with surprising agility . It was at this point in the proceedings that [I]0-i congratulated [myself]0-i earnestly upon the solid character of the water - worn rock which [I]0-i had selected as [a shelter]1012-a shelter .
