Behind this rock together with [[my]0-i gun - bearer]943-my gun - bearer and [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , who , as [he]125-umslopogaas did not shoot , had elected to be [[my]0-i companion]1014-my companion , [I]0-i crouched and banged away at the unwieldy creatures as [they]1002-the unhappy beasts , crazed with noise and fire and blood advanced . But fire fast as [I]0-i might with two rifles , [I]0-i could not stop the half of [them]1002-the unhappy beasts , crazed with noise and fire and blood - [they]1002-the unhappy beasts , crazed with noise and fire and blood were drawing unpleasantly near . [I]0-i glanced at [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and even then was amused to see that probably for the first time in [his]125-umslopogaas life [that redoubtable warrior]1015-that redoubtable warrior was in a genuine fright .

" This is madness , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , "[125-umslopogaas] [he]125-umslopogaas shouted above the din . " Are [we]1017-us to stop here and be stamped flat by a horde of water - pigs ? "[125-umslopogaas]

" It seems so , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " unless [you]125-umslopogaas prefer to be stamped flat outside - or eaten , "[0-i] [I]0-i added , pointing to a great crocodile that had also emerged from [the channel]968-the channel and was coming along towards [us]1017-us with open jaws .

" By the Axe ! "[125-umslopogaas] shouted [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas again , " [I]125-umslopogaas - [a warrior]506-a warrior - will not die thus , trodden on like a slug by an ox . "[125-umslopogaas]

Now [I]0-i have mentioned a tree which [I]0-i climbed . In [his]125-umslopogaas extremity [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas rushed for that tree and went up [it]1018-it like [a lamplighter]1019-a lamplighter , just as the crocodile wriggled past its trunk , snapping at [his]125-umslopogaas retreating legs .

After this [I]0-i took no more note of [him]125-umslopogaas , partly because of the advancing sea - cows , and more for the reason that [one of [the village natives posted above [me]0-i]1021-the village natives posted above me]1020-one of the village natives posted above me , firing wildly , put a large round bullet through the sleeve of [my]0-i coat . Indeed , had it not been for the wall which [I]0-i built that protected [us]1017-us , [I]0-i am certain that both [[my]0-i bearer]1022-my bearer and [I]0-i would have been killed , for afterwards [I]0-i found it splashed over with lead from bullets which had struck the stones .

Well , thanks to the strength of [my]0-i rock and to the wall , or as [Hans]87-hans said afterwards , to [Zikali 's Great Medicine]104-zikali , [we]1017-us escaped unhurt . The rush went by [me]0-i ; indeed , [I]0-i killed one sea - cow so close that the powder from the rifle actually burned its hide . But it did go by , leaving [us]1017-us untouched . All , however , were not so fortunate , since of [the village natives two]1023-the village natives two were trampled to death , while [a third]1024-a third had [his]1024-a third leg broken .

Also , and this was really amusing - a bewildered bull charging at full speed , crashed into the trunk of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas ' tree , and as it was not very thick , snapped it in two . Down came the top in which [the dignified chief]1025-the dignified chief was ensconced like a bird in a nest , though at that moment there was precious little dignity about [him]1025-the dignified chief . However , except for scratches [he]1025-the dignified chief was not hurt , as the hippopotamus had other business in urgent need of attention and did not stop to settle with [him]1025-the dignified chief .

" Such are the things which happen to [a man who mixes [himself]1025-the dignified chief up with matters of which [he]1025-the dignified chief knows nothing]3789-a man who mixes himself up with matters of which he knows nothing , "[125-umslopogaas] said [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas sententiously to [me]0-i afterwards . But all the same [he]1025-the dignified chief could never bear any allusion to this tree - climbing episode in [his]1025-the dignified chief martial career , which , as it happened , had taken place in full view of [[his]1025-the dignified chief retainers]1026-his retainers , among whom it remained the greatest of jokes . Indeed , [he]1025-the dignified chief wanted to kill [a man]3551-a man , [the wag of the party]1028-the wag of the party , who gave [him]1025-the dignified chief a slang name which , being translated , means " [He]3551-a man - who - is - so - brave - that - [he]3551-a man - dares - to - ride - a - water - horse - up - a - tree . "[1025-the dignified chief]

It was all over at last , for which [I]0-i thanked [Providence]127-providence devoutly . A good many of the sea - cows were dead , [I]0-i think [twenty - one]1029-twenty - one was out exact bag , but [the majority of [them]1029-twenty - one]1010-the majority of them had escaped in one way or another , many as [I]0-i fear , wounded . [I]0-i imagine that at the last the bulk of the herd overcame its fears and swimming through [our]1031-our screen , passed away down [the channel]968-the channel . At any rate [they]1033-they were gone , and having ascertained that there was nothing to be done for [the man who had been trampled on [my]0-i side of [the channel]968-the channel]1034-the man who had been trampled on my side of the channel , [I]0-i crossed [it]968-the channel in [the canoe]1036-the canoe with the object of returning quietly to [[our]1031-our camp]1037-our camp to rest .

But as yet there was to be no quiet for [me]0-i , for there [I]0-i found [Captain Robertson]161-robertson , who [I]0-i think had been refreshing [himself]161-robertson out of a bottle and was in a great state of excitement about [a native who had been killed near [him]161-robertson who was a favourite of [his]161-robertson]1038-a native who had been killed near him who was a favourite of his , and [another whose leg was broken]1039-another whose leg was broken . [He]161-robertson declared vehemently that the hippopotamus which had done this had been wounded and rushed into some bushes a few hundred yards away , and that [he]161-robertson meant to take vengeance upon [it]1040-it . Indeed , [he]161-robertson was just setting off to do so .

Seeing [his]161-robertson agitated state [I]0-i thought it wisest to follow [him]161-robertson . What happened need not be set out in detail . It is sufficient to say that [he]161-robertson found [that hippopotamus]1041-that hippopotamus and blazed both barrels at it in the bushes , hitting it , but not seriously . Out lumbered the creature with its mouth open , wishing to escape . [Robertson]161-robertson turned to fly as [he]161-robertson was in [its]1040-it path , but from one cause or another , tripped and fell down . Certainly [he]161-robertson would have been crushed beneath its huge feet had [I]0-i not stepped in front of [him]161-robertson and sent two solid eight - bore bullets down that yawning throat , killing it dead within three feet of where [Robertson]161-robertson was trying to rise , and [I]0-i may add , of [myself]0-i .

This narrow escape sobered [him]161-robertson , and [I]0-i am bound to say that [his]161-robertson gratitude was profuse .

" [You]0-i are [a brave man]3790-a brave man , "[161-robertson] [he]161-robertson said , " and had it not been for [you]0-i by now [I]161-robertson should be wherever [bad people]3791-bad people go . [I]161-robertson 'll not forget it , [Mr. Quatermain]83-allan , and if ever [you]0-i want anything that [John Robertson]171-john robertson can give , why , it 's [yours]0-i . "[161-robertson]

" Very well , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , being seized by an inspiration , " [I]0-i do want something that [you]161-robertson can give easily enough . "[0-i]

" Give it a name and it 's [yours]0-i , half [my]1042-my place , if [you]161-robertson like . "[1042-my]

" [I]0-i want , "[0-i] [I]0-i went on as [I]0-i slipped new cartridges into the rifle , " [I]0-i want [you]161-robertson to promise to give up drink for [[your]161-robertson daughter]3702-your daughter 's sake . That 's what nearly did for [you]161-robertson just now , [you]161-robertson know . "[0-i]

" [Man]287-man , [you]287-man ask a hard thing , "[1042-my] [he]1042-my said slowly . " But by [God]154-god [I]1042-my 'll try for [her]3702-your daughter sake and for [yours]287-man too . "[1042-my]

Then [I]0-i went to help to set the leg of [the injured man]1043-the injured man , which was all the rest [I]0-i got that morning .

CHAPTER VII

THE OATH

[We]1044-we spent three more days at [that place]1045-that place . First it was necessary to allow time to elapse before the gases which generated in [their]1046-they great bodies caused those of the sea - cows which had been killed in the water , to float . Then [they]1046-they must be skinned and [their]1046-they thick hides cut into strips and pieces to be traded for sjamboks or to make small native shields for which some of [the East Coast tribes]1047-the east coast tribes will pay heavily .

All this took a long while , during which [I]0-i amused , or disgusted [myself]0-i in watching [those river natives]1048-those river natives devouring the flesh of the beasts . The lean , what there was of it , [they]1046-they dried and smoked into a kind of " biltong , "[1046-they] but a great deal of the fat [they]1046-they ate at once . [I]0-i had the curiosity to weigh a lump which was given to [one thin , hungry - looking fellow]1049-one thin , hungry - looking fellow . It scaled quite twenty pounds . Within four hours [he]1049-one thin , hungry - looking fellow had eaten it to the last ounce and lay there , a distended and torpid log . What would not [we]1044-we [white people]3335-white people give for such a digestion !

At last all was over and [we]1044-we started homewards , [the man with a broken leg being carried in a kind of litter]1051-the man with a broken leg being carried in a kind of litter . On the edge of the bush - veld [we]1044-we found the waggon quite safe , also one of [Captain Robertson]161-robertson 's that had followed [us]1044-we from [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir in order to carry the expected load of hippopotamus ' hides and ivory . [I]0-i asked [my]0-i voorlooper if anything had happened during [our]1044-we absence . [He]1049-one thin , hungry - looking fellow answered nothing , but on the previous evening after dark , [he]1049-one thin , hungry - looking fellow had seen a glow in the direction of [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir which lay on somewhat lower ground about twenty miles away , as though numerous fires had been lighted there . It struck [him]1049-one thin , hungry - looking fellow so much , [he]1049-one thin , hungry - looking fellow added , that [he]1049-one thin , hungry - looking fellow climbed a tree to observe it better . [He]1049-one thin , hungry - looking fellow did not think , however , that any building had been burned [there]3196-there , as the glow was not strong enough for that .

[I]0-i suggested that it was caused by some grass fire or reed - burning , to which [he]1049-one thin , hungry - looking fellow replied indifferently that [he]1049-one thin , hungry - looking fellow did not think so as the line of the glow was not sufficiently continuous .

There the matter ended , though [I]0-i confess that the story made [me]0-i anxious , for what exact reason [I]0-i could not say . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas also , who had listened to it , for [our]1044-we talk was in [Zulu]183-the zulu , looked grave , but made no remark . But as since [his]1049-one thin , hungry - looking fellow tree - climbing experience [he]1049-one thin , hungry - looking fellow had been singularly silent , of this [I]0-i thought little .

[We]1044-we had trekked at a time which [we]1044-we calculated would bring [us]1044-we to [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir about an hour before sundown , allowing for a short halt half way . As [my]0-i oxen were got in more quickly than those of [the other waggon after this outspan]1053-the other waggon after this outspan , [I]0-i was [the first away]1054-the first away , followed at a little distance by [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , who preferred to walk with [[his]1049-one thin , hungry - looking fellow Zulus]931-his zulus . The truth was that [I]0-i could not get that story about the glow of fires out of [my]0-i mind and was anxious to push on , which had caused [me]0-i to hurry up the inspanning .

Perhaps [we]1044-we had covered a couple of miles of the ten or twelve which still lay between [us]1044-we and [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir , when far off on [the crest of one of the waves of [the veld]1057-the veld]1056-the crest of one of the waves of the veld which much resembled those of [the swelling sea]1058-the swelling sea frozen while in motion , [I]0-i saw a small figure approaching [us]1044-we at a rapid trot . Somehow that figure suggested [Hans]87-hans to [my]0-i mind , so much so that [I]0-i fetched [my]0-i glasses to examine it more closely . A short scrutiny through [them]1059-them convinced [me]0-i that [Hans]87-hans it was , [Hans]87-hans and [no other]3385-no other , advancing at a great pace .

Filled with uneasiness , [I]0-i ordered [the driver]942-the driver to flog up [the oxen]621-the oxen , with the result that in a little over five minutes [we]1044-we met . Halting the waggon , [I]0-i leapt from the waggon - box and calling to [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas who had kept up with [us]1044-we at a slow , swinging trot , went to [Hans]87-hans , who , when [he]87-hans saw [me]0-i , stood still at a little distance , swinging [his]87-hans apology for a hat in [his]87-hans hand , as was [his]87-hans fashion when ashamed or perplexed .

" What is the matter , [Hans]87-hans ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked when [we]1044-we were within speaking distance .

" Oh ! [Baas]121-baas , everything , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans answered , and [I]0-i noticed that [he]87-hans kept [his]87-hans eyes fixed upon the ground and that [his]87-hans lips twitched .

" Speak , [[you]87-hans fool]3794-you fool , and in Zulu , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , for by now [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas had joined [me]0-i .

" [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans answered in that tongue , " a terrible thing has come about at [the farm of [Red - Beard yonder]121-baas]3795-the farm of red - beard yonder . Yesterday afternoon at the time when [people]3197-people are in the habit of sleeping [there]3196-there till the sun grows less hot , a body of [great men with fierce faces who carried big spears]3798-great men with fierce faces who carried big spears - perhaps there were fifty of [them]3798-great men with fierce faces who carried big spears , [Baas]121-baas - crept up to [the place]328-the place through the long grass and growing crops , and attacked [it]328-the place . "[87-hans]

" Did [you]87-hans see [them]3798-great men with fierce faces who carried big spears come ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" No , [Baas]121-baas . [I]87-hans was watching at a little distance as [you]121-baas bade [me]87-hans do and the sun being hot , [I]87-hans shut [my]87-hans eyes to keep out the glare of it , so that [I]87-hans did not see [them]3798-great men with fierce faces who carried big spears until [they]3798-great men with fierce faces who carried big spears had passed [me]87-hans and heard the noise . "[87-hans]

" [You]87-hans mean that [you]87-hans were asleep or drunk , [Hans]87-hans , but go on . "[87-hans]

" [Baas]121-baas , [I]1063-i do not know , "[1063-i] [he]1063-i answered shamefacedly , " but after that [I]1063-i climbed a tall tree with a kind of bush at the top of it "[1063-i] [I]0-i ascertained afterwards that this was a sort of leafy - crowned palm , " and from it [I]0-i saw everything without being seen . "[0-i]

" What did [you]1063-i see , [Hans]87-hans ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked [him]1063-i .

" [I]0-i saw [the big men]3800-the big men run up and make a kind of circle round [the village]792-the village . Then [they]3800-the big men shouted , and [the people in [the village]792-the village]3802-the people in the village came out to see what was the matter . [Thomaso]163-thomaso and [some of [the men]3805-the men]3804-some of the men caught sight of [them]3800-the big men first and ran away fast into [the hillside]3806-the hillside at the back where the trees grow , before the circle was complete . Then [the women]899-the women and [the children]3808-the children came out and [the big men]3800-the big men killed [them]3800-the big men with [their]3800-the big men spears - all , all ! "[0-i]

" [Good God]154-god ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed . " And what happened at [the house]722-the house and to [the lady]3811-the lady ? "[0-i]

" [Baas]121-baas , [some of [the men]3805-the men]3804-some of the men had surrounded that also and when [she]3811-the lady heard the noise [the lady Sad - Eyes]3814-the lady sad - eyes came out on to [the stoep]3815-the stoep and with [her]3811-the lady came [the two Zulus of the Axe who had been left sick but were now quite recovered]3816-the two zulus of the axe who had been left sick but were now quite recovered . [A number of [the big men]3800-the big men]3817-a number of the big men ran as though to take [her]3811-the lady , but [the two Zulus]3819-the two zulus made a great fight in front of the little steps to [the stoep]3815-the stoep , having [their]3819-the two zulus backs protected by the stoep , and killed six of [them]3819-the two zulus before [they]3819-the two zulus [themselves]3819-the two zulus were killed . Also [Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes shot one with a pistol [she]170-sad - eyes carried , and wounded another so that the spear fell out of [his]121-baas hand .[0-i]

" Then [the rest]3749-the rest fell on [her]3811-the lady and tied [her]3811-the lady up , setting [her]3811-the lady in a chair on the stoep where two remained to watch [her]3811-the lady . [They]3800-the big men did [her]3811-the lady no hurt , [Baas]121-baas ; indeed , [they]3800-the big men seemed to treat [her]3811-the lady as gently as [they]3800-the big men could . Also [they]3800-the big men went into [the house]722-the house and there [they]3800-the big men caught [that tall fat yellow girl who always smiles and is called [Janee]172-janee , [she]172-janee who waits upon [the Lady Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes]3823-that tall fat yellow girl who always smiles and is called janee , she who waits upon the lady sad - eyes , and brought [her]172-janee out to [her]172-janee . [I]0-i think [they]3800-the big men told [her]172-janee , [Baas]121-baas , that [she]172-janee must look after [[her]172-janee mistress]3824-her mistress and that if [she]172-janee tried to run away [she]172-janee would be killed , for afterwards [I]0-i saw [Janee]172-janee bring [her]172-janee food and other things . "[0-i]

" And then , [Hans]87-hans ? "[0-i]

" Then , [Baas]121-baas , [most of [the great men]3826-the great men]3825-most of the great men rested a while , though [some of [them]3825-most of the great men]3163-some of them went through [the store]820-the store gathering such things as [they]3825-most of the great men liked , blankets , knives and iron cooking - pots , but [they]3825-most of the great men set fire to nothing , nor did [they]3825-most of the great men try to catch the cattle . Also [they]3825-most of the great men took dry wood from the pile and lit big fires , eight or nine of [them]3825-most of the great men , and when the sun set [they]3825-most of the great men began to feast . "[0-i]

" What did [they]3825-most of the great men feast on , [Hans]87-hans , if [they]3825-most of the great men took no cattle ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked with a shiver , for [I]0-i was afraid of [I]0-i knew not what .

" [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] answered [Hans]87-hans , turning [his]87-hans head away and looking at the ground , " [they]3825-most of the great men feasted on [the children whom [they]3825-most of the great men had killed]3829-the children whom they had killed , also on [some of [the young women]3831-the young women]3830-some of the young women . [These tall soldiers]3832-these tall soldiers are [men - eaters]3833-men - eaters , [Baas]121-baas . "[87-hans]

At this horrible intelligence [I]0-i turned faint and felt as though [I]0-i was going to fall , but recovering [myself]0-i , signed to [him]87-hans to go on with [his]87-hans story .

" [They]3825-most of the great men feasted quite nicely , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans continued , " making no noise . Then some of [them]3825-most of the great men slept while [others]279-others watched , and that went on all night . As soon as it was dark , but before the moon rose , [I]87-hans slid down the tree and crept round to the back of [the house]722-the house without being seen or heard , as [I]87-hans can , [Baas]121-baas . [I]87-hans got into [the house]722-the house by the back door and crawled to the window of [the sitting - room]634-the sitting - room . It was open and peeping through [I]87-hans saw [Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes still tied to the seat on the stoep not more than a pace away , while [the girl]3838-the girl [Janee]172-janee crouched on the floor at [her]172-janee feet - [I]87-hans think [she]172-janee was asleep or fainting .[87-hans]

" [I]87-hans made a little noise , like a night - adder hissing , and kept on making it , till at last [Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes turned [her]170-sad - eyes head . Then [I]87-hans spoke in a very low whisper , for fear lest [I]87-hans should wake [the two guards who were dozing on either side of [her]172-janee]3839-the two guards who were dozing on either side of her wrapped in [their]3839-the two guards who were dozing on either side of her blankets , saying , ' It is [I]87-hans , [Hans]87-hans , come to help [you]87-hans . ' ' [You]87-hans can not , ' [she]172-janee answered , also speaking very low . ' Get to [[your]87-hans master]3567-your master and tell [him]3567-your master and [[my]87-hans father]3272-my father to follow . [These men]850-these men are called [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas and live far away across [the river]3345-the river . [They]850-these men are going to take [me]87-hans to [[their]850-these men home]3844-their home , as [I]87-hans understand , to rule [them]850-these men , because [they]850-these men want [a white woman]3845-a white woman to be [a queen over [them]850-these men who have always been ruled by [a certain white queen]3847-a certain white queen , against whom [they]850-these men have rebelled]3846-a queen over them who have always been ruled by a certain white queen , against whom they have rebelled . [I]87-hans do not think [they]850-these men mean to do [me]87-hans any harm , unless perhaps [they]850-these men want to marry [me]87-hans to [[their]850-these men chief]3848-their chief , but of this [I]87-hans am not sure from [their]850-these men talk which [I]87-hans understand badly . Now go , before [they]850-these men catch [you]87-hans . '[87-hans]

" ' [I]87-hans think [you]87-hans might get away , ' [I]87-hans whispered back . ' [I]87-hans will cut [your]87-hans bonds . When [you]87-hans are free , slip through the window and [I]87-hans will guide [you]87-hans . '[87-hans]

" ' Very well , try it , ' [she]3849-she said .[87-hans]

" So [I]87-hans drew [my]87-hans knife and stretched out [my]87-hans arm . But then , [Baas]121-baas , [I]87-hans showed [myself]87-hans [a fool]3850-a fool - if [the Great Medicine]104-zikali had still been [there]3196-there [I]87-hans might have known better . [I]87-hans forgot the starlight which shone upon the blade of the knife . [That girl]3852-that girl [Janee]172-janee came out of [her]172-janee sleep or swoon , lifted [her]172-janee head and saw the knife . [She]172-janee screamed once , then at a word from [[her]172-janee mistress]3824-her mistress was silent . But it was enough , for it woke up [the guards who glared about [them]3854-the guards who glared about them and threatened janee with their great spears and threatened [Janee]172-janee with [their]3854-the guards who glared about them and threatened janee with their great spears great spears]3854-the guards who glared about them and threatened janee with their great spears , also [they]3854-the guards who glared about them and threatened janee with their great spears went to sleep no more , but began to talk together , though what [they]3854-the guards who glared about them and threatened janee with their great spears said [I]87-hans could not hear , for [I]87-hans was hiding on the floor of [the room]3855-the room . After this , knowing that [I]87-hans could do no good and might do harm and get [myself]87-hans killed , [I]87-hans crept out of [the house]722-the house as [I]87-hans had crept in , and crawled back to [my]87-hans tree . "[87-hans]

" Why did [you]87-hans not come to [me]0-i ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Because [I]87-hans still hoped [I]87-hans might be able to help [Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes , [Baas]121-baas . Also [I]87-hans wanted to see what happened , and [I]87-hans knew that [I]87-hans could not bring [you]121-baas here in time to be any good . Yet it is true [I]87-hans thought of coming though [I]87-hans did not know [the road]3133-the road . "[87-hans]

" Perhaps [you]87-hans were right . "[87-hans]

" At the first dawn , "[87-hans] continued [Hans]87-hans , " [the great men who are called [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas]3858-the great men who are called amahagger rose and ate what was left over from the night before . Then [they]3858-the great men who are called amahagger gathered [themselves]3858-the great men who are called amahagger together and went to [the house]722-the house . Here [they]3858-the great men who are called amahagger found a large chair , that seated with rimpis in which [the Baas Red - Beard]121-baas sits , and lashed two poles to the chair . Beneath the chair [they]3858-the great men who are called amahagger tied the garments and other things of [the Lady Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes which [they]3858-the great men who are called amahagger made [Janee]172-janee gather as [Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes directed [her]172-janee . This done , very gently [they]3858-the great men who are called amahagger sat [Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes [herself]170-sad - eyes in the chair , bowing while [they]3858-the great men who are called amahagger made [her]170-sad - eyes fast . After this eight of [them]3858-the great men who are called amahagger set the poles upon [their]3858-the great men who are called amahagger shoulders , and [they]3858-the great men who are called amahagger all went away at a trot , heading for [the bush - veld]948-the bush - veld , driving with [them]3858-the great men who are called amahagger a herd of goats which [they]3858-the great men who are called amahagger had stolen from [the farm]3861-the farm , and making [Janee]172-janee run by the chair . [I]87-hans saw everything , [Baas]121-baas , for [they]3858-the great men who are called amahagger passed just beneath [my]87-hans tree . Then [I]87-hans came to seek [you]121-baas , following the outward spoor of the waggons which [I]87-hans could not have done well at night . That is all , [Baas]121-baas . "[87-hans]

" [Hans]87-hans , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [you]87-hans have been drinking and because of it [the lady Sad - Eyes]3814-the lady sad - eyes is taken [a prisoner by cannibals]3863-a prisoner by cannibals ; for had [you]87-hans been awake and watching , [you]87-hans might have seen [them]3858-the great men who are called amahagger coming and saved [her]3814-the lady sad - eyes and the rest . Still , afterwards [you]87-hans did well , and for the rest [you]87-hans must answer to Heaven . "[0-i]

" [I]87-hans must tell [[your]87-hans reverend father]3327-your reverend father , [the Predikant]3326-the predikant , [Baas]121-baas , that [the white master]3866-the white master , [Red - Beard]121-baas , gave [me]87-hans the liquor and it is rude not to do as [a great white master]3867-a great white master does , and drink it up . [I]87-hans am sure [he]3866-the white master will understand , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] said [Hans]87-hans abjectly .

[I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i that it was true and that the spear which [Robertson]161-robertson cast had fallen upon [his]161-robertson own head , as [the Zulus]354-the zulus say , but [I]0-i made no answer , lacking time for argument .

" Did [you]87-hans say , "[125-umslopogaas] asked [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , speaking for the first time , " that [[my]125-umslopogaas servants]3372-my servants killed only [six of [these men - eaters]3870-these men - eaters]3869-six of these men - eaters ? "[125-umslopogaas]

[Hans]87-hans nodded and answered , " Yes , six . [I]87-hans counted the bodies . "[87-hans]

" It was ill done , [they]3372-my servants should have killed six each , "[125-umslopogaas] said [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas moodily . " Well , [they]3372-my servants have left the more for [us]3871-us to finish , "[125-umslopogaas] and [he]125-umslopogaas fingered the great axe .

Just then [Captain Robertson]161-robertson arrived in [[his]161-robertson waggon]1065-his waggon , calling out anxiously to know what was the matter , for some premonition of evil seemed to have struck [him]161-robertson . [My]0-i heart sank at the sight of [him]161-robertson , for how was [I]0-i to tell such a story to [the father of [the murdered children]1067-the murdered children]1066-the father of the murdered children and of [the abducted girl]1068-the abducted girl ?

In the end [I]0-i felt that [I]0-i could not . Yes , [I]0-i turned coward and saying that [I]0-i must fetch something out of the waggon , bolted into it , bidding [Hans]87-hans go forward and repeat [his]87-hans tale . [He]161-robertson obeyed unwillingly enough and looking out between the curtains of [the waggon tent]1069-the waggon tent [I]0-i saw all that happened , though [I]0-i could not hear the words that passed .

[Robertson]161-robertson had halted the oxen and jumping from the waggon - box strode forward and met [Hans]87-hans , who began to speak with [him]161-robertson , twitching [his]161-robertson hat in [his]161-robertson hands . Gradually as the tale progressed , [I]0-i saw [the Captain]765-the captain 's face freeze into a mask of horror . Then [he]765-the captain began to argue and deny , then to weep - oh ! it was a terrible sight to see [that great man]1071-that great man weeping over those whom [he]765-the captain had lost , and in such a fashion .

After this a kind of blind rage seized [him]765-the captain and [I]0-i thought [he]765-the captain was going to kill [Hans]87-hans , who was of the same opinion , for [he]765-the captain ran away . Next [he]765-the captain staggered about , shaking [his]765-the captain fists , cursing and shouting , till presently [he]765-the captain fell of a heap and lay face downwards , beating [his]765-the captain head against the ground and groaning .

Now [I]0-i went to [him]765-the captain and sat up .

" That 's a pretty story , [Quatermain]83-allan , which this little yellow monkey has been gibbering at [me]765-the captain . [Man]287-man , do [you]287-man understand what [he]765-the captain says ? [He]765-the captain says that [all those half - blood children of [mine]765-the captain]3873-all those half - blood children of mine are dead , murdered by savages from over [the Zambesi]11-the zambesi , yes , and eaten , too , with [[their]3873-all those half - blood children of mine mothers]922-their mothers . Do [you]287-man take the point ? Eaten like lambs . Those fires [[your]287-man man]3875-your man saw last night were the fires on which [they]3873-all those half - blood children of mine were cooked , [my]765-the captain little so - and - so and so - and - so , "[765-the captain] and [he]765-the captain mentioned half a dozen different names . " Yes , cooked , [Quatermain]83-allan . And that is n't all of it , [they]3873-all those half - blood children of mine have taken [Inez]164-inez too . [They]3873-all those half - blood children of mine did n't eat [her]164-inez , but [they]3873-all those half - blood children of mine have dragged [her]164-inez off [a captive]3876-a captive for God knows what reason . [I]765-the captain could n't understand . [The whole ship 's crew]3877-the whole ship 's crew is gone , except [the captain absent on leave]3878-the captain absent on leave and [the first officer]3879-the first officer , [Thomaso]163-thomaso , who deserted with [some Lascar stokers]3880-some lascar stokers , and left [the women]899-the women and [children]3412-children to [their]3877-the whole ship 's crew fate . [[My]765-the captain God]3883-my god , [I]765-the captain 'm going mad . [I]765-the captain 'm going mad ! If [you]3883-my god have any mercy in [you]3883-my god , give [me]765-the captain something to drink . "[765-the captain]

" All right , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [I]0-i will . Sit here and wait a minute . "[0-i]

Then [I]0-i went to the waggon and poured out a stiff tot of spirits into which [I]0-i put an amazing doze of bromide from a little medicine chest [I]0-i always carry with [me]0-i , and thirty drops of chlorodyne on the top of it . All this compound [I]0-i mixed up with a little water and took it to [him]1072-i in a tin cup so that [he]1072-i could not see the colour .

[He]1072-i drank it at a gulp and throwing the pannikin aside , sat down on the veld , groaning while [the company]1073-the company watched [him]1072-i at a respectful distance , for [Hans]87-hans had joined [the others]3164-the others and [his]87-hans tale had spread like fire in drought - parched grass .

In a few minutes the drugs began to take effect upon [Robertson]161-robertson 's tortured nerves , for [he]1072-i rose and said quietly ,

" What now ? "[1072-i]

" Vengeance , or rather justice , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" Yes , "[1072-i] [he]1072-i exclaimed , " vengeance . [I]1072-i swear that [I]1072-i will be avenged , or die - or both . "[1072-i]

Again [I]0-i saw [my]0-i opportunity and said , " [You]1072-i must swear more than that , [Robertson]161-robertson . [Only sober men]3884-only sober men can accomplish great things , for drink destroys the judgment . If [you]1072-i wish to be avenged for the dead and to rescue [the living]3885-the living , [you]1072-i must be sober , or [I]0-i for one will not help [you]1072-i . "[0-i]

" Will [you]0-i help [me]1072-i if [I]1072-i do , to the end , good or ill , [Quatermain]83-allan ? "[1072-i] [he]1072-i added .

[I]0-i nodded .

" That 's as much as another 's oath , "[1072-i] [he]1072-i muttered . " Still , [I]1072-i will put [my]1072-i thought in words . [I]1072-i swear by [God]154-god , by [[my]1072-i mother]3886-my mother - like [these natives]3887-these natives - and by [[my]1072-i daughter]3638-my daughter born in honest marriage , that [I]1072-i will never touch another drop of strong drink , until [I]1072-i have avenged [those poor women]3889-those poor women and [[their]3889-those poor women little children]3890-their little children , and rescued [Inez]164-inez from [[their]3889-those poor women murderers]3891-their murderers . If [I]1072-i do [you]3892-you may put a bullet through [me]1072-i . "[1072-i]

" That 's all right , "[0-i] [I]0-i said in an offhand fashion , though inwardly [I]0-i glowed with pride at the success of [my]0-i great idea , for at the time [I]0-i thought it great , and went on ,

" Now let [us]3893-us get to business . The first thing to do is to trek to [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir and make preparations ; the next to start upon [the trail]3894-the trail . Come to sit on the waggon with [me]0-i and tell [me]0-i what guns and ammunition [you]3892-you have got , for according to [Hans]87-hans [those savages]3895-those savages do n't seem to have touched anything , except a few blankets and a herd of goats . "[0-i]

[He]1075-he did as [I]0-i asked , telling [me]0-i all [he]1075-he could remember . Then [he]1075-he said ,

" It is a strange thing , but now [I]1075-he recall that about two years ago [a great savage with a high nose , who talked a sort of Arabic]3896-a great savage with a high nose , who talked a sort of arabic which , like [Inez]164-inez , [I]1075-he understand , having lived on [the coast]3718-the coast , turned up one day and said [he]1075-he wanted to trade . [I]1075-he asked [him]1075-he what in , and [he]1075-he answered that [he]1075-he would like to buy [some children]3898-some children . [I]1075-he told [him]1075-he that [I]1075-he was not [a slave - dealer]3899-a slave - dealer . Then [he]1075-he looked at [Inez]164-inez , who was moving about , and said that [he]1075-he would like to buy [her]164-inez to be [a wife for [[his]1075-he Chief]3901-his chief]3900-a wife for his chief , and offered some fabulous sum in ivory and in gold , which [he]1075-he said should be paid before [she]164-inez was taken away . [I]1075-he snatched [his]1075-he big spear from [his]1075-he hand , broke it over [his]1075-he head and gave [him]1075-he the best hiding with its shaft that [he]1075-he had ever heard of . Then [I]1075-he kicked [him]1075-he off [the place]328-the place . [He]1075-he limped away but when [he]1075-he was out of reach , turned and called out that one day [he]1075-he would come again with [others]279-others and take [her]164-inez , meaning [Inez]164-inez , without leaving the price in ivory and gold . [I]1075-he ran for [my]1075-he gun , but when [I]1075-he got back [he]1075-he had gone and [I]1075-he never thought of the matter again from that day to this . "[1075-he]

" Well , [he]1075-he kept [his]1075-he promise , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , but [Robertson]161-robertson made no answer , for by this time that thundering dose of bromide and laudanum had taken effect on [him]161-robertson and [he]161-robertson had fallen asleep , of which [I]0-i was glad , for [I]0-i thought that this sleep would save [his]161-robertson sanity , as [I]0-i believe it did for a while .

[We]1076-we reached [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir towards sunset , too late to think of attempting the pursuit that day . Indeed , during [our]1076-we trek , [I]0-i had thought the matter out carefully and come to the conclusion that to try to do so would be useless . [We]1076-we must rest and make preparations ; also there was no hope of [our]1076-we overtaking these brutes who already had a clear twelve hours ' start , by a sudden spurt . [They]1077-they must be run down patiently by following [their]1077-they spoor , if indeed [they]1077-they could be run down at all before [they]1077-they vanished into [the vast recesses of [unknown Africa]10-africa]1078-the vast recesses of unknown africa . The most [we]1076-we could do this night was to get ready .

[Captain Robertson]161-robertson was still sleeping when [we]1076-we passed [the village]792-the village and of this [I]0-i was heartily glad , since the remains of [a cannibal feast]1080-a cannibal feast are not pleasant to behold , especially when they are - - ! Indeed , of these [I]0-i determined to be rid at once , so slipping off the waggon with [Hans]87-hans and [some of [the farm boys]1082-the farm boys]1081-some of the farm boys , for [none of [the Zulus]354-the zulus]1083-none of the zulus would defile [themselves]1077-they by touching such human remnants - [I]0-i made up two of the smouldering fires , the light of which [the voorlooper]1085-the voorlooper had seen upon the sky , and on to [them]1086-them cast , or caused to be cast , those poor fragments . Also [I]0-i told [the farm natives]1087-the farm natives to dig a big grave and in it to place the other bodies and generally to remove the traces of murder .

Then [I]0-i went on to [the house]722-the house , and not too soon . Seeing [the waggons]1089-the waggons arrive and having made sure that [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas were gone , [Thomaso]163-thomaso and [the other cowards]1090-the other cowards emerged from [their]1077-they hiding - places and returned . Unfortunately for [the former]1091-the former [the first person [he]1091-the former met]1092-the first person he met was [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , who began to revile the fat half - breed in no measured terms , calling [him]163-thomaso dog , [coward]1093-coward , and other opprobrious names , such as deserter of [women]3186-women and [children]3412-children , and so forth - all of which [someone]293-someone translated .

[Thomaso]163-thomaso , [an insolent person]1097-an insolent person , tried to swagger the matter out , saying that [he]163-thomaso had gone to get assistance . Infuriated at this lie , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas leapt upon [him]163-thomaso with a roar and though [he]125-umslopogaas was [a strong man]1098-a strong man , dealt with [him]163-thomaso as a lion does with a buck . Lifting [him]163-thomaso from [his]163-thomaso feet , [he]125-umslopogaas hurled [him]163-thomaso to the ground , then as [he]125-umslopogaas strove to rise and run , caught [him]163-thomaso again and as it seemed to [me]0-i , was about to break [his]163-thomaso back across [his]163-thomaso knee . Just at this juncture [I]0-i arrived .

" Let [the man]324-the man go , "[0-i] [I]0-i shouted to [him]125-umslopogaas . " Is there not enough death here already ? "[0-i]

" Yes , "[125-umslopogaas] answered [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , " [I]125-umslopogaas think there is . Best that [this jackal]3905-this jackal should live to eat [his]3905-this jackal own shame , "[125-umslopogaas] and [he]125-umslopogaas cast [Thomaso]163-thomaso to [the ground]1099-the ground , where [he]163-thomaso lay groaning .

[Robertson]161-robertson , who was still asleep in the waggon , woke up at the noise , and descended from it , looking dazed . [I]0-i got [him]161-robertson to [the house]722-the house and in doing so made [my]0-i way past , or rather between the bodies of [the two Zulus]3819-the two zulus and of [the six men whom [they]3819-the two zulus had killed]1102-the six men whom they had killed , also of [him]161-robertson whom [Inez]164-inez had shot . [Those Zulus]101-the zulus had made a splendid fight for [they]101-the zulus were covered with wounds , all of [them]101-the zulus in front , as [I]0-i found upon examination .

Having made [Robertson]161-robertson lie down upon [his]161-robertson bed , [I]0-i took a good look at [the slain Amahagger]125-umslopogaas . [They]101-the zulus were [magnificent men]1103-magnificent men , all of [them]101-the zulus ; tall , spare and shapely with very clear - cut features and rather frizzled hair . From these characteristics , as well as the lightness of [their]101-the zulus colour , [I]0-i concluded that [they]101-the zulus were of [a Semitic or Arab type]1104-a semitic or arab type , and that the admixture of [their]101-the zulus blood with that of [the Bantus]173-the bantus was but slight , if indeed there were any at all . [Their]101-the zulus spears , of which one had been cut through by a blow of [a Zulu]1105-a zulu 's axe , were long and broad , not unlike to those used by [the Masai]1106-the masai , but of finer workmanship .

By this time the sun was setting and thoroughly tired by all that [I]0-i had gone through , [I]0-i went into [the house]722-the house to get something to eat , having told [Hans]87-hans to find food and prepare a meal . As [I]0-i sat down [Robertson]161-robertson joined [me]0-i and [I]0-i made [him]161-robertson also eat . [His]161-robertson first impulse was to go to the cupboard and fetch the spirit bottle ; indeed , [he]161-robertson rose to do so .

" [Hans]87-hans is making coffee , "[0-i] [I]0-i said warningly .

" Thank [you]0-i , "[161-robertson] [he]161-robertson answered , " [I]161-robertson forgot . Force of habit , [you]0-i know . "[161-robertson]

Here [I]0-i may state that never from that moment did [I]0-i see [him]161-robertson touch another drop of liquor , not even when [I]0-i drank [my]0-i modest tot in front of [him]161-robertson . [His]161-robertson triumph over temptation was splendid and complete , especially as the absence of [his]161-robertson accustomed potations made [him]161-robertson ill for some time and of course depressed [his]161-robertson spirits , with painful results that were apparent in due course .

In fact , [the man]324-the man became totally changed . [He]161-robertson grew gloomy but resourceful , also full of patience . Only one idea obsessed [him]161-robertson - to rescue [[his]161-robertson daughter]778-his daughter and avenge the murder of [[his]161-robertson people]3358-his people ; indeed , except [his]161-robertson sins , [he]161-robertson thought of and found interest in nothing else . Moreover , [his]161-robertson iron constitution cast off all the effects of [his]161-robertson past debauchery and [he]161-robertson grew so strong that although [I]0-i was pretty tough in those days , [he]161-robertson could out - tire [me]0-i .

To return ; [I]0-i engaged [him]161-robertson in conversation and with [his]161-robertson help made a list of what [we]1111-we should require on [our]1111-we vendetta journey , all of which served to occupy [his]161-robertson mind . Then [I]0-i sent [him]161-robertson to bed , saying that [I]0-i would call [him]161-robertson before dawn , having first put a little more bromide into [his]161-robertson third cup of coffee . After this [I]0-i turned in and notwithstanding the sight of those remains of the cannibal feast and the knowledge of [the dead men who lay outside [my]0-i window]1112-the dead men who lay outside my window , [I]0-i slept like a top .

Indeed , it was [the Captain who awakened [me]0-i]1113-the captain who awakened me , not [I]0-i [the Captain]765-the captain , saying that daylight was on the break and [we]1111-we had better be stirring . So [we]1111-we went down to [the Store]820-the store , where [I]0-i was thankful to find that everything had been tidied up in accordance with [my]0-i directions .

On [our]1111-we way [Robertson]161-robertson asked [me]0-i what had become of the remains , whereon [I]0-i pointed to the smouldering ashes of one of the great fires . [He]161-robertson went to [it]1116-it and kneeling down , said a prayer in broad Scotch , doubtless one that [he]161-robertson had learned at [[his]161-robertson mother]754-his mother 's knee . Then [he]161-robertson took some of the ashes from the edge of the pyre - for such it was - and threw them into the glowing embers where , as [he]161-robertson knew , lay all that was left of [those who had sprung from [him]161-robertson]1118-those who had sprung from him . Also [he]161-robertson tossed others of them into the air , though what [he]161-robertson meant by this [I]0-i did not understand and never asked . Probably it was some rite indicative of expiation or of revenge , or both , which [he]161-robertson had learned from the savages among whom [he]161-robertson had lived so long .

After this [we]1111-we went into [the Store]820-the store and with the help of [some of [the natives]972-the natives , or half - breeds , who had accompanied [us]1111-we on the sea - cow expedition]1120-some of the natives , or half - breeds , who had accompanied us on the sea - cow expedition , selected all the goods [we]1111-we wanted , which [we]1111-we sent to [the house]722-the house .

As [we]1111-we returned thither [I]0-i saw [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [[his]125-umslopogaas men]1123-his men engaged , with the usual Zulu ceremonies , in burying [[their]1124-they two companions]1125-their two companions in a hole [they]1124-they had made in [the hillside]3806-the hillside . [I]0-i noted , however , that [they]1124-they did not inter [their]1124-they war - axes or [their]1124-they throwing - spears with [them]1124-they as usual , probably because [they]1124-they thought that these might be needed . In place of [them]1124-they [they]1124-they put with [the dead little models]1127-the dead little models roughly shaped of bits of wood , which models [they]1124-they " killed "[1124-they] by first breaking [them]1127-the dead little models across .

[I]0-i lingered to watch the funeral and heard [Goroko]168-goroko , [the witch - doctor]907-the witch - doctor , make a little speech .

" [O Father]174-o father and [Chief of the Axe]3906-chief of the axe , "[168-goroko] [he]168-goroko said , addressing [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , who stood silent leaning on [his]125-umslopogaas weapon and watching all , [a portentous figure in the morning mist]1129-a portentous figure in the morning mist , " [O Father]174-o father , [O Son of the Heavens]3907-o son of the heavens "[168-goroko] this was an allusion to the royal blood of [Umslopogaas of which the secret]1130-umslopogaas of which the secret was well known , although it would never have been spoken aloud in [Zululand]4-zululand , " [O Slaughterer Bulalio]175-o slaughterer bulalio , [[O Woodpecker]144-the woodpecker who picks at the hearts of [men]3228-men]3908-o woodpecker who picks at the hearts of men ; [O King - Slayer]176-o king - slayer ; [O Conqueror of [the Halakazi]35-the halakazi]3910-o conqueror of the halakazi ; [O Victor]3911-o victor in a hundred fights ; [O Gatherer of the Lily - bloom that faded in the hand]3912-o gatherer of the lily - bloom that faded in the hand ; [O Wolf - man]3913-o wolf - man , [Captain of the Wolves that ravened ; [O Slayer of Faku]177-faku ; O Great One whom it pleases to seem small , because [he]3913-o wolf - man must follow [his]3913-o wolf - man blood to the end appointed]177-faku - - "[1132-the speaker]

This was the opening of the speech , the " bonga -ing "[1132-the speaker] or giving of Titles of Praise to [the person addressed]1131-the person addressed , of which [I]0-i have quoted but a sample , for there were many more of them that [I]0-i have forgotten . Then [the speaker]1132-the speaker went on ,

" It was told to [me]1132-the speaker , though of it [I]1132-the speaker remember nothing , that when [my]1132-the speaker Spirit was in [me]1132-the speaker a while ago [I]1132-the speaker prophesied that [this place]3445-this place would flow with blood , and lo ! the blood has flowed , and with it that of these [[our]3915-our brothers]3916-our brothers , "[1132-the speaker] and [he]1132-the speaker gave the names of [the two dead Zulus]1133-the two dead zulus , also those of [[their]1133-the two dead zulus forefathers]1134-their forefathers for several generations .

" It seems , [Father]174-o father , that [they]1133-the two dead zulus died well , as [you]174-o father would have wished [them]1133-the two dead zulus to die , and as doubtless [they]1133-the two dead zulus desired to die [themselves]1133-the two dead zulus , leaving a tale behind [them]1133-the two dead zulus , though it is true that [they]1133-the two dead zulus might have died better , killing [more of [the men - eaters]3918-the men - eaters]3917-more of the men - eaters , as it is certain [they]1133-the two dead zulus would have done , had [they]1133-the two dead zulus not been sick inside . [They]1133-the two dead zulus are finished ; [they]1133-the two dead zulus have gone beyond to await [us]3915-our in [the Under - world]3598-the under - world among the ghosts . [Their]1133-the two dead zulus story is told and soon to [[their]1133-the two dead zulus children]3920-their children [they]1133-the two dead zulus will be but names whispered in honour after the sun has set . [Enough of [them]1133-the two dead zulus who have showed [us]3915-our how to die as [[our]3915-our fathers]3922-our fathers did before [them]1133-the two dead zulus]3921-enough of them who have showed us how to die as our fathers did before them . "[1132-the speaker]

[Goroko]168-goroko paused a while , then added with a waving of [his]168-goroko hands ,

" [[My]168-goroko Spirit]3923-my spirit comes to [me]168-goroko again and [I]168-goroko know that these [[our]3915-our brothers]3916-our brothers shall not pass unavenged . [Chief of the Axe , great glory]3925-chief of the axe , great glory awaits the Axe , for it shall feed full . [I]168-goroko have spoken . "[168-goroko]

" Good words ! "[168-goroko] grunted [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas . Then [he]168-goroko saluted [the dead]3534-the dead by raising [Inkosikaas]156-inkosikaas and came to [me]0-i to consult about [our]1136-we journey .

CHAPTER VIII

PURSUIT

After all [we]1136-we did not get away much before noon , because first there was a great deal to be done . To begin with the loads had to be arranged . These consisted largely of ammunition , everything else being cut down to an irreducible minimum . To carry [them]1137-i [we]1136-we took two donkeys there were on [the place]328-the place , also half a dozen pack oxen , all of which animals were supposed to be ' salted " - that is , to have suffered and recovered from every kind of sickness , including the bite of the deadly tsetse fly . [I]1137-i suspected , it is true , that [they]1137-i would not be proof against further attacks , still , [I]1137-i hoped that [they]1137-i would last for some time , as indeed proved to be the case .[1137-i]

In the event of the beasts failing [us]1136-we , [we]1136-we took also [ten of the best of [those Strathmuir men who had accompanied [us]1136-we on the sea - cow trip]1140-those strathmuir men who had accompanied us on the sea - cow trip]1139-ten of the best of those strathmuir men who had accompanied us on the sea - cow trip , to serve as [bearers when it became necessary]1141-bearers when it became necessary . It can not be said that [these snuff - and - butter fellows]1142-these snuff - and - butter fellows - for most , if not all of [them]1142-these snuff - and - butter fellows had some dash of white blood in [their]1142-these snuff - and - butter fellows veins - were exactly [willing volunteers]1143-willing volunteers . Indeed , if a choice had been left to [them]1142-these snuff - and - butter fellows , [they]1142-these snuff - and - butter fellows would , [I]0-i think , have declined this adventure .

But there was no choice . [[Their]1142-these snuff - and - butter fellows master]1144-their master , [Robertson]161-robertson , ordered [them]1142-these snuff - and - butter fellows to come and after a glance at [the Zulus]101-the zulus [they]1142-these snuff - and - butter fellows concluded that the command was one which would be enforced and that if [they]1142-these snuff - and - butter fellows stopped behind , it would not be as [living men]1145-living men . Also [some of [them]1142-these snuff - and - butter fellows]3163-some of them had lost [wives]3434-wives or [children]3412-children in the slaughter , which , if [they]3163-some of them were not very brave , filled [them]3163-some of them with a desire for revenge . Lastly , [they]1142-these snuff - and - butter fellows could all shoot after a fashion and had good rifles ; moreover if [I]0-i may say so , [I]0-i think that [they]1142-these snuff - and - butter fellows put confidence in [my]0-i leadership . So [they]1142-these snuff - and - butter fellows made the best of a bad business and got [themselves]1142-these snuff - and - butter fellows ready .

Then arrangements must be made about the carrying on of [the farm]3861-the farm and [store]1150-store during [our]1151-our absence . [These]1152-these , together with [my]0-i waggon and oxen , were put in the charge of [Thomaso]163-thomaso , since there was [no one else who could be trusted at all]1153-no one else who could be trusted at all - [a very battered and crestfallen [Thomaso]163-thomaso]1154-a very battered and crestfallen thomaso , by the way . When [he]163-thomaso heard of it [he]163-thomaso was much relieved , since [I]0-i think [he]163-thomaso feared lest [he]163-thomaso also should be expected to take part in the hunt of [the Amahagger man - eaters]1155-the amahagger man - eaters . Also it may have occurred to [him]163-thomaso that in all probability none of [us]1151-our would ever come back at all , in which case by a process of natural devolution , [he]163-thomaso might find [himself]163-thomaso [the owner of the business]1156-the owner of the business and much valuable property . However , [he]163-thomaso swore by [sundry saints]1157-sundry saints - for [Thomaso]163-thomaso was nominally [a Catholic]776-a catholic - that [he]163-thomaso would look after everything as though it were [his]163-thomaso own , as no doubt [he]163-thomaso hoped it might become .

" Hearken , [fat pig]3926-fat pig , "[125-umslopogaas] said [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , [Hans]87-hans obligingly translating so that there might be no mistake , " if [I]87-hans come back , and come back [I]87-hans shall who travel with [the Great Medicine]104-zikali - and find even one of the cattle of [the white lord]3927-the white lord , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [Watcher - by - Night]3383-watcher - by - night , missing , or one article stolen from [his]163-thomaso waggon , or the fields of [[your]3926-fat pig master]3567-your master not cultivated or [his]163-thomaso goods wasted , [I]87-hans swear by the Axe that [I]87-hans will hew [you]3926-fat pig into pieces with the axe ; yes , if to do it [I]87-hans have to hunt [you]3926-fat pig from where the sun rises to where it sets and down the length of the night between . Do [you]3926-fat pig understand , [fat pig]3926-fat pig , deserter of [women]3186-women and [children]3412-children , who to save [yourself]3926-fat pig could run faster than a buck ? "[87-hans]

[Thomaso]163-thomaso replied that [he]163-thomaso understood very clearly indeed , and that , [Heaven]178-heaven helping [him]163-thomaso , all should be kept safe and sound . Still , [I]0-i was sure that in [his]163-thomaso manly heart [he]163-thomaso was promising great gifts to [the saints]3747-the saints if [they]3747-the saints would so arrange matters that [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [his]163-thomaso axe were never seen at [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir again , and reflecting that after all [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas had [their]1160-their uses . However , as [I]0-i did not trust [him]163-thomaso in the least , much against [their]3747-the saints will , [I]0-i left [[my]0-i driver]1161-my driver and [voorlooper]1162-voorlooper to guard [my]0-i belongings .

At last [we]1163-we did get off , pursued by the fervent blessings of [Thomaso]163-thomaso and the prayers of [the others]3164-the others that [we]1163-we would avenge [[their]3747-the saints murdered relatives]1165-their murdered relatives . [We]1163-we were [a curious and motley procession]1166-a curious and motley procession . First went [Hans]87-hans , because at following a spoor [he]87-hans was , [I]0-i believe , almost unequalled in [Africa]10-africa , and with [him]87-hans , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , and three of [[his]87-hans Zulus]931-his zulus to guard against surprise . [These]1168-these were followed by [Captain Robertson]161-robertson , who seemed to prefer to walk alone and whom [I]0-i thought it best to leave undisturbed . Then [I]0-i came and after [me]0-i straggled [the Strathmuir boys]1169-the strathmuir boys with the pack animals , the cavalcade being closed by [the remaining Zulus under the command of [Goroko]168-goroko]1170-the remaining zulus under the command of goroko . [These]179-these walked last in case any of [the mixed - bloods]1171-the mixed - bloods should attempt to desert , as [we]1163-we thought it quite probable that [they]179-these would .

Less than an hour 's tramp brought [us]1163-we to [the bush - veld]948-the bush - veld where [I]0-i feared that [our]1163-we troubles might begin , since if [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas were cunning , [they]179-these would take advantage of it to confuse or hide [their]179-these spoor . As it chanced , however , [they]179-these had done nothing of the sort and [a child]1173-a child could have followed [their]179-these march . Just before nightfall [we]1163-we came to [their]179-these first halting - place where [they]179-these had made a fire and eaten one of the herd of farm goats which [they]179-these had driven away with [them]179-these , although [they]179-these left the cattle , [I]0-i suppose , because goats are docile and travel well .

[Hans]87-hans showed [us]1163-we everything that had happened ; where the chair in which [Inez]164-inez was carried was set down , where [she]164-inez and [Janee]172-janee had been allowed to walk that [she]164-inez might stretch [her]164-inez stiff limbs , the dregs of some coffee that evidently [Janee]172-janee had made in a saucepan , and so forth .

[He]87-hans even told [us]1163-we the exact number of [the Amahagger]1174-the amahagger , which [he]87-hans said totalled forty - one , including [the man whom [Inez]164-inez had wounded]1175-the man whom inez had wounded . [His]87-hans spoor [he]87-hans distinguished from that of the others both by an occasional drop of blood and because [he]87-hans walked lightly on [his]87-hans right foot , doubtless for the reason that [he]87-hans wished to avoid jarring [his]87-hans wound , which was on that side .

At this spot [we]1163-we were obliged to stay till daybreak , since it was impossible to follow the spoor by night , a circumstance that gave [the cannibals]1176-the cannibals a great advantage over [us]1163-we .

The next two days were repetitions of the first , but on the fourth [we]1163-we passed out of [the bush - veld]948-the bush - veld into [the swamp country that bordered [the great river]670-the great river]1178-the swamp country that bordered the great river . Here [our]1163-we task was still easy since [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas had followed one of the paths made by [the river - dwellers who had [[their]1180-the river - dwellers who had their habitations on mounds habitations]1181-their habitations on mounds]1180-the river - dwellers who had their habitations on mounds , though whether these were natural or artificial [I]0-i am not sure , and sometimes on [floating islands]1182-floating islands .

On [our]1163-we second day in [the reeds]3547-the reeds [we]1163-we came upon a sad sight . To [our]1163-we left stood [one of these mound villages , if [a village it could be called]1185-a village it could be called , since [it]1184-one of these mound villages , if a village it could be called , since it consisted only of four or five huts inhabited perhaps by twenty people consisted only of [four or five huts]1186-four or five huts inhabited perhaps by [twenty people]1187-twenty people]1184-one of these mound villages , if a village it could be called , since it consisted only of four or five huts inhabited perhaps by twenty people . [We]1163-we went up to [it]1184-one of these mound villages , if a village it could be called , since it consisted only of four or five huts inhabited perhaps by twenty people to obtain information and stumbled across the body of [an old man lying in the pathway]1188-an old man lying in the pathway . A few yards further on [we]1163-we found the ashes of a big fire and by [it]1184-one of these mound villages , if a village it could be called , since it consisted only of four or five huts inhabited perhaps by twenty people such remains as [we]1163-we had seen at [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir . Here there had been another cannibal feast . [The miserable huts]1189-the miserable huts were empty , but as at [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir , had not been burnt .

[We]1163-we were going away when the acute ears of [Hans]87-hans caught the sound of groans . [We]1163-we searched about and in a clump of reeds near the foot of [the mound]1190-the mound , found [an old woman]1191-an old woman with a great spear wound just above [her]1191-an old woman skinny thigh piercing deep into the vitals , but of a nature which is not immediately mortal . One of [[Robertson]161-robertson 's people who understood the language of [these swamp - dwellers]1193-these swamp - dwellers]1192-robertson 's people who understood the language of these swamp - dwellers well , spoke to [her]1191-an old woman . [She]1191-an old woman told [him]1188-an old man lying in the pathway that [she]1191-an old woman wanted water . It was brought and [she]1191-an old woman drank copiously . Then in answer to [his]1188-an old man lying in the pathway questions [she]1191-an old woman began to talk .

[She]1191-an old woman said that [the Amahagger]1174-the amahagger had attacked [the village]792-the village and killed [all who could not escape]1196-all who could not escape . [They]1174-the amahagger had eaten [a young woman]1197-a young woman and [three children]1198-three children . [She]1191-an old woman had been wounded by a spear and fled away into the place where [we]1199-we found [her]1191-an old woman , where none of [them]1174-the amahagger took the trouble to follow [her]1191-an old woman as [she]1191-an old woman " was not worth eating . "[324-the man]

By [my]0-i direction [the man]324-the man asked [her]1191-an old woman whether [she]1191-an old woman knew anything of [these Amahagger]1201-these amahagger . [She]1191-an old woman replied that [[her]1191-an old woman grandfathers]1202-her grandfathers had , though [she]1191-an old woman had heard nothing of [them]1201-these amahagger since [she]1191-an old woman was [a child]1173-a child , which must have been seventy years before . [They]1201-these amahagger were [a fierce people who lived far up north across [the Great River]36-the great river]1204-a fierce people who lived far up north across the great river , [the remnants of [a race that had once " ruled [the world]277-the world]3933-a race that had once " ruled the world . "[1202-her grandfathers]

[[Her]1191-an old woman grandfathers]1202-her grandfathers used to say that [they]1201-these amahagger were not always [cannibals]1207-cannibals , but had become so long before because of a lack of food and now had acquired the taste . It was for this purpose that [they]1201-these amahagger still raided to get [other people]1208-other people to eat , since [[their]1201-these amahagger ruler]1209-their ruler would not allow [them]1201-these amahagger to eat [one another]1210-one another]1205-the remnants of a race that had once " ruled the world . " her grandfathers used to say that they were not always cannibals , but had become so long before because of a lack of food and now had acquired the taste . it was for this purpose that they still raided to get other people to eat , since their ruler would not allow them to eat one another . The flesh of cattle [they]1201-these amahagger did not care for , although [they]1201-these amahagger had plenty of [them]1211-them , but sometimes [they]1201-these amahagger ate goats and pigs because [they]1201-these amahagger said [they]1201-these amahagger tasted like [man]287-man . According to [[her]1191-an old woman grandfathers]1202-her grandfathers [they]1201-these amahagger were [a very evil people and full of magic]1214-a very evil people and full of magic .

All of this [the old woman]453-the old woman told [us]1216-we quite briskly after [she]453-the old woman had drunk the water , [I]0-i think because [her]453-the old woman wound had mortified and [she]453-the old woman felt no pain . [Her]453-the old woman information , however , as is common with [the aged]1217-the aged , dealt entirely with the far past ; of the history of [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas since the days of [[her]453-the old woman forebears]1218-her forebears [she]453-the old woman knew nothing , nor had [she]453-the old woman seen anything of [Inez]164-inez . All [she]453-the old woman could tell [us]1216-we was that some of [them]1201-these amahagger had attacked [[her]453-the old woman village]1219-her village at dawn and that when [she]453-the old woman ran out of [the hut]380-the hut [she]453-the old woman was speared .

While [Robertson]161-robertson and [I]0-i were wondering what [we]1216-we should do with [the poor old creature whom it seemed cruel to leave here to perish]1221-the poor old creature whom it seemed cruel to leave here to perish , [she]453-the old woman cleared up the question by suddenly expiring before [our]1216-we eyes . Uttering the name of someone with whom , doubtless , [she]453-the old woman had been familiar in [her]453-the old woman youth , three or four times over , [she]453-the old woman just sank down and seemed to go to sleep and on examination [we]1216-we found that [she]453-the old woman was dead . So [we]1216-we left [her]453-the old woman and went on .

Next day [we]1216-we came to [the edge of [the Great River]670-the great river]1222-the edge of the great river , here [a sheet of placid running water about a mile across]1224-a sheet of placid running water about a mile across , for at this time of the year it was low . Perceiving quite [a big village]1225-a big village on [our]1216-we left , [we]1216-we went to [it]1225-a big village and made enquiries , to find that [it]1225-a big village had not been attacked by [the cannibals]1176-the cannibals , probably because it was too powerful , but that three nights before some of [their]1176-the cannibals canoes had been stolen , in which no doubt these had crossed [the river]3345-the river .

As [the people of [this village]1229-this village]1228-the people of this village had traded with [Robertson]161-robertson at [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir , [we]1216-we had no difficulty in obtaining other canoes from [them]1228-the people of this village in which to cross [the Zambesi]11-the zambesi in return for one of [our]1216-we oxen that [I]0-i could see was already sickening from tsetse bite . These canoes were large enough to take the donkeys that were [patient creatures]1230-patient creatures and stood still , but the cattle [we]1216-we could not get into [them]1230-patient creatures for fear of an upset . So [we]1216-we killed the two driven beasts that were left to [us]1216-we and took [them]1230-patient creatures with [us]1216-we as dead meat for food , while the three remaining pack oxen [we]1216-we tried to swim across , dragging [them]1230-patient creatures after the canoes with hide reims round [their]1230-patient creatures horns . As a result two were drowned , but one , [a bold - hearted and enterprising animal]1231-a bold - hearted and enterprising animal , gained the other bank .

Here again [we]1216-we struck [a sea of reeds]1232-a sea of reeds in which , after casting about , [Hans]87-hans once more found [the spoor of [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas]1233-the spoor of the amahagger . That it was theirs beyond doubt was proved by the circumstance that on a thorny kind of weed [we]1216-we found a fragment of a cotton dress which , because of the pattern stamped on it , [we]1216-we all recognised as one that [Inez]164-inez had been wearing . At first [I]0-i thought that this had been torn off by the thorns , but on examination [we]1216-we became certain that it had been placed there purposely , probably by [Janee]172-janee , to give [us]1216-we a clue . This conclusion was confirmed when at subsequent periods of the hunt [we]1216-we found other fragments of the same garment .

Now it would be useless for [me]0-i to set out the details of this prolonged and arduous chase which in all endured for something over three weeks . Again and again [we]1216-we lost the trail and were only able to recover it by long and elaborate search , which occupied much time . Then , after [we]1216-we escaped from [the reeds and swamps]1234-the reeds and swamps , [we]1216-we found [ourselves]1216-we upon [stony uplands where the spoor was almost impossible to follow]1235-stony uplands where the spoor was almost impossible to follow , indeed , [we]1216-we only rediscovered [it]1233-the spoor of the amahagger by stumbling across the dead body of [that cannibal whom [Inez]164-inez had wounded]1236-that cannibal whom inez had wounded . Evidently [he]1236-that cannibal whom inez had wounded had perished from [his]1236-that cannibal whom inez had wounded hurt , which [I]0-i could see had mortified . From the state of [his]1236-that cannibal whom inez had wounded remains [we]1216-we gathered that [the raiders]1237-the raiders must be about two days ' march ahead of [us]1216-we .

Striking [their]1237-the raiders spoor again on softer ground where the impress of [their]1237-the raiders feet remained - at any rate to the cunning sight of [Hans]87-hans - [we]1216-we followed [them]1237-the raiders down across [great valleys wherein trees]1238-great valleys wherein trees grew sparsely , which valleys were separated from each other by [ridges of high and barren land]1239-ridges of high and barren land . On [these belts of rocky soil]1240-these belts of rocky soil [our]1216-we difficulties were great , but here twice [we]1216-we were put on the right track by more fragments torn from the dress of [Inez]164-inez .

At length [we]1216-we lost the spoor altogether ; not a sign of it was to be found . [We]1216-we had no idea which way to go . All about [us]1216-we appeared [these valleys]1241-these valleys covered with scattered bush running this way and that , so that [we]1216-we could not tell which of [them]1241-these valleys to follow or to cross . The thing seemed hopeless , for how could [we]1216-we expect to find a little body of [men in that immensity]1242-men in that immensity ? [Hans]87-hans shook [his]87-hans head and [even the fierce and steadfast Robertson]1243-even the fierce and steadfast robertson was discouraged .

" [I]87-hans fear [[my]87-hans poor lassie]3935-my poor lassie is gone , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans said , and relapsed into brooding as had become [his]87-hans wo nt .

" Never say die ! It 's dogged as does it ! "[0-i] [I]0-i replied cheerfully in the words of [Nelson]180-nelson , who also had learned what it meant to hunt [an enemy]1244-an enemy over [trackless wastes]1245-trackless wastes , although [his]180-nelson were of water .

[I]0-i walked to [the top of the rise where [we]1216-we were encamped]1246-the top of the rise where we were encamped , and sat down alone to think matters over . [Our]1216-we condition was somewhat parlous ; all [our]1216-we beasts were now dead , even [the second donkey , which was the last of them , having perished that morning , and been eaten , for food]1247-the second donkey , which was the last of them , having perished that morning , and been eaten , for food was scanty since of late [we]1216-we had met with little game . [The Strathmuir men , who now must carry the loads]1248-the strathmuir men , who now must carry the loads , were almost worn out and doubtless would have deserted , except for the fact that there was no place to which [they]1248-the strathmuir men , who now must carry the loads could go . Even [the Zulus]101-the zulus were discouraged , and said [they]101-the zulus had come away from [home]1249-home across [the Great River]36-the great river to fight , not to run about in wildernesses and starve , though [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas made no complaint , being buoyed up by the promise of [[his]125-umslopogaas soothsayer]1250-his soothsayer , [Goroko]168-goroko , that battle was ahead of [him]125-umslopogaas in which [he]125-umslopogaas would win great glory .

[Hans]87-hans , however , remained cheerful , for the reason , as [he]87-hans remarked vacuously , that [the Great Medicine]1251-the great medicine was with [us]1216-we and that therefore , however bad things seemed to be , all in fact was well ; an argument that carried no conviction to [my]0-i soul .

It was on a certain evening towards sunset that [I]0-i went away thus alone . [I]0-i looked about [me]0-i , east and west and north . Everywhere appeared [the same bush - clad valleys]1252-the same bush - clad valleys and [barren rises]1253-barren rises , miles upon miles of [them]1252-the same bush - clad valleys . [I]0-i bethought [me]0-i of the map that [old Zikali]104-zikali had drawn in the ashes , and remembered that it showed [these valleys]1241-these valleys and rises and that beyond them there should be [a great swamp]1255-a great swamp , and beyond [the swamp a mountain]1256-the swamp a mountain . So it seemed that [we]1216-we were on the right road to [the home of [[his]104-zikali white Queen]1258-his white queen]1257-the home of his white queen , if [such a person existed]1259-such a person existed , or at any rate [we]1216-we were passing over country similar to that which [he]104-zikali had pictured or imagined .

But at this time [I]0-i was not troubling [my]0-i head about [white queens]1260-white queens . [I]0-i was thinking of poor [Inez]164-inez . That [she]164-inez was alive a few days before [we]1216-we knew from the fragments of [her]164-inez dress . But where was [she]164-inez now ? [The spoor]1261-the spoor was utterly lost on that stony ground , or if any traces of it remained a heavy deluge of rain had washed them away . Even [Hans]87-hans had confessed [himself]87-hans beaten .

[I]0-i stared about [me]0-i helplessly , and as [I]0-i did so a flying ray of light from the setting sun reflected downwards from a storm - cloud , fell upon [a white patch on the crest of one of [the distant land - waves]1263-the distant land - waves]1262-a white patch on the crest of one of the distant land - waves . It struck [me]0-i that probably limestone outcropped at [this spot]626-this spot , as indeed proved to be the case ; also that such a patch of white would be a convenient guide for any who were travelling across [that sea of bush]1265-that sea of bush . Further , some instinct within seemed to impel [me]0-i to steer for it , although [I]0-i had all but made up [my]0-i mind to go in a totally different direction many more points to the east . It was almost as though a voice were calling to [me]0-i to take this path and no other . Doubtless this was an effect produced by weariness and mental overstrain . Still , there it was , very real and tangible , one that [I]0-i did not attempt to combat .

So next morning at the dawn [I]0-i headed north by west , laying [my]0-i course for [that white patch]1266-that white patch and for the first time breaking the straight line of [our]1267-our advance . [Captain Robertson]161-robertson , whose temper had not been bettered by prolonged and frightful anxiety , or [I]0-i may add , by [his]161-robertson unaccustomed abstinence , asked [me]0-i rather roughly why [I]0-i was altering the course .

" Look here , [Captain]3670-captain , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " if [we]1267-our were at [sea]3204-sea and [you]161-robertson did something of the sort , [I]0-i should not put such a question to [you]161-robertson , and if by any chance [I]0-i did , [I]0-i should not expect [you]161-robertson to answer . Well , by [your]161-robertson own wish [I]0-i am in command here and [I]0-i think that the same argument holds . "[0-i]

" Yes , "[161-robertson] [he]161-robertson replied . " [I]161-robertson suppose [you]161-robertson have studied [your]161-robertson chart , if there is any of [this God - forsaken country]3938-this god - forsaken country , and at any rate discipline is discipline . So steam ahead and do n't mind [me]161-robertson . "[161-robertson]

[The others]3164-the others accepted [my]0-i decision without comment ; [most of [them]3164-the others]1269-most of them were so miserable that [they]3164-the others did not care which way [we]1270-we went , also [they]3164-the others were good enough to repose confidence in [my]0-i judgment .

" Doubtless [the Baas]121-baas has reasons , "[87-hans] said [Hans]87-hans dubiously , " although [the spoor]1261-the spoor , when last [we]1270-we saw it , headed towards the rising sun and as [the country]3362-the country is all the same , [I]87-hans do not see why [those man - eaters]3941-those man - eaters should have returned . "[87-hans]
