" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [I]0-i have reasons , "[0-i] although in fact [I]0-i had none at all .

[Hans]87-hans surveyed [me]0-i with a watery eye as though waiting for [me]0-i to explain them , but [I]0-i looked haughty and declined to oblige .

" [The Baas]121-baas has reasons , "[87-hans] continued [Hans]87-hans , " for taking [us]1270-we on what [I]87-hans think to be [the wrong side of [that great ridge]3943-that great ridge]3942-the wrong side of that great ridge , there to hunt for the spoor of [the men - eaters]3918-the men - eaters , and [they]3918-the men - eaters are so deep down in [his]87-hans mind that [he]87-hans can not dig them up for poor old [Hans]87-hans to look at . Well , [the Baas]3945-the baas wears the Great Medicine and perhaps it is there that the reasons sit . [Those Strathmuir fellows]3946-those strathmuir fellows say that [they]3946-those strathmuir fellows can go no further and wish to die . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas has just gone to [them]3946-those strathmuir fellows with [his]125-umslopogaas axe to tell [them]3946-those strathmuir fellows that [he]125-umslopogaas is ready to help [them]3946-those strathmuir fellows to [their]3946-those strathmuir fellows wish . Look , [he]125-umslopogaas has got [there]3196-there , for [they]3946-those strathmuir fellows are coming quickly , who after all prefer to live . "[87-hans]

Well , [we]1271-we started for [my]0-i white patch of stones which [no one else]3137-no one else had noticed and of which [I]0-i said nothing to [anyone]281-anyone , and reached it by the following evening , to find , as [I]0-i expected , that it was a lime outcrop .

By now [we]1271-we were in a poor way , for [we]1271-we had practically nothing left to eat , which did not tend to raise the spirits of [the party]1274-the party . Also that lime outcrop proved to be an uninteresting spot overlooking [a wide valley]1275-a wide valley which seemed to suggest that there were [other valleys of a similar sort beyond]1276-other valleys of a similar sort beyond [it]1275-a wide valley , and nothing more .

[Captain Robertson]161-robertson sat stern - faced and despondent at a distance muttering into [his]161-robertson beard , as had become a habit with [him]161-robertson . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas leaned upon [his]125-umslopogaas axe and contemplated the heavens , also occasionally [the Strathmuir men who cowered beneath [his]125-umslopogaas eye]1277-the strathmuir men who cowered beneath his eye . [The Zulus]101-the zulus squatted about sharing such snuff as remained to [them]101-the zulus in economic pinches . [Goroko]168-goroko , [the witch - doctor]907-the witch - doctor , engaged [himself]168-goroko in consulting [his]168-goroko " Spirit , "[907-the witch - doctor] by means of bone - throwing , upon the humble subject of whether or no [we]1271-we should succeed in killing any game for food to - morrow , a point on which [I]0-i gathered that [his]168-goroko " Spirit "[87-hans] was quite uncertain . In short , the gloom was deep and universal and the sky looked as though it were going to rain .

[Hans]87-hans became sarcastic . Sneaking up to [me]0-i in [his]87-hans most aggravating way , like [a dog that means to steal something and cover up the theft]1279-a dog that means to steal something and cover up the theft with simulated affection , [he]87-hans pointed out one by one all the disadvantages of [our]1271-we present position . [He]87-hans indicated per contra , that if [his]87-hans advice had been followed , [his]87-hans conviction was that even if [we]1271-we had not found [the man - eaters]1280-the man - eaters and rescued [the lady called [Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes]1281-the lady called sad - eyes , [our]1271-we state would have been quite different . [He]87-hans was sure , [he]87-hans added , that [the valley which [he]87-hans had suggested [we]1271-we should follow]1282-the valley which he had suggested we should follow , was one full of game , inasmuch as [he]87-hans had seen [their]1283-their spoor at [its]1282-the valley which he had suggested we should follow entrance .

" Then why did [you]87-hans not say so ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

[Hans]87-hans sucked at [his]87-hans empty corn - cob pipe , which was [his]87-hans way of indicating that [he]87-hans would like [me]0-i to give [him]87-hans some tobacco , much as a dog groans heavily under the table when [he]87-hans wants a bit to eat , and answered that it was not for [him]87-hans to point out things to one who knew everything , like [the great Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , Watcher - by - Night , [[his]87-hans honoured master]1284-his honoured master . Still , the luck did seem to have gone a bit wrong . The privations could have been put up with here [he]87-hans sucked very loudly at the empty pipe and looked at [mine]0-i , which was alight , everything could have been put up with , if only there had been a chance of coming even with [those men - eaters]1285-those men - eaters and rescuing [the Lady Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes , whose face haunted [his]87-hans sleep . As it was , however , [he]87-hans was convinced that by following the course [I]0-i had mapped out [we]1286-we had lost [their]1285-those men - eaters spoor finally and that probably [they]1285-those men - eaters were now three days ' march away in another direction . Still , [the Baas]121-baas had said that [he]87-hans had [his]87-hans reasons , and that of course was enough for [him]87-hans , [Hans]87-hans , only if [the Baas]121-baas would condescend to tell [him]87-hans , [he]87-hans would as a matter of curiosity like to know what the reasons were .

At that moment [I]0-i confess that , much as [I]0-i was attached to [him]87-hans , [I]0-i should have liked to murder [Hans]87-hans , who , [I]0-i felt , believing that [he]87-hans had [me]0-i " on toast , "[87-hans] to use a vulgar phrase , was taking advantage of [my]0-i position to make a mock of [me]0-i in [his]87-hans sly , Hottentot way .

[I]0-i tried to continue to look grand , but felt that the attitude did not impress . Then [I]0-i stared about [me]0-i as though taking counsel with [the Heavens]181-the heavens , devoutly hoping that [the Heavens]181-the heavens would respond to [my]0-i mute appeal . As a matter of fact [they]181-the heavens did .

" There is [my]0-i reason , [Hans]87-hans , "[0-i] [I]0-i said in [my]0-i most icy voice , and [I]0-i pointed to a faint line of smoke rising against the twilight sky on [the further side of [the intervening valley]1288-the intervening valley]1287-the further side of the intervening valley .

" [You]87-hans will perceive , [Hans]87-hans , "[0-i] [I]0-i added , " that [those Amahagger cannibals]3948-those amahagger cannibals have forgotten [their]3948-those amahagger cannibals caution and lit a fire yonder , which [they]3948-those amahagger cannibals have not done for a long time . Perhaps [you]87-hans would like to know why this has happened . If so [I]0-i will tell [you]87-hans . It is because for some days past [I]0-i have purposely lost [their]3948-those amahagger cannibals spoor , which [they]3948-those amahagger cannibals knew [we]3949-us were following , and lit fires to puzzle [them]3948-those amahagger cannibals . Now , thinking that [they]3948-those amahagger cannibals have done with [us]3949-us , [they]3948-those amahagger cannibals have become incautious and shown [us]3949-us where [they]3948-those amahagger cannibals are . That is [my]0-i reason , [Hans]87-hans . "[0-i]

[He]1289-he heard and , although of course [he]1289-he did not believe that [I]0-i had lost the spoor on purpose , stared at [me]0-i till [I]0-i thought [his]1289-he little eyes were going to drop out of [his]1289-he head . But even in [his]1289-he admiration [he]1289-he contrived to convey an insult as only [a native]1290-a native can .

" How wonderful is [the Great Medicine of [the Opener - of - Roads]3230-the opener - of - roads]3562-the great medicine of the opener - of - roads , that it should have been able thus to instruct [the Baas]121-baas , "[1289-he] [he]1289-he said . " Without doubt the Great Medicine is right and yonder [those men - eaters]1285-those men - eaters are encamped , who might just as well as have been anywhere else within a hundred miles . "[1289-he]

" [Drat the Great Medicine]182-drat the great medicine , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied , but beneath [my]0-i breath , then added aloud ,

" Be so good , [Hans]87-hans , as to go to [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and to tell [him]125-umslopogaas that [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , or [the Great Medicine]1251-the great medicine , proposes to march at once to attack [the camp of [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas]3954-the camp of the amahagger , and - here is some tobacco . "[0-i]

" Yes , [Baas]121-baas , "[1289-he] answered [Hans]87-hans humbly , as [he]1289-he snatched the tobacco and wriggled away like a worm .

Then [I]0-i went to talk with [Robertson]161-robertson .

The end of it was that within an hour [we]1291-we were creeping across [that valley]1292-that valley towards [the spot where [I]0-i had seen the line of smoke rising against the twilight sky]1293-the spot where i had seen the line of smoke rising against the twilight sky .

Somewhere about midnight [we]1291-we reached [the neighbourhood of [this place]3445-this place]1294-the neighbourhood of this place . How near or how far [we]1291-we were from [it]3445-this place , [we]1291-we could not tell since the moon was invisible , as of course the smoke was in the dark . Now the question was , what should [we]1291-we do ?

Obviously there would be enormous advantages in a night attack , or at least in locating [the enemy]1296-the enemy , so that it might be carried out at dawn before [he]1296-the enemy marched . Especially was this so , since [we]1291-we were scarcely in a condition even if [we]1291-we could come face to face with [them]1296-the enemy , to fight [these savages]1297-these savages when [they]1296-the enemy were prepared and in the light of day . Only [we]1291-we two white men , with [Hans]87-hans , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [[his]87-hans Zulus]931-his zulus , could be relied upon in such a case , since [the Strathmuir mixed - bloods]1299-the strathmuir mixed - bloods had become entirely demoralised and were not to be trusted at a pinch . Indeed , tired and half starving as [we]1291-we were , none of [us]1291-we was at [his]87-hans best . Therefore a surprise seemed [our]1291-we only chance . But first [we]1291-we must find those whom [we]1291-we wished to surprise .

Ultimately , after a hurried consultation , it was agreed that [Hans]87-hans and [I]0-i should go forward and see if [we]1291-we could locate [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas . [Robertson]161-robertson wished to come too , but [I]0-i pointed out that [he]161-robertson must remain to look after [[his]161-robertson people]3358-his people , who , if [he]161-robertson left [them]3358-his people , might take the opportunity to melt away in the darkness , especially as [they]3358-his people knew that heavy fighting was at hand . Also if anything happened to [me]0-i it was desirable that [one white man]1301-one white man should remain to lead [the party]1274-the party . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , too , volunteered , but knowing [his]87-hans character , [I]0-i declined [his]87-hans help . To tell the truth , [I]0-i was almost certain that if [we]1291-we came upon [the men - eaters]3918-the men - eaters , [he]87-hans would charge the whole lot of [them]3918-the men - eaters and accomplish a fine but futile end after hacking down a number of [cannibal barbarians , whose extinction or escape]1304-cannibal barbarians , whose extinction or escape remained absolutely immaterial to [our]1291-we purpose , namely , the rescue of [Inez]164-inez .

So it came about that [Hans]87-hans and [I]0-i started alone , [I]0-i not at all enjoying the job . [I]0-i suppose that there lurks in [my]0-i nature some of that primeval terror of the dark , which must continually have haunted [[our]1291-we remote forefathers]1305-our remote forefathers of [a hundred or a thousand generations]1306-a hundred or a thousand generations gone and still lingers in the blood of [most of [us]1291-we]1307-most of us . At any rate even if [I]0-i am named [the Watcher - by - Night]1308-the watcher - by - night , greatly do [I]0-i prefer to fight or to face peril in the sunlight , though it is true that [I]0-i would rather avoid both at any time .

In fact , [I]0-i wished heartily that [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas were at [the other side of [Africa]10-africa]1309-the other side of africa , or in [heaven]1310-heaven , and that [I]0-i , completely ignorant of [the person called [Inez Robertson]159-inez]1311-the person called inez robertson , were seated smoking the pipe of peace on [[my]0-i own stoep in [Durban]3-durban]1312-my own stoep in durban . [I]0-i think that [Hans]87-hans guessed [my]0-i state of mind , since [he]87-hans suggested that [he]87-hans should go alone , adding with [his]87-hans usual unveiled rudeness , that [he]87-hans was quite certain that [he]87-hans would do much better without [me]0-i , since [white men]3143-white men always made a noise .

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied , determined to give [him]87-hans a Roland for [[his]87-hans Oliver]1314-his oliver , " [I]0-i have no doubt [you]87-hans would - under [the first bush [you]87-hans came across]3955-the first bush you came across , where [you]87-hans would sleep till dawn , and then return and say that [you]87-hans could not find [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas . "[0-i]

[Hans]87-hans chuckled , quite appreciating the joke , and having thus mutually affronted [each other]3176-each other , [we]1316-we started on [our]1316-we quest .

CHAPTER IX

THE SWAMP

Neither [Hans]87-hans nor [I]0-i carried rifles that [we]1316-we knew would be in the way on [our]1316-we business , which was just to scout . Moreover , one is always tempted to shoot if a gun is at hand , and this [I]0-i did not want to do at present . So , although [I]0-i had [my]0-i revolver in case of urgent necessity , [my]0-i only other weapon was a Zulu axe , that formerly had belonged to [one of [those two men who died defending [Inez]159-inez on the veranda at [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir]1318-those two men who died defending inez on the veranda at strathmuir]1317-one of those two men who died defending inez on the veranda at strathmuir , while [Hans]87-hans had nothing but [his]87-hans long knife . Thus armed , or unarmed , [we]1316-we crept forward towards that spot whence , as [we]1316-we conjectured , [we]1316-we had seen the line of smoke rising some hours before .

For about a quarter of a mile [we]1316-we went on thus without seeing or hearing anything , and a difficult job it was in that gloom among the scattered trees with no light save such as the stars gave [us]1316-we . Indeed , [I]0-i was about to suggest that [we]1316-we had better abandon the enterprise until daybreak when [Hans]87-hans nudged [me]0-i , whispering ,

" Look to the right between those twin thorns . "[87-hans]

[I]0-i obeyed and following the line of sight which [he]87-hans had indicated , perceived , at a distance of about two hundred yards a faint glow , so faint indeed that [I]0-i think only [Hans]87-hans would have noticed it . Really it might have been nothing more than the phosphorescence rising from a heap of fungus , or even from a decaying animal .

" The fire of which [we]1316-we saw the smoke that has burnt to ashes , "[87-hans] whispered [Hans]87-hans again . " [I]87-hans think that [they]3956-they have gone , but let [us]1316-we look . "[87-hans]

So [we]1316-we crawled forward very cautiously to avoid making the slightest noise ; so cautiously , indeed , that it must have taken [us]1316-we nearly half an hour to cover those two hundred yards .

At length [we]1316-we were within about forty yards of that dying fire and , afraid to go further , came to a stand - or rather , a lie - still - behind some bushes until [we]1316-we knew more . [Hans]87-hans lifted [his]87-hans head and sniffed with [his]87-hans broad nostrils ; then [he]87-hans whispered into [my]0-i ear , but so low that [I]0-i could scarcely hear [him]87-hans .

" Amahagger there all right , [Baas]121-baas , [I]87-hans smell them . "[87-hans]

This of course was possible , since what wind there was blew from the direction of the fire , although [I]0-i whose nose is fairly keen could smell nothing at all . So [I]0-i determined to wait and watch a while , and indicated [my]0-i decision to [Hans]87-hans , who , considering [our]1316-we purpose accomplished , showed signs of wishing to retreat .

Some minutes [we]1316-we lay thus , till of a sudden this happened . A [branch of resinous wood of which the stem had been eaten through by the flames , fell upon the ashes of the fire and burnt up with a brilliant light]1319-branch of resinous wood of which the stem had been eaten through by the flames , fell upon the ashes of the fire and burnt up with a brilliant light . In it [we]1316-we saw that [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas were sleeping in a circle round the fire wrapped in [their]1320-their blankets .

Also [we]1316-we saw another thing , namely that nearer to [us]1316-we , not more than a dozen yards away , indeed , was [a kind of little tent , also made of fur rugs or blankets , which doubtless sheltered [Inez]159-inez]1321-a kind of little tent , also made of fur rugs or blankets , which doubtless sheltered inez . Indeed , this was evident from the fact that at the mouth of it , wrapped up in something , lay none other than [[her]159-inez maid]1322-her maid , [Janee]172-janee , for [her]172-janee face being towards [us]1316-we , was recognised by [us]1316-we both in the flare of the flaming branch . One more thing [we]1316-we noted , namely , that two of [the cannibals]1176-the cannibals , evidently [a guard]1324-a guard , were sleeping between [us]1316-we and [the little tent]1325-the little tent . Of course [they]1326-they ought to have been awake , but fatigue had overcome [them]1326-they and there [they]1326-they slumbered , seated on the ground , [their]1326-they heads hanging forward almost upon [their]1326-they knees .

An idea came to [me]0-i . If [we]1316-we could kill [those men]3755-those men without waking [the others]3164-the others in that gloom , it might be possible to rescue [Inez]159-inez at once . Rapidly [I]0-i weighed the pros and cons of such an attempt . Its advantages , if successful , were that the object of [our]1316-we pursuit would be carried through without further trouble and that it was most doubtful whether [we]1316-we should ever get such a chance again . If [we]1316-we returned to fetch [the others]3164-the others and attacked in force , the probability was that those [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas , or [one of [them]3164-the others]3281-one of them , would hear some sound made by the advance of [a number of men]1331-a number of men , and fly into the darkness ; or , rather than lose [Inez]159-inez , [they]3164-the others might kill [her]159-inez . Or if [they]3164-the others stood and fought , [she]159-inez might be slain in the scrimmage . Or , as after all [we]1316-we had only about a dozen effectives , for [the Strathmuir bearers]1332-the strathmuir bearers could not be relied upon , [they]1332-the strathmuir bearers might defeat and kill [us]1316-we whom [they]1332-the strathmuir bearers outnumbered by two or three to one .

These were the arguments for the attempt . Those for not making it were equally obvious . To begin with it was one of extraordinary risk ; [the two guards]1333-the two guards or [someone else behind]1334-someone else behind [them]3164-the others might wake up - for [such people]852-such people , like dogs , mostly sleep with one eye open , especially when [they]852-such people knew that [they]852-such people are being pursued . Or if [they]852-such people did not [we]1316-we might bungle the business so that [they]852-such people raised an outcry before [they]852-such people grew silent for ever , in which case both of [us]1316-we and perhaps [Inez]159-inez also would probably pay the penalty before [we]1316-we could get away .

Such was the horned dilemma upon one point or other of which [we]1316-we ran the risk of being impaled . For a full minute or more [I]0-i considered the matter with an earnestness almost amounting to mental agony , and at last all but came to the conclusion that the danger was too enormous . It would be better , notwithstanding the many disadvantages of that plan , to go back and fetch the others .

But then it was that [I]0-i made one of [my]0-i many mistakes in life . Most of [us]1316-we do more foolish things than [wise ones]1336-wise ones and sometimes [I]0-i think that in spite of a certain reputation for caution and far - sightedness , [I]0-i am exceptionally cursed in this respect . Indeed , when [I]0-i look back upon [my]0-i past , [I]0-i can scarcely see the scanty flowers of wisdom that decorate its path because of the fat , ugly trees of error by which it is overshadowed .

On that occasion , forgetting past experiences where [Hans]87-hans was concerned , [my]0-i natural tendency to blunder took the form of relying upon [another]1337-another 's judgment instead of on [my]0-i own . Although [I]0-i had formed a certain view as to what should be done , the pros and cons seemed so evenly balanced that [I]0-i determined to consult [the little Hottentot]1338-the little hottentot and accept [his]1338-the little hottentot verdict . This , after all , was but a form of gambling like pitch and toss , since , although it is true [Hans]87-hans was a clever , or at any rate [a cunning man according to [his]87-hans lights]1339-a cunning man according to his lights , and experienced , it meant that [I]0-i was placing [my]0-i own judgment in abeyance , which [no one considering a life - and - death enterprise]1340-no one considering a life - and - death enterprise should do , taking the chance of that of another , whatever it might be . However , not for the first time , [I]0-i did so - to [my]0-i grief .

In the tiniest of whispers with [my]0-i lips right against [his]87-hans smelly head , [I]0-i submitted the problem to [Hans]87-hans , asking [him]87-hans what [we]1341-we should do , go on or go back . [He]87-hans considered a while , then answered in a voice which [he]87-hans contrived to make like the drone of a night beetle .

" [Those men]3755-those men are fast asleep , [I]87-hans know it by [their]3755-those men breathing . Also [the Baas]121-baas has the Great Medicine . Therefore [I]87-hans say go on , kill [them]3755-those men and rescue [Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes . "[87-hans]

Now [I]0-i saw that the Fates to which [I]0-i had appealed had decided against [me]0-i and that [I]0-i must accept [their]1342-their decree . With a sick and sinking heart - for [I]0-i did not at all like the business - [I]0-i wondered for a moment what had led [Hans]87-hans to take this view , which was directly opposite to any [I]0-i had expected from [him]87-hans . Of course [his]87-hans superstition about the Great Medicine had something to do with it , but [I]0-i felt convinced that this was not all .

Even then [I]0-i guessed that two arguments appealed to [him]87-hans , of which the first was that [he]87-hans desired , if possible , to put an end to this intolerable and unceasing hunt which had worn [us]1343-we all out , no matter what that end might be . [The second and more powerful]1344-the second and more powerful , however , was , [I]0-i believed , and rightly , that the idea of [this stealthy , midnight blow]1345-this stealthy , midnight blow appealed irresistibly to the craft of [his]87-hans half - wild nature in which the strains of the leopard and the snake seemed to mingle with that of [the human being]1346-the human being . For be it remembered that notwithstanding [his]87-hans veneer of civilisation , [Hans]87-hans was [a savage whose forefathers for countless ages]1347-a savage whose forefathers for countless ages had preserved [themselves]1342-their alive by means of such attacks and stratagems .

The die having been cast , in the same infinitesimal whispers [we]1343-we made [our]1343-we arrangements , which were few and simple . [They]1348-they amounted to this - that [we]1343-we were to creep on to [the men]3805-the men and each of [us]1343-we to kill [that one who was opposite to [him]87-hans]1350-that one who was opposite to him , [I]0-i with the axe and [Hans]87-hans with [his]87-hans knife , remembering that it must be done with a single stroke - that is , if [they]3805-the men did not wake up and kill [us]1343-we - after which [we]1343-we were to get [Inez]159-inez out of [her]159-inez shelter , dressed or undressed , and make off with [her]159-inez into the darkness where [we]1343-we were pretty sure of being able to baffle pursuit until [we]1343-we reached [[our]1343-we own camp]1351-our own camp .

Provided that [we]1343-we could kill [the two guards]1333-the two guards in the proper fashion - rather a large proviso , [I]0-i admit - the thing was simple as shelling peas which , notwithstanding the proverb , in [my]0-i experience is not simple at all , since generally the shells crack the wrong way and at least one of the peas remained in the pod . So it happened in this case , for [Janee]172-janee , whom [we]1343-we had both forgotten , remained in [the pod]1353-the pod .

[I]0-i am sure [I]0-i do n't know why [we]1343-we overlooked [her]172-janee ; indeed , the error was inexcusable , especially as [Hans]87-hans had already experienced [her]172-janee foolishness and [she]172-janee was lying there before [our]1343-we eyes . [I]0-i suppose that [our]1343-we minds were so concentrated upon the guard - killing and the tragic and impressive [Inez]159-inez that there was no room in [them]1354-them for [the stolid and matter - of - fact Janee]1355-the stolid and matter - of - fact janee . At any rate [she]172-janee proved to be the pea that would not come out of [the pod]1353-the pod .

Often in [my]0-i life [I]0-i have felt terrified , not being by nature [one of those who rejoices in dangers and wild adventures for [their]1358-them own sake , which only [the stupid]1359-the stupid do , but who has , on the contrary , been forced to undertake [them]1358-them by the pressure of circumstances , a kind of hydraulic force that [no one]3323-no one can resist , and who , having undertaken , has been carried through [them]1358-them , triumphing over the shrinkings of [his]1361-his flesh by some secret reserve of nerve power]1357-one of those who rejoices in dangers and wild adventures for their own sake , which only the stupid do , but who has , on the contrary , been forced to undertake them by the pressure of circumstances , a kind of hydraulic force that no one can resist , and who , having undertaken , has been carried through them , triumphing over the shrinkings of his flesh by some secret reserve of nerve power . Almost am [I]0-i tempted to call it spirit - power , something that lives beyond and yet inspires [our]1343-we frail and fallible bodies .

Well , rarely have [I]0-i been more frightened than [I]0-i was at this moment . Actually [I]0-i hung back until [I]0-i saw that [Hans]87-hans slithering through the grass like a thick yellow snake with the great knife in [his]87-hans right hand , was quite a foot ahead of [me]0-i . Then [my]0-i pride came to the rescue and [I]0-i spurted , if one can spurt upon one 's stomach , and drew level with [him]87-hans . After this [we]1343-we went at a pace so slow that [any able - bodied snail]1362-any able - bodied snail would have left [us]1343-we standing still . Inch by inch [we]1343-we crept forward , lying motionless a while after each convulsive movement , once for quite a long time , since [the left - hand cannibal]1363-the left - hand cannibal seemed about to wake up , for [he]1363-the left - hand cannibal opened [his]1363-the left - hand cannibal mouth and yawned . If so , [he]1363-the left - hand cannibal changed [his]1363-the left - hand cannibal mind and rolling from a sitting posture on to [his]1363-the left - hand cannibal side , went to sleep much more soundly than before .

A minute or so later [the right - hand ruffian]1364-the right - hand ruffian , [[my]0-i man]1365-my man , also stirred , so sharply that [I]0-i thought [he]1364-the right - hand ruffian had heard something . Apparently , however , [he]1364-the right - hand ruffian was only haunted by dreams resulting from an evil life , or perhaps by the prescience of its end , for after waving [his]1364-the right - hand ruffian arm and muttering something in a frightened voice , [he]1364-the right - hand ruffian too , wearied out , [poor devil]1366-poor devil , sank back into sleep .

At last [we]1343-we were on [them]1367-them , but paused because [we]1343-we could not see exactly where to strike and knew , each of [us]1343-we , that [our]1343-we first blow must be the last and fatal . A cloud had come up and dimmed what light there was , and [we]1343-we must wait for it to pass . It was a long wait , or so it seemed .

At length that cloud did pass and in faint outline [I]0-i saw the classical head of [my]0-i Amahagger bowed in deep sleep . With a heart beating as it does only in the fierce extremities of love or war , [I]0-i hissed like a snake , which was [our]1343-we agreed signal . Then rising to [my]0-i knees , [I]0-i lifted the Zulu axe and struck with all [my]0-i strength .

The blow was straight and true ; [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas [himself]125-umslopogaas could not have dealt a better . [The victim in front of [me]0-i]1368-the victim in front of me uttered no sound and made no movement ; only sank gently on to [his]125-umslopogaas side , and there lay as dead as though [he]125-umslopogaas had never been born .

It appeared that [Hans]87-hans had done equally well , since [the other man]1369-the other man kicked out [his]87-hans long legs , which struck [me]0-i on the knees . Then [he]87-hans also became strangely still . In short , [both of [them]1370-both of them]1370-both of them were stone dead and would tell no stories this side of Judgment Day .

Recovering [my]0-i axe , which had been wrenched from [my]0-i hand , [I]0-i crept forward and opened the curtain - like rugs or blankets , [I]0-i do not know which they were , that covered [Inez]159-inez . [I]0-i heard [her]159-inez stir at once . The movement had wakened [her]159-inez , since [captives]1371-captives sleep lightly .

" Make no noise , [Inez]159-inez , "[0-i] [I]0-i whispered . " It is [I]0-i , [Allan Quatermain]83-allan , come to rescue [you]159-inez . Slip out and follow [me]0-i ; do [you]159-inez understand ? "[0-i]

" Yes , quite , "[159-inez] [she]159-inez whispered back and began to rise .

At this moment a blood - curdling yell seemed to fill [earth]346-earth and heaven , a yell at the memory of which even now [I]0-i feel faint , although [I]0-i am writing years after its echoes died away .

[I]0-i may as well say at once that it came from [Janee]172-janee who , awaking suddenly , had perceived against the background of the sky , [Hans]87-hans standing over [her]172-janee , looking like a yellow devil with a long knife in [his]87-hans hand , which [she]172-janee thought was about to be used to murder [her]172-janee .

So , lacking self - restraint , [she]172-janee screamed in the most lusty fashion , for [her]172-janee lungs were excellent , and - the game was up .

Instantly [every man sleeping round the fire]1373-every man sleeping round the fire leapt to [his]1373-every man sleeping round the fire feet and rushed in the direction of the echoes of [Janee]172-janee 's yell . It was impossible to get [Inez]159-inez free of [[her]159-inez tent]1374-her tent arrangement or to do anything , except whisper to [her]159-inez ,

" Feign sleep and know nothing . [We]1375-we will follow [you]159-inez . [[Your]159-inez father]3624-your father is with [us]1375-we . "[159-inez]

Then [I]0-i bolted back into the bushes , which [Hans]87-hans had reached already .

A minute or two later when [we]1375-we were clear of the hubbub and nearing [[our]1375-we own camp]1351-our own camp , [Hans]87-hans remarked to [me]0-i sententiously ,

" [The Great Medicine]1251-the great medicine worked well , [Baas]121-baas , but not quite well enough , for what medicine can avail against [a woman]3331-a woman 's folly ? "[87-hans]

" It was [our]1375-we own folly [we]1375-we should blame , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " [We]1375-we ought to have known that [fool - girl]3961-fool - girl would shriek , and taken precautions . "[0-i]

" Yes , [Baas]121-baas , [we]1375-we ought to have killed [her]3961-fool - girl too , for nothing else would have kept [her]3961-fool - girl quiet , "[87-hans] replied [Hans]87-hans in cheerful assent . " Now [we]1375-we shall have to pay for [our]1375-we mistake , for the hunt must go on . "[87-hans]

At this moment [we]1375-we stumbled across [Robertson]159-inez and [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas who , with the others , and [every living thing within a mile or two]1377-every living thing within a mile or two had also heard [Janee]172-janee 's yell , and briefly told [our]1375-we story . When [he]1378-he learned how near [we]1375-we had been to rescuing [[his]1378-he daughter]778-his daughter , [Robertson]159-inez groaned , but [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas only said ,

" Well , there are two less of [the men - eaters left to deal with]3962-the men - eaters left to deal with . Still , for once [your]0-i wisdom failed [you]0-i , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . When [you]0-i had found [the camp]3963-the camp [you]0-i should have returned , so that [we]1375-we might all attack [it]3963-the camp together . Had [we]1375-we done so , before the dawn there would not have been one of [them]3962-the men - eaters left to deal with left . "[125-umslopogaas]

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " [I]0-i think that [my]0-i wisdom did fail [me]0-i , if [I]0-i have any to fail . But come ; perhaps [we]1380-we may catch [them]3962-the men - eaters left to deal with yet . "[0-i]

So [we]1380-we advanced , [Hans]87-hans and [I]0-i showing [the road]3133-the road . But when [we]1380-we reached [the place]328-the place it was too late , for all that remained of [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas , or of [Inez]159-inez and [Janee]172-janee , were [the two dead men whom [we]1380-we had killed]1383-the two dead men whom we had killed , and in that darkness pursuit was impossible . So [we]1380-we went back to [[our]1380-we own camp]1351-our own camp to rest and await the dawn before taking up [the trail]3894-the trail , only to find [ourselves]1380-we confronted with a new trouble . [All the Strathmuir half - breeds whom [we]1380-we had left behind as useless]1386-all the strathmuir half - breeds whom we had left behind as useless , had taken advantage of [our]1380-we absence and that of [the Zulus]101-the zulus , to desert . [They]1386-all the strathmuir half - breeds whom we had left behind as useless had just bolted back upon [our]1380-we tracks and vanished into [the sea of bush]1387-the sea of bush . What became of [them]1386-all the strathmuir half - breeds whom we had left behind as useless [I]0-i do not know , as [we]1380-we never saw [them]1386-all the strathmuir half - breeds whom we had left behind as useless again , but [my]0-i belief is that [these cowardly fellows]1388-these cowardly fellows all perished , for certainly not one of [them]1386-all the strathmuir half - breeds whom we had left behind as useless reached [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir .

Fortunately for [us]1380-we , however , [they]1386-all the strathmuir half - breeds whom we had left behind as useless departed in such a hurry that [they]1386-all the strathmuir half - breeds whom we had left behind as useless left all [their]1386-all the strathmuir half - breeds whom we had left behind as useless loads behind [them]1386-all the strathmuir half - breeds whom we had left behind as useless , and even some of the guns [they]1386-all the strathmuir half - breeds whom we had left behind as useless carried . Evidently [Janee]172-janee 's yell was the last straw which broke the back of such nerve as remained to [them]1386-all the strathmuir half - breeds whom we had left behind as useless . Doubtless [they]1386-all the strathmuir half - breeds whom we had left behind as useless believed it to be the signal of attack by hordes of [cannibals]1207-cannibals .

As there was nothing to said or done , since any pursuit of [these curs]1390-these curs was out of the question , [we]1380-we made the best of things as they were . It proved a simple business . From the loads [we]1380-we selected such articles as were essential , ammunition for the most part , to carry [ourselves]1380-we - and the rest [we]1380-we abandoned , hiding it under a pile of stones in case [we]1380-we should ever come that way again .

The guns [they]1386-all the strathmuir half - breeds whom we had left behind as useless had thrown aside [we]1380-we distributed among [the Zulus who had none]1391-the zulus who had none , though the thought that [they]1386-all the strathmuir half - breeds whom we had left behind as useless possessed them , so far as [I]0-i was concerned , added another terror to life . The prospect of going into battle with [those wild axemen]1392-those wild axemen letting off bullets in every direction was not pleasant , but fortunately when that crisis came , [they]1386-all the strathmuir half - breeds whom we had left behind as useless cast them away and reverted to the weapons to which [they]1386-all the strathmuir half - breeds whom we had left behind as useless were accustomed .

Now all this sounds much like a tale of disaster , or at any rate of failure . It is , however , wonderful by what strange ways good results are brought about , so much so that at times [I]0-i think that these seeming accidents must be arranged by [an Intelligence superior to [our]1380-we own]1393-an intelligence superior to our own , to fulfil through [us]1380-we purposes of which [we]1380-we know nothing , and frequently , be it admitted , of a nature sufficiently obscure . Of course this is a fatalistic doctrine , but then , as [I]0-i have said before , within certain limits [I]0-i am [a fatalist]1394-a fatalist .

To take the present case , for instance , the whole Inez episode at first sight might appear to be an excrescence on [my]0-i narrative , of which the object is to describe how [I]0-i met [a certain very wonderful woman]1395-a certain very wonderful woman and what [I]0-i heard and experienced in [her]1395-a certain very wonderful woman company . Yet it is not really so , since had it not been for the Inez adventure , it is quite clear that [I]0-i should never have reached [the home of [this woman]533-this woman]1396-the home of this woman , if [woman]325-woman [she]533-this woman were , or have seen [her]533-this woman at all . Before long this became very obvious to [me]0-i , as shall be told .

From the night upon which [Hans]87-hans and [I]0-i failed to rescue Inez [we]1380-we had no more difficulty in following the trail of [the cannibals , who thenceforward were never more than a few hours ahead of [us]1380-we and had no time to be careful or to attempt to hide [their]1399-the cannibals , who thenceforward were never more than a few hours ahead of us and had no time to be careful or to attempt to hide their spoor spoor]1399-the cannibals , who thenceforward were never more than a few hours ahead of us and had no time to be careful or to attempt to hide their spoor . Yet so fast did [they]1399-the cannibals , who thenceforward were never more than a few hours ahead of us and had no time to be careful or to attempt to hide their spoor travel that do what [we]1380-we would , burdened and wearied as [we]1380-we were , it proved impossible to overtake [them]1399-the cannibals , who thenceforward were never more than a few hours ahead of us and had no time to be careful or to attempt to hide their spoor .

For the first three days the track ran on through scattered , rolling bush - veld of the character that [I]0-i have described , but tending continually down hill . When [we]1380-we broke camp on the morning of the fourth day , eating a hasty meal at dawn for now game had become astonishingly plentiful , so that [we]1380-we did not lack food the rising sun showed beneath [us]1380-we an endless sea of billowy mist stretching in every direction far as the sight could carry .

To the north , however , it did come to an end , for there , as [I]0-i judged fifty or sixty miles away , rose the grim outline of what looked like [a huge fortress]1400-a huge fortress , which [I]0-i knew must be one of those extraordinary mountain formations , probably owing [their]1399-the cannibals , who thenceforward were never more than a few hours ahead of us and had no time to be careful or to attempt to hide their spoor origin to volcanic action , that are to be met with here and there in [the vast expanses of Central and [Eastern Africa]39-eastern africa]1401-the vast expanses of central and eastern africa . Being so distant it was impossible to estimate [its]1402-it size , which [I]0-i guessed must be enormous , but in looking at it [I]0-i bethought [me]0-i of [that great mountain in which [Zikali]104-zikali said [the marvellous white Queen]1404-the marvellous white queen lived]1403-that great mountain in which zikali said the marvellous white queen lived , and wondered whether it could be the same , as from [my]0-i memory of [his]104-zikali map upon the ashes , it well might be , that is , if such a place existed at all . If so the map had shown [it]1402-it as surrounded by swamps and - well , surely that mist hid the face of [a mighty swamp]1405-a mighty swamp ?

It did indeed , since before nightfall , following the spoor of those Amahagger , [we]1380-we had plunged into a morass so vast that in all [my]0-i experience [I]0-i have never seen or heard of [its]1402-it like . [It]1402-it was a veritable ocean of papyrus and other reeds , some of them a dozen or more feet high , so that it was impossible to see [a yard]1406-a yard in any direction .

Here it was that the Amahagger ahead of [us]1380-we proved [our]1380-we salvation , since without [them]1402-it to guide [us]1380-we [we]1380-we must soon have perished . For through [that gigantic swamp]1407-that gigantic swamp there ran [a road]3132-a road , as [I]0-i think [an ancient road]1409-an ancient road , since in one or two places [I]0-i saw stone work which must have been laid by [man]287-man . Yet it was not [a road]3132-a road which it would have been possible to follow without [a guide]3384-a guide , seeing that [it]1402-it also was overgrown with reeds . Indeed , the only difference between [it]1402-it and [the surrounding swamp]1413-the surrounding swamp was that on [the road]3133-the road the soil was comparatively firm , that is to say , [one]1415-one seldom sank into it above the knee , whereas on either side of it quagmires were often apparently bottomless , and what is more , partook of the nature of quicksand .

This [we]1380-we found out soon after [we]1380-we entered [the swamp]974-the swamp , since [Robertson]159-inez , pushing forward with the fierce eagerness which seemed to consume [him]1417-him , neglected to keep [his]1417-him eye upon [the spoor]1261-the spoor and stepped off the edge on to land that appeared to be exactly similar to [its]1402-it surface . Instantly [he]1417-him began to sink in greasy and tenacious mud . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [I]0-i were only twenty yards behind , yet by the time [we]1380-we reached [him]1417-him in answer to [his]1417-him shouts , already [he]1417-him was engulfed up to [his]1417-him middle and going down so rapidly that in another minute [he]1417-him would have vanished altogether . Well , [we]1380-we got [him]1417-him out but not with ease , for that mud clung to [him]1417-him like the tentacles of an octopus . After this [we]1380-we were more careful .

Nor did [this road]1419-this road run straight ; on the contrary , [it]1419-this road curved about and sometimes turned at right angles , doubtless to avoid [a piece of swamp over which it had proved impossible for [the ancients]1421-the ancients]1420-a piece of swamp over which it had proved impossible for the ancients to construct [a causeway]1422-a causeway , or to follow some out - crop of harder soil beneath .

The difficulties of [that horrible place]1423-that horrible place are beyond description , and indeed can scarcely be imagined . First there was that of a kind of grass which grew among the roots of the reeds and had edges like to those of knives . As [Robertson]159-inez and [I]0-i wore gaiters [we]1380-we did not suffer so much from it , but [the poor Zulus with [their]1424-the poor zulus with their bare legs bare legs]1424-the poor zulus with their bare legs were terribly cut about and in some cases lame .

Then there were the mosquitoes which lived [here by the million]1425-here by the million and all seemed anxious for a bite ; also snakes of a peculiarly deadly kind were numerous . [A Zulu]183-the zulu was bitten by one of [them]1426-them of so poisonous a nature that [he]183-the zulu died within three minutes , for the venom seemed to go straight to [his]183-the zulu heart . [We]1380-we threw [his]1417-him body into [the swamp]974-the swamp , where it vanished at once .

Lastly there was the all - pervading stench and the intolerable heat of [the place]328-the place , since no breath of air could penetrate [that forest of reeds]1429-that forest of reeds , while a minor trouble was that of the multitude of leeches which fastened on to [our]1380-we bodies . By looking one could see the creatures sitting on the under side of leaves with [their]1424-the poor zulus with their bare legs heads stretched out waiting to attack anything that went by . As wayfarers there could not have been numerous , [I]0-i wondered what [they]1424-the poor zulus with their bare legs had lived on for the last few thousand years . By the way , [I]0-i found that paraffin , of which [we]1380-we had a small supply for [our]1380-we hand - lamps , rubbed over all exposed surfaces , was to some extent a protection against these blood - sucking worms and the gnats , although it did make [one]1415-one go about smelling like a dirty oil tin .

During the day , except for the occasional rush of some great iguana or other reptile , and the sound of the wings of the flocks of wildfowl passing over [us]1380-we from time to time , the march was deathly silent . But at night it was different , for then the bull - frogs boomed incessantly , as did the bitterns , while great swamp owls and other night - flying birds uttered [their]1431-their weird cries . Also there were mysterious sucking noises caused , no doubt , by the sinking of [areas of swamp]1432-areas of swamp , with those of bursting bubbles of foul , up - rushing gas .

Strange lights , too , played about , will - o'-the - wisps or St. Elmo fires , as [I]0-i believe [they]1433-they are called , that frightened [the Zulus]101-the zulus very much , since [they]101-the zulus believed [them]101-the zulus to be [spirits of the dead]1434-spirits of the dead . Perhaps this superstition had something to do with [their]101-the zulus native legend that mankind was " torn out of [the reeds]3547-the reeds . "[101-the zulus] If so , [they]101-the zulus may have imagined that the ghosts of [men]3228-men went back to [the reeds]3547-the reeds , of which there were enough here to accommodate those of [the entire Zulu nation]1437-the entire zulu nation . Any way [they]101-the zulus were much scared ; even [the bold witch - doctor]1438-the bold witch - doctor , [Goroko]168-goroko , was scared and went through incantations with the little bag of medicines [he]1438-the bold witch - doctor carried to secure protection for [himself]1438-the bold witch - doctor and [[his]1438-the bold witch - doctor companions]472-his companions . Indeed , [I]0-i think even [the iron Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas [himself]125-umslopogaas was not as comfortable as [he]125-umslopogaas might have been , although [he]125-umslopogaas did inform [me]0-i that [he]125-umslopogaas had come out to fight and did not care whether it were with [man]287-man , or [wizard]1441-wizard , or spirit .

In short , of all the journeys that [I]0-i have made , with the exception of the passage of [the desert]1442-the desert on [our]1443-our way to [King Solomon 's Mines]40-king solomon 's mines , [I]0-i think that through [this enormous swamp]1444-this enormous swamp was the most miserable . Heartily did [I]0-i curse [myself]0-i for ever having undertaken such a quest in a wild attempt to allay that sickness , or rather to quench that thirst of the soul which , [I]0-i imagine , at times assails most of [those who have hearts and think or dream]1445-those who have hearts and think or dream .

For this was at the bottom of the business : this it was which had delivered [me]0-i into the hands of [Zikali]104-zikali , [Opener - of - Roads]3128-opener - of - roads , who , as now [I]0-i am sure , was merely making use of [me]0-i for [his]104-zikali private occult purposes . [He]104-zikali desired to consult [the distant Oracle]1447-the distant oracle , if [such a person]1448-such a person existed , as to great schemes of [his]104-zikali own , and therefore , to attain [his]104-zikali end , made use of [my]0-i secret longings which [I]0-i had been so foolish as to reveal to [him]104-zikali , quite careless of what happened to [me]0-i in the process . A bit narrow and uncharitable , this view . It seems to [me]0-i that [Zikali]104-zikali is taking a big risk in giving [him]104-zikali the Great Medicine . - JB

Well , [I]0-i was in for the business and must follow it to the finish whatever that might be . After all it was very interesting and if there were anything in what [Zikali]104-zikali said if there were not [I]0-i could not conceive what object [he]104-zikali had in sending [me]0-i on such a wild - goose chase through this home of geese and ducks , it might become more interesting still . For being pretty well fever - proof [I]0-i did not think [I]0-i should die in that morass , as of course [nine white men out of ten]1449-nine white men out of ten would have done , and , beyond it lay [the huge mountain]1450-the huge mountain which day by day grew larger and clearer .

Nor did [Hans]87-hans , who , with a childlike trust , pinned [his]87-hans faith to the Great Medicine . This , [he]104-zikali remarked , was the worst veld through which [he]104-zikali had ever travelled , but as [the Great Medicine]1251-the great medicine would never consent to be buried in that stinking mud , [he]104-zikali had no doubt that [we]1452-we should come safely through it some time . [I]0-i replied that this wonderful medicine of [his]104-zikali had not saved [one of [[our]1452-we companions who had now made a grave in [the same mud]1455-the same mud]1454-our companions who had now made a grave in the same mud]1453-one of our companions who had now made a grave in the same mud .

" No , [Baas]121-baas , "[104-zikali] [he]104-zikali said , " but [those Zulus]3760-those zulus have nothing to do with the Medicine which was given to [you]121-baas , and to [me]104-zikali who accompanied [you]121-baas when [we]1452-we saw [the Opener - of - Roads]20-opener - of - roads . Therefore perhaps [they]3760-those zulus will all die , except [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , whom [you]121-baas were told to take with [you]121-baas . If so , what does it matter , since there are plenty of [Zulus]3966-zulus , although there be but one [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn or one [Hans]87-hans ? Also [the Baas]121-baas may remember that [he]121-baas began by offending a snake and therefore it is quite natural that [[this snake]3967-this snake 's brother]3968-this snake 's brother should have bitten [the Zulu]183-the zulu . "[104-zikali]

" If [you]104-zikali are right , [he]121-baas should have bitten [me]104-zikali , [Hans]87-hans . "[104-zikali]

" Yes , [Baas]121-baas , and so no doubt [he]121-baas would have done had [you]121-baas not been protected by the Great Medicine , and [me]104-zikali too had not [[my]104-zikali grandfather]3969-my grandfather been [a snake - charmer]3970-a snake - charmer , to say nothing of the smell of the Medicine being on [me]104-zikali as well . The snakes know those that [they]3967-this snake should bite , [Baas]121-baas . "[104-zikali]

" So do the mosquitoes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , grabbing a handful of them . " The Great Medicine has no effect upon [them]3967-this snake . "[0-i]

" Oh ! yes , [Baas]121-baas , it has , since though it pleases [them]3967-this snake to bite , the bites do [us]3971-us no harm , or at least not much , and [all]568-all are made happy . Still , [I]104-zikali wish [we]3971-us could get out of [these reeds of which [I]104-zikali never want to see another]3973-these reeds of which i never want to see another , and [Baas]121-baas , please keep [your]121-baas rifle ready for [I]104-zikali think [I]104-zikali hear a crocodile stirring there . "[104-zikali]

" No need , [Hans]87-hans , "[0-i] [I]0-i remarked sarcastically . " Go and tell [him]87-hans that [I]0-i have the Great Medicine . "[0-i]

" Yes , [Baas]121-baas , [I]1456-i will ; also that if [he]87-hans is very hungry , there are [some Zulus camped a few yards further down the road]3974-some zulus camped a few yards further down the road , "[1456-i] and [he]1456-i went solemnly to the reeds a little way off and began to talk to [them]1457-them .

" [You]121-baas infernal donkey ! "[0-i] [I]0-i murmured , and drew [my]0-i blanket over [my]0-i head in a vain attempt to keep out the mosquitoes and smoking furiously with the same object , tried to get to sleep .

At last [the swamp bottom]1458-the swamp bottom began to slope upwards a little , with the result that as [the land]3243-the land dried through natural drainage , [the reeds]3547-the reeds grew thinner by degrees , until finally they ceased and [we]1461-us found [ourselves]1461-us on firmer ground ; indeed , upon the lowest slopes of [the great mountain that [I]0-i have mentioned]1462-the great mountain that i have mentioned , that now towered above [us]1461-us , forbidden and majestic .

[I]0-i had made a little map in [my]0-i pocket - book of the various twists and turns of [the road]3133-the road through [that vast Slough of Despond]1464-that vast slough of despond , marking them from hour to hour as [we]1461-us followed its devious wanderings . On studying this at the end of that part of [our]1461-us journey [I]0-i realised afresh how utterly impossible it would have been for [us]1461-us to thread that misty maze where a few false steps would always have meant death by suffocation , had it not been for the spoor of [those Amahagger travelling immediately ahead of [us]1461-us who were acquainted with [its]1464-that vast slough of despond secrets]1465-those amahagger travelling immediately ahead of us who were acquainted with its secrets . Had [they]1465-those amahagger travelling immediately ahead of us who were acquainted with its secrets been [friendly guides]1466-friendly guides [they]1465-those amahagger travelling immediately ahead of us who were acquainted with its secrets could not have done [us]1461-us a better turn .

What [I]0-i wondered was why [they]1465-those amahagger travelling immediately ahead of us who were acquainted with its secrets had not tried to ambush [us]1461-us in [the reeds]3547-the reeds , since [our]1461-us fires must have shown [them]1465-those amahagger travelling immediately ahead of us who were acquainted with its secrets that [we]1461-us were close upon [their]1465-those amahagger travelling immediately ahead of us who were acquainted with its secrets heels . That [they]1465-those amahagger travelling immediately ahead of us who were acquainted with its secrets did try to burn [us]1461-us out was clear from certain evidences that [I]0-i found , but fortunately at this season of the year in the absence of a strong wind the rank reeds were too green to catch fire . For the rest [I]0-i was soon to learn the reason of [their]1465-those amahagger travelling immediately ahead of us who were acquainted with its secrets neglect to attack [us]1461-us in that dense cover .

[They]1465-those amahagger travelling immediately ahead of us who were acquainted with its secrets were waiting for a better opportunity !

CHAPTER X

THE ATTACK

[We]1461-us won out of [the reeds]3547-the reeds at last , for which [I]0-i fervently thanked [God]154-god , since to have crossed [that endless marsh unguided]1469-that endless marsh unguided , with the loss of only [one man]1470-one man , seemed little less than miraculous . [We]1461-us emerged from [them]1465-those amahagger travelling immediately ahead of us who were acquainted with its secrets late in the afternoon and being wearied out , stopped for a while to rest and eat of the flesh of a buck that [I]0-i had been fortunate enough to shoot upon [their]1465-those amahagger travelling immediately ahead of us who were acquainted with its secrets fringe . Then [we]1461-us pushed forward up the slope , proposing to camp for the night on [the crest of [it]1472-it]1471-the crest of it a mile or so away where [I]0-i thought [we]1461-us should escape from the deadly mist in which [we]1461-us had been enveloped for so long , and obtain a clear view of [the country ahead]1473-the country ahead .

Following the bank of [a stream]623-a stream which here ran down into [the marsh]1475-the marsh , [we]1461-us came at length to [this crest]1476-this crest just as the sun was sinking . Below [us]1461-us lay [a deep valley]1477-a deep valley , a fold , as [it]1477-a deep valley were , in the skin of [the mountain , well but not densely bushed]1478-the mountain , well but not densely bushed . [The woods of [this valley]1480-this valley]1479-the woods of this valley climbed up [the mountain flank]1481-the mountain flank for some distance above [it]1480-this valley and then gave way to grassy slopes that ended in [steep sides of rock]1482-steep sides of rock , which were crowned by a black and frowning precipice of unknown height .

There was , [I]0-i remember , something very impressive about this towering natural wall , which seemed to shut off whatever lay beyond the gaze of [man]287-man , as though it veiled an ancient mystery . Indeed , the aspect of it thrilled [me]0-i , [I]0-i knew not why . [I]0-i observed , however , that at one point in [the mighty cliff]1484-the mighty cliff there seemed to be a narrow cleft down which , no doubt , lava had flowed in a remote age , and it occurred to [me]0-i that up [this cleft]1485-this cleft ran [a roadway]1486-a roadway , probably a continuation of that by which [we]1461-us had threaded [the swamp]974-the swamp . The fact that through [my]0-i glasses [I]0-i could see herds of cattle grazing on [the slopes of [the mountain]1489-the mountain]1488-the slopes of the mountain went to confirm this view , since [cattle]1490-cattle imply [owners]1491-owners and [herdsmen]1492-herdsmen , and search as [I]0-i would , [I]0-i could find [no native villages on [the slopes]825-the slopes]1493-no native villages on the slopes . The inference seemed to be that [those owners]1495-those owners dwelt beyond or within [the mountain]1489-the mountain .

All of these things [I]0-i saw and pointed out to [Robertson]159-inez in the light of the setting sun .

Meanwhile [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas had been engaged in selecting the spot where [we]1461-us were to camp for the night . Some soldierlike instinct , or perchance some prescience of danger , caused [him]125-umslopogaas to choose [a place particularly suitable to defence]1497-a place particularly suitable to defence . It was on [a steep - sided mound that more or less resembled [a gigantic ant - heap]1499-a gigantic ant - heap]1498-a steep - sided mound that more or less resembled a gigantic ant - heap . Upon one side [this mound]1500-this mound was protected by [the stream]1501-the stream which because of [a pool]1502-a pool was here rather deep , while at the back of [it]1500-this mound stood a collection of those curious and piled - up water - worn rocks that are often to be found in [Africa]10-africa . These rocks , lying one upon another like the stones of a Cyclopean wall , curved round the western side of the mound , so that practically [it]1500-this mound was only open for a narrow space , say thirty or forty feet , upon that face of [it]1500-this mound which looked on to [the mountain]1489-the mountain .

" [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas expects battle , "[87-hans] remarked [Hans]87-hans to [me]0-i with a grin , " otherwise with [all this nice plain round [us]1461-us]3975-all this nice plain round us [he]125-umslopogaas would not have chosen to camp in [a place which [a few men]3977-a few men could hold against many]3976-a place which a few men could hold against many . Yes , [Baas]121-baas , [he]125-umslopogaas thinks that [those cannibals]3978-those cannibals are going to attack [us]1461-us . "[87-hans]

" Stranger things have happened , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered indifferently , and having seen to the rifles , went to lie down , observing as [I]0-i did so that [the tired Zulus]1504-the tired zulus seemed already to be asleep . Only [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas did not sleep . On the contrary , [he]125-umslopogaas stood leaning on [his]125-umslopogaas axe staring at the dim outlines of the opposing precipice .

" [A strange mountain]3979-a strange mountain , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , "[125-umslopogaas] [he]125-umslopogaas said , " compared to it that of [the Witch]3980-the witch , beneath which [my]125-umslopogaas kraal lies , is but [a little baby]3981-a little baby . [I]125-umslopogaas wonder what [we]1461-us shall find within [it]3979-a strange mountain . [I]125-umslopogaas have always loved mountains , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , ever since [a dead brother of mine]3982-a dead brother of mine and [I]125-umslopogaas lived with the wolves in [the Witch]3980-the witch 's lap , for on [them]3979-a strange mountain [I]125-umslopogaas have had the best of [my]125-umslopogaas fighting . "[125-umslopogaas]

" Perhaps it is not done with yet , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered wearily .

" [I]125-umslopogaas hope not , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , since some is due for [us]1461-us , after all these days of mud and stench . Sleep a while now , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , for that head of [yours]105-macumazahn which [you]105-macumazahn use so much , must need rest . Fear not , [I]125-umslopogaas and [the little yellow man who do not think as much as [you]105-macumazahn do]3984-the little yellow man who do not think as much as you do , will keep watch and wake [you]105-macumazahn if there is need , as mayhap there will be before the dawn . Here none can come at [us]1461-us except in front , and [the place]328-the place is narrow . "[125-umslopogaas]

So [I]0-i lay down and slept as soundly as ever [I]0-i had done in [my]0-i life , for a space of four or five hours [I]0-i suppose . Then , by some instinct perhaps , [I]0-i awoke suddenly , feeling much refreshed in that sweet mountain air , [a new man]1505-a new man indeed , and in the moonlight saw [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas striding towards [me]0-i .

" Arise , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , "[125-umslopogaas] [he]125-umslopogaas said , " [I]125-umslopogaas hear [men]3228-men stirring below [us]1461-us . "[125-umslopogaas]

At this moment [Hans]87-hans slipped past [him]125-umslopogaas , whispering ,

" [The cannibals]1176-the cannibals are coming , [Baas]121-baas , a good number of [them]1176-the cannibals . [I]87-hans think [they]1176-the cannibals mean to attack before dawn . "[87-hans]

Then [he]87-hans passed behind [me]0-i to warn [the Zulus]101-the zulus . As [he]87-hans went by , [I]0-i said to [him]87-hans ,

" If so , [Hans]87-hans , now is the time for [your]87-hans Great Medicine to show what it can do . "[0-i]

" [The Great Medicine]1251-the great medicine will look after [you]0-i and [me]87-hans all right , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans replied , pausing and speaking in Dutch , which [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas did not understand , " but [I]87-hans expect there will be fewer of [those Zulus]3760-those zulus to cook for before the sun grows hot . [Their]3760-those zulus spirits will be turned into snakes and go back into the reeds from which [they]3760-those zulus say [they]3760-those zulus were ' torn out , ' "[87-hans] [he]87-hans added over [his]87-hans shoulder .

[I]0-i should explain that [Hans]87-hans acted as cook to [[our]1506-us party]1507-our party and it was a grievance with [him]87-hans that [the Zulus]354-the zulus ate so much of the meat which [he]87-hans was called upon to prepare . Indeed , there is never much sympathy between [Hottentots]1509-hottentots and [Zulus]101-the zulus .

" What is [the little yellow man]3990-the little yellow man saying about [us]1506-us ? "[125-umslopogaas] asked [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas suspiciously .

" [He]3990-the little yellow man is saying that if it comes to battle , [you]125-umslopogaas and [[your]125-umslopogaas men]3991-your men will make a great fight , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied diplomatically .

" Yes , [we]1506-us will do that , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , but [I]125-umslopogaas thought [he]3990-the little yellow man said that [we]1506-us should be killed and that this pleased [him]3990-the little yellow man . "[125-umslopogaas]

" Oh dear no ! "[0-i] [I]0-i answered hastily . " How could [he]3990-the little yellow man be pleased if that happened , since then [he]3990-the little yellow man would be left defenceless , if [he]3990-the little yellow man were not killed too . Now , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , let [us]1506-us make a plan for this fight . "[0-i]

So , together with [Robertson]159-inez , rapidly [we]1510-we discussed the thing . As a result , with the help of [the Zulus]354-the zulus , [we]1510-we dragged together some loose stones and the tops of three small thorn trees which [we]1510-we had cut down , and with them made a low breastwork , sufficient to give [us]1510-we some protection if [we]1510-we lay down to shoot . It was the work of a few minutes since [we]1510-we had prepared the material when [we]1510-we camped in case an emergency should arise .

Behind this breastwork [we]1510-we gathered and waited , [Robertson]159-inez and [I]0-i being careful to get a little to the rear of [the Zulus]101-the zulus , who it will be remembered had the rifles which [the Strathmuir bastards]1512-the strathmuir bastards had left behind [them]1512-the strathmuir bastards when [they]1512-the strathmuir bastards bolted , in addition to [their]1512-the strathmuir bastards axes and throwing assegais . The question was how [these cannibals]1513-these cannibals would fight . [I]0-i knew that [they]1513-these cannibals were armed with long spears and knives but [I]0-i did not know if [they]1513-these cannibals used those spears for thrusting or for throwing . In the former case it would be difficult to get at [them]1513-these cannibals with the axes because [they]1513-these cannibals must have the longer reach . Fortunately as it turned out , [they]1513-these cannibals did both .

At length all was ready and there came that long and trying wait , the most disagreeable part of a fight in which [one]1415-one grows nervous and begins to reflect earnestly upon [one]1415-one 's sins . Clearly [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas , if [they]1513-these cannibals really intended business , did not mean to attack till just before dawn , after the common native fashion , thinking to rush [us]1510-we in the low and puzzling light . What perplexed [me]0-i was that [they]1513-these cannibals should wish to attack [us]1510-we at all after having let so many opportunities of doing so go by . Apparently [these men]850-these men were now in sight of [[their]850-these men own home]1517-their own home , where no doubt [they]850-these men had [many friends]1518-many friends , and by pushing on could reach [its]1517-their own home shelter before [us]1510-we , especially as [they]850-these men knew [the roads]1519-the roads and [we]1510-we did not .

[They]850-these men had come out for a secret purpose that seemed to have to do with the abduction of [a certain young white woman]1520-a certain young white woman for reasons connected with [their]850-these men tribal statecraft or ritual , which is the kind of thing that happens not infrequently among [obscure and ancient African tribes]1521-obscure and ancient african tribes . Well , [they]850-these men had abducted [[their]850-these men young woman]1522-their young woman and were in sight of safety and success in [their]850-these men objects , whatever these might be . For what possible reason , then , could [they]1513-these cannibals desire to risk a fight with [the outraged friends and relatives of [that young woman]1524-that young woman]1523-the outraged friends and relatives of that young woman ?

It was true that [they]1513-these cannibals outnumbered [us]1510-we and therefore had a good chance of victory , but on the other hand , [they]1513-these cannibals must know that it would be very dearly won , and if it were not won , that [we]1510-we should retake [[their]1513-these cannibals captive]1525-their captive , so that all [their]1513-these cannibals trouble would have been for nothing . Further [they]1513-these cannibals must be as exhausted and travel - worn as [we]1510-we were [ourselves]1510-we and in no condition to face a desperate battle .

The problem was beyond [me]0-i and [I]0-i gave it up with the reflection that either this threatened attack was a mere feint to delay [us]1510-we , or that behind it was something mysterious , such as a determination to prevent [us]1510-we at all hazards from discovering the secrets of [that mountain stronghold]1526-that mountain stronghold .

When [I]0-i put the riddle to [Hans]87-hans , who was lying next to [me]0-i , [he]87-hans was ready with another solution .

" [They]1513-these cannibals are [men - eaters]3833-men - eaters , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans said , " and being hungry , wish to eat [us]1510-we before [they]1513-these cannibals get to [[their]1513-these cannibals own land]3993-their own land where doubtless [they]1513-these cannibals are not allowed to eat [each other]3176-each other . "[87-hans]

" Do [you]87-hans think so , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " when [we]1510-we are so thin ? "[0-i] and [I]0-i surveyed [Hans]87-hans ' scraggy form in the moonlight .

" Oh ! yes , [Baas]121-baas , [we]1510-we should be quite good boiled - like [old hens]3995-old hens , [Baas]121-baas . Also it is the nature of [cannibals]1207-cannibals to prefer [thin man]3997-thin man to fat beef . [The devil that is in [them]1513-these cannibals]3998-the devil that is in them gives [them]1513-these cannibals that taste , [Baas]121-baas , just as [he]3998-the devil that is in them makes [me]0-i like gin , or [you]121-baas turn [your]121-baas head to look at [pretty women]3999-pretty women , as [those Zulus]3760-those zulus say [you]121-baas always did in [[their]3760-those zulus country]4001-their country , especially at [a certain witch who was named [Mameena]107-mameena and whom [you]121-baas kissed before [everybody]520-everybody]4002-a certain witch who was named mameena and whom you kissed before everybody - - "[0-i]

Here [I]0-i turned [my]0-i head to look at [Hans]87-hans , proposing to smite [him]87-hans with words , or physically , since to have this Mameena myth , of which [I]0-i have detailed the origin in the book called [Child of Storm]184-child of storm , re - arise out of [his]87-hans hideous little mouth was too much . But before [I]0-i could get out a syllable [he]87-hans held up [his]87-hans finger and whispered ,

" Hush ! the dawn breaks and [they]1528-these figures come . [I]87-hans hear [them]1528-these figures . "[87-hans]

[I]0-i listened intently but could distinguish nothing . Only straining [my]0-i eyes , presently [I]0-i thought that about a hundred yards down the slope beneath [us]1527-we in the dim light [I]0-i caught sight of ghostlike figures flitting from tree to tree ; also that [these figures]1528-these figures were drawing nearer .

" Look out ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [Robertson]159-inez on [my]0-i right , " [I]0-i believe [they]1528-these figures are coming . "[0-i]

" [Man]287-man , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans answered sternly , " [I]87-hans hope so , for whom else have [I]87-hans wanted to meet all these days ? "[87-hans]

Now the figures vanished into a little fold of the ground . A minute or so later [they]1528-these figures re - appeared upon [its]1528-these figures hither side where such light as there was from the fading stars and the gathering dawn fell full upon them , for here were no trees . [I]0-i looked and a thrill of horror went through [me]0-i , for with one glance [I]0-i recognised that these were not [the men whom [we]1527-we had been following]1529-the men whom we had been following . To begin with , there were [many more of [them]1528-these figures]1530-many more of them , quite a hundred , [I]0-i should think , also [they]1528-these figures had painted shields , wore feathers in [their]1528-these figures hair , and generally so far as [I]0-i could judge , seemed to be fat and fresh .

" [We]1527-we have been led into an ambush , "[0-i] [I]0-i said first in [Zulu]183-the zulu to [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas immediately in front , and then in English to [Robertson]159-inez .

" If so , [man]287-man , [we]1527-we must just do the best [we]1527-we can , "[1531-the latter] answered [the latter]1531-the latter , " but God help [[my]1531-the latter poor daughter]4006-my poor daughter , for those other devils will have taken [her]4006-my poor daughter away , leaving [[their]1532-the savages brethren]4007-their brethren to make an end of [us]1527-we . "[1531-the latter]

" It is so , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , "[159-inez] broke in [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas . " Well , whatever the end of it , [we]1527-we shall have a better fight . Now do [you]105-macumazahn give the word and [we]1527-we will obey . "[159-inez]

[The savages]1532-the savages , for so [I]0-i call [them]1532-the savages , although [I]0-i admit that [cannibals or not]1533-cannibals or not , [they]1532-the savages looked more like [high - class Arabs]1534-high - class arabs than [savages]1535-savages , came on in perfect silence , hoping , [I]0-i suppose , to catch [us]1536-us asleep . When [they]1532-the savages were about fifty yards away , running in a treble line with spears advanced , [I]0-i called out " Fire ! "[0-i] in Zulu , and set the example by loosing off both barrels of [my]0-i express rifle at [men whom [I]0-i had picked out as [leaders]1538-leaders]1537-men whom i had picked out as leaders , with results that must have been more satisfactory to [me]0-i than to [the two Amahagger whose troubles in [this world]1540-this world came to an end]1539-the two amahagger whose troubles in this world came to an end .

There followed a tremendous fusillade , [the Zulus]101-the zulus banging off [their]101-the zulus guns wildly , but even at that distance managing for the most part to shoot over [the enemy]1296-the enemy 's heads . [Captain Robertson]161-robertson and [Hans]87-hans , however , did better and the general result was that [the Amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms , retreated in a hurry to a fold of the ground whence [they]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms had emerged . Before [the last of [them]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms]1543-the last of them got [there]3196-there [I]0-i loaded again , so that [two more]1545-two more stopped behind . Altogether [we]1546-us had put nine or ten of [them]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms out of action .

Now [I]0-i hoped that [they]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms would give the business up . But this was not so , for being [brave fellows]1547-brave fellows , after a pause of perhaps five minutes , once more [they]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms charged in a body , hoping to overwhelm [us]1546-us . Again [we]1546-us greeted [them]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms with bullets and knocked out several , whereon the rest threw a volley of [their]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms long spears at [us]1546-us . [I]0-i was glad to see [them]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms do this although [one of [the Zulus]101-the zulus]1548-one of the zulus got [his]1548-one of the zulus death from it , while [two more]1545-two more were wounded . [I]0-i [myself]0-i had a very narrow escape , for a spear passed between [my]0-i neck and shoulder . [Each of [them]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms]1550-each of them carried but one of these weapons and [I]0-i knew that if [they]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms used them up in throwing , only [their]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms big knives would remain to [them]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms with which to attack [us]1546-us .

After this discharge of spears which was kept up for some time , [they]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms rushed at [us]1546-us and there followed a great fight . [The Zulus]101-the zulus , throwing down [their]101-the zulus guns , rose to [their]101-the zulus feet and holding [their]101-the zulus little fighting shields which had been carried in [their]101-the zulus mats , in the left hand , wielded [their]101-the zulus axes with the right . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , who stood in the centre of [them]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms , however , had no shield and swung [his]125-umslopogaas great axe with both arms . This was the first time that [I]0-i had seen [him]125-umslopogaas fight and the spectacle was in a way magnificent . Again and again the axe crashed down and every time it fell it left one dead beneath the stroke , till at length those [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas shrank back out of [his]125-umslopogaas reach .

Meanwhile [Robertson]161-robertson , [Hans]87-hans and [I]0-i , standing on some stones at the back , kept up a continual fire upon [them]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms , shooting over the heads of [the Zulus , who were playing [their]1551-the zulus , who were playing their part like men part like [men]3228-men]1551-the zulus , who were playing their part like men . Yes , [they]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms shrank back , leaving many dead behind [them]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms . Then [a captain]1553-a captain tried to gather [them]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms for another rush , and once more [they]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms moved forward .
