[I]0-i killed [that captain]1554-that captain with a revolver shot , for [my]0-i rifle had become too hot to hold , and at the sight of [his]1554-that captain fall , [they]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms broke and ran back into [the little hollow where [our]1556-we bullets could not reach [them]1542-the amahagger , who appeared to be unaccustomed to firearms]1555-the little hollow where our bullets could not reach them .

So far [we]1556-we had held [our]1556-we own , but at a price , for [three of [the Zulus]101-the zulus]1557-three of the zulus were now dead and [three more wounded]1558-three more wounded , one of [them]101-the zulus severely , the other two but enough to cripple [them]101-the zulus . In fact , now there were left of [them]101-the zulus but [three untouched men]1559-three untouched men , and [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , so that in all for fighting purposes [we]1556-we were but seven . What availed [it]1560-it that [we]1556-we had killed [a great number of these [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas]1561-a great number of these amahagger , when [we]1556-we were but seven ? How could [seven men]1562-seven men withstand such another onslaught ?

There in the pale light of the dawn [we]1556-we looked at [each other]3176-each other dismayed .

" Now , "[125-umslopogaas] said [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , leaning on [his]125-umslopogaas red axe , " there remains but one thing to do , make a good end , though [I]125-umslopogaas would that it were in a greater cause . At least [we]1556-we must either fight or fly , "[125-umslopogaas] and [he]125-umslopogaas looked down at [the wounded]1564-the wounded .

" Think not of [us]1556-we , [Father]174-o father , "[3281-one of them] murmured [one of [them]1564-the wounded]3281-one of them , [the man who had a mortal hurt]1566-the man who had a mortal hurt . " If it is best , kill [us]1556-we and begone that [you]174-o father may live to bear the Axe in years to come . "[3281-one of them]

" Well spoken ! "[125-umslopogaas] said [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , and again stood still a while , then added , " The word is with [you]174-o father , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , who are [[our]1556-we captain]3380-our captain . "[125-umslopogaas]

[I]0-i set out the situation to [Robertson]161-robertson and [Hans]87-hans as briefly as [I]0-i could , showing that there was a chance of life if [we]1567-we ran , but so far as [I]0-i could see , none if [we]1567-we stayed .

" Go if [you]174-o father like , [Quatermain]83-allan , "[765-the captain] answered [the Captain]765-the captain , " but [I]765-the captain shall stop and die here , for since [[my]765-the captain girl]3682-my girl is gone [I]765-the captain think [I]765-the captain 'm better dead . "[765-the captain]

[I]0-i motioned to [Hans]87-hans to speak .

" [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans answered , " [the Great Medicine]1251-the great medicine is here with [us]1567-we upon [the earth]285-the earth and [[your]174-o father reverend father]3327-your reverend father , [the Predikant]124-the predikant , is with [us]1567-we in the sky , so [I]87-hans think [we]1569-we had better stop here and do what [we]1569-we can , especially as [I]87-hans do not want to see those reeds any more at present . "[87-hans]

" So do [I]0-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i said briefly , giving no reasons .

So [we]1569-we made ready for the next attack which [we]1569-we knew would be the last , strengthening [our]1569-we little wall and dragging [the dead Amahagger]1570-the dead amahagger up against it as an added protection . As [we]1569-we were thus engaged the sun rose and in its first beams , some miles away on [the opposing slopes of [the mountain]1489-the mountain]1571-the opposing slopes of the mountain looking tiny against the black background of the precipice , [we]1569-we saw a party of [men]3228-men creeping forward . Lifting [my]0-i glasses [I]0-i studied it and perceived that in its midst was a litter .

" There goes [[your]161-robertson daughter]3702-your daughter , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , and handed the glasses to [Robertson]161-robertson .

" Oh ! [[my]161-robertson God]3883-my god , "[161-robertson] [he]161-robertson answered , " [those villains]4015-those villains have outwitted [us]1569-we after all . "[161-robertson]

Another minute and the litter , or rather the chair with its escort , had vanished into the shadow of [the great cliffs]1574-the great cliffs , probably up some pass which [we]1569-we could not see .

Next moment [our]1569-we thoughts were otherwise engaged , since from various symptoms [we]1569-we gathered that the attack was about to be renewed . [Spears upon which shone the light of the rising sun]1575-spears upon which shone the light of the rising sun , appeared above the edge of the ground - fold that [I]0-i have mentioned , which to the east increased to [a deep , bush - clad ravine]1576-a deep , bush - clad ravine . Also there were voices as of [leaders]1538-leaders encouraging [[their]1538-leaders men]1578-their men to a desperate effort .

" [They]4015-those villains are coming , "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [Robertson]161-robertson .

" Yes , "[161-robertson] [he]161-robertson answered , " [they]4015-those villains are coming and [we]1569-we are going . It 's a queer end to the thing [we]1569-we call life , is n't it , [Quatermain]83-allan , and hang it all ! [I]161-robertson wonder what 's beyond ? Not much for [me]161-robertson , [I]161-robertson expect , but whatever it is could scarcely be worse than what [I]161-robertson 've gone through here below in one way and another . "[161-robertson]

" There 's hope for all of [us]1569-we , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied as cheerfully as [I]0-i could , for [the man]324-the man 's deep depression disturbed [me]0-i .

" Mayhap , [Quatermain]83-allan , for who knows the infinite mercy of whatever made [us]1569-we as [we]1569-we are ? [[My]324-the man old mother]4016-my old mother used to preach of it and [I]324-the man remember [her]4016-my old mother words now . But in [my]324-the man case [I]324-the man expect it will stop at hope , or sleep , and if it was n't for [Inez]159-inez , [I]324-the man 'd not mind so much , for [I]324-the man tell [you]83-allan [I]324-the man 've had enough of [the world]277-the world and life . Look , there 's one of them . Take that , [you]83-allan black devil ! "[324-the man] and lifting [his]324-the man rifle [he]324-the man aimed and fired at [an Amahagger who appeared upon the edge of the fold of ground]1580-an amahagger who appeared upon the edge of the fold of ground . What is more [he]324-the man hit [him]1580-an amahagger who appeared upon the edge of the fold of ground , for [I]0-i saw [the man]324-the man double up and fall backwards .

Then the game began afresh , for [the cannibals]1176-the cannibals [I]0-i suppose [they]1176-the cannibals were cannibals like [[their]1176-the cannibals brethren]4007-their brethren crept out of shelter , advancing on [their]1176-the cannibals stomachs or [their]1176-the cannibals hands and knees , so as to offer a smaller mark , and dragging between [them]1176-the cannibals a long and slender tree - trunk with which clearly [they]1176-the cannibals intended to batter down [our]1584-our wall .

Of course [I]0-i blazed away at [them]1176-the cannibals , pretty carefully too , for [I]0-i was determined that what [I]0-i believed to be the last exercise of the gift of shooting that has been given to [me]0-i , should prove a record . Therefore [I]0-i selected [[my]0-i men]1585-my men and even where [I]0-i would hit [them]1585-my men , and as subsequent examination showed , [I]0-i made no mistakes in the seven or eight shots that [I]0-i fired . But all the while , like [poor Captain Robertson]161-robertson , [I]0-i was thinking of other things ; namely , where [I]0-i was bound for presently and if [I]0-i should meet [certain folk there]1586-certain folk there and what was the meaning of this show called Life , which unless it leads somewhere , according to [my]0-i judgment has none at all . Until these questions were solved , however , [my]0-i duty was to kill as many of those ruffians as [I]0-i could , and this [I]0-i did with finish and despatch .

[Robertson]161-robertson and [Hans]87-hans were firing also , with more or less success , but there were too many to be stopped by [our]1587-our three rifles . Still [they]1585-my men came on till at length [their]1585-my men fierce faces were within a few yards of [[our]1587-our little parapet]1588-our little parapet and [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas had lifted [his]125-umslopogaas great axe to give [them]1585-my men greeting . [They]1585-my men paused a moment before making [their]1585-my men final rush , and so did [we]1587-our to slip in fresh cartridges .

" Die well , [Hans]87-hans , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " and if [you]87-hans get there first , wait for [me]0-i on the other side . "[0-i]

" Yes , [Baas]121-baas , [I]125-umslopogaas always meant to do that , though not yet . [We]1587-our are not going to die this time , [Baas]121-baas . [Those who have the Great Medicine]4018-those who have the great medicine do n't die ; it is [the others who die , like that fellow]4019-the others who die , like that fellow , "[125-umslopogaas] and [he]125-umslopogaas pointed to an Amahagger who went reeling round and round with a bullet from [his]125-umslopogaas Winchester through the middle , for [he]125-umslopogaas had fired in the midst of [his]125-umslopogaas remarks .

" [Curse]185-curse - [I]0-i mean bless - the Great Medicine , "[0-i] [I]0-i said as [I]0-i lifted [my]0-i rifle to [my]0-i shoulder .

At that moment [all those [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas - there were about sixty of [them]1589-all those amahagger - there were about sixty of them left left]1589-all those amahagger - there were about sixty of them left - became seized with a certain perturbation . [They]1589-all those amahagger - there were about sixty of them left stood still , [they]1589-all those amahagger - there were about sixty of them left stared towards the fold of ground out of which [they]1589-all those amahagger - there were about sixty of them left had emerged ; [they]1589-all those amahagger - there were about sixty of them left called to each other words which [I]0-i did not catch , and then - [they]1589-all those amahagger - there were about sixty of them left turned to run .

[Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas saw , and with [a leader]1590-a leader 's instinct , acted . Springing over the parapet , followed by [his]125-umslopogaas remaining Zulus of the Axe , [he]125-umslopogaas leapt upon [them]1589-all those amahagger - there were about sixty of them left with a roar . Down [they]1589-all those amahagger - there were about sixty of them left went before [Inkosikaas]156-inkosikaas , like corn before a sickle . The thing was marvellous to see , it was like the charge of a leopard , so swift was the rush and so lightning - like were the strokes or rather the pecks of that flashing axe , for now [he]125-umslopogaas was tapping at [their]1589-all those amahagger - there were about sixty of them left heads or spines with the gouge - like point upon its back . Nor were [these]1591-these [the only victims]1592-the only victims , for [those brave followers of [his]125-umslopogaas]1593-those brave followers of his also did [their]1593-those brave followers of his part . In a minute [all who remained upon [their]1589-all those amahagger - there were about sixty of them left feet of [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas]1594-all who remained upon their feet of the amahagger were in full flight , vanishing this way and that among the trees . [Hans]87-hans fired a parting shot after the last of [them]1589-all those amahagger - there were about sixty of them left , then sat down upon a stone and finding [his]87-hans corn - cob pipe , proceeded to fill it .

" The Great Medicine , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans began sententiously , " or perhaps [[your]121-baas reverend father]3327-your reverend father , [the Predikant]124-the predikant - - "[87-hans] Here [he]87-hans paused and pointed doubtfully with the bowl of the pipe towards the fold in the ground , adding , " Here it is , but [I]87-hans think it must be [[your]121-baas reverend father]3327-your reverend father , [not the Great Medicine]4022-not the great medicine , yes , [the Predikant]3326-the predikant [himself]3326-the predikant , returned from Heaven , [the Place of Fires]3329-the place of fires ! "[87-hans]

Looking vaguely in the direction indicated , for [I]0-i could not conceive what [he]87-hans meant and thought that the excitement must have made [him]87-hans mad , [I]0-i perceived [a venerable old man with a long white beard]1595-a venerable old man with a long white beard and clothed in a flowing garment , also white , who reminded [me]0-i of [Father Christmas]174-o father at [a child]1173-a child 's party , walking towards [us]1597-us and radiating benignancy . Also behind [him]87-hans [I]0-i perceived a whole forest of spear points emerging from [the gully]1598-the gully . [He]87-hans seemed to take it for granted that [we]1597-us should not shoot at [him]87-hans , for [he]87-hans came on quite unconcerned , carefully picking [his]87-hans way among the corpses . When [he]87-hans was near enough [he]87-hans stopped and said in a kind of Arabic which [I]0-i could understand ,

" [I]87-hans greet [you]0-i , [Strangers]4025-strangers , in the name of [her]4026-her [I]87-hans serve . [I]87-hans see that [I]87-hans am just in time , but this does not surprise [me]87-hans , since [she]4026-her said that it would be so . [You]0-i seem to have done very well with these dogs , "[87-hans] and [he]87-hans prodded [a dead Amahagger]125-umslopogaas with [his]87-hans sandalled foot . " Yes , very well indeed . [You]0-i must be [great warriors]4027-great warriors . "[87-hans]

Then [he]87-hans paused and [we]1599-we stared at [each other]3176-each other .

CHAPTER XI

THROUGH [THE MOUNTAIN WALL]42-the mountain wall

" These do not seem to be [friends of yours]4028-friends of yours , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , pointing to the fallen . " And yet , "[0-i] [I]0-i added , nodding towards [the spearmen who were now emerging from the gully]1601-the spearmen who were now emerging from the gully , " [they]1601-the spearmen who were now emerging from the gully are very like [[your]0-i friends]3617-your friends . "[0-i]

" [Puppies from the same litter]4030-puppies from the same litter are often alike , yet when [they]4030-puppies from the same litter grow up sometimes [they]4030-puppies from the same litter fight each other , "[174-o father] replied [Father Christmas]174-o father blandly . " At least these come to save and not to kill [you]0-i . Look ! [they]1601-the spearmen who were now emerging from the gully kill [the others]3164-the others ! "[87-hans] and [he]87-hans pointed to [them]1601-the spearmen who were now emerging from the gully making an end of [some of [the wounded men]1603-the wounded men]1602-some of the wounded men . " But who are these ? "[87-hans] and [he]87-hans glanced with evident astonishment , first at [the fearsome - looking Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and then at [the grotesque Hans]87-hans . " Nay , answer not , [you]0-i must be weary and need rest . Afterwards [we]1604-we can talk . "[87-hans]

" Well , as a matter of fact [we]1604-we have not yet breakfasted , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . " Also [I]0-i have business to attend to here , "[0-i] and [I]0-i glanced at [[our]1604-we wounded]1605-our wounded .

[The old fellow]1606-the old fellow nodded and went to speak to [the captains of [[his]1606-the old fellow force]1608-his force]1607-the captains of his force , doubtless as to the pursuit of [the enemy]1296-the enemy , for presently [I]0-i saw [a company spring forward on [their]1610-a company spring forward on their tracks tracks]1610-a company spring forward on their tracks . Then , assisted by [Hans]87-hans and [the remaining Zulus]1611-the remaining zulus , of whom one was [Goroko]168-goroko , [I]0-i turned to attend to [[our]1604-we own people]1612-our own people . The task proved lighter than [I]0-i expected , since [the badly injured man]1613-the badly injured man was dead or dying and the hurts of [the two others]1614-the two others were in [their]1614-the two others legs and comparatively slight , such as [Goroko]168-goroko could doctor in [his]168-goroko own native fashion .

After this , taking [Hans]87-hans to guard [my]0-i back , [I]0-i went down to [the stream]1501-the stream and washed [myself]0-i . Then [I]0-i returned and ate , wondering the while that [I]0-i could do so with appetite after the terrible dangers which [we]1604-we had passed . Still , [we]1604-we had passed [them]1616-them , and [Robertson]161-robertson , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas with [three of [[his]161-robertson men]1123-his men]1617-three of his men , [I]0-i and [Hans]87-hans were quite unharmed , a fact for which [I]0-i returned thanks in silence but sincerely enough to [Providence]127-providence .

[Hans]87-hans also returned thanks in [his]87-hans own fashion , after [he]87-hans had filled [himself]87-hans , not before , and lit [his]87-hans corn - cob pipe . But [Robertson]161-robertson made no remark ; indeed , when [he]161-robertson had satisfied [his]161-robertson natural cravings , [he]161-robertson rose and walking a few paces forward , stood staring at the cleft in [the mountain cliff]1619-the mountain cliff into which [he]161-robertson had seen [the litter vanish that bore [[his]161-robertson daughter]778-his daughter to some fate unknown]1620-the litter vanish that bore his daughter to some fate unknown .

Even the great fight that [we]1622-we had fought and the victory [we]1622-we had won against overpowering odds did not appear to impress [him]161-robertson . [He]161-robertson only glared at [the mountain into the heart of which [Inez]159-inez had been raped away]1623-the mountain into the heart of which inez had been raped away , and shook [his]161-robertson fist . Since [she]159-inez was gone all else went for nothing , so much so that [he]161-robertson did not offer to assist with [the wounded Zulus]1624-the wounded zulus or show curiosity about [the strange old man by whom [we]1622-we had been rescued]1625-the strange old man by whom we had been rescued .

" [The Great Medicine]104-zikali , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] said [Hans]87-hans in a bewildered way , " is even more powerful than [I]87-hans thought . Not only has it brought [us]1622-we safely through the fighting and without a scratch , for [those Zulus]3760-those zulus there do not matter and there will be less cooking for [me]87-hans to do now that [they]3760-those zulus are gone ; it has also brought down [[[your]121-baas reverend]4033-your reverend father [the Predikant]124-the predikant from [the Place of Fires in [Heaven]178-heaven]43-the place of fires in heaven]4034-your reverend father the predikant from the place of fires in heaven , somewhat changed from what [I]87-hans remember [him]124-the predikant , it is true , but still without doubt the same . When [I]87-hans make [my]87-hans report to [him]124-the predikant presently , if [he]124-the predikant can understand [my]87-hans talk , [I]87-hans shall - - "[87-hans]

" Stop [your]1626-he infernal nonsense , [[you]1626-he son of a donkey]4035-you son of a donkey , "[0-i] [I]0-i broke in , for at this moment old Father Christmas , smiling more benignly than before , re - appeared from the kloof into which [he]1626-he had vanished and advanced towards [us]1627-us bowing with much politeness .

Having seated [himself]1626-he upon the little wall that [we]1627-us had built up , [he]1626-he contemplated [us]1627-us , stroking [his]1626-he beautiful white beard , then said , addressing [me]0-i ,

" Of a certainty [you]0-i should be proud who with [a few]4036-a few have defeated so many . Still , had [I]1626-he not been ordered to come at speed , [I]1626-he think that by now [you]0-i would have been as [those are]4037-those are , "[1626-he] and [he]1626-he looked towards [the dead Zulus who were laid out at a distance like [men asleep]1629-men asleep , while [[their]1628-the dead zulus who were laid out at a distance like men asleep , while their companions sought for a place to bury them companions]1630-their companions sought for a place to bury [them]1628-the dead zulus who were laid out at a distance like men asleep , while their companions sought for a place to bury them]1628-the dead zulus who were laid out at a distance like men asleep , while their companions sought for a place to bury them .

" Ordered by whom ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" There is [only one who can order]4038-only one who can order , "[1626-he] [he]1626-he answered with mild astonishment . " ' [She]4038-only one who can order - who - commands , [She]4038-only one who can order - who - is - everlasting ' ! "[1626-he]

It occurred to [me]0-i that this must be some Arabic idiom for the Eternal Feminine , but [I]0-i only looked vague and said ,

" It would appear that there are [some whom this exalted everlasting [She]4038-only one who can order can not command]4039-some whom this exalted everlasting she can not command ; [those who attacked [us]4041-us]4040-those who attacked us ; also those who have fled away yonder , "[0-i] and [I]0-i waved [my]0-i hand towards [the mountain]1489-the mountain .

" No command is absolute ; in [every country]4042-every country there are [rebels]4043-rebels , even , as [I]0-i have heard , in [Heaven above [us]4041-us]4044-heaven above us . But , [Wanderer]186-wanderer , what is [your]186-wanderer name ? "[0-i]

" Watcher - by - Night , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" Ah ! a good name for [one who must have watched well by night , and by day]4045-one who must have watched well by night , and by day too , to reach [[this country]446-this country living where [She]4038-only one who can order - who - commands]4047-this country living where she - who - commands says that [no man of your colour has set foot for many generations]4048-no man of your colour has set foot for many generations . Indeed , [I]0-i think [she]4038-only one who can order told [me]0-i once that two thousand years had gone by since [she]4038-only one who can order spoke to [a white man in [the City of K"r]3120-the city of k"r]4049-a white man in the city of k"r[0-i] . "[0-i]

" Did [she]4038-only one who can order indeed ? "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed , stifling a cough .

" [You]0-i do not believe [me]1632-you , "[1632-you] [he]1632-you went on , smiling . " Well , [[She]4038-only one who can order - who - commands]4051-she - who - commands can explain matters for [herself]4038-only one who can order better than [I]1632-you who was not alive two thousand years ago , so far as [I]1632-you remember . But what must [I]1632-you call [him]4049-a white man in the city of k"r with the Axe ? "[1632-you]

" [Warrior]4052-warrior is [his]4049-a white man in the city of k"r name . "[0-i]

" Again a good name , as to judge by the wounds on [them]4052-warrior , [certain of [those rebels [I]1632-you think]4054-those rebels i think are now telling [each other]3176-each other in [Hell]45-hell]4053-certain of those rebels i think are now telling each other in hell . And [this man]427-this man , if indeed [he]427-this man be [a man]3551-a man - - "[1632-you] [he]1632-you added , looking doubtfully at [Hans]87-hans .

" Light - in - Darkness is [his]427-this man name . "[0-i]

" [I]0-i see , doubtless because [his]427-this man colour is that of the winter sun in thick fog , or a bad egg broken into milk . And [the other white man who mutters and whose brow is like a storm]4058-the other white man who mutters and whose brow is like a storm ? "[0-i]

" [He]427-this man is called [Avenger]187-avenger ; [you]1632-you will learn why later on , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered impatiently , for [I]0-i grew tired of this catechism , adding , " And what are [you]1632-you called and , if [you]1632-you are pleased to tell it to [us]4059-us , upon what errand do [you]1632-you visit [us]4059-us in so fortunate an hour ? "[0-i]

" [I]1632-you am named [Billali]93-billali , "[1632-you] [he]1632-you answered , " [the servant and [messenger of She - who - commands]4061-messenger of she - who - commands]4060-the servant and messenger of she - who - commands , and [I]1632-you was sent to save [you]1632-you and to bring [you]1632-you safely to [her]427-this man . "[1632-you]

" How can this be , [Billali]93-billali , seeing that [none]540-none knew of [our]4059-us coming ? "[0-i]

" Yet [She - who - commands]4051-she - who - commands knew , "[1632-you] [he]1632-you said with [his]1632-you benignant smile . " Indeed , [I]1632-you think that [she]427-this man learned of it some moons ago through a message that was sent to [her]427-this man and so arranged all things that [you]1632-you should be guided safely to [[her]427-this man secret home]4064-her secret home ; since otherwise how would [you]1632-you have passed [a great pathless swamp]4065-a great pathless swamp with the loss , [I]1632-you think [she]427-this man said , of [but one man whom a snake bit]4066-but one man whom a snake bit ? "[1632-you]

Now [I]0-i stared at [the old fellow]1606-the old fellow , for how could [he]1606-the old fellow know of the death of [this man]427-this man , but thought it useless to pursue the conversation further .

" When [you]1632-you are rested and ready , "[1632-you] [he]1632-you went on , " [we]4067-we will start . Meanwhile [I]1632-you leave [you]1632-you that [I]1632-you may prepare litters to carry [those wounded men]4068-those wounded men , and [you]1632-you also , [Watcher - by - Night]3383-watcher - by - night , if [you]1632-you wish . "[1632-you] Then with a dignified bow , for everything about [this old fellow]1635-this old fellow was stately , [he]1632-you turned and vanished into [the kloof]3306-the kloof .

The next hour or so was occupied in the burial of [the dead Zulus]1637-the dead zulus , a ceremony in which [I]0-i took no part beyond standing up and raising [my]0-i hat as [they]1637-the dead zulus were borne away , for as [I]0-i have said somewhere , it is best to leave [natives]1638-natives alone on these occasions . Indeed , [I]0-i lay down , reflecting that strangely enough there seemed to be something in [old Zikali]104-zikali 's tale of [a wonderful white Queen who lived in a mountain fastness , since there was [the mountain]1489-the mountain as [he]1632-you had drawn it on the ashes , and [the servants of that Queen who , apparently , had knowledge of [our]1642-our coming , appeared in the nick of time to rescue [us]1642-our from one of the tightest fixes in which ever [I]0-i found [myself]0-i]1641-the servants of that queen who , apparently , had knowledge of our coming , appeared in the nick of time to rescue us from one of the tightest fixes in which ever i found myself]1639-a wonderful white queen who lived in a mountain fastness , since there was the mountain as he had drawn it on the ashes , and the servants of that queen who , apparently , had knowledge of our coming , appeared in the nick of time to rescue us from one of the tightest fixes in which ever i found myself .

Moreover , [the antique and courteous individual]1643-the antique and courteous individual called [Billali]93-billali , spoke of [her]1644-she as " [She]1644-she - who - is - everlasting . "[93-billali] What [the deuce]1645-the deuce could [he]1643-the antique and courteous individual mean by that , [I]0-i wondered ? Probably that [she]1644-she was very old and therefore disagreeable to look on , which [I]0-i confessed to [myself]0-i would be a disappointment .

And how did [she]1644-she know that [we]1642-our were coming ? [I]0-i could not guess and when [I]0-i asked [Robertson]161-robertson , [he]161-robertson merely shrugged [his]161-robertson shoulders and intimated that [he]161-robertson took no interest in the matter . The truth is that nothing moved [the man]324-the man , whose whole soul was wrapped in one desire , namely to rescue , or avenge , [the daughter against whom [he]324-the man knew [he]324-the man had so sorely sinned]1647-the daughter against whom he knew he had so sorely sinned .

In fact , [this loose - living but reformed seaman]1648-this loose - living but reformed seaman was becoming [a monomaniac]1649-a monomaniac , and what is more , [one of the religious type]1650-one of the religious type . [He]324-the man had a Bible with [him]324-the man that had been given to [him]324-the man by [[his]324-the man mother]754-his mother when [he]324-the man was [a boy]1652-a boy , and in this [he]324-the man read constantly ; also [he]324-the man was always on [his]324-the man knees and at night [I]0-i could hear [him]324-the man groaning and praying aloud . Doubtless now that the chains of drink had fallen off [him]324-the man , the instincts and the blood of [the dour old Covenanters from whom [he]324-the man was descended]1653-the dour old covenanters from whom he was descended , were asserting [themselves]1654-themselves . In a way this was a good thing though for some time past [I]0-i had feared lest it should end in [his]324-the man going mad , and certainly as [a companion]3752-a companion [he]324-the man was more cheerful in [his]324-the man unregenerate days .

Abandoning speculation as useless and taking [my]0-i chance of being murdered where [I]0-i lay , for after all [[Billali]93-billali 's followers]1656-billali 's followers were singularly like [the men with whom [we]1658-we had been fighting]1657-the men with whom we had been fighting and for aught [I]0-i knew might be animated by identical objects - [I]0-i just went to sleep , as [I]0-i can do at any time , to wake up an hour or so later feeling wonderfully refreshed . [Hans]87-hans , who when [I]0-i closed [my]0-i eyes was already asleep slumbering at [my]0-i feet curled up like a dog on a spot where the sun struck hotly , roused [me]0-i by saying :

" Awake , [Baas]121-baas , [they]1660-they are here ! "[87-hans]

[I]0-i sprang up , snatching at [my]0-i rifle , for [I]0-i thought that [he]87-hans meant that [we]1658-we were being attacked again , to see [Billali]93-billali advancing at the head of [a train of four litters]1659-a train of four litters made of bamboo with grass mats for curtains and coverings , each of which was carried by stalwart [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas , as [I]0-i supposed that [they]1660-they must be . Two of these , the finest , [Billali]93-billali indicated were for [Robertson]161-robertson and [myself]0-i , and the two others for [the wounded]1564-the wounded . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [the remaining Zulus]1611-the remaining zulus evidently were expected to walk , as was [Hans]87-hans .

" How did [you]87-hans make these so quickly , "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , surveying [their]1660-they elegant and indeed artistic workmanship .

" [We]1658-we did not make them , Watcher - by - Night , [we]1658-we brought [them]1660-they with [us]1658-we folded up . [[She]3811-the lady - who - commands]4051-she - who - commands looked in [her]3811-the lady glass and said that four would be needed , besides [my]93-billali own which is yonder , two for [white lords]4071-white lords and two for [wounded black men]4072-wounded black men , which [you]0-i see is the number required . "[93-billali]

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered vaguely , marvelling what kind of a glass it was that gave [the lady]3811-the lady this information .

Before [I]0-i could inquire upon the point [Billali]93-billali added ,

" [You]0-i will be glad to learn that [[my]93-billali men]1585-my men caught some of [those rebels who dared to attack [you]0-i]4074-those rebels who dared to attack you , [eight or ten of [them]4074-those rebels who dared to attack you who had been hurt by [your]0-i missiles or axe - cuts]4075-eight or ten of them who had been hurt by your missiles or axe - cuts , and put [them]4074-those rebels who dared to attack you to death in the proper fashion - yes , quite the proper fashion , "[93-billali] and [he]93-billali smiled a little . " [The rest]3749-the rest had gone too far where it would have been dangerous to follow [them]4074-those rebels who dared to attack you among [the rocks]4077-the rocks . Enter now , [[my]93-billali lord]4078-my lord Watcher - by - Night , for [the road]3133-the road is steep and [we]4080-we must travel fast if [we]4080-we would reach [the place where [She - who - commands]4051-she - who - commands is camped in [the ancient holy city]4083-the ancient holy city]4081-the place where she - who - commands is camped in the ancient holy city , before the moon sinks behind [the cliffs to - night]4084-the cliffs to - night . "[93-billali]

So having explained matters to [Robertson]161-robertson and [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , who announced that nothing would induce [him]93-billali to be carried like [an old woman]1191-an old woman , or a corpse upon a shield , and seen that [the hurt Zulus]1665-the hurt zulus were comfortably accommodated , [Robertson]161-robertson and [I]0-i got into [our]1666-our litters , which proved to be delightfully easy and restful .

Then when [our]1666-our gear was collected by [the hook - nosed bearers to whom [we]1666-our were obliged to trust , though [we]1666-our kept with [us]1666-our [our]1666-our rifles and a certain amount of ammunition]1667-the hook - nosed bearers to whom we were obliged to trust , though we kept with us our rifles and a certain amount of ammunition , [we]1666-our started . First went a number of [[Billali]93-billali 's spearmen]1668-billali 's spearmen , then came the litters with the wounded alongside of which [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [[his]125-umslopogaas three uninjured Zulus]1669-his three uninjured zulus talked or trotted , then another litter containing [Billali]93-billali , then [my]0-i own by which ran [Hans]87-hans , and [Robertson]161-robertson 's , and lastly the rest of [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas and [the relief bearers]1670-the relief bearers .

" [I]87-hans see now , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] said [Hans]87-hans , thrusting [his]87-hans head between [my]0-i curtains , " that [yonder Whitebeard]188-yonder whitebeard can not be [[your]121-baas reverend father]3327-your reverend father , [the Predikant]3326-the predikant , after all . "[87-hans]

" Why not ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , though the fact was fairly obvious .

" Because , [Baas]121-baas , if [he]125-umslopogaas were , [he]125-umslopogaas would not have left [Hans]87-hans , of whom [he]125-umslopogaas always thought so well , to run in the sun like a dog , while [he]125-umslopogaas and [others]279-others travel in [carriages]4088-carriages like [great white ladies]4089-great white ladies . "[87-hans]

" [You]1671-you had better save [your]1671-you breath instead of talking nonsense , [Hans]87-hans , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , ' since [I]0-i believe that [you]1671-you have a long way to go . "[0-i]

In fact , it proved to be a very long way indeed , especially as after [we]1672-we began to breast [the mountain]1489-the mountain , [we]1672-we must travel slowly . [We]1672-we started about ten o'clock in the morning , for the fight which after all did not take long - had , it will be remembered , begun shortly after dawn , and it was three in the afternoon before [we]1672-we reached the base of [the towering cliff which [I]0-i have mentioned]1674-the towering cliff which i have mentioned .

Here , at the foot of [a remarkable , isolated column of rock]1675-a remarkable , isolated column of rock , on which [I]0-i was destined to see a strange sight in the after days , [we]1672-we halted and ate of the remaining food which [we]1672-we had brought with [us]1672-we , while [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas consumed [their]1676-they own , that seemed to consist largely of curdled milk , such as the Zulus call maas , and lumps of a kind of bread .

[I]0-i noted that [they]1676-they were [a very curious people who fed in silence and on whose handsome , solemn faces]1677-a very curious people who fed in silence and on whose handsome , solemn faces [one never saw a smile]1678-one never saw a smile . Somehow it gave [me]0-i the creeps to look at [them]1676-they . [Robertson]161-robertson was affected in the same way , for in one of the rare intervals of [his]161-robertson abstraction [he]161-robertson remarked that [they]1676-they were " no canny . "[161-robertson] Then [he]161-robertson added ,

" Ask [[yon]4090-yon old wizard who might be one of [the Bible prophets come to life]4092-the bible prophets come to life - what [those man - eating devils]4093-those man - eating devils have done with [[my]161-robertson daughter]3638-my daughter]4091-yon old wizard who might be one of the bible prophets come to life - what those man - eating devils have done with my daughter . "[161-robertson]

[I]0-i did so , and [Billali]93-billali answered ,

" Say that [they]4093-those man - eating devils have taken [her]3638-my daughter away to make [a queen of [her]3638-my daughter]4095-a queen of her , since having rebelled against [[their]4093-those man - eating devils own queen]4096-their own queen , [they]4093-those man - eating devils must have [another who is white]4097-another who is white . Say too that [She]3638-my daughter - who - commands will wage war on [them]4093-those man - eating devils and perhaps win [her]3638-my daughter back , unless [they]4093-those man - eating devils kill [her]3638-my daughter first . "[93-billali]

" Ah ! "[161-robertson] [Robertson]161-robertson repeated when [I]0-i had translated , " unless [they]4093-those man - eating devils kill [her]3638-my daughter first - or worse . "[161-robertson] Then [he]161-robertson relapsed into [his]161-robertson usual silence .

Presently [we]1679-we started on again , heading straight for what looked like [a sheer wall of black rock]1680-a sheer wall of black rock a thousand feet or more in height , up a path so steep that [Robertson]161-robertson and [I]0-i got out and walked , or rather scrambled , in order to ease [the bearers]1681-the bearers . [Billali]93-billali , [I]0-i noticed , remained in [his]93-billali litter . The convenience of [the bearers]1681-the bearers did not trouble [him]93-billali ; [he]93-billali only ordered an extra gang to the poles . [I]0-i could not imagine how [we]1679-we were to negotiate this precipice . Nor could [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , who looked at it and said ,

" If [we]1679-we are to climb that , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [I]125-umslopogaas think that [the only one who will live to get to the top]4098-the only one who will live to get to the top will be that little yellow monkey of [yours]105-macumazahn , "[125-umslopogaas] and [he]125-umslopogaas pointed with [his]125-umslopogaas axe at [Hans]87-hans .

" If [I]1683-that worthy do , "[1683-that worthy] replied [that worthy]1683-that worthy , much nettled , for [he]125-umslopogaas hated to be called a " yellow monkey "[125-umslopogaas] by [the Zulus]101-the zulus , " be sure that [I]125-umslopogaas will roll down stones upon [any black butcher whom [I]125-umslopogaas see sprawling upon [the cliff below]4100-the cliff below]4099-any black butcher whom i see sprawling upon the cliff below . "[125-umslopogaas]

[Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas smiled grimly , for [he]125-umslopogaas had a sense of humour and could appreciate a repartee even when it hit [him]125-umslopogaas hard . Then [we]1684-we stopped talking for the climb took all [our]1684-we breath .

At length [we]1684-we came to [the cliff face]1685-the cliff face where , to all appearance , [our]1684-we journey must end . Suddenly , however , out of the blind black wall in front of [us]1684-we started the apparition of [a tall man armed with a great spear]1686-a tall man armed with a great spear and wearing a white robe , who challenged [us]1684-we hoarsely .

Suddenly [he]1686-a tall man armed with a great spear stood before [us]1684-we , as a ghost might do , though whence [he]1686-a tall man armed with a great spear came [we]1684-we could not see . Presently the mystery was explained . Here in [the cliff face]1685-the cliff face there was a cleft , though one invisible even from a few paces away , since [its]1688-its outer edge projected over the inner wall of rock . Moreover , this opening was not above four feet in width , a mere split in the huge mountain mass caused by some titanic convulsion in past ages . For it was a definite split since , once entered , far , far above could be traced a faint line of light coming from the sky , although the gloom of [the passage]1689-the passage was such that torches , which were stored at hand , must be used by [those who threaded it]1690-those who threaded it . [One man]1470-one man could have held [the place]328-the place against a hundred - until [he]1470-one man was killed . Still , [it]328-the place was guarded , not only at [the mouth where [the warrior]1694-the warrior had appeared]1693-the mouth where the warrior had appeared , but further along at every turn in [the jagged chasm]1695-the jagged chasm , and these were many .

Into [this grim place]1696-this grim place [we]1684-we went . [The Zulus]101-the zulus did not like it at all , for [they]101-the zulus are [a light - loving people]1697-a light - loving people and [I]0-i noted that even [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas seemed scared and hung back a little . Nor did [Hans]87-hans , who with [his]87-hans usual suspicion , feared some trap ; nor , for the matter of that , did [I]0-i , though [I]0-i thought it well to appear much interested . [Only Robertson]161-robertson seemed quite indifferent and trudged along stolidly after [a man carrying a torch]1698-a man carrying a torch .

[Old Billali]93-billali put [his]93-billali head out of the litter and shouted back to [me]0-i to fear nothing , since there were no pitfalls in [the path]1699-the path , [his]93-billali voice echoing strangely between those narrow walls of measureless height .

For half an hour or more [we]1684-we pursued this dreary , winding path round the corners of which the draught tore in gusts so fierce that more than once the litters with [the wounded men]1603-the wounded men and [those who bore them]1701-those who bore them were nearly blown over . It was safe enough , however , since on either side of [us]1684-we , smooth and without break , rose the sheer walls of rock over which lay the tiny ribbon of blue sky . At length the cleft widened somewhat and the light grew stronger , making the torches unnecessary .

Then of a sudden [we]1684-we came to its end and found [ourselves]1684-we upon [a little plateau in [the mountainside]1703-the mountainside]1702-a little plateau in the mountainside . Behind [us]1684-we for a thousand feet or so rose the sheer rock wall as [it]1704-it did upon the outer face , while in front and beneath , far beneath , was a beautiful plain circular in shape and of great extent , which plain was everywhere surrounded , so far as [I]0-i could see , by [the same wall of rock]1705-the same wall of rock . In short , notwithstanding [its]1704-it enormous size , without doubt [it]1704-it was neither more nor less than the crater of [a vast extinct volcano]1706-a vast extinct volcano . Lastly , not far from [the centre of [this plain]484-this plain]1707-the centre of this plain was what appeared to be [a city]1709-a city , since through [my]0-i glasses [I]0-i could see great walls built of stone , and what [I]0-i thought were [houses]1710-houses , all of [them]1710-houses of a character more substantial than any that [I]0-i had discovered in [the wilds of [Africa]10-africa]1711-the wilds of africa .

[I]0-i went to [[Billali]93-billali 's litter]1712-billali 's litter and asked [him]1713-him who lived in [the city]3203-the city .

" [No one]3323-no one , "[1713-him] [he]1713-him answered , " it has been dead for thousands of years , but [[She]4102-she - who - commands]4051-she - who - commands is camped there at present with [an army]4104-an army , and thither [we]1715-we go at once . Forward , [bearers]4105-bearers . "[1713-him]

So , [Robertson]161-robertson and [I]0-i having re - entered [our]1715-we litters , [we]1715-we started on [down hill]1716-down hill at a rapid pace , for [the road]3133-the road , though steep , was safe and kept in good order . All the rest of that afternoon [we]1715-we travelled and by sunset reached [the edge of [the plain]3355-the plain]1718-the edge of the plain , where [we]1715-we halted a while to rest and eat , till the light of the growing moon grew strong enough to enable [us]1715-we to proceed . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas came up and spoke to [me]0-i .

" Here is [a fortress]4106-a fortress indeed , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , "[125-umslopogaas] [he]125-umslopogaas said , ' since [none]540-none can climb that fence of rock in which the holes seem to be few and small . "[125-umslopogaas]

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " but it is one out of which [those who are in]4107-those who are in , would find it difficult to get out . [We]1715-we are buffaloes in a pit , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas . "[0-i]

" That is so , "[125-umslopogaas] [he]125-umslopogaas answered , " [I]125-umslopogaas have thought it already . But if any would meddle with [us]1715-we [we]1715-we still have [our]1715-we horns and can toss for a while . "[125-umslopogaas]

Then [he]125-umslopogaas went back to [[his]125-umslopogaas men]1123-his men .

The sunset in [that great solemn place]1722-that great solemn place was a wonderful thing to see . First of all [the measureless crater]1723-the measureless crater was filled with light like a bowl with fire . Then as the great orb sank behind [the western cliff]1724-the western cliff , half of [the plain]3355-the plain became quite dark while shadows seemed to rush forward over the eastern part of [its]3355-the plain surface , till that too was swallowed up in gloom and for a little while there remained only a glow reflected from [the cliff face]1685-the cliff face and from the sky above , while on the crest of [the parapet of rock]1727-the parapet of rock played strange and glorious fires . Presently these too vanished and [the world]277-the world was dark .

Then the half moon broke from behind a bank of clouds and by its silver , uncertain light [we]1729-we struggled forward across [the flat plain]1730-the flat plain , rather slowly now , for even the iron muscles of [those bearers]1731-those bearers grew tired . [I]0-i could not see much of it , but [I]0-i gathered that [we]1729-we were passing through crops , very fine crops to judge by [their]1731-those bearers height , as doubtless [they]1731-those bearers would be upon [this lava soil]1732-this lava soil ; also once or twice [we]1729-we splashed through [streams]362-streams .

At length , being tired and lulled by the swaying of the litter and by the sound of a weird , low chant that [the bearers]1681-the bearers had set up now that [they]1681-the bearers neared [home]1249-home and were afraid of no attack , [I]0-i sank into a doze . When [I]0-i awoke again it was to find that the litter had halted and to hear the voice of [Billali]93-billali say ,

" Descend , [White Lords]4071-white lords , and come with [[your]4071-white lords companions]3226-your companions , [the black Warrior]4110-the black warrior and [the yellow man who is named [Light - in - Darkness]189-light - in - darkness]4111-the yellow man who is named light - in - darkness . [She]189-light - in - darkness - who - commands desires to see [you]4071-white lords at once before [you]4071-white lords eat and sleep , and must not be kept waiting . Fear not for [the others]3164-the others , [they]3164-the others will be cared for till [you]4071-white lords return . "[93-billali]

CHAPTER XII

[THE WHITE WITCH]3261-the white witch

[I]0-i descended from the litter and told [the others]3164-the others what [the old fellow]1606-the old fellow had said . [Robertson]161-robertson did not want to come , and indeed refused to do so until [I]0-i suggested to [him]161-robertson that such conduct might prejudice [a powerful person]1739-a powerful person against [us]1740-we . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas was indifferent , putting , as [he]125-umslopogaas remarked , no faith in [a ruler who was [a woman]3331-a woman]1741-a ruler who was a woman .

Only [Hans]87-hans , although [he]87-hans was so tired , acquiesced with some eagerness , the fact being that [his]87-hans brain was more alert and that [he]87-hans had all the curiosity of [the monkey tribe which [he]87-hans so much resembled in appearance , and wanted to see [this queen whom [Zikali]104-zikali revered]1744-this queen whom zikali revered]1743-the monkey tribe which he so much resembled in appearance , and wanted to see this queen whom zikali revered .

In the end [we]1740-we started , conducted by [Billali]93-billali and by [men who carried torches whereof the light]1745-men who carried torches whereof the light showed [me]0-i that [we]1740-we were passing between [houses]1710-houses , or at any rate walls that had been those of [houses]1710-houses , and along what seemed to be [a paved street]1748-a paved street .

Walking under what [I]0-i took to be a great arch or portico , [we]1740-we came into [a court that was full of towering pillars but unroofed , for [I]0-i could see the stars above]1749-a court that was full of towering pillars but unroofed , for i could see the stars above . At [its]1749-a court that was full of towering pillars but unroofed , for i could see the stars above end [we]1740-we entered [a building of which the doorway was hung with mats , to find that [it]1750-a building of which the doorway was hung with mats , to find that it was lighted with lamps and that all down its length on either side guards with long spears stood at intervals was lighted with lamps and that all down [its]1750-a building of which the doorway was hung with mats , to find that it was lighted with lamps and that all down its length on either side guards with long spears stood at intervals length on either side guards with long spears stood at intervals]1750-a building of which the doorway was hung with mats , to find that it was lighted with lamps and that all down its length on either side guards with long spears stood at intervals .

" Oh , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] said [Hans]87-hans hesitatingly , " this is the mouth of a trap , "[87-hans] while [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas glared about [him]87-hans suspiciously , fingering the handle of [his]87-hans great axe .

" Be silent , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " All [this mountain]4113-this mountain is a trap , therefore another does not matter , and [we]1740-we have [our]1740-we pistols . "[0-i]

Walking forward between the double line of [guards who stood immovable as statues]1751-guards who stood immovable as statues , [we]1740-we came to some curtains hung at the end of [a long , narrow hall]1752-a long , narrow hall which , although [I]0-i know little of such things , were , [I]0-i noted , made of rich stuff embroidered in colours and with golden threads . Before these curtains [Billali]93-billali motioned [us]1740-we to halt .

After a whispered colloquy with [someone beyond]1753-someone beyond carried on through the join of the curtains , [he]93-billali vanished between them , leaving [us]1740-we alone for five minutes or more . At length [they]1754-they opened and [a tall and elegant woman with an Arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes , appeared and beckoned to [us]1740-we to enter . [She]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes did not speak or answer when [I]0-i spoke to [her]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes , which was not wonderful as afterwards [I]0-i discovered that [she]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes was [a mute]1756-a mute . [We]1740-we went in , [I]0-i wondering very much what [we]1740-we were going to see .

On the further side of the curtains was [a room of no great size illumined with lamps of which the light fell upon sculptured walls]1757-a room of no great size illumined with lamps of which the light fell upon sculptured walls . [It]1757-a room of no great size illumined with lamps of which the light fell upon sculptured walls looked to [me]0-i as though [it]1757-a room of no great size illumined with lamps of which the light fell upon sculptured walls might once have been the inmost court or [a sanctuary of [some temple]1759-some temple]1758-a sanctuary of some temple , for at [its]1757-a room of no great size illumined with lamps of which the light fell upon sculptured walls head was a dais upon which once perhaps had stood the shrine or statue of [a god]335-a god . On this dais there was now a couch and on the couch - [a goddess]1761-a goddess !

There [she]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes sat , straight and still , clothed in shining white and veiled , but with [her]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes draperies so arranged that they emphasised rather than concealed the wonderful elegance of [her]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes tall form . From beneath the veil , which was such as [a bride wears]1762-a bride wears , appeared two plaits of glossy , raven hair of great length , to the end of each of which was suspended a single large pearl . On either side of [her]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes stood [a tall woman like to [her]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes who had led [us]1740-we through the curtains , and on [his]1763-a tall woman like to her who had led us through the curtains , and on his knees in front , but to the right knees in front , but to the right]1763-a tall woman like to her who had led us through the curtains , and on his knees in front , but to the right , knelt [Billali]93-billali .

About [this seated personage]1764-this seated personage there was an air of singular majesty , such as might pervade [a queen]1765-a queen as fancy paints [her]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes , though [she]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes had a nobler figure than [any queen [I]0-i ever saw depicted]1766-any queen i ever saw depicted . Mystery seemed to flow from [her]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes ; it clothed [her]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes like the veil [she]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes wore , which of course heightened the effect . Beauty flowed from [her]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes also ; although it was shrouded [I]0-i knew that it was there , no veil or coverings could obscure it - at least , to [my]0-i imagination . Moreover [she]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes breathed out power also ; [one]1415-one felt it in the air as one feels a thunderstorm before it breaks , and it seemed to [me]0-i that this power was not quite human , that it drew its strength from afar and dwelt [a stranger]3743-a stranger to [the earth]285-the earth .

To tell the truth , although [my]0-i curiosity , always strong , was enormously excited and though now [I]0-i felt glad that [I]0-i had attempted this journey with all its perils , [I]0-i was horribly afraid , so much afraid that [I]0-i should have liked to turn and run away . From the beginning [I]0-i knew [myself]0-i to be in the presence of [an unearthly being clothed in soft and perfect woman]1770-an unearthly being clothed in soft and perfect woman 's flesh , something alien , too , and different from [[our]1771-our human race]1772-our human race .

What a picture it all made ! There [she]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes sat , quiet and stately as a perfect marble statue ; only [her]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes breast , rising and falling beneath the white robe , showed that [she]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes was alive and breathed as [others]279-others do . Another thing showed it also - [her]1755-a tall and elegant woman with an arab cast of countenance and clad in white robes eyes . At first [I]0-i could not see them through the veil , but presently either because [I]0-i grew accustomed to the light , or because they brightened as those of certain animals have power to do when [they]1774-them watch intently , it ceased to be a covering to [them]1774-them . Distinctly [I]0-i saw [them]1774-them now , large and dark and splendid with a tinge of deep blue in the iris ; alluring and yet awful in [their]1774-them majestic aloofness which seemed to look through and beyond , to embrace all without seeking and without effort . Those eyes were like windows through which light flows from within , a light of the spirit .

[I]0-i glanced round to see the effect of this vision upon [[my]0-i companions]1775-my companions . It was most peculiar . [Hans]87-hans had sunk to [his]87-hans knees ; [his]87-hans hands were joined in the attitude of prayer and [his]87-hans ugly little face reminded [me]0-i of that of a big fish out of water and dying from excess of air . [Robertson]161-robertson , startled out of [his]161-robertson abstraction , stared at [the royal - looking woman on the couch]1776-the royal - looking woman on the couch with [his]161-robertson mouth open .

" [Man]287-man , "[161-robertson] [he]161-robertson whispered , " [I]161-robertson 've got them back although [I]161-robertson have touched nothing for weeks , only this time they are lovely . For yon 's [no human lady]4115-no human lady , [I]161-robertson feel it in [my]161-robertson bones . "[161-robertson]

[Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas stood great and grim , [his]87-hans hands resting on the handle of [his]87-hans tall axe ; and [he]87-hans stared also , the blood pulsing against the skin that covered the hole in [his]87-hans head .

" [Watcher - by - Night]3383-watcher - by - night , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans said to [me]0-i in [his]87-hans deep voice , but also speaking in a whisper , " [this chieftainess]4117-this chieftainess is not [one woman]4118-one woman , but [all women]3420-all women . Beneath those robes of [hers]4117-this chieftainess [I]87-hans seem to see the beauty of one who has ' gone Beyond , ' of [the Lily who is lost to [me]87-hans]4120-the lily who is lost to me . Do [you]0-i not feel it thus , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn ? "[87-hans]

Now that [he]87-hans mentioned it , certainly [I]0-i did ; indeed , [I]0-i had felt it all along although amid the rush of sensations this one had scarcely disentangled itself in [my]0-i mind . [I]0-i looked at the draped shape and saw - well , never mind whom [I]0-i saw ; it was not one only but several in sequence ; also [a woman who at that time [I]0-i did not know although [I]0-i came to know [her]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards afterwards]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards , too well , perhaps , or at any rate quite enough to puzzle [me]0-i . The odd thing was that in this hallucination [the personalities of [these individuals]1779-these individuals]1778-the personalities of these individuals seemed to overlap and merge , till at last [I]0-i began to wonder whether [they]1779-these individuals were not parts of [the same entity or being , manifesting itself in sundry shapes , yet springing from one centre , as different coloured rays flow from the same crystal , while the beams from their source of light]1780-the same entity or being , manifesting itself in sundry shapes , yet springing from one centre , as different coloured rays flow from the same crystal , while the beams from their source of light shift and change . But the fancy is too metaphysical for [my]0-i poor powers to express as clearly as [I]0-i would . Also no doubt it was but a hallucination that had its origin , perhaps , in the mischievous brain of [her]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards who sat before [us]1781-us .

At length [she]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards spoke and [her]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards voice sounded like silver bells heard over water in a great calm . It was low and sweet , oh ! so sweet that at its first notes for a moment [my]0-i senses seemed to swoon and [my]0-i pulse to stop . It was to [me]0-i that [she]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards addressed [herself]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards .

" [[My]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards servant]3733-my servant here , "[1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards] and ever so slightly [she]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards turned [her]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards head towards the kneeling [Billali]93-billali , " tells [me]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards that [you]0-i who are named [Watcher - in - the - Night]4122-watcher - in - the - night , understand the tongue in which [I]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards speak to [you]0-i . Is it so ? "[1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards]

" [I]0-i understand Arabic of a kind well enough , having learned it on [the East Coast]4123-the east coast and from [Arabs]190-arabs in past years , but not such Arabic as [you]0-i use , O - - "[0-i] and [I]0-i paused .

" Call [me]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards [Hiya]191-hiya , "[1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards] [she]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards broke in , " which is [my]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards title here , meaning , as [you]0-i know , [She]4124-she , or [Woman]325-woman . Or if that does not please [you]0-i , call [me]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards [Ayesha]84-ayesha . It would rejoice [me]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards after so long to hear the name [I]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards bore spoken by the lips of one of [my]1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards colour and of gentle blood . "[1777-a woman who at that time i did not know although i came to know her afterwards]

[I]0-i blushed at the compliment so artfully conveyed , and repeated stupidly enough ,

" - Not such Arabic as [you]0-i use , O - [Ayesha]84-ayesha . "[0-i]

" [I]1782-i thought that [you]0-i would like the sound of the word better than that of [Hiya]191-hiya , though afterwards [I]1782-i will teach [you]0-i to pronounce it as [you]0-i should , O - have [you]0-i any other name save Watcher - by - Night , which seems also to be a title ? "[1782-i]

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " [Allan]83-allan . "[0-i]

" - O - [Allan]83-allan . Tell [me]1782-i of these , "[1782-i] [she]1782-i went on quickly , indicating [[my]0-i companions]1775-my companions with a sweep of [her]1782-i slender hand , " for [they]1775-my companions do not speak Arabic , [I]1782-i think . Or stay , [I]1782-i will tell [you]0-i of [them]1775-my companions and [you]0-i shall say if [I]1782-i do so rightly . [This one]4126-this one , "[1782-i] and [she]1782-i nodded towards [Robertson]161-robertson , " is [a man]3551-a man bemused . There comes from [him]3551-a man a colour which [I]1782-i see if [you]0-i can not , and that colour betokens a desire for revenge , though [I]1782-i think that in [his]3551-a man time [he]3551-a man has desired other things also , as [I]1782-i remember [men]3228-men always did from the beginning , to [their]3228-men ruin . Human nature does not change , [Allan]83-allan , and wine and [women]3186-women are ancient snares . Enough of [him]3551-a man for this time . [The little yellow one there]4130-the little yellow one there is afraid of [me]1782-i , as are [all of [you]4131-all of you]4131-all of you . That is [woman]325-woman 's greatest power , although [she]325-woman is so weak and gentle , [men]3228-men are still afraid of [her]325-woman just because [they]3228-men are so foolish that [they]3228-men can not understand [her]325-woman . To [them]3228-men after a million years [she]325-woman still remains the Unknown and to [us]4134-us all the Unknown is also the awful . Do [you]4131-all of you remember the proverb of [the Romans]192-the romans that says it well and briefly ? "[1782-i]

[I]0-i nodded , for it was one of the Latin tags that [[my]0-i father]3272-my father had taught [me]0-i .

" Good . Well , [he]4135-he is [a little wild man]4136-a little wild man , is [he]4135-he not , nearer to the apes from whose race [our]4134-us bodies come ? But do [you]4131-all of you know that , [Allan]83-allan ? "[1785-i]

[I]0-i nodded again , and said ,

" There are disputes upon the point , [Ayesha]84-ayesha . "[0-i]

" Yes , they had begun in [my]1785-i day and [we]4134-us will discuss them later . Still , [I]1785-i say - nearer to the ape than [you]4131-all of you or [I]1785-i , and therefore of interest , as the germ of things is always . Yet [he]4135-he has qualities , [I]1785-i think ; cunning , and fidelity and love which in its round is all in all . Do [you]4131-all of you understand , [Allan]83-allan , that love is all in all ? "[1785-i]

[I]0-i answered warily that it depended upon what [she]1785-i meant by love , to which [she]1785-i replied that [she]1785-i would explain afterwards when [we]1786-we had leisure to talk , adding ,

" What [this little yellow monkey]4137-this little yellow monkey understands by it at least has served [you]0-i well , or so [I]1785-i believe . [You]0-i shall tell [me]1785-i the tale of it some day . Now of the last , this Black One . Here [I]1785-i think is [a man]3551-a man indeed , [a warrior of warriors such as there used to be in [the early world]4140-the early world]4139-a warrior of warriors such as there used to be in the early world , if [a savage]4141-a savage . Well , believe [me]1785-i , [Allan]83-allan , [savages]1535-savages are often the best . Moreover , [all are still savage at heart]4143-all are still savage at heart , even [you]0-i and [I.]1785-i For what is termed culture is but coat upon coat of paint laid on to hide [our]1786-we native colour , and often there is poison in the paint . That axe of [his]4137-this little yellow monkey has drunk deep , [I]1785-i think , though always in fair fight , and [I]1785-i say that it shall drink deeper yet . Have [I]1785-i read [these men]850-these men aright , [Allan]83-allan ? "[1785-i]

" Not so ill , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" [I]1787-i thought it , "[1787-i] [she]1787-i said with a musical laugh , " although at this place [I]1787-i rust and grow dull like an unused sword . Now [you]0-i would rest . Go - all of [you]0-i . To - morrow [you]0-i and [I]1787-i will talk alone . Fear nothing for [your]0-i safety ; [you]0-i are watched by [[my]1787-i slaves]4145-my slaves and [I]1787-i watch [[my]1787-i slaves]4145-my slaves . Until to - morrow , then , farewell . Go now , eat and sleep , as alas [we]4147-we all must do who linger on [this ball of earth]4148-this ball of earth and cling to a life [we]4147-we should do well to lose . [Billali]93-billali , lead [them]1788-the audience hence , "[1787-i] and [she]1787-i waved [her]1787-i hand to signify that [the audience]1788-the audience was ended .

At this sign [Hans]87-hans , who apparently was still much afraid , rose from [his]87-hans knees and literally bolted through the curtains . [Robertson]161-robertson followed [him]87-hans . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas stood a moment , drew [himself]125-umslopogaas up and lifting the great axe , cried [Bayéte]193-bayéte , after which [he]125-umslopogaas too turned and went .

" What does that word mean , [Allan]83-allan ? "[1787-i] [she]1787-i asked .

[I]0-i explained that it was the salutation which [the Zulu people]1789-the zulu people only give to [kings]3464-kings .

" Did [I]1787-i not say that [savages]1535-savages are often the best ? "[1787-i] [she]1787-i exclaimed in a gratified voice . " [The white man]3607-the white man , [[your]83-allan companion]4151-your companion , gave [me]1787-i no salute , but [the Black One]4152-the black one knows when [he]3607-the white man stands before [a woman who is royal]4153-a woman who is royal . "[1787-i]

" [He]3607-the white man too is of royal blood in [[his]3607-the white man own land]4154-his own land , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" If so , [we]4155-we are akin , [Allan]83-allan . "[1787-i]

Then [I]0-i bowed deeply to [her]1787-i in [my]0-i best manner and rising from [her]1787-i couch for the first time [she]1787-i stood up , looking very tall and commanding , and bowed back .

After this [I]0-i went to find [the others on the further side of the curtains]1791-the others on the further side of the curtains , except [Hans]87-hans , who had run down [the long narrow hall]1792-the long narrow hall and through the mats at [its]1792-the long narrow hall end . [We]1793-we followed , marching with dignity behind [Billali]93-billali and between the double line of [guards]1794-guards , who raised [their]1794-guards spears as [we]1793-we passed [them]1794-guards , and on the further side of the mats discovered [Hans]87-hans , still looking terrified .

" [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans said to [me]0-i as [we]1793-we threaded [our]1793-we way through the court of columns , " in [my]87-hans life [I]87-hans have seen all kinds of dreadful things and faced [them]1794-guards , but never have [I]87-hans been so much afraid as [I]87-hans am of [that white witch]4156-that white witch . [Baas]121-baas , [I]87-hans think that [she]4156-that white witch is [the devil of whom [[your]121-baas reverend father]3327-your reverend father , [the Predikant]3326-the predikant , used to talk so much , or perhaps [[his]3327-your reverend father wife]654-his wife]4157-the devil of whom your reverend father , the predikant , used to talk so much , or perhaps his wife . "[87-hans]

" If so , [Hans]87-hans , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " [the devil]3709-the devil is not so black as [he]3709-the devil is painted . But [I]0-i advise [you]87-hans to be careful of what [you]87-hans say as [she]4156-that white witch may have long ears . "[0-i]

" It does n't matter at all what [one]1415-one says , [Baas]121-baas , because [she]4156-that white witch reads thoughts before they pass the lips . [I]87-hans felt [her]4156-that white witch doing it there in [that room]4163-that room . And do [you]87-hans be careful , [Baas]121-baas , or [she]4156-that white witch will eat up [your]87-hans spirit and make [you]87-hans fall in love with [her]4156-that white witch , who , [I]87-hans expect , is very ugly indeed , since otherwise [she]4156-that white witch would not wear a veil . Whoever saw [a pretty woman]4164-a pretty woman tie up [her]4156-that white witch head in a sack , [Baas]121-baas ? "[87-hans]

" Perhaps [she]4156-that white witch does this because [she]4156-that white witch is so beautiful , [Hans]87-hans , that [she]4156-that white witch fears the hearts of men who look upon [her]4156-that white witch would melt . "[0-i]

" Oh , no , [Baas]121-baas , [all women]3420-all women want to melt [men]3228-men 's hearts ; the more the better . [They]3420-all women seem to have other things in [their]3420-all women minds , but really [they]3420-all women think of nothing else until [they]3420-all women are too old and ugly , and it takes [them]3420-all women a long while to be sure of that . "[87-hans]

So [Hans]87-hans went on talking [his]87-hans shrewd nonsense till , following so far as [I]0-i could see , the same road as that by which [we]1795-we had come , [we]1795-we reached [[our]1795-we quarters]1796-our quarters , where [we]1795-we found food prepared for [us]1795-we , broiled goat 's flesh with corncakes and milk , [I]0-i think it was ; also beds for [us]1795-we [two white men covered with skin rugs and blankets woven of wool]1797-two white men covered with skin rugs and blankets woven of wool .

[These quarters]1798-these quarters , [I]0-i should explain , consisted of rooms in [a house built of stone of which the walls had once been painted]1799-a house built of stone of which the walls had once been painted . The roof of [the house]722-the house was gone now , for [we]1795-we could see the stars shining above [us]1795-we , but as the air was very soft in [this sheltered plain]1801-this sheltered plain , this was an advantage rather than otherwise . [The largest room]1802-the largest room was reserved for [Robertson]161-robertson and [myself]0-i , while another at the back was given to [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [[his]125-umslopogaas Zulus]931-his zulus , and a third to [the two wounded men]1804-the two wounded men .

[Billali]93-billali showed [us]1795-we these arrangements by the light of lamps and apologised that they were not better because , as [he]93-billali explained , [the place]328-the place was a ruin and there had been no time to build [us]1795-we [a house]327-a house . [He]93-billali added that [we]1795-we might sleep without fear as [we]1795-we were guarded and [none]540-none would dare to harm [the guests of [She]1809-she - who - commands , on whom [he]93-billali was sure [we]1795-we , or at any rate [I]0-i and [the black Warrior]4110-the black warrior]1808-the guests of she - who - commands , on whom he was sure we , or at any rate i and the black warrior , had produced an excellent impression . Then [he]93-billali bowed [himself]93-billali out , saying that [he]93-billali would return in the morning , and left [us]1795-we to [our]1795-we own devices .

[Robertson]161-robertson and [I]0-i sat down on stools that had been set for [us]1795-we , and ate , but [he]93-billali seemed so overcome by [his]93-billali experiences , or by [his]93-billali sombre thoughts , that [I]0-i could not draw [him]93-billali into conversation . All [he]93-billali remarked was that [we]1795-we had fallen into queer company and that those who supped with [Satan]194-satan needed a long spoon . Having delivered [himself]93-billali of this sentiment [he]93-billali threw [himself]93-billali upon the bed , prayed aloud for a while as had become [his]93-billali fashion , to be " protected from [warlocks]4167-warlocks and [witches]4168-witches , "[93-billali] amongst other things , and went to sleep .

Before [I]0-i turned in [I]0-i visited [[Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas 's room]1811-umslopogaas 's room to see that all was well with [him]93-billali and [[his]93-billali people]3358-his people , and found [him]93-billali standing in the doorway staring at the star - spangled sky .

" Greeting , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , "[93-billali] [he]93-billali said , " [you]105-macumazahn who are white and wise and [I]93-billali am black and [a fighter]4169-a fighter have seen many strange things beneath the sun , but never such a one as [we]4170-we have looked upon to - night . Who and what is [that chieftainess]4171-that chieftainess , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn ? "[93-billali]

" [I]0-i do not know , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " but it is worth while to have lived to see [her]4171-that chieftainess , even though [she]4171-that chieftainess be veiled . "[0-i]

" Nor do [I]93-billali , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . Nay , [I]93-billali do know , for [my]93-billali heart tells [me]93-billali that [she]4171-that chieftainess is the greatest of [all witches]4172-all witches and that [you]105-macumazahn will do well to guard [your]105-macumazahn spirit lest [she]4171-that chieftainess should steal it away . If [she]4171-that chieftainess were not [a witch]4173-a witch , should [I]93-billali have seemed to behold the shape of [[Nada]112-nada the Lily who was [the wife of [my]93-billali youth]4175-the wife of my youth , beneath those white robes of [hers]112-nada , and though the tongue in which [she]112-nada spoke was strange to [me]93-billali , to hear the murmur of [Nada]112-nada 's voice between [her]112-nada lips , of [Nada]112-nada who has gone further from [me]93-billali than those stars]4174-nada the lily who was the wife of my youth , beneath those white robes of hers , and though the tongue in which she spoke was strange to me , to hear the murmur of nada 's voice between her lips , of nada who has gone further from me than those stars . It is good that [you]105-macumazahn wear the Great Medicine of Zikali upon [your]105-macumazahn breast , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , for perhaps it will shield [you]105-macumazahn from harm at those hands that are shaped of ivory . "[93-billali]

" [Zikali]104-zikali is another of [the tribe]655-the tribe , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , laughing , " although less beautiful to see . Also [I]0-i am not afraid of any of [them]655-the tribe , and from this one , if [she]112-nada be more than [some white woman whom it pleases to veil]4177-some white woman whom it pleases to veil [herself]112-nada , [I]0-i shall hope to gather wisdom . "[0-i]

" Yes , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , such wisdom as [Spirits and the dead]4178-spirits and the dead have to give . "[93-billali]

" Mayhap , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , but [we]1813-we came here to seek [Spirits]169-spirits and the dead , did [we]1813-we not ? "[0-i]

" Aye , "[125-umslopogaas] answered [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , " these and war , and [I]125-umslopogaas think that [we]1813-we shall find enough of all three . Only [I]125-umslopogaas hope that war will come the first , lest the Spirits and the dead should bewitch [me]125-umslopogaas and take away [my]125-umslopogaas skill and courage . "[125-umslopogaas]

Then [we]1813-we parted , and too tired even to wonder any more , [I]0-i threw [myself]0-i down on [my]0-i bed and slept .

[I]0-i was awakened when the sun was already high , by the sound of [Robertson]161-robertson , who was on [his]161-robertson knees , praying aloud as usual , a habit of [his]161-robertson which [I]0-i confess got on [my]0-i nerves . Prayer , in [my]0-i opinion , is a private matter between [man]287-man and [[his]287-man Creator]1815-his creator , that is , except in [church]1816-church ; further , [I]0-i did not in the least wish to hear all about [Robertson]161-robertson 's sins , which seemed to have been many and peculiar .
