It is bad enough to have to bear the burden of [one]1415-one 's own transgressions without learning of those of [other people]1208-other people , that is , unless [one]1415-one is [a priest]1820-a priest and must do so professionally . So [I]0-i jumped up to escape and make arrangements for a wash , only to butt into [old Billali]93-billali , who was standing in the doorway contemplating [Robertson]161-robertson with much interest and stroking [his]93-billali white beard .

[He]93-billali greeted [me]0-i with [his]93-billali courteous bow and said ,

" Tell [[your]0-i companion]4151-your companion , [O Watcher]4180-o watcher , that it is not necessary for [him]93-billali to go upon [his]93-billali knees to [She]4151-your companion - who - commands - and must be obeyed , "[93-billali] [he]93-billali added with emphasis , " when [he]93-billali is not in [her]4151-your companion presence , and that even then [he]93-billali would do well to keep silent , since so much talking in a strange tongue might trouble [her]4151-your companion . "[93-billali]

[I]0-i burst out laughing and answered ,

" [He]93-billali does not go upon [his]93-billali knees and pray to [She]4151-your companion - who - commands , but to [the Great One who is in the sky]4181-the great one who is in the sky . "[0-i]

" Indeed , [Watcher]195-watcher . Well , here [we]4182-we only know [a Great One who is upon [the earth]285-the earth]4183-a great one who is upon the earth , though it is true that perhaps [she]4183-a great one who is upon the earth visits the skies sometimes . "[0-i]

" Is it so , [Billali]93-billali ? "[0-i] [I]0-i answered incredulously . " And now , [I]0-i would ask [you]1821-you to take [me]0-i to some place where [I]0-i can bathe . "[0-i]

" It is ready , "[1821-you] [he]1821-you replied . " Come . "[1821-you]

So [I]0-i called to [Hans]87-hans , who was hanging about with a rifle on [his]87-hans arm , to follow with a cloth and soap , of which fortunately [we]1822-we had a couple of pieces left , and [we]1822-we started along what had once been a paved roadway running between [stone houses]1823-stone houses , whereof the time - eaten ruins still remained on either side .

" Who and what is [this Queen of [yours]1821-you]4185-this queen of yours , [Billali]93-billali ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked as [we]1822-we went . " Surely [she]4185-this queen of yours is not of the Amahagger blood . "[0-i]

" Ask it of [herself]4185-this queen of yours , [O Watcher]195-watcher , for [I]1824-i can not tell [you]1821-you . All [I]1824-i know is that [I]1824-i can trace [[my]1824-i own family]4186-my own family for ten generations and that [[my]1824-i tenth forefather]4187-my tenth forefather told [[his]4187-my tenth forefather son]4188-his son on [his]4187-my tenth forefather deathbed , for the saying has come down through [[his]4187-my tenth forefather descendants]4189-his descendants - that when [he]4187-my tenth forefather was young [She]4190-she - who - commands had ruled [the land]3243-the land for more scores of years than [he]4187-my tenth forefather could count months of life . "[1824-i]

[I]0-i stopped and stared at [him]1824-i , since the lie was so amazing that it seemed to deprive [me]0-i of the power of motion . Noting [my]0-i very obvious disbelief [he]1824-i continued blandly ,

" If [you]0-i doubt , ask . And now here is where [you]0-i may bathe . "[1824-i]

Then [he]1824-i led [me]0-i through an arched doorway and down [a wrecked passage]1825-a wrecked passage to what very obviously once had been [a splendid bath - house]1826-a splendid bath - house such as some [I]0-i have seen pictures of that were built by [the Romans]1827-the romans . [Its]1826-a splendid bath - house size was that of [a large room]1828-a large room ; [it]1826-a splendid bath - house was constructed of a kind of marble with a sloping bottom that varied from three to seven feet in depth , and water still ran in and out of [it]1826-a splendid bath - house through large glazed pipes . Moreover round [it]1826-a splendid bath - house was a footway about five feet across , from which opened chambers , unroofed now , that [the bathers]1829-the bathers used as [dressing - rooms]1830-dressing - rooms , while between [these chambers]1831-these chambers stood the remains of statues . One at the end indeed , where an alcove had protected [it]1826-a splendid bath - house from sun and weather , was still quite perfect , except for the outstretched arms which were gone the right hand [I]0-i noticed lying at the bottom of [the bath]1832-the bath . It was that of [a nude young woman in the attitude of diving]1833-a nude young woman in the attitude of diving , a very beautiful bit of work , [I]0-i thought , though of course [I]0-i am [no judge of sculpture]1834-no judge of sculpture . Even the smile mingled with trepidation upon [the girl]3838-the girl 's face was most naturally portrayed .

This statue showed two things , that [the bath]1832-the bath was used by [females]1837-females and that [the people who built it]1838-the people who built it were highly civilised , also that [they]1838-the people who built it belonged to an advanced if somewhat Eastern race , since [the girl]3838-the girl 's nose was , if anything , Semitic in character , and [her]3838-the girl lips , though prettily shaped , were full . For the rest , the basin was so clean that [I]0-i presume [it]1826-a splendid bath - house must have been made ready for [me]0-i or [other recent bathers]1840-other recent bathers , and at [its]1826-a splendid bath - house bottom [I]0-i discovered gratings and broken pipes of earthenware which suggested that in the old days the water could be warmed by means of a furnace .

This relic of a long - past civilisation excited [Hans]87-hans even more than it did [myself]0-i , since having never seen anything of the sort , [he]87-hans thought it so strange that , as [he]87-hans informed [me]0-i , [he]87-hans imagined that [it]1832-the bath must have been built by [witchcraft]1841-witchcraft . In [it]1832-the bath [I]0-i had [a most delightful and much - needed bath]1842-a most delightful and much - needed bath . Even [Hans]87-hans was persuaded to follow [my]0-i example - a thing [I]0-i had rarely known [him]87-hans to do before - and seated in its shallowest part , splashed some water over [his]87-hans yellow , wrinkled anatomy . Then [we]1843-us returned to [[our]1843-us house]1844-our house , where [I]0-i found an excellent breakfast had been provided which was brought to [us]1843-us by [tall , silent , handsome women who surveyed [us]1843-us out of the corners of [their]1845-tall , silent , handsome women who surveyed us out of the corners of their eyes eyes]1845-tall , silent , handsome women who surveyed us out of the corners of their eyes , but said nothing .

Shortly after [I]0-i had finished [my]0-i meal , [Billali]93-billali , who had disappeared , came back again and said that [She]1846-she - who - commands desired [my]0-i presence as [she]1846-she would speak with [me]0-i ; also that [I]0-i must come alone . So , after attending to [the wounded , who both seemed to be getting on well]1847-the wounded , who both seemed to be getting on well , [I]0-i went , followed by [Hans]87-hans armed with [his]87-hans rifle , though [I]0-i only carried [my]0-i revolver . [Robertson]161-robertson wished to accompany [me]0-i , as [he]161-robertson did not seem to care about being left alone with [the Zulus]354-the zulus in [that strange place]1849-that strange place , but this [Billali]93-billali would not allow . Indeed , when [he]161-robertson persisted , [two great men]1850-two great men stepped forward and crossed [their]1850-two great men spears before [him]161-robertson in a somewhat threatening fashion . Then at [my]0-i entreaty , for [I]0-i feared lest trouble should arise , [he]161-robertson gave in and returned to [the house]722-the house .

Following [our]1852-we path of the night before , [we]1852-we walked up [a ruined street]1853-a ruined street which [I]0-i could see was only one of scores in what had once been [a very great city]1854-a very great city , until [we]1852-we came to [the archway that [I]0-i have mentioned]1855-the archway that i have mentioned , [a large one now overgrown with plants that from their yellow , sweet - scented bloom [I]0-i judged to be a species of wallflower , also with a kind of houseleek or saxifrage]1856-a large one now overgrown with plants that from their yellow , sweet - scented bloom i judged to be a species of wallflower , also with a kind of houseleek or saxifrage .

Here [Hans]87-hans was stopped by [guards]1794-guards , [Billali]93-billali explaining to [me]0-i that [he]161-robertson must await [my]0-i return , an order which [he]161-robertson obeyed unwillingly enough . Then [I]0-i went on down [the narrow passage]1858-the narrow passage , lined as before by [guards who stood silent as statues]1859-guards who stood silent as statues , and came to the curtains at the end . Before these at a motion from [Billali]93-billali , who did not seem to dare to speak in [this place]3445-this place , [I]0-i stood still and waited .

[CHAPTER XIII]196-chapter xiii

[ALLAN HEARS]82-allan A STRANGE TALE

For some minutes [I]0-i remained before those curtains until , had it not been for something electric in the air which got into [my]0-i bones , a kind of force that , perhaps in [my]0-i fancy only , seemed to pervade [the place]328-the place , [I]0-i should certainly have grown bored . Indeed [I]0-i was about to ask [[my]0-i companion]1014-my companion why [he]1014-my companion did not announce [our]1863-our arrival instead of standing there like a stuck pig with [his]1014-my companion eyes shut as though in prayer or meditation , when the curtains parted and from between [them]1864-them appeared one of [those tall waiting women whom [we]1863-our [had seen on the previous night]1866-had seen on the previous night]1865-those tall waiting women whom we had seen on the previous night . [She]1867-she contemplated [us]1863-our gravely for a few moments , then moved [her]1867-she hand twice , once forward , towards [Billali]93-billali as a signal to [him]93-billali to retire , which [he]93-billali did with great rapidity , and next in a beckoning fashion towards [myself]0-i to invite [me]0-i to follow [her]1867-she .

[I]0-i obeyed , passing between the thick curtains which [she]1867-she fastened in some way behind [me]0-i , and found [myself]0-i in [the same roofed and sculptured room that [I]0-i have already described]1868-the same roofed and sculptured room that i have already described . Only now there were no lamps , such light as penetrated it coming from an opening above that [I]0-i could not see , and falling upon the dais at its head , also on [her]1867-she who sat upon the dais .

Yes , there [she]1867-she was in [her]1867-she white robes and veil , the point and centre of a little lake of light , a wondrous and in a sense a spiritual vision , for in truth there was something about [her]1867-she which was not of [the world]277-the world , something that drew and yet frightened [me]0-i . Still as a statue [she]1867-she sat , like one to whom time is of no account and who has grown weary of motion , and on either side of [her]1867-she yet more still , like caryatides supporting a shrine , stood [two of the stately women who were [[her]1867-she attendants]1871-her attendants]1870-two of the stately women who were her attendants .

For the rest a sweet and subtle odour pervaded the chamber which took hold of [my]0-i senses as [hasheesh]198-hasheesh might do , which [I]0-i was sure proceeded from [her]1867-she , or from [her]1867-she garments , for [I]0-i could see no perfumes burning . [She]1867-she spoke no word , yet [I]0-i knew [she]1867-she was inviting [me]0-i to come nearer and moved forward till [I]0-i reached a curious carved chair that was placed just beneath the dais , and there halted , not liking to sit down without permission .

For a long while [she]1867-she contemplated [me]0-i , for as before [I]0-i could feel [her]1867-she eyes searching [me]0-i from head to foot and as it were looking through [me]0-i as though [she]1867-she would discover [my]0-i very soul . Then at length [she]1867-she moved , waving those two ivory arms of hers outwards with a kind of swimming stroke , whereon [the women to right]1872-the women to right and left of [her]1867-she turned and glided away , [I]0-i know not whither .

" Sit , [Allan]82-allan , "[1867-she] [she]1867-she said , " and let [us]4192-us talk , for [I]1867-she think [we]4192-us have much to say to [each other]3176-each other . Have [you]82-allan slept well ? And eaten ? - though [I]1867-she fear that the food is but rough . Also was the bath made ready for [you]82-allan ? "[1867-she]

" Yes , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered to all three questions , adding , for [I]0-i knew not what to say , " It seems to be [a very ancient bath]4194-a very ancient bath . "[0-i]

" When [I]1867-she last saw it , "[1867-she] [she]1867-she replied , " it was well enough with statues standing round [it]4194-a very ancient bath worked by [a sculptor who had seen beauty in [his]4195-a sculptor who had seen beauty in his dreams dreams]4195-a sculptor who had seen beauty in his dreams . But in two thousand years - or is it more ? - the tooth of Time bites deep , and doubtless like all else in [this dead place]4196-this dead place [it]4194-a very ancient bath is now a ruin . "[1867-she]

[I]0-i coughed to cover up the exclamation of disbelief that rose to [my]0-i lips and remarked blandly that two thousand years was certainly a long time .

" When [you]82-allan say one thing , [Allan]82-allan , and mean another , [your]82-allan Arabic is even more vile than usual and does not serve to cloak [your]82-allan thought . "[1867-she]

" It may be so , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , for [I]1873-i only know that tongue as [I]1873-i do many other of the dialects of [Africa]10-africa by learning it from [common men]4197-common men . [My]1873-i own speech is English , in which , if [you]82-allan are acquainted with it , [I]1873-i should prefer to talk . "[1873-i]

" [I]1867-she know not English , which doubtless is some language that has arisen since [I]1867-she left [the world]277-the world . Perhaps later [you]82-allan shall teach it to [me]1867-she . [I]1867-she tell [you]82-allan , [you]82-allan anger [me]1867-she whom it is not well to anger , because [you]82-allan believe nothing that passes [my]1867-she lips and yet do not dare to say so . "[1867-she]

" How can [I]1873-i believe one , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , who if [I]1873-i understand aright , speaks of having seen a certain bath two thousand years ago , whereas one hundred years are the full days of [man]287-man ? Forgive [me]1873-i therefore if [I]1873-i can not believe what [I]1873-i know to be untrue . "[1873-i]

Now [I]0-i thought that [she]1873-i would be very angry and was sorry that [I]0-i had spoken . But as it happened [she]1873-i was not .

" [You]0-i must have courage to give [me]1873-i the lie so boldly - and [I]1873-i like courage , "[1873-i] [she]1873-i said , " who have been cringed to for so long . Indeed , [I]1873-i know that [you]0-i are brave , who have heard how [you]0-i bore [yourself]0-i in the fight yesterday , and much else about [you]0-i . [I]1873-i think that [we]4200-we shall be [friends]3149-friends , but - seek no more . "[1873-i]

" What else should [I]0-i seek , [Ayesha]84-ayesha ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked innocently .

" Now [you]0-i are lying again , "[1873-i] [she]1873-i said , " who know well that [no man who is a man]4202-no man who is a man sees [a woman who is beautiful and pleases [him]4202-no man who is a man]4203-a woman who is beautiful and pleases him , without wondering whether , should [he]4202-no man who is a man desire it , [she]4203-a woman who is beautiful and pleases him could come to love [him]4202-no man who is a man , that is , if [she]4203-a woman who is beautiful and pleases him be young . "[1873-i]

" Which at least is not possible if [she]4203-a woman who is beautiful and pleases him has lived two thousand years . Then naturally [she]4203-a woman who is beautiful and pleases him would prefer to wear a veil , "[0-i] [I]0-i said boldly , seeking to avoid the argument into which [I]0-i saw [she]1873-i wished to drag [me]0-i .

" Ah ! "[1873-i] [she]1873-i answered , " [the little yellow man who is named [Light - in - Darkness]189-light - in - darkness]4204-the little yellow man who is named light - in - darkness put that thought into [your]0-i heart , [I]1873-i think . Oh , do not trouble as to how [I]1873-i know it , who have many spies here , as [he]4204-the little yellow man who is named light - in - darkness guessed well enough . So [a woman who has lived two thousand years]4205-a woman who has lived two thousand years must be hideous and wrinkled , must [she]4205-a woman who has lived two thousand years ? The stamp of youth and loveliness must long have fled from [her]4205-a woman who has lived two thousand years ; of that [you]0-i , [the wise man]4206-the wise man , are sure . Very well . Now [you]0-i tempt [me]1873-i to do what [I]1873-i had determined [I]1873-i would not do and [you]0-i shall pluck the fruit of that tree of curiosity which grows so fast within [you]0-i . Look , [Allan]82-allan , and say whether [I]1873-i am old and hideous , even though [I]1873-i have lived two thousand years upon [the earth]285-the earth and mayhap many more . "[1873-i]

Then [she]1874-she lifted [her]1874-she hands and did something to [her]1874-she veil , so that for a moment - only one moment - [her]1874-she face was revealed , after which the veil fell into its place .

[I]0-i looked , [I]0-i saw , and if that chair had lacked a back [I]0-i believe that [I]0-i should have fallen out of it to the ground . As for what [I]0-i saw - well , it can not be described , at any rate by [me]0-i , except perhaps as a flash of glory .

[Every man]1875-every man has dreamed of perfect beauty , basing [his]1875-every man ideas of it perhaps on that of [some woman [he]1875-every man has met who chanced to take [his]1875-every man fancy , with a few accessories from splendid pictures or [Greek statues thrown in]1877-greek statues thrown in , plus a garnishment of the imagination]1876-some woman he has met who chanced to take his fancy , with a few accessories from splendid pictures or greek statues thrown in , plus a garnishment of the imagination . At any rate [I]0-i have , and here was that perfect beauty multiplied by ten , such beauty , that at the sight of it the senses reeled . And yet [I]0-i repeat that it is not to be described .

[I]0-i do not know what the nose or the lips were like ; in fact , all that [I]0-i can remember with distinctness is the splendour of the eyes , of which [I]0-i had caught some hint through [her]1874-she veil on the previous night . Oh , they were wondrous , those eyes , but [I]0-i can not tell [their]1878-their colour save that the groundwork of them was black . Moreover they seemed to be more than eyes as [we]1879-we understand [them]1878-their . They were indeed windows of the soul , out of which looked thought and majesty and infinite wisdom , mixed with all the allurements and the mystery that [we]1879-we are accustomed to see or to imagine in [woman]325-woman .

Here let [me]0-i say something at once . If [this marvellous creature]1881-this marvellous creature expected that the revelation of [her]1874-she splendour was going to make [me]0-i [[her]1874-she slave]1882-her slave ; to cause [me]0-i to fall in love with [her]1874-she , as it is called , well , [she]1874-she must have been disappointed , for it had no such effect . It frightened and in a sense humbled [me]0-i , that is all , for [I]0-i felt [myself]0-i to be in the presence of something that was not human , something alien to [me]0-i as [a man]3551-a man , which [I]0-i could fear and even adore as [humanity]1884-humanity would adore that which is Divine , but with which [I]0-i had no desire to mix . Moreover , was it divine , or was it something very different ? [I]0-i did not know , [I]0-i only knew that it was not for [me]0-i ; as soon should [I]0-i have thought of asking for a star to set within [my]0-i lantern .

[I]0-i think that [she]1874-she felt this , felt that [her]1874-she stroke had missed , as [the French]199-the french say , that is if [she]1874-she meant to strike at all at this moment . Of this [I]0-i am not certain , for it was in a changed voice , one with a suspicion of chill in it that [she]1874-she said with a little laugh ,

" Do [you]0-i admit now , [Allan]82-allan , that [a woman]3331-a woman may be old and still remain fair and unwrinkled ? "[1874-she]

" [I]0-i admit , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , although [I]0-i was trembling so much that [I]0-i could hardly speak with steadiness , " that [a woman]3331-a woman may be splendid and lovely beyond anything that the mind of [man]287-man can conceive , whatever [her]3331-a woman age , of which [I]0-i know nothing . [I]0-i would add this , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , that [I]0-i thank [you]84-ayesha very much for having revealed to [me]0-i the glory that is hid beneath [your]84-ayesha veil . "[0-i]

" Why ? "[1874-she] [she]1874-she asked , and [I]0-i thought that [I]0-i detected curiosity in [her]1874-she question .

" For this reason , [Ayesha]84-ayesha . Now there is no fear of [my]0-i troubling [you]84-ayesha in such a fashion as [you]84-ayesha seemed to dread a little while ago . As soon would [a man]3551-a man desire to court the moon sailing in [her]3331-a woman silver loveliness through heaven . "[0-i]

" The moon ! It is strange that [you]0-i should compare [me]1874-she to the moon , "[1874-she] [she]1874-she said musingly . " Do [you]0-i know that the moon was [a great goddess in [Old Egypt]46-old egypt]4212-a great goddess in old egypt and that [her]4212-a great goddess in old egypt name was [Isis]200-isis and - well , once [I]1874-she had to do with [Isis]200-isis ? Perhaps [you]0-i were there and knew it , since more lives than one are given to most of [us]4213-us . [I]1874-she must search and learn . For the rest , all have not thought as [you]0-i do , [Allan]82-allan . [Many]3487-many , on the contrary , love and seek to win the Divine . "[1874-she]

" So do [I]0-i at a distance , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , but to come too near to it [I]0-i do not aspire . If [I]0-i did perhaps [I]0-i might be consumed . "[0-i]

" [You]0-i have wisdom , "[1874-she] [she]1874-she replied , not without a note of admiration in [her]1874-she voice . " The moths are [few that fear the flame]4215-few that fear the flame , but those are the moths which live . Also [I]1874-she think that [you]0-i have scorched [your]0-i wings before and learned that fire hurts . Indeed , now [I]1874-she remember that [I]1874-she have heard of three such fires of love through which [you]0-i have flown , [Allan]82-allan , though all of them are dead ashes now , or shine elsewhere . Two burned in [your]0-i youth when [a certain lady]4216-a certain lady died to save [you]0-i , [a great woman that , is it not so ? And the third]4217-a great woman that , is it not so ? and the third , ah ! [she]4217-a great woman that , is it not so ? and the third was fire indeed , though of a copper hue . What was [her]4217-a great woman that , is it not so ? and the third name ? [I]1874-she can not remember , but [I]1874-she think it had something to do with the wind , yes , with the wind when it wails . "[1874-she]

[I]0-i stared at [her]1874-she . Was this Mameena myth to be dug up again in a secret place in [the heart of [Africa]10-africa]1885-the heart of africa ? And how [the deuce]1645-the deuce did [she]1874-she know anything about [Mameena]107-mameena ? Could [she]1874-she have been questioning [Hans]87-hans or [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas ? No , it was not possible , for [she]1874-she had never seen them out of [my]0-i presence .

" Perhaps , "[1874-she] [she]1874-she went on in a mocking voice , " perhaps once again [you]0-i disbelieve , [Allan]82-allan , whose cynic mind is so hard to open to new truths . Well , shall [I]1874-she show [you]0-i the faces of these three ? [I]1874-she can , "[1874-she] and [she]1874-she waved [her]1874-she hand towards some object that stood on a tripod to the right of [her]1874-she in the shadow - it looked like a crystal basin . " But what would it serve when [you]0-i who know [them]4218-them so well , believed that [I]1874-she drew [their]4218-them pictures out of [your]0-i own soul ? Also perchance but one face would appear and that one strange to [you]0-i . [Lady Ragnall]201-lady ragnall perhaps ? - [JB]103-jb[1874-she]

" Have [you]82-allan heard , [Allan]82-allan , that among [the wise some]4219-the wise some hold that not all of [us]4220-us is visible at once here on [earth]346-earth within [the same house of flesh]4222-the same house of flesh ; that the whole self in [[its]4223-its home]4224-its home above , separates itself into sundry parts , each of which walks [the earth]285-the earth in different form , a segment of life 's circle that can never be dissolved and must unite again at last ? "[1874-she]

[I]0-i shook [my]0-i head blankly , for [I]0-i had never heard anything of the sort .

" [You]0-i have still much to learn , [Allan]82-allan , although doubtless there are some who think [you]0-i wise , "[1887-i] [she]1887-i went on in the same mocking voice . " Well , [I]1887-i hold that this doctrine is built upon a rock of truth ; also , "[1887-i] [she]1887-i added after studying [me]0-i for a minute , " that in [your]0-i case [these three women]4226-these three women do not complete that circle . [I]1887-i think there is [a fourth who as yet is strange to [you]0-i in this life , though [you]0-i have known [her]4227-a fourth who as yet is strange to you in this life , though you have known her well enough in others well enough in others]4227-a fourth who as yet is strange to you in this life , though you have known her well enough in others . "[1887-i]

[I]0-i groaned , imagining that [she]1887-i alluded to [herself]1887-i , which was foolish of [me]0-i , for at once [she]1887-i read [my]0-i mind and went on with a rather acid little laugh ,

" No , no , not [the humble slave who sits before [you]0-i , whom , as [you]0-i have told [me]1887-i , it would please [you]0-i to reject as unworthy were [she]4227-a fourth who as yet is strange to you in this life , though you have known her well enough in others brought to [you]0-i in offering , as in the old days was done at the courts of [the great kings of [the East]47-the east]4229-the great kings of the east]4228-the humble slave who sits before you , whom , as you have told me , it would please you to reject as unworthy were she brought to you in offering , as in the old days was done at the courts of the great kings of the east . [O fool]4230-o fool , [fool]4231-fool ! who hold [yourself]0-i so strong and do not know that if [I]1887-i chose , before [yon]0-i shadow had moved a finger 's breadth , [I]1887-i could bring [you]0-i to [my]1887-i feet , praying that [you]0-i might be suffered to kiss [my]1887-i robe , yes , just the border of [my]1887-i robe . "[1887-i]

" Then [I]1887-i beg of [you]0-i not to choose , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , since [I]1887-i think that when there is work to be done by both of [us]4232-us , [we]4232-us shall find more comfort side by side than if [I]1887-i were on the ground seeking to kiss a garment that doubtless then it would delight [you]0-i to snatch away . "[1887-i]

At these words [her]1888-her whole attitude seemed to change . [I]0-i could see [her]1888-her lovely shape brace itself up , as it were , beneath [her]1888-her robes and felt in some way that [her]1888-her mind had also changed ; that it had rid [itself]1889-itself of mockery and [woman]325-woman 's pique and like a shifting searchlight , was directed upon some new objective .

" Work to be done , "[1888-her] [she]1888-her repeated after [me]0-i in a new voice . " Yes , [I]1888-her thank [you]0-i who bring it to [my]1888-her mind , since the hours pass and that work presses . Also [I]1888-her think there is a bargain to be made between [us]4232-us who are [both of the blood that keeps bargains]4233-both of the blood that keeps bargains , even if they be not written on a roll and signed and sealed . Why do [you]0-i come to [me]1888-her and what do [you]0-i seek of [me]1888-her , [Allan]82-allan , [Watcher - in - the - Night]4122-watcher - in - the - night ? "[1888-her]

Now [I]0-i hesitated , as what [I]0-i had to tell [her]1891-you seemed so foolish , indeed so insane , while [she]1891-you waited patiently as though to give [me]0-i time to shape [my]0-i thoughts . Speaking at last because [I]0-i must , [I]0-i said ,

" [I]0-i come to ask [you]1891-you , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , to show [me]0-i the dead , if [the dead]3534-the dead still live elsewhere . "[0-i]

" And who told [you]1891-you , [Allan]82-allan , that [I]0-i could show [you]1891-you the dead , if [they]3534-the dead are not truly dead ? " What token ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked innocently , though [I]0-i guessed [her]1892-her meaning well enough .

" [I]1892-her think - nay , let [me]1892-her be sure , "[1892-her] and half rising from the couch , [she]1892-her bent [her]1892-her heard over the tripod that [I]0-i have described , and stared into what seemed to be a crystal bowl . " Give it to [me]1892-her , "[1892-her] [she]1892-her said .

"[0-i]

[I]0-i admit , however , that it proved to have compensations , since even through the veil [I]0-i saw [her]1892-her marvellous eyes better than [I]0-i had done before , and something of the pure outline of [her]1892-her classic face ; also the fragrance of [her]1892-her hair was wonderful .

[She]1892-her took the talisman in [her]1892-her hand and examined it closely .

" [I]1892-her have heard of this charm and it is true that the thing has power , "[1892-her] [she]1892-her said , " for [I]1892-her can feel it running through [my]1892-her veins , also that it is a shield of defence to [him]4250-him who wears it . " Yes , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , the very picture , as [I]0-i think , carved by [himself]4250-him , though [he]4250-him said that it is ancient , and [others]279-others tell that it has been known in [the land]3243-the land for centuries . "[0-i]

" A little , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

"[0-i]

"[0-i]

"[1902-i]

Now [she]1902-i rose from [her]1902-i couch and descending off the dais , began to walk up and down [the chamber]1905-the chamber . [I]1902-i am not as [other women]3407-other women are , [O [Allan]82-allan , who having conquered the secrets of Nature]82-allan , "[1902-i] here [I]0-i felt an intense desire to ask what secrets , but remembered and held [my]0-i tongue , " to [my]1902-i sorrow have preserved [my]1902-i youth and beauty through many ages . " By [my]1902-i last birth [I]1902-i am [an Arab lady of royal blood]4275-an arab lady of royal blood , [a descendant of [the Kings of [the East]47-the east]4277-the kings of the east]4276-a descendant of the kings of the east . " At [Paphos]49-paphos in [the Isle of Chitim]4294-the isle of chitim [I]1902-i dwelt a while till [the folk of [that city]4296-that city]4295-the folk of that city thought that [I]1902-i was [Aphrodite]206-aphrodite returned to [earth]346-earth and sought to worship [me]1902-i . " It was a wondrous scene , "[1907-i] [she]1907-i added reflectively , " that of the cursing , since for every word [I]1907-i gave back two . Yet the curse fell in its season , since in [her]206-aphrodite day , doubt it or not , [Aphrodite]206-aphrodite had strength , as indeed under other names [she]206-aphrodite has and will have while [the world]277-the world endures , and for aught [I]1907-i know , beyond it . " No , only [her]206-aphrodite statues because of [their]4306-they beauty , though Love is always worshipped . "[84-ayesha]

" Yes , who can testify to that better than [you]82-allan [yourself]82-allan , [Allan]82-allan , if [he]4308-he who is called [Zikali]104-zikali tells [me]1907-i the truth concerning [you]82-allan in the dreams [he]4308-he sends ? "[1907-i]

Thinking it better not to enter on a discussion as to [Ayesha]84-ayesha 's shoulder , [I]0-i remained silent and [she]84-ayesha went on .

" [I]84-ayesha dwelt in [Egypt]51-egypt also , and there , to be rid of [men who wearied [me]84-ayesha with [their]4311-men who wearied me with their sighs and importunities sighs and importunities]4311-men who wearied me with their sighs and importunities , also to acquire more wisdom of which [she]84-ayesha was [the mistress]4312-the mistress , [I]84-ayesha entered the service of [the goddess [Isis]200-isis]4313-the goddess isis , [Queen of [Heaven]1310-heaven]4314-queen of heaven , vowing to remain virgin for ever . Yes , [kings]3464-kings would come to seek counsel from [me]84-ayesha where [I]84-ayesha sat throned , dressed in the garb of [Isis]200-isis and breathing out [her]200-isis power . Yet , [my]84-ayesha task accomplished , of it all [I]84-ayesha grew weary , as [men]3228-men will surely do of the heavens that [they]3228-men preach , should [they]3228-men chance to find [them]3228-men . "[84-ayesha]

[I]0-i wondered what this " task "[84-ayesha] might be , but only asked , " Why ? "[0-i]

" Because in [their]3228-men pictured heaven all things lie to [their]3228-men hands and [man]287-man , being [man]287-man , can not be happy without struggle , and [woman]325-woman , being [woman]325-woman , without victory over [others]279-others . What is cheaply bought , or given , has no value , [Allan]82-allan ; to be enjoyed , it must first be won . But [I]1908-i bade [you]1908-i not to break [my]1908-i thought . "[1908-i]

[I]0-i asked pardon and [she]1908-i went on ,

" Then it was that the shadow of the curse of [Aphrodite]206-aphrodite fell upon [me]1908-i , yes , and of the curse of [Isis]200-isis also , so that these twin maledictions have made [me]1908-i what [I]1908-i am , a lost soul dwelling in the wilderness waiting the fulfilment of a fate whereof [I]1908-i know not the end . For though [I]1908-i have all wisdom , all knowledge of the Past and much power together with the gift of life and beauty , the future is as dark to [me]1908-i as night without its moon and stars .[1908-i]

" [Hearken]132-hearken , this chanced to [me]1908-i . Though it be to [my]1908-i shame [I]1908-i tell it [you]1908-i that all may be clear . At [a temple of [Isis]200-isis on [the Nile]52-the nile where [I]1908-i ruled]4328-a temple of isis on the nile where i ruled , there was [a certain priest]4329-a certain priest , [a Greek by birth]4330-a greek by birth , vowed like [myself]1908-i to the service of [the goddess]4318-the goddess and therefore to [we]4332-we d none but [her]4318-the goddess , [the goddess [herself]4333-the goddess herself]4333-the goddess herself - that is , in the spirit . [He]4329-a certain priest was named [Kallikrates]95-kallikrates , [a man of courage and of beauty]4334-a man of courage and of beauty , such an one as [those Greeks carved in the statues of [[their]4335-those greeks carved in the statues of their god apollo god]4336-their god [Apollo]207-apollo]4335-those greeks carved in the statues of their god apollo . " [The Pharaoh of that day]4341-the pharaoh of that day , [the last of the native blood]4342-the last of the native blood , [him]4341-the pharaoh of that day whom [the Persians]208-the persians drove to doom , had [a daughter]4343-a daughter , [the Princess of [Egypt]51-egypt]4344-the princess of egypt , [Amenartas]209-amenartas by name , [a fair woman in [her]4343-a daughter fashion , though somewhat swarthy]4345-a fair woman in her fashion , though somewhat swarthy . Indeed , [she]4343-a daughter brought blood upon [his]4341-the pharaoh of that day hands because of [her]4343-a daughter , wherefore [he]4341-the pharaoh of that day fled to [Isis]200-isis for forgiveness and for peace . [Thither]211-thither in after time [she]4343-a daughter followed [him]4341-the pharaoh of that day and again urged [her]4343-a daughter love .[1908-i]

" Learning of the thing and knowing it for sacrilege , [I]1908-i summoned [this priest]4348-this priest and warned [him]4348-this priest of [his]4348-this priest danger and of the doom which awaited [him]4348-this priest should [he]4348-this priest continue in that path . [He]4348-this priest grew affrighted . [He]4348-this priest flung [himself]4348-this priest upon the ground before [me]1908-i with groans and supplications , and kissing [my]1908-i feet , vowed most falsely to [me]1908-i that [his]4348-this priest dealings with [the royal Amenartas]4349-the royal amenartas were but a veil and that it was [I]1908-i whom [he]4348-this priest worshipped . [His]4348-this priest unhallowed words filled [me]1908-i with horror and sternly [I]1908-i bade [him]4348-this priest begone and do penance for [his]4348-this priest crime , saying that [I]1908-i would pray [the goddess]4318-the goddess on behalf of [him]4348-this priest .[1908-i]

" [He]4348-this priest went , leaving [me]1908-i alone lost in thought in [the darkening shrine]4351-the darkening shrine . Then sleep fell on [me]1908-i and in [my]1908-i sleep [I]1908-i dreamed a dream , or saw a vision . For suddenly there stood before [me]1908-i [a woman beauteous as [myself]1908-i clad in nothing save a golden girdle and a veil of gossamer]4352-a woman beauteous as myself clad in nothing save a golden girdle and a veil of gossamer .[1908-i]

" ' O [Ayesha]84-ayesha , ' [she]4318-the goddess said in a honeyed voice , ' [priestess of [Isis of the Egyptians]200-isis , sworn to the barren worship of [Isis]200-isis and fed on the ashes of [her]200-isis unprofitable wisdom]4353-priestess of isis of the egyptians , sworn to the barren worship of isis and fed on the ashes of her unprofitable wisdom , know that [I]1908-i am [Aphrodite]206-aphrodite of [the Greeks whom many times [thou]4355-thou hast mocked and defied , and Queen of [the breathing world]4356-the breathing world]4354-the greeks whom many times thou hast mocked and defied , and queen of the breathing world , as [Isis]200-isis is Queen of [the world that is dead]4357-the world that is dead . Now because [thou]4355-thou didst despise [me]1908-i and pour contempt upon [my]1908-i name , [I]1908-i smite [thee]4355-thou with [my]1908-i strength and lay a curse upon [thee]4355-thou . It is that [thou]4355-thou shalt love and desire [this man who but now hath kissed [thy]4355-thou feet , ever longing till [the world]277-the world 's end]4358-this man who but now hath kissed thy feet , ever longing till the world 's end to kiss [his]4358-this man who but now hath kissed thy feet , ever longing till the world 's end lips in payment , although [thou]4355-thou art as far above [him]4358-this man who but now hath kissed thy feet , ever longing till the world 's end as the moon [thou]4355-thou servest is above [the Nile]52-the nile . Think not that [thou]4355-thou shalt escape [my]1908-i doom , for know that however strong the spirit , here upon [the earth]285-the earth the flesh is stronger still and of all flesh [I]1908-i am [the queen]4361-the queen . '[1908-i]

" Then [she]4355-thou laughed softly and smiting [me]1908-i across the eyes with a lock of [her]4355-thou scented hair , was gone .[1908-i]

" [Allan]82-allan , [I]1908-i awoke from [my]1908-i sleep and a great trouble fell upon [me]1908-i , for [I]1908-i who had never loved before now was rent with a rage of love and for [this man who till that moment had been naught to [me]1908-i but as some beauteous image of gold and ivory]4362-this man who till that moment had been naught to me but as some beauteous image of gold and ivory . [I]1908-i longed for [him]4358-this man who but now hath kissed thy feet , ever longing till the world 's end , [my]1908-i heart was racked with jealousy because of [the Egyptian who favoured [him]4358-this man who but now hath kissed thy feet , ever longing till the world 's end]4363-the egyptian who favoured him , an eating flame possessed [my]1908-i breast . [I]1908-i grew mad . There in [the shrine of [Isis]200-isis]4364-the shrine of isis the divine [I]1908-i cast [myself]1908-i upon [my]1908-i knees and cried to [Aphrodite]206-aphrodite to return and give [me]1908-i [him]4358-this man who but now hath kissed thy feet , ever longing till the world 's end [I]1908-i sought , for whose sake [I]1908-i would renounce all else , even if [I]1908-i must pour [my]1908-i wisdom into a beauteous , empty cup . Yes , thus [I]1908-i prayed and lay upon the ground and wept until , outworn , once more sleep fell upon [me]1908-i .[1908-i]

" Now in the darkness of [the holy place]4365-the holy place once more there came a dream or vision , since before [me]1908-i in [her]200-isis glory stood [the goddess [Isis]200-isis crowned with the crescent of the young moon]4366-the goddess isis crowned with the crescent of the young moon and holding in [her]200-isis hand the jewelled sistrum that is [her]200-isis symbol , from which came music like to the melody of distant bells . [She]200-isis gazed at [me]1908-i and in [her]200-isis great eyes were scorn and anger .[1908-i]

" ' O [Ayesha]84-ayesha , [Daughter of Wisdom]4367-daughter of wisdom , ' [she]200-isis said in a solemn voice , ' whom [I]1908-i , [Isis]200-isis , had come to look upon rather as [a child]1173-a child than [a servant]4369-a servant , since in none other of [[my]1908-i priestesses]4370-my priestesses was such greatness to be found , and whom in a day to be [I]1908-i had purposed to raise to the very steps of [my]1908-i heavenly throne , [thou]4371-thou hast broken [thine]4371-thou oath and , forsaking [me]1908-i , hast worshipped [false Aphrodite of [the Greeks who is [mine]1908-i enemy]4373-the greeks who is mine enemy]4372-false aphrodite of the greeks who is mine enemy . Yea , in the eternal war between the spirit and the flesh , [thou]4371-thou hast chosen the part of flesh . Therefore [I]1908-i hate [thee]4371-thou and add [my]1908-i doom to that which [Aphrodite]206-aphrodite laid upon [thee]4371-thou , which , hadst [thou]4371-thou prayed to [me]1908-i and not to [her]206-aphrodite , [I]1908-i would have lifted from [thy]4371-thou heart .[1908-i]

" ' Hearken ! The Grecian whom [thou]4371-thou hast chosen , by [Aphrodite]206-aphrodite 's will , [thou]4371-thou shalt love as [the Pathian]4374-the pathian said . More , [thy]4371-thou love shall bring [his]4374-the pathian blood upon [thy]4371-thou hands , nor mayest [thou]4371-thou follow [him]4374-the pathian to the grave . For [I]1908-i will show [thee]4371-thou the Source of Life and [thou]4371-thou shalt drink of it to make [thyself]4375-thyself more fair even than [thou]4371-thou art and thus outpace [[thy]4371-thou rival]4376-thy rival , and when [[thy]4371-thou lover]4377-thy lover is dead , in [a desolate place]4378-a desolate place [thou]4371-thou shalt wait in grief and solitude till [he]4374-the pathian is born again and find [thee]4371-thou there .[1908-i]

" ' Yet shall this be but the beginning of [thy]4371-thou sorrows , since through all time [thou]4371-thou shalt pursue [thy]4371-thou fate till at length [thou]4371-thou canst draw up [this man]427-this man to the height on which [thine]4371-thou own soul stands by the ropes of love and loss and suffering . Moreover through it all [thou]4371-thou shalt despise [thyself]4380-thyself , which is [man]287-man 's and [woman]325-woman 's hardest lot , [thou]4371-thou who having the rare feast of spirit spread out before [thee]4371-thou , hast chosen to fill thyself from the troughs of flesh . '[1908-i]

" Then , [Allan]82-allan , in [my]1908-i dream [I]1908-i made a proud answer to [the goddess]4318-the goddess , saying , ' Hear [me]1908-i , [mighty mistress of [many Forms who dost appear in all that lives]4385-many forms who dost appear in all that lives]4384-mighty mistress of many forms who dost appear in all that lives ! An evil fate has fallen upon [me]1908-i , but was it [I]1908-i who chose that fate ? Can the leaf contend against the driving gale ? Can the falling stone turn upwards to the sky , or when Nature draws it , can the tide cease to flow ? [A goddess whom [I]1908-i have offended]4386-a goddess whom i have offended , that goddess whose strength causes [the whole world]4387-the whole world to be , has laid [her]4386-a goddess whom i have offended curse upon [me]1908-i and because [I]1908-i have bent before the storm , as bend [I]1908-i must , or break , [another goddess whom [I]1908-i serve]4388-another goddess whom i serve , [thou]4371-thou thyself , [Mother Isis]212-isis , hast added to the curse . Where then is [Justice]213-justice , [O Lady of [the Moon]54-the moon]4389-o lady of the moon ? '[1908-i]

" ' Not here , [Woman]325-woman , ' [she]4386-a goddess whom i have offended answered . ' Yet far away [Justice]213-justice lives and shall be won at last and mayhap because [thou]4371-thou art so proud and high - stomached , it is laid upon [thee]4371-thou to seek [her]4386-a goddess whom i have offended blinded eyes through many an age . Yet at last [I]1908-i think [thou]4371-thou shalt set [thy]4371-thou sins against [her]4386-a goddess whom i have offended weights and find the balance even . Therefore cease from questioning the high decrees of destiny which [thou]4371-thou canst not understand and be content to suffer , remembering that all joy grows from the root of pain . Moreover , know this for [thy]4371-thou comfort , that the wisdom which [thou]4371-thou hast shall grow and gather on [thee]4371-thou and with it [thy]4371-thou beauty and [thy]4371-thou power ; also that at the last [thou]4371-thou shalt look upon [my]1908-i face again , in token whereof [I]1908-i leave to [thee]4371-thou [my]1908-i symbol , the sistrum that [I]1908-i bear , and with it this command . Follow [that false priest of [mine]1908-i]4391-that false priest of mine wherever [he]4391-that false priest of mine may go and avenge [me]1908-i upon [him]4391-that false priest of mine , and if [thou]4371-thou lose [him]4391-that false priest of mine there , wait while the generations pass till [he]4391-that false priest of mine return again . Such and no other is [thy]4371-thou destiny . '[1908-i]

" Allan , the vision faded and when [I]1909-her awoke the lights of dawn played upon the image of [the goddess]4318-the goddess in [the sanctuary]4393-the sanctuary . [They]4394-they played , moreover , upon the holy jewelled thing that in [my]1909-her dream [her]4318-the goddess hand had held , the sistrum of [her]4318-the goddess worship , shaped like the loop of life , the magic symbol that [she]4318-the goddess had vowed to [me]1909-her , wherewith goes [her]4318-the goddess power , which henceforth was [mine]1909-her .[1909-her]

" [I]1909-her took it and followed after [the priest [Kallikrates]95-kallikrates , to whom thenceforward [I]1909-her was bound by passion 's ties that are stronger than [all the goddesses in [this wide universe]4397-this wide universe]4396-all the goddesses in this wide universe]4395-the priest kallikrates , to whom thenceforward i was bound by passion 's ties that are stronger than all the goddesses in this wide universe . "[1909-her]

Here [I]0-i , [Allan]82-allan , could contain [myself]0-i no longer and asked , " What for ? "[1909-her] then , fearing [her]1909-her wrath , wished that [I]0-i had been silent .

But [she]1909-her was not angry , perhaps because this tale of [her]1909-her interviews with [goddesses]1910-goddesses , doubtless fabled , had made [her]1909-her humble , for [she]1909-her answered quietly ,

" By [Aphrodite]206-aphrodite , or by [Isis]212-isis , or both of [them]1910-goddesses [I]1909-her did not know . All [I]1909-her knew was that [I]1909-her must seek [him]4398-him , then and evermore , as seek [I]1909-her do to - day and shall perchance through æons yet unborn . So [I]1909-her followed , as [I]1909-her was taught and commanded , [the sistrum]4399-the sistrum being [[my]1909-her guide]4400-my guide , how it matters not , and giving [me]1909-her the means , and so at last [I]1909-her came to [this ancient land whereof the ruin in which [you]0-i sit was once known as [K"r]1-k"r]4401-this ancient land whereof the ruin in which you sit was once known as k"r[1909-her] . "[1909-her]

CHAPTER XIV

ALLAN MISSES OPPORTUNITY

All the while that [she]1909-her was talking thus [the Lady]3811-the lady or [the Queen]4361-the queen or [the Witch - woman]1913-the witch - woman , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , had been walking up and down [the place]328-the place from the curtains to the foot of the dais , sweeping [me]0-i with [her]1909-her scented robes as [she]1909-her passed to and fro , and as [she]1909-her walked [she]1909-her waved [her]1909-her arms as [an orator]1915-an orator might do to emphasise the more moving passages of [her]1909-her tale . Now at the end of it , or what [I]0-i took to be the end , [she]1909-her stepped on to the dais and sank upon the couch as if exhausted , though [I]0-i think [her]1909-her spirit was weary rather than [her]1909-her body .

Here [she]1909-her sat awhile , brooding , [her]1909-her chin resting on [her]1909-her hand , then suddenly looked up and fixing [her]1909-her glance upon [me]0-i - for [I]0-i could see the flash of it through [her]1909-her thin veil - said ,

" What think [you]0-i of this story , [Allan]82-allan ? Do [you]0-i believe it and have [you]0-i ever heard its like ? "[1909-her]

" Never , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered with emphasis , " and of course [I]0-i believe every word . Only there are one or two questions that with [your]0-i leave [I]0-i would wish to ask , [Ayesha]84-ayesha . "[0-i]

" By which [you]0-i mean , [Allan]82-allan , that [you]0-i believe nothing , being by nature without faith and doubtful of all that [you]0-i can not see and touch and handle . Well , perhaps [you]0-i are wise , since what [I]0-i have told [you]0-i is not all the truth . For example , it comes back to [me]0-i now that it was not in [the temple on [the Nile]52-the nile]4402-the temple on the nile , or indeed upon [the Earth]55-the earth , that [I]0-i saw the vision of [Aphrodite]206-aphrodite and of [Isis]212-isis , but elsewhere ; also that it was here in [K"r]1-k"r[0-i] that [I]0-i was first consumed by passion for [Kallikrates]95-kallikrates whom hitherto [I]0-i had scorned . In two thousand years one forgets much , [Allan]82-allan . Out with [your]82-allan questions and [I]0-i will answer them , unless they be too long . "[0-i]

" [Ayesha]84-ayesha , "[0-i] [I]0-i said humbly , reflecting to [myself]0-i that [my]0-i questions would , at any rate , be shorter than [her]82-allan varying tale , " even [I]0-i who am not learned have heard of [these goddesses of whom [you]82-allan speak]4403-these goddesses of whom you speak , of [the Grecian Aphrodite who rose from [the sea]3206-the sea upon [the shores of [Cyprus]56-cyprus]4406-the shores of cyprus and dwelt at [Paphos]49-paphos and elsewhere]4404-the grecian aphrodite who rose from the sea upon the shores of cyprus and dwelt at paphos and elsewhere - - "[0-i]

" Yes , doubtless like most men [you]0-i have heard of [her]4404-the grecian aphrodite who rose from the sea upon the shores of cyprus and dwelt at paphos and elsewhere and perchance also have been struck across the eyes with [her]4404-the grecian aphrodite who rose from the sea upon the shores of cyprus and dwelt at paphos and elsewhere hair , like [your]0-i betters before [you]0-i , "[82-allan] [she]82-allan interrupted with sarcasm .

" - - Also , "[0-i] [I]0-i went on , avoiding argument , " [I]0-i have heard of [Isis of the Egyptians]200-isis , [Lady of the Moon]4407-lady of the moon , [Mother of Mysteries]4408-mother of mysteries , [Spouse of [Osiris]214-osiris whose child was [Horus the Avenger]187-avenger]4409-spouse of osiris whose child was horus the avenger . "[0-i]

" Aye , and [I]82-allan think will hear more of [her]4404-the grecian aphrodite who rose from the sea upon the shores of cyprus and dwelt at paphos and elsewhere before [you]0-i have done , [Allan]82-allan , for now something comes back to [me]82-allan concerning [you]0-i and [her]4404-the grecian aphrodite who rose from the sea upon the shores of cyprus and dwelt at paphos and elsewhere and another . [I]82-allan am not [the only one who has broken the oaths of [Isis]200-isis and received [her]200-isis curse , [Allan]82-allan , as [you]0-i may find out in the days to come . But what of [these heavenly queens]4411-these heavenly queens]4410-the only one who has broken the oaths of isis and received her curse , allan , as you may find out in the days to come . but what of these heavenly queens ? "[82-allan]

" Only this , [Ayesha]84-ayesha ; [I]0-i have been taught that [they]4411-these heavenly queens were but phantasms fabled by [men with many another false divinity]4412-men with many another false divinity , and could have sworn that this was true . And yet [you]0-i talk of [them]4411-these heavenly queens as real and living , which perplexes [me]0-i . "[0-i]

" Being dull of understanding doubtless it perplexes [you]0-i , [Allan]82-allan . Yet if [you]0-i had imagination [you]0-i might understand that [these goddesses]4413-these goddesses are great Principles of Nature ; [Isis]200-isis , of throned Wisdom and strait virtue , and [Aphrodite]206-aphrodite , of Love , as it is known to [men]3228-men and women who , being human , have it laid upon [them]4415-their that [they]4415-their must hand on the torch of Life in [their]4415-their little hour . Also [you]0-i would know that such Principles can seem to take shape and form and at certain ages of [the world]277-the world appear to [[their]4415-their servants]4417-their servants visible in majesty , though perchance to - day [others with changed names]4418-others with changed names wield [their]4418-others with changed names sceptres and work [their]4418-others with changed names will . Now [you]0-i are answered on this matter . So to the next . "[82-allan]

Privately [I]0-i did not feel as though [I]0-i were answered at all and [I]0-i was sure that [I]0-i know nothing of the kind [she]1916-she indicated , but thinking it best to leave the subject , [I]0-i went on ,

" If [I]0-i understood rightly , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , the events which [you]84-ayesha have been pleased first to describe to [me]0-i , and then to qualify or contradict , took place when [the Pharaohs]4419-the pharaohs reigned . Now [no Pharaoh]4420-no pharaoh has sat upon the throne of [Egypt]51-egypt for near two thousand years , for the last was [a Grecian woman whom [the Romans]1827-the romans conquered and drove to death]4421-a grecian woman whom the romans conquered and drove to death . And yet , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , [you]0-i speak as though [you]0-i have lived all through that gulf of time , and in this there must be error , because it is impossible . Therefore [I]0-i suppose [you]0-i to mean that this history has come down to [you]0-i in writing , or perhaps in dreams . [I]0-i believe that even in such far - off times there were [writers of romance]4423-writers of romance , and [we]4424-we all know of what stuff dreams are made . At least this thought comes to [me]0-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i added hurriedly , fearing lest [I]0-i had said too much , " and one so wise as [you]0-i are , [I]0-i repeat , knows well that [a woman who says [she]4425-a woman who says she has lived two thousand years has lived two thousand years]4425-a woman who says she has lived two thousand years must be mad or - suffer from delusions , because [I]0-i repeat , it is impossible . "[0-i]

At these quite innocent remarks [she]1917-i sprang to [her]1917-i feet in a rage that might truly be called royal in every sense .

" Impossible ! Romance ! Dreams ! Delusions ! Mad ! "[1917-i] [she]1917-i cried in a ringing voice . " Oh ! of a truth [you]0-i weary [me]1917-i , and [I]1917-i have a mind to send [you]0-i whither [you]0-i will learn what is impossible and what is not . Indeed , [I]1917-i would do it , and now , only [I]1917-i need [your]0-i services , and if [I]1917-i did there would be none left for [me]1917-i to talk with , since [[your]0-i companion]4151-your companion is moonstruck and the others are but savages of whom [I]1917-i have seen enough .[1917-i]

" Hearken , [fool]4231-fool ! Nothing is impossible . Why do [you]0-i seek , [you]0-i who talk of the impossible , to girdle [the great world]4428-the great world in the span of [your]0-i two hands and to weigh the secrets of [the Universe]57-the universe in the balance of [your]0-i petty mind and , of that which [you]0-i can not understand , to say that it is not ? Life [you]0-i admit because [you]0-i see it all about [you]0-i . But that it should endure for two thousand years , which after all is but a second 's beat in [the story of [the earth]285-the earth]4429-the story of the earth , that to [you]0-i is ' impossible , ' although in truth the buried seed or the sealed - up toad can live as long . Doubtless , also , [you]0-i have some faith which promises [you]0-i this same boon to all eternity , after the little change called Death .[1917-i]

" Nay , [Allan]82-allan , it is possible enough , like to many other things of which [you]0-i do not dream to - day that will be common to the eyes of those who follow after [you]0-i . Mayhap [you]0-i think it impossible that [I]1917-i should speak with and learn of [you]0-i from [yonder old black wizard who dwells in [the country whence [you]0-i came]4432-the country whence you came . And yet whenever [I]1917-i will [I]1917-i do so in the night because [he]4433-he is in tune with [me]1917-i , and what [I]1917-i do shall be done by [all men]4434-all men in the years unborn]4431-yonder old black wizard who dwells in the country whence you came . and yet whenever i will i do so in the night because he is in tune with me , and what i do shall be done by all men in the years unborn . Yes , [they]4434-all men shall talk together across [the wide spaces of [the earth]285-the earth]4435-the wide spaces of the earth , and [the lover]3280-the lover shall hear [[her]3280-the lover lover]4438-her lover 's voice although great seas roll between [them]4434-all men . Nor perchance will it stop at this ; perchance in future time [men]3228-men shall hold converse with [the denizens of the stars]4440-the denizens of the stars , and even with [the dead who have passed into silence and the darkness]4441-the dead who have passed into silence and the darkness . Do [you]0-i hear and understand [me]1917-i ? "[1917-i]

" Yes , yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered feebly .

" [You]0-i lie , as [you]0-i are too prone to do . [You]0-i hear but [you]0-i do not understand nor believe , and oh ! [you]0-i vex [me]1917-i sorely . Now [I]1917-i had it in [my]1917-i mind to tell [you]0-i the secret of this long life of [mine]1917-i ; long , mark [you]0-i , but not endless , for doubtless [I]1917-i must die and change and return again , like others , and even to show [you]0-i how it may be won . But [you]0-i are not worthy in [your]0-i faithlessness . "[1917-i]

" No , no , [I]0-i am not worthy , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , who at that moment did not feel the least desire to live two thousand years , perhaps with [this woman]533-this woman as [a neighbour]1919-a neighbour , rating [me]0-i from generation to generation . Yet it is true , that now when [I]0-i am older and a certain event can not be postponed much longer , [I]0-i do often regret that [I]0-i neglected to take this unique chance , if in truth there was one , of prolonging an existence which after all has its consolations - especially when [one]1415-one has made one 's pile . Certainly it is a case , a flagrant case , of neglected opportunities , and [my]0-i only consolation for having lost them is that this was due to the uprightness of [my]0-i nature which made it so hard for [me]0-i to acquiesce in alternative statements that [I]0-i had every cause to disbelieve and thus to give offence to [a very powerful and petulant if attractive lady]1921-a very powerful and petulant if attractive lady .

" So that is done with , "[533-this woman] [she]533-this woman went on with a little stamp of indignation , " as soon [you]0-i will be also , who , had [you]0-i not crossed and doubted [me]533-this woman , might have lived on for untold time and become one of [the masters of [the world]277-the world]4442-the masters of the world , as [I]533-this woman am . "[533-this woman]

Here [she]533-this woman paused , choked , [I]0-i think , with [her]533-this woman almost childish anger , and because [I]0-i could not help it , [I]0-i said ,

" Such place and power , if [they]4444-they be [yours]0-i , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , do not seem to bring [you]533-this woman much reward . If [I]0-i were [a master of [the world]277-the world]4445-a master of the world [I]0-i do not think that [I]0-i should choose to dwell unchangingly among [savages who eat [men]3228-men and in a pile of ruins]4447-savages who eat men and in a pile of ruins . This bold argument - for now [I]0-i see that it was bold - seemed to astonish and even bewilder [[my]0-i wonderful companion]1922-my wonderful companion .

" [You]0-i have more wisdom than [I]1922-my wonderful companion thought , "[1922-my wonderful companion] [she]1922-my wonderful companion said reflectively , " who have come to understand that [no one]3323-no one is really [lord of anything]4451-lord of anything , since above there is always [a more powerful lord who withers all [his]4452-a more powerful lord who withers all his pomp and pride to nothingness , even as the great kings learned in olden days pomp and pride to nothingness , even as [the great kings]4453-the great kings learned in olden days]4452-a more powerful lord who withers all his pomp and pride to nothingness , even as the great kings learned in olden days , and [I]1922-my wonderful companion , who am higher than [they]4453-the great kings are , am learning now . [Hearken]132-hearken . "[1922-my wonderful companion]

" What must [we]4460-we do to gain these things ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " How can [we]4460-we humble creatures help one who is all powerful and who has gathered in [her]4461-her breast the infinite knowledge of two thousand years ? "[0-i]

" [Ra]215-ra was the sun , was [he]4469-this god not ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Aye , and [Rezu]88-rezu also was [a sun - god whom from [his]88-rezu throne in the fires of [the Lord of Day]4476-the lord of day]4475-a sun - god whom from his throne in the fires of the lord of day , gave life to [men]3228-men , or slew [them]3228-men if [he]88-rezu willed with [his]88-rezu thunderbolts of drought and pestilence and storm . "[88-rezu]

" Did [you]88-rezu see this great pestilence ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , much interested .

" Nay , it befell generations before [I]0-i came to [K"r]1-k"r[0-i] . "[1820-a priest]

" What brought [you]84-ayesha to [K"r]1-k"r[84-ayesha] , [Ayesha]84-ayesha ? " [I]84-ayesha asked irrelevantly .[84-ayesha]

"[1940-i]

" Aye , [I]84-ayesha found [them]4502-a certain pair , one of whom had broken his oaths to her , or rather [they]4502-a certain pair , one of whom had broken his oaths to her found [me]84-ayesha , and in [my]84-ayesha presence [the goddess]4318-the goddess executed [her]4318-the goddess decree upon [[her]4318-the goddess false priest]4504-her false priest and drove [[his]4504-her false priest temptress]4505-his temptress back to [the world]277-the world . "[84-ayesha]

" That must have been dreadful for [you]84-ayesha , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , since [I]1941-i understood that [you]84-ayesha also - liked [this priest]4348-this priest . "[1941-i]

[She]1941-i sprang from [her]1941-i couch and in a low , hissing voice which resembled the sound made by an angry snake and turned [my]0-i blood cold to hear , exclaimed ,

" [Man]287-man , do [you]287-man dare to mock [me]1941-i ? Nay , [you]287-man are but [a blundering , curious fool]4509-a blundering , curious fool , and it is well for [you]0-i that this is so , since otherwise like [Kallikrates]95-kallikrates , never should [you]0-i leave [K"r]1-k"r[1941-i] living . " [Stranger]4510-stranger , "[200-isis] [she]200-isis went on in a softer voice , " perchance [your]0-i faith , whate'er it be , parades a hell to terrify [[its]4511-its worshippers]4512-its worshippers and give strength to the arms of [[its]4511-its prophesying priests]4513-its prophesying priests , who swear [they]4513-its prophesying priests [hold the keys of doom or of the eternal joys]4514-hold the keys of doom or of the eternal joys . "[0-i]

[She]200-isis sank down upon the couch as though exhausted by emotion , of which [I]0-i could only guess the reasons , hiding [her]200-isis face in [her]200-isis hands . Presently [she]200-isis let them fall again and continued ,

" Of these woes ask [me]200-isis no more . ' Twas near the mark ; nearer , [Allan]82-allan , than [you]0-i know , not in it ! Therefore leave [them]4513-its prophesying priests to [their]4513-its prophesying priests sleep as [I]200-isis would if [I]200-isis might - ah ! if [I]200-isis might , whose companions [they]4513-its prophesying priests are throughout the weary ages . " Look [you]0-i , [Wanderer]4519-wanderer , after that which was fated had happened and [I]200-isis remained in [my]200-isis agony of solitude and sorrow , after , too , [I]200-isis had drunk of the cup of enduring life and like the Prometheus of old fable , found [myself]200-isis bound to [this changeless rock]4520-this changeless rock , whereon day by day the vultures of remorse tear out [my]200-isis living heart which in the watches of the night is ever doomed to grow again within [[my]200-isis woman]4521-my woman 's breast , [I]200-isis was plunged into petty troubles of the flesh , aye and welcomed [them]4513-its prophesying priests because [their]4513-its prophesying priests irk at times gave [me]200-isis forgetfulness . " ' Here , ' [they]4522-the savage dwellers in this land said , ' is [the goddess [Lulala]217-lulala]4530-the goddess lulala come to [earth]346-earth . "[200-isis]

" Why not ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" For this reason , [Allan]82-allan . In some past age [[his]88-rezu god]4537-his god showed [him]88-rezu the same secret that was shown to [me]200-isis . "[200-isis]

" Then what spear can ? "[0-i] [I]0-i inquired helplessly , who was bewildered .

" None at all , [Allan]82-allan , yet an axe may , as [you]82-allan shall hear , or so [I]0-i think . "[217-lulala]

" It is , [Allan]82-allan , since presently [he]1947-their chief rezu will give it out that [I]1949-i am dead or fled , if [he]1947-their chief rezu has not done so already , and that [this new queen]4546-this new queen has arisen in [my]1949-i place . [You]1958-you are thinking in [your]1958-you heart that [such savages]1959-such savages would be little loss and this is so , but still [they]1959-such savages serve as slaves to [me]0-i in [my]0-i loneliness . "[1960-those who trusted in she - who - commands]

" What do [you]0-i mean about an axe , [Ayesha]84-ayesha ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " Why can an axe alone kill [Rezu]88-rezu ? "[0-i]

" The thing is a mystery , [O Allan]82-allan , of which [I]1960-those who trusted in she - who - commands may not tell [you]1958-you all , since to do so [I]1960-those who trusted in she - who - commands must reveal secrets which [I]1960-those who trusted in she - who - commands have determined [you]1958-you shall not learn . Suffice it to [you]1958-you to know that when [this Rezu]1955-this rezu drank of the Cup of Life [he]1955-this rezu took with [him]1955-this rezu [his]1955-this rezu axe . Now this axe was an ancient weapon rumoured to have been fashioned by [the gods]4548-the gods and , as it chanced , that axe drew to itself more and stronger life than did [Rezu]88-rezu , how , it does not matter , if indeed the tale be more than a fable . At least this [I]1960-those who trusted in she - who - commands know is true , for [[he]1955-this rezu who guarded the Gate of Life]4549-he who guarded the gate of life , [a certain Noot]4550-a certain noot , [a master of mysteries]4551-a master of mysteries , and [mine]1960-those who trusted in she - who - commands also in [my]1960-those who trusted in she - who - commands day of youth , who being [a philosopher and very wise]4552-a philosopher and very wise , chose never to pass that portal which was open to [him]1955-this rezu , said it to [me]1960-those who trusted in she - who - commands [himself]1955-this rezu ere [he]1955-this rezu went the way of flesh . [He]1955-this rezu told [this Rezu]1955-this rezu also that now [he]1955-this rezu had naught to fear save [his]1955-this rezu own axe and therefore [he]1955-this rezu counselled [him]1955-this rezu to guard it well , since if it was lifted against [him]1955-this rezu in another 's hands it would bring [him]1955-this rezu down to death , which nothing else could do . Like to the heel of [Achilles]219-achilles whereof [the great Homer]4554-the great homer sings - have [you]0-i read [Homer]220-homer , [Allan]82-allan ? "[1960-those who trusted in she - who - commands]

" In a translation , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" Good , then [you]0-i will remember the story . Like to the heel of [Achilles]219-achilles , [I]1960-those who trusted in she - who - commands say , that axe would be the only gate by which death could enter [his]1955-this rezu invulnerable flesh , or rather it alone could make the gate . "[1960-those who trusted in she - who - commands]

" How did [Noot]221-noot know that ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [I]1962-i can not say , "[1962-i] [she]1962-i answered with irritation . " Perchance [he]1955-this rezu did not know it . Perchance it is all an idle tale , but at least it is true that [Rezu]88-rezu believed and believes it , and what [a man]3551-a man believes is true for [him]3551-a man and will certainly befall . If it were otherwise , what is the use of faith which in a thousand forms supports [[our]4556-our race]4557-our race and holds it from the horrors of the Pit ? Only [those who believe nothing]4558-those who believe nothing inherit what [they]4558-those who believe nothing believe - nothing , [Allan]82-allan . "[1962-i]

" It may be so , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied prosaically , " but what happened about the axe ? "[0-i]

" In the end it was lost , or as some say stolen by [a woman whom [Rezu]88-rezu had deserted]4559-a woman whom rezu had deserted , and therefore [he]88-rezu walks [the world]277-the world in fear from day to day . Nay , ask no more empty questions "[0-i] [I]0-i had opened [my]0-i mouth to speak " but hear the end of the tale . In [my]0-i trouble concerning [Rezu]88-rezu [I]0-i remembered this wild legend of the axe and since , when lost in [a forest]4561-a forest every path that may lead to safety should be explored , [I]0-i sent [my]0-i wisdom forth to make inquiry concerning it , as [I]0-i who am great , have the power to do , of certain who are in tune with [me]0-i throughout [this wide land of [Africa]10-africa]4562-this wide land of africa . Amongst others , [I]0-i inquired of [that old wizard whom [you]4564-you named [Zikali]104-zikali , Opener of Roads]4563-that old wizard whom you named zikali , opener of roads , and [he]4563-that old wizard whom you named zikali , opener of roads gave [me]0-i an answer that there lived in [his]4563-that old wizard whom you named zikali , opener of roads land a certain warrior who ruled [a tribe called [the People of the Axe]3274-the people of the axe by right of the Axe , of which axe [none]540-none , not even [he]4563-that old wizard whom you named zikali , opener of roads]4565-a tribe called the people of the axe by right of the axe , of which axe none , not even he , knew the beginning or the legend . On the chance , though it was a small one , [I]0-i bade [the wizard]4568-the wizard send [that warrior]4569-that warrior here with [his]4569-that warrior axe . Last night [he]4569-that warrior stood before [me]0-i and [I]0-i looked upon [him]4569-that warrior and the axe , which at least is ancient and has a story . Whether it be the same that [Rezu]88-rezu bore [I]0-i do not know who never saw it , yet perchance [he]4569-that warrior who bears it now is prepared to hold it aloft in battle even against [Rezu]88-rezu , though [he]4569-that warrior be terrible to see , and then [we]4570-we shall learn . "[0-i]

" Oh ! yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " [he]4569-that warrior is quite prepared , for that is [his]4569-that warrior nature . Also among [[this man]427-this man 's people]4572-this man 's people , [the holder of the Axe]516-the holder of the axe is thought to be unconquerable . "[0-i]

" Yet [some]4574-some must have been conquered who held it , "[1963-she] [she]1963-she replied musingly . " Well , [you]0-i shall tell [me]1963-she that tale later . Now [we]4570-we have talked long and [you]0-i are weary and astonished . Go , eat and rest [yourself]0-i . To - night when the moon rises [I]1963-she will come to where [you]0-i are , not before , for [I]1963-she have much that must be done , and show [you]0-i those with whom [you]0-i must fight against [Rezu]88-rezu , and make a plan of battle . "[1963-she]

" But [I]0-i do not want to fight , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " who have fought enough and came here to seek wisdom , not bloodshed . "[0-i]

" First the sacrifice , then the reward , "[1963-she] [she]1963-she answered , " that is if any are left to be rewarded . [Farewell]222-farewell . "[1963-she]

CHAPTER XV

ROBERTSON IS LOST

So [I]0-i went and was conducted by [Billali]93-billali , [the old chamberlain]1964-the old chamberlain , for such seemed to be [[his]1964-the old chamberlain office]1965-his office , who had been waiting patiently without all this while , back to [[our]1966-our rest - house]1967-our rest - house . On [my]0-i way [I]0-i picked up [Hans]87-hans , whom [I]0-i found sitting outside the arch , and found that as usual that worthy had been keeping [his]87-hans eyes and ears open .

" [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans said , " did [the White Witch]3261-the white witch tell [you]121-baas that there is a big impi encamped over yonder outside [the houses]4576-the houses , in what looks like [a great dry ditch]4577-a great dry ditch , and on [the edge of [the plain beyond]4579-the plain beyond]4578-the edge of the plain beyond ? "[87-hans]

" No , [Hans]87-hans , but [she]3261-the white witch said that this evening [she]3261-the white witch would show [us]1966-our [those in whose company [we]1966-our must fight]4580-those in whose company we must fight . "[0-i]

" Well , [Baas]121-baas , [they]4580-those in whose company we must fight are there , some thousands of [them]4580-those in whose company we must fight , for [I]87-hans crept through the broken walls like a snake and saw [them]4580-those in whose company we must fight . And , [Baas]121-baas , [I]87-hans do not think [they]4580-those in whose company we must fight are [men]3228-men , [I]87-hans think that [they]4580-those in whose company we must fight are evil spirits who walk at night only . "[87-hans]

" Why , [Hans]87-hans ? "[0-i]

" Because when the sun is high , [Baas]121-baas , as it is now , [they]4580-those in whose company we must fight are all sleeping . Yes , there [they]4580-those in whose company we must fight lie abed , fast asleep , as [other people]1208-other people do at night , with [only a few sentries out on guard]4583-only a few sentries out on guard , and these are yawning and rubbing [their]4580-those in whose company we must fight eyes . "[87-hans]

" [I]0-i have heard that there are folk like that in [the middle of [Africa]10-africa]4584-the middle of africa where the sun is very hot , [Hans]87-hans , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " which perhaps is why [She]4585-she - who - commands is going to take [us]4586-us to see [them]4580-those in whose company we must fight at night . Also [these people]679-these people , it seems , are [worshippers of the moon]4588-worshippers of the moon . "[0-i]

" No , [Baas]121-baas , [they]4580-those in whose company we must fight are worshippers of [the devil]3709-the devil and that [White Witch]223-the white witch is [[his]3709-the devil wife]654-his wife . "[87-hans]

" [You]87-hans had better keep [your]87-hans thoughts to [yourself]87-hans , [Hans]87-hans , for whatever [she]4585-she is [I]0-i think that [she]4585-she can read thoughts from far away , as [you]87-hans guessed last night . Therefore [I]0-i would not have any if [I]0-i were [you]87-hans . "[0-i]

" No , [Baas]121-baas , or if [I]1968-i must think , henceforth , it shall be only of gin which in [this place is also far away]4591-this place is also far away , "[1968-i] [he]1968-i replied , grinning .

Then [we]1969-we came to [the rest - house]1970-the rest - house where [I]0-i found that [Robertson]161-robertson had already eaten [his]161-robertson midday meal and like [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas gone to sleep , while apparently [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas had done the same ; at least [I]0-i saw nothing of [him]161-robertson . Of this [I]0-i was glad , since that wondrous [Ayesha]84-ayesha seemed to draw vitality out of [me]0-i and after [my]0-i long talk with [her]84-ayesha [I]0-i felt very tired . So [I]0-i too ate and then went to lie down under an old wall in the shade at a little distance , and to reflect upon the marvellous things that [I]0-i had heard .

Here be it said at once that [I]0-i believed nothing of them , or at least very little indeed . All the involved tale of [Ayesha]84-ayesha 's long life [I]0-i dismissed at once as incredible . Clearly [she]84-ayesha was [some beautiful woman who was more or less mad and suffered from megalomania]1971-some beautiful woman who was more or less mad and suffered from megalomania ; probably [an Arab]1972-an arab , who had wandered to [this place]3445-this place for reasons of [her]84-ayesha own , and become [the chieftainess of [a savage tribe whose traditions [she]84-ayesha had absorbed and reproduced as personal experiences , again for reasons of [her]84-ayesha own]1975-a savage tribe whose traditions she had absorbed and reproduced as personal experiences , again for reasons of her own]1974-the chieftainess of a savage tribe whose traditions she had absorbed and reproduced as personal experiences , again for reasons of her own .

For the rest , [she]84-ayesha was now threatened by [another tribe]1976-another tribe and knowing that [we]1977-we had guns and could fight from what happened on the yesterday , wished naturally enough for [our]1977-we assistance in the coming battle . As for [the marvellous chief Rezu]1978-the marvellous chief rezu , or rather for [his]1978-the marvellous chief rezu supernatural attributes and all the cock - and - bull story about an axe - well , it was humbug like the rest , and if [she]84-ayesha believed in it [she]84-ayesha must be more foolish than [I]0-i took [her]84-ayesha to be - even if [she]84-ayesha were unhinged on certain points . For the rest , [her]84-ayesha information about [myself]0-i and [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas doubtless had reached [her]84-ayesha from [Zikali]104-zikali in some obscure fashion , as [she]84-ayesha [herself]84-ayesha acknowledged .

But heavens ! how beautiful [she]84-ayesha was ! That flash of loveliness when out of pique or coquetry [she]84-ayesha lifted [her]84-ayesha veil , blinded like the lightning .
