But thank goodness , also like the lightning it frightened ; instinctively one felt that it was very dangerous , even to death , and with it [I]0-i for one wished no closer acquaintance . [Fire]224-fire may be lovely and attractive , also comforting at a proper distance , but [he]1979-he who sits on the top of it is cremated , as many a moth has found .

So [I]0-i argued , knowing well enough all the while that if this particular human - or inhuman - fire desired to make an holocaust of [me]0-i , it could do so easily enough , and that in reality [I]0-i owed [my]0-i safety so far to a lack of that desire on its part . [The glorious Ayesha]84-ayesha saw nothing to attract [her]84-ayesha in [an insignificant and withered hunter]1980-an insignificant and withered hunter , or at any rate in [his]1980-an insignificant and withered hunter exterior , though with [his]1980-an insignificant and withered hunter mind [she]84-ayesha might find some small affinity . Moreover to make a fool of [him]1980-an insignificant and withered hunter just for the fun of it would not serve [her]84-ayesha purpose , since [she]84-ayesha needed [his]1980-an insignificant and withered hunter assistance in a business that necessitated clear wits and unprejudiced judgment .

Lastly [she]84-ayesha had declared [herself]84-ayesha to be absorbed in some tiresome complication with [another man , of which it]1981-another man , of which it was rather difficult to follow the details . It is true that [she]84-ayesha described [him]1980-an insignificant and withered hunter as [a handsome but somewhat empty - headed person whom [she]84-ayesha had last seen two thousand years ago]1982-a handsome but somewhat empty - headed person whom she had last seen two thousand years ago , but probably this only meant that [she]84-ayesha thought poorly of [him]1980-an insignificant and withered hunter because [he]1980-an insignificant and withered hunter had preferred [some other woman]1983-some other woman to [herself]84-ayesha , while the two thousand years were added to the tale to give it atmosphere .

The worst of scandals becomes romantic and even respectable in two thousand years ; witness that of [Cleopatra]225-cleopatra with [Cæsar]155-julius cæsar , [Mark Antony]226-mark antony and [other gentlemen]1984-other gentlemen . The most virtuous read of [Cleopatra]225-cleopatra with sympathy , even in [boarding - schools]1985-boarding - schools , and it is felt that were [she]225-cleopatra by some miracle to be blotted out of the book of history , the loss would be enormous . The same applied to [Helen]227-helen , [Phryne]228-phryne , and other bad lots . In fact now that one comes to think of it , most of [the attractive personages in history]1986-the attractive personages in history , male or female , especially [the latter]1531-the latter , were bad lots . When [we]1988-we find someone to whose name is added " the good "[1988-we] [we]1988-we skip . No doubt [Ayesha]84-ayesha , being very clever , appreciated this regrettable truth , and therefore moved [her]84-ayesha murky entanglements of the past decade or so back for a couple of thousand years , as many of [us]1988-we would like to do .

There remained the very curious circumstance of [her]84-ayesha apparent correspondence with [old Zikali who lived far away]1989-old zikali who lived far away . This , however , after all was not inexplicable . In the course of a great deal of experience [I]0-i have observed that [all the witch - doctor family]1990-all the witch - doctor family , to which doubtless [she]84-ayesha belonged , have strange means of communication .

In most instances these are no doubt physical , carried on by help of [messengers]1991-messengers , or messages passed from one to the other . But sometimes it is reasonable to assume what is known as telepathy , as [their]1990-all the witch - doctor family link of intercourse . Between [two such highly developed experts]1992-two such highly developed experts as [Ayesha]84-ayesha and [Zikali]104-zikali , it might for the sake of argument safely be supposed that it was thus [they]1992-two such highly developed experts learned [each other]3176-each other 's mind and co - operated in each other 's projects , though perhaps this end was effected by commoner methods .

Whatever its interpretations , the issue of the business seemed to be that [I]0-i was to be let in for more fighting . Well , in any case this could not be avoided , since [[Robertson]161-robertson 's daughter]1994-robertson 's daughter , [Inez]159-inez , had to be saved at all costs , if it could possibly be done , even if [we]1988-we lost [our]1988-we lives in the attempt . Therefore fight [we]1988-we must , so there was nothing more to be said . Also without doubt this adventure was particularly interesting and [I]0-i could only hope that good luck , or [Zikali]104-zikali 's Great Medicine , or rather [Providence]127-providence , would see [me]0-i through it safely .

For the rest the fact that [our]1988-we help was necessary to [her]84-ayesha in this war - like venture showed [me]0-i clearly enough that all [this wonderful woman]1995-this wonderful woman 's pretensions to supernatural powers were the sheerest nonsense . Had [they]1992-two such highly developed experts been otherwise [she]84-ayesha would not have needed [our]1988-we help in [her]84-ayesha tribal fights , notwithstanding the rubbish [she]84-ayesha talked about [the chief]503-the chief , [Rezu]88-rezu , who according to [her]84-ayesha account of [him]503-the chief , must resemble one of the fabulous " trolls , "[84-ayesha] half - human and half - ghostly evil creatures , of whom [I]0-i have read in the Norse Sagas , who could only be slain by [some particular hero armed with a particular weapon]1997-some particular hero armed with a particular weapon .

Reflecting thus [I]0-i went to sleep and did not wake until the sun was setting . Finding that [Hans]87-hans was also sleeping at [my]0-i feet just like a faithful dog , [I]0-i woke [him]87-hans up and [we]1988-we went back together to [the rest - house]1970-the rest - house , which [we]1988-we reached as the darkness fell with extraordinary swiftness , as it does in [those latitudes]1999-those latitudes , especially in [a place surrounded by cliffs]2000-a place surrounded by cliffs .

Not finding [Robertson]161-robertson in [the house]722-the house , [I]0-i concluded that [he]161-robertson was somewhere outside , possibly making a reconnaissance on [his]161-robertson own account , and told [Hans]87-hans to get supper ready for [both of [us]1988-we]2002-both of us . While [he]161-robertson was doing so , by aid of the Amahagger lamps , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas suddenly appeared in the circle of light , and looking about [him]161-robertson , said ,

" Where is [Red - Beard]121-baas , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn ? "[125-umslopogaas]

[I]0-i answered that [I]0-i did not know and waited , for [I]0-i felt sure that [he]161-robertson had something to say .

" [I]161-robertson think that [you]0-i had better keep [Red - Beard]121-baas close to [you]0-i , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , "[161-robertson] [he]161-robertson went on . " This afternoon , when [you]0-i had returned from visiting [the white doctoress]4592-the white doctoress and having eaten , had gone to sleep under the wall yonder , [I]161-robertson saw [Red - Beard]121-baas come out of [the house]722-the house carrying a gun and a bag of cartridges . [His]121-baas eyes rolled wildly and [he]121-baas turned first this way and then that , sniffing at the air , like a buck that scents danger . Then [he]121-baas began to talk aloud in [his]121-baas own tongue and as [I]161-robertson saw that [he]121-baas was speaking with [his]121-baas Spirit , as those do who are mad , [I]161-robertson went away and left [him]121-baas . "[161-robertson]

" Why ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Because , as [you]0-i know , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , it is a law among [[us]4594-us [Zulus]101-the zulus]4595-us zulus never to disturb [one who is mad and engaged in talking with [his]121-baas Spirit]4596-one who is mad and engaged in talking with his spirit . Moreover , had [I]161-robertson done so , probably [he]121-baas would have shot [me]161-robertson , nor should [I]161-robertson have complained who would have thrust [myself]161-robertson in where [I]161-robertson had no right to be . "[161-robertson]

" Then why did [you]0-i not come to call [me]161-robertson , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas ? "[161-robertson]

" Because then [he]121-baas might have shot [you]0-i , for , as [I]161-robertson have seen for some time [he]121-baas is inspired of [heaven]1310-heaven and knows not what [he]121-baas does upon [the earth]285-the earth , thinking only of [the Lady Sad - Eyes who has been stolen away from [him]121-baas , as is but natural . So [I]161-robertson left [him]121-baas walking up and down]170-sad - eyes , and when [I]161-robertson returned later to look , saw that [he]121-baas was gone , as [I]161-robertson thought into [this walled hut]4599-this walled hut . Now when [Hansi]145-hansi tells [me]161-robertson that [he]121-baas is not [here]3339-here , [I]161-robertson have come to speak to [you]0-i about [him]121-baas . "[161-robertson]

" No , certainly [he]121-baas is not [here]3339-here , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , and [I]0-i went to look at the bed where [Robertson]161-robertson slept to see if it had been used that evening .

Then for the first time [I]0-i saw lying on it a piece of paper torn from a pocketbook and addressed to [myself]0-i . [I]0-i seized and read it . It ran thus :

" [The merciful Lord]4602-the merciful lord has sent [me]0-i a vision of [Inez]159-inez and shown [me]0-i where [she]159-inez is over [the cliff - edge]4603-the cliff - edge away to the west , also [the road to [her]159-inez]4604-the road to her . In [my]0-i sleep [I]0-i heard [her]159-inez talking to [me]0-i . [She]159-inez told [me]0-i that [she]159-inez is in great danger - that [they]4605-they are going to marry [her]159-inez to [some brute]4606-some brute - and called to [me]0-i to come at once and save [her]159-inez ; yes , and to come alone without saying anything to [anyone]281-anyone . So [I]0-i am going at once . Do n't be frightened or trouble about [me]0-i . All will be well , all will be quite well . [I]0-i will tell [you]0-i the rest when [we]4608-we meet . "[0-i]

[Horrorstruck]229-horrorstruck [I]0-i translated this insane screed to [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [Hans]87-hans . [The former]1091-the former nodded gravely .

" Did [I]0-i not tell [you]0-i that [he]4606-some brute was talking with [[his]4606-some brute Spirit]4609-his spirit , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn ? "[0-i] [I]0-i had rendered " [the merciful Lord]4610-the merciful lord "[0-i] as [the Good Spirit]230-the good spirit . " Well , [he]4606-some brute has gone and doubtless [[his]4606-some brute Spirit]4609-his spirit will take care of [him]4606-some brute . It is finished . "[0-i]

" At any rate [we]4612-we can not , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] broke in [Hans]87-hans , who [I]0-i think feared that [I]0-i might send [him]87-hans out to look for [Robertson]161-robertson . " [I]87-hans can follow [most spoors]4613-most spoors , but not on such a night as this when one could cut the blackness into lumps and build a wall of it . "[87-hans]

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " [he]87-hans has gone and nothing can be done at present , "[0-i] though to [myself]0-i [I]0-i reflected that probably [he]87-hans had not gone far and would be found when the moon rose , or at any rate on the following morning .

Still [I]0-i was most uneasy about [the man who , as [I]0-i had noted for a long while , was losing [his]2004-the man who , as i had noted for a long while , was losing his balance more and more balance more and more]2004-the man who , as i had noted for a long while , was losing his balance more and more . The shock of the barbarous and dreadful slaughter of [[his]2004-the man who , as i had noted for a long while , was losing his balance more and more half - breed children]2005-his half - breed children and of the abduction of [Inez]159-inez by [these grim , man - eating savages]2006-these grim , man - eating savages began the business , and [I]0-i think that it was increased and accentuated by [his]2004-the man who , as i had noted for a long while , was losing his balance more and more sudden conversion to complete temperance after years of heavy drinking .

When [I]0-i persuaded [him]2004-the man who , as i had noted for a long while , was losing his balance more and more to this course [I]0-i was very proud of [myself]0-i , thinking that [I]0-i had done a clever thing , but now [I]0-i was not so sure . Perhaps it would have been better if [he]2004-the man who , as i had noted for a long while , was losing his balance more and more had continued to drink something , at any rate for a while , but the trouble is that in such cases there is generally [no half - way house]2007-no half - way house . [A man]3551-a man , or still more [a woman , given to this frailty]2009-a woman , given to this frailty either turns aggressively sober or remains very drunken . At any rate , even if [I]0-i had made a mess of it , [I]0-i had acted for the best and could not blame [myself]0-i .

For the rest it was clear that in [his]2004-the man who , as i had noted for a long while , was losing his balance more and more new phase the religious associations of [his]2004-the man who , as i had noted for a long while , was losing his balance more and more youth had re - asserted themselves with remarkable vigour , for [I]0-i gathered that [he]2004-the man who , as i had noted for a long while , was losing his balance more and more had been brought up almost as [a Calvinist]2010-a calvinist , and in the rush of [their]2011-their return , had overset [his]2004-the man who , as i had noted for a long while , was losing his balance more and more equilibrium . As [I]0-i have said , [he]2004-the man who , as i had noted for a long while , was losing his balance more and more prayed night and day without any of those reserves which [most people]292-most people prefer in [their]292-most people religious exercises , and when [he]2004-the man who , as i had noted for a long while , was losing his balance more and more talked of matters outside [our]2013-our quest , [his]2004-the man who , as i had noted for a long while , was losing his balance more and more conversation generally revolved round the devil , or hell and its torments , which , to say the truth , did not make [him]2004-the man who , as i had noted for a long while , was losing his balance more and more a cheerful companion . Indeed in this respect [I]0-i liked [him]2004-the man who , as i had noted for a long while , was losing his balance more and more much better in [his]2004-the man who , as i had noted for a long while , was losing his balance more and more old , unregenerate days , being , [I]0-i fear , [myself]0-i [a somewhat worldly soul]2014-a somewhat worldly soul .

Well , the sum of it was that [the poor fellow]2015-the poor fellow had gone mad and given [us]2013-our the slip , and as [Hans]87-hans said , to search for [him]2015-the poor fellow at once in that darkness was impossible . Indeed , even if it had been lighter , [I]0-i do not think that it would have been safe among [these Amahagger nightbirds whom [I]0-i did not trust]2016-these amahagger nightbirds whom i did not trust . Certainly [I]0-i could not have asked [Hans]87-hans to undertake the task , and if [I]0-i had , [I]0-i do not think [he]87-hans would have gone since [he]87-hans was afraid of [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas . Therefore there was nothing to be done except wait and hope for the best .

So [I]0-i waited till at last the moon came and with it [Ayesha]84-ayesha , as [she]84-ayesha had promised . Clad in a rich , dark cloak [she]84-ayesha arrived in some pomp , heralded by [Billali]93-billali , followed by [women]3186-women , also cloaked , and surrounded by [a guard of tall spearmen]2018-a guard of tall spearmen . [I]0-i was seated outside [the house]722-the house , smoking , when suddenly [she]84-ayesha arrived from the shadows and stood before [me]0-i .

[I]0-i rose respectfully and bowed , while [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , [Goroko]168-goroko and [the other Zulus who were with [me]0-i]2020-the other zulus who were with me , gave [her]84-ayesha the royal salute , and [Hans]87-hans cringed like a dog that is afraid of being kicked .

After a swift glance at [them]2021-them , as [I]0-i guessed by the motion of [her]84-ayesha veiled head , [she]84-ayesha seemed to fix [her]84-ayesha gaze upon [my]0-i pipe that evidently excited [her]84-ayesha curiosity , and asked [me]0-i what it was . [I]0-i explained as well as [I]0-i could , expatiating on the charms of smoking .

" So [men]3228-men have learned another useless vice since [I]84-ayesha left [the world]277-the world , and one that is filthy also , "[84-ayesha] [she]84-ayesha said , sniffing at the smoke and waving [her]84-ayesha hand before [her]84-ayesha face , whereon [I]0-i dropped the pipe into [my]0-i pocket , where , being alight , it burnt a hole in [my]0-i best remaining coat .

[I]0-i remember the remark because it showed [me]0-i what [a clever actress]2022-a clever actress [she]84-ayesha was who , to keep up [her]84-ayesha character of antiquity , pretended to be astonished at a habit with which [she]84-ayesha must have been well acquainted , although [I]0-i believe that it was unknown in [the ancient world]2023-the ancient world .

" [You]0-i are troubled , "[84-ayesha] [she]84-ayesha went on , swiftly changing the subject , " [I]84-ayesha read it in [your]0-i face . [One of [[your]0-i company]4617-your company]4616-one of your company is missing . Who is it ? Ah ! [I]84-ayesha see , [the white man [you]0-i name [Avenger]187-avenger]4618-the white man you name avenger . Where is [he]4618-the white man you name avenger gone ? "[84-ayesha]

" That is what [I]0-i wish to ask [you]84-ayesha , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" How can [I]84-ayesha tell [you]84-ayesha , [Allan]82-allan , who in [this place]3445-this place lack any glass into which to look for things that pass afar . Still , let [me]84-ayesha try , "[84-ayesha] and pressing [her]84-ayesha hands to [her]84-ayesha forehead , [she]84-ayesha remained silent for perhaps a minute , then spoke slowly .

" [I]84-ayesha think that [he]4618-the white man you name avenger has gone over [the mountain lip]4620-the mountain lip towards [the worshippers of [Rezu]88-rezu]4621-the worshippers of rezu . [I]84-ayesha think that [he]4618-the white man you name avenger is mad ; sorrow and something else which [I]84-ayesha do not understand have turned [his]4618-the white man you name avenger brain ; something that has to do with [the Heavens]181-the heavens . [I]84-ayesha think also that [we]4622-we shall recover [him]4618-the white man you name avenger living , if only for a little while , though of this [I]84-ayesha can not be sure since it is not given to [me]84-ayesha to read the future , but only the past , and sometimes the things that happen in the present though they be far away . "[84-ayesha]

" Will [you]84-ayesha send to search for [him]4618-the white man you name avenger , [O Ayesha]84-ayesha ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked anxiously .

" Nay , it is useless , for [he]4618-the white man you name avenger is already distant . Moreover [those who went]4623-those who went might be taken by [the outposts of [Rezu]88-rezu]4624-the outposts of rezu , as perchance has happened to [[your]0-i companion]4151-your companion wandering in [his]4618-the white man you name avenger madness . Do [you]0-i know what [he]4618-the white man you name avenger went to seek ? "[84-ayesha]

" More or less , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered and translated to [her]2024-her the letter that [Robertson]161-robertson had left for [me]0-i .

" It may be as [the man]324-the man writes , "[2024-her] [she]2024-her commented , ' since [the mad]2025-the mad often see well in [their]2025-the mad dreams , though these are not sent by [a god]335-a god as [he]2025-the mad imagines . The mind in [[its]2027-its secret places]2028-its secret places knows all things , O [Allan]82-allan , although it seems to know little or nothing , and when the breath of vision or the fury of a soul distraught blows away the veils or burns through the gates of distance , then for a while it sees and learns , since , whatever [fools]2029-fools may think , often madness is true wisdom . Now follow [me]0-i with [the little yellow man]3990-the little yellow man and [the Warrior of the Axe]2031-the warrior of the axe . Stay , let [me]0-i look upon that axe . "[0-i]

[I]0-i interpreted [her]2024-her wish to Umslopogaas who held it out to [her]2024-her but refused to loose it from [his]2025-the mad wrist to which it was attached by the leathern thong .

" Does [the Black One]153-the black one think that [I]2024-her shall cut [him]153-the black one down with [his]153-the black one own weapon , [I]2024-her who am so weak and gentle ? "[2024-her] [she]2024-her asked , laughing .

" Nay , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , but it is [his]153-the black one law not to part with [this Drinker of Lives]4627-this drinker of lives , which [he]153-the black one names ' [Chieftainess and Groan - maker]4628-chieftainess and groan - maker , ' and clings to closer by day and night than [a man]3551-a man does to [[his]3551-a man wife]654-his wife . "[0-i]

" There [he]153-the black one is wise , [Allan]82-allan , since [a savage captain]4631-a savage captain may get [more wives but never such another axe]4632-more wives but never such another axe . The thing is ancient , "[2024-her] [she]2024-her added musingly after examining its every detail , " and who knows ? It may be that whereof the legend tells which is fated to bring [Rezu]88-rezu to the dust . Now ask [this fierce - eyed Slayer]4633-this fierce - eyed slayer whether , armed with [his]4633-this fierce - eyed slayer axe [he]4633-this fierce - eyed slayer can find courage to face [the most terrible of all men]4634-the most terrible of all men and the strongest , one who is [a wizard also , of whom it is prophesied that only by such an axe as this]4635-a wizard also , of whom it is prophesied that only by such an axe as this can [he]4633-this fierce - eyed slayer be made to bite the dust . "[2024-her]

[I]0-i obeyed . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas laughed grimly and answered ,

" Say to [the White Witch]223-the white witch that there is [no man]3232-no man living upon [the earth]285-the earth whom [I]125-umslopogaas would not face in war , [I]125-umslopogaas [who have never been conquered in fair fight]4638-who have never been conquered in fair fight , though once a chance blow brought [me]125-umslopogaas to the doors of death , "[125-umslopogaas] and [he]125-umslopogaas touched the great hole in [his]125-umslopogaas forehead . " Say to [her]223-the white witch also that [I]125-umslopogaas have no fear of defeat , [I]125-umslopogaas from whom doom is , as [I]125-umslopogaas think , still far away , though [the Opener - of - Roads]3230-the opener - of - roads has told [me]125-umslopogaas that among [a strange people]4640-a strange people [I]125-umslopogaas shall die in war at last , as [I]125-umslopogaas desire to do , who from [my]125-umslopogaas boyhood have lived in war . "[125-umslopogaas]

" [He]125-umslopogaas speaks well , "[2032-she] [she]2032-she answered with a note of admiration in [her]2032-she voice . " By [Isis]200-isis , were [he]125-umslopogaas but white [I]2032-she would set [him]125-umslopogaas to rule these Amahagger under [me]2032-she . Tell [him]125-umslopogaas , [Allan]82-allan , that if [he]125-umslopogaas lays [Rezu]88-rezu low [he]125-umslopogaas shall have a great reward . "[2032-she]

" And tell [the White Witch]223-the white witch , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , "[125-umslopogaas] [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas replied when [I]0-i had translated , " that [I]125-umslopogaas seek no reward , save glory only , and with it the sight of one who is lost to [me]125-umslopogaas but with whom [my]125-umslopogaas heart still dwells , if indeed [this Witch]3214-this witch has strength to break the wall of blackness that is built between [me]125-umslopogaas and [her]3214-this witch who is ' gone down . ' "[125-umslopogaas]

" Strange , "[84-ayesha] reflected [Ayesha]84-ayesha when [she]84-ayesha understood , " that [this grim Destroyer]4642-this grim destroyer should yet be bound by the silken bonds of love and yearn for [one whom the grave has taken]4643-one whom the grave has taken . Learn from it , [Allan]82-allan , that all humanity is cast in the same mould , since [my]84-ayesha longings and [your]4644-your longings are [his]125-umslopogaas also , though the three of [us]4645-they be far apart as are the sun and the moon and [the earth]285-the earth , and as different in every other quality . Yet it is true that sun and moon and [earth]346-earth are born of the same black womb of chaos . Therefore in the beginning [they]4645-they were identical , as doubtless [they]4645-they will be in the end when , [their]4645-they journeyings done , [they]4645-they rush together to light space with a flame at which [the mocking gods that made [them]4645-they may warm [their]4645-they hands]4648-the mocking gods that made them may warm their hands . Well , so it is with [men]3228-men , [Allan]82-allan , whose soul - stuff is drawn from the gulf of Spirit by [Nature]82-allan 's hand , and , cast upon the cold air of [this death - driven world]4650-this death - driven world , freezes into a million shapes each different to the other and yet , be sure , the same . Now talk no more , but follow [me]84-ayesha . [Slave]231-slave "[84-ayesha] this was addressed to [Billali]93-billali , " bid [the guards]3475-the guards lead on to [the camp of [the servants of [Lulala]217-lulala]4653-the servants of lulala]4652-the camp of the servants of lulala . "[93-billali]

So [we]2033-we went through [the silent ruins]2034-the silent ruins . [Ayesha]84-ayesha walked , or rather glided a pace or two ahead , then came [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [I]0-i side by side , while at [our]2033-we heels followed [Hans]87-hans , very close at [our]2033-we heels since [he]87-hans did not wish to be out of reach of the virtue of [the Great Medicine]104-zikali and incidentally of the protection of axe and rifle .

Thus [we]2033-we marched surrounded by [the solemn guard]2035-the solemn guard for something between a quarter and half a mile , till at length [we]2033-we climbed the debris of a mighty wall that once had encompassed [the city]3203-the city , and by the moonlight saw beneath [us]2033-we a vast hollow which clearly at some unknown time had been the bed of [an enormous moat and filled with water]2037-an enormous moat and filled with water .

Now , however , [it]2038-it was dry and all about [its]2038-it surface were dotted numerous camp - fires round which [men]3228-men were moving , also [some women who appeared to be engaged in cooking food]2040-some women who appeared to be engaged in cooking food . At a little distance too , upon the further edge of the moat - like depression were a number of white - robed individuals gathered in a circle about a large stone upon which something was stretched that resembled the carcase of a sheep or goat , and round [these a great number of spectators]2041-these a great number of spectators .

" The priests of [Lulala who make sacrifice to the moon]4654-lulala who make sacrifice to the moon , as [they]4654-lulala who make sacrifice to the moon do night by night , save when [she]4654-lulala who make sacrifice to the moon is dead , "[84-ayesha] said [Ayesha]84-ayesha , turning back towards [me]0-i as though in answer to the query which [I]0-i had conceived but left unuttered .

What struck [me]0-i about the whole scene was its extraordinary animation and briskness . [All the folk round the fires]2042-all the folk round the fires and outside of [them]2042-all the folk round the fires moved about quickly and with the same kind of liveliness which might animate a camp of [more natural people]2043-more natural people at the rising of the sun . It was as though [they]2042-all the folk round the fires had just got up full of vigour to commence [their]2042-all the folk round the fires daily , or rather [their]2042-all the folk round the fires nightly round , which in truth was the case , since as [Hans]87-hans discovered , by habitude [these Amahagger]1201-these amahagger preferred to sleep during the day unless something prevented [them]2042-all the folk round the fires , and to carry on the activities of life at night . It only remains to add that there seemed to be a great number of [them]2042-all the folk round the fires , for [their]2042-all the folk round the fires fires following the round of [the dry moat]2045-the dry moat , stretched further than [I]0-i could see .

Scrambling down the crumpled wall by [a zig - zag pathway]2046-a zig - zag pathway , [we]2047-we came upon the outposts of [the army beneath [us]2047-we who challenged , then seeing with whom [they]2042-all the folk round the fires had to do]2048-the army beneath us who challenged , then seeing with whom they had to do , fell flat upon [their]2042-all the folk round the fires faces , leaving [their]2042-all the folk round the fires great spears , which had iron spikes on their shafts like to those of [the Masai]1106-the masai , sticking in the ground beside [them]2042-all the folk round the fires .

[We]2047-we passed on between some of the fires and [I]0-i noted how solemn and gloomy , although handsome , were the countenances of [the folk by whom these were surrounded]2050-the folk by whom these were surrounded . Indeed , [they]2042-all the folk round the fires looked like denizens of [a different world to [ours]2047-we]2051-a different world to ours , one alien to [the kindly race of men]2052-the kindly race of men . There was nothing social about these [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas , who seemed to be [a people labouring under some ancient ancestral curse of which [they]2053-a people labouring under some ancient ancestral curse of which they could never shake off the memory could never shake off the memory]2053-a people labouring under some ancient ancestral curse of which they could never shake off the memory . Even [the women]899-the women rarely smiled ; [their]899-the women clear - cut , stately countenances remained stern and set , except when [they]899-the women glowered at [us]2047-we incuriously . Only when [Ayesha]84-ayesha passed [they]899-the women prostrated [themselves]899-the women like the rest .

[We]2047-we went on through [them]899-the women and across [the moat]2055-the moat , climbing [its]2055-the moat further slope and here suddenly came upon [a host of men]2056-a host of men gathered in a hollow square , apparently in order to receive [us]2047-we . [They]2056-a host of men stood in ranks of five or six deep and [their]2056-a host of men spear - points glimmering in the moonlight looked like long bands of level steel . As [we]2047-we entered the open side of [the square]2057-the square all these spears were lifted . Thrice they were lifted and at each uplifting there rose a deep - throated cry of [Hiya]191-hiya , which is the Arabic for [She]84-ayesha , and [I]0-i suppose was a salutation to [Ayesha]84-ayesha .

[She]84-ayesha swept on taking no heed , till [we]2047-we came to the centre of [the square]2057-the square where [a number of men]1331-a number of men were gathered who prostrated [themselves]1331-a number of men in the usual fashion . Motioning to [them]1331-a number of men to rise [she]84-ayesha said ,

" [Captains]4655-captains , this very night within two hours [we]2047-we march against [Rezu]88-rezu and [the sun - worshippers]4656-the sun - worshippers , since otherwise as [my]2060-my arts tell [me]2060-my , [they]1331-a number of men march against [us]2047-we . [She]84-ayesha - who - commands is immortal , as [[your]4655-captains fathers]4657-your fathers have known from generation to generation , and can not be destroyed ; but [you]4655-captains , [[her]84-ayesha servants]4658-her servants , can be destroyed , and [Rezu]88-rezu , who also has [drunk of the Cup of Life]4659-drunk of the cup of life , out - numbers [you]4655-captains by three to one and prepares [a queen]1765-a queen to set up in [my]2060-my place over [[his]88-rezu own people]4661-his own people and such of [you]4655-captains as remain . As though , "[2060-my] [she]2060-my added with a contemptuous laugh , " [any woman of a day]4662-any woman of a day could take [my]2060-my place . "[2060-my]

[She]2060-my paused and [the spokesman of [the captains]2062-the captains]2061-the spokesman of the captains said ,

" [We]4663-we hear , [O Hiya]191-hiya , and [we]4663-we understand . What wouldst [thou]4664-thy have [us]4663-we do , O Lulala - come - to - [earth]346-earth ? [The armies of [Rezu]88-rezu]4666-the armies of rezu are great and from the beginning [he]88-rezu has hated [thee]4664-thy and [us]4663-we , also [his]88-rezu magic is as [thy]4664-thy magic and [his]88-rezu length of days as [thy]4664-thy length of days . How then can [we]4663-we who are few , [three thousand men at the most]4667-three thousand men at the most , match [ourselves]4663-we against [Rezu]88-rezu , [Son of the Sun]4668-son of the sun ? Would it not be better that [we]4663-we should accept the terms of [Rezu]88-rezu , which are light , and acknowledge [him]88-rezu as [[our]4663-we king]4669-our king ? "[2060-my]

As [she]2063-i heard these words [I]0-i saw the tall shape of [Ayesha]84-ayesha quiver beneath [her]2063-i robes , as [I]0-i think , not with fear but with rage , because the meaning of them was clear enough , namely that rather than risk a battle with [Rezu]88-rezu , [these people]679-these people were contemplating surrender and [her]2063-i own deposition , if indeed [she]2063-i could be deposed . Still [she]2063-i answered in a quiet voice ,

" It seems that [I]2063-i have dealt too gently with [you]0-i and with [[your]0-i fathers]4657-your fathers , Children of [Lulala]217-lulala , whose shadow [I]2063-i am here upon [the earth]285-the earth , so that because [you]0-i only see the scabbard , [you]0-i have forgotten the sword within and that it can shine forth and smite . Well , why should [I]2063-i be wrath because [the brutish]4672-the brutish will follow the law of brutes , though it be true that [I]2063-i am minded to slay [you]0-i where [you]0-i stand ? Hearken ! Were [I]2063-i less merciful [I]2063-i would leave [you]0-i to the clutching hands of [Rezu]88-rezu , who would drag [you]0-i one by one to the stone of sacrifice and there offer up [your]0-i hearts to [his]88-rezu god of fire and devour [your]0-i bodies with [his]88-rezu heat . But [I]2063-i bethink [me]2063-i of [[your]0-i wives]3409-your wives and [children]3412-children and of [[your]0-i forefathers]4675-your forefathers whom [I]2063-i knew in the dead days , and therefore , if [I]2063-i may , [I]2063-i still would save [you]0-i from [yourselves]0-i and [your]0-i heads from the glowing pot .[2063-i]

" Take counsel together now and say - Will [you]0-i fight against [Rezu]88-rezu , or will [you]0-i yield ? If that is [your]0-i desire , speak it , and by to - morrow 's sun [I]2065-i will begone , taking these with [me]2065-i , "[2065-i] and [she]2065-i pointed to [us]2066-us , " whom [I]2065-i have summoned to help [us]2066-us in the war . Aye , [I]2065-i will begone , and when [you]0-i are stretched upon the stone of sacrifice , and [[your]0-i women]4676-your women and [children]3412-children are [the slaves of [the men of [Rezu]88-rezu]4679-the men of rezu]4678-the slaves of the men of rezu , then shall [you]0-i cry ,[2065-i]

" ' Oh , where is [Hiya]191-hiya whom [[our]2066-us fathers]3922-our fathers knew ? Oh , will [she]191-hiya not return and save [us]2066-us from this hell ? '[2065-i]

" Yes , so shall [you]0-i cry but there shall come no answer , since then [she]191-hiya will have departed to [[her]191-hiya own habitations]4681-her own habitations in [the moon]4682-the moon and thence appear no more . Now consult together and answer swiftly , since [I]2065-i weary of [you]0-i and [your]0-i ways . "[2065-i]

[The captains]2062-the captains drew apart and began to talk in low voices , while [Ayesha]84-ayesha stood still , apparently quite unconcerned , and [I]0-i considered the situation .

It was obvious to [me]0-i that [these people]679-these people were almost in rebellion against [[their]679-these people strange ruler]2069-their strange ruler , whose power over [them]679-these people was of a purely moral nature , one that emanated from [her]84-ayesha personality alone . What [I]0-i wondered was , being what [she]84-ayesha seemed to be , why [she]84-ayesha thought it worth while to exercise it at all . Then [I]0-i remembered [her]84-ayesha statement that here and nowhere else [she]84-ayesha must abide for some secret reason , until [a certain mystical gentleman with a Greek name]2070-a certain mystical gentleman with a greek name came to fetch [her]84-ayesha away from [this appointed rendezvous]2071-this appointed rendezvous . Therefore [I]0-i supposed [she]84-ayesha had no choice , or rather , suffering as [she]84-ayesha did from hallucinations , believed [herself]84-ayesha to have no choice and was obliged to put up with [a crowd of [disagreeable savages]2073-disagreeable savages]2072-a crowd of disagreeable savages in quarters which were sadly out of repair .

Presently [the spokesman]468-the spokesman returned , saluted with [his]468-the spokesman spear , and asked ,

" If [we]4683-we go up to fight against [Rezu]88-rezu , who will lead [us]4683-we in the battle , [O Hiya]191-hiya ? "[468-the spokesman]

" [My]84-ayesha wisdom shall be [your]0-i guide , "[84-ayesha] [she]84-ayesha answered , " [this white man]675-this white man shall be [[your]0-i General]4685-your general and there stands [the warrior who shall meet [Rezu]88-rezu face to face and bring [him]88-rezu to the dust]4686-the warrior who shall meet rezu face to face and bring him to the dust , "[84-ayesha] and [she]84-ayesha pointed to [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas leaning upon [his]468-the spokesman axe and watching [them]2075-them with a contemptuous smile .

This reply did not seem to please [the man]324-the man for [he]324-the man withdrew to consult again with [[his]324-the man companions]472-his companions . After a debate which [I]0-i suppose was animated for [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas , [men of few words who did not indulge in oratory]2078-men of few words who did not indulge in oratory , [all of [them]2079-all of them]2079-all of them advanced on [us]2080-we and [the spokesman]468-the spokesman said ,

" The choice of [a General]4687-a general does not please [us]2080-we , [Hiya]191-hiya . [We]2080-we know that [the white man]3607-the white man is brave because of the fight [he]3607-the white man made against [the men of [Rezu]88-rezu over [the mountain yonder]4690-the mountain yonder]4689-the men of rezu over the mountain yonder ; also that [he]3607-the white man and [[his]3607-the white man followers]4691-his followers have weapons that deal death from afar . But there is a prophecy among [us]2080-we of which [none]540-none know the beginning , that [he]3607-the white man who commands in the last great battle between [Lulala]217-lulala and [Rezu]88-rezu must produce before the eyes of [the People of [Lulala]217-lulala]4693-the people of lulala a certain holy thing , a charm of power , without which defeat will be the portion of [Lulala]217-lulala . Of this holy thing , this spirit - haunted shape of power , [we]2080-we know the likeness and the fashion , for these have come down among [[our]2080-we priests]4694-our priests , though who told it to [them]4694-our priests [we]2080-we can not tell , but of it [I]468-the spokesman will say this only , that it speaks both of the spirit and the body , of [man]287-man and yet of more than [man]287-man . "[468-the spokesman]

" And if this wondrous charm , this talisman of might , can not be shown by [the white lord]3927-the white lord here , what then ? "[84-ayesha] asked [Ayesha]84-ayesha coldly .

" Then , [Hiya]191-hiya , this is the word of [the People of [Lulala]217-lulala]4693-the people of lulala , that [we]2080-we will not serve under [him]88-rezu in the battle , and this also is [their]4693-the people of lulala word that [we]2080-we will not go up against [Rezu]88-rezu . That [thou]4699-thou art mighty [we]2080-we know well , [Hiya]191-hiya , also that [thou]4699-thou canst slay if [thou]4699-thou wilt , but [we]2080-we know also that [Rezu]88-rezu is mightier and that against [him]88-rezu [thou]4699-thou hast no power . Therefore kill [us]2080-we if [thou]4699-thou dost so desire , until [thy]4699-thou heart is satisfied with death . For it is better that [we]2080-we should perish thus than upon the altar of sacrifice wearing the red - hot crowns of [Rezu]88-rezu . "[84-ayesha]

" So say [we]2080-we all , "[2083-he] exclaimed the rest of [the company]1073-the company when [he]2083-he had finished .

" The thought comes to [me]84-ayesha to begin to satisfy [my]84-ayesha heart with [thy]4699-thou coward blood and that of [[thy]4699-thou companions]4700-thy companions , "[84-ayesha] said [Ayesha]84-ayesha contemptuously . Then [she]84-ayesha paused and turning to [me]0-i , added , " [O Watcher - by - Night]3398-o watcher - by - night , what counsel ? Is there aught that will convince these chicken - hearted ones over whom [I]84-ayesha have spread [my]84-ayesha feathers for so long ? "[84-ayesha]

[I]0-i shook [my]0-i head blankly , whereat [they]2084-they murmured together and made as though [they]2084-they would go .

Then it was that [Hans]87-hans , who understood something of [Arabic]232-arabic as [he]87-hans did of most African tongues , pulled [my]0-i sleeve and whispered in [my]0-i ear .

" [The Great Medicine]1251-the great medicine , [Baas]121-baas ! Show [them]2084-they [Zikali]104-zikali 's Great Medicine . "[87-hans]

Here was an idea . The description of the article required , a ' spirit - haunted shape of power " that spoke "[87-hans] both of the spirit and the body of [man and yet of more than man]2085-man and yet of more than man , " was so vague that it might mean anything or nothing . And yet - -[0-i]

[I]0-i turned to [Ayesha]84-ayesha and prayed [her]84-ayesha to ask [them]2084-they if what [they]2084-they wanted should be produced , whether [they]2084-they would follow [me]0-i bravely and fight [Rezu]88-rezu to the death . [She]84-ayesha did so and with one voice [they]2084-they replied ,

" Aye , bravely and to the death , [him]88-rezu and [the Bearer of the Axe of whom also [our]4704-our legend]4703-the bearer of the axe of whom also our legend tells . "[84-ayesha]

Then with deliberation [I]0-i opened [my]0-i shirt and holding out the image of [Zikali]104-zikali as far as the chain of elephant hair would allow , [I]0-i asked ,

" Is this the holy thing , the charm of power , of which [your]468-the spokesman legend tells , [O People of the Amahagger]4705-o people of the amahagger and [worshippers of [Lulala]217-lulala]4706-worshippers of lulala ? "[0-i]

[The spokesman]468-the spokesman glanced at it , then snatching a brand from a watch - fire that burnt near by held it over the carving and stared , and stared again ; and as [he]468-the spokesman did , so did [the others]3164-the others bending over [him]468-the spokesman .

" [Dog]233-dog ! would [you]233-dog singe [my]0-i beard ? "[0-i] [I]0-i cried in affected rage , and seizing the brand from [his]468-the spokesman hand [I]0-i smote [him]468-the spokesman with it over the head .

But [he]468-the spokesman took no heed of the affront which [I]0-i had offered to [him]468-the spokesman merely to assert [my]0-i authority . Still for a few moments [he]468-the spokesman stared although the sparks from the wood were frizzling in [his]468-the spokesman greasy hair , then of a sudden went down on [his]468-the spokesman face before [me]0-i , as did [all the others]2088-all the others and cried out ,

" It is the Holy Thing ! It is the spirit - haunted Shape of Power itself , and [we]4707-we [the Worshippers of [Lulala]217-lulala]4708-the worshippers of lulala will follow [thee]4709-thee to the death , [O white lord]4710-o white lord , Watcher - by - Night . Yes , where [thou]4709-thee goest and [he]468-the spokesman goes who bears the Axe , thither will [we]4707-we follow till not one of [us]4707-we is left upon [his]468-the spokesman feet . "[468-the spokesman]

" Then that 's settled , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , yawning , since it is never wise to show concern about anything before [savages]1535-savages . Indeed personally [I]0-i had no wish to be [the leader of this very peculiar tribe]2090-the leader of this very peculiar tribe in an adventure of which [I]0-i knew nothing , and therefore had hoped that [they]2091-they would leave that honour to [someone else]2092-someone else . Then [I]0-i turned and told [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas what had passed , a tale at which [he]125-umslopogaas only shrugged [his]125-umslopogaas great shoulders , handling [his]125-umslopogaas axe as though [he]125-umslopogaas were minded to try its edge upon some of [these " Dark - lovers]4711-these " dark - lovers , "[125-umslopogaas] as [he]125-umslopogaas named [the Amahagger people]2093-the amahagger people because of [their]2093-the amahagger people nocturnal habits .

Meanwhile [Ayesha]84-ayesha gave certain orders . Then [she]84-ayesha came to [me]0-i and said ,

" [These men]850-these men march at once , three thousand strong , and by dawn will camp on [the northern mountain crest]4713-the northern mountain crest . At sunrise [litters]4714-litters will come to bear [you]0-i and those with [you]0-i if [they]4714-litters will , to join [them]4714-litters , which [you]0-i should do by midday . In the afternoon marshall [them]4714-litters as [you]0-i think wise , for the battle will take place in the small hours of the following morning , since [the People of [Lulala]217-lulala]4693-the people of lulala only fight at night . [I]84-ayesha have said . "[84-ayesha]

" Do [you]84-ayesha not come with [us]4716-us ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , dismayed .

" Nay , not in a war against [Rezu]88-rezu , why it matters not . Yet [my]2094-i Spirit will go with [you]0-i , for [I]2094-i shall watch all that passes , how it matters not and perchance [you]0-i may see it there - [I]2094-i know not . On the third day from to - morrow [we]4716-us shall meet again in the flesh or beyond [it]4717-it , but as [I]2094-i think in the flesh , and [you]0-i can claim the reward which [you]0-i journeyed here to seek . [A place]4718-a place shall be prepared for [the white lady whom [Rezu]88-rezu would have set up as [a rival queen to [me]2094-i]4720-a rival queen to me]4719-the white lady whom rezu would have set up as a rival queen to me . Farewell , and farewell also to [yonder Bearer of the Axe that shall drink the blood of [Rezu]88-rezu]4721-yonder bearer of the axe that shall drink the blood of rezu , also to [the little yellow man who is rightly named [Light - in - Darkness]189-light - in - darkness]4722-the little yellow man who is rightly named light - in - darkness , as [you]0-i shall learn ere all is done . "[2094-i]

Then before [I]0-i could speak [she]2094-i turned and glided away , swiftly surrounded by [[her]2094-i guards]2095-her guards , leaving [me]0-i astonished and very uncomfortable .

CHAPTER XVI

ALLAN 'S VISION

[The old chamberlain]1964-the old chamberlain , [Billali]93-billali , conducted [us]2097-us back to [[our]2097-us camp]1037-our camp . As [we]2097-us went [he]1964-the old chamberlain discoursed to [me]0-i of [these Amahagger]1201-these amahagger , of whom it seemed [he]1964-the old chamberlain was [himself]1964-the old chamberlain [a developed specimen , one who threw back , perhaps tens of generations]2100-a developed specimen , one who threw back , perhaps tens of generations , to [some superior ancestor who lived before [they]1201-these amahagger became debased]2101-some superior ancestor who lived before they became debased . In substance [he]1964-the old chamberlain told [me]0-i that [they]1201-these amahagger were a wild and lawless lot who lived amongst ruins or in caves , or some of [them]1201-these amahagger in [swamp dwellings]2102-swamp dwellings , in [small separate communities]2103-small separate communities , each governed by [[its]2103-small separate communities petty headman who was generally a priest of [[their]1201-these amahagger goddess [Lulala]217-lulala]2105-their goddess lulala]2104-its petty headman who was generally a priest of their goddess lulala .

Originally [they]1201-these amahagger and [the people of [Rezu]88-rezu]2106-the people of rezu were the same , in times when [they]1201-these amahagger worshipped the sun and the moon jointly , but " thousands of years "[1964-the old chamberlain] ago , as [he]1964-the old chamberlain expressed it , [they]1201-these amahagger had separated , [the Rezuites]234-the rezuites having gone to dwell to [the north of [the Great Mountain]61-the great mountain]2107-the north of the great mountain , whence [they]1201-these amahagger continually threatened [the Lulalaites whom , had it not been for [She]2108-she - who - commands , [they]1201-these amahagger would have destroyed long before]235-the lulalaites whom , had it not been for she - who - commands , they would have destroyed long before . [The Rezuites]234-the rezuites , it seemed , were [habitual cannibals]2109-habitual cannibals , whereas [the Lulalaite branch of [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas]2110-the lulalaite branch of the amahagger only practised cannibalism occasionally when by a lucky chance [they]1201-these amahagger got hold of [strangers]4025-strangers . " Such as [yourself]4723-yourself , [Watcher - by - Night]3383-watcher - by - night , and [[your]4723-yourself companions]3226-your companions , "[1964-the old chamberlain] [he]1964-the old chamberlain added with meaning . If [their]1201-these amahagger crime were discovered , however , [Hiya]191-hiya , [She]191-hiya - who - commands , punished it by death .

[I]0-i asked if [she]191-hiya exercised an active rule over [these people]679-these people . [He]1964-the old chamberlain answered that [she]191-hiya did not , as [she]191-hiya lacked sufficient interest in [them]679-these people ; only when [she]191-hiya was angry with [individuals]2113-individuals [she]191-hiya would destroy some of [them]679-these people by " [her]191-hiya arts , "[191-hiya] as [she]191-hiya had power to do if [she]191-hiya chose . Most of [them]679-these people indeed had never seen [her]191-hiya and only knew of [her]191-hiya existence by rumour . To [them]679-these people [she]191-hiya was a spirit or a goddess who inhabited the ancient tombs that lay to [the south of [the old city]2115-the old city]2114-the south of the old city whither [she]191-hiya had come because of the threatened war with [Rezu]88-rezu , whom alone [she]191-hiya feared , [he]88-rezu did not know why . [He]88-rezu told [me]0-i again , moreover , that [she]191-hiya was the greatest magician who had ever been , and that it was certain [she]191-hiya did not die , since [[their]2116-their forefathers]1134-their forefathers knew [her]191-hiya generations ago . Still [she]191-hiya seemed to be under some curse , like [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas [themselves]125-umslopogaas , who were [the descendants of those who had once inhabited [K"r]1-k"r and [the country round [it]1-k"r , as far as [the sea - coast]4728-the sea - coast and for hundreds of miles inland]4727-the country round it , as far as the sea - coast and for hundreds of miles inland , having been [a mighty people]4729-a mighty people in [their]4729-a mighty people day before a great plague destroyed [them]4729-a mighty people]4726-the descendants of those who had once inhabited k"r and the country round it , as far as the sea - coast and for hundreds of miles inland , having been a mighty people in their day before a great plague destroyed them .[125-umslopogaas]

For the rest [he]88-rezu thought that [she]191-hiya was [a very unhappy woman who " lived with [her]191-hiya own soul mourning the dead "[88-rezu] and consorting with none upon [the earth]285-the earth]2118-a very unhappy woman who " lived with her own soul mourning the dead " and consorting with none upon the earth .

[I]0-i asked [him]88-rezu why [she]191-hiya stayed [here]3339-here , whereat [he]88-rezu shook [his]88-rezu head and replied , [he]88-rezu supposed because of the " curse , "[88-rezu] since [he]88-rezu could conceive of no other reason . [He]88-rezu informed [me]0-i also that [her]191-hiya moods varied very much . Sometimes [she]191-hiya was fierce and active and at others by comparison mild and low - spirited . Just now [she]191-hiya was passing through one of the latter stages , perhaps because of [the Rezu]88-rezu trouble , for [she]191-hiya did not wish [[her]191-hiya people]2121-her people to be destroyed by [this terrible person]2122-this terrible person ; or perhaps for some other reason with which [he]88-rezu was not acquainted .

When [she]191-hiya chose , [she]191-hiya knew all things , except the distant future . Thus [she]191-hiya knew that [we]2123-we were coming , also the details of [our]2123-we march and that [we]2123-we should be attacked by [the Rezuites who were going out to meet [[their]2124-the rezuites who were going out to meet their returning company that had been sent afar to find a white queen returning company that had been sent afar to find [a white queen]4540-a white queen]2125-their returning company that had been sent afar to find a white queen]2124-the rezuites who were going out to meet their returning company that had been sent afar to find a white queen . Therefore [she]191-hiya had ordered [him]88-rezu to go with [soldiers]499-soldiers to [our]2123-we assistance . [I]0-i asked why [she]191-hiya went veiled , and [he]88-rezu replied , because of [her]191-hiya beauty which drove even [savage men]2128-savage men mad , so that in old days [she]191-hiya had been obliged to kill [a number of [them]2128-savage men]2129-a number of them .

That was all [he]88-rezu seemed to know about [her]191-hiya , except that [she]191-hiya was kind to those who served [her]191-hiya well , like [himself]88-rezu , and protected [them]2128-savage men from evil of every sort .

Then [I]0-i asked [him]88-rezu about [Rezu]88-rezu . [He]88-rezu answered that [he]88-rezu was [a dreadful person]2130-a dreadful person , undying , it was said , like [She]2131-she - who - commands , though [he]88-rezu had never seen [the man]324-the man [himself]88-rezu and never wanted to do so . [[His]88-rezu followers]4691-his followers being [cannibals]1207-cannibals and having literally eaten up all those that [they]4691-his followers could reach , were now desirous of conquering [the people of [Lulala]217-lulala]4693-the people of lulala that [they]4691-his followers might eat [them]4693-the people of lulala also at [their]4691-his followers leisure . [Each other]3176-each other [they]4691-his followers did not eat , because dog does not eat dog , and therefore [they]4691-his followers were beginning to grow hungry , although [they]4691-his followers had plenty of grain and cattle of which [they]4691-his followers used the milk and hides .

As for the coming battle , [he]88-rezu knew nothing about it or what would happen , save that [She]2131-she - who - commands said that it would go well for [the Lulalaites under [my]0-i direction]2137-the lulalaites under my direction . [She]2131-she was so sure that it would go well , that [she]2131-she did not think it worth while to accompany [the army]2138-the army , for [she]2131-she hated noise and bloodshed .

It occurred to [me]0-i that perhaps [she]2131-she was afraid that [she]2131-she too would be taken captive and eaten , but [I]0-i kept [my]0-i reflection to [myself]0-i .

Just then [we]2139-we arrived at [[our]2139-we camp - house]2140-our camp - house , where [Billali]93-billali bade [me]0-i farewell , saying that [he]93-billali wished to rest as [he]93-billali must be back at dawn with litters , when [he]93-billali hoped to find [us]2139-we ready to start . Then [he]93-billali departed . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [Hans]87-hans also went away to sleep , leaving [me]0-i alone who , having taken [my]0-i repose in the afternoon , did not feel drowsy at the moment . So lovely was the night indeed that [I]0-i made up [my]0-i mind to take a little walk during the midnight hours , after the manner of [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas [themselves]125-umslopogaas , for having now been recognised as [Generalissimo of [their]2142-their forces]2141-generalissimo of their forces , [I]0-i had little fear of being attacked , especially as [I]0-i carried a pistol in [my]0-i pocket . So off [I]0-i set strolling slowly down what seemed to have been [a main street of [the ancient city]2144-the ancient city]2143-a main street of the ancient city , which in [its]2144-the ancient city general appearance resembled [excavated Pompeii]2145-excavated pompeii , only on an infinitely larger scale .

As [I]0-i went [I]0-i meditated on the strange circumstances in which [I]0-i found [myself]0-i . Really [they]2142-their tempted [me]0-i to believe that [I]0-i was suffering from delusions and perhaps all the while in fact lay stretched upon a bed in the delirium of fever . [That marvellous woman]2146-that marvellous woman , for instance - even rejecting [her]2146-that marvellous woman tale of miraculously extended life , which [I]0-i did - what was [I]0-i to make of [her]2146-that marvellous woman ? [I]0-i did not know , except that wondrous as [she]2146-that marvellous woman was , it remained clear that [she]2146-that marvellous woman claimed a great deal more power than [she]2146-that marvellous woman possessed . This was evident from [her]2146-that marvellous woman tone in the interview with [the captains]2062-the captains , and from the fact that [she]2146-that marvellous woman had shuffled off the command of [[her]2146-that marvellous woman tribe]2148-her tribe on to [my]0-i shoulders . If [she]2146-that marvellous woman were so mighty , why did [she]2146-that marvellous woman not command it [herself]2146-that marvellous woman and bring [her]2146-that marvellous woman celestial , or infernal , powers to bear upon [the enemy]1296-the enemy ? Again , [I]0-i could not say , but one fact emerged , namely that [she]2146-that marvellous woman was as interesting as [she]2146-that marvellous woman was beautiful , and uncommonly clever into the bargain .

But what a task was this that [she]2146-that marvellous woman had laid upon [me]0-i , to lead into battle , with [a foe of unascertained strength]2150-a foe of unascertained strength , [a mob of savages]2151-a mob of savages probably quite undisciplined , of whose fighting qualities [I]0-i knew nothing and whom [I]0-i had no opportunity of organising . The affair seemed madness and [I]0-i could only hope that luck or destiny would take [me]0-i through somehow .

To tell the truth , [I]0-i believed it would , for [I]0-i had grown almost as superstitious about [Zikali]104-zikali and [his]104-zikali Great Medicine as was [Hans]87-hans [himself]87-hans . Certainly the effect of it upon [those captains]2152-those captains was very odd , or would have been had not the explanation come to [me]0-i in a flash . On the first night of [our]2153-our meeting , as [I]0-i have described , [I]0-i showed this talisman to [Ayesha]84-ayesha , as a kind of letter of credentials , and now [I]0-i could see that it was [she]84-ayesha who had arranged all the scene with [the captains]2062-the captains , or [[their]2062-the captains tribal magician]2155-their tribal magician , in order to get [her]84-ayesha way about [my]0-i appointment to the command .

Everything about [her]84-ayesha conduct bore this out , even [her]84-ayesha feigning ignorance of the existence of the charm and the leaving of it to [Hans]87-hans to suggest its production , which perhaps [she]84-ayesha did by influencing [his]87-hans mind subconsciously . No doubt more or less it fitted in with one of those nebulous traditions which are so common amongst [ancient savage races]2156-ancient savage races , and therefore once shown to [[her]84-ayesha confederate]2157-her confederate , or [confederates]2158-confederates , would be accepted by [the common people]2159-the common people as a holy sign , after which the rest was easy .

Such an obvious explanation involved the death of any illusions [I]0-i might still cherish about [this Arab lady]2160-this arab lady , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , and it is true that [I]0-i parted with [them]2161-them with regret , as [we]2162-we all do when [we]2162-we think [we]2162-we have discovered something wonderful in the female line . But there it was , and to bother any more about [her]84-ayesha , [her]84-ayesha history and aims , seemed useless .

So dismissing [her]84-ayesha and all present anxieties from [my]0-i mind , [I]0-i began to look about [me]0-i and to wonder at the marvellous scene which unfolded itself before [me]0-i in the moonlight . That [I]0-i might see it better , although [I]0-i was rather afraid of snakes which might hide among the stones , by an easy ascent [I]0-i climbed [a mount of ruins]2163-a mount of ruins and up the broad slope of a tumbled massive wall , which from [its]2164-its thickness [I]0-i judged must have been that of [some fort or temple]2165-some fort or temple . On the crest of this wall , some seventy or eighty feet above the level of [the streets]2166-the streets , [I]0-i sat down and looked about [me]0-i .

Everywhere around [me]0-i stretched [the ruins of [the great city]2168-the great city , now as fallen and as deserted as [Babylon]236-babylon [herself]236-babylon]2167-the ruins of the great city , now as fallen and as deserted as babylon herself . The majestic loneliness of [the place]328-the place was something awful . Even the vision of [companies]2170-companies and [battalions of men]2171-battalions of men crossing [the plain]3355-the plain towards the north with the moonlight glistening on [their]2171-battalions of men spear - points , did little to lessen this sense of loneliness . [I]0-i knew that these were [the regiments which [I]0-i was destined to command]2173-the regiments which i was destined to command , travelling to [the camp where [I]0-i must meet [them]2173-the regiments which i was destined to command]2174-the camp where i must meet them . But in such silence did [they]2173-the regiments which i was destined to command move that no sound came from [them]2173-the regiments which i was destined to command even in the deathly stillness of the perfect night , so that almost [I]0-i was tempted to believe [them]2173-the regiments which i was destined to command to be the shadow - ghosts of [some army of old K"r]4730-some army of old k"r .[2173-the regiments which i was destined to command]

[They]2173-the regiments which i was destined to command vanished , and musing thus [I]0-i think [I]0-i must have dozed . At any rate it seemed to [me]0-i that of a sudden [the city]3203-the city was as [it]3203-the city had been in the days of [its]3203-the city glory . [I]0-i saw [it]3203-the city brilliant with a hundred colours ; everywhere was colour , on the painted walls and roofs , the flowering trees that lined [the streets]2166-the streets and the bright dresses of [the men]3805-the men and women who by [thousands]2178-thousands crowded [them]2166-the streets and [the marts and squares]2179-the marts and squares . Even [the chariots that moved to and fro]2180-the chariots that moved to and fro were coloured as were the countless banners which floated from palace walls and temple tops .

[The enormous place]2181-the enormous place teemed with every activity of life ; [brides]2182-brides being borne to marriage and [dead men]2183-dead men to burial ; [squadrons]2184-squadrons marching , clad in glittering armour ; [merchants]2185-merchants chaffering ; [white - robed priests]2186-white - robed priests and [priestesses]2187-priestesses passing in procession who or what did [they]2188-they worship ? [I]0-i wondered ; [children]3412-children breaking out of [school]2190-school ; [grave philosophers debating in the shadow of a cool arcade]2191-grave philosophers debating in the shadow of a cool arcade ; [a royal person]2192-a royal person making a progress preceded by [runners]2193-runners and surrounded by [slaves]2194-slaves , and lastly the multitudes of [citizens]2195-citizens going about the daily business of life .

Even details were visible , such as those of [officers of the law]2196-officers of the law chasing [an escaped prisoner who had a broken rope tied to [his]2198-his arm , and a collision between two chariots in [a narrow street]2199-a narrow street , about the wrecks of which [an idle mob]2200-an idle mob gathered as it does to - day if [two vehicles]2201-two vehicles collide , while [the owners]2202-the owners argued , gesticulating angrily , and [the police]2203-the police and [grooms]2204-grooms tried to lift a fallen horse on to [its]2205-its feet]2197-an escaped prisoner who had a broken rope tied to his arm , and a collision between two chariots in a narrow street , about the wrecks of which an idle mob gathered as it does to - day if two vehicles collide , while the owners argued , gesticulating angrily , and the police and grooms tried to lift a fallen horse on to its feet . Only no sound of the argument or of anything else reached [me]0-i . [I]0-i saw , and that was all . The silence remained intense , as well it might do , since [those chariots]2206-those chariots must have come to grief thousands upon thousands of years ago .

A cloud seemed to pass before [my]0-i eyes , a thin , gauzy cloud which somehow reminded [me]0-i of the veil that [Ayesha]84-ayesha wore . Indeed at the moment , although [I]0-i could not see [her]84-ayesha , [I]0-i would have sworn that [she]84-ayesha was present at [my]0-i side , and what is more , that [she]84-ayesha was mocking [me]0-i who had set [her]84-ayesha down as so impotent [a trickstress]2207-a trickstress , which doubtless was part of the dream .

At any rate [I]0-i returned to [my]0-i normal state , and there about [me]0-i were the miles of [desolate streets]2208-desolate streets and the thousands of broken walls , and the black blots of [roofless houses]2209-roofless houses and [the wide , untenanted plain bounded by the battlemented line of encircling mountain crests]2210-the wide , untenanted plain bounded by the battlemented line of encircling mountain crests , and above all , the great moon shining softly in a tender sky .

[I]0-i looked and thrilled , though oppressed by the drear and desolate beauty of the scene around [me]0-i , descended the wall and the ruined slope and made [my]0-i way homewards , afraid even of [my]0-i own shadow . For [I]0-i seemed to be the only living thing among [the dead habitations of [immemorial K"r]1-k"r]4731-the dead habitations of immemorial k"r .[87-hans]

Reaching [[our]2211-our camp]1037-our camp [I]0-i found [Hans]87-hans awake and watching for [me]0-i .

" [I]87-hans was just coming to look for [you]0-i , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans said . " Indeed [I]87-hans should have done so before , only [I]87-hans knew that [you]0-i had gone to pay a visit to [that tall white ' Missis ' who ties up [her]4732-that tall white ' missis ' who ties up her head in a blanket , and thought that neither of you head in a blanket , and thought that neither of [you]0-i]4732-that tall white ' missis ' who ties up her head in a blanket , and thought that neither of you would like to be disturbed . "[87-hans]

" Then [you]87-hans thought wrong , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " and what is more , if [you]87-hans had made that visit [I]0-i think it might have been one from which [you]87-hans would never have come back . "[0-i]

" Oh yes , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] sniggered [Hans]87-hans . " [The tall white lady]4733-the tall white lady would not have minded . It is [you]0-i who are so particular , after the fashion of men whom [Heaven]178-heaven made very shy . "[87-hans]

Without deigning to reply to the gibes of [Hans]87-hans [I]0-i went to lie down , wondering what kind of a bed [poor Robertson]161-robertson occupied that night , and soon fell asleep , as fortunately for [myself]0-i [I]0-i have the power to do , whatever [my]0-i circumstances at the moment . [Men who can sleep]2213-men who can sleep are [those who do the work of [the world]277-the world]2214-those who do the work of the world and succeed , though personally [I]0-i have had more of the work than of the success .

[I]0-i was awakened at the first grey dawn by [Hans]87-hans , who informed [me]0-i that [Billali]93-billali was waiting outside with litters , also that [Goroko]168-goroko had already made [his]168-goroko incantations and doctored [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [[his]168-goroko two men]2216-his two men for war after the Zulu fashion when battle was expected . [He]87-hans added that [these Zulus]2217-these zulus had refused to be left behind to guard and nurse [[their]2217-these zulus wounded companions]2218-their wounded companions , and said that rather than do so , [they]2217-these zulus would kill [them]2218-their wounded companions .

Somehow , [he]87-hans informed [me]0-i , in what way [he]87-hans could not guess , this had come to the ears of [the White Lady who " hid [her]2219-her face from [men]3228-men]4734-the white lady who " hid her face from men because it was so ugly , "[2219-her] and [she]2219-her had sent [women]3186-women to attend to [the sick ones]2221-the sick ones , with word that [they]2221-the sick ones should be well cared for . All of this proved to be true enough , but [I]0-i need not enter into the details .

In the end off [we]2222-we went , [I]0-i in [my]0-i litter following [Billali]93-billali 's , with an express and a repeating rifle and plenty of ammunition for both , and [Hans]87-hans , also well armed , in that which had been sent for [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , who preferred to walk with [Goroko]168-goroko and [the two other Zulus]2223-the two other zulus .

For a little while [Hans]87-hans enjoyed the sensation of being carried by [somebody else]2224-somebody else , and lay upon the cushions smoking with a seraphic smile and addressing sarcastic remarks to [the bearers]1681-the bearers , who fortunately did not understand [them]2226-them . Soon , however , [he]87-hans wearied of these novel delights and as [he]87-hans was still determined not to walk until [he]87-hans was obliged , climbed on to the roof of the litter , astride of which [he]87-hans sat as though it were a horse , looking for all [the world]277-the world like a toy monkey on a horizontal stick .

[[Our]2222-we road]716-our road ran across [the level , fertile plain]2229-the level , fertile plain but a small portion of which was cultivated , though [I]0-i could see that at some time or other , when [its]2229-the level , fertile plain population was greater , every inch of [it]2229-the level , fertile plain had been under crop . Now [it]2229-the level , fertile plain was largely covered by trees , many of [them]2230-them fruit - bearing , between which meandered streams of water which once , [I]0-i think , had been irrigation channels .

About ten o'clock [we]2222-we reached [the foot of [the encircling cliffs]2232-the encircling cliffs]2231-the foot of the encircling cliffs and began the climb of [the escarpment]2233-the escarpment , which was steep , tortuous and difficult . By noon [we]2222-we reached [its]2229-the level , fertile plain crest and here found all [[our]2222-we little army]2234-our little army encamped and , except for [the sentries]2235-the sentries , sleeping , as seemed to be the invariable custom of [these people]679-these people in the daytime .

[I]0-i caused [the chief captains]2237-the chief captains to be awakened and with [them]2237-the chief captains made a circuit of [the camp]3963-the camp , reckoning the numbers of [the men which came to about 3,250]2239-the men which came to about 3,250 and learning what [I]0-i could concerning [them]2239-the men which came to about 3,250 and [their]2239-the men which came to about 3,250 way of fighting . Then , accompanied by [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [Hans]87-hans with [the Zulus]354-the zulus as [a guard]1324-a guard , also by three of [the head - captains of [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas]2242-the head - captains of the amahagger , [I]0-i walked forward to study [the lie of [the land]3243-the land]2243-the lie of the land .

Coming to the further edge of [the escarpment]2233-the escarpment , [I]0-i found that at [this place]3445-this place [two broad - based ridges]2247-two broad - based ridges , shaped like those that spring from the boles of [certain tropical forest trees]2248-certain tropical forest trees , ran from [its]2247-two broad - based ridges crest to [the plain beneath]2249-the plain beneath at a gentle slope . Moreover [I]0-i saw that on [this plain between the ends of the ridges]2250-this plain between the ends of the ridges [an army]4104-an army was encamped which , by the aid of [my]0-i glasses , [I]0-i examined and estimated to number at least [ten thousand men]2252-ten thousand men .

This army , [the Amahagger captains]2253-the amahagger captains informed [me]0-i , was that of [Rezu]88-rezu , who , [they]2253-the amahagger captains said , intended to commence [his]88-rezu attack at dawn on the following morning , since [the People of Rezu]2106-the people of rezu , being [sun - worshippers]2255-sun - worshippers , would never fight until [[their]2106-the people of rezu god]4336-their god appeared above the horizon . Having studied all there was to see [I]0-i asked [the captains]2062-the captains to set out [their]2062-the captains plan of battle , if [they]2062-the captains had a plan .

[[The chief]503-the chief of [them]2062-the captains]2259-the chief of them answered that it was to advance halfway down [the right - hand ridge]2260-the right - hand ridge to a spot where there was [a narrow flat piece of ground]2261-a narrow flat piece of ground , and there await attack , since at [this place]3445-this place [their]2062-the captains smaller numbers would not so much matter , whereas these made it impossible for [them]2062-the captains to assail [the enemy]1296-the enemy .

" But suppose that [Rezu]88-rezu should choose to come up to the other ridge and get behind [you]2264-you . What would happen then ? "[0-i] [I]0-i inquired .

[He]2264-you replied that [he]2264-you did not know , [his]2264-you ideas of strategy being , it was clear , of a primitive order .

" Do [[your]2264-you people]3642-your people fight best at night or in the day ? "[0-i] [I]0-i went on .

[He]2264-you said undoubtedly at night , indeed in all [their]2062-the captains history there was no record of [their]2062-the captains having done so in the daytime .

" And yet [you]2264-you propose to let [Rezu]88-rezu join battle with [you]2264-you when the sun is high , or in other words to court defeat , "[0-i] [I]0-i remarked .

Then [I]0-i went aside and discussed things for a while with [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [Hans]87-hans , after which [I]0-i returned and gave [my]0-i orders , declining all argument . Briefly these were that in the dusk before the rising of the moon , [[our]2265-our Amahagger]2266-our amahagger must advance down [the right - hand ridge]2260-the right - hand ridge in complete silence , and hide [themselves]2266-our amahagger among the scrub which [I]0-i saw grew thickly near [its]2260-the right - hand ridge root . [A small party]2268-a small party , however , under the leadership of [Goroko]168-goroko , whom [I]0-i knew to be [a brave and clever captain]2269-a brave and clever captain , was to pass halfway down [the left - hand ridge]2270-the left - hand ridge and there light fires over [a wide area]2271-a wide area , so as to make [the enemy]1296-the enemy think that [our]2265-our whole force had encamped there . Then at the proper moment which [I]0-i had not yet decided upon , [we]2265-our would attack [the army of [Rezu]88-rezu]2273-the army of rezu .

[The Amahagger captains]2253-the amahagger captains did not seem pleased with this plan which [I]0-i think was too bold for [their]2253-the amahagger captains fancy , and began to murmur together . Seeing that [I]0-i must assert [my]0-i authority at once , [I]0-i walked up to [them]2253-the amahagger captains and said to [[their]2253-the amahagger captains chief man]2275-their chief man ,

" Hearken , [[my]0-i friend]270-my friend . By [your]270-my friend own wish , not [mine]0-i , [I]0-i have been appointed [[your]270-my friend general]4685-your general and [I]0-i expect to be obeyed without question . From the moment that the advance begins [you]270-my friend will keep close to [me]0-i and to the Black One , and if so much as one of [[your]270-my friend men]3991-your men hesitates or turns back , [you]270-my friend will die , "[0-i] and [I]0-i nodded towards the axe of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas . " Moreover , afterwards [She]4740-she - who - commands will see that others of [you]270-my friend die , should [you]270-my friend escape in the fight . "[0-i]

Still [they]2253-the amahagger captains hesitated . Thereon without another word , [I]0-i produced [Zikali]104-zikali 's Great Medicine and held it before [their]2253-the amahagger captains eyes , with the result that the sight of this ugly thing did what even the threat of death could not do . [They]2253-the amahagger captains went flat on the ground , [every one of [them]2253-the amahagger captains]2276-every one of them , and swore by [Lulala]217-lulala and by [She]2277-she - who - commands , [[her]217-lulala priestess]2278-her priestess , that [they]2253-the amahagger captains would do all [I]0-i said , however mad it seemed to [them]2253-the amahagger captains .

" Good , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " Now go back and make ready , and for the rest , by this time to - morrow [we]2283-we shall know who is or is not mad . "[0-i]

From that moment till the end [I]0-i had no more trouble with [these Amahagger]1201-these amahagger .

[I]0-i will get on quickly with the story of this fight whereof the preliminary details do not matter . At the proper time [Goroko]168-goroko went off with [two hundred and fifty men]2280-two hundred and fifty men and [one of [the two Zulus]3819-the two zulus]2281-one of the two zulus to light the fires and , at an agreed signal , namely the firing of two shots in rapid succession by [myself]0-i , to begin shouting and generally make as much noise as [they]2253-the amahagger captains could .

[We]2283-we also went off with [the remaining three thousand]2284-the remaining three thousand , and before the moon rose , crept as quietly as ghosts down [the right - hand ridge]2260-the right - hand ridge .
