Being such [a silent folk who were accustomed to move at night and could see in the dark almost as well as cats]2286-a silent folk who were accustomed to move at night and could see in the dark almost as well as cats , [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas executed this manoeuvre splendidly , wrapping [their]2253-the amahagger captains spear - blades in bands of dry grass lest light should glint on them and betray [our]2283-we movements . So in due course [we]2283-we came to the patch of bush where [the ridge]2287-the ridge widened out about five hundred yards from [the plain beneath]2249-the plain beneath , and there lay down in [four companies]2289-four companies or [regiments]2290-regiments , each of [them]2289-four companies about seven hundred and fifty strong .

Now the moon had risen , but because of the mist which covered the surface of [the plain]3355-the plain , [we]2283-we could see nothing of [the camp of Rezu which [we]2283-we knew must be within a thousand yards of [us]2283-we]2292-the camp of rezu which we knew must be within a thousand yards of us , unless indeed it had been moved , as the silence seemed to suggest .

This circumstance gave [me]0-i much anxiety , since [I]0-i feared lest abandoning [their]2253-the amahagger captains reputed habits , [these Rezuites]2293-these rezuites were also contemplating a night attack . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , too , was disturbed on the subject , though because of [Goroko]168-goroko and [[his]168-goroko men]1123-his men whose fires began to twinkle on [the opposing ridge something over a mile away]2295-the opposing ridge something over a mile away , [they]2293-these rezuites could not pass up there without [our]2283-we knowledge .

Still , for aught [I]0-i knew there might be other ways of scaling [this mountain]4113-this mountain . [I]0-i did not trust [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas , who declared that none existed , since [their]2253-the amahagger captains local knowledge was slight as [they]2253-the amahagger captains never visited [these northern slopes]2297-these northern slopes because of [their]2253-the amahagger captains fear of [Rezu]88-rezu . Supposing that [the enemy]1296-the enemy gained the crest and suddenly assaulted [us]2283-we in the rear ! The thought of it made [me]0-i feel cold down the back .

While [I]0-i was wondering how [I]0-i could find out the truth , [Hans]87-hans , who was squatted behind a bush , suddenly rose and gave the rifle [he]87-hans was carrying to [the remaining Zulu]2299-the remaining zulu .

" [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans said , " [I]87-hans am going to look and find out what [those people]4741-those people are doing , if [they]4741-those people are still there , and then [you]121-baas will know how and when to attack [them]4741-those people . Do n't be afraid for [me]87-hans , [Baas]121-baas , it will be easy in that mist and [you]121-baas know [I]87-hans can move like a snake . Also if [I]87-hans should not come back , it does not matter and it will tell [you]121-baas that [they]4741-those people are there . "[87-hans]

[I]0-i hesitated who did not wish to expose [the brave little Hottentot]2300-the brave little hottentot to such risks . But when [he]87-hans understood , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas said ,

" Let [the man]324-the man go . It is [his]324-the man gift and duty to spy , as it is mine to smite with the axe , and [yours]121-baas to lead , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . Let [him]324-the man go , [I]125-umslopogaas say . "[125-umslopogaas]

[I]0-i nodded [my]0-i head , and having kissed [my]0-i hand in [his]87-hans silly fashion in token of much that [he]87-hans did not wish to say , [Hans]87-hans slipped out of sight , saying that [he]87-hans hoped to be back within an hour . Except for [his]87-hans great knife , [he]87-hans went unarmed , who feared that if [he]87-hans took a pistol [he]87-hans might be tempted to fire it and make a noise .

[CHAPTER XVII

THE MIDNIGHT BATTLE

That hour]2301-chapter xvii the midnight battle that hour went by very slowly . Again and again [I]0-i consulted [my]0-i watch by the light of the moon , which was now rising high in the heavens , and thought that it would never come to an end . Listen as [I]0-i would , there was nothing to be heard , and as the mist still prevailed the only thing [I]0-i could see except the heavens , was the twinkling of the fires lit by [Goroko]168-goroko and [[his]168-goroko party]2302-his party .

At length it was done and there was no sign of [Hans]87-hans . Another half hour passed and still no sign of [Hans]87-hans .

" [I]125-umslopogaas think that [Light - in - Darkness]189-light - in - darkness is dead or taken prisoner , "[125-umslopogaas] said [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas .

[I]0-i answered that [I]0-i feared so , but that [I]0-i would give [him]87-hans another fifteen minutes and then , if [he]87-hans did not appear , [I]0-i proposed to order an advance , hoping to find [the enemy where [we]2304-we had last seen [them]2303-the enemy where we had last seen them from the top of the mountain from [the top of the mountain]2305-the top of the mountain]2303-the enemy where we had last seen them from the top of the mountain .

The fifteen minutes went by also , and as [I]0-i could see that [the Amahagger captains who sat at a little distance]2306-the amahagger captains who sat at a little distance were getting very nervous , [I]0-i picked up [my]0-i double - barrelled rifle and turned round so that [I]0-i faced up hill with a view of firing it as had been agreed with [Goroko]168-goroko , but in such a fashion that the flashes perhaps would not be seen from [the plain below]2307-the plain below . For this purpose [I]0-i moved a few yards to the left to get behind the trunk of a tree that grew there , and was already lifting the rifle to [my]0-i shoulder , when a yellow hand clasped the barrel and a husky voice said ,

" Do n't fire yet , [Baas]121-baas , as [I]0-i want to tell [you]121-baas [my]0-i story first . "[0-i]

[I]0-i looked down and there was the ugly face of [Hans]87-hans wearing a grin that might have frightened [the man in the moon]2308-the man in the moon .

" Well , "[0-i] [I]0-i said with cold indifference , assumed [I]0-i admit to hide [my]0-i excessive joy at [his]87-hans safe return , " tell on , and be quick about it . [I]0-i suppose [you]87-hans lost [your]87-hans way and never found [them]4743-them . "[0-i]

" Yes , [Baas]121-baas , [I]0-i lost [my]0-i way for the fog was very thick down there . But in the end [I]0-i found [them]4743-them all right , by [my]0-i nose , [Baas]121-baas , for [those man - eating people]4744-those man - eating people smell strong and [I]0-i got the wind of one of [[their]4743-them sentries]4745-their sentries . It was easy to pass [him]87-hans in the mist , [Baas]121-baas , so easy that [I]0-i was tempted to cut [his]87-hans throat as [I]0-i went , but [I]0-i did n't for fear lest [he]87-hans should make a noise . No , [I]0-i walked on right into the middle of [them]4743-them , which was easy too , for [they]4743-them were all asleep , wrapped up in blankets . [They]4743-them had n't any fires perhaps because [they]4743-them did n't want them to be seen , or perhaps because it is so hot down in [that low land]4746-that low land , [I]0-i do n't know which .[0-i]

" So [I]0-i crept on taking note of all [I]0-i saw , till at last [I]0-i came to [a little hill of which [the top rose above the level of the mist]4748-the top rose above the level of the mist]4747-a little hill of which the top rose above the level of the mist , so that [I]0-i could see on [it]4747-a little hill of which the top rose above the level of the mist [a long hut built of green boughs with the leaves still fresh upon them]4749-a long hut built of green boughs with the leaves still fresh upon them . Now [I]0-i thought that [I]0-i would crawl up to [the hut]380-the hut since it came into [my]0-i mind that [Rezu]88-rezu [himself]88-rezu must be sleeping [there]3196-there and that [I]0-i might kill [him]88-rezu . But while [I]0-i stood hesitating [I]0-i heard a noise like to that made by [an old woman whose husband]4752-an old woman whose husband had thrown a blanket over [her]4752-an old woman whose husband head to keep [her]4752-an old woman whose husband quiet , or to that of a bee in a bottle , a sort of droning noise that reminded [me]0-i of something .[0-i]

" [I]0-i thought a while and remembered that when [Red Beard]121-baas was on [his]121-baas knees praying to [Heaven]178-heaven , as is [his]121-baas habit when [he]121-baas has nothing else to do , [Baas]121-baas , [he]121-baas makes a noise just like that . [I]0-i crept towards the sound and presently there [I]0-i found [Red Beard]121-baas [himself]121-baas tied upon a stone and looking as mad as a buffalo bull stuck in [a swamp]4753-a swamp , for [he]121-baas shook [his]121-baas head and rolled [his]121-baas eyes about , just as though [he]121-baas had had two bottles of bad gin , Baas , and all the while [he]121-baas kept saying prayers . Now [I]0-i thought that [I]0-i would cut [him]121-baas loose , and bent over [him]121-baas to do so , when by ill - luck [he]121-baas saw [my]0-i face and began to shout , saying ,[0-i]

" ' Go away , [[you]0-i yellow devil]4754-you yellow devil . [I]0-i know [you]0-i have come to take [me]0-i to hell , but [you]0-i are too soon , and if [my]0-i hands were loose [I]0-i would twist [your]0-i head off [your]0-i shoulders . '[0-i]

" [He]121-baas said this in English , [Baas]121-baas , which as [you]0-i know [I]0-i can understand quite well , after which [I]0-i was sure that [I]0-i had better leave [him]121-baas alone . Whilst [I]0-i was thinking , there came out of [the hut]380-the hut above [two old men]4756-two old men dressed in night - shirts , such as [you]0-i white people wear , with yellow things upon [their]4756-two old men heads that had a metal picture of the sun in front of [them]4756-two old men . "[0-i]

" [Medicine - men]4757-medicine - men , "[0-i] [I]0-i suggested .

" Yes , [Baas]121-baas , or [Predikants of some sort]4758-predikants of some sort , for [they]4756-two old men were rather like [[your]0-i reverend father]3327-your reverend father when [he]3327-your reverend father dressed [himself]3327-your reverend father up and went into a box to preach . Seeing [them]4756-two old men [I]0-i slipped back a little way to where the mist began , lay down and listened . [They]4756-two old men looked at [Red Beard]121-baas , for [his]121-baas shouts at [me]0-i had brought [them]4756-two old men out , but [he]121-baas took no notice of [them]4756-two old men , only went on making a noise like a beetle in a tin can .[0-i]

" ' It is nothing , ' said one of [the Predikants]237-the predikants to the other in the same tongue that [these Amahagger]1201-these amahagger use . ' But when is [he]121-baas to be sacrificed ? Soon , [I]0-i hope , for [I]0-i can not sleep because of the noise [he]121-baas makes . '[0-i]

" ' When the edge of the sun appears , not before , ' answered [the other Predikant]4761-the other predikant . ' Then [the new queen]4762-the new queen will be brought out of [the hut]380-the hut and [this white man]675-this white man will be sacrificed to [her]4762-the new queen . '[0-i]

" ' [I]0-i think it is a pity to wait so long , ' said [the first Predikant]4765-the first predikant , ' for never shall [we]4766-they sleep in peace until the red - hot pot is on [his]121-baas head . '[0-i]

" ' First the victory , then the feast , ' answered [the second Predikant]4767-the second predikant , ' though [he]121-baas will not be so good to eat as [that fat young woman who was with [the new queen]4762-the new queen]4768-that fat young woman who was with the new queen . '[0-i]

" Then , [Baas]121-baas , [they]4766-they both smacked [their]4766-they lips and one of [them]4766-they went back towards [the hut]380-the hut . But [the other]3553-the other did not go back . No , [he]3553-the other sat down on the ground and glowered at [Baas Red - Beard]121-baas upon the stone . More , [he]3553-the other struck [him]3553-the other on the face to make [him]3553-the other quiet .[0-i]

" Now , [Baas]121-baas , when [I]0-i saw this and remembered that [they]4766-they had said that [they]4766-they had eaten [Janee]172-janee whom [I]0-i liked although [she]172-janee was such [a fool]3850-a fool , the spirit in [me]0-i grew so very angry and [I]0-i thought that [I]0-i would give [this old skellum i.e. rascal of a Predikant]4773-this old skellum i.e. rascal of a predikant a taste of sacrifice [himself]4773-this old skellum i.e. rascal of a predikant , after which [I]0-i purposed to creep to [the hut]380-the hut and see if [I]0-i could get speech with [the Lady Sad - Eyes]3814-the lady sad - eyes , if [she]172-janee was there .[0-i]

" So [I]0-i wriggled up behind [the Predikant]124-the predikant as [he]124-the predikant sat glowering over Red - Beard , and stuck [my]0-i knife into [his]124-the predikant back where [I]0-i thought it would kill [him]124-the predikant at once . But it did n't , [Baas]121-baas , for [he]124-the predikant fell on to [his]124-the predikant face and began to make a noise like a wounded hyena before [I]0-i could finish [him]124-the predikant . Then [I]0-i heard a sound of shouts , and to save [my]0-i life was obliged to run away into the mist , without loosing [Red - Beard]121-baas or seeing [Lady Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes . [I]0-i ran very hard , [Baas]121-baas , making a wide circle to the left , and so at last got back here . That 's all , [Baas]121-baas . "[0-i]

" And quite enough , too , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " though if [they]2253-the amahagger captains did not see [you]121-baas , the death of [the Medicine - man]4776-the medicine - man may frighten [them]2253-the amahagger captains . [Poor Janee]172-janee ! Well , [I]0-i hope to come even with [those devils]4777-those devils before [they]4777-those devils are three hours older . "[0-i]

Then [I]0-i called up [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [the Amahagger captains]2253-the amahagger captains and told [them]2253-the amahagger captains the substance of the story , also that [Hans]87-hans had located [the army]2138-the army , or part of it .

The end of it was that [we]2311-we made up [our]2311-we minds to attack at once ; indeed [I]0-i insisted on this , as [I]0-i was determined if [I]0-i could to save [that unfortunate man]2312-that unfortunate man , [Robertson]161-robertson , who , from [Hans]87-hans ' account , evidently was now quite mad and raving . So [I]0-i fired the two shots as had been arranged and presently heard the sound of distant shoutings on [the slope of [the opposing ridge]2314-the opposing ridge]2313-the slope of the opposing ridge . A few minutes later [we]2311-we started , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [I]0-i leading [the vanguard]2315-the vanguard and [the Amahagger captains]2253-the amahagger captains following with [the three remaining companies]2317-the three remaining companies .

Now [the reader]2318-the reader , presuming the existence of [such a person]1448-such a person , will think that everything is sure to go right ; that [this cunning old fellow]2320-this cunning old fellow , [Allan Quatermain]83-allan , is going to surprise and wipe the floor with those Rezuites , who were already beguiled by the trick [he]2320-this cunning old fellow had instructed [Goroko]168-goroko to play . That after this [he]2320-this cunning old fellow will rescue [Robertson]161-robertson who doubtless shortly recovers [his]161-robertson mind , also [Inez]159-inez with the greatest ease , in fact that everything will happen as it ought to do if this were a romance instead of a mere record of remarkable facts . But being the latter , as it happened , matters did not work out quite in this convenient way .

To begin with , when those [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas told [me]0-i that [the Rezuites]234-the rezuites never fought in the dark or before the sun was well up , either [they]234-the rezuites lied or [they]234-the rezuites were much mistaken , for at any rate on this occasion [they]234-the rezuites did the exact contrary . All the while that [we]2321-we thought [we]2321-we were stalking [them]234-the rezuites , [they]234-the rezuites were stalking [us]2321-we . The Goroko manoeuvre had not deceived [them]234-the rezuites in the least , since from [[their]234-the rezuites spies]2322-their spies [they]234-the rezuites knew its exact significance .

Here , [I]0-i may add that [those spies]2323-those spies were in [our]2321-we own ranks , [traitors]2324-traitors , in short , who were really in the pay of [Rezu]88-rezu and possibly belonged to [his]88-rezu abominable faith , some of whom slipped away from time to time to [the enemy]1296-the enemy to report [our]2321-we progress and plans , so far as [they]1296-the enemy knew [them]2326-them .

Further , what [Hans]87-hans had stumbled on was [a mere rear guard left around [the place of sacrifice]2328-the place of sacrifice and [the hut where [Inez]159-inez was confined]2329-the hut where inez was confined]2327-a mere rear guard left around the place of sacrifice and the hut where inez was confined . [The real army [he]87-hans never found at all]2330-the real army he never found at all . That was divided into two bodies and hidden in bush to the right and left of [the ridge which [we]2321-we were descending just at the spot where it joined [the plain beneath]2249-the plain beneath]2331-the ridge which we were descending just at the spot where it joined the plain beneath , and into the jaws of [these two armies]2333-these two armies [we]2321-we marched gaily .

Now that [hypothetical reader]2334-hypothetical reader will say , " Why did n't [that silly old fool]4778-that silly old fool , [Allan]83-allan , think of all these things ? Why did n't [he]4778-that silly old fool remember that [he]4778-that silly old fool was commanding [a pack of savages with whom [he]4778-that silly old fool had no real acquaintance , among whom there were sure to be [traitors]2324-traitors , especially as [they]2324-traitors were of the same blood as [the Rezuites]234-the rezuites]4779-a pack of savages with whom he had no real acquaintance , among whom there were sure to be traitors , especially as they were of the same blood as the rezuites , and take precautions ? "[2334-hypothetical reader]

Ah ! [[my]0-i dear reader]2335-my dear reader , [I]0-i will only answer that [I]0-i wish [you]2335-my dear reader had handled the job [yourself]2335-my dear reader , and enjoyed the opportunity of seeing what [you]2335-my dear reader could do in the circumstances . Do [you]2335-my dear reader suppose [I]0-i did n't think of all these points ? Of course [I]0-i did . But have [you]2335-my dear reader ever heard of the difficulty of making silk purses out of [sows]2336-sows ' ears , or of turning [a lot of gloomy and disagreeable barbarians whom [you]2335-my dear reader had never even drilled , into trustworthy and efficient soldiers ready to fight three times [their]2337-a lot of gloomy and disagreeable barbarians whom you had never even drilled , into trustworthy and efficient soldiers ready to fight three times their own number and beat them own number and beat [them]2337-a lot of gloomy and disagreeable barbarians whom you had never even drilled , into trustworthy and efficient soldiers ready to fight three times their own number and beat them]2337-a lot of gloomy and disagreeable barbarians whom you had never even drilled , into trustworthy and efficient soldiers ready to fight three times their own number and beat them ?

Also [I]0-i beg to observe that [I]0-i did get through somehow , as [you]2335-my dear reader shall learn , which is more than [you]2335-my dear reader might have done , [Mr. Wisdom]89-wisdom , though [I]0-i admit , not without help from another quarter . It is all very well for [you]2335-my dear reader to sit in [your]2335-my dear reader armchair and be sapient and turn up [your]2335-my dear reader learned nose , like [the gentlemen who criticise plays and poems]2338-the gentlemen who criticise plays and poems , an easy job compared to the writing of them . From all of which , however , [you]2335-my dear reader will understand that [I]0-i am , to tell the truth , rather ashamed of what followed , since qui s'excuse , s'accuse .

As [we]2339-we slunk down [that hill]2340-that hill in the moonlight , [a queer - looking crowd]2341-a queer - looking crowd , [I]0-i admit also that [I]0-i felt very uncomfortable . To begin with [I]0-i did not like that remark of [the Medicine - man]4776-the medicine - man which [Hans]87-hans reported , to the effect that the feast must come after the victory , especially as [he]87-hans had said just before that [Robertson]159-inez was to be sacrificed as the sun rose , which would seem to suggest that the " victory "[87-hans] was planned to take place before that event .

While [I]0-i was ruminating upon this subject , [I]0-i looked round for [Hans]87-hans to cross - examine [him]87-hans as to [the priest]2343-the priest 's exact words , only to find that [he]87-hans had slunk off somewhere . A few minutes later [he]87-hans reappeared running back towards [us]2339-we swiftly and , [I]0-i noticed , taking shelter behind tree trunks and rocks as [he]87-hans came .

" [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans gasped , for [he]87-hans was out of breath , " be careful , [those Rezu men]4781-those rezu men are on either side ahead . [I]87-hans went forward and ran into [them]4781-those rezu men . [They]4781-those rezu men threw many spears at [me]87-hans . Look ! "[87-hans] and [he]87-hans showed a slight cut on [his]87-hans arm from which blood was flowing .

Instantly [I]0-i understood that [we]2339-we were ambushed and began to think very hard indeed . As it chanced [we]2339-we were passing across [a large flat space upon [the ridge]2287-the ridge]2344-a large flat space upon the ridge , say seven or eight acres in extent , where the bush grew lightly , though owing to the soil being better , the trees were tall .

On [the steep slope below [this little plain]2347-this little plain]2346-the steep slope below this little plain [it]2348-it seemed to be denser and there it was , according to [Hans]87-hans , that the ambush was set . [I]0-i halted [[my]0-i regiment]2349-my regiment and sent back messengers to [the others]3164-the others that [they]3164-the others were to halt also as [they]3164-the others came up , on the pretext of giving [them]3164-the others a rest before [they]3164-the others were marshalled and [we]2339-we advanced to the battle .

Then [I]0-i told [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas what [Hans]87-hans said and asked [him]87-hans to send out [[his]87-hans Zulu soldier whom [he]87-hans could trust]2351-his zulu soldier whom he could trust , to see if [he]87-hans could obtain confirmation of the report . This [he]87-hans did at once . Also [I]0-i asked [him]87-hans what [he]87-hans thought should be done , supposing that it was true .

" Form [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas into a ring or [a square]4782-a square and await attack , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans answered .

[I]0-i nodded , for that was [my]0-i own opinion , but replied ,

" If [they]4783-they were [Zulus]3966-zulus , the plan would be good . But how do [we]4785-we know that [these men]850-these men will stand ? "[0-i]

" [We]4785-we know nothing , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , and therefore can only try . If [they]4783-they run it must be up - hill . "[0-i]

Then [I]0-i called [the captains]2062-the captains and told [them]2062-the captains what was toward , which seemed to alarm [them]2062-the captains very much . Indeed [one or two of [them]2062-the captains]2353-one or two of them wanted to retreat at once , but [I]0-i said [I]0-i would shoot [the first man who tried to do so]2354-the first man who tried to do so . In the end [they]2062-the captains agreed to [my]0-i plan and said that [they]2062-the captains would post [[their]2062-the captains best soldiers]2355-their best soldiers above , at the top of [the square]2057-the square , with the orders to stop any attempt at a flight up [the mountain]1489-the mountain .

After this [we]2358-we formed up [the square]2057-the square as best [we]2358-we could , arranging [it]2057-the square in a rather rough , four - fold line . While [we]2358-we were doing this [we]2358-we heard some shouts below and presently [the Zulu]2360-the zulu returned , who reported that all was as [Hans]87-hans had said and that [[Rezu]88-rezu 's men]2361-rezu 's men were moving round [us]2358-we , having discovered , as [he]87-hans thought , that [we]2358-we had halted and escaped [their]2361-rezu 's men ambush .

Still the attack did not develop at once , for the reason that [the Rezu army]2362-the rezu army was crawling up the steep flanks of [the spur on either side of [the level piece of ground]2364-the level piece of ground]2363-the spur on either side of the level piece of ground , with a view of encircling [us]2358-we altogether , so as to make a clean sweep of [[our]2358-we force]2365-our force . As a matter of fact , considered from [our]2358-we point of view , this was a most fortunate move , since thereby [they]2361-rezu 's men stopped any attempt at a retreat on the part of [[our]2358-we Amahagger]2266-our amahagger , whose bolt - hole was now blocked .

When [we]2358-we had done all [we]2358-we could , [we]2358-we sat down , or at least [I]0-i did , and waited . The night , [I]0-i remember , was strangely still , only from the slopes on either side of [[our]2358-we plateau]2367-our plateau came a kind of rustling sound which in fact was caused by the feet of [[Rezu]88-rezu 's people]2368-rezu 's people , as [they]2361-rezu 's men marched to surround [us]2358-we .

It ceased at last and the silence grew complete , so much so that [I]0-i could hear the teeth of [some of [our]2358-we tall [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas]2369-some of our tall amahagger chattering with fear , a sound that gave [me]0-i little confidence and caused [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas to remark that the hearts of [these big men]2370-these big men had never grown ; [they]2370-these big men remained " as those of [babies]4787-babies . "[2370-these big men] [I]0-i told [the captains]2062-the captains to pass the word down the ranks that [those who stood]2372-those who stood might live , but [those who fled]2373-those who fled would certainly die . Therefore if [they]2370-these big men wished to see [[their]2370-these big men homes]2374-their homes again [they]2370-these big men had better stand and fight like [men]3228-men . Otherwise [most of [them]2370-these big men]1269-most of them would be killed and the rest eaten by [Rezu]88-rezu . This was done , and [I]0-i observed that the message seemed to produce a steadying effect upon [[our]2358-we ranks]2377-our ranks .

Suddenly all around [us]2358-we , from below , from above and on either side there broke a most awful roar which seemed to shape itself into the word , [Rezu]88-rezu , and next minute also from above , below and either side , [some ten thousand men]2378-some ten thousand men poured forth upon [[our]2358-we square]2379-our square .

In the moonlight [they]2378-some ten thousand men looked very terrible with [their]2378-some ten thousand men flowing white robes and great gleaming spears . [Hans]87-hans and [I]0-i fired some shots , though for all the effect [they]2378-some ten thousand men produced , [we]2358-we might as well have pelted [a breaker with pebbles]2380-a breaker with pebbles . Then , as [I]0-i thought that [I]0-i should be more useful alive than dead , [I]0-i retreated within [the square]2057-the square , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , [[his]125-umslopogaas Zulu]2382-his zulu , and [Hans]87-hans coming with [me]0-i .

On the whole [our]2358-we [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas stood the attack better than [I]0-i expected . [They]2378-some ten thousand men beat back the first rush with considerable loss to [the enemy]1296-the enemy , also the second after a longer struggle . Then there was a pause during which [we]2358-we re - formed [our]2358-we ranks , dragging [the wounded men]1603-the wounded men into [the square]2057-the square .

Scarcely had [we]2358-we done this when with another mighty shout of " [Rezu]88-rezu ! "[1296-the enemy] [the enemy]1296-the enemy attacked again - that was about an hour after the battle had begun . But now [they]2378-some ten thousand men had changed [their]2378-some ten thousand men tactics , for instead of trying to rush all sides of [the square]2057-the square at once , [they]2378-some ten thousand men concentrated [their]2378-some ten thousand men efforts on the western front , that which faced towards [the plain below]2307-the plain below .

On [they]2378-some ten thousand men came , and among [them]2378-some ten thousand men in the forefront of the battle , now and again [I]0-i caught sight of [a gigantic man]2389-a gigantic man , a huge creature who seemed to [me]0-i to be seven feet high and big in proportion . [I]0-i could not see [him]2389-a gigantic man clearly because of the uncertain moonlight , but [I]0-i noted [his]2389-a gigantic man fierce aspect , also that [he]2389-a gigantic man had an enormous beard , black streaked with grey , that flowed down to [his]2389-a gigantic man middle , and that [his]2389-a gigantic man hair hung in masses upon [his]2389-a gigantic man shoulders .

" [Rezu]88-rezu [himself]88-rezu ! "[0-i] [I]0-i shouted to [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas .

" Aye , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [Rezu]88-rezu [himself]88-rezu without doubt , and [I]0-i rejoice to see [him]88-rezu for [he]88-rezu will be [a worthy foe to fight]4788-a worthy foe to fight . Look ! [he]88-rezu carries an axe as [I]0-i do . Now [I]0-i must save [my]0-i strength for when [we]4789-we come face to face [I]0-i shall need it all . "[0-i]

[I]0-i thought that [I]0-i would spare [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas this exertion and watched [my]0-i opportunity to put a bullet through this giant . But [I]0-i could never get one . Once when [I]0-i had covered [him]2390-him an [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas rushed in front of [my]0-i gun so that [I]0-i could not shoot , and when a second chance came a little cloud floated over the face of the moon and made [him]2390-him invisible . After that [I]0-i had other things to which to attend , since , as [I]0-i expected would happen , the western face of [[our]2391-us square]2379-our square gave , and yelling like devils , [the enemy]1296-the enemy began to pour in through the gap .

A cold thrill went through [me]0-i for [I]0-i saw that the game was up . To re - form these undisciplined [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas was impossible ; nothing was to be expected except panic , rout and slaughter . [I]0-i cursed [my]0-i folly for ever having had anything to do with the business , while [Hans]87-hans screamed to [me]0-i in a thin voice that the only chance was for [us]2391-us three and [the Zulu]2360-the zulu to bolt and hide in the bush .

[I]0-i did not answer [him]87-hans because , apart from any nasty pride , the thing was impossible , for how could [we]2391-us get through [those struggling masses of men which surrounded [us]2391-us on every side]2395-those struggling masses of men which surrounded us on every side ? No , [my]0-i clock had struck , so [I]0-i went on making a kind of mental sandwich of prayers and curses ; prayers for [my]0-i soul and forgiveness for [my]0-i sins , and curses on [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas and everything to do with [them]2395-those struggling masses of men which surrounded us on every side , especially [Zikali]104-zikali and [the woman called [Ayesha]84-ayesha]2396-the woman called ayesha , who , between [them]2395-those struggling masses of men which surrounded us on every side , had led [me]0-i into this affair .

" Perhaps [the Great Medicine of Zikali]4790-the great medicine of zikali , "[87-hans] piped [Hans]87-hans again as [he]87-hans fired a rifle at [the advancing foe]2397-the advancing foe .

" Hang the Great Medicine , "[0-i] [I]0-i shouted back , " and [Ayesha]84-ayesha with it . No wonder [she]84-ayesha declined to take a hand in this business . "[0-i]

As [I]0-i spoke the words [I]0-i saw [old Billali]93-billali , who not being [a man of war]2398-a man of war was keeping as close to [us]2399-us as [he]93-billali could , go flat onto [his]93-billali venerable face , and reflected that [he]93-billali must have got a thrown spear through [him]93-billali . Casting a hurried glance at [him]93-billali to see if [he]93-billali were done for or only wounded , out of the corner of [my]0-i eye [I]0-i caught sight of something diaphanous which gleamed in the moonlight and reminded [me]0-i of [I]0-i knew not what at the moment .

[I]0-i looked round quickly to see what it might be and lo ! there , almost at [my]0-i side was the veiled [Ayesha]84-ayesha [herself]84-ayesha , holding in [her]84-ayesha hand a little rod made of black wood inlaid with ivory not unlike [a field marshal]2400-a field marshal 's baton , or a sceptre .

[I]0-i never saw [her]84-ayesha come and to this day [I]0-i do not know how [she]84-ayesha did so ; [she]84-ayesha was just there and what is more [she]84-ayesha must have put luminous paint or something else on [her]84-ayesha robes , for they gleamed with a sort of faint , phosphorescent fire , which in the moonlight made [her]84-ayesha conspicuous all over the field of battle . Nor did [she]84-ayesha speak a single word , [she]84-ayesha only waved the rod , pointed with it towards the fierce hordes who were drawing near to [us]2401-we , killing as [they]2402-they came , and began to move forward with a gliding motion .

Now from every side there went up a roar of " [She]84-ayesha - who - commands ! [She]84-ayesha - who - commands ! "[84-ayesha] while [the people of Rezu in front]2403-the people of rezu in front shouted " [Lulala]217-lulala ! [Lulala]217-lulala ! Fly , [Lulala]217-lulala is upon [us]2401-we with the witchcrafts of the moon ! "[84-ayesha]

[She]84-ayesha moved forward and by some strange impulse , for no order was given , [we]2401-we all began to move after [her]84-ayesha . Yes , the ranks that a minute before were beginning to give way to wild panic , became filled with a marvellous courage and moved after [her]84-ayesha .

[The men of [Rezu]88-rezu]4679-the men of rezu also , and [I]0-i suppose with [them]4679-the men of rezu [Rezu]88-rezu [himself]88-rezu , for [I]0-i saw no more of [him]88-rezu at that time , began to move uncommonly fast over [the edge of [the plateau]2406-the plateau]2405-the edge of the plateau towards [the plain beneath]2249-the plain beneath . In fact [they]4679-the men of rezu broke into flight and leaping over dead and dying , [we]2401-we rushed after [them]4679-the men of rezu , always following the gleaming robe of [Ayesha]84-ayesha , who must have been [an extremely agile person]2408-an extremely agile person , since without any apparent exertion [she]84-ayesha held [her]84-ayesha place a few steps ahead of [us]2401-we .

There was another curious circumstance about this affair , namely , that terrified though [they]4679-the men of rezu were , those [Rezuites]234-the rezuites , after the first break , soon seemed to find it impossible to depart with speed . [They]4679-the men of rezu kept turning round to look behind [them]4679-the men of rezu at that following vision , as though [they]4679-the men of rezu were so many of [[Lot]238-lot 's wives]2409-lot 's wives . Moreover , the same fate overtook many of [them]4679-the men of rezu which fell upon [that scriptural lady]2410-that scriptural lady , since [they]4679-the men of rezu appeared to become petrified and stood there quite still , like rabbits fascinated by a snake , until [[our]2401-we people]2411-our people came up and killed [them]4679-the men of rezu .

This slaying went on all down [the last steep slope of [the ridge]2287-the ridge]2412-the last steep slope of the ridge , on which [I]0-i suppose at least two - thirds of [the army of [Rezu]88-rezu]2273-the army of rezu must have perished , since [[our]2401-we [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas]2266-our amahagger showed [themselves]125-umslopogaas [very handy men when it came to exterminating foes who were too terror - struck to fight , and , exhilarated by the occupation , gained courage every moment]2416-very handy men when it came to exterminating foes who were too terror - struck to fight , and , exhilarated by the occupation , gained courage every moment .

CHAPTER XVIII

THE SLAYING OF [REZU]88-rezu

At last [we]2401-we were on [the plain]3355-the plain , [the bemused remnant of [[Rezu]88-rezu 's army]2419-rezu 's army still doubling before [us]2401-we like a mob of game pursued by wild dogs . Here [we]2401-we halted to re - form [our]2401-we ranks]2418-the bemused remnant of rezu 's army still doubling before us like a mob of game pursued by wild dogs . here we halted to re - form our ranks ; it seemed to [me]0-i , although still [she]2420-she spoke no word , that some order reached [me]0-i from the gleaming [Ayesha]84-ayesha that [I]0-i should do this . The business took twenty minutes or so , and then , numbering about [two thousand five hundred strong]2421-two thousand five hundred strong , for the rest had fallen in the fight of the square , [we]2401-we advanced again .

Now there came that dusk which often precedes the rising of the sun , and through it [I]0-i could see that the battle was not yet over , since gathered in front of [us]2401-we was still [a force about equal to [our]2401-we own]2422-a force about equal to our own . [Ayesha]84-ayesha pointed towards it with [her]84-ayesha wand and [we]2401-we leapt forward to the attack . Here [the men of [Rezu]88-rezu]4679-the men of rezu stood awaiting [us]2401-we , for [they]4679-the men of rezu seemed to overcome [their]4679-the men of rezu terror with the approach of day .

The battle was fierce , a very strange battle in that dim , uncertain light , which scarcely showed [us]2401-we friend from foe . Indeed [I]0-i am not sure that [we]2401-we should have won it , since [Ayesha]84-ayesha was no longer visible to give [our]2401-we [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas confidence , and as the courage of [the Rezuites]234-the rezuites increased , so theirs seemed to lessen with the passing of the night .

Fortunately , however , just as the issue hung doubtful , there was a shout to [our]2401-we left and looking , [I]0-i made out the tall shape of [Goroko]168-goroko , [the witch - doctor]907-the witch - doctor , with [the other Zulu]2425-the other zulu , followed by [[his]168-goroko two hundred and fifty men]2426-his two hundred and fifty men , and leaping on to the flank of [the line of [Rezu]88-rezu]2427-the line of rezu .

That settled the business . [The enemy]1296-the enemy crumpled up and melted , and just then the first lights of dawn appeared in the sky . [I]0-i looked about [me]0-i for [Ayesha]84-ayesha , but [she]84-ayesha had gone , where to [I]0-i knew not , though at the moment [I]0-i feared that [she]84-ayesha must have been killed in the mêlée .

Then [I]0-i gave up looking and thinking , since now or never was the time for action . Signalling and shouting to [those hatchet - faced Amahagger]2429-those hatchet - faced amahagger to advance , accompanied by Umslopogaas with [Goroko]168-goroko who had joined [us]2401-we , and [Hans]87-hans , [I]0-i sprang forward to give [them]2429-those hatchet - faced amahagger an example , which , to be just to [them]2429-those hatchet - faced amahagger , [they]2429-those hatchet - faced amahagger took .

" This is [the mound on which Red - Beard should be]4791-the mound on which red - beard should be , "[87-hans] cried [Hans]87-hans as [we]2401-we faced a little slope .

[I]0-i ran up [it]2430-it and through the gloom which precedes the actual dawn , saw [a group of men]2431-a group of men gathered round something , as [people collect about a street accident]2432-people collect about a street accident .

" Red - Beard on the stone . [They]2429-those hatchet - faced amahagger are killing [him]88-rezu , "[87-hans] screeched [Hans]87-hans again .

It was so ; at least [several white - robed priests]2433-several white - robed priests were bending over a prostrate figure with knives in [their]2433-several white - robed priests hands , while behind stood [the huge fellow whom [I]0-i took to be [Rezu]88-rezu , staring towards the east as though [he]88-rezu were waiting for the rim of the sun to appear before [he]88-rezu gave some order]2434-the huge fellow whom i took to be rezu , staring towards the east as though he were waiting for the rim of the sun to appear before he gave some order . At that very moment it did appear , just a thin edge of bright light on the horizon , and [he]88-rezu turned , shouting the order .

Too late ! For [we]2401-we were on [them]2429-those hatchet - faced amahagger . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas cut down one of [the priests]2435-the priests with [his]125-umslopogaas axe , and [the men about [me]0-i]2436-the men about me dealt with [the others]3164-the others , while [Hans]87-hans with a couple of sweeps of [his]87-hans long knife , severed the cords with which [Robertson]159-inez was tied .

[The poor man who in the growing light]2438-the poor man who in the growing light [I]0-i could see was raving mad , sprang up , calling out something in [Scotch]239-scotch about " the deil . "[88-rezu] Seizing a great spear which had fallen from the hand of [one of [the priests]2435-the priests]2439-one of the priests , [he]88-rezu rushed furiously at [the giant who had given the order , and with a yell]2441-the giant who had given the order , and with a yell drove it at [his]2438-the poor man who in the growing light heart . [I]0-i saw the spear snap , from which [I]0-i concluded that [this man]427-this man , whom rightly [I]0-i took to be [Rezu]88-rezu , wore some kind of armour .

Next instant the axe [he]427-this man held , a great weapon , flashed aloft and down went [Robertson]159-inez before its awful stroke , stone dead , for as [we]2443-we found out afterwards , [he]427-this man was cloven almost in two . At the sight of the death of [[my]0-i poor friend]2444-my poor friend rage took hold of [me]0-i . In [my]0-i hand was a double - barrelled rifle , an Express loaded with hollow - pointed bullets . [I]0-i covered [the giant]2445-the giant and let drive , first with one barrel and then with the other , and what is more , distinctly [I]0-i heard both bullets strike upon [him]427-this man .

Yet [he]427-this man did not fall . [He]427-this man rocked a little , that is all , then turned and marched off towards [a hut]2446-a hut , that whereof [Hans]87-hans had told [me]0-i , which stood about fifty yards away .

" Leave [him]427-this man to [me]125-umslopogaas , "[125-umslopogaas] shouted [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas . " Steel cuts where bullets can not pierce , "[125-umslopogaas] and with a bound like to that of a buck , [the great Zulu]2447-the great zulu leapt away after [him]427-this man .

[I]0-i think that [Rezu]88-rezu meant to enter [the hut]380-the hut for some purpose of [his]88-rezu own , but [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas was too hard upon [his]88-rezu tracks . At any rate [he]427-this man ran past [it]380-the hut and down the other slope of [the little hill]2449-the little hill on to the plain behind where [the remnants of [[his]427-this man army]2451-his army were trying to re - form]2450-the remnants of his army were trying to re - form . There in front of [them]2450-the remnants of his army were trying to re - form [the giant]2445-the giant turned and stood at bay .

[Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas halted also , waiting for [us]2453-us to come up , since , [cunning old warrior]2454-cunning old warrior as [he]125-umslopogaas was , [he]125-umslopogaas feared lest should [he]125-umslopogaas begin the fight before that happened , the horde of [them]2450-the remnants of his army were trying to re - form would fall on [him]125-umslopogaas . Thirty seconds later [we]2453-us arrived and found [him]125-umslopogaas standing still with bent body , small shield advanced and the great axe raised as though in the act of striking , a wondrous picture outlined as it was against the swiftly rising - sun .

Some ten paces away stood [the giant]2445-the giant leaning on the axe [he]2445-the giant bore , which was not unlike to that with which [woodmen]2456-woodmen fell big trees . [He]2445-the giant was [an evil man to see]2457-an evil man to see and at this , [my]0-i first full sight of [him]2445-the giant , [I]0-i likened [him]2445-the giant in [my]0-i mind to [Goliath]240-goliath whom [David]241-david overthrew . Huge [he]2445-the giant was and hairy , with deep - set , piercing eyes and a great hooked nose . [His]2445-the giant face seemed thin and ancient also , when with a motion of the great head , [he]2445-the giant tossed [his]2445-the giant long locks back from about it , but [his]2445-the giant limbs were those of [a Hercules]2458-a hercules and [his]2445-the giant movements full of a youthful vigour . Moreover [his]2445-the giant aspect as a whole was that of [a devil]2459-a devil rather than of [a man]3551-a man ; indeed the sight of it sickened [me]0-i .

" Let [me]0-i shoot [him]2445-the giant , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried to [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , for [I]0-i had reloaded the rifle as [I]0-i ran .

" Nay , [Watcher - by - Night]3383-watcher - by - night , "[2360-the zulu] answered [the Zulu]2360-the zulu without moving [his]2360-the zulu head , " rifle has had its chance and failed . Now let [us]2465-us see what axe can do . If [I]2360-the zulu can not kill [this man]427-this man , [I]2360-the zulu will be borne hence [feet first who shall have made a long journey for nothing]4794-feet first who shall have made a long journey for nothing . "[2360-the zulu]

Then [the giant]2445-the giant began to talk in a low , rumbling voice that reverberated from [the slope of [the little hill]2449-the little hill behind [us]2465-us]2463-the slope of the little hill behind us .

" Who are [you]0-i ? "[2445-the giant] [he]2445-the giant asked , speaking in the same tongue that [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas use , " who dare to come face to face with [Rezu]88-rezu ? [Black hound]4795-black hound , do [you]88-rezu not know that [I]2445-the giant can not be slain who have lived a year for every week of [your]88-rezu life 's days , and set [my]2445-the giant foot upon the necks of [men]3228-men by [thousands]2178-thousands . Have [you]88-rezu not seen the spear shatter and the iron balls melt upon [my]2445-the giant breast like rain - drops , and would [you]88-rezu try to bring [me]2445-the giant down with that toy [you]88-rezu carry ? [[My]2445-the giant army]4798-my army is defeated - [I]2445-the giant know it . But what matters that when [I]2445-the giant can get [me]2445-the giant more ? Because the sacrifice was not completed and [the white queen]3277-the white queen was not [we]4800-we d , therefore [[my]2445-the giant army]4798-my army was defeated by the magic of [Lulala]217-lulala , [the White Witch who dwells in [the tombs]4803-the tombs]4802-the white witch who dwells in the tombs . But [I]2445-the giant am not defeated who can not be slain until [I]2445-the giant show [my]2445-the giant back , and then only by a certain axe which long ago has rusted into dust . "[2445-the giant]

Now of this long speech [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas understood nothing , so [I]0-i answered for [him]125-umslopogaas , briefly enough , but to the point , for there flashed into [my]0-i mind all [Ayesha]84-ayesha 's tale about an axe .

" A certain axe ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried . " Aye , a certain axe ! Well , look at that which is held by [the Black One]4152-the black one , [the captain who is named Slaughterer]4805-the captain who is named slaughterer , the ancient axe whose title is [Chieftainess]3566-chieftainess , because if so [she]4152-the black one wills , [she]4152-the black one takes the lives of [all]568-all . Look at it well , [Rezu]88-rezu , [Giant and Wizard]4808-giant and wizard , and say whether it is not that which [[your]88-rezu forefather]4809-your forefather lost , that which is destined to bring [you]88-rezu to [your]88-rezu doom ? "[0-i]

Thus [I]0-i spoke , very loudly that all might hear , slowly also , pausing between each word because [I]0-i wished to give time for the light to strengthen , seeing as [I]0-i did that the rays of the rising sun struck upon the face of [the giant]2445-the giant , whereas the eyes of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas were less dazzled by it .

[Rezu]88-rezu heard , and stared at the axe which [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas held aloft , causing it to quiver slightly by an imperceptible motion of [his]125-umslopogaas arm . As [he]125-umslopogaas stared [I]0-i saw [his]125-umslopogaas hideous face change , and that on it for the first time gathered a look of something resembling fear . Also [[his]125-umslopogaas followers]4691-his followers behind [him]125-umslopogaas who were also studying the axe , began to murmur together .

For here [I]0-i should say that as though by common consent the battle had been stayed ; [we]2468-we no longer attacked and [the enemy]1296-the enemy no longer ran . [They]4691-his followers , or whose who were left of [them]4691-his followers , stood still as though [they]4691-his followers felt that the real and ultimate issue of the fight depended upon the forthcoming duel between [these two champions]2470-these two champions , though of that issue [they]4691-his followers had little doubt since , as [I]0-i learned afterwards , [they]4691-his followers believed [[their]4691-his followers king]2471-their king to be invulnerable .

For quite a while [Rezu]88-rezu went on staring . Then [he]125-umslopogaas said aloud as if [he]125-umslopogaas were thinking to [himself]125-umslopogaas .

" It is like , very like . The horn haft is the same ; the pointed gouge is the same ; the blade shaped like the young moon is the same . [Almost]242-almost could [I]125-umslopogaas think that before [me]125-umslopogaas shook the ancient holy axe . Nay , [the gods]4548-the gods have taken that back long ago and this is but a trick of [the witch]3980-the witch , [Lulala of the Caves]4812-lulala of the caves . "[125-umslopogaas]

Thus [he]125-umslopogaas spoke , but still for a moment hesitated .

" [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , "[0-i] [I]0-i said in the deep silence that followed , " hear [me]0-i . "[0-i]

" [I]125-umslopogaas hear [you]0-i , "[125-umslopogaas] [he]125-umslopogaas answered without turning [his]125-umslopogaas head or moving [his]125-umslopogaas arms . " What counsel , Watcher - by - Night ? "[125-umslopogaas]

" This , [Slaughterer]4813-slaughterer . Strike not at [that man]3696-that man 's face and breast , for there [I]0-i think [he]3696-that man is protected by witchcraft or by armour . Get behind [him]3696-that man and strike at [his]3696-that man back . Do [you]125-umslopogaas understand ? "[0-i]

" Nay , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [I]125-umslopogaas understand not . Yet [I]125-umslopogaas will do [your]125-umslopogaas bidding because [you]125-umslopogaas are wiser than [I]125-umslopogaas and utter no empty words . Now be still . "[125-umslopogaas]

Then [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas threw the axe into the air and caught it as it fell , and as [he]125-umslopogaas did so began to chant [his]125-umslopogaas own praises Zulu fashion .

" Oho ! "[125-umslopogaas] [he]125-umslopogaas said , " [I]125-umslopogaas am [the child of the Lion]4815-the child of the lion , [the Black - maned Lion , whose claws never loosened of [their]4816-the black - maned lion , whose claws never loosened of their prey prey]4816-the black - maned lion , whose claws never loosened of their prey . [I]125-umslopogaas am [the Wolf - king]4817-the wolf - king , [[he]4817-the wolf - king who hunted with the wolves upon [the Witch - mountain]4819-the witch - mountain with [[my]125-umslopogaas brother]4820-my brother , [Bearer of the Club named Watcher - of - [the - Fords]63-the - fords]4821-bearer of the club named watcher - of - the - fords , [I]125-umslopogaas am [he]4817-the wolf - king who slew [him]125-umslopogaas called [the Unconquered , Chief of [the People of the Axe]3274-the people of the axe]4822-the unconquered , chief of the people of the axe , [he]4817-the wolf - king who bore the ancient Axe before [me]125-umslopogaas ; [I]125-umslopogaas am [he]4817-the wolf - king who smote [the Halakazi tribe]4824-the halakazi tribe in [[their]4824-the halakazi tribe caves]4825-their caves and won [me]125-umslopogaas [Nada the Lily]112-nada to wife]4818-he who hunted with the wolves upon the witch - mountain with my brother , bearer of the club named watcher - of - the - fords , i am he who slew him called the unconquered , chief of the people of the axe , he who bore the ancient axe before me ; i am he who smote the halakazi tribe in their caves and won me nada the lily to wife . [I]125-umslopogaas am [he]4817-the wolf - king who took to [the King Dingaan]243-dingaan a gift that [he]243-dingaan loved little , and afterward with [Mopo]105-macumazahn , [[my]125-umslopogaas foster - sire]4826-my foster - sire , hurled this [Dingaan]243-dingaan down to death . [I]125-umslopogaas am [the Royal One]4827-the royal one , named [Bulalio]110-bulalio [the Slaughterer]3239-the slaughterer , named Woodpecker , named [Umhlopekazi the Captain]143-umhlopekazi , before whom never yet [man]287-man has stood in fair and open fight . Now , [[thou]4830-thou [Wizard Rezu]88-rezu]4831-thou wizard rezu , now [thou]4830-thou Giant , now [thou]4830-thou [Ghost - man]4832-ghost - man , come on against [me]125-umslopogaas and before the sun has risen by a hand 's breadth , [all those who watch]4833-all those who watch shall see which of [us]4834-us is better at the game of war . Come on , then ! Come on , for [I]125-umslopogaas say that [my]125-umslopogaas blood boils over and [my]125-umslopogaas feet grow cold . Come on , [thou]4830-thou grinning dog , [[thou]4830-thou monster grown fat with eating the flesh of [men]3228-men]4835-thou monster grown fat with eating the flesh of men , [thou]4830-thou hook - beaked vulture , [thou]4830-thou old , grey - whiskered wolf ! "[125-umslopogaas]

Thus [he]2472-his changed in [his]2472-his fierce , boastful way , while [[his]2472-his two remaining Zulus]2473-his two remaining zulus clapped [their]2473-his two remaining zulus hands and sentence by sentence echoed [his]2472-his words , and [Goroko]168-goroko , [the witch - doctor]907-the witch - doctor , muttered incantations behind [him]2472-his .

While [he]2472-his sang thus [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas began to stir . First only [his]2472-his head and shoulders moved gently , swaying from side to side like a reed shaken in the wind or a snake about to strike . Then slowly [he]2472-his put out first one foot and next the other and drew [them]2475-them back again , as [a dancer]2476-a dancer might do , tempting [Rezu]88-rezu to attack .

But [the giant]2445-the giant would not , [his]2472-his shield held before [him]2472-his , [he]2472-his stood still and waited to see what [this black warrior]2478-this black warrior would do .

The snake struck . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas darted in and let drive with the long axe . [Rezu]88-rezu raised [his]88-rezu shield above [his]88-rezu head and caught the blow . From the clank it made [I]0-i knew that this shield which seemed to be of hide , was lined with iron . [Rezu]88-rezu smote back , but before the blow could fall [the Zulu]2360-the zulu was out of [his]88-rezu reach . This taught [me]0-i how great was [the giant]2445-the giant 's strength , for though the stroke was heavy , like the steel - hatted axe [he]88-rezu bore , still when [he]88-rezu saw that it had missed [he]88-rezu checked the weapon in mid air , which [only a mighty man]2481-only a mighty man could have done .

[Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas saw these things also and changed [his]125-umslopogaas tactics . [His]125-umslopogaas axe was six or eight inches longer in the haft than that of [Rezu]88-rezu , and therefore [he]125-umslopogaas could reach where [Rezu]88-rezu could not , for [the giant]2445-the giant was short - armed . [He]88-rezu twisted it round in [his]88-rezu hand so that the moon - shaped blade was uppermost , and keeping it almost at full length , began to peck with the gouge - shaped point on the back at the head and arms of [Rezu]88-rezu , that as [I]0-i knew was a favourite trick of [his]88-rezu in fight from which [he]88-rezu won [his]88-rezu name of " Woodpecker . "[88-rezu] [Rezu]88-rezu defended [his]88-rezu head with [his]88-rezu shield as best [he]88-rezu could against the sharp points of steel which flashed all about [him]88-rezu .

Twice it seemed to [me]0-i that [the Zulu]183-the zulu 's pecks went home upon [the giant]2445-the giant 's breast , but if so they did no harm . Either [Rezu]88-rezu 's thick beard , or armour beneath it stopped [them]2484-them from penetrating [his]88-rezu body . Still [he]88-rezu roared out as though with pain , or fury , or both , and growing mad , charged at [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and smote with all [his]88-rezu strength .

[The Zulu]183-the zulu caught the blow upon [his]183-the zulu shield , through which it shore as though the tough hide were paper . Stay the stroke [it]183-the zulu could not , yet it turned its direction , so that the falling axe slid past [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas 's shoulder , doing [him]183-the zulu no hurt . Next instant , before [Rezu]88-rezu could strike again , [the Zulu]2360-the zulu threw the severed shield into [his]183-the zulu face and seizing the axe with both hands , leapt in and struck . It was a mighty blow , for [I]0-i saw the rhinoceros - horn handle of the famous axe bend like a drawn bow , and it went home with a dull thud full upon [Rezu]88-rezu 's breast . [He]88-rezu shook , but no more . Evidently the razor edge of [Inkosikaas]156-inkosikaas had failed to pierce . There was a sound as though a hollow tree had been smitten and some strands of the long beard , shorn off , fell to the ground , but that was all .

" [Tagati]244-tagati ! bewitched , "[2486-the watching zulus] cried [the watching Zulus]2486-the watching zulus . " That stroke should have cut [him]244-tagati in two ! "[2486-the watching zulus] while [I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i that [this man]427-this man knew how to make good armour .

[Rezu]88-rezu laughed aloud , a bellowing kind of laugh , while [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas sprang back astonished .

" Is it thus ! "[427-this man] [he]427-this man cried in Zulu . " Well , [all wizards]4837-all wizards have some door by which [[their]4837-all wizards Spirit]4838-their spirit enters and departs . [I]427-this man must find the door , [I]427-this man must find the door ! "[427-this man]

So [he]427-this man spoke and with springing movements tried to get past [Rezu]88-rezu , first to the right and then to the left , all the while keeping out of reach . But [Rezu]88-rezu ever turned and faced [him]427-this man , as [he]88-rezu did so retreating step by step down [the slope of [the little hill]2449-the little hill]2488-the slope of the little hill and striking whenever [he]88-rezu found a chance , but without avail , for always [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas was beyond [his]88-rezu reach . Also the sunlight which now grew strong , dazzled [him]427-this man , or so [I]0-i thought . Moreover [he]427-this man seemed to tire somewhat - or so [I]0-i thought also .

At any rate [he]427-this man determined to make an end of the play , for with a swift motion , as [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas had done , [he]427-this man threw away [his]427-this man shield and grasping the iron handle of [his]427-this man axe with both hands , charged [the Zulu]183-the zulu like a bull . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas leapt back out of reach . Then suddenly [he]427-this man turned and ran up [the rise]2490-the rise . Yes , [Bulalio the Slaughterer]110-bulalio ran !

A roar of mockery went up from [the sun - worshippers]4656-the sun - worshippers behind , while [[our]2492-our [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas]2266-our amahagger laughed and [Goroko]168-goroko and [the two Zulus]3819-the two zulus stared astonished and ashamed . Only [I]0-i read [his]427-this man mind aright and wondered what guile [he]427-this man had conceived .

[He]427-this man ran , and [Rezu]88-rezu ran after [him]427-this man , but never could [he]427-this man catch [the swiftest - footed man in [Zululand]4-zululand]2495-the swiftest - footed man in zululand . To and fro [he]427-this man followed [him]88-rezu , for [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas was taking a zig - zag path towards [the crest of the slope]2496-the crest of the slope , till at length [Rezu]88-rezu stopped breathless . But [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas still ran another twenty yards or so until [he]125-umslopogaas reached the top of the slope and there halted and wheeled round .

For ten seconds or more [he]427-this man stood drawing [his]427-this man breath in great gasps , and , looking at [his]427-this man face , [I]0-i saw that it had become as the face of a wolf . [His]427-this man lips were drawn up into a terrible grin , showing the white teeth between ; [his]427-this man cheeks seemed to have fallen in and [his]427-this man eyes glared , while the skin over the hole in [his]427-this man forehead beat up and down .

There [he]427-this man stood , gathering [himself]427-this man together for some mighty effort .

" Run on ! "[2497-the spectators] shouted [the spectators]2497-the spectators . " Run back to [K"r]1-k"r[2497-the spectators] , black dog ! "[2497-the spectators]

[Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas knew that [they]2497-the spectators were mocking [him]427-this man , but [he]427-this man took no heed , only bent down and rubbed [his]427-this man sweating hand in the grit of the dry earth . Then [he]427-this man straightened [himself]427-this man and charged down on [Rezu]88-rezu .

[I]0-i , [Allan Quatermain]83-allan , have seen many things in battle , but never before or since did [I]0-i see aught like to this charge . It was swift as that of a lioness , so swift that [the Zulu]2360-the zulu 's feet scarcely seemed to touch the ground . On [he]427-this man sped like a thrown spear , till , when within about a dozen feet of [Rezu]88-rezu who stood staring at [him]427-this man , [he]427-this man bent [his]427-this man frame almost double and leapt into the air .

Oh ! what a leap was that . Surely [he]427-this man must have learnt it from the lion , or the spring - buck . High [he]427-this man rose and now [I]0-i saw [his]427-this man purpose ; it was to clear the tall shape of [Rezu]88-rezu . Aye , and [he]427-this man cleared [him]427-this man with half a foot to spare , and as [he]427-this man passed above , smote downwards with the axe so that the blow fell upon the back of [Rezu]88-rezu 's head . Moreover it went home this time , for [I]0-i saw the red blood stream and [Rezu]88-rezu fell forward on [his]88-rezu face . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas landed far beyond [him]427-this man , ran a little way because [he]427-this man must , then wheeled round and charged again .

[Rezu]88-rezu was rising , but before [he]88-rezu gained [his]88-rezu feet , the axe [Inkosikaas]156-inkosikaas thundered down where the neck joins the shoulder and sank in . Still , so great was [his]88-rezu strength that [Rezu]88-rezu found [his]88-rezu feet and smote out wildly . But now [his]88-rezu movements were slow and again [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas got behind [him]88-rezu , smiting at [his]88-rezu back . Once , twice , thrice , [he]88-rezu smote , and at the third blow it seemed as though the massive spine were severed , for [his]88-rezu weapon fell from [Rezu]88-rezu 's hand and slowly [he]88-rezu sank down to the ground , and lay there , a huddled heap .

Believing that all was over [I]0-i ran to where [he]88-rezu lay with [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas standing over [him]88-rezu , as it seemed to [me]0-i , utterly exhausted , for [he]88-rezu supported [himself]88-rezu by the axe and tottered upon [his]88-rezu feet . But [Rezu]88-rezu was not yet dead . [He]88-rezu opened [his]88-rezu cavernous eyes and glared at [the Zulu]183-the zulu with a look of hellish hate .

" [Thou]4839-thou hast not conquered [me]88-rezu , [Black One]153-the black one , "[88-rezu] [he]88-rezu gasped . " It is thine axe which gave [thee]153-the black one victory ; the ancient , holy axe that once was [mine]88-rezu until [the woman]3332-the woman stole it , yes , that and the craft of [the Witch of the Caves]4841-the witch of the caves who told [thee]153-the black one to smite where the Spirit of Life which [I]88-rezu feared to enter wholly , had not kissed [my]88-rezu flesh , and there only left [me]88-rezu mortal . [Wolf]245-wolf of [a black man]3533-a black man , may [we]4843-we meet elsewhere and fight this fray again . Ah ! would that [I]88-rezu could get these hands about [thy]153-the black one throat and take [thee]153-the black one with [me]88-rezu down into [the Darkness]65-the darkness . But [Lulala]217-lulala wins if only for a while , since [her]217-lulala fate , [I]88-rezu think , shall be worse than [mine]88-rezu . Ah ! [I]88-rezu see the magic beauty that [she]217-lulala boasts turn to shameful - - "[88-rezu]

[Here of a sudden life]2499-here of a sudden life left [him]2500-his and throwing [his]2500-his great arms wide , a last breath passed bubbling from [his]2500-his lips .

As [I]0-i stooped to examine [the man]324-the man 's huge and hairy carcase that to [me]0-i looked only half human , with a thunder of feet [our]2502-them [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas rushed down upon [us]2502-them and thrusting [me]0-i aside , fell upon the body of [[their]2502-them ancient foe]2503-their ancient foe like hounds upon a helpless fox , and with hands and spears and knives literally tore and hacked [it]2504-it limb from limb , till no semblance of humanity remained .

It was impossible to stop [them]2502-them ; indeed [I]0-i was too outworn with labours and emotions to make any such attempt . This [I]0-i regret the more since [I]0-i lost the opportunity of making an examination of the body of [this troll - like man]2505-this troll - like man , and of ascertaining what kind of armour it was [he]2505-this troll - like man wore beneath that great beard of [his]2505-this troll - like man , which was strong enough to stop [my]0-i bullets , and even the razor edge of the axe [Inkosikaas]156-inkosikaas driven with all the might of the arms of [the Zulu]2360-the zulu , [Bulalio]110-bulalio . For when [I]0-i looked again at the sickening sight [the giant]2445-the giant was but scattered fragments and the armour , whatever it might have been , was gone , rent to little pieces and carried off , doubtless , by [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas , perhaps to be divided between [them]2502-them to serve as charms .

So of [Rezu]88-rezu [I]0-i know only that [he]88-rezu was [the hugest , most terrible - looking man [I]0-i have ever seen]2508-the hugest , most terrible - looking man i have ever seen , one too who carried [his]88-rezu vast strength very late in life , since from the aspect of [his]88-rezu countenance [I]0-i imagine that [he]88-rezu must have been nigh upon seventy years of age , though [his]88-rezu supposed unnatural antiquity of course was nothing but a fable put about by [the natives]972-the natives for [their]972-the natives own purposes .

[Presently Umslopogaas]246-presently umslopogaas seemed to recover from the kind of faint into which [he]88-rezu had fallen and opening [his]88-rezu eyes , looked about [him]88-rezu . [The first person [they]2511-they fell on]2510-the first person they fell on was [old Billali]93-billali who stood stroking [his]93-billali white beard and contemplating the scene with an air which was at once philosophic and satisfied . This seemed to anger [Umslopogaas]246-presently umslopogaas , for [he]93-billali cried ,

" [I]93-billali think it was [you]246-presently umslopogaas , ancient bag of words and sweeper of paths for the feet of [the great]4844-the great , who made a mock of [me]93-billali but now , when [you]246-presently umslopogaas thought that [I]93-billali fled before the horns of yonder man - eating bull - "[93-billali] and [he]93-billali nodded towards the fragments of what once had been [Rezu]88-rezu . " Find now [his]93-billali axe and though [I]93-billali am weak and weary , [I]93-billali will wash away the insult with [your]246-presently umslopogaas blood . "[93-billali]

" What does [this glorious black hero]4845-this glorious black hero say , Watcher - by - Night ? "[93-billali] asked [Billali]93-billali in [his]93-billali most courteous tones .

[I]0-i told [him]93-billali word by word , whereon [Billali]93-billali lifted [his]93-billali hands in horror , turned and fled . Nor did [I]0-i see [him]93-billali again until [we]2512-we arrived at [K"r]1-k"r .[93-billali]

At the sight of the fall of [[their]2513-their giant chief Rezu whom [they]2513-their believed to be invulnerable]88-rezu , [[his]88-rezu followers]4691-his followers , who were watching the fray , set up a great wailing , a most mournful and uncanny noise to hear . Then , as [I]0-i think did [the hosts of [the Philistines]247-the philistines]2515-the hosts of the philistines when [David]241-david brought down [Goliath]240-goliath by [his]241-david admirable shot with a stone , [they]2513-their set out for [[their]2513-their homes]2374-their homes wherever these may have been , at an absolutely record pace and in the completest disarray .

[[Our]2512-we [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas]2266-our amahagger followed [them]2513-their for a while , but soon were left standing still . So [they]2266-our amahagger contented [themselves]2266-our amahagger with killing any wounded [they]2266-our amahagger could find and returned . [I]0-i did not accompany [them]2266-our amahagger ; indeed the battle being won , metaphorically [I]0-i washed [my]0-i hands of [them]2266-our amahagger , and in [my]0-i thoughts consigned [them]2266-our amahagger to a certain locality as [a people of whom it might well be said that manners [they]2266-our amahagger had none and [their]2266-our amahagger customs]2518-a people of whom it might well be said that manners they had none and their customs were simply beastly . Also , although fierce and cruel , these night - bats were [not good fighting men]2519-not good fighting men and in short never did [I]0-i wish to have to do with such another company .

Moreover , a very different matter pressed . The object of this business so far as [I]0-i was concerned , had been to rescue [poor Inez]159-inez , since had it not been for [her]159-inez sake , never would [I]0-i have consented to lead [those Amahagger]2520-those amahagger against [[their]2520-those amahagger fellow blackguards]2521-their fellow blackguards , [the Rezuites]234-the rezuites .

But where was [Inez]159-inez ? If [Hans]87-hans had understood [the medicine - man aright]2522-the medicine - man aright , [she]159-inez was , or had been , in [the hut]380-the hut , where it was [my]0-i earnest hope that [she]159-inez still remained , since otherwise the hunt must be continued . This at any rate was easy to discover . Calling [Hans]87-hans , who was amusing [himself]87-hans by taking long shots at [the flying enemy]2524-the flying enemy , so that [they]2520-those amahagger might not forget [him]87-hans , as [he]87-hans said , and [the Zulus]101-the zulus , [I]0-i walked up the slope to [the hut]380-the hut , or rather booth of boughs , for [it]380-the hut was quite twenty feet long by twelve or fifteen broad .

At [its]380-the hut eastern end was a doorway or opening closed with a heavy curtain . Here [I]0-i paused full of tremors , and listened , for to tell the truth [I]0-i dreaded to draw that curtain , fearing what [I]0-i might see within . Gathering up [my]0-i courage at length [I]0-i tore it aside and , a revolver in [my]0-i hand , looked in . At first after the strong light without , for the sun was now well up , [I]0-i could see nothing , since those green boughs and palm leaves were very closely woven . As [my]0-i eyes grew accustomed to the gloom , however , [I]0-i perceived a glittering object seated on a kind of throne at the end of [the booth]2526-the booth , while in a double row in front knelt [six white - robed women who seemed to wear chains about [their]2527-six white - robed women who seemed to wear chains about their necks and carried large knives slung round their middles necks and carried large knives slung round [their]2527-six white - robed women who seemed to wear chains about their necks and carried large knives slung round their middles middles]2527-six white - robed women who seemed to wear chains about their necks and carried large knives slung round their middles . On the floor between [these women]2528-these women and the throne lay [a dead man]2529-a dead man , [a priest of some sort]2530-a priest of some sort as [I]0-i gathered from [his]2529-a dead man garb , who still held a huge spear in [his]2529-a dead man hand . So silent were [the figure on the throne]2531-the figure on the throne and [those that knelt before it]2532-those that knelt before it , that at first [I]0-i thought that all of [them]2527-six white - robed women who seemed to wear chains about their necks and carried large knives slung round their middles must be dead .

" [Lady Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes , "[87-hans] whispered [Hans]87-hans , " and [[her]170-sad - eyes bride - women]4846-her bride - women . Doubtless that [old Predikant]124-the predikant came to kill [her]170-sad - eyes when [he]2534-the priest in his disappointed rage saw that the battle was lost , but [the bride - women]4847-the bride - women killed [him]2534-the priest in his disappointed rage with [their]4847-the bride - women knives . "[87-hans]

Here [I]0-i may state that [Hans]87-hans ' suppositions proved to be quite correct , which shows how quick and deductive was [his]87-hans mind . [The figure on the throne]2531-the figure on the throne was [Inez]159-inez ; [the priest in [his]2534-the priest in his disappointed rage disappointed rage]2534-the priest in his disappointed rage had come to kill [her]159-inez , and [the bride - women]4847-the bride - women had killed [him]2534-the priest in his disappointed rage with [their]4847-the bride - women knives before [he]2534-the priest in his disappointed rage could do so .

[I]0-i bade [the Zulus]354-the zulus tear down the curtain and pull away some of the end boughs , so as to let in more light . Then [we]2537-we advanced up [the place]328-the place , holding [our]2537-we pistols and spears in readiness . [The kneeling women]2539-the kneeling women turned [their]2539-the kneeling women heads to look at [us]2537-we and [I]0-i saw that [they]2539-the kneeling women were all young and handsome in [their]2539-the kneeling women fashion , although fierce - faced . Also [I]0-i saw [their]2539-the kneeling women hands go to the knives [they]2539-the kneeling women wore . [I]0-i called to [them]2539-the kneeling women to let these be and come out , and that if [they]2539-the kneeling women did so [they]2539-the kneeling women had nothing to fear . But if [they]2539-the kneeling women understood , [they]2539-the kneeling women did not heed [my]0-i words .

On the contrary while [Hans]87-hans and [I]0-i covered [them]2539-the kneeling women with [our]2537-we pistols , fearing lest [they]2539-the kneeling women should stab [the person on the throne]2540-the person on the throne whom [we]2537-we took to be [Inez]159-inez , at some word from one of [them]2539-the kneeling women , [they]2539-the kneeling women bowed simultaneously towards [her]159-inez , then at another word , suddenly [they]2539-the kneeling women drew the knives and plunged them to [their]2539-the kneeling women own hearts !

It was a dreadful sight and one of which [I]0-i never saw the like . Nor to this day do [I]0-i know why the deed was done , unless perhaps [the women]899-the women were sworn to the service of [the new queen]4762-the new queen and feared that if [they]899-the women failed to protect [her]4762-the new queen , [they]899-the women would be doomed to some awful end . At any rate [we]2537-we got [them]899-the women out dead or dying , for [their]899-the women blows had been strong and true , and not one of [them]899-the women lived for more than a few minutes .

Then [I]0-i advanced to the figure on the throne , or rather foot - stooled chair of black wood inlaid with ivory , which sat so silent and motionless that [I]0-i was certain it was that of [a dead woman]2543-a dead woman , especially when [I]0-i perceived that [she]159-inez was fastened to the chair with leather straps , which were sewn over with gold wire . Also [she]159-inez was veiled and , with one exception , made up , if [I]0-i may use the term , exactly to resemble [the lady Ayesha]2544-the lady ayesha , even down to the two long plaits of black hair , each finished with some kind of pearl and to the sandalled feet .

The exception was that about [her]159-inez hung a great necklace of gold ornaments from which were suspended pendants also of gold representing the rayed disc of the sun in rude but bold and striking workmanship .

[I]0-i went to [her]159-inez and having cut the straps , since [I]0-i could not stop to untie [their]899-the women knots , lifted the veil .

Beneath it was [Inez]159-inez sure enough , and [Inez]159-inez living , for [her]159-inez breast rose and fell as [she]159-inez breathed , but [Inez]159-inez senseless . [Her]159-inez eyes were wide open , yet [she]159-inez was quite senseless . Probably [she]159-inez had been drugged , or perhaps some of the sights of horror which [she]159-inez saw , had taken away [her]159-inez mind . [I]0-i confess that [I]0-i was glad that this was so , who otherwise must have told [her]159-inez the dreadful story of [[her]159-inez father]902-her father 's end .

[We]2546-we bore [her]159-inez out and away from [that horrible place]1423-that horrible place , apparently quite unhurt , and laid [her]159-inez under the shadow of a tree till a litter could be procured . [I]0-i could do no more who knew not how to treat [her]159-inez state , and had no spirits with [me]0-i to pour down [her]159-inez throat .

This was the end of [our]2546-we long pursuit , and thus [we]2546-we rescued [Inez]159-inez , whom [the Zulus]101-the zulus called [the Lady Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes .

CHAPTER XIX

THE SPELL

Of [our]2546-we return to [K"r]1-k"r [I]170-sad - eyes need say nothing , except that in due course [we]2546-we reached [that interesting ruin]4848-that interesting ruin . The journey was chiefly remarkable for one thing , that on this occasion , [I]170-sad - eyes imagine for the first and last time in [his]4849-his life , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas consented to be carried in a litter , at least for part of the way . [He]4849-his was , as [I]170-sad - eyes have said , unwounded , for the axe of [[his]4849-his mighty foe]4850-his mighty foe had never once so much as touched [his]4849-his skin . What [he]4849-his suffered from was shock , a kind of collapse , since , although few would have thought it , [this great and utterly fearless warrior]4851-this great and utterly fearless warrior was at bottom [a nervous , highly - strung man]4852-a nervous , highly - strung man .[170-sad - eyes]
