It is only [the nervous that climb the highest points of anything]2548-the nervous that climb the highest points of anything , and this is true of fights as of all others . That fearful fray with [Rezu]88-rezu had been a great strain on [the Zulu]183-the zulu . As [he]88-rezu put it [himself]88-rezu , " [the wizard]4568-the wizard had sucked the strength "[88-rezu] out of [him]88-rezu , especially when [he]88-rezu found that owing to [his]88-rezu armour [he]88-rezu could not harm [him]88-rezu in front , and owing to [his]88-rezu cunning could not get at [him]88-rezu behind . Then it was that [he]88-rezu conceived the desperate expedient of leaping over [his]88-rezu head and smiting backwards as [he]88-rezu leapt , a trick , [he]88-rezu told [me]0-i , that [he]88-rezu had once played years before when [he]88-rezu was young , in order to break a shield ring and reach [one who stood in its centre]2549-one who stood in its centre .

In this great leap over [Rezu]88-rezu 's head [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas knew that [he]88-rezu must succeed , or be slain , which in turn would mean [my]0-i death and that of [the others]3164-the others . For this reason [he]88-rezu faced the shame of seeming to fly in order to gain the higher ground , whence alone [he]88-rezu could gather the speed necessary to such a terrific spring .

Well , [he]88-rezu made it and thereby conquered , and this was the end , but as [he]88-rezu said , it had left [him]88-rezu , " weak as a snake when it crawls out of its hole into the sun after the long winter sleep . "[88-rezu]

Of one thing , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas added , [he]88-rezu was thankful , namely that [Rezu]88-rezu had never succeeded in getting [his]88-rezu arms round [him]88-rezu , since [he]88-rezu was quite certain that if [he]88-rezu had [he]88-rezu would have broken [him]88-rezu " as a baboon breaks a mealie - stalk . "[88-rezu] No strength , not even [his]88-rezu , could have resisted the iron might of [that huge , gorilla - like man]2551-that huge , gorilla - like man .

[I]0-i agreed with [him]125-umslopogaas who had noted [Rezu]88-rezu 's vast chest and swelling muscles , also the weight of the blows that [he]88-rezu struck with the steel - hafted axe which , by the way , when [I]0-i sought for it , was missing , stolen , [I]0-i suppose , by [one of [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas]2552-one of the amahagger .

Whence did that strength come , [I]0-i wondered , in one who from [his]88-rezu face appeared to be old ? Was there perchance , after all , some truth in the legend of [Samson]248-samson and did it dwell in that gigantic beard and those long locks of [his]248-samson ? It was impossible to say and probably [the man]324-the man was but [a Herculean freak]2554-a herculean freak , for that [he]324-the man was as strong as [Hercules]249-hercules all the stories that [I]0-i heard afterwards of [his]324-the man feats , left little room for doubt .

About one thing only was [I]0-i certain in connection with [him]324-the man , namely , that the tales of [his]324-the man supernatural abilities were the merest humbug . [He]324-the man was simply one of [the representatives of [the family of ' strong men]2555-the family of ' strong men , " of whom examples are still to be seen doing marvellous feats all over [the earth]285-the earth]4854-the representatives of the family of ' strong men , " of whom examples are still to be seen doing marvellous feats all over the earth .[4854-the representatives of the family of ' strong men , " of whom examples are still to be seen doing marvellous feats all over the earth]

For the rest , [he]324-the man was dead and broken up by those [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas blood - hounds before [I]0-i could examine [him]324-the man , or [his]324-the man body - armour either , and there was an end of [him]324-the man and [his]324-the man story . But when [I]0-i looked at the corpse of poor [Robertson]159-inez , which [I]0-i did as [we]2556-we buried it where [he]324-the man fell , and saw that though so large and thick - set , it was cleft almost in two by a single blow of [Rezu]88-rezu 's axe , [I]0-i came to understand what the might of [this savage]2557-this savage must have been .

[I]0-i say savage , but [I]0-i am not sure that this is a right description of [Rezu]88-rezu . Evidently [he]88-rezu had a religion of a sort , also imagination , as was shown by the theft of [the white woman]2558-the white woman to be [[his]88-rezu queen]2559-his queen ; by [his]88-rezu veiling of [her]2558-the white woman to resemble Ayesha whom [he]88-rezu dreaded ; by the intended propitiatory sacrifice ; by [the guard of women sworn to [her]2558-the white woman service who slew [the priest that tried to kill [her]2558-the white woman]2561-the priest that tried to kill her , and afterwards committed suicide when [they]2560-the guard of women sworn to her service who slew the priest that tried to kill her , and afterwards committed suicide when they had failed in their office had failed in [[their]2560-the guard of women sworn to her service who slew the priest that tried to kill her , and afterwards committed suicide when they had failed in their office office]2562-their office]2560-the guard of women sworn to her service who slew the priest that tried to kill her , and afterwards committed suicide when they had failed in their office , and by other things . All this indicated something more than savagery , perhaps survivals from a forgotten civilisation , or perhaps native ability on the part of [an individual ruler]2563-an individual ruler . [I]0-i do not know and it matters nothing .

[Rezu]88-rezu is dead and [the world]277-the world is well rid of [him]88-rezu , and [those who want to learn more of [[his]88-rezu people]3358-his people]2565-those who want to learn more of his people can go to study such as remain of [them]3358-his people in [[their]3358-his people own habitat]2567-their own habitat , which for [my]0-i part [I]0-i never wish to visit any more .

During [our]2568-us journey to [K"r]1-k"r [poor Inez]159-inez never stirred . Whenever [I]93-billali went to look at [her]159-inez in the litter , [I]93-billali found [her]159-inez lying there with [her]159-inez eyes open and a fixed stare upon [her]159-inez face which frightened [me]93-billali very much , since [I]93-billali began to fear lest [she]159-inez should die . However [I]93-billali could do nothing to help [her]159-inez , except urge [the bearers]1681-the bearers to top speed . So swiftly did [we]2568-us travel down [the hill]4857-the hill and across [the plain]3355-the plain that [we]2568-us reached [K"r]1-k"r[93-billali] just as the sun was setting . As [we]2568-us crossed [the moat]2055-the moat [I]0-i perceived [old Billali]93-billali coming to meet [us]2568-us . This [he]93-billali did with many bows , keeping an anxious eye upon the litter which [he]93-billali had learned contained [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas . Indeed [his]93-billali attitude and that of [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas towards [the two of [us]2568-us]2570-the two of us , and even [Hans]87-hans , thenceforward became almost abject , since after [our]2568-us victory over [Rezu]88-rezu and [his]88-rezu death beneath the axe , [they]2571-they looked upon [us]2568-us as half divine and treated [us]2568-us accordingly .

" O mighty General , "[93-billali] [he]93-billali said , " [[She]4859-she - who - commands]4051-she - who - commands bids [me]93-billali conduct [the lady who is sick to [the place that has been made ready for [her]159-inez , which is near [your]0-i own]4862-the place that has been made ready for her , which is near your own so that [you]0-i may watch over [her]159-inez if [you]0-i will]4861-the lady who is sick to the place that has been made ready for her , which is near your own so that you may watch over her if you will . "[93-billali]

[I]0-i wondered how [Ayesha]84-ayesha knew that [Inez]159-inez was sick , but being too tired to ask questions , merely bade [him]93-billali lead on . This [he]93-billali did , taking [us]2568-us to [another ruined house next to [[our]2568-us own quarters]2573-our own quarters]2572-another ruined house next to our own quarters which had been swept , cleaned and furnished after a fashion , and moreover cleverly roofed in with mats , so that [it]2574-it was really quite comfortable . Here [we]2568-us found [two middle - aged women of a very superior type]2575-two middle - aged women of a very superior type , who , [Billali]93-billali informed [me]0-i , were by [trade nurses of [the sick]2577-the sick]2576-trade nurses of the sick . Having seen [her]159-inez laid upon [her]159-inez bed , [I]0-i committed [Inez]159-inez to [their]2575-two middle - aged women of a very superior type charge , since the case was not one that [I]0-i dared to try to doctor [myself]0-i , not knowing what drug of the few [I]0-i possessed should be administered to [her]159-inez . [Moreover Billali]93-billali comforted [me]0-i with the information that soon [She]159-inez - who - commands would visit [her]159-inez and " make [her]159-inez well again , "[159-inez] as [she]159-inez could do .

[I]0-i answered that [I]0-i hoped so and went to [[our]2578-our quarters]1796-our quarters where [I]0-i found an excellent meal ready cooked and with it a stone flagon , of the contents of which [Billali]93-billali said [we]2578-our were all three to drink by the command of [Ayesha]84-ayesha , who declared that it would take away [our]2578-our weariness .

[I]0-i tried the stuff , which was pale yellow in colour like sherry and , for aught [I]0-i knew , might be poison , to find it most comforting , though it did not seem to be very strong to the taste . Certainly , too , its effects were wonderful , since presently all [my]0-i great weariness fell from [me]0-i like a discarded cloak , and [I]0-i found [myself]0-i with a splendid appetite and feeling better and stronger than [I]0-i had done for years . In short that drink was a " cocktail "[84-ayesha] of the best , one of which [I]0-i only wish [I]0-i possessed the recipe , though [Ayesha]84-ayesha told [me]0-i afterwards that it was distilled from quite harmless herbs and not in any sense a spirit .

Having discovered this , [I]0-i gave some of it to [Hans]87-hans , also to [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , who was with [the wounded Zulus , who , [we]2578-our found]2580-the wounded zulus , who , we found , were progressing well towards complete recovery , and lastly to [Goroko who also was worn out]2581-goroko who also was worn out . On all of these the effect of that magical brew proved most satisfactory .

Then , having washed , [I]0-i ate a splendid dinner , though in this respect [Hans]87-hans , who was seated on the ground nearby , far outpassed [my]0-i finest efforts .

" [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans said , " things have gone very well with [us]2578-our when [they]4863-they might have gone very ill . [The Baas Red - Beard]121-baas is dead , which is a good thing , since [a madman]4864-a madman would have been difficult to look after , and a brain full of moonshine is a bad companion for [any one]4865-any one . Oh ! without doubt [he]87-hans is better dead , though [[your]121-baas reverend father]3327-your reverend father [the Predikant]3326-the predikant will have a hard job looking after [him]87-hans there in [the Place of Fires]3329-the place of fires . "[87-hans]

" Perhaps , "[0-i] [I]0-i said with a sigh , ' since it is better to be dead than to live [a lunatic]2582-a lunatic . But what [I]0-i fear is that [the lady [[his]87-hans daughter]778-his daughter]2583-the lady his daughter will follow [him]87-hans . "[2583-the lady his daughter]

" Oh , no ! [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] replied [Hans]87-hans cheerfully , " though [I]87-hans daresay that [she]2583-the lady his daughter will always be a little mad also , because [you]121-baas see it is in [her]2583-the lady his daughter blood and doubtless [she]2583-the lady his daughter has looked on dreadful things . But [the Great Medicine]104-zikali will see to it that [she]2583-the lady his daughter does not die after [we]4869-we have taken so much trouble and gone into such big dangers to save [her]2583-the lady his daughter . That Great Medicine is very wonderful , [Baas]121-baas . First of all it makes [you]121-baas General over [those Amahagger who without [you]121-baas would never have fought , as the Witch who ties up [her]2583-the lady his daughter head in a cloth knew well enough . Then it brings [us]4869-we safe through the battle and gives strength to [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas to kill [the old man - eating giant]4870-the old man - eating giant]125-umslopogaas . "[87-hans]

" Why did it not give [me]2585-i strength to kill [him]4870-the old man - eating giant , [Hans]87-hans ? [I]2585-i let [him]4870-the old man - eating giant have two Express bullets on [his]4870-the old man - eating giant chest , which hurt [him]4870-the old man - eating giant no more than a tap upon the horns with a dancing stick would hurt a bull - buffalo . "[2585-i]

" Oh ! [Baas]121-baas , perhaps [you]121-baas missed [him]4870-the old man - eating giant , who because [you]121-baas hit things sometimes , think that [you]121-baas do so always . "[87-hans]

Having waited to see if [I]0-i would rise to this piece of insolence , which of course [I]0-i did not , [he]2585-i went on by way of letting [me]0-i down easily , " Or perhaps [he]4870-the old man - eating giant wore very good armour under [his]4870-the old man - eating giant beard , for [I]2585-i saw some of [those Amahagger who pulled [his]4870-the old man - eating giant hair off and cut [him]4870-the old man - eating giant to pieces , go away with what looked like little bits of brass]4871-those amahagger who pulled his hair off and cut him to pieces , go away with what looked like little bits of brass . Also [the Great Medicine]104-zikali meant that [he]4870-the old man - eating giant should be killed by [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and not by [you]121-baas , since otherwise [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas would have been sad for the rest of [his]4870-the old man - eating giant life , whereas now [he]4870-the old man - eating giant will walk about [the world]277-the world as proud as a cock with two tails and crow all night as well as all day . Then , [Baas]121-baas , when [Rezu]88-rezu broke the square and [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas began to run , without doubt it was the Great Medicine which changed [their]4873-they hearts and made [them]4873-they brave again , so that [they]4873-they charged at the right moment when [they]4873-they saw it going forward on [your]121-baas breast , and instead of being eaten up , ate up [the cannibals]1176-the cannibals . "[2585-i]

" Indeed ! [I]87-hans thought that [the Lady who dwells yonder]4875-the lady who dwells yonder had something to do with that business . Did [you]121-baas see [her]4875-the lady who dwells yonder , [Hans]87-hans ? "[87-hans]

" Oh , yes ! [I]2585-i saw [her]4875-the lady who dwells yonder , [Baas]121-baas , and [I]2585-i think that without doubt [she]4875-the lady who dwells yonder lifted the cloth from over [her]4875-the lady who dwells yonder head and when [the people of Rezu]2106-the people of rezu saw how ugly was the face beneath , it did frighten [them]2106-the people of rezu a little . But doubtless [the Great Medicine]104-zikali put that thought into [her]4875-the lady who dwells yonder also , for , [Baas]121-baas , what could [a silly woman]4877-a silly woman do in such a case ? Did [you]121-baas ever know of [a woman who was of any use in a battle]4878-a woman who was of any use in a battle , or for anything else except to nurse [babies]4787-babies , and [this one]4126-this one does not even do that , no doubt because being so hideous under that sheet , [no man]3232-no man can be found to marry [her]4875-the lady who dwells yonder . "[2585-i]

Now [I]0-i looked up by chance and in the light of the lamps saw [Ayesha]84-ayesha standing in [the room]3855-the room , which [she]84-ayesha had entered through the open doorway , within six feet of [Hans]87-hans ' back indeed .

" Be sure [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans went on , " that this bundle of rags is nothing but [a common old cheat who frightens [people]3197-people]4882-a common old cheat who frightens people by pretending to be [a spook]4884-a spook , as , if [she]4875-the lady who dwells yonder dared to say that it was [she]4875-the lady who dwells yonder who made [those stinking Amahagger charge]4885-those stinking amahagger charge , and not [the Great Medicine of [the Opener - of - Roads]3230-the opener - of - roads]3562-the great medicine of the opener - of - roads , [I]87-hans would tell [her]4875-the lady who dwells yonder to [her]4875-the lady who dwells yonder face . "[87-hans]

Now [I]0-i was too paralysed to speak , and while [I]0-i was reflecting that it was fortunate [Ayesha]84-ayesha did not understand [Dutch]250-dutch , [she]84-ayesha moved a little so that one of the lamps behind [her]84-ayesha caused [her]84-ayesha shadow to fall on to the back of [the squatting Hans]2587-the squatting hans and over it on to the floor beyond . [He]87-hans saw it and stared at the distorted shape of the hooded head , then slowly screwed [his]87-hans neck round and looked upwards behind [him]87-hans .

For a moment [he]87-hans went on staring as though [he]87-hans were frozen , then uttering a wild yell , [he]87-hans scrambled to [his]87-hans feet , bolted out of [the house]722-the house and vanished into the night .

" It seems , [Allan]83-allan , "[84-ayesha] said [Ayesha]84-ayesha slowly , " that [yonder yellow ape of yours]4888-yonder yellow ape of yours is very bold at throwing sticks when [the leopardess]4889-the leopardess is not beneath the tree . But when [she]4889-the leopardess comes it is otherwise with [him]87-hans . Oh ! make no excuse , for [I]84-ayesha know well that [he]87-hans was speaking ill things of [me]84-ayesha , because being curious , as apes are , [he]87-hans burns to learn what is behind [my]84-ayesha veil , and being simple , believes that [no woman]4245-no woman would hide [her]4245-no woman face unless its fashion were not pleasing to the nice taste of [men]3228-men . "[84-ayesha]

Then , to [my]0-i relief , [she]84-ayesha laughed a little , softly , which showed [me]0-i that [she]84-ayesha had a sense of humour , and went on , " Well , let [him]87-hans be , for [he]87-hans is a good ape and courageous in [his]87-hans fashion , as [he]87-hans showed when [he]87-hans went out to spy upon [the host of [Rezu]88-rezu]4892-the host of rezu , and stabbed [the murderer - priest]4893-the murderer - priest by the stone of sacrifice . "[84-ayesha]

" How can [you]84-ayesha know the words of [Hans]87-hans , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , ' seeing that [he]2589-he spoke in a tongue which [you]84-ayesha have never learned ? "[2589-he]

" Perchance [I]84-ayesha read faces , [Allan]83-allan . "[84-ayesha]

" Or backs , "[0-i] [I]0-i suggested , remembering that [his]2589-he was turned to [her]84-ayesha .

" Or backs , or voices , or hearts . It matters little which , since read [I]84-ayesha do . But have done with such childish talk and lead [me]84-ayesha to [this maiden who has been snatched from the claws of [Rezu]88-rezu]4894-this maiden who has been snatched from the claws of rezu and a fate that is worse than death . Do [you]83-allan understand , [Allan]83-allan , that ere [the demon Rezu]4493-the demon rezu took [her]4894-this maiden who has been snatched from the claws of rezu to [wife]3440-wife , the plan was to sacrifice [[her]4894-this maiden who has been snatched from the claws of rezu own father]4897-her own father to [her]4894-this maiden who has been snatched from the claws of rezu and then eat [him]4897-her own father as [the woman with [her]4894-this maiden who has been snatched from the claws of rezu]4898-the woman with her was eaten , and before [her]4894-this maiden who has been snatched from the claws of rezu eyes ? Now [the father]4899-the father is dead , which is well , as [I]84-ayesha think [the little yellow man]3990-the little yellow man said to [you]83-allan - nay , start not , [I]84-ayesha read it from [his]3990-the little yellow man back Ha ! - [JB]103-jb - since had [he]3990-the little yellow man lived whose brain was rotted , [he]3990-the little yellow man would have raved till [his]3990-the little yellow man death 's day . Better , therefore , that [he]3990-the little yellow man should die like [a man]3551-a man fighting against a foe unconquerable by [all save one]4902-all save one . But [she]4894-this maiden who has been snatched from the claws of rezu still lives . "[84-ayesha]

" Aye , but mindless , [Ayesha]84-ayesha . "[2590-her]

" Which , in great trouble such as [she]4894-this maiden who has been snatched from the claws of rezu has passed , is a blessed state , [O Allan]82-allan . Bethink [you]83-allan , have there not been days , aye and months , in [your]83-allan own life when [you]83-allan would have rejoiced to sleep in mindlessness ? And should [we]2592-we not , perchance , be happier , all of [us]2592-we , if like the beasts [we]2592-we could not remember , foreknow and understand ? Oh ! [men]3228-men talk of Heaven , but believe [me]84-ayesha , [the real Heaven]4904-the real heaven is one of dreamless sleep , since life and wakefulness , however high [their]3228-men scale and on whatever star , mean struggle , which being so oft mistaken , must breed sorrow - or remorse that spoils all . Come now . "[84-ayesha]

So [I]0-i preceded [her]2590-her to [the next ruined house]2591-the next ruined house where [we]2592-we found [Inez]159-inez lying on the bed still clothed in [her]159-inez barbaric trappings , although the veil had been drawn off [her]159-inez face . There [she]159-inez lay , wide - eyed and still , while [the women]899-the women watched [her]159-inez . [Ayesha]84-ayesha looked at [her]159-inez a while , then said to [me]0-i ,

" So [they]899-the women tricked [her]159-inez out to be [Ayesha]84-ayesha 's mock and image , and in time accepted by [those barbarians]4905-those barbarians as [[my]84-ayesha very self]4906-my very self , and even set the seals of [royalty]4907-royalty on [her]159-inez , "[84-ayesha] and [she]84-ayesha pointed to the gold discs stamped with the likeness of the sun . " Well , [she]159-inez is [a fair maiden , white and gently bred]4908-a fair maiden , white and gently bred , the first such that [I]84-ayesha have seen for many an age . Nor did [she]159-inez wish this trickery . Moreover [she]159-inez has taken no hurt ; [her]159-inez soul has sunk deep into a sea of horror and that is all , whence doubtless it can be drawn again . Yet [I]84-ayesha think it best that for a while [she]159-inez should remember naught , lest [her]159-inez brain break , as did [[her]159-inez father]902-her father 's , and therefore no net of mine shall drag [her]159-inez back to memory . Let that return gently in future days , and then of it not too much , for so shall all this terror become to [her]159-inez a void in which sad shapes move like shadows , and as shadows are soon forgot and gone , no more to be held than dreams by the awakening sense . Stand aside , [Allan]82-allan , and [[you]899-the women women]4910-you women , leave [us]4910-you women for a while . "[84-ayesha]

[I]0-i obeyed , and [the women]899-the women bowed and went . Then [Ayesha]84-ayesha drew up [her]84-ayesha veil , and knelt down by the bed of [Inez]159-inez , but in such a fashion that [I]0-i could not see [her]84-ayesha face although [I]0-i admit that [I]0-i tried to do so . [I]0-i could see , however , that [she]84-ayesha set [her]84-ayesha lips against those of [Inez]159-inez and as [I]0-i gathered by [her]84-ayesha motions , seemed to breathe into [her]84-ayesha lips . Also [she]84-ayesha lifted [her]84-ayesha hands and placing one of them upon the heart of [Inez]159-inez , for a minute or more swayed the other from side to side above [her]84-ayesha eyes , pausing at times to touch [her]84-ayesha upon the forehead with [her]84-ayesha finger - tips .

Presently [Inez]159-inez stirred and sat up , whereon [Ayesha]84-ayesha took a vessel of milk which stood upon the floor and held it to [her]84-ayesha lips . [Inez]159-inez drank to the last drop , then sank on to the bed again . For a while longer [Ayesha]84-ayesha continued the motions of [her]84-ayesha hands , then let fall [her]84-ayesha veil and rose .

" Look , [I]84-ayesha have laid a spell upon [her]159-inez , "[84-ayesha] [she]84-ayesha said , beckoning to [me]0-i to draw near .

[I]0-i did so and perceived that now the eyes of [Inez]159-inez were shut and that [she]159-inez seemed to be plunged in a deep and natural sleep .

" So [she]159-inez will remain for this night and that day which follows , "[84-ayesha] said [Ayesha]84-ayesha , " and when [she]159-inez wakes it will be , [I]84-ayesha think , to believe [herself]159-inez once more [a happy child]4911-a happy child . Not until [she]159-inez sees [[her]159-inez home]4912-her home again will [she]159-inez find [her]159-inez womanhood , and then all this story will be forgotten by [her]159-inez . Of [[her]159-inez father]902-her father [you]0-i must tell [her]159-inez that [he]902-her father died when [you]0-i went out to hunt the river - beasts together , and if [she]159-inez seeks for [certain others]4914-certain others , that [they]4914-certain others have gone away . But [I]84-ayesha think that [she]159-inez will ask little more when [she]159-inez learns that [he]902-her father is dead , since [I]84-ayesha have laid that command upon [her]159-inez soul . "[84-ayesha]

" Hypnotic suggestion , "[0-i] thought [I]0-i to [myself]0-i , " and [I]0-i only hope to heaven that it will work . "[0-i]

[Ayesha]84-ayesha seemed to guess what was passing through [my]0-i mind , for [she]84-ayesha nodded and said ,

" [Have]4915-have no fear , [Allan]82-allan , for [I]84-ayesha am what [the black axe - bearer]4916-the black axe - bearer and [the little yellow man]3990-the little yellow man called [a ' witch]4918-a ' witch ' which means , as [you]4919-you who are instructed know , [one who has knowledge of medicine and other things and who holds a key to some of the mysteries that lie hid in Nature]4920-one who has knowledge of medicine and other things and who holds a key to some of the mysteries that lie hid in nature . "[84-ayesha]

" For instance , "[0-i] [I]0-i suggested , " of how to transport [yourself]0-i into a battle at the right moment , and out of it again - also at the right moment . "[0-i]

" Yes , [Allan]82-allan , since watching from afar , [I]2595-i saw that [those Amahagger curs]4921-those amahagger curs were about to flee and that [I]2595-i was needed there to hearten [them]4921-those amahagger curs and to put fear into [the army of [Rezu]88-rezu]2273-the army of rezu . So [I]2595-i came . "[2595-i]

" But how did [you]82-allan come , [Ayesha]84-ayesha ? "[0-i]

[She]2595-i laughed as [she]2595-i answered ,

" Perhaps [I]2595-i did not come at all . Perhaps [you]0-i only thought [I]2595-i came ; since [I]2595-i seemed to be there the rest matters nothing . "[2595-i]

As [I]0-i still looked unconvinced [she]2595-i went on ,

" Oh ! [foolish man]4923-foolish man , seek not to learn of that which is too high for [you]4923-foolish man . Yet listen . [You]4923-foolish man in [your]4923-foolish man ignorance suppose that the soul dwells within the body , do [you]4923-foolish man not ? "[2595-i]

[I]0-i answered that [I]0-i had always been under this impression .

" Yet , [Allan]82-allan , it is otherwise , for the body dwells within the soul . "[2595-i]

" Like the pearl in an oyster , "[0-i] [I]0-i suggested .

" Aye , in a sense , since the pearl which to [you]4923-foolish man is beautiful , is to the oyster a sickness and a poison , and so is the body to [the soul whose temple it troubles and defiles]4924-the soul whose temple it troubles and defiles . Yet round it is the white and holy soul that ever seeks to bring [the vile body to its own purity and colour]4925-the vile body to its own purity and colour , yet oft - times fails . Learn , [Allan]82-allan , that flesh and spirit are [the deadliest foes joined together by a high decree]4926-the deadliest foes joined together by a high decree that [they]4926-the deadliest foes joined together by a high decree may forget [their]4926-the deadliest foes joined together by a high decree hate and perfect each other , or failing , be separate to all eternity , the spirit going to [its]4927-its own place and the flesh to [its]4927-its corruption . "[2595-i]

" A strange theory , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" Aye , [Allan]82-allan , and one which is so new to [you]4923-foolish man that never will [you]4923-foolish man understand it . Yet it is true and [I]2595-i set it out for this reason . The soul of [man]287-man , being at liberty and not cooped within [his]287-man narrow breast , is in touch with that soul of [the Universe]4929-the universe , which [men]3228-men know as [God Whom [they]3228-men call by many names]4931-god whom they call by many names . Therefore it has all knowledge and perhaps all power , and at times the body within it , if it be [a wise body]4932-a wise body , can draw from this well of knowledge and abounding power . So at least can [I.]2595-i And now [you]4923-foolish man will understand why [I]2595-i am so good [a doctoress]4933-a doctoress and how [I]2595-i came to appear in the battle , as [you]4923-foolish man said , at the right time , and to leave it when [my]2595-i work was done . "[2595-i]

" Oh ! yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " [I]0-i quite understand . [I]0-i thank [you]2596-i much for putting it so plainly . "[0-i]

[She]2596-i laughed a little , appreciating [my]0-i jest , looked at [the sleeping Inez]2597-the sleeping inez , and said ,

" [The fair body of [this lady]4935-this lady]4934-the fair body of this lady dwells in a large soul , [I]2596-i think , though one of a somewhat sombre hue , for [souls]4936-souls have [their]4936-souls colours , [Allan]82-allan , and stain that which is within [them]4936-souls . [She]4935-this lady will never be [a happy woman]4937-a happy woman . "[2596-i]

" [The black people]4938-the black people named [her]4935-this lady [Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" Is it so ? Well , [I]2596-i name [her]4935-this lady Sad - Heart , though for such often there is joy at last . Meanwhile [she]4935-this lady will forget ; yes , [she]4935-this lady will forget the worst and how narrow was the edge between [her]4935-this lady and the arms of [Rezu]88-rezu . "[2596-i]

" Just the width of the blade of the axe , [Inkosikaas]156-inkosikaas , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " But tell [me]0-i , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , why could not that axe cut and why did [my]0-i bullets flatten or turn aside when these smote the breast of [Rezu]88-rezu ? "[0-i]

" Because [his]88-rezu front - armour was good , [Allan]82-allan , [I]2598-i suppose , "[2598-i] [she]2598-i replied indifferently , " and on [his]88-rezu back [he]88-rezu wore none . "[2598-i]

" Then why did [you]2598-i fill [my]0-i ears with such a different tale about [that horrible giant having drunk of a Cup of Life]4939-that horrible giant having drunk of a cup of life , and all the rest ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked with irritation .

" [I]2598-i have forgotten , [Allan]82-allan . Perhaps because [the curious]4940-the curious , such as [you]82-allan are , like to hear tales even stranger than [their]4940-the curious own , which in the days to be may become [their]4940-the curious own . Therefore [you]82-allan will be wise to believe only what [I]2598-i do , and of what [I]2598-i tell [you]82-allan , nothing . "[2598-i]

" [I]0-i do n't , "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed exasperated .

[She]2598-i laughed again and replied ,

" What need to say to [me]2598-i that which [I]2598-i know already ? Yet perhaps in the future it may be different , since often by the alchemy of the mind the fables of [our]4941-our youth are changed into the facts of [our]4941-our age , and [we]4941-our come to believe in anything , as [[your]82-allan little yellow man]4942-your little yellow man believes in [some savage named [Zikali]104-zikali]4943-some savage named zikali , and those [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas believe in the talisman round [your]82-allan neck , and [I]2598-i who am [the maddest of [you]82-allan all]4944-the maddest of you all , believe in Love and Wisdom , and [the black warrior]4110-the black warrior , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , believes in the virtue of that great axe of [his]4110-the black warrior , rather than in those of [his]4110-the black warrior own courage and of the strength that wields it . [Fools]2029-fools , [every one of [us]4941-our]4947-every one of us , though perchance [I]2598-i am [the greatest fool among [them]2029-fools]4948-the greatest fool among them . Now take [me]2598-i to [the warrior]1694-the warrior , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , whom [I]2598-i would thank , as [I]2598-i thank [you]82-allan , [Allan]82-allan , and [the little yellow man]3990-the little yellow man , although [he]3990-the little yellow man jeers at [me]2598-i with [his]3990-the little yellow man sharp tongue , not knowing that if [I]2598-i were angered , with a breath [I]2598-i could cause [him]3990-the little yellow man to cease to be . "[2598-i]

" Then why did [you]2598-i not choose [Rezu]88-rezu to cease to be , and [[his]88-rezu army]2451-his army also , [Ayesha]84-ayesha ? "[2598-i]

" It seems that [I]2598-i have done these things through the axe of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and by the help of [[your]82-allan generalship]4952-your generalship , [Allan]82-allan . Why then , waste [my]2598-i own strength when [yours]82-allan lay to [my]2598-i hand ? "[2598-i]

" Because [you]2598-i had no power over [Rezu]88-rezu , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , or so [you]2598-i told [me]2598-i . "[2598-i]

" Have [I]2598-i not said that [my]2598-i words are snowflakes , meant to melt and leave no trace , hiding [my]2598-i thoughts as this veil hides [my]2598-i beauty ? Yet as the beauty is beneath the veil , perchance there is truth beneath the words , though not that truth [you]84-ayesha think . So [you]84-ayesha are well answered , and for the rest , [I]2598-i wonder whether [Rezu]88-rezu thought [I]2598-i had no power over [him]88-rezu when yonder on [the mountain]1489-the mountain spur [he]88-rezu saw [me]2598-i float down upon [[his]88-rezu companies]4954-his companies like a spirit of the night . Well , perchance some day [I]2598-i shall learn this and many other things . "[2598-i]

[I]0-i made no answer , since what was the use of arguing with [a woman who told [me]0-i frankly that all [she]2599-a woman who told me frankly that all she said was false said was false]2599-a woman who told me frankly that all she said was false . So , although [I]0-i longed to ask [her]2599-a woman who told me frankly that all she said was false why [these Amahagger]125-umslopogaas had such reverence for the talisman that [Hans]87-hans called [the Great Medicine]1251-the great medicine , since now [I]0-i guessed that [her]2599-a woman who told me frankly that all she said was false first explanations concerning it were quite untrue , [I]0-i held [my]0-i tongue .

Yet as [we]2601-we went out of [the house]722-the house , by some coincidence [she]2599-a woman who told me frankly that all she said was false alluded to this very matter .

" [I]2599-a woman who told me frankly that all she said was false wish to tell [you]0-i , [Allan]82-allan , "[2599-a woman who told me frankly that all she said was false] [she]2599-a woman who told me frankly that all she said was false said , " why it was those [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas would not accept [you]0-i as [a General]4687-a general till [their]4956-their eyes had seen that which [you]0-i wear upon [your]0-i breast . [Their]4956-their tale of a legend of this very thing seemed that of [savages]1535-savages or of [[their]4956-their cunning priests]4958-their cunning priests , not to be believed by [a wise man]4959-a wise man such as [you]0-i are , like [some others that [you]0-i have heard in [K"r]1-k"r]4960-some others that you have heard in k"r[2599-a woman who told me frankly that all she said was false] . Yet it has in it a grain of truth , for as it chanced a little while ago , about a hundred years ago , [I]0-i think , [the old wizard whose picture is cut upon the wood]2603-the old wizard whose picture is cut upon the wood , came to visit [her]2599-a woman who told me frankly that all she said was false who held [my]0-i place before [me]0-i as [ruler of [this tribe]2605-this tribe]2604-ruler of this tribe - [she]2599-a woman who told me frankly that all she said was false was very like [me]0-i and as [I]0-i believe , [[my]0-i mother]3886-my mother , [Allan]82-allan - because of [her]2599-a woman who told me frankly that all she said was false repute for wisdom .

" At that time [I]2607-i have heard there was a question of war between [the worshippers of [Lulala]217-lulala]4708-the worshippers of lulala and [the grandfather of Rezu]4962-the grandfather of rezu . But this [Zikali]104-zikali told [the People of [Lulala]217-lulala]4693-the people of lulala that [they]2609-they must not fight [the People of [Rezu]88-rezu]2106-the people of rezu until in a day to come [a white man]3255-a white man should visit [K"r]1-k"r[2607-i] and bring with [him]2607-i a piece of wood on which was cut the image of [a dwarf like to that of [Zikali]104-zikali [himself]104-zikali]2608-a dwarf like to that of zikali himself . Then and not before [they]2609-they must fight and conquer [the People of [Rezu]88-rezu]2106-the people of rezu . Now this story came down among [them]2609-they and [you]2611-you who may have thought the first tale magical , will understand it in its simplicity : is it not so , [[you]2611-you wise [Allan]82-allan]2612-you wise allan ? "[2611-you]

" Oh ! yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " except that [I]0-i do not see how [Zikali]104-zikali can have come here a hundred years ago , since [men]3228-men do not live as long , although [he]104-zikali pretends to have done so . "[0-i]

" No , [Allan]82-allan , nor do [I]84-ayesha , but perhaps it was [[his]104-zikali father]3312-his father , or [[his]104-zikali grandfather]4968-his grandfather who came , since being observant , [you]0-i will have noted that if [the parent]4969-the parent is mis - formed , so often are [the descendants]4970-the descendants ; also that the pretence of wizardry at times comes down with the blood . "[84-ayesha]

Again [I]0-i made no answer for [I]0-i saw that [Ayesha]84-ayesha was fooling [me]0-i , and before [she]84-ayesha could exhaust that amusement [we]2613-we reached the place where [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [[his]125-umslopogaas men]1123-his men were gathered round [a camp fire]2615-a camp fire . [He]125-umslopogaas sat silent , but [Goroko]168-goroko with much animation was telling the story of the fight in picturesque and colourful language , or that part of it which [he]168-goroko had seen , for the benefit of [the two wounded men who took no share in it and who , lying on [their]2616-the two wounded men who took no share in it and who , lying on their blankets with heads thrust forward , were listening with eagerness to the entrancing tale blankets with heads thrust forward , were listening with eagerness to the entrancing tale]2616-the two wounded men who took no share in it and who , lying on their blankets with heads thrust forward , were listening with eagerness to the entrancing tale . Suddenly [they]2616-the two wounded men who took no share in it and who , lying on their blankets with heads thrust forward , were listening with eagerness to the entrancing tale caught sight of [Ayesha]84-ayesha , and those of [the party who could stand]2617-the party who could stand sprang to [their]2616-the two wounded men who took no share in it and who , lying on their blankets with heads thrust forward , were listening with eagerness to the entrancing tale feet , while one and all [they]2616-the two wounded men who took no share in it and who , lying on their blankets with heads thrust forward , were listening with eagerness to the entrancing tale gave [her]84-ayesha the royal salute of [Bayéte]193-bayéte .

[She]84-ayesha waited till the sound had died away . Then [she]84-ayesha said ,

" [I]84-ayesha come to thank [you]125-umslopogaas and [[your]125-umslopogaas men]3991-your men , [O Wielder of the Axe]4972-o wielder of the axe , who have shown [yourself]125-umslopogaas very great in battle , and to say to [you]125-umslopogaas that [[my]84-ayesha Spirit]3923-my spirit tells [me]84-ayesha that [every one of [you]125-umslopogaas , yes , [even those who are still sick]4975-even those who are still sick , will come safe to [[your]125-umslopogaas own land]4976-your own land again and live out [your]125-umslopogaas years with honour]4974-every one of you , yes , even those who are still sick , will come safe to your own land again and live out your years with honour . "[84-ayesha]

Again [they]2618-they saluted at this pleasing intelligence , when [I]0-i had translated it to [them]2618-they , for of course [they]2618-they knew no Arabic . Then [she]2619-she went on ,

" [I]2619-she am told , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , [Son of the Lion]4977-son of the lion , as [a certain king]4978-a certain king was named in [[your]125-umslopogaas land]4979-your land , that the fight [you]125-umslopogaas made against [Rezu]88-rezu was a very great fight , and that such a leap as yours above [his]4978-a certain king head when [you]125-umslopogaas smote [him]4978-a certain king with the axe on the hinder parts where [he]4978-a certain king wore no armour , and brought [him]4978-a certain king to [his]4978-a certain king death , has not been seen before , nor will be again . "[2619-she]

[I]0-i rendered the words , and [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , preferring truth to modesty , replied emphatically that this was the case .

" Because of that fight and that leap , "[84-ayesha] [Ayesha]84-ayesha went on , " as for other deeds that [you]125-umslopogaas have done and will do , [[my]84-ayesha Spirit]3923-my spirit tells [me]84-ayesha that [your]125-umslopogaas name will live in story for many generations . Yet of what use is fame to the dead ? Therefore [I]84-ayesha make [you]125-umslopogaas an offer . Bide here with [me]84-ayesha and [you]125-umslopogaas shall rule [these Amahagger]1201-these amahagger , and with [them]1201-these amahagger [the remnant of [the People of [Rezu]88-rezu]2106-the people of rezu]4982-the remnant of the people of rezu . [[Your]125-umslopogaas cattle]4984-your cattle shall be countless and [[your]125-umslopogaas wives]3409-your wives the fairest in [the land]3243-the land , and [[your]125-umslopogaas children]4987-your children many , for [I]84-ayesha will lift a certain curse from off [you]125-umslopogaas so that no more shall [you]125-umslopogaas be childless . Do [you]125-umslopogaas accept , [O Holder of the Axe]4988-o holder of the axe ? "[84-ayesha]

When [he]2620-he understood , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , after pondering a moment , asked if [I]0-i meant to stay in [this land]299-this land and marry [the white chieftainess who spoke such wise words and could appear and disappear in the battle]2622-the white chieftainess who spoke such wise words and could appear and disappear in the battle at [her]2622-the white chieftainess who spoke such wise words and could appear and disappear in the battle will , and like a mountain - top hid [her]2622-the white chieftainess who spoke such wise words and could appear and disappear in the battle head in a cloud , which was [his]2620-he way of alluding to [her]2622-the white chieftainess who spoke such wise words and could appear and disappear in the battle veil .

[I]0-i answered at once and with decision that [I]0-i intended to do nothing of the sort and immediately regretted [my]0-i words , since , although [I]0-i spoke in [Zulu]183-the zulu , [I]0-i suppose [she]2622-the white chieftainess who spoke such wise words and could appear and disappear in the battle read their meaning from [my]0-i face . At any rate [she]2622-the white chieftainess who spoke such wise words and could appear and disappear in the battle understood the drift of [them]2623-them .

" Tell [him]2620-he , [Allan]82-allan , "[2622-the white chieftainess who spoke such wise words and could appear and disappear in the battle] [she]2622-the white chieftainess who spoke such wise words and could appear and disappear in the battle said with a kind of icy politeness , " that [you]82-allan will not stop here and marry [me]2622-the white chieftainess who spoke such wise words and could appear and disappear in the battle , because if ever [I]2622-the white chieftainess who spoke such wise words and could appear and disappear in the battle chose [a husband]4989-a husband [he]2620-he would not be [a little man at the doors of whose heart so many [women]3186-women 's hands have knocked]4990-a little man at the doors of whose heart so many women 's hands have knocked - yes , even those that are black - and not , [I]2622-the white chieftainess who spoke such wise words and could appear and disappear in the battle think , in vain . One , moreover , who holds [himself]2620-he so clever that [he]2620-he believes [he]2620-he has nothing left to learn , and in every flower of truth that is shown to [him]2620-he , however fair , smells only poison , and beneath , nurturing it , sees only the gross root of falsehood planted in corruption . Tell [him]2620-he these things , [Allan]82-allan , if it pleases [you]82-allan . "[2622-the white chieftainess who spoke such wise words and could appear and disappear in the battle]

" It does not please [me]0-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered in a rage at [her]2622-the white chieftainess who spoke such wise words and could appear and disappear in the battle insults .

" Nor is it needful , [Allan]82-allan , since if [I]0-i caught the meaning of that barbarous tongue [you]82-allan use aright , [you]82-allan have told [him]2620-he already . Well , let the jest pass , [O man who least of all things desires to be [[Ayesha]84-ayesha 's husband]4993-ayesha 's husband , and whom [Ayesha]84-ayesha least of all things desires as [[her]84-ayesha spouse]4994-her spouse]4992-o man who least of all things desires to be ayesha 's husband , and whom ayesha least of all things desires as her spouse , and ask [the Axe - bearer]4995-the axe - bearer nothing since [I]0-i perceive that without [you]82-allan [he]2624-he will not stay at [K"r]1-k"r[0-i] . Nor indeed is it fated that [he]2624-he should do so , for now [my]0-i Spirit tells [me]0-i what it hid from [me]0-i when [I]0-i spoke a moment gone , that [this warrior]3259-this warrior shall die in a great fight far away and that between then and now much sorrow waits [him]2624-he who save that of one , knows not how to win the love of [women]3186-women . Let [him]2624-he say moreover what reward [he]2624-he desires since if [I]0-i can give it to [him]2624-he , it shall be [his]2624-he . "[2624-he]

Again [I]0-i translated . [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas received [her]2627-she prophecies in stoical silence , and as [I]0-i thought with indifference , and only said in reply ,

" The glory that [I]0-i have won is [my]0-i reward and the only boon [I]0-i seek at [this queen]3212-this queen 's hands is that if [she]3212-this queen can [she]3212-this queen should give [me]0-i sight of [a woman for whom [my]0-i heart is hungry , and with it knowledge that [this woman]533-this woman lives in [that land]4999-that land whither [I]0-i travel like [all men]4434-all men]4997-a woman for whom my heart is hungry , and with it knowledge that this woman lives in that land whither i travel like all men . "[0-i]

When [she]2627-she heard these words [Ayesha]84-ayesha said ,

" True , [I]84-ayesha had forgotten . [Your]0-i heart also is hungry , [I]84-ayesha think , [Allan]82-allan , for the vision of sundry faces that [you]0-i see no more . Well , [I]84-ayesha will do [my]84-ayesha best , but since only faith fulfils itself , how can [I]84-ayesha who must strive to pierce the gates of darkness for one so unbelieving , know that they will open at [my]84-ayesha word ? Come to [me]84-ayesha , both of [you]0-i , at the sunset to - morrow . "[84-ayesha]

Then as though to change the subject , [she]2627-she talked to [me]0-i for a long while about [K"r]1-k"r , of which [she]2627-she told [me]2627-she a most interesting history , true or false , that [I]2627-she omit here .[2627-she]

At length , as though suddenly [she]2627-she had grown tired , waving [her]2627-she hand to show that the conversation was ended , [Ayesha]84-ayesha went to [the wounded men]1603-the wounded men and touched [them]1603-the wounded men each in turn .

" Now [they]1603-the wounded men will recover swiftly , "[84-ayesha] [she]84-ayesha said , and leaving [the place]328-the place was gone into the darkness .

CHAPTER XX

THE GATE OF DEATH

Before turning in [I]0-i examined [these wounded men]2630-these wounded men for [myself]0-i . The truth is that [I]0-i was anxious to learn [their]2630-these wounded men exact condition in order that [I]0-i might make an estimate as to when it would be possible for [us]2631-us to leave [this valley]1480-this valley or [crater bottom of [K"r]1-k"r]5001-crater bottom of k"r , of which [I]84-ayesha was heartily tired . Who could desire to stay in [a place where [he]5003-he had not only been involved in a deal of hard , doubtful , and very dangerous fighting from which all personal interest was absent]5002-a place where he had not only been involved in a deal of hard , doubtful , and very dangerous fighting from which all personal interest was absent , but where also [he]5003-he was meshed in a perfect spider 's web of bewilderment , and exposed to continual insult into the bargain ?[84-ayesha]

For that is what it came to ; this [Ayesha]84-ayesha took every opportunity to jeer at and affront [me]0-i . And why ? Just because [I]0-i had conceived doubts , which somehow [she]84-ayesha discovered , of the amazing tales with which it had amused [her]84-ayesha to stuff [me]0-i , as [[a farmer]2633-a farmer 's wife]2634-a farmer 's wife does a turkey poult with meal pellets . How could [she]84-ayesha expect [me]0-i , [a man , after all , of some experience]2635-a man , after all , of some experience , to believe such lies , which , not half an hour before , in the coolest possible fashion [she]84-ayesha had [herself]84-ayesha admitted to be lies and nothing else , told for the mere pleasure of romancing ?

[The immortal Rezu , for instance , who had drunk of the Cup of Life or some such rubbish]2636-the immortal rezu , for instance , who had drunk of the cup of life or some such rubbish , now turned out to be nothing but [a brawny savage descended from [generations of [chiefs also called Rezu]2639-chiefs also called rezu]2638-generations of chiefs also called rezu]2637-a brawny savage descended from generations of chiefs also called rezu . Moreover [the immemorial Ayesha , who also had drunk of Cups of Life]2640-the immemorial ayesha , who also had drunk of cups of life , and according to [her]2640-the immemorial ayesha , who also had drunk of cups of life first story , had lived in [this place]3445-this place for thousands of years , had come [here]3339-here with [a mother]2643-a mother , who filled the same mystic r"le before [her]2640-the immemorial ayesha , who also had drunk of cups of life for the benefit of [an extremely gloomy and disagreeable tribe of [Semitic savages]5005-semitic savages]5004-an extremely gloomy and disagreeable tribe of semitic savages . Yet [she]84-ayesha was cross with [me]2643-a mother because [I]2643-a mother had not swallowed [her]84-ayesha crude and indigestible mixture of fable and philosophy without a moment 's question .[2643-a mother]

At least [I]0-i supposed that this was the reason , though another possible explanation did come into [my]0-i mind . [I]0-i had refused to be duly overcome by [her]84-ayesha charms , not because [I]0-i was unimpressed , for who could be , having looked upon that blinding beauty even for a moment ? but rather because , after sundry experiences , [I]0-i had at last attained to some power of judgment and learned what it is best to leave alone . Perhaps this had annoyed [her]84-ayesha , especially as [no white man]308-no white man seemed to have come [her]84-ayesha way for a long while and [the fabulous Kallikrates]95-kallikrates had not put in [his]308-no white man promised appearance .

Also it was unfortunate that in one way or another - how did [she]84-ayesha do it , [I]0-i wondered - [she]84-ayesha had interpreted [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas ' question to [me]0-i about marrying [her]84-ayesha , and [my]0-i compromising reply . Not that for one moment , as [I]0-i saw very clearly , did [she]84-ayesha wish to marry [me]0-i . But that fact , intuition suggested to [my]0-i mind , did not the least prevent [her]84-ayesha from being angry because [I]0-i shared [her]84-ayesha views upon this important subject .

Oh ! the whole thing was a bore and the sooner [I]0-i saw the last of [that veiled lady]2645-that veiled lady and the interesting but wearisome ruins in which [she]84-ayesha dwelt , the better [I]0-i should be pleased , although apparently [I]0-i must trek homewards with [a poor young woman who was out of [her]84-ayesha mind , leaving the bones of [[her]84-ayesha unfortunate father]2647-her unfortunate father behind [me]0-i]2646-a poor young woman who was out of her mind , leaving the bones of her unfortunate father behind me . [I]0-i admitted to [myself]0-i , however , that there were consolations in the fact that [Providence]127-providence had thus decreed , for [Robertson]159-inez since [he]2647-her unfortunate father gave up drink had not been [a cheerful companion]2648-a cheerful companion , and [two mad people]2649-two mad people would really have been more than [I]0-i could manage .

To return , for these reasons [I]0-i examined [the two wounded Zulus]2650-the two wounded zulus with considerable anxiety , only to discover another instance of the chicanery which it amused [this Ayesha]84-ayesha to play off upon [me]0-i . For what did [I]0-i find ? That [they]2650-the two wounded zulus were practically well . [Their]2650-the two wounded zulus hurts , which had never been serious , had healed wonderfully in that pure air , as those of [savages]1535-savages have a way of doing , and [they]2650-the two wounded zulus told [me]0-i [themselves]2650-the two wounded zulus that [they]2650-the two wounded zulus felt quite strong again . Yet with colossal impudence [Ayesha]84-ayesha had managed to suggest to [my]0-i mind that [she]84-ayesha was going to work some remarkable cure upon [them]2650-the two wounded zulus , who were already cured .

Well , it was of a piece with the rest of [her]84-ayesha conduct and there was nothing to do except go to bed , which [I]0-i did with much gratitude that [my]0-i resting place that night was not of another sort . The last thing [I]0-i remember was wondering how on earth [Ayesha]84-ayesha appeared and disappeared in the course of that battle , a problem as to which [I]0-i could find no solution , though , as in the case of [the others]3164-the others , [I]0-i was sure that one would occur to [me]0-i in course of time .

[I]0-i slept like a top , so soundly indeed that [I]0-i think there was some kind of soporific in the pick - [me]0-i - up which looked like sherry , especially as the others who had drunk of it also passed an excellent night .

About ten o'clock on the following morning [I]0-i awoke feeling particularly well and quite as though [I]0-i had been enjoying a week at [the seaside]2653-the seaside instead of [my]0-i recent adventures , which included an abominable battle and some agonising moments during which [I]0-i thought that [my]0-i number was up upon the board of [Destiny]251-destiny .

[I]0-i spent the most of that day lounging about , eating , talking over the details of the battle with [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [the Zulus]354-the zulus and smoking more than usual . [I]0-i forgot to say that [these Amahagger]1201-these amahagger grew some capital tobacco of which [I]0-i had obtained a supply , although like [most Africans]2656-most africans , [they]1201-these amahagger only used it in the shape of snuff . The truth was that after all [my]0-i marvellings and acute anxieties , also mental and physical exertions , [I]0-i felt like [the housemaid who caused to be cut upon [her]2657-the housemaid who caused to be cut upon her tombstone tombstone]2657-the housemaid who caused to be cut upon her tombstone that [she]2657-the housemaid who caused to be cut upon her tombstone had gone to [a better land where [her]2657-the housemaid who caused to be cut upon her tombstone ambition was to do nothing " for ever and ever]5006-a better land where her ambition was to do nothing " for ever and ever . "[2657-the housemaid who caused to be cut upon her tombstone] [I]0-i just wanted to be completely idle and vacuous - minded for at least a month , but as [I]0-i knew that all [I]0-i could expect in that line was a single bank holiday , like [a City clerk on the spree]2658-a city clerk on the spree , of it [I]0-i determined to make the most .

The result was that before the evening [I]0-i felt very bored indeed . [I]0-i had gone to look at [Inez]159-inez , who was still fast asleep , as [Ayesha]84-ayesha said would be the case , but whose features seemed to have plumped up considerably . The reason of this [I]0-i gathered from [[her]159-inez Amahagger nurses]2659-her amahagger nurses , was that at certain intervals [she]159-inez had awakened sufficiently to swallow considerable quantities of milk , or rather cream , which [I]0-i hoped would not make [her]159-inez ill . [I]0-i had chatted with [the wounded Zulus , who were now walking about , more bored even than [I]0-i was [myself]0-i , and heaping maledictions on [their]2660-the wounded zulus , who were now walking about , more bored even than i was myself , and heaping maledictions on their ancestral spirits because they had not been well enough to take part in the battle against rezu ancestral spirits because [they]2660-the wounded zulus , who were now walking about , more bored even than i was myself , and heaping maledictions on their ancestral spirits because they had not been well enough to take part in the battle against rezu had not been well enough to take part in the battle against [Rezu]88-rezu]2660-the wounded zulus , who were now walking about , more bored even than i was myself , and heaping maledictions on their ancestral spirits because they had not been well enough to take part in the battle against rezu .

[I]0-i even took a little stroll to look for [Hans]87-hans , who had vanished in [his]87-hans mysterious fashion , but the afternoon was so hot and oppressive with coming thunder , that soon [I]0-i came back again and fell into a variety of reflections that [I]0-i need not detail .

While [I]0-i was thus engaged and meditating , not without uneasiness , upon the ordeal that lay before [me]0-i after sunset , for [I]0-i felt sure that it would be an ordeal , [Hans]87-hans appeared and said that [the Amahagger impi or army]2661-the amahagger impi or army was gathered on that spot where [I]0-i had been elected to the proud position of [[their]2661-the amahagger impi or army General]2662-their general . [He]87-hans added that [he]87-hans believed - how [he]87-hans got this information [I]0-i do not know - that [the White Lady]2663-the white lady was going to hold a review of [them]2661-the amahagger impi or army and give [them]2661-the amahagger impi or army the rewards that [they]2661-the amahagger impi or army had earned in the battle .

Hearing this , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [the other Zulus]2664-the other zulus said that [they]2661-the amahagger impi or army would like to see this review if [I]0-i would accompany [them]2661-the amahagger impi or army . Although [I]0-i did not want to go nor indeed desired ever to look at another [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas , [I]0-i consented to save the trouble of argument , on condition that [we]2665-we should do so from a distance .

So , including [the wounded men]1603-the wounded men , [we]2665-we strolled off and presently came to the crumbled wall of [the old city]2115-the old city , beyond which lay [the great moat now dry]2668-the great moat now dry , that once had encircled [it]2669-it with water .

Here on the top of this wall [we]2665-we sat down where [we]2665-we could see without being seen , and observed [the Amahagger companies]2670-the amahagger companies , considerably reduced during the battle , being marshalled by [[their]2670-the amahagger companies captains]2671-their captains beneath [us]2665-we and about a couple of hundred yards away . Also [we]2665-we observed [several groups of [men under guard]2673-men under guard]2672-several groups of men under guard . These [we]2665-we took to be [prisoners captured in the fight with [Rezu]88-rezu , who , as [Hans]87-hans remarked with a smack of [his]87-hans lips]2674-prisoners captured in the fight with rezu , who , as hans remarked with a smack of his lips , were probably awaiting sacrifice .

[I]0-i said [I]0-i hoped not and yawned , for really the afternoon was intensely hot and the weather most peculiar . The sun had vanished behind clouds , and vapours filled the still air , so dense that at times it grew almost dark ; also when these cleared for brief intervals , the landscape in the grey , unholy light looked distorted and unnatural , as it does during an eclipse of the sun .

[Goroko]168-goroko , [the witch - doctor]907-the witch - doctor , stared round [him]168-goroko , sniffed the air and then remarked ocularly that it was " [wizard]1441-wizard 's weather "[168-goroko] and that there were many spirits about . Upon [my]0-i word [I]0-i felt inclined to agree with [him]168-goroko , for [my]0-i feelings were very uncomfortable , but [I]0-i only replied that if so , [I]0-i should be obliged if [he]168-goroko , as [a professional]2676-a professional , would be good enough to keep [them]2677-them off [me]0-i . Of course [I]0-i knew that electrical charges were about , which accounted for [my]0-i sensations , and wished that [I]0-i had never left [the camp]3963-the camp .

It was during one of these periods of dense gloom that [Ayesha]84-ayesha must have arrived upon [the review ground]2679-the review ground . At least , when it lifted , there [she]84-ayesha was in [her]84-ayesha white garments , surrounded by [women]3186-women and [guards]1794-guards , engaged apparently in making an oration , for although [I]0-i could not hear a word , [I]0-i could see by the motions of [her]84-ayesha arms that [she]84-ayesha was speaking .

Had [she]84-ayesha been [the central figure in some stage scene]2682-the central figure in some stage scene , no limelights could have set [her]84-ayesha off to better advantage , than did those of [the heavens above [her]84-ayesha]2683-the heavens above her . Suddenly , through the blanket of cloud , flowing from a hole in it that looked like an eye , came a blood - red ray which fell full upon [her]84-ayesha , so that [she]84-ayesha alone was fiercely visible whilst all around was gloom in which shapes moved dimly . Certainly [she]84-ayesha looked strange and even terrifying in that red ray which stained [her]84-ayesha robe till [I]0-i who had but just come out of battle with its " confused noise , "[84-ayesha] began to think of " the garments rolled in blood "[84-ayesha] of which [I]0-i often read in [my]0-i favourite Old Testament . For crimson was [she]84-ayesha from head to foot ; a tall shape of terror and of wrath .

The eye in heaven shut and the ray went out . Then came one of the spaces of grey light and in it [I]0-i saw [men]3228-men being brought up , apparently from the groups of [prisoners]2685-prisoners , under guard , and , to the number of a dozen or more , stood in a line before [Ayesha]84-ayesha .

Then [I]0-i saw nothing more for a long while , because blackness seemed to flow in from every quarter of [the heavens]2686-the heavens and to block out the scene beneath . At least after a pause of perhaps five minutes , during which the stillness was intense , the storm broke .

It was a very curious storm ; in all [my]0-i experience of African tempests [I]0-i can not recall one which it resembled . It began with the usual cold and wailing wind . This died away , and suddenly [the whole arch of heaven]2687-the whole arch of heaven was alive with little lightnings that seemed to strike horizontally , not downwards to the earth , weaving a web of fire upon the surface of the sky .

By the illumination of these lightnings which , but for the swiftness of [their]2688-their flashing and greater intensity , somewhat resembled a dense shower of shooting stars , [I]0-i perceived that [Ayesha]84-ayesha was addressing [the men that had been brought before [her]84-ayesha , who stood dejectedly in a long line with [their]2689-the men that had been brought before her , who stood dejectedly in a long line with their heads bent , quite unattended , since their guards had fallen back heads bent , quite unattended , since [[their]2689-the men that had been brought before her , who stood dejectedly in a long line with their heads bent , quite unattended , since their guards had fallen back guards]2690-their guards had fallen back]2689-the men that had been brought before her , who stood dejectedly in a long line with their heads bent , quite unattended , since their guards had fallen back .

" If [I]87-hans were going to receive a reward of cattle or [wives]3434-wives , [I]87-hans should look happier than [those moon - worshippers]5009-those moon - worshippers , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] remarked [Hans]87-hans reflectively .

" Perhaps it would depend , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " upon what the cattle and [wives]3434-wives were like . If the cattle had red - water and would bring disease into [your]87-hans herd , or wild bulls that would gore [you]87-hans , and [the wives]5011-the wives were [skinny old widows with evil tongues]5012-skinny old widows with evil tongues , then [I]0-i think [you]87-hans would look as do [those men]3755-those men , [Hans]87-hans . "[0-i]

[I]0-i do n't quite know what made [me]0-i speak thus , but [I]0-i believe it was some sense of pending death or disaster , suggested , probably , by the ominous character of the setting provided by Nature to the curious drama of which [we]2691-we were [witnesses]2692-witnesses .

" [I]87-hans never thought of that , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] commented [Hans]87-hans , " but it is true that all gifts are not good , especially [witches]4168-witches ' gifts . "[87-hans]

As [he]87-hans spoke the little net - like lightnings died away , leaving behind [them]2693-them a gross darkness through which , far above [us]2691-we , the wind wailed again .

Then suddenly all the heaven was turned into one blaze of light , and by it [I]0-i saw [Ayesha]84-ayesha standing tall and rigid with [her]84-ayesha hand pointed towards [the line of men in front of [her]84-ayesha]2694-the line of men in front of her . The blaze went out , to be followed by blackness , and to return almost instantly in a yet fiercer blaze which seemed to fall earthwards in a torrent of fire that concentrated itself in a kind of flame - spout upon the spot where [Ayesha]84-ayesha stood .

Through that flame or rather in the heart of it , [I]0-i saw [Ayesha]84-ayesha and [the file of men in front of [her]84-ayesha]2695-the file of men in front of her , as [the great King]2696-the great king saw [the prophets in the midst of the furnace that had been heated sevenfold]2697-the prophets in the midst of the furnace that had been heated sevenfold . Only [these men]850-these men did not walk about in the fire ; no , [they]850-these men fell backwards , while [Ayesha]84-ayesha alone remained upon [her]84-ayesha feet with outstretched hand .

Next came more blackness and crash upon crash of such thunder that the earth shook as it reverberated from [the mountain cliffs]2699-the mountain cliffs . Never in [my]0-i life did [I]0-i hear such fearful thunder . It frightened [the Zulus]354-the zulus so much , that [they]354-the zulus fell upon [their]354-the zulus faces , except [Goroko]168-goroko and [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , whose pride kept [them]850-these men upon [their]850-these men feet , the former because [he]168-goroko had a reputation to preserve as [a " Heaven - herd]5015-a " heaven - herd , "[168-goroko] or [Master of tempests]2701-master of tempests .

[I]0-i confess that [I]0-i should have liked to follow [their]850-these men example , and lie down , being dreadfully afraid lest the lightning should strike [me]0-i . But there - [I]0-i did not .

At last the thunder died away and in the most mysterious fashion that violent tempest came to a sudden end , as does a storm upon the stage . No rain fell , which in itself was surprising enough and most unusual , but in place of it a garment of the completest calm descended upon [the earth]285-the earth . By degrees , too , the darkness passed and the westering sun reappeared . Its rays fell upon [the place where [the Amahagger companies]2670-the amahagger companies had stood]2703-the place where the amahagger companies had stood , but now not one of [them]2670-the amahagger companies was to be seen .

[They]2670-the amahagger companies were all gone and [Ayesha]84-ayesha with [them]2670-the amahagger companies . So completely had [they]2670-the amahagger companies vanished away that [I]0-i should have thought that [we]2705-we suffered from illusions , were it not for [the line of dead men which lay there looking very small and lonesome on [the veld]1057-the veld]2706-the line of dead men which lay there looking very small and lonesome on the veld ; mere dots indeed at that distance .

[We]2705-we stared at [each other]3176-each other and at [them]2670-the amahagger companies , and then [Goroko]168-goroko said that [he]168-goroko would like to inspect the bodies to learn whether lightning killed at [K"r]1-k"r as it did elsewhere , also whether it had smitten [them]2670-the amahagger companies altogether or leapt from [man]287-man to [man]287-man . This , as [a professional "[168-goroko] Heaven - herd]5018-a professional " heaven - herd , " [he]168-goroko declared [he]168-goroko could tell from the marks upon [these unfortunates]5019-these unfortunates .[168-goroko]

As [I]0-i was curious also and wanted to make a few observations , [I]0-i consented . So with the exception of [the wounded men]1603-the wounded men , who [I]0-i thought should avoid the exertion , [we]2705-we scrambled down the débris of the tumbled wall and across [the open space beyond]2710-the open space beyond , reaching the scene of the tragedy without meeting or seeing [anyone]281-anyone .

There lay [the dead]3534-the dead , eleven of [them]3534-the dead , in an exact line as [they]3534-the dead had stood . [They]3534-the dead were all upon [their]3534-the dead backs with widely - opened eyes and an expression of great fear frozen upon [their]3534-the dead faces . Some of these [I]0-i recognised , as did [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [Hans]87-hans . [They]3534-the dead were [[soldiers]499-soldiers or captains who had marched under [me]0-i to attack [Rezu]88-rezu]2714-soldiers or captains who had marched under me to attack rezu , although until this moment [I]0-i had not seen any of [them]3534-the dead after [we]2705-we began to descend [the ridge where the battle took place]2715-the ridge where the battle took place .

" [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] said [Hans]87-hans , " [I]87-hans believe that these were [the traitors who slipped away and told [Rezu]88-rezu of [our]2705-we plans so that [he]88-rezu attacked [us]2705-we on [the ridge]2287-the ridge]5020-the traitors who slipped away and told rezu of our plans so that he attacked us on the ridge , instead of [our]2705-we attacking [him]88-rezu on [the plain]3355-the plain as [we]2705-we had arranged so nicely . At least [they]5020-the traitors who slipped away and told rezu of our plans so that he attacked us on the ridge were none of [them]5020-the traitors who slipped away and told rezu of our plans so that he attacked us on the ridge in the battle and afterwards [I]87-hans heard [the Amahagger]125-umslopogaas talking of some of [them]5020-the traitors who slipped away and told rezu of our plans so that he attacked us on the ridge . "[87-hans]

[I]0-i remarked that if so the lightning had discriminated very well in this instance .

[Meanwhile Goroko]168-goroko was examining the bodies one by one , and presently called out ,

" [These doomed ones]5023-these doomed ones died not by lightning but by witchcraft . There is not a burn upon one of [them]5023-these doomed ones , nor are [their]5023-these doomed ones garments scorched . "[168-goroko]

[I]0-i went to look and found that it was perfectly true ; to all outward appearance [the eleven]2716-the eleven were quite unmarked and unharmed . Except for [their]2716-the eleven frightened air , [they]2716-the eleven might have died a natural death in [their]2716-the eleven sleep .

" Does lightning always scorch ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked [Goroko]168-goroko .

" Always , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , "[168-goroko] [he]168-goroko answered , " that is , if [he]168-goroko who has been struck is killed , as these are , and not only stunned . Moreover , [most of [yonder dead]5025-yonder dead]5024-most of yonder dead wear knives which should have melted or shattered with the sheaths burnt off them . Yet those knives are as though they had just left [the smith]5026-the smith 's hammer and the whet - stone , "[168-goroko] and [he]168-goroko drew some of them to show [me]0-i .

Again it was quite true and here [I]0-i may remark that [my]0-i experience tallied with that of [Goroko]168-goroko , since [I]0-i have never seen [anyone killed by lightning on whom or on whose clothing there was not some trace of its passage]2717-anyone killed by lightning on whom or on whose clothing there was not some trace of its passage .

" Ow ! "[125-umslopogaas] said [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , " this is witchcraft , not Heaven - wrath . [The place]328-the place is enchanted . Let [us]2718-us get away lest [we]2718-us be smitten also who have not earned doom like [those traitors]5028-those traitors . "[125-umslopogaas]

" No need to fear , "[87-hans] said [Hans]87-hans , ' since with [us]2718-us is the Great Medicine of [Zikali]104-zikali which can tie up the lightning as [an old woman]1191-an old woman does a bundle of sticks . "[1191-an old woman]

Still [I]0-i observed that for all [his]168-goroko confidence , [Hans]87-hans [himself]87-hans was the first to depart and with considerable speed . So [we]2718-us went back to [[our]2718-us camp]1037-our camp without more conversation , since [the Zulus]101-the zulus were scared and [I]0-i confess that [myself]0-i [I]0-i could not understand the matter , though no doubt it admitted of some quite simple explanation .

However that might be , [this K"r]1-k"r was [a queer place with [its]1-k"r legends]5029-a queer place with its legends , [its]1-k"r sullen [Amahagger]125-umslopogaas and [[its]1-k"r mysterious queen]5030-its mysterious queen , to whom at times , in spite of [my]2721-my inner conviction to the contrary , [I]2721-my was still inclined to attribute powers beyond those that are common even among [very beautiful and able women]5031-very beautiful and able women .[2721-my]

This reflection reminded [me]0-i that [she]2721-my had promised [us]2718-us a further exhibition of those powers and within an hour or two . Remembering this [I]0-i began to regret that [I]0-i had ever asked for any such manifestations , for who knew what these might or might not involve ?

So much did [I]0-i regret it that [I]0-i determined , unless [Ayesha]84-ayesha sent for [us]2718-us , as [she]84-ayesha had said [she]84-ayesha would do , [I]0-i would conveniently forget the appointment . [Luckily Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas seemed to be of the same way of thinking ; at any rate [he]2722-his went off to eat [his]2722-his evening meal without alluding to it at all . So [I]0-i made up [my]0-i mind that [I]0-i would not bring the matter to [his]2722-his notice and having ascertained that [Inez]159-inez was still asleep , [I]0-i followed [his]2722-his example and dined [myself]0-i , though without any particular appetite .

As [I]0-i finished the sun was setting in a perfectly clear sky , so as there was no sign of [any messenger]2723-any messenger , [I]0-i thought that [I]0-i would go to bed early , leaving orders that [I]0-i was not to be disturbed . But on this point [my]0-i luck was lacking , for just as [I]0-i had taken off [my]0-i coat , [Hans]87-hans arrived and said that [old Billali]93-billali was without and had come to take [me]0-i somewhere .

Well , there was nothing to do but to put it on again . Before [I]0-i had finished this operation [Billali]93-billali [himself]93-billali arrived with undignified and unusual haste . [I]0-i asked [him]93-billali what was the matter , and [he]93-billali answered inconsequently that [the Black One]4152-the black one , [the slayer of [Rezu]88-rezu]2725-the slayer of rezu , was at the door " with [his]4152-the black one axe . "[93-billali]

" That generally accompanies [him]93-billali , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . Then , remembering the cause of [Billali]93-billali 's alarm , [I]0-i explained to [him]93-billali that [he]93-billali must not take too much notice of a few hasty words spoken by [an essentially gentle - natured person whose nerve had given way beneath provocation and bodily effort]2726-an essentially gentle - natured person whose nerve had given way beneath provocation and bodily effort . [The old fellow]1606-the old fellow bowed in assent and stroked [his]1606-the old fellow beard , but [I]0-i noticed that while [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas was near , [he]1606-the old fellow clung to [me]0-i like a shadow . Perhaps [he]1606-the old fellow thought that nervous attacks might be recurrent , like those of fever .

Outside [the house]722-the house [I]0-i found [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas leaning on [his]125-umslopogaas axe and looking at the sky in which the last red rays of evening lingered .

" The sun has set , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , "[1606-the old fellow] [he]1606-the old fellow said , " and it is time to visit [this white queen]5032-this white queen as [she]5032-this white queen bade [us]5033-us , and to learn whether [she]5032-this white queen can indeed lead [us]5033-us ' down below ' where the dead are said to dwell . "[1606-the old fellow]

So [he]1606-the old fellow had not forgotten , which was disconcerting . To cover up [my]0-i own doubts [I]0-i asked [him]1606-the old fellow with affected confidence and cheerfulness whether [he]1606-the old fellow was not afraid to risk this journey " down below , "[0-i] that is , to [the Realm of Death]2729-the realm of death .
