" Why should [I]1606-the old fellow fear to tread [a road that awaits the feet of all of [us]5033-us]5034-a road that awaits the feet of all of us and at the gate of which [we]2730-we knock day by day , especially if [we]2730-we chance to live by war , as do [you]0-i and [I]1606-the old fellow , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn ? "[1606-the old fellow] [he]1606-the old fellow inquired with a quiet dignity , which made [me]0-i feel ashamed .

" Why indeed ? "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , adding to [myself]0-i , " though [I]0-i should much prefer any other highway . "[0-i]

After this [we]2730-we started without more words , [I]0-i keeping up [my]0-i spirits by reflecting that the whole business was nonsense and that there could be nothing to dread .

All too soon [we]2730-we passed [the ruined archway]2731-the ruined archway and were admitted into [Ayesha]84-ayesha 's presence in the usual fashion . As [Billali]93-billali , who remained outside of [them]2731-the ruined archway , drew the curtains behind [us]2730-we , [I]0-i observed , to [my]0-i astonishment , that [Hans]87-hans had sneaked in after [me]0-i , and squatted down quite close to [them]2731-the ruined archway , apparently in the hope of being overlooked .

It seemed , as [I]0-i gathered later , that somehow or other [he]1606-the old fellow had guessed , or become aware of the object of [our]2730-we visit , and that [his]1606-the old fellow burning curiosity had overcome [his]1606-the old fellow terror of the " White Witch . "[1606-the old fellow] Or possibly [he]1606-the old fellow hoped to discover whether or not [she]84-ayesha were so ugly as [he]1606-the old fellow supposed [her]84-ayesha veil - hidden face to be . At any rate there [he]1606-the old fellow was , and if [Ayesha]84-ayesha noticed [him]1606-the old fellow , as [I]0-i think [she]84-ayesha did , for [I]0-i saw by the motion of [her]84-ayesha head , that [she]84-ayesha was looking in [his]1606-the old fellow direction , [she]84-ayesha made no remark .

For a while [she]84-ayesha sat still in [her]84-ayesha chair contemplating [us]2730-we both . Then [she]84-ayesha said ,

" How comes it that [you]0-i are late ? Those that seek [their]5035-their lost loves should run with eager feet , but [yours]0-i have tarried . "[84-ayesha]

[I]0-i muttered some excuse to which [she]84-ayesha did not trouble to listen , for [she]84-ayesha went on ,

" [I]84-ayesha think , [Allan]82-allan , that [your]0-i sandals , which should be winged like to those of [the Roman Mercury]5036-the roman mercury , are weighted with the grey lead of fear . Well , it is not strange , since [you]0-i have come to travel through the Gates of [Death]67-death that are feared by [all]568-all , even by [[Ayesha]84-ayesha 's self]5038-ayesha 's self , for who knows what [he]125-umslopogaas may find beyond [them]5039-them ? Ask [the Axe - Bearer]4995-the axe - bearer if [he]125-umslopogaas also is afraid . "[84-ayesha]

[I]0-i obeyed , rendering all that [she]84-ayesha had said into the Zulu idiom as best [I]0-i could .

" Say to [the Queen]4361-the queen , "[125-umslopogaas] answered [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , when [he]125-umslopogaas understood , " that [I]125-umslopogaas fear nothing , except [women]3186-women 's tongues . [I]125-umslopogaas am ready to pass the Gates of Death and , if need be , to come back no more . With [the white people]5043-the white people [I]125-umslopogaas know it is otherwise because of some dark teachings to which [they]5043-the white people listen , that tell of terrors to be , such as [we]5043-the white people who are black do not dread . Still , [we]5043-the white people believe that there are ghosts and that the spirits of [[our]5043-the white people fathers]3922-our fathers live on and as it chances [I]125-umslopogaas would learn whether this is so , who above all things desire to met a certain ghost , for which reason [I]125-umslopogaas journeyed to [this far land]5045-this far land .[125-umslopogaas]

" Say these things to [the white Queen]3277-the white queen , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , and tell [her]3277-the white queen that if [she]3277-the white queen should send [me]84-ayesha to a place whence there is no return , [[I]84-ayesha who do not love [the world]277-the world]5047-i who do not love the world , shall not blame [her]3277-the white queen overmuch , though it is true that [I]84-ayesha should have chosen to die in war . Now [I]84-ayesha have spoken . "[84-ayesha]

When [I]0-i had passed on all this speech to [Ayesha]84-ayesha , [her]84-ayesha comment on it was ,

" [This black Captain]5049-this black captain has a spirit as brave as [his]5049-this black captain body , but how is it with [your]84-ayesha spirit , [Allan]82-allan ? Are [you]84-ayesha also prepared to risk so much ? Learn that [I]84-ayesha can promise [you]84-ayesha nothing , save that when [I]84-ayesha loose the bonds of [your]84-ayesha mortality and send out [your]84-ayesha soul to wander in the depths of Death , as [I]84-ayesha believe that [I]84-ayesha can do , though even of this [I]84-ayesha am not certain - [you]84-ayesha must pass through a gate of terrors that may be closed behind [you]84-ayesha by a stronger arm than [mine]84-ayesha . Moreover , what [you]84-ayesha will find beyond it [I]84-ayesha do not know , since be sure of this , each of [us]5050-us has [[his]5051-his own heaven]5052-his own heaven or [[his]5051-his own hell]5053-his own hell , or both , that soon or late [he]5051-his is doomed to travel . Now will [you]84-ayesha go forward , or go back ? Make choice while there is still time . "[84-ayesha]

At all this ominous talk [I]0-i felt [my]0-i heart shrivel like a fire - withered leaf , if [I]0-i may use that figure , and [my]0-i blood assume the temperature and consistency of ice - cream . Earnestly did [I]0-i curse [myself]0-i for having allowed [my]0-i curiosity about matters which [we]2732-we are not meant to understand to bring [me]0-i to the edge of such a choice . Swiftly [I]0-i determined to temporise , which [I]0-i did by asking [Ayesha]84-ayesha whether [she]84-ayesha would accompany [me]0-i upon this eerie expedition .

[She]84-ayesha laughed a little as [she]84-ayesha answered ,

" Bethink [you]0-i , [Allan]82-allan . Am [I]84-ayesha , whose face [you]0-i have seen , [a meet companion for [a man who desires to visit the loves that once were [his]5055-a man who desires to visit the loves that once were his]5055-a man who desires to visit the loves that once were his]5054-a meet companion for a man who desires to visit the loves that once were his ? What would [they]5056-they say or think , if [they]5056-they should see [you]0-i hand in hand with [such a one]5057-such a one ? "[84-ayesha]

" [I]0-i do n't know and do n't care , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied desperately , " but this is the kind of journey on which one requires [a guide who knows [the road]3133-the road]5058-a guide who knows the road . Can not [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas go first and come back to tell [me]0-i how it has fared with [him]5055-a man who desires to visit the loves that once were his ? "[0-i]

" If [the brave and instructed white lord]5060-the brave and instructed white lord , panoplied in [the world]277-the world 's last Faith , is not ashamed to throw [the savage]5062-the savage in [his]5055-a man who desires to visit the loves that once were his ignorance out like a feather to test the winds of hell and watch the while to learn whether these blow [him]5055-a man who desires to visit the loves that once were his back unscorched , or waft [him]5055-a man who desires to visit the loves that once were his into fires whence there is no return , perchance it might so be ordered , [Allan]82-allan . Ask [him]5055-a man who desires to visit the loves that once were his [yourself]82-allan , [Allan]82-allan , if [he]5055-a man who desires to visit the loves that once were his is willing to run this errand for [your]82-allan sake . Or perhaps [the little yellow man]3990-the little yellow man - - "[2733-she] and [she]2733-she paused .

At this point [Hans]87-hans , who having a smattering of [Arabic]232-arabic understood something of [our]2734-our talk , could contain [himself]87-hans no longer .

" No , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans broke in from [his]87-hans corner by the curtain , " not [me]87-hans . [I]87-hans do n't care for hunting spooks , [Baas]121-baas , which leave no spoor that [you]82-allan can follow and are always behind when [you]82-allan think [they]5064-they are in front . Also there are too many of them waiting for [me]87-hans down there and how can [I]87-hans stand up to [them]5064-they until [I]87-hans am [a spook]4884-a spook [myself]87-hans and know [their]5064-they ways of fighting ? Also if [you]82-allan should die when [your]82-allan spirit is away , [I]87-hans want to be left that [I]87-hans may bury [you]82-allan nicely . "[87-hans]

" Be silent , "[0-i] [I]0-i said in [my]0-i sternest manner . Then , unable to bear more of [Ayesha]84-ayesha 's mockery , for [I]0-i felt that as usual [she]84-ayesha was mocking [me]0-i , [I]0-i added with all the dignity that [I]0-i could command ,

" [I]0-i am ready to make this journey through the gate of Death , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , if indeed [you]84-ayesha can show [me]0-i [the road]3133-the road . For one purpose and no other [I]0-i came to [K"r]1-k"r[0-i] , namely to learn , if so [I]0-i might , whether those who have died upon [the world]277-the world , live on elsewhere . Now , what must [I]0-i do ? "[0-i]

CHAPTER XXI

THE LESSON

" Yes , "[84-ayesha] answered [Ayesha]84-ayesha , laughing very softly , " for that purpose alone , O truth - seeking [Allan]82-allan , whose curiosity is so fierce that [the wide world]5067-the wide world can not hold it , did [you]82-allan come to [K"r]1-k"r[84-ayesha] and not to seek wealth or [new lands]2736-new lands , or to fight [more savages]2737-more savages . No , not even to look upon [a certain Ayesha]2738-a certain ayesha , of whom [the old wizard]359-the old wizard told [you]2740-you , though [I]0-i think [you]2740-you have always loved to try to lift the veil that hides [women]3186-women 's hearts , if not [their]3186-women faces . Yet it was [I]0-i who brought [you]2740-you to [K"r]1-k"r for [my]0-i own purposes , not [your]2740-you desire , nor [Zikali]104-zikali 's map and talisman , since had [not the white lady who lies sick been stolen by Rezu]5068-not the white lady who lies sick been stolen by rezu , never would [you]2740-you have pursued the journey nor found the way hither . "[0-i]

" How could [you]0-i have had anything to do with that business ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked testily , for [my]0-i nerves were on edge and [I]0-i said the first thing that came into [my]0-i mind .

" That , [Allan]82-allan , is a question over which [you]2740-you will wonder for a long while either beneath or beyond the sun , as [you]2740-you will wonder concerning much that has to do with [me]0-i , which [your]2740-you little mind , shut in its iron box of ignorance and pride , can not understand to - day .[0-i]

" For example , [you]2740-you have been wondering , [I]2742-i am sure , how the lightning killed [those eleven men whose bodies [you]2740-you went to look on an hour or two ago]5069-those eleven men whose bodies you went to look on an hour or two ago , and left the rest untouched . Well , [I]2742-i will tell [you]2740-you at once that it was not lightning that killed [them]5069-those eleven men whose bodies you went to look on an hour or two ago , although the strength within [me]2742-i was manifest to [you]2740-you in storm , but rather what [that witch - doctor of [your]2740-you following]5070-that witch - doctor of your following called wizardry . Because [they]5069-those eleven men whose bodies you went to look on an hour or two ago were [traitors who betrayed [[your]2740-you army]5072-your army to [Rezu]88-rezu , [I]2742-i killed [them]5069-those eleven men whose bodies you went to look on an hour or two ago with [my]2742-i wrath and by the wand of [my]2742-i power]5071-traitors who betrayed your army to rezu , i killed them with my wrath and by the wand of my power . Oh ! [you]2740-you do not believe , yet perhaps ere long [you]2740-you will , since thus to fulfil [your]2740-you prayer [I]2742-i must also kill [you]2740-you - almost . That is the trouble , [Allan]82-allan . To kill [you]2740-you outright would be easy , but to kill [you]2740-you just enough to set [your]2740-you spirit free and yet leave one crevice of mortal life through which it can creep back again , that is most difficult ; a thing that only [I]2742-i can do and even of [myself]2742-i [I]2742-i am not sure . "[2742-i]

" Pray do not try the experiment - - "[0-i] [I]0-i began thoroughly alarmed , but [she]2742-i cut [me]0-i short .

" Disturb [me]2742-i no more , [Allan]82-allan , with the tremors and changes of [your]2740-you uncertain mind , lest [you]2740-you should work more evil than [you]2740-you think , and making [mine]2742-i uncertain also , spoil [my]2742-i skill . Nay , do not try to fly , for already the net has thrown itself about [you]2740-you and [you]2740-you can not stir , who are bound like a little gilded wasp in the spider 's web , or like birds beneath the eyes of basilisks . "[2742-i]

This was true , for [I]0-i found that , strive as [I]0-i would , [I]0-i could not move a limb or even an eyelid . [I]0-i was frozen to that spot and there was nothing for it except to curse [my]0-i folly and say [my]0-i prayers .

All this while [she]2742-i went on talking , but of what [she]2742-i said [I]0-i have not the faintest idea , because [my]0-i remaining wits were absorbed in these much - needed implorations .

Presently , of a sudden , [I]0-i appeared to see [Ayesha]84-ayesha seated in [a temple]2743-a temple , for there were columns about [her]84-ayesha , and behind [her]84-ayesha was an altar on which a fire burned . All round [her]84-ayesha , too , were hooded snakes like to that which [she]84-ayesha wore about [her]84-ayesha middle , fashioned in gold . To these snakes [she]84-ayesha sang and [they]2744-they danced to [her]84-ayesha singing ; yes , with flickering tongues they danced upon their tails ! What the scene signified [I]0-i can not conceive , unless it meant that [this mistress of magic]2745-this mistress of magic was consulting [[her]84-ayesha familiars]2746-her familiars .

Then that vision vanished and [Ayesha]84-ayesha 's voice began to seem very far away and dreamy , also [her]84-ayesha wondrous beauty became visible to [me]0-i through [her]84-ayesha veil , as though [I]0-i had acquired a new sense that overcame the limitations of mortal sight . Even in this extremity [I]0-i reflected it was well that the last thing [I]0-i looked on should be something so glorious . No , not quite the last thing , for out of the corners of [my]0-i eyes [I]0-i saw that [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas from a sitting position had sunk on to [his]125-umslopogaas back and lay , apparently dead , with [his]125-umslopogaas axe still gripped tightly and held above [his]125-umslopogaas head , as though [his]125-umslopogaas arm had been turned to ice .

After this terrible things began to happen to [me]0-i and [I]0-i became aware that [I]0-i was dying . A great wind seemed to catch [me]0-i up and blow [me]0-i to and fro , as a leaf is blown in the eddies of a winter gale . Enormous rushes of darkness flowed over [me]0-i , to be succeeded by vivid bursts of brightness that dazzled like lightning . [I]0-i fell off precipices and at the foot of them was caught by some fearful strength and tossed to the very skies .

From those skies [I]0-i was hurled down again into a kind of whirlpool of inky night , round which [I]0-i spun perpetually , as it seemed for hours and hours . But worst of all was the awful loneliness from which [I]0-i suffered . It seemed to [me]0-i as though there were no other living thing in all [the Universe]57-the universe and never had been and never would be [any other living thing]2747-any other living thing . [I]0-i felt as though [I]0-i were [the Universe rushing solitary through space for ages upon ages in a frantic search for fellowship , and finding none]2748-the universe rushing solitary through space for ages upon ages in a frantic search for fellowship , and finding none .

Then something seemed to grip [my]0-i throat and [I]0-i knew that [I]0-i had died - for [the world]277-the world floated away from beneath [me]0-i .

Now fear and every mortal sensation left [me]0-i , to be replaced by a new and spiritual terror . [I]0-i , or rather [my]0-i disembodied consciousness , seemed to come up for judgment , and the horror of it was that [I]0-i appeared to be [[my]0-i own judge]2750-my own judge . There , a very embodiment of cold justice , [my]0-i Spirit , grown luminous , sat upon a throne and to it , with dread and merciless particularity [I]0-i set out all [my]0-i misdeeds . It was as if some part of [me]0-i remained mortal , for [I]0-i could see [my]0-i two eyes , [my]0-i mouth and [my]0-i hands , but nothing else - and strange enough they looked . From the eyes came tears , from the mouth flowed words and the hands were joined , as though in prayer to that throned and adamantine Spirit which was [ME]0-i .

[It]2751-it was as though [this Spirit]2752-this spirit were asking how [my]0-i body had served [its]2752-this spirit purposes and advanced its mighty ends , and in reply - oh ! what a miserable tale [I]0-i had to tell . Fault upon fault , weakness upon weakness , sin upon sin ; never before did [I]0-i understand how black was [my]0-i record . [I]0-i tried to relieve the picture with some incidents of attempted good , but that [Spirit]230-the good spirit would not hearken . [It]230-the good spirit seemed to say that [it]230-the good spirit had gathered up the good and knew it all . It was of the evil that [it]230-the good spirit would learn , not of the good that had bettered it , but of the evil by which it had been harmed .

Hearing this there rose up in [my]0-i consciousness some memory of what [Ayesha]84-ayesha had said ; namely , that the body lived within the temple of the spirit which is oft defied , and not the spirit in the body .

The story was told and [I]0-i hearkened for the judgment , [my]0-i own judgment on [myself]0-i , which [I]0-i knew would be accepted without question and registered for good or ill . But none came , since ere the balance sank this way or that , ere it could be uttered , [I]0-i was swept afar .

Through Infinity [I]0-i was swept , and as [I]0-i fled faster than the light , the meaning of what [I]0-i had seen came home to [me]0-i . [I]0-i knew , or seemed to know for the first time , that at [the last man]2753-the last man must answer to [himself]2753-the last man , or perhaps to a divine principle within [himself]2753-the last man , that out of [his]2753-the last man own free - will , through long æons and by a million steps , [he]2753-the last man climbs or sinks to the heights or depths dormant in [his]2753-the last man nature ; that from what [he]2753-the last man was , springs what [he]2753-the last man is , and what [he]2753-the last man is , engenders what [he]2753-the last man shall be for ever and aye .

Now [I]0-i envisaged Immortality and splendid and awful was its face . [It]2754-it clasped [me]0-i to its breast and in the vast circle of its arms [I]0-i was up - borne , [I]0-i who knew [myself]0-i to be without beginning and without end , and [yet of the past and of the future]2755-yet of the past and of the future knew nothing , save that these were full of mysteries .

As [I]0-i went [I]0-i encountered [others]279-others , or overtook [them]279-others , making the same journey . [Robertson]159-inez swept past [me]0-i , and spoke , but in a tongue [I]0-i could not understand . [I]0-i noted that the madness had left [his]2757-his eyes and that [his]2757-his fine - cut features were calm and spiritual . [The other wanderers]2758-the other wanderers [I]0-i did not know .

[I]0-i came to [a region of blinding light]2759-a region of blinding light ; the thought rose in [me]0-i that [I]0-i must have reached the sun , or a sun , though [I]0-i felt no heat . [I]0-i stood in [a lovely , shining valley about which burned mountains of fire]2760-a lovely , shining valley about which burned mountains of fire . There were huge trees in [that valley]1292-that valley , but they glowed like gold and their flowers and fruit were as though they had been fashioned of many - coloured flames .

[The place]328-the place was glorious beyond compare , but very strange to [me]0-i and not to be described . [I]0-i sat [me]0-i down upon a boulder which burned like a ruby , whether with heat or colour [I]0-i do not know , by the edge of a stream that flowed with what looked like fire and made a lovely music . [I]0-i stooped down and drank of this water of flames and the scent and the taste of it were as those of the costliest wine .

There , beneath the spreading limbs of a fire - tree [I]0-i sat , and examined the strange flowers that grew around , coloured like rich jewels and perfumed above imagining . There were birds also which might have been feathered with sapphires , rubies and amethysts , and [their]2763-their song was so sweet that [I]0-i could have wept to hear it . The scene was wonderful and filled [me]0-i with exaltation , for [I]0-i thought of [the land where it is promised that there shall be no more night]2764-the land where it is promised that there shall be no more night .

[People]3197-people began to appear ; [men]3228-men , [women]3186-women , and even [children]3412-children , though whence [they]3197-people came [I]0-i could not see . [They]3197-people did not fly and [they]3197-people did not walk ; [they]3197-people seemed to drift towards [me]0-i , as unguided boats drift upon the tide . One and all [they]3197-people were very beautiful , but [their]3197-people beauty was not human although [their]3197-people shapes and faces resembled those of [men]3228-men and [women]3186-women made glorious . [None]540-none were old , and except [the children]3808-the children , none seemed very young ; it was as though [they]3808-the children had grown backwards or forwards to middle life and rested there at [their]3808-the children very best .

Now came the marvel ; [all these uncounted people]2773-all these uncounted people were known to [me]0-i , though so far as [my]0-i knowledge went [I]0-i had never set eyes on most of [them]2773-all these uncounted people before . Yet [I]0-i was aware that in some forgotten life or epoch [I]0-i had been intimate with [every one of [them]2773-all these uncounted people]2276-every one of them ; also that it was the fact of [my]0-i presence and the call of [my]0-i sub - conscious mind which drew [them]2773-all these uncounted people to this spot . Yet that presence and that call were not visible or audible to [them]2773-all these uncounted people , who , [I]0-i suppose , flowed down some stream of sympathy , why or whither [they]2773-all these uncounted people did not know . Had [I]0-i been as [they]2773-all these uncounted people were perchance [they]2773-all these uncounted people would have seen [me]0-i , as it was [they]2773-all these uncounted people saw nothing and [I]0-i could not speak and tell [them]2773-all these uncounted people of [my]0-i presence .

[Some of this multitude]2775-some of this multitude , however , [I]0-i knew well enough even when [they]2775-some of this multitude had departed years and years ago . But about these [I]0-i noted this , that every one of [them]2773-all these uncounted people was [a man]3551-a man or [a woman]3331-a woman or [a child]1173-a child for whom [I]0-i had felt love or sympathy or friendship . [Not one]2779-not one was [a person whom [I]0-i had disliked or whom [I]0-i had no wish to see again]2780-a person whom i had disliked or whom i had no wish to see again . If [they]2773-all these uncounted people spoke at all [I]0-i could not hear - or read - [their]2773-all these uncounted people speech , yet to a certain extent [I]0-i could hear [their]2773-all these uncounted people thoughts .

Many of these were beyond the power of [my]0-i appreciation on subjects which [I]0-i had no knowledge , or that were too high for [me]0-i , but some were of quite simple things such as concern [us]2781-us upon [the earth]285-the earth , such as of friendship , or learning , or journeys made or to be made , or art , or literature , or the wonders of Nature , or of the fruits of [the earth]285-the earth , as [they]2773-all these uncounted people knew them in [this region]2784-this region .

This [I]0-i noted too , that each separate thought seemed to be hallowed and enclosed in an atmosphere of prayer or heavenly aspiration , as a seed is enclosed in the heart of a flower , or a fruit in its odorous rind , and that this prayer or aspiration presently appeared to bear the thought away , whither [I]0-i knew not . Moreover , all these thoughts , even of the humblest things , were beauteous and spiritual , nothing cruel or impure or even coarse was to be found among them : they radiated charity , purity and goodness .

Among [them]2773-all these uncounted people [I]0-i perceived were none that had to do with [[our]2781-us earth]2785-our earth ; this and its affairs seemed to be left far behind [these thinkers]2786-these thinkers , a truth that chilled [my]0-i soul was alien to [their]2773-all these uncounted people company . Worse still , so far as [I]0-i could discover , although [I]0-i knew that [all these bright ones]2787-all these bright ones had been near to [me]0-i at some hour in the measurements of time and space , not one of [their]2787-all these bright ones musings dwelt upon [me]0-i or on aught with which [I]0-i had to do .

Between [me]0-i and [them]2787-all these bright ones there was a great gulf fixed and a high wall built .

Oh , look ! One came shining like a star , and from far away came [another with dove - like eyes and beautiful exceedingly]2788-another with dove - like eyes and beautiful exceedingly , and with [this last]2789-this last [a maiden]2790-a maiden , whose eyes were as [hers]2790-a maiden who [my]0-i own heart told [me]0-i was [[her]2790-a maiden mother]3706-her mother .

Well , [I]0-i knew [them]2787-all these bright ones both ; [they]2787-all these bright ones were those whom [I]0-i had come to seek , [the women who had been mind upon [the earth]285-the earth]2792-the women who had been mind upon the earth , and at the sight of [them]2787-all these bright ones [my]0-i spirit thrilled . Surely [they]2787-all these bright ones would discover [me]0-i . Surely at least [they]2787-all these bright ones would speak of [me]0-i and feel [my]0-i presence .

But , although [they]2787-all these bright ones stayed within a pace or two of where [I]0-i rested , alas ! it was not so . [They]2787-all these bright ones seemed to kiss and to exchange swift thoughts about many things , high things of which [I]0-i will not write , and common things ; yes , even of the shining robes [they]2787-all these bright ones wore , but never a one of [me]0-i ! [I]0-i strove to rise and go to [them]2787-all these bright ones , but could not ; [I]0-i strove to speak and could not ; [I]0-i strove to throw out [my]0-i thought to [them]2787-all these bright ones and could not ; it fell back upon [my]0-i head like a stone hurled heavenward .

[They]2787-all these bright ones were remote from [me]0-i , utterly apart . [I]0-i wept tears of bitterness that [I]0-i should be so near and yet so far ; a dull and jealous rage burned in [my]0-i heart , and this [they]2787-all these bright ones did seem to feel , or so [I]0-i fancied ; at any rate , apparently by mutual consent , [they]2787-all these bright ones moved further from [me]0-i as though something pained [them]2787-all these bright ones . Yes , [my]0-i love could not reach [their]2787-all these bright ones perfected natures , but [my]0-i anger hurt [them]2787-all these bright ones .

As [I]0-i sat chewing this root of bitterness , [a man]3551-a man appeared , [a very noble man]2795-a very noble man , in whom [I]0-i recognised [[my]0-i father]3272-my father grown younger and happier - looking , but still [[my]0-i father]3272-my father , with whom came [others]279-others , [men]3228-men and [women whom [I]0-i knew to be [[my]0-i brothers and sisters who had died in youth far away in [Oxfordshire]68-oxfordshire]2801-my brothers and sisters who had died in youth far away in oxfordshire]2800-women whom i knew to be my brothers and sisters who had died in youth far away in oxfordshire . Joy leapt up in [me]0-i , for [I]0-i thought - these will surely know [me]0-i and give [me]0-i welcome , since , though here sex has lost its power , blood must still call to blood .

But it was not so . [They]2787-all these bright ones spoke , or interchanged [their]2787-all these bright ones thoughts , but not one of [me]0-i . [I]0-i read something that passed from [[my]0-i father]3272-my father to [them]2787-all these bright ones . It was a speculation as to what had brought [them]2787-all these bright ones all together there , and read also the answer hazarded , that perhaps it might be to give welcome to [some unknown who was drawing near from below and would feel lonely and unfriended]2803-some unknown who was drawing near from below and would feel lonely and unfriended . Thereon [[my]0-i father]3272-my father replied that [he]3272-my father did not see or feel [this wanderer]2805-this wanderer , and thought that it could not be so , since it was [his]3272-my father mission to greet such on [their]2787-all these bright ones coming .

Then in an instant all were gone and [that lovely , glowing plain]2806-that lovely , glowing plain was empty , save for [myself]0-i seated on the ruby - like stone , weeping tears of blood and shame and loss within [my]0-i soul .

So [I]0-i sat a long while , till presently [I]0-i was aware of [a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes . Straight [she]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes came towards [me]0-i , like a thrown spear , and [I]0-i knew [her]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes for [a certain royal and savage woman who [on earth]2808-on earth was named [Mameena]107-mameena , or " Wind - that - wailed]5073-a certain royal and savage woman who on earth was named mameena , or " wind - that - wailed . "[2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes] Moreover [she]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes divined [me]0-i , though see [me]0-i [she]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes could not .

" Art there , [Watcher - in - the - Night]4122-watcher - in - the - night , watching in the light ? "[2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes] [she]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes said or thought , [I]0-i know not which , but the words came to [me]0-i in the Zulu tongue .

" Aye , "[2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes] [she]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes went on , " [I]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes know that [thou]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes art there ; from ten thousand leagues away [I]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes felt [thy]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes presence and broke from [my]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes own place to welcome [thee]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes , though [I]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes must pay for it with burning chains and bondage . How did those welcome [thee]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes whom [thou]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes camest out to seek ? Did [they]2809-they clasp [thee]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes in [their]2809-they arms and press [their]2809-they kisses on [thy]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes brow ? Or did [they]2809-they shrink away from [thee]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes because the smell of earth was on [thy]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes hands and lips ? "[2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes]

[I]0-i seemed to answer that [they]2809-they did not appear to know that [I]0-i was there .

" Aye , [they]2809-they did not know because [their]2809-they love is not enough , because [they]2809-they have grown too fine for love . But [I]2809-they , [the sinner]5075-the sinner , [I]2809-they knew well , and here am [I]2809-they ready to suffer all for [thee]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes and to give [thee]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes place within this stormy heart of [mine]2809-they . Forget [them]2809-they , then , and come to rule with [me]2809-they who still am queen in [[my]2809-they own house]5076-my own house that [thou]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes shalt share . There [we]5077-we will live royally and when [our]5077-we hour comes , at least [we]5077-we shall have had [our]5077-we day . "[2809-they]

Now before [I]0-i could reply , some power seemed to seize [this splendid creature]2810-this splendid creature and whirl [her]2810-this splendid creature thence so that [she]2810-this splendid creature departed , flashing these words from [her]2810-this splendid creature mind to [mine]0-i ,

" For a little while farewell , but remember always that [Mameena]107-mameena , the Wailing Wind , being still as [a sinful woman]5078-a sinful woman in [a woman]3331-a woman 's love and of [the earth]285-the earth , earthy , found [thee]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes , whom [all the rest]5081-all the rest forgot . [O Watcher - in - the - Night]5082-o watcher - in - the - night , watch in the night for [me]2810-this splendid creature , for there [thou]2807-a new presence , a presence dusky and splendid and arrayed in rich barbaric robes shalt find [me]2810-this splendid creature , [the Child of Storm]5083-the child of storm , again , and yet again . "[2810-this splendid creature]

[She]2810-this splendid creature was gone and once more [I]0-i sat in utter solitude upon that ruby stone , staring at the jewelled flowers and the glorious flaming trees and [the lambent waters of [the brook]2812-the brook]2811-the lambent waters of the brook . What was the meaning of it all , [I]0-i wondered , and why was [I]0-i deserted by [everyone]3308-everyone save [a single savage woman]2814-a single savage woman , and why had [she]2810-this splendid creature a power to find [me]0-i which was denied to [all the rest]5081-all the rest ? Well , [she]2810-this splendid creature had given [me]0-i an answer , because [she]2810-this splendid creature was " as [a sinful woman with [a woman]3331-a woman]5084-a sinful woman with a woman 's love and of [the earth]285-the earth , earthy , "[2810-this splendid creature] while with the rest it was otherwise . Oh ! this was clear , that in [the heavens]2686-the heavens [man]287-man has [no friend among the heavenly]2818-no friend among the heavenly , save perhaps [the greatest Friend of all Who understands both flesh and spirit]2819-the greatest friend of all who understands both flesh and spirit .

Thus [I]0-i mused in [this burning world which was still so beautiful]2820-this burning world which was still so beautiful , [this alien world into which [I]0-i had thrust [myself]0-i unwanted and unsought]2821-this alien world into which i had thrust myself unwanted and unsought . And while [I]0-i mused this happened . [The fiery waters of [the stream]1501-the stream]2822-the fiery waters of the stream were disturbed by something and looking up [I]0-i saw the cause .

A dog had plunged into them and was swimming towards [me]0-i . At a glance [I]0-i knew that dog on which [my]0-i eyes had not fallen for decades . It was [a mongrel]2824-a mongrel , half spaniel and half bull - terrier , which for years had been the dear friend of [my]0-i youth and died at last on the horns of a wounded wildebeeste that attacked [me]0-i when [I]0-i had fallen from [my]0-i horse upon [the veld]1057-the veld . Boldly it tackled the maddened buck , thus giving [me]0-i time to scramble to [my]0-i rifle and shoot it , but not before the poor hound had yielded [its]2824-a mongrel life for [mine]0-i , since presently [it]2824-a mongrel died disembowelled , but licking [my]0-i hand and forgetful of [its]2824-a mongrel agonies . This dog , [Smut]253-smut by name , it was that swam or seemed to swim [the brook of fire]2826-the brook of fire . [It]2824-a mongrel scrambled to [the hither shore]2827-the hither shore , it nosed the earth and ran to the ruby stone and stared about it whining and sniffing .

At last it seemed to see or feel [me]0-i , for it stood upon its hind legs and licked [my]0-i face , yelping with mad joy , as [I]0-i could see though [I]0-i heard nothing . Now [I]0-i wept in earnest and bent down to hug and kiss the faithful beast , but this [I]0-i could not do , since like [myself]0-i it was only shadow .

Then suddenly all dissolved in a cataract of many - coloured flames and [I]0-i fell down into an infinite gulf of blackness .

Surely [Ayesha]84-ayesha was talking to [me]0-i ! What did [she]84-ayesha say ? What did [she]84-ayesha say ? [I]0-i could not catch [her]84-ayesha words , but [I]0-i caught [her]84-ayesha laughter and knew that after [her]84-ayesha fashion [she]84-ayesha was making a mock of [me]0-i . [My]0-i eyelids were dragged down as though with heavy sleep ; it was difficult to lift them . At last they were open and [I]0-i saw [Ayesha]84-ayesha seated on [her]84-ayesha couch before [me]0-i and - this [I]0-i noted at once - with [her]84-ayesha lovely face unveiled . [I]0-i looked about [me]0-i , seeking Umslopogaas and [Hans]87-hans . But [they]2828-they were gone as [I]0-i guessed [they]2828-they must be , since otherwise [Ayesha]84-ayesha would not have been unveiled . [We]2829-we were quite alone . [She]84-ayesha was addressing [me]0-i and in a new fashion , since now [she]84-ayesha had abandoned the formal " [you]0-i "[84-ayesha] and was using the more impressive and intimate " thou , "[84-ayesha] much as is the manner of [the French]2830-the french .

" [Thou]84-ayesha hast made [thy]84-ayesha journey , [Allan]82-allan , "[84-ayesha] [she]84-ayesha said , " and what [thou]84-ayesha hast seen [there]3196-there [thou]84-ayesha shalt tell [me]84-ayesha presently . Yet from [thy]84-ayesha mien [I]84-ayesha gather this - that [thou]84-ayesha art glad to look upon flesh and blood again and , after the company of spirits , to find that of [mortal woman]5088-mortal woman . Come then and sit beside [me]84-ayesha and tell [thy]84-ayesha tale . "[84-ayesha]

" Where are [the others]3164-the others ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked as [I]0-i rose slowly to obey , for [my]0-i head swam and [my]0-i feet seemed feeble .

" Gone , [Allan]82-allan , who as [I]2831-her think have had enough of ghosts , which is perhaps [thy]84-ayesha case also . Come , drink this and be [a man]3551-a man once more . Drink it to [me]2831-her whose skill and power have brought [thee]84-ayesha safe from lands that human feet were never meant to tread , "[2831-her] and taking a strange - shaped cup from a stool that stood beside [her]2831-her , [she]2831-her offered it to [me]0-i .

[I]0-i drank to the last drop , neither knowing nor caring whether it were wine or poison , since [my]0-i heart seemed desperate at its failure and [my]0-i spirit crushed beneath the weight of its great betrayal . [I]0-i suppose it was the former , for the contents of that cup ran through [my]0-i veins like fire and gave [me]0-i back [my]0-i courage and the joy of life .

[I]0-i stepped to the dais and sat [me]0-i down upon the couch , leaning against [its]2832-its rounded end so that [I]0-i was almost face to face with [Ayesha]84-ayesha who had turned towards [me]0-i , and [thence]2833-thence could study [her]84-ayesha unveiled loveliness . For a while [she]2831-her said nothing , only eyed [me]0-i up and down and smiled and smiled , as though [she]2831-her were waiting for that wine to do its work with [me]0-i .

" Now that [thou]5091-thou art [a man]3551-a man again , [Allan]82-allan , tell [me]2831-her what [thou]5091-thou didst see when [thou]5091-thou wast more - or less - than [man]287-man . "[2831-her]

So [I]0-i told [her]2831-her all , for some power within [her]2831-her seemed to draw the truth out of [me]0-i . Nor did the tale appear to cause [her]2831-her much surprise .

" There is truth in [thy]5091-thou dream , "[2831-her] [she]2831-her said when [I]0-i had finished ; " a lesson also . "[2831-her]

" Then it was all a dream ? "[0-i] [I]0-i interrupted .

" Is not everything a dream , even life itself , [Allan]82-allan ? If so , what can this be that [thou]5091-thou hast seen , but a dream within a dream , and itself containing other dreams , as in the old days the ball fashioned by [the eastern workers of ivory]5094-the eastern workers of ivory would oft be found to contain another ball , and this yet another and another and another , till at the inmost might be found a bead of gold , or perchance a jewel , which was the prize of [him]5095-him who could draw out ball from ball and leave them all unbroken . That search was difficult and rarely was the jewel come by , if at all , so that [some]4574-some said there was none , save in [the maker]5097-the maker 's mind . Yes , [I]2831-her have seen [a man]3551-a man go crazed with seeking and die with the mystery unsolved . How much harder , then , is it to come at the diamond of Truth which lies at the core of all [our]5099-our nest of dreams and without which to rest upon they could not be fashioned to seem realities ? "[2831-her]

" But was it really a dream , and if so , what were the truth and the lesson ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , determined not to allow [her]2831-her to bemuse or escape [me]0-i with [her]2831-her metaphysical talk and illustrations .

" The first question has been answered , [Allan]82-allan , as well as [I]2831-her can answer , who am not the architect of this great globe of dreams , and as yet can not clearly see the ineffable gem within , whose prisoned rays illuminate their substance , though so dimly that only [those with the insight of a god]5100-those with the insight of a god can catch [their]5100-those with the insight of a god glamour in the night of thought , since to most they are dark as glow - flies in the glare of noon . "[2831-her]

" Then what are the truth and the lesson ? "[0-i] [I]0-i persisted , perceiving that it was hopeless to extract from [her]2831-her an opinion as to the real nature of [my]0-i experiences and that [I]0-i must content [myself]0-i with [her]2831-her deductions from them .

" [Thou]5101-thou tellest [me]2831-her , [Allan]82-allan , that in [thy]5101-thou dream or vision [thou]5101-thou didst seem to appear before [thyself]5101-thou seated on a throne and in that self to find [[thy]5101-thou judge]5102-thy judge . That is the Truth whereof [I]2831-her spoke , though how it found its way through the black and ignorant shell of one whose wit is so small , is more than [I]2831-her can guess , since [I]2831-her believed that it was revealed to [me]2831-her alone . "[2831-her]

Now [I]0-i , [Allan]82-allan , thought to [myself]0-i that [I]0-i began to see the origin of all these fantasies and that for once [Ayesha]84-ayesha had made a slip . If [she]84-ayesha had a theory and [I]0-i developed that same theory in a hypnotic condition , it was not difficult to guess its fount . However , [I]0-i kept [my]0-i mouth shut , and luckily for once [she]84-ayesha did not seem to read [my]0-i mind , perhaps because [she]84-ayesha was too much occupied in spinning [her]84-ayesha smooth web of entangling words .

" [All men]4434-all men worship [[their]4434-all men own god]5104-their own god , "[84-ayesha] [she]84-ayesha went on , " and yet seem not to know that [this god]4469-this god dwells within [them]4434-all men and that of [him]4469-this god [they]4434-all men are a part . There [he]4469-this god dwells and there [they]4434-all men mould [him]4469-this god to [their]4434-all men own fashion , as [the potter]5106-the potter moulds [his]5106-the potter clay , though whatever the shape [he]4469-this god seems to take beneath [their]4434-all men fingers , still [he]4469-this god remains [the god]5107-the god infinite and unalterable . Still [he]4469-this god is [the Seeker]5108-the seeker and the Sought , the Prayer and its Fulfilment , the Love and the Hate , the Virtue and the Vice , since all these qualities the alchemy of [his]4469-this god spirit turns into an ultimate and eternal Good . For [the god]5107-the god is in all things and all things are in the god , whom [men]3228-men clothe with such diverse garments and whose countenance [they]3228-men hide beneath so many masks .[84-ayesha]

" In the tree flows the sap , yet what knows the great tree it nurtures of the sap ? In [the world]277-the world 's womb burns the fire that gives life , yet what of the fire knows the glorious earth it conceived and will destroy ; in the heavens the great globes swing through space and rest not , yet what know [they]4434-all men of the Strength that sent [them]4434-all men spinning and in a time to come will stay [their]4434-all men mighty motions , or turn [them]4434-all men to another course ? Therefore of everything [this all - present god]5112-this all - present god is [judge]5113-judge , or rather , [not one but many judges]5114-not one but many judges , since of [each living creature]5115-each living creature [he]4469-this god makes its own magistrate to deal out justice according to that creature 's law which in the beginning [the god]5107-the god established for [it]5115-each living creature and decreed . Thus in the breast of [everyone]3308-everyone there is a rule and by that rule , at work through a countless chain of lives , in the end [he]4469-this god shall be lifted up to Heaven , or bound about and cast down to Hell and death . "[84-ayesha]

" [You]2834-you mean a conscience , "[0-i] [I]0-i suggested rather feebly , for [her]2834-you thoughts and images overpowered [me]0-i .

" Aye , a conscience , if [thou]5118-thou wilt , and canst only understand that term , though it fits [my]84-ayesha theme but ill . This is [my]84-ayesha meaning , that consciences , as [thou]5118-thou namest [them]5119-them , are many . [I]84-ayesha have one ; [thou]5118-thou , [Allan]82-allan , hast another ; [that black Axe - bearer]5120-that black axe - bearer has a third ; [the little yellow man]3990-the little yellow man a fourth , and so on through the tale of living things . For [even a dog such as [thou]5118-thou sawest]5122-even a dog such as thou sawest has a conscience and - like [thyself]5118-thou or [I]84-ayesha - must in the end be [its own judge]5123-its own judge , because of the spark that comes to it from above , the same spark which in [me]84-ayesha burns as a great fire , and in [thee]5118-thou as a smouldering ember of green wood . "[84-ayesha]

" When [you]2835-thou sit in judgment on [yourself]2835-thou in a day to come , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , "[0-i] [I]0-i could not help interpolating , " [I]0-i trust that [you]2835-thou will remember that humility did not shine among [your]2835-thou virtues . "[0-i]

[She]2835-thou smiled in [her]2835-thou vivid way - only twice or thrice did [I]0-i see [her]2835-thou smile thus and then it was like a flash of summer lightning illumining a clouded sky , since for the most part [her]2835-thou face was grave and even sombre .

" Well answered , "[2835-thou] [she]2835-thou said . " Goad [the patient]5124-the patient ox enough and even it will grow fierce and paw the ground .[2835-thou]

" Humility ! What have [I]2835-thou to do with it , [O Allan]82-allan ? Let humility be the part of [the humble - souled and lowly]5125-the humble - souled and lowly , but for those who reign as [I]2835-thou do , and [they]5125-the humble - souled and lowly are few indeed , let there be pride and the glory [they]5125-the humble - souled and lowly have earned . Now [I]2835-thou have told [thee]2835-thou of the Truth [thou]2835-thou sawest in [thy]2835-thou vision and wouldst [thou]2835-thou hear the Lesson ? "[2835-thou]

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , ' since [I]0-i may as well be done with it at once , and doubtless it will be good for [me]0-i . "[0-i]

" The Lesson , [Allan]82-allan , is one which [thou]2835-thou preachest - humility . [Vain man]5126-vain man and foolish as [thou]2835-thou art , [thou]2835-thou didst desire to travel [the Underworld]69-the underworld in search of [certain ones who once were all in all to [thee]2835-thou]5127-certain ones who once were all in all to thee - nay , not all in all since of [them]5127-certain ones who once were all in all to thee there were two or more - but at least much . Thus [thou]2835-thou wouldst do because , as [thou]2835-thou saidest , [thou]2835-thou didst seek to know whether [they]5127-certain ones who once were all in all to thee still lived on beyond the gates of [Blackness]70-blackness . Yes , [thou]2835-thou saidest this , but what [thou]2835-thou didst hope to learn in truth was whether [they]5127-certain ones who once were all in all to thee lived on in [thee]2835-thou and for [thee]2835-thou only . For [thou]2835-thou , [thou]2835-thou in [thy]2835-thou vanity , didst picture [these departed souls]5128-these departed souls as doing naught in [that Heaven [they]5128-these departed souls had won]5129-that heaven they had won , save think of [thee]2835-thou still burrowing on [the earth]285-the earth , and , at times lightening [thy]2835-thou labours with kisses from other lips than [theirs]5128-these departed souls . "[0-i]

" Never ! "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed indignantly . " Never ! it is not true . "[0-i]

" Then [I]0-i pray pardon , [Allan]82-allan , who only judged of [thee]2835-thou by [others that were as]5131-others that were as [men are made , and being such , not to be blamed]5132-men are made , and being such , not to be blamed if perchance from time to time , [they]5127-certain ones who once were all in all to thee turned to look on [women]3186-women , who alas ! were as [they]3186-women are made . So at least it was when [I]0-i knew [the world]277-the world , but mayhap since then [its]277-the world richest wine has turned to water , whereby [I]0-i hope it has been bettered . At the least this was [thy]2835-thou thought , that [those women who had been thine for an hour , through all eternity]5135-those women who had been thine for an hour , through all eternity could dream of naught else save [thy]2835-thou perfections , and hope for naught else than to see [thee]2835-thou at [their]5135-those women who had been thine for an hour , through all eternity sides through that eternity , or such part of [thee]2835-thou as [thou]2835-thou couldst spare to each of [them]5135-those women who had been thine for an hour , through all eternity . For [thou]2835-thou didst forget that where [they]5135-those women who had been thine for an hour , through all eternity have gone there may be others even more peerless than [thou]2835-thou art and more fit to hold [a woman]3331-a woman 's love , which as [we]5137-we know on [earth]346-earth was ever changeful , and perhaps may so remain where it is certain that new lights must shine and new desires beckon . Dost understand [me]0-i , [Allan]82-allan ? "[0-i]

" [I]0-i think so , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered with a groan . " [I]0-i understand [you]82-allan to mean that worldly impressions soon wear out and that [people who have departed to other spheres]5139-people who have departed to other spheres may there form new ties and forget the old . "[0-i]

" Yes , [Allan]82-allan , as do [those who remain upon [this earth]5141-this earth , whence [these others]5142-these others have departed]5140-those who remain upon this earth , whence these others have departed . Do [men]3228-men and [women]3186-women still re - marry in [the world]277-the world , [Allan]82-allan , as in [my]0-i day [they]5146-them were wo nt to do ? "[0-i]

" Of course - it is allowed . "[0-i]

" As many other things , or perchance this same thing , may be allowed elsewhere , for when there are so many habitations from which to choose , why should [we]5147-we always dwell in one of [them]5146-them , however strait [the house]722-the house or poor the prospect ? "[0-i]

Now understanding that [I]0-i was symbolised by [the ' strait house]2836-the ' strait house " and the "[0-i] poor prospect " [I]0-i should have grown angry , had not a certain sense of humour come to [my]0-i rescue , who remembered that after all [Ayesha]84-ayesha 's satire was profoundly true . Why , beyond [the earth]285-the earth , should [anyone]281-anyone desire to remain unalterably tied to and inextricably wrapped up in such a personality as [my]0-i own , especially if [others of superior texture]5151-others of superior texture abounded about [them]5146-them ? Now that [I]0-i came to think of it , the thing was absurd and not to be the least expected in the midst of a thousand new and vivid interests . [I]0-i had met with one more disillusionment , that was all .[0-i]

" Dost understand , [Allan]82-allan , "[84-ayesha] went on [Ayesha]84-ayesha , who evidently was determined that [I]0-i should drink this cup to the last drop , " that [these dwellers in the sun]5152-these dwellers in the sun , or [the far planet where [thou]5154-thee hast been according to [thy]5154-thee tale]5153-the far planet where thou hast been according to thy tale , saw [thee]5154-thee not and knew naught of [thee]5154-thee ? It may chance therefore that at this time [thou]5154-thee wast not in [their]5152-these dwellers in the sun minds which at others dream of [thee]5154-thee continually . Or it may chance that [they]5152-these dwellers in the sun never dream of [thee]5154-thee at all , having quite forgotten [thee]5154-thee , as the weaned cub forgets [its mother]5155-its mother . "[84-ayesha]

" At least there was one who seemed to remember , "[0-i] [I]0-i exclaimed , for [her]84-ayesha poisoned mocking stung the words out of [me]0-i , " [one woman]4118-one woman and - a dog . "[0-i]

" Aye , [the savage , who being [[Nature]82-allan 's child]5158-nature 's child]5157-the savage , who being nature 's child , [a sinner that departed hence by [her]84-ayesha own act]5159-a sinner that departed hence by her own act "[84-ayesha] how [Ayesha]84-ayesha knew this [I]0-i can not say , [I]0-i never told [her]84-ayesha , " has not yet put on perfection and therefore still remembers [him]5157-the savage , who being nature 's child whose kiss was last upon [her]84-ayesha lips . But surely , [Allan]82-allan , it is not [thy]82-allan desire to pass from the gentle , ordered claspings of those white souls for the tumultuous arms of [such a one as this]5160-such a one as this . Still , let that be , for who knows what [men]3228-men will or will not do in jealousy and disappointed love ? And the dog , it remembered also and even sought [thee]82-allan out , since dogs are more faithful and single - hearted than is [mankind]5162-mankind . There at least [thou]82-allan hast [thy]82-allan lesson , namely to grow more humble and never to think again that [thou]82-allan holdest all [a woman]3331-a woman 's soul for aye , because once [she]84-ayesha was kind to [thee]82-allan for a little while on [earth]346-earth . "[0-i]

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , jumping up in a rage , " as [you]84-ayesha say , [I]0-i have [my]0-i lesson , and more of it than [I]0-i want . So by [your]84-ayesha leave , [I]0-i will now bid [you]84-ayesha farewell , hoping that when it comes to be [your]84-ayesha turn to learn this lesson , or [a worse , Ayesha]5165-a worse , ayesha , as [I]0-i am sure it will one day , for something tells [me]0-i so , [you]84-ayesha may enjoy it more than [I]0-i have done . "[0-i]

CHAPTER XXII

[AYESHA]84-ayesha 'S FAREWELL

Thus [I]0-i spoke whose nerves were on edge after all that [I]0-i had seen or , as even then [I]0-i suspected , seemed to see . For how could [I]0-i believe that these visions of [mine]0-i had any higher origin than [Ayesha]84-ayesha 's rather malicious imagination ? Already [I]0-i had formed [my]0-i theory .

It was that [she]84-ayesha must be [a hypnotist of power , who , after [she]84-ayesha had put a spell upon [[her]84-ayesha subject]2838-her subject , could project into [his]2839-his mind such fancies as [she]84-ayesha chose together with a selection of [her]84-ayesha own theories]2837-a hypnotist of power , who , after she had put a spell upon her subject , could project into his mind such fancies as she chose together with a selection of her own theories . Only two points remained obscure . The first was - how did [she]84-ayesha get the necessary information about the private affairs of [a humble individual like [myself]0-i]2840-a humble individual like myself , for these were not known even to [Zikali]104-zikali with whom [she]84-ayesha seemed to be in some kind of correspondence , or to [Hans]87-hans , at any rate in such completeness ?

[I]0-i could but presume that in some mysterious way [she]84-ayesha drew them from , or rather excited them in [my]0-i own mind and memory , so that [I]0-i seemed to see those with whom once [I]0-i had been intimate , with modifications and in surroundings that [her]84-ayesha intelligence had carefully prepared . It would not be difficult for a mind like [hers]84-ayesha familiar , as [I]0-i gathered it was , with the ancient lore of [the Greeks]254-the greeks and [the Egyptians]2841-the egyptians , to create a kind of Hades and , by way of difference , to change it from one of shadow to one of intense illumination , and into it to plunge the consciousness of [him]2839-his upon whom [she]84-ayesha had laid [her]84-ayesha charm of sleep . [I]0-i had seen nothing and heard nothing that [she]84-ayesha might not thus have moulded , always given that [she]84-ayesha had access to the needful clay of facts which [I]0-i alone could furnish .

Granting this hypothesis , the second point was - what might be the object of [her]84-ayesha elaborate and most bitter jest ? Well , [I]0-i thought that [I]0-i could guess . First , [she]84-ayesha wished to show [her]84-ayesha power , or rather to make [me]0-i believe that [she]84-ayesha had power of a very unusual sort . Secondly , [she]84-ayesha owed [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [myself]0-i a debt for [our]2842-our services in the war with [Rezu]88-rezu which [we]2842-our had been told would be repaid in this way . Thirdly , [I]0-i had offended [her]84-ayesha in some fashion and [she]84-ayesha took [her]84-ayesha opportunity of settling the score . Also there was a fourth possibility - that really [she]84-ayesha considered [herself]84-ayesha [a moral instructress]2843-a moral instructress and desired , as [she]84-ayesha said , to teach [me]0-i a lesson by showing how futile were human hopes and vanities in respect to [the departed]375-the departed and [their]375-the departed affections .

Now [I]0-i do not pretend that all this analysis of [Ayesha]84-ayesha 's motives occurred to [me]0-i at the moment of [my]0-i interview with [her]84-ayesha ; indeed , [I]0-i only completed it later after much careful thought , when [I]0-i found it sound and good . At that time , although [I]0-i had inklings , [I]0-i was too bewildered to form a just judgment .

Further , [I]0-i was too angry and it was from this bow of [my]0-i anger that [I]0-i loosed a shaft at a venture as to some lesson which awaited [her]84-ayesha . Perhaps certain words spoken by [the dying Rezu]2845-the dying rezu had shaped that shaft . Or perhaps some shadow of [her]84-ayesha advancing fate fell upon [me]0-i .

The success of the shot , however , was remarkable . Evidently it pierced the joints of [her]84-ayesha harness , and indeed went [home]1249-home to [Ayesha]84-ayesha 's heart . [She]84-ayesha turned pale ; all the peach - bloom hues faded from [her]84-ayesha lovely face , [her]84-ayesha great eyes seemed to lessen and grow dull and [her]84-ayesha cheeks to fall in . Indeed , for a moment [she]84-ayesha looked old , very old , quite [an aged woman]2847-an aged woman . Moreover [she]84-ayesha wept , for [I]0-i saw two big tears drop upon [her]84-ayesha white raiment and [I]0-i was horrified .

" What has happened to [you]84-ayesha ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said , or rather gasped .

" Naught , "[84-ayesha] [she]84-ayesha answered , ' save that [thou]2848-thou hast hurt [me]0-i sore . Dost [thou]2848-thou not know , [Allan]82-allan , that it is cruel to prophesy ill to any , since such words feathered from [Fate]96-fate 's own wing and barbed with venom , fester in the breast and mayhap bring about [their]2849-their own accomplishment . Most cruel of all is it when with [them]2849-their are repaid friendship and gentleness . "[0-i]

[I]0-i reflected to [myself]0-i - yes , friendship of the order that is called candid , and gentleness such as is hid in a cat 's velvet paw , but contented [myself]0-i with asking how it was that [she]84-ayesha who said [she]84-ayesha was so powerful , came to fear anything at all .

" Because as [I]84-ayesha have told [thee]84-ayesha , [Allan]82-allan , there is no armour that can turn the spear of Destiny which , when [I]84-ayesha heard those words of thine , it seemed to [me]84-ayesha , [I]84-ayesha know not why , was directed by [thy]84-ayesha hand . Look now on [Rezu]88-rezu who thought [himself]88-rezu unconquerable and yet was slain by [the black Axe - bearer and whose bones to - night stay the famine of the jackals]5166-the black axe - bearer and whose bones to - night stay the famine of the jackals . Moreover [I]84-ayesha am accursed who sought to steal [its servant]5167-its servant from [Heaven]178-heaven to be [my]84-ayesha love , and how know [I]84-ayesha when and where vengeance will fall at last ? Indeed , it has fallen already on [me]84-ayesha , [who through the long ages amid savages]5168-who through the long ages amid savages must mourn widowed and alone , but not all of it - oh ! [I]84-ayesha think , not all . "[84-ayesha]

Then [she]84-ayesha began to weep in good earnest , and watching [her]84-ayesha , for the first time [I]0-i understood that [this glorious creature who seemed to be so powerful , was after all one of the most miserable of [women and as much a prey to loneliness , every sort of passion and apprehensive fear , as can be any common mortal]2851-women and as much a prey to loneliness , every sort of passion and apprehensive fear , as can be any common mortal]2850-this glorious creature who seemed to be so powerful , was after all one of the most miserable of women and as much a prey to loneliness , every sort of passion and apprehensive fear , as can be any common mortal . If , as [she]84-ayesha said , [she]84-ayesha had found the secret of life , which of course [I]0-i did not believe , at least it was obvious that [she]84-ayesha had lost that of happiness .

[She]84-ayesha sobbed softly and wept and while [she]84-ayesha did so the loveliness , which had left [her]84-ayesha for a little while , returned to [her]84-ayesha like light to a grey and darkened sky . Oh , how beautiful [she]84-ayesha seemed with the abundant locks in disorder over [her]84-ayesha tear - stained face , how beautiful beyond imagining ! [My]0-i heart melted as [I]0-i studied [her]84-ayesha ; [I]0-i could think of nothing else except [her]84-ayesha surpassing charm and glory .

" [I]0-i pray [you]84-ayesha , do not weep , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " it hurts [me]0-i and indeed [I]0-i am sorry if [I]0-i said anything to give [you]84-ayesha pain . "[0-i]

But [she]84-ayesha only shook that glorious hair further about [her]84-ayesha face and behind its veil wept on .

" [You]84-ayesha know , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , "[0-i] [I]0-i continued , " [you]84-ayesha have said many hard things to [me]0-i , making [me]0-i the target of [your]84-ayesha bitter wit , therefore it is not strange that at last [I]0-i answered [you]84-ayesha . "[0-i]

" And hast [thou]5169-thou not deserved them , [Allan]82-allan ? "[84-ayesha] [she]84-ayesha murmured in soft and broken tones from behind that veil of scented locks .

" Why ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Because from the beginning [thou]5169-thou didst defy [me]0-i , showing in thine every accent that [thou]5169-thou heldest [me]0-i [a liar]5170-a liar and one of no account in body or in spirit , one not worthy of [thy]5169-thou kind look , or of those gentle words which once were [my]0-i portion among [men]3228-men . Oh ! [thou]5169-thou hast dealt hardly with [me]0-i and therefore perchance - [I]0-i know not - [I]0-i paid [thee]84-ayesha back with such poor weapons as [a woman]3331-a woman holds , though all the while [I]0-i liked [thee]84-ayesha well . "[0-i]

Then again [she]84-ayesha fell to sobbing , swaying [herself]84-ayesha gently to and fro in [her]84-ayesha sweet sorrow .

It was too much . Not knowing what else to do to comfort [her]84-ayesha , [I]0-i patted [her]84-ayesha ivory hand which lay upon the couch beside [me]0-i , and as this appeared to have no effect , [I]0-i kissed it , which [she]84-ayesha did not seem to resent . Then suddenly [I]0-i remembered and let it fall .

[She]84-ayesha tossed back [her]84-ayesha hair from [her]84-ayesha face and fixing [her]84-ayesha big eyes on [me]0-i , said gently enough , looking down at [her]84-ayesha hand ,

" What ails [thee]0-i , [Allan]82-allan ? "[84-ayesha]

" Oh , nothing , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered ; " only [I]0-i remembered the story [you]84-ayesha told [me]0-i about [some man called [Kallikrates]95-kallikrates]5173-some man called kallikrates . "[0-i]

[She]84-ayesha frowned .

" And what of [Kallikrates]95-kallikrates , [Allan]82-allan ? Is it not enough that for [my]84-ayesha sins , with tears , empty longings and repentance , [I]84-ayesha must wait for [him]5173-some man called kallikrates through all the weary centuries ? Must [I]84-ayesha also wear the chains of [this Kallikrates]5174-this kallikrates , to whom [I]84-ayesha owe many a debt , when [he]5173-some man called kallikrates is far away ? Say , didst [thou]84-ayesha see [him]5173-some man called kallikrates in [that Heaven of thine]5175-that heaven of thine , [Allan]82-allan , for there perchance [he]5173-some man called kallikrates dwells ? "[84-ayesha]

[I]0-i shook [my]0-i head and tried to think the thing out while all the time those wonderful eyes of [hers]84-ayesha seemed to draw the soul from [me]0-i . It seemed to [me]0-i that [she]84-ayesha bent forward and held up [her]84-ayesha face to [me]0-i . Then [I]0-i lost [my]0-i reason and also bent forward . Yes , [she]84-ayesha made [me]0-i mad , and , save [her]84-ayesha , [I]0-i forgot all .

Swiftly [she]84-ayesha placed [her]84-ayesha hand upon [my]0-i heart , saying ,

" Stay ! What meanest [thou]0-i ? Dost love [me]84-ayesha , [Allan]82-allan ? "[84-ayesha]

" [I]0-i think so - that is - yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

[She]84-ayesha sank back upon the couch away from [me]0-i and began to laugh very softly .

" What words are these , "[84-ayesha] [she]84-ayesha said , " that they pass [thy]0-i lips so easily and so unmeant , perchance from long practice ? Oh ! [Allan]82-allan , [I]84-ayesha am astonished . Art [thou]0-i [the same man who some few days ago told [me]84-ayesha , and this unasked , that as soon wouldst [thou]0-i think of courting the moon as of courting [me]84-ayesha]5176-the same man who some few days ago told me , and this unasked , that as soon wouldst thou think of courting the moon as of courting me ? Art [thou]0-i [he]5176-the same man who some few days ago told me , and this unasked , that as soon wouldst thou think of courting the moon as of courting me who not a minute gone swore proudly that never had [his]5176-the same man who some few days ago told me , and this unasked , that as soon wouldst thou think of courting the moon as of courting me heart and [his]5176-the same man who some few days ago told me , and this unasked , that as soon wouldst thou think of courting the moon as of courting me lips wandered from certain angels whither [they]5176-the same man who some few days ago told me , and this unasked , that as soon wouldst thou think of courting the moon as of courting me should not ? And now , and now - - ? "[84-ayesha]

[I]0-i coloured to [my]0-i eyes and rose , muttering ,

" Let [me]0-i be gone ! "[0-i]

" Nay , [Allan]82-allan , why ? [I]84-ayesha see no mark here , "[84-ayesha] and [she]84-ayesha held up [her]84-ayesha hand , scanning it carefully . " [Thou]0-i art too much what [thou]0-i wert before , except perhaps in [thy]0-i soul , which is invisible , "[84-ayesha] [she]84-ayesha added with a touch of malice . " Nor am [I]84-ayesha angry with [thee]0-i ; indeed , hadst [thou]0-i not tried to charm away [my]84-ayesha woe , [I]84-ayesha should have thought but poorly of [thee]0-i as [a man]3551-a man . There let it rest and be forgotten - or remembered as [thou]0-i wilt . Still , in answer to [thy]0-i words concerning [my]84-ayesha Kallikrates , what of those adored ones that , according to [thy]0-i tale , but now [thou]0-i didst find again in a place of light ? Because they seemed faithless , shouldst [thou]0-i be faithless also ? Shame on [thee]0-i , [thou]0-i fickle [Allan]82-allan ! "[84-ayesha]

[She]84-ayesha paused , waiting for [me]0-i to speak .

Well , [I]0-i could not . [I]0-i had nothing to say who was utterly disgraced and overwhelmed .

" [Thou]0-i thinkest , [Allan]82-allan , "[84-ayesha] [she]84-ayesha went on , " that [I]84-ayesha have cast [my]84-ayesha net about [thee]0-i , and this is true . Learn wisdom from it , [Allan]82-allan , and never again defy [a woman]3331-a woman - that is , if [she]3331-a woman be fair , for then [she]3331-a woman is stronger than [thou]0-i art , since Nature for its own purpose made [her]3331-a woman so . Whatever [I]84-ayesha have done by tears , that ancient artifice of [my]84-ayesha sex , as in other ways , is for [thy]0-i instruction , [Allan]82-allan , that [thou]0-i mayest benefit thereby . "[84-ayesha]

Again [I]0-i sprang up , uttering an English exclamation which [I]0-i trust [Ayesha]84-ayesha did not understand , and again [she]84-ayesha motioned to [me]0-i to be seated , saying ,

" Nay , leave [me]84-ayesha not yet since , even if the light fancy of [a man that comes and goes like the evening wind and for a breath]5179-a man that comes and goes like the evening wind and for a breath made [me]84-ayesha dear to [thee]0-i , has passed away , there remains certain work which [we]5180-we must do together . Although , thinking of [thyself]5181-thyself alone , [thou]0-i hast forgotten it , having been paid [thine]0-i own fee , one is yet due to [that old wizard in [a far land]5183-a far land who sent [thee]0-i to visit [K"r]1-k"r[84-ayesha] and [me]0-i , as indeed [he]2852-he has reminded [me]0-i and within an hour]5182-that old wizard in a far land who sent thee to visit k"r and me , as indeed he has reminded me and within an hour . "[2852-he]

This amazing statement aroused [me]0-i from [my]0-i personal and painful pre - occupation and caused [me]0-i to stare at [her]84-ayesha blankly .

" Again [thou]0-i disbelievest [me]84-ayesha , "[84-ayesha] [she]84-ayesha said , with a little stamp . " Do so once more , [Allan]82-allan , and [I]84-ayesha swear [I]84-ayesha 'll bring [thee]0-i to grovel on the ground and kiss [my]84-ayesha foot and babble nonsense to [a woman sworn to [another man]5185-another man]5184-a woman sworn to another man , such as never for all [thy]0-i days [thou]0-i shalt think of without a blush of shame . "[84-ayesha]

" Oh ! no , "[0-i] [I]0-i broke in hurriedly , " [I]0-i assure [you]84-ayesha that [you]84-ayesha are mistaken . [I]0-i believe every word [you]84-ayesha have said , or say or will say ; [I]0-i do in truth . "[0-i]

" Now [thou]0-i liest . Well , what is one more falsehood among so many ? Let it pass . "[84-ayesha]

" What , indeed ? "[0-i] [I]0-i echoed in eager affirmation , " and as for [Zikali]104-zikali 's message - - "[0-i] and [I]0-i paused .

" It was to recall to [my]84-ayesha mind that [he]104-zikali desired to learn whether a certain great enterprise of [his]104-zikali will succeed , the details of which [he]104-zikali says [thou]0-i canst tell [me]84-ayesha . Repeat them to [me]84-ayesha . "[84-ayesha]

So , glad enough to get away from more dangerous topics , [I]0-i narrated to [her]2853-thee as briefly and clearly as [I]0-i could , the history of [the old witch - doctor]2854-the old witch - doctor 's feud with [the Royal House of [Zululand]4-zululand]72-the royal house of zululand . [She]2853-thee listened , taking in every word , and said ,

" So now [he]104-zikali yearns to know whether [he]104-zikali will conquer or be conquered ; and that is why [he]104-zikali sent , or thinks that [he]104-zikali sent [thee]2853-thee on this journey , not for [thy]2853-thee sake , [Allan]82-allan , but for [his]104-zikali own . [I]2855-i can not tell [thee]2853-thee , for what have [I]2855-i do to with the finish of this petty business , which to [him]104-zikali seems so large ? Still , as [I]2855-i owe [him]104-zikali a debt for luring [the Axe - Bearer]4995-the axe - bearer here to rid [me]2855-i of [[mine]2855-i enemy]5187-mine enemy , and [thee]2853-thee to lighten [my]2855-i solitude for an hour by the burnishing of [thy]2853-thee mind , [I]2855-i will try . Set that bowl before [me]2855-i , [Allan]82-allan , "[2855-i] and [she]2855-i pointed to a marble tripod on which stood a basin half full of water , " and come , sit close by [me]2855-i and look into it , telling [me]2855-i what [thou]2853-thee seest . "[2855-i]

[I]0-i obeyed [her]2855-i instructions and presently found [myself]0-i with [my]0-i head over the basin , staring into the water in the exact attitude of [a person who is about to be shampooed]2856-a person who is about to be shampooed .

" This seems rather foolish , "[0-i] [I]0-i said abjectly , for at that moment [I]0-i resembled [the Queen of [Sheba]73-sheba]2857-the queen of sheba in one particular , if in no other , namely , that there was no more spirit in [me]0-i . " What am [I]2855-i supposed to do ? [I]2855-i see nothing at all . "[2855-i]

" Look again , "[2855-i] [she]2855-i said , and as [she]2855-i spoke the water grew clouded . Then on it appeared a picture . [I]0-i saw the interior of [a Kaffir hut]2858-a kaffir hut dimly lighted by a single candle set in the neck of a bottle . To the left of the door of [the hut]380-the hut was [a bedstead]2860-a bedstead and on it lay stretched [a wasted and dying man]2861-a wasted and dying man , in whom , to [my]0-i astonishment , [I]0-i recognised [Cetywayo]129-cetywayo , [King of [the Zulus]354-the zulus]2862-king of the zulus . At the foot of the bed stood [another man - [myself]0-i grown older by many years]2864-another man - myself grown older by many years , and leaning over the bed , apparently whispering into [the dying man]2865-the dying man 's ear , was a grotesque and malevolent figure which [I]0-i knew to be that of [Zikali]104-zikali , [Opener - of - Roads]20-opener - of - roads , whose glowing eyes were fixed upon the terrified and tortured face of [Cetywayo]129-cetywayo . All was as it happened afterwards , as [I]0-i have written down in the book called " Finished . "[0-i]

[I]0-i described what [I]0-i saw to [Ayesha]84-ayesha , and while [I]0-i was doing so the picture vanished away , so that nothing remained save the clear water in the marble bowl . The story did not seem to interest [her]84-ayesha ; indeed , [she]84-ayesha leaned back and yawned a little .

" [Thy]84-ayesha vision is good , [Allan]82-allan , "[84-ayesha] [she]84-ayesha said indifferently , " and wide also , since [thou]84-ayesha canst see what passes in the sun or distant stars , and pictures of things to be in [the water]983-the water , to say nothing of other pictures in [a woman]3331-a woman 's eyes , all within an hour . Well , this savage business concerns [me]84-ayesha not and of it [I]84-ayesha want to know no more . Yet it would appear that here [the old wizard who is [[thy]84-ayesha friend]5191-thy friend]5190-the old wizard who is thy friend , has the answer that [he]5190-the old wizard who is thy friend desires . For there in the picture [the king [he]5190-the old wizard who is thy friend hates]5192-the king he hates lies dying while [he]5190-the old wizard who is thy friend hisses in [his]5190-the old wizard who is thy friend ear and [thou]84-ayesha dost watch the end . What more can [he]5190-the old wizard who is thy friend seek ? Tell [him]5190-the old wizard who is thy friend it when [ye]84-ayesha meet , and tell [him]5190-the old wizard who is thy friend also it is [my]84-ayesha will that in future [he]5190-the old wizard who is thy friend should trouble [me]84-ayesha less , since [I]84-ayesha love not to be wakened from [my]84-ayesha sleep to listen to [his]5190-the old wizard who is thy friend half - instructed talk and savage vapourings . Indeed , [he]5190-the old wizard who is thy friend presumes too much . And now enough of [him]5190-the old wizard who is thy friend and [his]5190-the old wizard who is thy friend dark plots . [Ye]84-ayesha have [your]84-ayesha desires , all of [you]84-ayesha , and are paid in full . "[84-ayesha]

" Over - paid , perhaps , "[0-i] [I]0-i said with a sigh .

" Ah , [Allan]82-allan , [I]0-i think that Lesson [thou]84-ayesha hast learned pleases [thee]84-ayesha but little . Well , be comforted for the thing is common . Hast never heard that there is but one morsel more bitter to the taste than desire denied , namely , desire fulfilled ? Believe [me]0-i that there can be no happiness for [man]287-man until [he]287-man attains [a land where all desire is dead]5194-a land where all desire is dead . "[0-i]

" That is what [the Buddha]5195-the buddha preaches , [Ayesha]84-ayesha . "[84-ayesha]

" Aye , [I]0-i remember the doctrines of [that wise man]5196-that wise man well , who without doubt had found a key to the gate of Truth , one key only , for , mark [thou]84-ayesha , [Allan]82-allan , there are many .
