Yet , [man being man]5197-man being man must know desires , since without them , robbed of ambitions , strivings , hopes , fears , aye and of life itself , [the race]5198-the race must die , which is not the will of [the Lord of Life who needs a nursery for [[his]287-man servant]3496-his servant 's souls , wherein [his]287-man swords of Good and Ill shall shape them to [his]287-man pattern]5199-the lord of life who needs a nursery for his servant 's souls , wherein his swords of good and ill shall shape them to his pattern . So it comes about , [Allan]82-allan , that what [we]5201-we think the worst is oft the best for [us]5201-we , and with that knowledge , if [we]5201-we are wise , let [us]5201-we assuage [our]5201-we bitterness and wipe away [our]5201-we tears . "[0-i]

" [I]0-i have often thought that , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" [I]0-i doubt it not , [Allan]82-allan , since though it has pleased [me]0-i to make a jest of [thee]82-allan , [I]0-i know that [thou]82-allan hast [thy]82-allan share of wisdom , such little share as [thou]82-allan canst gather in [thy]82-allan few short years . [I]0-i know , too , that [thy]82-allan heart is good and aspires high , and [Friend]3537-friend - well , [I]0-i find in [thee]82-allan [a friend]5203-a friend indeed , as [I]0-i think not for the first time , nor certainly for the last . [Mark]226-mark antony , [Allan]82-allan , what [I]0-i say , not [a lover]5204-a lover , but [a friend]5203-a friend , which is higher far . For when passion dies with the passing of the flesh , if there be no friendship what will remain save certain memories that , mayhap , are well forgot ? Aye , how would [those lovers]5206-those lovers meet elsewhere who were never more than [lovers]5207-lovers ? With weariness , [I]0-i hold , as [they]5206-those lovers stared into [each other]3176-each other 's empty soul , or even with disgust .[0-i]

" Therefore [the wise]5209-the wise will seek to turn those with whom Fate mates [them]5209-the wise into [friends]3149-friends , since otherwise soon [they]5209-the wise will be lost for aye . More , if [they]5209-the wise are wiser still , having made [them]5209-the wise [friends]3149-friends , [they]5209-the wise will suffer [them]5209-the wise to find [lovers]5207-lovers where [they]5209-the wise will . Good maxims , are [they]5209-the wise not ? Yet hard to follow , or so , perchance , [thou]5213-thou thinkest [them]5209-the wise - as [I]0-i do . "[0-i]

[She]2866-her grew silent and brooded a while , resting [her]2866-her chin upon [her]2866-her hand and staring down [the hall]2867-the hall . Thus the aspect of [her]2866-her face was different from any that [I]0-i had seen it wear . No longer had it the allure of [Aphrodite]206-aphrodite or the majesty of [Hera]2868-hera ; rather might it have been that of [Athene]255-athene [herself]2866-her . So wise it seemed , so calm , so full of experience and of foresight , that almost it frightened [me]0-i .

What was [this woman]533-this woman 's true story , [I]0-i wondered , what [her]533-this woman real self , and what the sum of [her]533-this woman gathered knowledge ? Perhaps it was accident , or perhaps , again , [she]533-this woman guessed [my]0-i mind . At any rate [her]533-this woman next words seemed in some sense an answer to these speculations . Lifting [her]533-this woman eyes [she]533-this woman contemplated [me]0-i a while , then said ,

" [[My]533-this woman friend]270-my friend , [we]5215-we part to meet no more in [thy]270-my friend life 's day . Often [thou]270-my friend wilt wonder concerning [me]533-this woman , as to what in truth [I]533-this woman am , and mayhap in the end [thy]270-my friend judgment will be to write [me]533-this woman down [some false and beauteous wanderer who , rejected of [the world]277-the world or driven from it by [her]533-this woman crimes , made choice to rule among [savages]1535-savages , playing the part of [Oracle]5219-oracle to [that little audience]5220-that little audience and telling strange tales to [such few travellers]5221-such few travellers as come [her]533-this woman way]5216-some false and beauteous wanderer who , rejected of the world or driven from it by her crimes , made choice to rule among savages , playing the part of oracle to that little audience and telling strange tales to such few travellers as come her way . Perhaps , indeed , [I]533-this woman do play this part among many others , and if so , [thou]270-my friend wilt not judge [me]533-this woman wrongly .[533-this woman]

" [Allan]82-allan , in the old days , [mariners who had sailed [the northern seas]5223-the northern seas]5222-mariners who had sailed the northern seas , told [me]533-this woman that therein amidst mist and storm float mountains of ice , shed from dizzy cliffs which are hid in darkness where no sun shines . [They]5222-mariners who had sailed the northern seas told [me]533-this woman also that whereas above [the ocean]5224-the ocean 's breast appears but a blue and dazzling point , sunk beneath it is oft [a whole frozen isle]5225-a whole frozen isle , invisible to [man]287-man .[533-this woman]

" Such am [I]533-this woman , [Allan]82-allan . Of [my]533-this woman being [thou]270-my friend seest but one little peak glittering in light or crowned with storm , as heaven 's moods sweep over it . But in the depths beneath are hid [its]5227-its white and broad foundations , hollowed by the seas of time to caverns and to palaces which [my]533-this woman spirit doth inhabit . So picture [me]533-this woman , therefore , as wise and fair , but with a soul unknown , and pray that in time to come [thou]270-my friend mayest see it in [its]5227-its splendour .[533-this woman]

" Hadst [thou]270-my friend been other than [thou]270-my friend art , [I]533-this woman might have shown [thee]270-my friend secrets , making clear to [thee]270-my friend the parable of much that [I]533-this woman have told [thee]270-my friend in metaphor and varying fable , aye , and given [thee]270-my friend great gifts of power and enduring days of which [thou]270-my friend knowest nothing . But of [those who visit shrines]5228-those who visit shrines , [O Allan]82-allan , two things are required , worship and faith , since without these [the oracles]5229-the oracles are dumb and the healing waters will not flow .[533-this woman]

" Now [I]533-this woman , [Ayesha]84-ayesha , am a shrine ; yet to [me]533-this woman [thou]270-my friend broughtest no worship until [I]533-this woman won it by [a woman]3331-a woman 's trick , and in [me]533-this woman [thou]270-my friend hast no faith . Therefore for [thee]270-my friend [the oracle]5231-the oracle will not speak and the waters of deliverance will not flow . Yet [I]533-this woman blame [thee]270-my friend not , who art as [thou]270-my friend wast made and [the hard world]5232-the hard world has shaped [thee]270-my friend .[533-this woman]

" And so [we]5233-we part : Think not [I]533-this woman am far from [thee]270-my friend because [thou]270-my friend seest [me]533-this woman not in the days to come , since like that Isis whose majesty alone [I]533-this woman still exercise on [earth]346-earth , [I]533-this woman , whom [men]3228-men name [Ayesha]84-ayesha , am in all things . [I]533-this woman tell [thee]270-my friend that [I]533-this woman am not One but Many and , being many , am both Here and Everywhere . When [thou]270-my friend standest beneath the sky at night and lookest on the stars , remember that in [them]5236-them [mine]533-this woman eyes behold [thee]270-my friend ; when the soft winds of evening blow , that [my]533-this woman breath is on [thy]270-my friend brow and when the thunder rolls , that there am [I]533-this woman riding on the lightnings and rushing with the gale . "[533-this woman]

" Do [you]533-this woman mean that [you]533-this woman are [the goddess [Isis]200-isis]4313-the goddess isis ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , bewildered . " Because if so why did [you]533-this woman tell [me]0-i that [you]533-this woman were but [[her]200-isis priestess]2278-her priestess ? "[0-i]

" Have it as [thou]270-my friend wilt , [Allan]82-allan . All sounds do not reach thine ears ; all sights are not open to [thy]270-my friend eyes and therefore [thou]270-my friend art both half deaf and blind . Perchance now that [[her]200-isis shrines]5239-her shrines are dust and [her]200-isis worship is forgot , some spark of the spirit of [that immortal Lady whose chariot was the moon]5240-that immortal lady whose chariot was the moon , lingers on the earth in [this woman]533-this woman 's shape of [mine]0-i , though [her]200-isis essence dwells afar , and perchance [her]200-isis other name is [Nature]82-allan , [[my]2873-i mother]3886-my mother and thine , O [Allan]82-allan . At the least hath not [the World]277-the world a soul - and of that soul am [I]2873-i not mayhap a part , aye , and [thou]270-my friend also ? For the rest are not [the priest]2343-the priest and the Divine [he]2343-the priest bows to , oft the same ? "[2873-i]

It was on [my]0-i lips to answer , Yes , if [the priest]2343-the priest is [a knave]2871-a knave or [a self - deceiver]2872-a self - deceiver , but [I]0-i did not .

" Farewell , [Allan]82-allan , and let [Ayesha]84-ayesha 's benison go with [thee]82-allan . Safe shalt [thou]82-allan reach [[thy]82-allan home]5245-thy home , for all is prepared to take [thee]82-allan hence , and [[thy]82-allan companions]4700-thy companions with [thee]82-allan . Safe shalt [thou]82-allan live for many a year , till [thy]82-allan time comes , and then , perchance , [thou]82-allan wilt find [those whom thou hast lost more kind]5247-those whom thou hast lost more kind than [they]5247-those whom thou hast lost more kind seemed to be to - night . "[2873-i]

[She]2873-i paused awhile , then added ,

" Hearken unto [my]2873-i last word ! As [I]2873-i have said , much that [I]2873-i have told [thee]82-allan may bear a double meaning , as is the way of parables , to be interpreted as [thou]82-allan wilt . Yet one thing is true . [I]2873-i love [a certain man , in the old days named [Kallikrates]95-kallikrates , to whom alone [I]2873-i am appointed by a divine decree , and [I]2873-i await [him]5248-a certain man , in the old days named kallikrates , to whom alone i am appointed by a divine decree , and i await him here here]5248-a certain man , in the old days named kallikrates , to whom alone i am appointed by a divine decree , and i await him here . Oh , shouldest [thou]82-allan find [him]5248-a certain man , in the old days named kallikrates , to whom alone i am appointed by a divine decree , and i await him here in [the world]277-the world without , tell [him]5248-a certain man , in the old days named kallikrates , to whom alone i am appointed by a divine decree , and i await him here that [Ayesha]84-ayesha awaits [him]5248-a certain man , in the old days named kallikrates , to whom alone i am appointed by a divine decree , and i await him here and grows weary in the waiting . Nay , [thou]82-allan wilt never find [him]5248-a certain man , in the old days named kallikrates , to whom alone i am appointed by a divine decree , and i await him here , since even if [he]5248-a certain man , in the old days named kallikrates , to whom alone i am appointed by a divine decree , and i await him here be born again , by what token would [he]5248-a certain man , in the old days named kallikrates , to whom alone i am appointed by a divine decree , and i await him here be known to [thee]82-allan ? Therefore [I]2873-i charge [thee]82-allan , keep [my]2873-i secrets well , lest [Ayesha]84-ayesha 's curse should fall on [thee]82-allan . While [thou]82-allan livest tell naught of [me]2873-i to [the world]277-the world [thou]82-allan knowest . Dost [thou]82-allan swear to keep [my]2873-i secrets , [Allan]82-allan ? "[2873-i]

" [I]2874-her swear , [Ayesha]84-ayesha . "[2874-her]

" [I]2874-her thank [thee]82-allan , [Allan]82-allan , "[2874-her] [she]2874-her answered , and grew silent for a while .

At length [Ayesha]84-ayesha rose and drawing [herself]84-ayesha up to the full of [her]84-ayesha height , stood there majestic . Next [she]2874-her beckoned to [me]0-i to come near , for [I]0-i too had risen and left the dais .

[I]0-i obeyed , and bending down [she]2874-her held [her]2874-her hands over [me]0-i as though in blessing , then pointed towards the curtains which at this moment were drawn asunder , by whom [I]0-i do not know .

[I]0-i went and when [I]0-i reached them , turned to look [my]0-i last on [her]2874-her .

There [she]2874-her stood as [I]0-i had left [her]2874-her , but now [her]2874-her eyes were fixed upon the ground and [her]2874-her face once more was brooding absently as though [no such a man]2875-no such a man as [I]0-i had ever been . It came into [my]0-i mind that already [she]2874-her had forgotten [me]0-i , the plaything of an hour , who had served [her]2874-her turn and been cast aside .

CHAPTER XXIII

WHAT UMSLOPOGAAS SAW

Like one who drams [I]0-i passed down [the outer hall]2876-the outer hall where stood [the silent guards as statues]2877-the silent guards as statues might , and out through the archway . Here [I]0-i paused for a moment , partly to calm [my]0-i mind in the familiar surroundings of the night , and partly because [I]0-i thought that [I]0-i heard [someone]293-someone approaching [me]0-i through the gloom , and in such a place where [I]0-i might have [many enemies]2879-many enemies , it was well to be prepared .

As it chanced , however , [[my]0-i imaginary assailant]2880-my imaginary assailant was only [Hans]87-hans , who emerged from some place where [he]87-hans had been hiding ; [a very disturbed and frightened Hans]2881-a very disturbed and frightened hans .

" Oh , [Baas]121-baas , "[87-hans] [he]87-hans said in a low and shaky whisper , " [I]87-hans am glad to see [you]121-baas again , and standing on [your]121-baas feet , not being carried with [them]5251-them sticking straight in front of [you]121-baas as [I]87-hans expected . "[87-hans]

" Why ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Oh , [Baas]121-baas , because of the things that happened in that place where the tall vrouw with [her]5252-her head tied up as though [she]5252-her had tooth - ache , sits like a spider in a web . "[87-hans]

" Well , what happened , [Hans]87-hans ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked as [we]2882-we walked forward .

" This , [Baas]121-baas . [The Doctoress]5253-the doctoress talked and talked at [you]121-baas and [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , and as [she]5253-the doctoress talked , [your]121-baas faces began to look as though [you]121-baas had drunk half a flask too much of the best gin , such as [I]87-hans wish [I]87-hans had some of here to - night , at once wise and foolish , and full and empty , Baas . Then [you]121-baas both rolled over and lay there quite dead , and whilst [I]87-hans was wondering what [I]87-hans should do and how [I]87-hans should get out [your]121-baas bodies to bury [them]5254-them , [the Doctoress]5253-the doctoress came down off [her]5253-the doctoress platform and bent , first over [you]121-baas and next over [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , whispering into the ears of both of [you]121-baas . Then [she]5253-the doctoress took off a snake that looked as though it were made of gold with green eyes , which [she]5253-the doctoress wears about [her]5253-the doctoress middle beneath the long dish - cloth , [Baas]121-baas , and held it to [your]121-baas lips and next to those of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas . "[87-hans]

" Well , and what then , [Hans]87-hans ? "[87-hans]

" After that all sorts of things came about , [Baas]121-baas , and [I]87-hans felt as though [the whole house]5256-the whole house were travelling through the air , [Baas]121-baas , twice as fast as a bullet does from a rifle . Suddenly , too , [the room]3855-the room became filled with fire so hot that it scorched [me]87-hans , and so bright that it made [my]87-hans eyes water , although they can look at the sun without winking . And , [Baas]121-baas , the fire was full of spooks which walked around ; yes , [I]87-hans saw some of [them]5258-them standing on [your]121-baas head and stomach , [Baas]121-baas , also on that of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , whilst [others]279-others went and talked to [the white Doctoress]4592-the white doctoress as quietly as though [they]279-others had met [her]4592-the white doctoress in the market - place and wanted to sell [her]4592-the white doctoress eggs or butter . Then , [Baas]121-baas , suddenly [I]87-hans saw [[your]121-baas reverend father]3327-your reverend father , [the Predikant]3326-the predikant , who looked as though [he]3327-your reverend father were red - hot , as doubtless [he]3327-your reverend father is in [the Place of Fires]3329-the place of fires . [I]87-hans thought [he]3327-your reverend father came up to [me]87-hans , [Baas]121-baas , and said , ' Get out of this , [Hans]87-hans . This is no place for a good Hottentot like [you]121-baas , [Hans]87-hans , for here only the very best [Christians]256-christians can bear the heat for long . '[87-hans]

" That finished [me]125-umslopogaas , [Baas]121-baas . [I]125-umslopogaas just answered that [I]125-umslopogaas handed [you]121-baas , [the Baas]121-baas Allan [[his]121-baas son]4188-his son , over to [his]121-baas care , hoping that [he]121-baas would see that [you]121-baas did not burn in that oven , whatever happened to [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas . Then [I]125-umslopogaas shut [my]125-umslopogaas eyes and mouth and held [my]125-umslopogaas nose , and wriggled beneath those curtains as a snake does , [Baas]121-baas , and ran down [the hall]2867-the hall and across [the kraal - yard]5266-the kraal - yard and through the archway out into the night , where [I]125-umslopogaas have been sitting cooling [myself]125-umslopogaas ever since , waiting for [you]121-baas to be carried away , [Baas]121-baas . And now [you]121-baas have come alive and with not even [your]121-baas hair burnt off , which shows how wonderful must be the Great Medicine of [Zikali]104-zikali , [Baas]121-baas , since nothing else could have saved [you]121-baas in that fire , no , not even [[your]121-baas reverend father]3327-your reverend father , [the Predikant]3326-the predikant . "[125-umslopogaas]

" [Hans]87-hans , "[0-i] [I]0-i said when [he]2883-i had finished , " [you]87-hans are [a very wonderful fellow]5269-a very wonderful fellow , for [you]87-hans can get drunk on nothing at all . Please remember , [Hans]87-hans , that [you]87-hans have been drunk to - night , yes , very drunk indeed , and never dare to repeat anything that [you]87-hans thought [you]87-hans saw while [you]87-hans were drunk . "[0-i]

" Yes , [Baas]121-baas , [I]2883-i understand that [I]2883-i was drunk and already have forgotten everything . But , [Baas]121-baas , there is still a bottle full of brandy and if [I]2883-i could have just one more tot [I]2883-i should forget so much better ! "[2883-i]

By now [we]2884-we had reached [[our]2884-we camp]1037-our camp and here [I]0-i found [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas sitting in the doorway and staring at the sky .

" Good - evening to [you]125-umslopogaas , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , "[0-i] [I]0-i said in [my]0-i most unconcerned manner , and waited .

" Good - evening , Watcher - by - Night , who [I]2883-i thought was lost in the night , since in the end the night is stronger than [any of [its]5271-its watchers]5270-any of its watchers . "[2883-i]

At this cryptic remark [I]0-i looked bewildered but said nothing . At length [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , whose nature , for [a Zulu]1105-a zulu , was impulsive and lacking in the ordinary native patience , asked ,

" Did [you]121-baas make a journey this evening , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , and if so , what did [you]121-baas see ? "[2887-i]

" Did [you]121-baas have a dream this evening , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas ? "[0-i] [I]0-i inquired by way of answer , " and if so , what was it about ? [I]0-i thought that [I]0-i saw [you]125-umslopogaas shut [your]125-umslopogaas eyes in [the House of the White One yonder]5272-the house of the white one yonder , doubtless because [you]125-umslopogaas were weary of talk which [you]125-umslopogaas did not understand . "[0-i]

" Aye , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , as [you]105-macumazahn suppose [I]2887-i grew weary of that talk which flowed from the lips of [the White Witch]223-the white witch like the music that comes from a little stream babbling over stones when the sun is hot , and being weary , [I]2887-i fell asleep and dreamed . What [I]2887-i dreamed does not much matter . It is enough to say that [I]2887-i felt as though [I]2887-i were thrown through the air like a stone cast from [his]2887-i sling by [a boy who is set upon a stage]5273-a boy who is set upon a stage to scare the birds out of [a mealie garden]5274-a mealie garden . Further than any stone [I]2887-i went , aye , further than a shooting star , till [I]2887-i reached [a wonderful place]5275-a wonderful place . It does not much matter what it was like either , and indeed [I]2887-i am already beginning to forget , but there [I]2887-i met [everyone [I]2887-i have ever known]5276-everyone i have ever known . [I]2887-i met [the Lion of [the Zulus]354-the zulus]5277-the lion of the zulus , [the Black One]4152-the black one , [the Earth - Shaker]5280-the earth - shaker , [he]2887-i who had [a ' sister ' named [Baleka]149-baleka , which [sister]3536-sister]5281-a ' sister ' named baleka , which sister , "[2887-i] here [he]2887-i dropped [his]2887-i voice and looked about [him]2887-i suspiciously , " bore [a child]1173-a child , [which child]5284-which child was fostered by [one Mopo]105-macumazahn , [that Mopo who afterwards slew [the Black one]4152-the black one with [the Princes]105-macumazahn . Now , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [I]2887-i had a score to settle with [this Black One]5286-this black one , aye , even though [our]5287-our blood]105-macumazahn be much of the same colour , [I]2887-i had a score to settle with [him]5286-this black one , because of the slaying of [this sister of [his]5286-this black one , [Baleka]149-baleka , together with [the Langeni tribe]5289-the langeni tribe]5288-this sister of his , baleka , together with the langeni tribe . So [I]2887-i walked up to [him]5286-this black one and took [him]5286-this black one by the head - ring and spat in [his]5286-this black one face and bade [him]5286-this black one find a spear and shield , and meet [me]2887-i as [man to man]5290-man to man . Yes , [I]2887-i did this . "[2887-i]

For the history of [Baleka]149-baleka , [the mother of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas]2888-the mother of umslopogaas , and [Mopo]105-macumazahn , see the book called " [Nada the Lily]112-nada . "[2889-editor] - [Editor]2889-editor .

" And what happened then , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said , when [he]2889-editor paused in [his]2889-editor narrative .

" [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , nothing happened at all . [My]2889-editor hand seemed to go through [his]5286-this black one head - ring and the skull beneath , and to shut upon itself while [he]5286-this black one went on talking to [someone else]2092-someone else , [a captain whom [I]2889-editor recognised]5292-a captain whom i recognised , yes , [one [Faku]177-faku , whom in the days of [Dingaan]243-dingaan]5293-one faku , whom in the days of dingaan , [[the Black One]153-the black one 's brother]5294-the black one 's brother , [I]2889-editor [myself]2889-editor slew upon [the Ghost - Mountain]75-the ghost - mountain .[2889-editor]

" Yes , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , and [Faku]177-faku was telling [him]5286-this black one the tale of how [I]2889-editor killed [him]5286-this black one and of the fight that [I]2889-editor and [[my]2889-editor blood - brother]3414-my blood - brother and the wolves made , there on the knees of [the old witch who sits aloft on [the Ghost Mountain]75-the ghost - mountain waiting for [the world]277-the world to die]5296-the old witch who sits aloft on the ghost mountain waiting for the world to die , for [I]2889-editor could understand [their]5298-them talk , though [mine]2889-editor went by [them]5298-them like the wind .[2889-editor]

" [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [they]5298-them passed away and there came others , [Dingaan]243-dingaan among [them]5298-them , aye , [Dingaan]243-dingaan who also knows something of [the Witch - Mountain]4819-the witch - mountain , seeing that there [Mopo]105-macumazahn and [I]2889-editor hurled [him]5286-this black one to [his]5286-this black one death . With [him]5286-this black one also [I]2889-editor would have had words , but it was the same story , only presently [he]5286-this black one caught sight of the Black One , yes , of [Chaka]106-chaka whom [he]5286-this black one slew , stabbing [him]5286-this black one with the little red assegai , and turned and fled , because in [that land]4999-that land [I]2889-editor think [he]5286-this black one still fears [Chaka]106-chaka , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , or so the dream told .[2889-editor]

" [I]2889-editor went on and met [others]279-others , [[men]3228-men [I]2889-editor had fought in [my]2889-editor day]5303-men i had fought in my day , most of [them]279-others , among [them]279-others was [Jikiza]257-jikiza , [he]257-jikiza who ruled [the People of the Axe before [me]2889-editor whom [I]2889-editor slew with [his]257-jikiza own axe]258-the people of the axe before me whom i slew with his own axe . [I]2889-editor lifted the axe and made [me]2889-editor ready to fight again , but [not one of [them]279-others]3575-not one of them took any note of [me]2889-editor . There [they]279-others walked about , or sat drinking beer or taking snuff , but never a sup of the beer or a pinch of the snuff did [they]279-others offer [me]2889-editor , no , [not even [those among [them]279-others whom [I]2889-editor chanced not to have killed]5306-those among them whom i chanced not to have killed . So [I]2889-editor left [them]279-others and walked on , seeking for [Mopo]105-macumazahn , [[my]2889-editor foster - father]3494-my foster - father , and [a certain man , [my]2889-editor blood - brother]5308-a certain man , my blood - brother , by whose side [I]2889-editor hunted with the wolves , yes , for [them]279-others , and for another]5305-not even those among them whom i chanced not to have killed . so i left them and walked on , seeking for mopo , my foster - father , and a certain man , my blood - brother , by whose side i hunted with the wolves , yes , for them , and for another . "[5310-the " blood - brother]

" Well , and did [you]2889-editor find [them]279-others ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [Mopo]105-macumazahn [I]2890-he found not , which makes [me]2890-he think , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , that , as once [you]105-macumazahn hinted to [me]2890-he , [he]427-this man whom [I]2890-he thought long dead , perchance still lingers on [the earth]285-the earth . But the others [I]2890-he did find . . . "[2890-he] and [he]2890-he ceased , brooding .

Now [I]0-i knew enough of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas 's history to be aware that [he]2890-he had loved [this man]427-this man and woman of whom [he]2890-he spoke more than [any others on [the earth]285-the earth]2892-any others on the earth . [The " blood - brother]5310-the " blood - brother , "[5310-the " blood - brother] whose name [he]2890-he would not utter , by which [he]2890-he did not mean that [he]2890-he was [[his]2890-he brother]2894-his brother in blood but one with whom [he]2890-he had made a pact of eternal friendship by the interchange of blood or some such ceremony , according to report , had dwelt with [him]2890-he on [the Witch - Mountain]4819-the witch - mountain where legend told , though this [I]0-i could scarcely believe , that [they]2896-they had hunted with [a pack of hyenas]2897-a pack of hyenas . There , it said also , [they]2896-they fought a great fight with a band send out by [Dingaan [the king under the command of that Faku whom [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas had mentioned]2899-the king under the command of that faku whom umslopogaas had mentioned , in which fight the " Blood - Brother , "[2898-dingaan the king under the command of that faku whom umslopogaas had mentioned , in which fight the " blood - brother , " wielder of a famous club known as watcher - of - the - fords] wielder of [a famous club known as Watcher - of - [the - Fords]63-the - fords]2900-a famous club known as watcher - of - the - fords]2898-dingaan the king under the command of that faku whom umslopogaas had mentioned , in which fight the " blood - brother , " wielder of a famous club known as watcher - of - the - fords , got [his]2890-he death after doing mighty deeds . There also , as [I]0-i had heard , [Nada the Lily]112-nada , whose beauty was still famous in [the land]3243-the land , died under circumstances strange as [they]2896-they were sad .

Naturally , remembering [my]0-i own experiences , or rather what seemed to be [my]0-i experiences , for already [I]0-i had made up [my]0-i mind that they were but a dream , [I]0-i was most anxious to learn whether [these two who had been so dear to this fierce Zulu]2902-these two who had been so dear to this fierce zulu , had recognised [him]2890-he .

" Well , and what did [they]2902-these two who had been so dear to this fierce zulu say to [you]2890-he , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [they]2902-these two who had been so dear to this fierce zulu said nothing at all . [Hearken]132-hearken ! There stood [this pair]5311-this pair , or sometimes [they]2902-these two who had been so dear to this fierce zulu moved to and fro ; [[my]0-i brother]4820-my brother , [an even greater man than [he]4820-my brother used to be]5313-an even greater man than he used to be , with the wolfskin girt about [him]4820-my brother and the club , [Watcher - of - the - Fords]5314-watcher - of - the - fords , which [he]4820-my brother alone could wield , upon [his]4820-my brother shoulder , and [Nada]112-nada , grown lovelier even than [she]112-nada was of old , so lovely , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , that [my]0-i heart rose into [my]0-i throat when [I]0-i saw [her]112-nada and stopped [my]0-i breath . Yes , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , there [they]2902-these two who had been so dear to this fierce zulu stood , or walked about arm in arm as [lovers]5207-lovers might , and looked into [each other]3176-each other 's eyes and talked of how [they]2902-these two who had been so dear to this fierce zulu had known [each other]3176-each other on [the earth]285-the earth , for [I]0-i could understand [their]2902-these two who had been so dear to this fierce zulu words or thoughts , and how it was good to be at rest together where [they]2902-these two who had been so dear to this fierce zulu were . "[0-i]

" [You]105-macumazahn see , [they]2902-these two who had been so dear to this fierce zulu were [old friends]5319-old friends , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" Yes , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , very old friends as [I]0-i thought . So much so that [they]2902-these two who had been so dear to this fierce zulu had never had a word to say of [me]0-i who also was [the old friend of both of [them]2902-these two who had been so dear to this fierce zulu]5320-the old friend of both of them . Aye , [[my]0-i brother]4820-my brother , whose name [I]0-i am sworn not to speak , [the woman - hater who vowed [he]4820-my brother loved nothing save [me]0-i and the wolves]5322-the woman - hater who vowed he loved nothing save me and the wolves , could smile into the face of [Nada the Lily]112-nada , [[Nada]112-nada the bride of [my]0-i youth]5323-nada the bride of my youth , yet never a word of [me]0-i , while [she]112-nada could smile back and tell [him]4820-my brother how great [a warrior [he]4820-my brother had been and never a word of [me]0-i whose deeds [she]112-nada was wo nt to praise , who saved [her]112-nada in [the Halakazi caves]5325-the halakazi caves and from [Dingaan]111-dingaan]5324-a warrior he had been and never a word of me whose deeds she was wo nt to praise , who saved her in the halakazi caves and from dingaan ; no , never a word of [me]0-i although [I]0-i stood there staring at [them]5326-they . "[0-i]

" [I]0-i suppose that [they]5326-they did not see [you]0-i , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas . "[0-i]

" That is so , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn ; [I]0-i am sure that [they]5326-they did not see [me]0-i , for if [they]5326-they had [they]5326-they would not have been so much at ease . But [I]0-i saw [them]5326-they and as [they]5326-they would not take heed when [I]0-i shouted , [I]0-i ran up calling to [[my]0-i brother]4820-my brother to defend [himself]4820-my brother with [his]4820-my brother club . Then , as [he]4820-my brother still took no note , [I]0-i lifted the axe [Inkosikaas]156-inkosikaas , making it circle in the light , and smote with all [my]0-i strength . "[0-i]

" And what happened , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas ? "[0-i]

" Only this , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , that the axe went straight through [[my]0-i brother]4820-my brother from the crown of [his]4820-my brother head to the groin , cutting [him]4820-my brother in two , and [he]4820-my brother just went on talking ! Indeed , [he]4820-my brother did more , for stooping down [he]4820-my brother gathered a white lily - bloom which grew there and gave it to [Nada]112-nada , who smelt at it , smiled and thanked [him]4820-my brother , and then thrust it into [her]112-nada girdle , still thanking [him]4820-my brother all the while . Yes , [she]112-nada did this for [I]0-i saw it with [my]0-i eyes , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . "[0-i]

Here [the Zulu]183-the zulu 's voice broke and [I]0-i think that [he]183-the zulu wept , for in the faint light [I]0-i saw [him]183-the zulu draw [his]183-the zulu long hand across [his]183-the zulu eyes , whereon [I]0-i took the opportunity to turn [my]0-i back and light a pipe .

" [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , "[183-the zulu] [he]183-the zulu went on presently , " it seems that madness took hold of [me]183-the zulu for a long while , for [I]183-the zulu shouted and raved at [them]5329-them , thinking that words and rage might hurt where good steel could not , and as [I]183-the zulu did so [they]5329-them faded away and disappeared , still smiling and talking , [Nada]112-nada smelling at the lily which , having a long stalk , rose up above [her]112-nada breast . After this [I]183-the zulu rushed away and suddenly met [that savage king]5330-that savage king , [Rezu]88-rezu , whom [I]183-the zulu slew a few days gone . At [him]5330-that savage king [I]183-the zulu went with the axe , wondering whether [he]5330-that savage king would put up a better fight this second time . "[183-the zulu]

" And did [he]5330-that savage king , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas ? "[183-the zulu]

" Nay , but [I]183-the zulu think [he]5330-that savage king felt [me]183-the zulu for [he]5330-that savage king turned and fled and when [I]183-the zulu tried to follow [I]183-the zulu could not see [him]5330-that savage king . So [I]183-the zulu ran on and presently who should [I]183-the zulu find but [Baleka]149-baleka , [Baleka]149-baleka , [[Chaka]106-chaka 's ' sister]5331-chaka 's ' sister ' who - repeat it not , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn - was [[my]183-the zulu mother]3886-my mother ; and , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , [she]3886-my mother saw [me]183-the zulu . Yes , though [I]183-the zulu was but little when last [she]3886-my mother looked on [me]183-the zulu who now am great and grim , [she]3886-my mother saw and knew [me]183-the zulu , for [she]3886-my mother floated up to [me]183-the zulu and smiled at [me]183-the zulu and seemed to press [her]3886-my mother lips upon [my]183-the zulu forehead , though [I]183-the zulu could feel no kiss , and to draw the soreness out of [my]183-the zulu heart . Then [she]3886-my mother , too , was gone and of a sudden [I]183-the zulu fell down through space , having , [I]183-the zulu suppose , stepped into [some deep hole]5333-some deep hole , or perchance a well .[183-the zulu]

" The next thing [I]183-the zulu knew was that [I]183-the zulu awoke in [the house of [the White Witch]223-the white witch]5334-the house of the white witch and saw [you]5335-you sleeping at [my]183-the zulu side and [the Witch]3980-the witch leaning back upon [her]3980-the witch bed and smiling at [me]183-the zulu through the thin blanket with which [she]3980-the witch covers [herself]3980-the witch up , for [I]183-the zulu could see the laughter in [her]3980-the witch eyes .[183-the zulu]

" Now [I]183-the zulu grew mad with [her]3980-the witch because of the things that [I]183-the zulu had seen in [the Place of Dreams]5337-the place of dreams , and it came into [my]183-the zulu heart that it would be well to kill [her]3980-the witch that [the world]277-the world might be rid of [her]3980-the witch and [her]3980-the witch evil magic which can show lies to [men]3228-men . So , being distraught , [I]183-the zulu sprang up and lifted the axe and stepped towards [her]3980-the witch , whereon [she]3980-the witch rose and stood before [me]183-the zulu , laughing out loud . Then [she]3980-the witch said something in the tongue [I]183-the zulu can not understand , and pointed with [her]3980-the witch finger , and lo ! next moment it was as if giants had seized [me]183-the zulu and were whirling [me]183-the zulu away , till presently [I]183-the zulu found [myself]183-the zulu breathless but unharmed beyond the arch and - what does it all mean , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn ? "[183-the zulu]

" Very little , as [I]183-the zulu think , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , except that [this queen]3212-this queen has powers to which those of [Zikali]104-zikali are as nothing , and can cause visions to float before the eyes of [men]3228-men . For know that such things as [you]125-umslopogaas saw , [I]183-the zulu saw , and in them [those whom [I]183-the zulu have loved]5342-those whom i have loved also seemed to take no thought of [me]183-the zulu but only to be concerned with [each other]3176-each other . Moreover when [I]183-the zulu awoke and told this to [the queen who is called [She]5344-the queen who is called she - who - commands - who - commands]5344-the queen who is called she - who - commands , [she]5344-the queen who is called she - who - commands laughed at [me]183-the zulu as [she]5344-the queen who is called she - who - commands did at [you]125-umslopogaas , and said that it was a good lesson for [[my]183-the zulu pride who in that pride had believed that [the dead]3534-the dead only thought of [the living]3885-the living]5345-my pride who in that pride had believed that the dead only thought of the living . But [I]183-the zulu think that the lesson came from [her]5344-the queen who is called she - who - commands who wished to humble [us]5348-us , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , and that it was [her]5344-the queen who is called she - who - commands mind that shaped these visions which [we]5348-us saw . "[183-the zulu]

" [I]183-the zulu think so too , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , but how [she]5344-the queen who is called she - who - commands knew of all the matters of [your]125-umslopogaas life and [mine]183-the zulu , [I]183-the zulu do not know , unless perchance [Zikali]104-zikali told [them]5349-them to [her]5344-the queen who is called she - who - commands , speaking in the night - watches as [wizards]5350-wizards can . "[183-the zulu]

" Nay , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , [I]183-the zulu believe that by [her]5344-the queen who is called she - who - commands magic [she]5344-the queen who is called she - who - commands drew [our]5348-us stories out of [our]5348-us own hearts and then set them forth to [us]5348-us afresh , putting [her]5344-the queen who is called she - who - commands own colour on them . Also it may be that [she]5344-the queen who is called she - who - commands drew something from [Hans]87-hans , and from [Goroko]168-goroko and [the other Zulus]2664-the other zulus with [you]125-umslopogaas , and thus paid [us]5348-us the fee that [she]5344-the queen who is called she - who - commands had promised for [our]5348-us service , but in lung - sick oxen and barren cows , not in good cattle , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas . "[183-the zulu]

[He]2903-i nodded and said ,

" Though at the time [I]2903-i seemed to go mad and though [I]2903-i know that [women]3186-women are false and [men]3228-men must follow where [they]3228-men lead [them]3228-men , never will [I]2903-i believe that [[my]2903-i brother]4820-my brother , [the woman - hater]5355-the woman - hater , and [Nada]112-nada are lovers in [the land below]5356-the land below and have there forgotten [me]2903-i , [the comrade of one of [them]5358-them]5357-the comrade of one of them and [the husband of the other]5359-the husband of the other . Moreover [I]2903-i hold , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , that [you]105-macumazahn and [I]2903-i have met with a just reward for [our]5360-we folly .[2903-i]

" [We]5360-we have sought to look through the bottom of the grave at things which the Great - Great in Heaven above did not mean that [men]3228-men should see , and now that [we]5360-we have seen [we]5360-we are unhappier than [we]5360-we were , since such dreams burn themselves upon the heart as a red - hot iron burns the hide of an ox , so that the hair will never grow again where it has been and the hide is marred .[183-the zulu]

" To [you]105-macumazahn , [Watcher - by - Night]3383-watcher - by - night , [I]2903-i say , ' Content [yourself]105-macumazahn with [your]105-macumazahn watching and whatever it may bring to [you]105-macumazahn in fame and wealth . ' And to [myself]2903-i [I]2903-i say , ' [Holder of the Axe]5363-holder of the axe , content [yourself]105-macumazahn with the axe and what it may bring to [you]105-macumazahn in fair fight and glory ' ; and to both of [us]5360-we [I]2903-i say , ' Let [the Dead]259-the dead sleep unawakened until [we]5360-we go to join [them]259-the dead , which surely will be soon enough . ' "[2903-i]

" Good words , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , but they should have been spoken ere ever [we]5360-we set out on this journey . "[183-the zulu]

" Not so , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn , since that journey [we]5360-we were fated to make to save one who lies yonder , [the Lady Sad - Eyes]3814-the lady sad - eyes , and , as [they]259-the dead tell [me]2903-i , is well again . Also [Zikali]104-zikali willed it , and who can resist the will of [the Opener - of - Roads]3230-the opener - of - roads ? So it is made and [we]5360-we have seen many strange things and won some glory and come to know how deep is the pool of [our]5360-we own foolishness , who thought that [we]5360-we could search out the secrets of Death , and there have only found those of [a witch]4173-a witch 's mind and venom , reflected as in water . And now having discovered all these things [I]2903-i wish to be gone from [this haunted land]5367-this haunted land . When do [we]5360-we march , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn ? "[2903-i]

" To - morrow morning , [I]183-the zulu believe , if [the Lady Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes and [the others]3164-the others are well enough , as [She]170-sad - eyes - who - commands says they will be . "[183-the zulu]

" Good . Then [I]2903-i would sleep who am more weary than [I]2903-i was after [I]2903-i had killed [Rezu]88-rezu in the battle on [the mountain]1489-the mountain . "[2903-i]

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , ' since it is harder to fight [ghosts]2904-ghosts than [men]3228-men , and dreams , if they be bad , are more dreadful than deeds . Good - night , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas . "[125-umslopogaas]

[He]2906-he went , and [I]0-i too went to see how it fared with [Inez]159-inez . [I]0-i found that [she]159-inez was fast asleep but in a quite different sleep to that into which [Ayesha]84-ayesha seemed to have plunged [her]159-inez . Now it was absolutely natural and looking at [her]159-inez lying there upon the bed , [I]0-i thought how young and healthy was [her]159-inez appearance . [The women in charge of [her]159-inez]2907-the women in charge of her also told [me]0-i that [she]159-inez had awakened at the hour appointed by [She]159-inez - who - commands , as it seemed , quite well and very hungry , although [she]159-inez appeared to be puzzled by [her]159-inez surroundings . After [she]159-inez had eaten , [they]2907-the women in charge of her added that [she]159-inez had ' sung a song , " which was probably a hymn , and prayed upon [her]159-inez knees , "[159-inez] making signs upon [her]159-inez breast " and then gone quietly to bed .[2907-the women in charge of her]

[My]0-i anxiety relieved as [regards Inez]159-inez , [I]0-i returned to [[my]0-i own quarters]2908-my own quarters . Not feeling inclined for slumber , however , instead of turning in [I]0-i sat at the doorway contemplating the beauty of the night while [I]0-i watched the countless fireflies that seemed to dust the air with sparks of burning gold ; also the great owls and other fowl that haunt the dark . These had come out in numbers from [their]2907-the women in charge of her hiding - places among [the ruins]2909-the ruins and sailed to and fro like white - winged spirits , now seen and now lost in the gloom .

While [I]0-i sat thus many reflections came to [me]0-i as to the extraordinary nature of [my]0-i experiences during the past few days . Had [any man]3256-any man ever known [the like]2911-the like , [I]0-i wondered ? What could [they]2907-the women in charge of her mean and what could [this marvellous woman]2912-this marvellous woman [Ayesha]84-ayesha be ? Was [she]2912-this marvellous woman perhaps [a personification of Nature itself , as indeed to some extent all women]2913-a personification of nature itself , as indeed to some extent all women are ? Was [she]2912-this marvellous woman human at all , or was [she]2912-this marvellous woman [some spirit symbolising [a departed people , faith and civilisation]2915-a departed people , faith and civilisation , and haunting [the ruins]2909-the ruins where once [she]2912-this marvellous woman reigned as [queen]3185-queen]2914-some spirit symbolising a departed people , faith and civilisation , and haunting the ruins where once she reigned as queen ? No , the idea was ridiculous , since [such beings]2918-such beings do not exist , though it was impossible to doubt that [she]2912-this marvellous woman possessed powers beyond those of common humanity , as [she]2912-this marvellous woman possessed beauty and fascination greater than are given to [any other woman]2919-any other woman .

Of one thing [I]0-i was certain , however , that [the Shades [I]0-i had seemed to visit]2920-the shades i had seemed to visit had [their]2920-the shades i had seemed to visit being in the circle of [her]2912-this marvellous woman own imagination and intelligence . There [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas was right ; [we]2921-we had seen [no dead]2922-no dead , [we]2921-we had only seen pictures and images that [she]2912-this marvellous woman drew and fashioned .

Why did [she]2912-this marvellous woman do this , [I]0-i wondered . Perhaps to pretend to powers which [she]2912-this marvellous woman did not possess , perhaps out of sheer elfish mischief , or perhaps , as [she]2912-this marvellous woman asserted , just to teach [us]2921-we a lesson and to humble [us]2921-we in [our]2921-we own sight . Well , if so [she]2912-this marvellous woman had succeeded , for never did [I]0-i feel so crushed and humiliated as at that moment .

[I]0-i had seemed to descend , or ascend , into [Hades]2-hades , and there had only seen things that gave [me]0-i little joy and did but serve to reopen old wounds . Then , on awaking , [I]0-i had been bewitched ; yes , fresh from those visions of [the most dear dead]2923-the most dear dead , [I]0-i had been bewitched by the overpowering magic of [this woman]533-this woman 's loveliness and charm , and made a fool of [myself]0-i , only to be brought back to [my]0-i senses by [her]533-this woman triumphant mockery . Oh , [I]0-i was humbled indeed , and yet the odd thing is that [I]0-i could not feel angry with [her]533-this woman , and what is more that , perhaps from vanity , [I]0-i believed in [her]533-this woman profession of friendship towards [myself]0-i .

Well , the upshot of it was that , like [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , more than anything else in [the world]277-the world did [I]0-i desire to depart from this haunted [K"r]1-k"r and to bury all [its]1-k"r recollections in such activities as fortune might bring to [me]0-i . And yet , and yet it was well to have seen it and to have plucked the flower of such marvellous experience , nor , as [I]0-i knew even then , could [I]0-i ever inter the memory of [Ayesha]84-ayesha the wise , [the perfect in all loveliness]5370-the perfect in all loveliness , and [the half - divine in power]5371-the half - divine in power .[0-i]

When [I]0-i awoke the next morning the sun was well up and after [I]0-i had taken a swim in the old bath and dressed [myself]0-i , [I]0-i went to see how it fared with [Inez]159-inez . [I]0-i found [her]159-inez sitting at the door of [[her]159-inez house]2926-her house looking extremely well and with a radiant face . [She]159-inez was engaged in making a chain of some small and beautiful blue flowers of the iris tribe , of which quantities grew about , that [she]159-inez threaded together upon stalks of dry grass .

This chain , which was just finished , [she]159-inez threw over [her]159-inez head so that it hung down upon [her]159-inez white robe , for now [she]159-inez was dressed like [an Arab woman though without the veil]2927-an arab woman though without the veil . [I]0-i watched [her]159-inez unseen for a little while then came forward and spoke to [her]159-inez . [She]159-inez started at the sight of [me]0-i and rose as though to run away ; then , apparently reassured by [my]0-i appearance , selected a particularly fine flower and offered it to [me]0-i .

[I]0-i saw at once that [she]159-inez did not know [me]0-i in the least and thought that [she]159-inez had never seen [me]0-i before , in short , that [her]159-inez mind had gone , exactly as [Ayesha]84-ayesha had said that it would do . By way of making conversation [I]0-i asked [her]159-inez if [she]159-inez felt well . [She]159-inez replied , Oh , yes , [she]159-inez had never felt better , then added ,

" [Daddy]260-daddy has gone on a long journey and will not be back for weeks and weeks . "[159-inez]

An idea came to [me]0-i and [I]0-i answered ,

" Yes , [Inez]159-inez , but [I]0-i am [a friend of [his]5373-him]5372-a friend of his and [he]5373-him has sent [me]0-i to take [you]159-inez to [a place where [I]0-i hope that [we]5375-we shall find [him]5373-him]5374-a place where i hope that we shall find him . Only [it]5374-a place where i hope that we shall find him is far away , so [you]159-inez also must make a long journey . "[0-i]

[She]159-inez clapped [her]159-inez hands and answered ,

" Oh , that will be nice , [I]159-inez do so love travelling , especially to find [Daddy]260-daddy , who [I]159-inez expect will have [my]159-inez proper clothes with [him]5373-him , not these which , although they are very comfortable and pretty , seem different to what [I]159-inez used to wear . [You]159-inez look very nice too and [I]159-inez am sure that [we]5375-we shall be [great friends]5376-great friends , which [I]159-inez am glad of , for [I]159-inez have been rather lonely since [[my]159-inez mother]3886-my mother went to live with [the saints]3747-the saints in [Heaven]178-heaven , because , [you]159-inez see , [Daddy]260-daddy is so busy and so often away , that [I]159-inez do not see much of [him]5379-him . "[159-inez]

Upon [my]0-i word [I]0-i could have wept when [I]0-i heard [her]2928-her prattle on thus . It is so terribly unnatural , almost dreadful indeed , to listen to [a full grown woman who talks in the accents]2929-a full grown woman who talks in the accents and expresses the thoughts of [a child]1173-a child . However , under all the circumstances [I]0-i recognised that [her]2928-her calamity was merciful , and remembering that [Ayesha]84-ayesha had prophesied the recovery of [her]2928-her mind as well as its loss and how great seemed to be [her]2928-her powers in these directions , [I]0-i took such comfort as [I]0-i could .

Leaving [her]2928-her [I]0-i went to see [the two Zulus who had been wounded]2931-the two zulus who had been wounded and found to [my]0-i joy that [they]2931-the two zulus who had been wounded were now quite well and fit to travel , for here , too , [Ayesha]84-ayesha 's prophecy had proved good . [The other men]2932-the other men also were completely rested and anxious to be gone like [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [myself]0-i .

While [I]0-i was eating [my]0-i breakfast [Hans]87-hans announced [the venerable Billali]93-billali , who with a sweeping bow informed [me]0-i that [he]93-billali had come to inquire when [we]2933-we should be ready to start , as [he]93-billali had received orders to see to all the necessary arrangements . [I]0-i replied - within an hour , and [he]93-billali departed in a hurry .

But little after the appointed time [he]93-billali reappeared with a number of litters and [[their]2931-the two zulus who had been wounded bearers]2934-their bearers , also with a bodyguard of [twenty - five picked men]2935-twenty - five picked men , [all of whom [we]2933-we recognised as [brave fellows who had fought well in the battle]2937-brave fellows who had fought well in the battle]2936-all of whom we recognised as brave fellows who had fought well in the battle . [These men]850-these men and [the bearers]1681-the bearers [old Billali]93-billali harangued , telling [them]850-these men that [they]850-these men were to guide , carry and escort [us]2933-we to [the other side of [the great swamp]2941-the great swamp]2940-the other side of the great swamp , or further if [we]2933-we needed it , and that it was the word of [She]2942-she - who - commands that if so much as the smallest harm came to [any one of [us]2933-we]2943-any one of us , even by accident , [they]850-these men should die [every man of [them]850-these men]2944-every man of them " by the hot - pot , "[93-billali] whatever that might be , for [I]0-i was not sure of the significance of this horror . Then [he]93-billali asked [them]850-these men if [they]850-these men understood . [They]850-these men replied with fervour that [they]850-these men understood perfectly and would lead and guard [us]2933-we as though [we]2933-we were [[their]850-these men own mothers]2945-their own mothers .

For this see the book called " [She]5380-she . "[108-editor] - [Editor]108-editor .

As a matter of fact [they]850-these men did , and [I]0-i think would have done so independently of [Ayesha]84-ayesha 's command , since [they]850-these men looked upon [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [myself]0-i almost as [gods]2946-gods and thought that [we]2933-we could destroy [them]850-these men all if [we]2933-we wished , as [we]2933-we had destroyed [Rezu]88-rezu and [[his]88-rezu host]2947-his host .

[I]0-i asked [Billali]93-billali if [he]93-billali were not coming with [us]2933-we , to which [he]93-billali replied , No , as [She]2948-her - who - commands had returned to [[her]2948-her own place]2949-her own place and [he]93-billali must follow [her]2948-her at once . [I]0-i asked [him]93-billali again where [[her]2948-her own place]2949-her own place might be , to which [he]93-billali answered vaguely that it was everywhere and [he]93-billali stared first at the heavens and then at [the earth]285-the earth as though [she]2948-her inhabited [most of them]1269-most of them , adding that generally it was " in [the Caves]5381-the caves , "[93-billali] though what [he]93-billali meant by that [I]0-i did not know . Then [he]93-billali said that [he]93-billali was very glad to have met [us]2953-us and that the sight of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas killing [Rezu]88-rezu was a spectacle that [he]93-billali would remember with pleasure all [his]93-billali life . Also [he]93-billali asked [me]0-i for a present . [I]0-i gave [him]93-billali a spare pencil that [I]0-i possessed in a little German silver case , with which [he]93-billali was delighted . Thus [I]0-i parted with [old Billali]93-billali , of whom [I]0-i shall always think with a certain affection .

[I]0-i noticed even then that [he]93-billali kept very clear indeed of [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , thinking , [I]0-i suppose , that [he]93-billali might take a last opportunity to fulfil [his]93-billali threats and introduce [him]93-billali to [his]93-billali terrible Axe .

CHAPTER XXIV

UMSLOPOGAAS [WEARS THE GREAT MEDICINE]261-wears the great medicine

A little while later [we]2954-we started , some of [us]2954-we in litters , including the wounded Zulus , who [I]0-i [insisted should be carried for a day or two]2955-insisted should be carried for a day or two , and [some on foot]2956-some on foot . [Inez]159-inez [I]0-i caused to be borne immediately in front of [myself]0-i so that [I]0-i could keep an eye upon [her]159-inez . Moreover [I]0-i put [her]159-inez in the especial charge of [Hans]87-hans , to whom fortunately [she]159-inez took a great fancy at once , perhaps because [she]159-inez remembered subconsciously that [she]159-inez knew [him]87-hans and that [he]87-hans had been kind to [her]159-inez , although when [they]2957-they met after [her]159-inez long sleep , as in [my]0-i own case , [she]159-inez did not recognise [him]87-hans in the least .

Soon , however , [they]2957-they were again [the fastest of friends]2958-the fastest of friends , so much so that within a day or two [the little Hottentot]1338-the little hottentot practically filled the place of [a maid to [her]159-inez]2960-a maid to her , attending to [her]159-inez every want and looking after [her]159-inez exactly as [a nurse]2961-a nurse does after [a child]1173-a child , with the result that it was quite touching to see how [she]159-inez came to depend upon [him]87-hans , " [[her]159-inez monkey]5382-her monkey , "[159-inez] as [she]159-inez called [him]87-hans , and how fond [he]87-hans grew of [her]159-inez .

Once , indeed , there was trouble , since hearing a noise , [I]0-i came up to find [Hans]87-hans bristling with fury and threatening to shoot one of [the Zulus]101-the zulus , who stupidly , or perhaps rudely , had knocked against the litter of [Inez]159-inez and nearly turned it over . For the rest , [the Lady Sad - Eyes]170-sad - eyes , as [they]2963-they called [her]159-inez , had for the time became [the Lady Glad - Eyes]262-the lady glad - eyes , since [she]159-inez was merry as the day was long , laughing and singing and playing just as [a healthy happy child]2964-a healthy happy child should do .

Only once did [I]0-i see [her]159-inez wretched and weep . It was when a kitten which [she]159-inez had insisted on bringing with [her]159-inez , sprang out of the litter and vanished into some bush where it could not be found . Even when [she]159-inez was soon consoled and dried [her]159-inez tears , when [Hans]87-hans explained to [her]159-inez in a mixture of bad English and worse Portuguese , that it had only run away because it wished to get back to [[its]2965-its mother]5155-its mother which [it]2965-its loved , and that it was cruel to separate [it]2965-its from [[its]2965-its mother]5155-its mother .

[We]2968-we made good progress and by the evening of the first day were over the crest of the cliff or volcano lip that encircles [the great plain of [K"r]1-k"r]5383-the great plain of k"r , and descending rapidly to a sheltered spot on the outer slope where [[our]2968-we camp]1037-our camp was to be set for the night .[0-i]

Not very far from [this place]3445-this place , as [I]0-i think [I]0-i have mentioned , stood , and [I]0-i suppose still stands , a very curious pinnacle of rock , which , doubtless being of some harder sort , had remained when , hundreds of thousands or millions of years before , the surrounding lava had been washed or had corroded away . This rock pillar was perhaps fifty feet high and as smooth as though [it]2970-it had been worked by [man]287-man ; indeed , [I]0-i remembered having remarked to [Hans]87-hans , or [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas - [I]0-i forget which - when [we]2968-we passed it on [our]2968-we inward journey , that there was a column which [no monkey]2972-no monkey could climb .

As [we]2968-we went by [it]2973-it for the second time , the sun had already disappeared behind [the western cliff]1724-the western cliff , but a fierce ray from its sinking orb , struck upon a storm - cloud that hung over [us]2968-we , and thence was reflected in a glow of angry light of which the focus or centre seemed to fall upon the summit of [this strange and obelisk - like pinnacle of rock]2975-this strange and obelisk - like pinnacle of rock .

At the moment [I]0-i was out of [my]0-i litter and walking with [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas at the end of the line , to make sure that [no one straggled in the oncoming darkness]2976-no one straggled in the oncoming darkness . When [we]2968-we had passed the column by some forty or fifty yards , something caused [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas to turn and look back . [He]125-umslopogaas uttered an exclamation which made [me]0-i follow [his]125-umslopogaas example , with the result that [I]0-i saw a very wonderful thing . For there on the point of the pillar , like [St. Simeon Stylites]263-st. simeon stylites on [his]125-umslopogaas famous column , glowing in the sunset rays as though [she]2977-she were on fire , stood [Ayesha]84-ayesha [herself]84-ayesha !

It was a strange and in a way a glorious sight , for poised thus between [earth]346-earth and [heaven]1310-heaven , [she]84-ayesha looked like [some glowing angel]2980-some glowing angel rather than [a woman]3331-a woman , standing as [she]84-ayesha seemed to do upon the darkness ; since the shadows , save for the faintest outline , had swallowed up the column that supported [her]84-ayesha . Moreover , in the intense , rich light that was focussed on [her]84-ayesha , [we]2968-we could see every detail of [her]84-ayesha form and face , for [she]84-ayesha was unveiled , and even [her]84-ayesha large and tender eyes which gazed upwards emptily at this moment they seemed very tender , yes , and the little gold studs that glittered on [her]84-ayesha sandals and the shine of the snake girdle [she]84-ayesha wore about [her]84-ayesha waist .

[We]2968-we stared and stared till [I]0-i said inconsequently ,

" [Learn]264-learn , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , what [a liar]5170-a liar is [that old [Billali]93-billali , who told [me]0-i that [She]84-ayesha - who - commands]93-billali had departed from [K"r]1-k"r[0-i] to [[her]84-ayesha own place]2949-her own place . "[0-i]

" Perhaps [this rock edge]5386-this rock edge is [[her]84-ayesha own place]2949-her own place , if [she]84-ayesha be there at all , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn . "[0-i]

" If [she]84-ayesha be there , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered angrily , for [my]0-i nerves were at once thrilled and torn . " Speak not empty words , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas , for where else can [she]84-ayesha be when [we]5388-we see [her]84-ayesha with [our]5388-we eyes ? "[0-i]

" Who am [I]0-i that [I]0-i should know the ways of witches who , like the winds , are able to go and come as [they]5389-they will ? Can [a woman]3331-a woman run up [a wall of rock]5391-a wall of rock like a lizard , [Macumazahn]105-macumazahn ? "[0-i]

" Doubtless - - "[0-i] and [I]0-i began some explanation which [I]0-i have forgotten , when a passing cloud , or [I]0-i know not what , cut off the light so that both the pinnacle and [she]2983-she who stood on it became invisible . A minute later it returned for a little while , and there was the point of the needle - shaped rock , but it was empty , as , save for the birds that rested on it , it had been since the beginning of [the world]277-the world .

Then [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [I]0-i shook [our]2985-our heads and pursued [our]2985-our way in silence .

This was the last that [I]0-i saw of the glorious [Ayesha]84-ayesha , if indeed [I]0-i did see [her]84-ayesha and not [her]84-ayesha ghost . Yet it is true that for all the first part of the journey , till [we]2985-our were through [the great swamp]2941-the great swamp in fact , from time to time [I]0-i was conscious , or imagined that [I]0-i was conscious of [her]84-ayesha presence . Moreover , once [others]279-others saw [her]84-ayesha , or someone who might have been [her]84-ayesha . It happened thus .

[We]2985-our were in [the centre of [the great swamp]2941-the great swamp]2988-the centre of the great swamp and [the trained guides who were leading]2990-the trained guides who were leading came to a place where [the path forked and were uncertain which road to take]2991-the path forked and were uncertain which road to take . Finally [they]2990-the trained guides who were leading fixed on [the right - hand path]2992-the right - hand path and were preparing to follow it together with [those who bore the litter of Inez]2993-those who bore the litter of inez , by the side of which [Hans]87-hans was walking as usual .

At this moment , as [Hans]87-hans told [me]0-i , [the guides]2994-the guides went down upon [their]2994-the guides faces and [he]87-hans saw standing in front of [them]2994-the guides [a white - veiled form who pointed to the left - hand path , and then seemed to be lost in the mist]2995-a white - veiled form who pointed to the left - hand path , and then seemed to be lost in the mist . Without a word [the guides]2994-the guides rose and followed this left - hand path . [Hans]87-hans stopped the litter till [I]0-i came up when [he]87-hans told [me]0-i what had happened , while [Inez]159-inez also began to chatter in [her]159-inez childish fashion about a " White Lady . "[159-inez]

[I]0-i had the curiosity to walk a little way along the right - hand path which [they]2994-the guides were about to take . Only a few yards further on [I]0-i found [myself]0-i sinking in a floating quagmire , from which [I]0-i extricated [myself]0-i with much difficulty but just in time for as [I]0-i discovered afterwards by probing with a pole , the water beneath the matted reeds was deep . That night [I]0-i questioned [the guides]2994-the guides upon the subject , but without result , for [they]2994-the guides pretended to have seen nothing and not to understand what [I]0-i meant . Of neither of these incidents have [I]0-i any explanation to offer , except that once contracted , it is as difficult to be rid of the habit of hallucinations as of any other .

It is not necessary that [I]0-i should give all the details of [our]2998-our long homeward journey . So [I]0-i will only say that having dismissed [[our]2998-our bearers]2999-our bearers and [escorts]3000-escorts when [we]2998-our reached [higher ground beyond [the horrible swamp]3002-the horrible swamp]3001-higher ground beyond the horrible swamp , keeping one litter for [Inez]159-inez in which [the Zulus]101-the zulus carried [her]159-inez when [she]159-inez was tired , [we]2998-our accomplished it in complete safety and having crossed [the Zambesi]11-the zambesi , at last one evening reached [the house called [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir]3003-the house called strathmuir .

Here [we]2998-our found the waggon and oxen quite safe and were welcomed rapturously by [[my]0-i Zulu driver]3004-my zulu driver and [the voorlooper , who had made up [their]3005-the voorlooper , who had made up their minds that we were dead and were thinking of trekking homewards minds that [we]2998-our were dead and were thinking of trekking homewards]3005-the voorlooper , who had made up their minds that we were dead and were thinking of trekking homewards . Here also [Thomaso]163-thomaso greeted [us]2998-our , though [I]0-i think that , like [the Zulus]101-the zulus , [he]163-thomaso was astonished at [our]2998-our safe return and indeed not over - pleased to see [us]2998-our . [I]0-i told [him]163-thomaso that [Captain Robertson]161-robertson had been killed in a fight in which [we]2998-our had rescued [[his]161-robertson daughter]778-his daughter from [the cannibals who had carried [her]778-his daughter off information which [I]0-i cautioned [him]163-thomaso to keep to [himself]163-thomaso but nothing else that [I]0-i could help]3007-the cannibals who had carried her off information which i cautioned him to keep to himself but nothing else that i could help .

Also [I]0-i warned [the Zulus]101-the zulus through [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas and [Goroko]168-goroko , that no mention was to be made of [our]2998-our adventures , either then or afterwards , since if this were done the curse of [the White Queen]265-the white queen would fall on [them]101-the zulus and bring [them]101-the zulus to disaster and death . [I]0-i added that the name of [this queen]3212-this queen and everything that was connected with [her]3212-this queen , or [her]3212-this queen doings , must be locked up in [their]101-the zulus own hearts . It must be like the name of [dead kings]3009-dead kings , not to be spoken . Nor indeed did [they]101-the zulus ever speak it or tell the story of [our]2998-our search , because [they]101-the zulus were too much afraid both of [Ayesha]84-ayesha whom [they]101-the zulus believed to be the greatest of [all witches]4172-all witches , and of the axe of [[their]101-the zulus captain]4534-their captain , [Umslopogaas]125-umslopogaas .

[Inez]159-inez went to bed that night without seeming to recognise [[her]159-inez old home]3012-her old home , to all appearance just [a mindless child]3013-a mindless child as [she]159-inez had been ever since [she]159-inez awoke from [her]159-inez trance at [K"r]1-k"r . Next morning , however , [Hans]87-hans came to tell [me]159-inez that [she]159-inez was changed and that [she]159-inez wished to speak with [me]159-inez . [I]159-inez went , wondering , to find [her]159-inez in [the sitting - room]634-the sitting - room , dressed in European clothes which [she]159-inez had taken from where [she]159-inez kept them , and once more [a reasoning woman]5393-a reasoning woman .[159-inez]

" [Mr. Quatermain]83-allan , "[159-inez] [she]159-inez said , " [I]159-inez suppose that [I]159-inez must have been ill , for the last thing [I]159-inez remember is going to sleep on the night after [you]83-allan started for the hippopotamus hunt . Where is [[my]159-inez father]3272-my father ? Did any harm come to [him]3272-my father while [he]3272-my father was hunting ? "[159-inez]

" Alas ! "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , lying boldly , for [I]0-i feared lest the truth should take away [her]159-inez mind again , " it did . [He]3272-my father was trampled upon by a hippopotamus bull , which charged [him]3272-my father , and killed , and [we]5395-we were obliged to bury [him]3272-my father where [he]3272-my father died . "[0-i]

[She]159-inez bowed [her]159-inez head for a while and muttered some prayer for [his]3014-his soul , then looked at [me]0-i keenly and said ,

" [I]159-inez do not think [you]0-i are telling [me]159-inez everything , [Mr. Quatermain]83-allan , but something seems to say that this is because it is not well that [I]159-inez should learn everything . "[159-inez]

" No , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered , " [you]159-inez have been ill and out of [your]159-inez mind for quite a long while ; something gave [you]159-inez a shock . [I]0-i think that [you]159-inez learned of [[your]159-inez father]3624-your father 's death , which [you]159-inez have now forgotten , and were overcome with the news . Please trust to [me]0-i and believe that if [I]0-i keep anything back from [you]159-inez , it is because [I]0-i think it best to do so for the present . "[0-i]

" [I]3015-i trust and [I]3015-i believe , "[3015-i] [she]3015-i answered . " Now please leave [me]3015-i , but tell [me]3015-i first where are [those women]5397-those women and [[their]5397-those women children]3920-their children ? "[3015-i]

" After [[your]159-inez father]3624-your father died [they]5397-those women went away , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied , lying once more .

[She]3015-i looked at [me]0-i again but made no comment .

Then [I]0-i left [her]3015-i .

How much [Inez]159-inez ever learned of the true story of [her]159-inez adventures [I]0-i do not know to this hour , though [my]0-i opinion is that it was but little . To begin with , [everyone]3308-everyone , including [Thomaso]163-thomaso , was threatened with the direst consequences if [he]163-thomaso said a word to [her]159-inez on the subject ; moreover in [her]159-inez way [she]159-inez was [a wise woman]3017-a wise woman , [one who knew when it was best not to ask questions]3018-one who knew when it was best not to ask questions . [She]159-inez was aware that [she]159-inez had suffered from a fit of aberration or madness and that during this time [[her]159-inez father]902-her father had died and certain peculiar things had happened . There [she]159-inez was content to leave the business and [she]159-inez never again spoke to [me]0-i upon the subject . Of this [I]0-i was very glad , as how on earth could [I]0-i have explained to [her]159-inez about [Ayesha]84-ayesha 's prophecies as to [her]159-inez lapse into childishness and subsequent return to a normal state when [she]159-inez reached [[her]159-inez home]4912-her home seeing that [I]0-i did not understand them [myself]0-i ?

Once indeed [she]159-inez did inquire what had become of [Janee]172-janee to which [I]0-i answered that [she]159-inez had died during [her]159-inez sickness . It was another lie , at any rate by implication , but [I]0-i hold that there are occasions when it is righteous to lie . At least these particular falsehoods have never troubled [my]0-i conscience .

Here [I]0-i may as well finish the story of [Inez]159-inez , that is , as far as [I]0-i can . As [I]0-i have shown [she]159-inez was always [a woman of melancholy and religious temperament]3021-a woman of melancholy and religious temperament , qualities that seemed to grow upon [her]159-inez after [her]159-inez return to health . Certainly the religion did , for continually [she]159-inez was engaged in prayer , a development with which heredity may have had something to do , since after [he]3022-he became a reformed character and grew unsettled in [his]3022-he mind , [[her]159-inez father]902-her father followed [the same road]3024-the same road .

On [our]3025-our return to civilisation , as it chanced , [one of [the first persons with whom [she]159-inez came in contact]3027-the first persons with whom she came in contact was [a very earnest and excellent old priest of [her]159-inez own faith]3028-a very earnest and excellent old priest of her own faith]3026-one of the first persons with whom she came in contact was a very earnest and excellent old priest of her own faith . The end of this intimacy was much what might have been expected . Very soon [Inez]159-inez determined to renounce [the world]277-the world , which [I]0-i think never had any great attractions for [her]159-inez , and entered [a sisterhood of [an extremely strict Order in [Natal]14-natal]3031-an extremely strict order in natal , where , added to [her]159-inez many merits , [her]159-inez considerable possessions made [her]159-inez very welcome indeed]3030-a sisterhood of an extremely strict order in natal , where , added to her many merits , her considerable possessions made her very welcome indeed .

Once in after years [I]0-i saw [her]159-inez again when [she]159-inez expected before long to become [the Mother - Superior of [[her]159-inez convent]3033-her convent]3032-the mother - superior of her convent . [I]0-i found [her]159-inez very cheerful and [she]159-inez told [me]0-i that [her]159-inez happiness was complete . Even then [she]159-inez did not ask [me]0-i the true story of what had happened to [her]159-inez during that period when [her]159-inez mind was a blank . [She]159-inez said that [she]159-inez knew something had happened but that as [she]159-inez no longer felt any curiosity about earthly things , [she]159-inez did not wish to know the details . Again [I]0-i rejoiced , for how could [I]0-i tell the true tale and expect to be believed , even by [the most confiding and simple - minded nun]3034-the most confiding and simple - minded nun ?

To return to more immediate events . When [we]3035-we had been at [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir for a day or two and [I]0-i thought that [her]159-inez mind was clear enough to judge of affairs , [I]0-i told [Inez]159-inez that [I]0-i must journey on to [Natal]14-natal , and asked [her]159-inez what [she]159-inez wished to do . Without a moment 's hesitation [she]159-inez replied that [she]159-inez desired to come with [me]0-i , as now that [[her]159-inez father]902-her father was dead nothing would induce [her]159-inez to continue to live at [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir without [friends]3149-friends , or indeed the consolations of religion .

Then [she]159-inez showed [me]0-i a secret hiding - place cunningly devised in a sort of cellar under [the sitting - room floor]3038-the sitting - room floor , where [[her]159-inez father]902-her father was accustomed to keep the spirits of which [he]902-her father consumed so great a quantity . In this hole beneath some bricks , [we]3040-we discovered a large sum in gold stored away , which [Robertson]159-inez had always told [[his]902-her father daughter]778-his daughter [she]778-his daughter would find there , in the event of anything happening to [him]902-her father . With the money were [his]902-her father will and securities , also certain mementos of [his]902-her father youth and some love - letters together with a prayer - book that [[his]902-her father mother]754-his mother had given [him]902-her father .

These valuables , of which [no one]3323-no one knew the existence except [herself]159-inez , [we]3040-we removed and then made [our]3040-we preparations for departure . They were simple ; such articles of value as [we]3040-we could carry were packed into the waggon and the best of the cattle [we]3040-we drove with [us]3040-we . [The place]328-the place with [the store]820-the store and the rest of the stock were handed over to [Thomaso]163-thomaso on a half - profit agreement under arrangement that [he]163-thomaso should remit the share of [Inez]159-inez twice a year to [a bank on [the coast]3718-the coast , where [[her]159-inez father]902-her father had an account]3046-a bank on the coast , where her father had an account . Whether or not [he]163-thomaso ever did this [I]0-i am unable to say , but as [no one]3323-no one wished to stop at [Strathmuir]27-strathmuir , [I]0-i could conceive no better plan because purchasers of property in [that district]3050-that district did not exist .

As [we]3040-we trekked away one fine morning [I]0-i asked [Inez]159-inez whether [she]159-inez was sorry to leave [the place]328-the place .

" No , "[159-inez] [she]159-inez replied with energy , " [my]159-inez life there has been a hell and [I]159-inez never wish to see it again . "[159-inez]
